firstLine: The Creation
rest: In the beginning, God created the heavens and the earth—

firstLine: The Generations of Heaven and Earth
rest: These are the generations of heaven and earth when they were created, in the day that Yahweh God made earth and heaven—

firstLine: And the man said,
rest:
“She is now bone from my bones
and flesh from my flesh;
she shall be called ‘Woman,’
for she was taken from man.”

firstLine: The Fall
rest: Now the serpent was more crafty than any other wild animal which Yahweh God had made. He said to the woman, “Did God indeed say, ‘You shall not eat from any tree in the garden’?”

firstLine: Then Yahweh God said to the serpent,
rest:
“Because you have done this,
you will be cursed
more than any domesticated animal
and more than any wild animal.
On your belly you shall go
and dust you shall eat
all the days of your life.

firstLine: And I will put hostility
rest:
between you and between the woman,
and between your offspring and between her offspring;
he will strike you on the head,
and you will strike him on the heel.”

firstLine: To the woman he said,
rest:
“I will greatly increase
your pain in childbearing;
in pain you shall bear children.
And to your husband shall be your desire.
And he shall rule over you.”

firstLine: And thorns and thistles shall sprout for you,
rest: and you shall eat the plants of the field.

firstLine: By the sweat of your brow
Cain and Abel
rest: Now Adam knew Eve his wife, and she conceived and bore Cain. And she said, “I have given birth to a man with the help of Yahweh.”

firstLine: Then Lamech said to his wives,
rest:
“Adah and Zillah, listen to my voice;
O wives of Lamech, hear my words.
I have killed a man for wounding me,
Even a young man for injuring me.

firstLine: If Cain is avenged sevenfold,
rest: Then Lamech will be avenged seventy and seven times.

firstLine: Adam’s Descendants to Noah
rest: This is the record of the generations of Adam. When God created Adam, he made him in the likeness of God.

firstLine: Prelude to the Flood
rest: And it happened that, when humankind began to multiply on the face of the ground, daughters were born to them.

firstLine: The Flood
rest: Noah was six hundred years old when the flood waters came upon the earth.

firstLine: The Flood Subsides
rest: And God remembered Noah and all the wild animals, and all the domesticated animals that were with him in the ark. And God caused a wind to blow over the earth, and the waters subsided.

firstLine: God’s Covenant with Noah and Humankind
rest: And God blessed Noah and his sons, and said to them, “Be fruitful and multiply, and fill the earth.

firstLine: “As for the one shedding the blood of humankind,
rest:
by humankind his blood shall be shed,
for God made humankind in his own image.

firstLine: Noah’s Descendants
rest: Now the sons of Noah who came out of the ark were Shem, Ham, and Japheth. (Ham was the father of Canaan.)

firstLine: And he said,
rest:
“Cursed be Canaan,
a slave of slaves he shall be to his brothers.”

firstLine: Then he said,
rest:
“Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Shem,
and let Canaan be a slave to them.

firstLine: May God make space for Japheth,
rest:
and let him dwell in the tents of Shem,
and let Canaan be a slave for him.”

firstLine: The Descendants of the Sons of Noah
rest: These are the generations of the sons of Noah—Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Children were born to them after the flood.

firstLine: The Tower of Babel
rest: Now the whole earth had one language and the same words.

firstLine: The Descendants of Shem
rest: These are the generations of Shem. When Shem was one hundred years old, he fathered Arphaxad, two years after the flood.

firstLine: The Descendants of Terah
rest: Now these are the generations of Terah. Terah fathered Abram, Nahor, and Haran, and Haran fathered Lot.

firstLine: The Call of Abram
rest: And Yahweh said to Abram, “Go out from your land and from your relatives, and from the house of your father, to the land that I will show you.

firstLine: Abram’s Journey
rest: And Abram went out as Yahweh had told him, and Lot went with him. Now Abram was seventy-five years old when he went out from Haran.

firstLine: The Parting of Abram and Lot
rest: Then Abram went up from Egypt, he and his wife and all that was with him. And Lot went with him to the Negev.

firstLine: Abram Rescues Lot
rest: And it happened that in the days of Amraphel, the king of Shinar, Arioch, the king of Ellasar, Kedorlaomer, the king of Elam, and Tidal, the king of Goiim,

firstLine: Abram Meets Melchizedek
rest: After his return from defeating Kedorlaomer and the kings who were with him, the king of Sodom went out to meet him at the Valley of Shaveh (that is, the Valley of the King).

firstLine: And he blessed him and said,
rest:
“Blessed be Abram by God Most High,
Maker of heaven and earth.

firstLine: And blessed be God Most High
rest:
who delivered your enemies into your hand.”
And he gave to him a tenth of everything.

firstLine: Yahweh’s Covenant with Abram
rest: After these things the word of Yahweh came to Abram in a vision, saying: “Do not be afraid, Abram; I am your shield, and your reward shall be very great.”

firstLine: Sarai and Hagar
rest: Now Sarai, the wife of Abram, had borne him no children. And she had a female Egyptian servant, and her name was Hagar.

firstLine: Hagar and the Angel of Yahweh
rest: And the angel of Yahweh found her at a spring of water in the wilderness, at the spring by the road of Shur.

firstLine: And the angel of Yahweh said to her:
rest:
“Behold, you are pregnant
and shall have a son.
And you shall call his name Ishmael,
for Yahweh has listened to your suffering.

firstLine: And he shall be a wild donkey of a man,
rest:
his hand will be against everyone,
and the hand of everyone will be against him,
and he will live in hostility with all his brothers.”

firstLine: Abram and Circumcision, the Sign of the Covenant
rest: When Abram was ninety-nine years old Yahweh appeared to Abram. And he said to him, “I am El-Shaddai; walk before me and be blameless

firstLine: Yahweh Appears to Abraham as a Man
rest: And Yahweh appeared to him by the oaks of Mamre. And he was sitting in the doorway of the tent at the heat of the day.

firstLine: Abraham Intercedes for Sodom
rest: And the men turned from there and went toward Sodom. And Abraham was still standing before Yahweh.

firstLine: The Rescue of Lot from Sodom
rest: And the two angels came to Sodom in the evening. And Lot was sitting in the gateway of Sodom. Then Lot saw them and stood up to meet them. And he bowed down with his face to the ground.

firstLine: The Destruction of Sodom
rest: After the sun had risen upon the earth and Lot had entered Zoar,

firstLine: Lot and His Daughters
rest: And Lot went out from Zoar and settled in the hill country with his two daughters, for he was afraid to stay in Zoar. So he lived in a cave, he and his two daughters.

firstLine: Abraham and Abimelech
rest: And Abraham journeyed from there to the land of the Negev, and he settled between Kadesh and Shur. And he dwelled as an alien in Gerar.

firstLine: The Birth of Isaac
rest: And Yahweh visited Sarah as he had said. And Yahweh did to Sarah as he had promised.

firstLine: Hagar and Ishmael
rest: And the child grew and was weaned. And Abraham made a great feast on the day Isaac was weaned.

firstLine: The Covenant Between Abraham and Abimelech
rest: And it happened that at that time, Abimelech and Phicol, the commander of his army, said to Abraham, “God is with you, in all that you do.

firstLine: God Tests Abraham
rest: And it happened that after these things, God tested Abraham. And he said to him, “Abraham!” And he said, “Here I am.”

firstLine: Sarah’s Death and Burial
rest: And Sarah lived one hundred and twenty-seven years; these were the years of the life of Sarah.

firstLine: Isaac and Rebekah
rest: Now Abraham was old, advanced in age, and Yahweh had blessed Abraham in everything.

firstLine: The Death and Descendants of Abraham
rest: Now Abraham again took a wife, and her name was Keturah.

firstLine: Jacob and Esau
rest: Now these are the generations of Isaac, the son of Abraham. Abraham fathered Isaac,

firstLine: Isaac and Abimelech
rest: And there was a famine in the land, besides the former famine which was in the days of Abraham. And Isaac went to Abimelech, king of the Philistines, to Gerar.

firstLine: Jacob Steals Esau’s Blessing
rest: And it happened that when Isaac was old and his eyesight was weak, he called Esau his older son and said to him, “My son.” And he said to him, “Here I am.”

firstLine: May God give you of the dew of heaven
rest:
and of the fatness of the earth,
and abundance of grain and new wine.

firstLine: Let peoples serve you,
rest:
and nations bow down to you;
Be lord of your brothers,
and may the sons of your mother bow down to you.
Cursed be those cursing you,
and blessed be those blessing you.”

firstLine: Then Isaac his father answered and said to him,
rest:
“Your home shall be from the fatness of the land,
and from the dew of heaven above.

firstLine: But by your sword you shall live,
rest:
and you shall serve your brother.
But it shall be that when free yourself
you shall tear off his yoke from your neck.

firstLine: Jacob Flees to Haran
rest: Then Isaac called Jacob and blessed him. And he instructed him and said to him, “You must not take a wife from the daughters of Canaan.

firstLine: Jacob’s Dream
rest: Then Jacob went out from Beersheba and went to Haran.

firstLine: Jacob Flees to Haran
rest: And Jacob continued his journey and went to the land of the Easterners.

firstLine: Jacob’s Marriages
rest: Then Laban said to Jacob, “Just because you are my brother should you work for me for nothing? Tell me what your wage should be.”

firstLine: Jacob’s Children
rest: When Yahweh saw that Leah was unloved he opened her womb, but Rachel was barren.

firstLine: Jacob’s Children
rest: When Rachel saw that she could not bear children to Jacob, Rachel envied her sister. And she said to Jacob, “Give me children—if not, I will die!”

firstLine: Jacob’s Prosperity
rest: And it happened that as soon as Rachel had given birth to Joseph, Jacob said to Laban, “Send me away that I may go to my place and my land.

firstLine: Jacob Flees from Laban
rest: Now he heard the words of the sons of Laban, saying, “Jacob has taken all that our father has,” and “From that which was our father’s he has gained all this wealth.”

firstLine: Jacob Fears Esau
rest: And Jacob went on his way, and angels of God met him.

firstLine: Jacob Wrestles with God
rest: That night he arose and took his two wives, his two female servants, and his eleven children and crossed the ford of the Jabbok.

firstLine: Jacob Meets Esau and Settles at Shechem
rest: And Jacob lifted up his eyes and looked. And behold, Esau was coming and four hundred men were with him. And he divided the children among Leah and among Rachel, and among the two of his female servants.

firstLine: The Rape of Dinah and the Massacre at Shechem
rest: Now Dinah the daughter of Leah, whom she had borne to Jacob, went out to see the daughters of the land.

firstLine: Jacob Goes Back to Bethel
rest: And God said to Jacob, “Arise, go up to Bethel and dwell there, and make an altar to the God who appeared to you when you fled from before Esau your brother.”

firstLine: The Death of Rachel
rest: Then they journeyed from Bethel. And when they were still some distance from Ephrath, Rachel went into labor. And she had hard labor.

firstLine: The Death of Isaac
rest: And Jacob came to Isaac his father at Mamre, or Kiriath-Arba (that is, Hebron), where Abraham and Isaac dwelled as aliens.

firstLine: The Descendants of Esau
rest: Now these are the descendants of Esau (that is, Edom).

firstLine: The Kings of Edom
rest: Now these are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king ruled over the Israelites.

firstLine: The Dreams of Joseph
rest: And Jacob settled in the land of the sojourning of his father, in the land of Canaan.

firstLine: Joseph Sold Into Slavery by his Brothers
rest: Now his brothers went to pasture the flock of their father in Shechem.

firstLine: Judah and Tamar
rest: And it happened that at that time Judah went down from his brothers and pitched his tent near a certain Adullamite, whose name was Hirah.

firstLine: Joseph in Potiphar’s House
rest: Now Joseph had been brought down to Egypt, and Potiphar, a court official of Pharaoh, commander of the guard, an Egyptian, bought him from the hand of the Ishmaelites who had brought him down there.

firstLine: Joseph Interprets Dreams in Prison
rest: And it happened that after these things the cupbearer of the king of Egypt and his baker did wrong against their lord, against the king of Egypt.

firstLine: Joseph Interprets Pharaoh’s Dreams
rest: And it happened that after two full years Pharaoh dreamed, and behold, he was standing by the Nile.

firstLine: Joseph Rises to Power
rest: And the plan was good in the eyes of Pharaoh and in the eyes of all his servants.

firstLine: Joseph’s Brothers Go to Egypt for Food
rest: When Jacob realized that there was grain in Egypt, Jacob said to his sons, “Why do you look at one another?”

firstLine: Joseph’s Brothers Return to Egypt
rest: Now the famine in the land was severe.

firstLine: Joseph Tests His Brothers
rest: Then he commanded the one who was over his household, saying, “Fill the sacks of the men with food as much as they are able to carry, and put each one’s money in the mouth of his sack.

firstLine: Joseph Reveals His Identity
rest: Then Joseph was not able to control himself before all who were standing by him. And he cried out, “Make every man go out from me!” So no one stood with him when Joseph made himself known to his brothers.

firstLine: Jacob and His Offspring Go to Egypt
rest: So Israel journeyed with all that he had, and he came to Beersheba and offered sacrifices to the God of his father, Isaac.

firstLine: Jacob Settles in Goshen
rest: So Joseph went and reported to Pharaoh. And he said, “My father and my brothers, with their flocks and their herds, and all that they have, have come from the land of Canaan. Now they are here in the land of Goshen.”

firstLine: The Famine in Egypt Continues
rest: Now there was no food in all the land, for the famine was very severe. And the land of Egypt languished, with the land of Canaan, on account of the famine.

firstLine: Jacob Blesses Ephraim and Manasseh
rest: And it happened that after these things, it was said to Joseph, “Behold, your father is ill.” And he took his two sons with him, Ephraim and Manasseh.

firstLine: And he blessed Joseph and said,
rest:
“The God before whom my fathers, Abraham and Isaac, walked,
The God who shepherded me all my life unto this day,

firstLine: The angel who redeemed me from all evil,
rest:
may he bless the boys.
And through them let my name be perpetuated,
and the name of my fathers, Abraham and Isaac.
And let them multiply into many in the midst of the earth.

firstLine: So he blessed them that day, saying,
rest:
Through you Israel shall pronounce blessing, saying,
‘May God make you like Ephraim and like Manasseh.’”
So he put Ephraim before Manasseh.

firstLine: Jacob Blesses His Twelve Sons
rest: Then Jacob called his sons and said, “Gather together so that I can tell you what will happen with you in days to come.

firstLine: Reuben, you are my firstborn,
rest:
my strength, and the firstfruit of my vigor,
excelling in rank and excelling in power.

firstLine: Unstable as water, you shall not excel any longer,
rest:
for you went up upon the bed of your father,
then defiled it. You went up upon my couch!

firstLine: Simeon and Levi are brothers;
rest:
weapons of violence are their swords.
Let me not come into their council.

firstLine: Cursed be their anger, for it is fierce,
rest:
and their wrath, for it is cruel.
I will divide them in Jacob,
and I will scatter them in Israel.

firstLine: The scepter shall not depart from Judah,
rest:
nor the ruler’s staff between his feet,
until Shiloh comes.
And to him shall be the obedience of nations.

firstLine: Binding his donkey to the vine
rest:
and his donkey’s colt to the choice vine,
he washes his clothing in the wine
and his garment in the blood of grapes.

firstLine: The eyes are darker than wine,
rest: and the teeth whiter than milk.

firstLine: Issachar is a strong donkey,
rest: crouching between the sheepfolds.

firstLine: He saw a resting place that was good,
rest:
and land that was pleasant.
So he bowed his shoulder to the burden
and became a servant of forced labor.

firstLine: Dan shall judge his people
rest: as one of the tribes of Israel.

firstLine: Dan shall be a serpent on the way,
rest:
a viper on the road
that bites the heels of a horse,
so that its rider falls backward.

firstLine: Bandits shall attack Gad,
rest: but he shall attack their heels.

firstLine: Asher’s food is delicious,
rest: and he shall provide from the king’s delicacies.

firstLine: Naphtali is a doe running free
rest: that puts forth beautiful words.

firstLine: Joseph is the bough of a fruitful vine,
rest:
a fruitful bough by a spring.
His branches climb over the wall.

firstLine: But his bow remained in a steady position;
rest:
his arms were made agile
by the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob.
From there is the Shepherd, the Rock of Israel.

firstLine: Because of the God of your father he will help you
rest:
and by Shaddai he will bless you
with the blessings of heaven above,
blessings of the deep that crouches beneath,
blessings of the breasts and the womb.

firstLine: The blessings of your father
rest:
are superior to the blessings of my ancestors,
to the bounty of the everlasting hills.
May they be on the head of Joseph,
and on the forehead of the prince of his brothers.

firstLine: Benjamin is a devouring wolf,
rest:
devouring the prey in the morning,
and dividing the plunder in the evening.

firstLine: The Death and Burial of Jacob
rest: All these are the twelve tribes of Israel, and this is what their father said to them when he blessed them, each according to their blessing.

firstLine: Jacob’s Funeral and Joseph’s Remaining Time in Egypt
rest: Then Joseph fell on the face of his father and wept upon him and kissed him.

firstLine: The Death of Joseph
rest: So Joseph remained in Egypt, he and the house of his father. And Joseph lived one hundred and ten years.

firstLine: Israel and Oppression in Egypt
rest: And these are the names of the sons of Israel who came to Egypt; with Jacob, they each came with his family:

firstLine: The Birth and Early Life of Moses
rest: And a man from the family of Levi went, and he took a descendent of Levi.

firstLine: Yahweh’s Plan to Rescue the Israelites
rest: And Moses was a shepherd with the flock of Jethro, his father-in-law, the priest of Midian, and he led the flock to the west of the desert, and he came to the mountain of God, to Horeb.

firstLine: Yahweh Provides Signs and Help for Speaking
rest: And Moses answered, and he said, “And if they do not believe me and they do not listen to my voice, but they say, ‘Yahweh did not appear to you?’”

firstLine: Moses Leaves Midian and Returns to Egypt
rest: And Moses went, and he returned to Jethro his father-in-law, and he said to him, “Please let me go, and let me return to my brothers who are in Egypt, and let me see whether they are yet alive. And Jethro said to Moses, “Go in peace.”

firstLine: Pharaoh Rejects Yahweh’s Authority and Makes Israel’s Troubles Worse
rest: And afterward, Moses and Aaron went, and they said to Pharaoh, “Thus says Yahweh the God of Israel, ‘Release my people so that they may hold a festival for me in the desert.’”

firstLine: The Foremen Complain to Pharaoh and Moses, and Moses Complains to Yahweh
rest: And the foremen of the Israelites came and cried out to Pharaoh, saying, “Why do you treat your servants like this?

firstLine: Yahweh Discusses His Name and Israel’s Future
rest: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Now you will see what I will do to Pharaoh, because with a strong hand he will release them, and with a strong hand he will drive them out from his land.”

firstLine: The Genealogy of Moses and Aaron
rest:
These are the heads of their families.
The sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel, are Enoch and Pallu, Hezron and Carmi. These are the clans of Reuben.

firstLine: Yahweh Reviews Plans for Bringing the Israelites out of Egypt
rest: And Yahweh said to Moses, “See, I have made you as a god to Pharaoh, and Aaron your brother will be your prophet.

firstLine: Provision of a Wonder: Aaron’s Staff Becomes a Snake
rest: And Yahweh said to Moses and to Aaron, saying,

firstLine: Plague One: Blood
rest: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Pharaoh’s heart is insensitive; he refuses to release the people.

firstLine: Plague Two: Frogs
rest: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Go to Pharaoh, and say to him, ‘Thus says Yahweh, “Release my people so that they may serve me.”

firstLine: Plague Three: Gnats
rest: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Say to Aaron, ‘Stretch out your staff and strike the dust of the land, and it will become gnats in all the land of Egypt.’”

firstLine: Plague Four: Flies
rest: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Start early in the morning and stand before Pharaoh. Look, he is going out to the water, and you must say to him, ‘Thus says Yahweh, “Release my people so that they may serve me.”

firstLine: Plague Five: Livestock Death
rest: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Go to Pharaoh and say to him, ‘Thus says Yahweh, the God of the Hebrews, “Release my people so that they may serve me.”

firstLine: Plague Six: Painful Sores
rest: And Yahweh said to Moses and to Aaron, “Take for yourselves full handfuls of soot from a smelting furnace, and let Moses sprinkle it toward the heavens before the eyes of Pharaoh.

firstLine: Plague Seven: Hail
rest: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Start early in the morning and stand before Pharaoh. Look, he is going out to the water, and you must say to him, ‘Thus says Yahweh, the God of the Hebrews, “Release my people so that they may serve me.

firstLine: Plague Eight: Locusts
rest: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Go to Pharaoh, for I have made his heart insensitive and the heart of his servants in order to put these signs of mine in his midst,

firstLine: Plague Nine: Darkness
rest: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Stretch out your hand toward the heavens so that there may be darkness over the land of Egypt and so that a person can feel darkness.”

firstLine: Announcement of the Tenth Plague: Death of the Firstborn
rest: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Still one plague I will bring upon Pharaoh and upon Egypt; afterward he will release you from here. At the moment of his releasing, he will certainly drive you completely out from here.

firstLine: Instructions for the Feast of Passover
rest: And Yahweh said to Moses and to Aaron in the land of Egypt, saying,

firstLine: Death of Firstborn and Deliverance from Egypt
rest: And in the middle of the night, Yahweh struck all of the firstborn in the land of Egypt, from the firstborn of Pharaoh sitting on his throne to the firstborn of the captive who was in the prison house and every firstborn of an animal.

firstLine: Unleavened Bread and Dedication of Firstborn to Commemorate the Rescue from Egypt
rest: And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

firstLine: Summary of Travel
rest: And when Pharaoh released the people, God did not lead them the way of the land of the Philistines, though it was nearer, because God said, “Lest the people change their mind when they see war and return to Egypt.”

firstLine: Yahweh Rescues Israel at the Red Sea
rest: And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

firstLine: Song of Victory at the Sea
Yah is my strength and song, and he has become my salvation;
rest: this is my God, and I will praise him—the God of my father—and I will exalt him.

firstLine: The chariots of Pharaoh and his army he cast into the sea,
rest: and his choice adjutants were sunk in the Red Sea.

firstLine: The deep waters covered them;
rest: they went down into the depths like a stone.

firstLine: Yahweh, your right hand is glorious in power;
rest: Yahweh, your right hand destroyed the enemy.

firstLine: And in the greatness of your majesty you overthrew those standing up to you;
rest: you released your fierce anger, and it consumed them like stubble.

firstLine: And by the breath of your nostrils waters were piled up;
rest:
waves stood like a heap;
deep waters in the middle of the sea congealed.

firstLine: The enemy said, ‘I will pursue, I will overtake, I will divide plunder,
rest: my desire will be full of them, I will draw my sword, my hand will destroy them.’

firstLine: You blew with your breath; the sea covered them;
rest: they dropped like lead in the mighty waters.

firstLine: You stretched out your right hand;
rest: the earth swallowed them.

firstLine: In your loyal love you led the people whom you redeemed;
rest: in your strength you guided them to the abode of your holiness.

firstLine: Peoples heard; they trembled;
rest: anguish seized the inhabitants of Philistia.

firstLine: Then the chiefs of Edom were horrified; great distress seized the leaders of Moab;
rest: all of the inhabitants of Canaan melted away.

firstLine: Terror and dread fell on them;
rest:
at the greatness of your arm they became silent like the stone,
until your people passed by, Yahweh,
until the people whom you bought passed by.

firstLine: You brought them and planted them on the mountain of your inheritance,
rest:
a place you made for yourself to inhabit, Yahweh,
a sanctuary, Lord, that your hands established.

firstLine: Yahweh Provides Water at Marah
rest: And Moses caused Israel to set out from the Red Sea, and they went out into the desert of Shur, and they traveled three days in the desert, and they did not find water.

firstLine: Yahweh Provides Food in the Desert
rest: And they set out from Elim, and all the community of the Israelites came to the desert of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, in the fifteenth day of the second month of their going out from the land of Egypt.

firstLine: Water from a Rock
rest: And all the community of the Israelites set out from the desert of Sin for their journeys according to the command of Yahweh, and they camped in Rephidim, and there was no water for the people to drink.

firstLine: Battle with the Amalekites
rest: And Amalek came and fought with Israel at Rephidim.

firstLine: Jethro’s Visit to Moses at the Mountain of God
rest: And Jethro, the priest of Midian, the father-in-law of Moses, heard all that God had done for Moses and for Israel, his people, that Yahweh had brought Israel out from Egypt.

firstLine: Preparation for Receiving the Covenant at Mount Sinai
rest: In the third month after the Israelites went out from the land of Egypt, on this day they came to the Sinai desert.

firstLine: Ten Commandments
rest: And God spoke all these words, saying,

firstLine: Instructions for Building Altars
rest: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Thus you will say to the Israelites, ‘You yourselves have seen that I have spoken to you from the heavens.

firstLine: Regulations Regarding Hebrew Slaves
rest: “And these are the regulations that you will set before them.

firstLine: Regulations Regarding Murder, Manslaughter, and Various Injuries
rest: “‘Whoever strikes someone and he dies will surely be put to death.

firstLine: Regulations Regarding Theft, Borrowing, and Accidental Damage or Loss
rest: “‘If a man steals an ox or small livestock and slaughters it or sells it, he will make restitution with five cattle in place of the ox and with four sheep or goats in place of the small livestock.

firstLine: Regulations Regarding Various Offences
rest: “‘If a man seduces a virgin who is not engaged and he lies with her, he surely will give her bride price to have her as his wife.

firstLine: Regulations Regarding Foreigners and the Poor
rest: “‘You will not mistreat an alien, and you will not oppress him, because you were aliens in the land of Egypt.

firstLine: Regulations Regarding Tribute and Holiness
rest: “‘You will not curse God, and you will not curse a leader among your people.

firstLine: Regulations Regarding Justice
rest: “‘You will not spread a false report. Do not lift your hand with the wicked to be a malicious witness.

firstLine: Regulations Regarding Work and Festivals
rest: “‘And six years you will sow your land and gather its yield.

firstLine: “‘The best of the firstfruits of your land you will bring to the house of Yahweh your God.
rest: “‘You will not boil a young goat in its mother’s milk.

firstLine: Reasons for Loyal Obedience
rest: “‘Look, I am about to send an angel before you to guard you on the way and to bring you to the place that I have prepared.

firstLine: Confirming the Covenant
rest: And to Moses he said, “Go up to Yahweh—you and Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and seventy from the elders of Israel—and you will worship at a distance.

firstLine: The Start of Forty Days and Nights on Mount Sinai
rest: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Come up to me on the mountain, and be there, and I will give you the tablets of stone and the law and the commandments that I have written to instruct them.”

firstLine: Instruction to Collect Materials
rest: And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

firstLine: Instructions for Making the Ark of the Covenant
rest: “And they will make an ark of acacia wood, two and a half cubits its length and a cubit and a half its width and a cubit and a half its height.

firstLine: Instructions for Making a Table and a Lampstand
rest: “And you will make a table of acacia wood, two cubits its length and a cubit its width and a cubit and a half its height.

firstLine: Instructions for Making the Tabernacle
rest: “And the tabernacle you will make with ten curtains; you will make them of finely twisted linen and blue and purple and crimson yarns, with cherubim, the work of a skilled craftsman.

firstLine: Instructions for Making the Bronze Altar
rest: “And you will make the altar of acacia wood, five cubits long and five cubits wide; the altar will be square, and its height will be three cubits.

firstLine: Instructions for Making the Courtyard
rest: “You will make the courtyard of the tabernacle; for the south side will be hangings for the courtyard of finely twisted linen, one hundred cubits long for the one side.

firstLine: Instructions for Making Oil for the Lampstand
rest: “And you will command the Israelites, and they will bring to you pure, beaten olive oil for the light, to cause a lamp to burn continually.

firstLine: Instructions for Making Garments for Priests
rest: “And bring near to you Aaron, your brother, and his sons with him from the midst of the Israelites to serve as priests for me—Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar, the sons of Aaron.

firstLine: Instructions for Consecrating Aaron and His Sons
rest: “And this is the thing that you will do for them to consecrate them to serve as a priest for me: Take one young bull and two rams without defect

firstLine: Instructions for Regular Offerings at the Tabernacle
rest: “And you will offer a bull for a sin offering every day for the atonement; and you will offer a sin offering on the altar when you make atonement for it, and you will anoint it to consecrate it.

firstLine: Instructions for Making the Incense Altar
rest: “And you will make an altar for burning incense; you will make it of acacia wood,

firstLine: The Golden Calf
rest: And the people saw that Moses delayed to come down from the mountain, and the people gathered opposite Aaron, and they said to him, “Come, make for us gods who will go before us, because this Moses, the man who brought us up from the land of Egypt, we do not know what has become of him.”

firstLine: Command to Resume Travel
rest: And Yahweh spoke to Moses, “Go, go up from here, you and the people whom you have brought up from the land of Egypt, to the land that I swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, saying, ‘I will give it to your offspring.’

firstLine: The Tent outside the Camp
rest: And Moses took the tent and pitched it outside the camp far from the camp, and he called it the tent of assembly, and all seeking Yahweh would go out to the tent of assembly, which was outside the camp.

firstLine: Presence and Glory
rest: And Moses said to Yahweh, “See, you are saying to me, ‘Take this people up.’ But you have not let me know whom you will send with me, and you yourself have said, ‘I know you by name, and you also have found favor in my eyes.’

firstLine: Yahweh’s Description of Himself
rest: And Yahweh said to Moses, “Cut for yourself two stone tablets like the first ones, and I will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets, which you broke.

firstLine: Covenant Stipulations
rest: And he said, “Look, I am about to make a covenant. In front of all your people I will do wonders that have not been created on all the earth and among all the nations, and all the people among whom you are will see Yahweh’s work, because what I am about to do with you will be awesome.

firstLine: The Shining Face of Moses
rest: And he was there with Yahweh forty days and forty nights. He ate no food and drank no water. And he wrote on the tablets the words of the covenant, the ten words.

firstLine: Preparation of Materials and People for Building
rest: And Moses assembled all the community of the Israelites, and he said to them, “These are the words that Yahweh has commanded for us to do them.

firstLine: Making the Tabernacle
rest: And Moses called Bezalel and Oholiab and everyone skilled of heart, in whose heart Yahweh had put skill, all whose heart lifted him to come near to the work in order to do it.

firstLine: Making the Ark of the Covenant
rest: And Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood, two and a half cubits its length and a cubit and a half its width and a cubit and a half its height.

firstLine: Making the Table and the Lampstand
rest: And he made the table of acacia wood, two cubits its length and a cubit its width and a cubit and a half its height.

firstLine: Making the Incense Altar and Anointing Oil
rest: And he made the incense altar of acacia wood, a cubit its length and a cubit its width—a square—and two cubits its height; its horns were of one piece with it.

firstLine: Making the Bronze Altar and the Basin
rest: And he made the burnt-offering altar of acacia wood; its length was five cubits, and its width was five cubits—it was square—and its height was three cubits.

firstLine: Making the Courtyard
rest: And he made the courtyard; for the south side were the hangings of the court of finely twisted linen, one hundred cubits,

firstLine: Amounts of Gold, Silver, and Bronze Used
rest: These are the records of the tabernacle, the tabernacle of the testimony, which were recorded at the command of Moses, the work of the Levites, in the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.

firstLine: Making Garments for Priests
rest: And from the blue and the purple and the crimson yarns they made woven garments for serving in the sanctuary, and they made the holy garments that were for Aaron, as Yahweh had commanded Moses.

firstLine: Preparations Complete
rest: And all the work of the tabernacle of the tent of assembly was finished, and the Israelites had done according to all that Yahweh had commanded Moses; so they did.

firstLine: Completion of the Tabernacle
rest: And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

rest: “‘When a person brings a grain offering to Yahweh, his offering must be finely milled flour, and he must pour out oil on it and place frankincense on it.

firstLine: Laws for Fellowship Offerings
rest: “‘Now if his offering is a sacrifice of fellowship offering, if he brings it from the cattle, whether male or female, he must bring it without defect before Yahweh.

firstLine: You Shall Keep My Statutes
rest: “‘You must keep my statutes: as for your domestic animals, you shall not cause two differing kinds to breed; as for your field, you shall not sow two differing kinds of seed; and, a garment of two differing kinds of woven material should not be worn on you.

rest: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

firstLine: Punishment for Blasphemy
rest: And an Israelite woman’s son, and he was an Egyptian man’s son, went out in the midst of the Israelites; and the Israelite woman’s son and an Israelite man fought in the camp.

firstLine: The Sabbath Year
rest: Then Yahweh spoke to Moses on Mount Sinai, saying,

firstLine: The Year of Jubilee
rest: “‘And you shall count for yourself seven Sabbaths of years, seven times seven years, and they shall be for you time periods of years: forty-nine years.

firstLine: Blessings for Obedience
rest: “‘You shall not make for yourselves idols and divine images, and you shall not raise up stone pillars for yourselves, and you shall not put a sculptured stone in your land in order to worship before it, because I am Yahweh your God.

rest: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

rest: Yahweh spoke to Moses in the desert of Sinai, in the second year after they came out from the land of Egypt, in the first month, saying,

rest: And on a day setting up the tabernacle, the cloud covered the tent of the tabernacle, the tent of the testimony; in the evening it was on the tabernacle as an appearance of fire until morning.

firstLine: The Silver Trumpets
rest: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

rest: And it happened, in the second year, in the second month, on the twentieth of the month the cloud was lifted from upon the tabernacle of the testimony.

firstLine: And whenever the ark was setting out Moses would say,
And when it rested he would say,
rest:
“Return, Yahweh,
to the countless thousands of Israel.”

firstLine: The Israelites Complain
rest: And it happened, the people were like those who complain of hardship in the hearing of Yahweh, and Yahweh became angry, and the fire of Yahweh burned among them, and it consumed the edge of the camp.

firstLine: The Quail
rest: Then a wind set out from Yahweh, and it drove quails from the west, and he spread them out on the camp about a day’s journey on one side and about a day’s journey on the other, all around the camp, about two cubits on the surface of the land.

firstLine: Aaron and Miriam Murmur Against Moses
rest: And Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Cushite woman whom he took (because he took a Cushite wife);

firstLine: and he said,
rest:
“Please hear my words:
If there is a prophet among you, I, Yahweh,
will make myself known to him in a vision.
I will speak to him in a dream.

firstLine: Not so with my servant Moses;
rest: in all my house he is faithful.

firstLine: I will speak to him mouth to mouth,
Spies Sent to Spy Out the Land of Canaan
rest: And Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

firstLine: The Spies Return
rest: They returned from exploring the land at the end of forty days.

firstLine: The People Complain
rest: Then all the community lifted up their voices, and the people wept during that night.

firstLine: ‘Yahweh is slow to anger
rest:
and great of loyal love,
forgiving sin and rebellion;
but surely he leaves nothing unpunished,
visiting the sin of the fathers on the sons
to the third and fourth generations.’

firstLine: Various Sacrifices and Offerings
rest: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

rest: When the Israelites were in the desert, they found a man who was gathering wood on the day of the Sabbath.

firstLine: Garment Fringes
rest: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

rest: Now Korah son of Izhar, son of Kohath, son of Levi, and Dathan and Abiram sons of Eliab, and On son of Peleth, the descendants of Reuben,

rest: The next day all the community of the Israelites grumbled against Moses and Aaron, saying, “You have killed the people of Yahweh!”

firstLine: Aaron’s Staff Is Chosen
rest: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

firstLine: The Duties of the Priests and Levities
rest: Yahweh said to Aaron, “You, your sons, and your family with you will bear the guilt of the sanctuary, and you and your sons with you will bear the guilt of your priesthood.

firstLine: Portions for the Priests
rest: Yahweh spoke to Aaron, “Behold, I myself have given to you the responsibility of my contributions for all the holy objects of the Israelites; I have given them as a portion to you and your sons as an eternal decree.

firstLine: Ashes of the Red Heifer
rest: And Yahweh spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,

firstLine: Miriam Dies
rest: Then the entire community of the Israelites came to the desert of Zin on the first month, and the people stayed in Kadesh; Miriam died and was buried there.

firstLine: Aaron Dies
rest: And they set out from Kadesh. The Israelites, the whole community, came to Mount Hor.

firstLine: Arad Captured
rest: The Canaanite king of Arad, who was dwelling in the Negev, heard that Israel came along the way of Atharim; he fought against Israel and took some of them captive.

firstLine: The Bronze Serpent
rest: And Yahweh sent among the people poisonous snakes; they bit the people, and many people from Israel died.

firstLine: Therefore thus it is said in the scroll of the Wars of Yahweh,
rest:
“Waheb in Suphah,
and the wadis of Arnon,

firstLine: and the slope of the wadis
rest:
that spreads out to the dwelling of Ar
and lies at the boundary of Moab.”

firstLine: Sihon and Og Defeated
rest: Israel sent messengers to Sihon, the king of the Amorites, saying,

firstLine: Thus the ones who quote proverbs say,
rest:
“Come to Heshbon! Let it be built!
And let the city of Sihon be established.

firstLine: Because fire went out from Heshbon,
We destroyed them;
Balak and Balaam
rest: The Israelites set out, and they encamped on the desert-plateau of Moab, across from Jericho beyond the Jordan.

firstLine: Balaam and the Angel
rest: But God became angry because he was going, and the angel of Yahweh stood in the road as an adversary to him; he was riding on his donkey, and two servants were with him.

firstLine: Balaam’s Oracles
rest: Balaam said to Balak, “Build for me this: seven altars. And prepare for me this: seven bulls and seven rams.”

firstLine: And he lifted up his oracle and said,
rest:
“From Aram Balak lead me,
from the mountains of the east the king of Moab,
‘Go for me, curse Jacob,
and go, denounce Israel.’

firstLine: How can I curse whom God has not cursed,
rest: and how can I denounce whom Yahweh has not denounced?

firstLine: Because from the top of the rocks I see him,
rest:
from hilltops I watch him.
Behold, a people who dwell alone,
they do not consider themselves among the nations.

firstLine: Who can count the dust of Jacob,
rest:
or as a number the fourth part of Israel?
Let my life die the death of an upright person,
and let my end be like his!”

firstLine: Then he uttered his oracle, and said,
rest:
“Stand up, Balak, and hear;
listen to me, son of Zippor!

firstLine: God is not a man, that he should lie,
rest:
nor a son of humankind,
that he should change his mind.
Has he said, and will he not do it?
And has he spoken, and will he not fulfill it?

firstLine: Behold, I have received a command to bless;
rest: when he has blessed, I cannot cause it to return.

firstLine: He has no regard for evil in Jacob,
God, who brings them out from Egypt,
rest: is like the strength of a wild ox for them.

firstLine: Because there is no sorcery against Jacob,
rest:
and there is no divination against Israel.
Now it will be said to Jacob and Israel,
what God has done!

firstLine: Balaam Continues to Utter Oracles
rest: And Balaam saw that it pleased Yahweh to bless Israel, and he did not go as other times to seek out sorcery; instead, he set his face toward the desert.

firstLine: He uttered his oracle and said,
rest:
“The declaration of Balaam son Beor,
the declaration of the man whose eyes are closed,

firstLine: the declaration of the hearer of God’s words,
rest:
who sees the revelation of Shaddai,
falling down but whose eyes are uncovered.

firstLine: How good are your tents, O Jacob,
rest: your dwellings, O Israel!

firstLine: They are spread out like valleys,
rest:
like gardens on a river,
like aloes planted by Yahweh,
like cedars at the waters.

firstLine: He will pour water from his buckets,
God, who brings him out from Egypt,
He crouches, he lies down like a lion,
rest:
and like a lioness, who will rouse him?
They who bless you will be blessed,
and they who curse you will be cursed.”

firstLine: And he uttered his oracle and said,
rest:
“The declaration of Balaam son of Beor,
and the declaration of the man whose eye is closed,

firstLine: the declaration of the hearer of God’s words,
rest:
and the knower of the knowledge of the Most High,
who sees the vision of Shaddai,
who is falling, and his eyes are revealed.

firstLine: I see him, but not now;
Edom will be a captive;
rest:
Seir, its enemies, will be a captive,
and Israel will be acting courageously.

firstLine: Someone from Jacob will rule
rest: and will destroy a remnant from the city.”

firstLine: And he looked at Amalek, uttered his oracle, and said,
rest:
“Amalek is first of the nations,
but his future will be forever ruin.”

firstLine: And he looked at the Kenites, uttered his oracle, and said,
rest:
“Steady is your dwelling place;
in the rock is your nest.

firstLine: Nevertheless, the Kenite will be burned;
rest: how long will Asshur keep you captive?”

firstLine: Again he uttered his oracle and said,
rest: “Woe, who will live when God establishes this?

firstLine: The ships will come from the hand of the Kittim,
rest:
and they will afflict Asshur and will afflict Eber;
also he will be forever ruin.”

rest: The leaders of the families of the clans of descendants of Gilead the son of Makir, the son of Manasseh, of the clans of the descendants of Joseph came near and spoke before Moses and before the leaders of the families of the Israelites.

firstLine: Preamble
rest: These are the words that Moses spoke to all of Israel on the other side of the Jordan in the desert, in the desert plateau opposite Suph, between Paran and between Tophel and Laban and Hazeroth and Dizahab.

firstLine: Historical Prologue
rest: “Yahweh our God spoke to us at Horeb, saying, ‘You have stayed long enough at this mountain.

firstLine: Introduction to the Stipulations
rest: “Now, Israel, listen to the rules and to the regulations that I am teaching you to do, in order that you may live and you may go in and you may take possession of the land that Yahweh, the God of your ancestors, is giving to you.

firstLine: Basic Stipulations
rest: And then Moses summoned all of Israel and said to them, “Hear, Israel, the rules and the regulations that I am speaking in your ears today, and you shall learn them, and you must observe them diligently.

firstLine: Detailed Stipulations
rest: “Now this is the commandment, the rules and the regulations, that Yahweh your God charged to teach to you for you to observe in the land that you are about to cross over into to take possession of it,

firstLine: Detailed Stipulations: Purity and Unity
rest: “These are the rules and the regulations that you must diligently observe in the land that Yahweh, the God of your ancestors, has given to you to take possession of it, during all the days that you are living on the land.

firstLine: Ceremonies
rest: Then Moses and the elders of Israel charged the people, saying, “Keep all of the commandment that I am commanding you today.

firstLine: Blessings and Curses
rest: And Moses charged the people on that day, saying,

firstLine: Covenant Renewal, Oaths, Restoration, Charges to the Nation
rest: These are the words of the covenant that Yahweh commanded Moses to make with the Israelites in the land of Moab besides the covenant that he made with them at Horeb.

firstLine: Succession, Deposition, and Recitation of Text
rest: And Moses went and spoke these words to all Israel.

firstLine: The Song of Moses
rest:
“Give ear, O heavens, and I will speak,
and let the earth hear the words of my mouth.

firstLine: May my teaching trickle like the dew,
rest:
my words like rain showers on tender grass,
and like spring showers on new growth.

firstLine: For I will proclaim the name of Yahweh;
rest: ascribe greatness to our God!

firstLine: The Rock, his work is perfect,
They have behaved corruptly toward him;
rest:
they are not his children; this is their flaw,
a generation crooked and perverse.

firstLine: Like this do you treat Yahweh,
rest:
foolish and unwise people?
Has he not, your father, created you?
He made you, and he established you.

firstLine: Remember the old days, the years long past;
rest:
ask your father, and he will inform you,
your elders and they will tell you.

firstLine: When the Most High apportioned the nations,
rest:
at his dividing up of the sons of humankind,
he fixed the boundaries of the peoples,
according to the number of the children of Israel.

firstLine: For Yahweh’s portion was his people,
rest: Jacob the share of his inheritance.

firstLine: He found him in a desert land,
As an eagle stirs up its nest,
rest:
hovers over its young,
spreads out its wings, takes them,
carries them on its pinions,

firstLine: so Yahweh alone guided him,
rest: and there was no foreign god accompanying him.

firstLine: And he set him on the high places of the land,
rest:
and he fed him the crops of the field,
and he nursed him with honey from crags,
and with oil from flinty rock,

firstLine: With curds from the herd,
rest:
and with milk from the flock,
with the fat of young rams,
and rams, the offspring of Bashan,
and with goats along with the finest kernels of wheat,
and from the blood of grapes you drank fermented wine.

firstLine: And Jeshurun grew fat, and he kicked;
They made him jealous with strange gods;
rest: with detestable things they provoked him.

firstLine: They sacrificed to the demons, not God,
The rock who bore you, you neglected,
rest: and you forgot God, the one giving you birth.

firstLine: Then Yahweh saw, and he spurned them,
rest: because of the provocation of his sons and his daughters.

firstLine: So he said, ‘I will hide my face from them;
They annoyed me with what is not a god;
rest:
they provoked me with their idols.
So I will make them jealous with those not a people,
with a foolish nation I will provoke them.

firstLine: For a fire was kindled by my anger,
rest:
and it burned up to the depths of Sheol,
and it devoured the earth and its produce,
and it set afire the foundation of the mountains.

firstLine: I will heap disasters upon them;
rest: my arrows I will spend on them.

firstLine: They will become weakened by famine,
From outside her boundaries the sword will make her childless,
I thought, “I will wipe them out;
rest: I will make people forget they ever existed.”

firstLine: If I had not feared a provocation of the enemy,
rest:
lest their foes might misunderstand,
lest they should say,  “Our hand is
triumphant, and Yahweh did not do all this.”’

firstLine: For they are a nation void of sense,
rest: and there is not any understanding in them.

firstLine: If only they were wise, they would understand this;
rest: they would discern for themselves their end.

firstLine: How could one chase a thousand
For the fact of the matter is,
rest:
their rock is not like our Rock,
and our enemies recognize this.

firstLine: For their vine is from the vine of Sodom,
Their wine is the poison of snakes,
rest: and the deadly poison of horned vipers.

firstLine: ‘Is not this stored up with me,
rest: sealed in my treasuries?’

firstLine: Vengeance belongs to me and also recompense,
For Yahweh will judge on behalf of his people,
And he will say, ‘Where are their gods,
rest: their rock in whom they took refuge?

firstLine: Who ate the fat of their sacrifices
See, now, that I, even I am he,
For indeed I lift up my hand to heaven,
rest: And I promise as I live forever,

firstLine: When I sharpen my flashing sword,
rest:
and my hand takes hold of it in judgment,
I will take reprisals against my foes,
and my haters I will repay.

firstLine: I will make my arrows drunk with blood,
rest:
and my sword shall devour flesh with the blood of the slain,
and captives from the heads of the leaders of the enemy.’

firstLine: Call for songs of joy, O nations, concerning his people,
Instructions Concerning Moses’ Death
rest: And Yahweh said to Moses on exactly this day, saying,

firstLine: Blessings of Moses on Israel
rest: Now this is the blessing with which Moses, the man of God, blessed the Israelites before his death.

firstLine: Then he said,
rest:
“Yahweh came from Sinai,
and he dawned upon them from Seir;
he shone forth from Mount Paran,
and he came with myriads of holy ones,
at his right hand a fiery law for them.

firstLine: Moreover, he loves his people,
rest:
all the holy ones were in your hand,
and they bowed down to your feet,
each one accepted directions from you.

firstLine: A law Moses instructed for us,
rest: as a possession for the assembly of Jacob.

firstLine: And then a king arose in Jeshurun,
rest:
at the gathering of the leaders of the people,
united were the tribes of Israel.

firstLine: “May Reuben live, and may he not die,
rest: and let his number not be few.”

firstLine: And he said this of Judah,
rest:
“Hear, O Yahweh, the voice of Judah,
and bring him to his people;
his own hands strive for him,
and may you be a help against his foes.”

firstLine: And of Levi he said,
rest:
“Your Thummim and your Urim
are for your faithful one,
whom you tested at Massah;
you contended with him
at the waters of Meribah.

firstLine: The one saying of his father and of his mother,
rest:
‘I have not regarded them,’
and his brothers he did not acknowledge,
and his children he did not know,
but rather they observed your word,
and your covenant they kept.

firstLine: They taught your regulations to Jacob,
Bless, O Yahweh, his substance,
Of Benjamin he said,
rest:
“The beloved of Yahweh dwells securely,
the Most High shields all around him,
all the day,
and between his shoulders he dwells.”

firstLine: And of Joseph he said,
rest:
“Blessed by Yahweh is his land,
with the choice things of heaven,
with dew, and with the deep lying down beneath,

firstLine: and with the choice things of the fruits of the the sun,
rest: and with the choice things of the yield of the seasons,

firstLine: and with the finest things of the ancient mountains,
rest: and with the choice things of the eternal hills,

firstLine: and with the choice things of the earth and its fullness,
rest:
and the favor of the one who dwelt in the bush.
Let them come to the head of Joseph,
and to the crown of the prince among his brothers.

firstLine: As the firstborn of his ox, majesty belongs to him,
rest:
and his horns are the horns of a wild ox;
with them he drives people together,
and they are the myriads of Ephraim,
and they are the thousands of Manasseh.”

firstLine: And of Zebulun he said,
rest:
“Rejoice, Zebulun, in your going out,
and rejoice, Issachar, in your tents;

firstLine: They summon people to the mountains;
rest:
there they sacrifice the sacrifices of righteousness,
because the affluence of the seas they suck out,
and the most hidden treasures of the sand.”

firstLine: And of Gad he said,
And he selected the best part for himself,
And of Dan he said,
rest:
“Dan is a cub of a lion;
he leaps from Bashan.”

firstLine: And of Naphtali, he said,
rest:
“Oh, Naphtali, sated of favor,
and full of the blessing of Yahweh;
take possession of the lake,
and the land to the south.”

firstLine: And of Asher he said,
Your bars are iron and bronze,
rest: and as your days, so is your strength.”

firstLine: “There is no one like God, O, Jeshurun,
rest:
who rides through the heavens to your help,
and with his majesty through the skies.

firstLine: The God of ancient time is a hiding place,
rest:
and underneath are the arms of eternity,
and he drove out from before you your enemy,
and he said, ‘Destroy them!’

firstLine: So Israel dwells alone and carefree,
rest:
the spring of Jacob in a land of grain and wine;
his heavens even drip dew.

firstLine: The Death of Moses and the Commissioning of Joshua
rest: Then Moses went up from the desert plateau of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, which is opposite Jericho, and Yahweh showed him all of the land, Gilead all the way up to Dan,

firstLine: Joshua Addresses the Israelites
rest: After the death of Moses the servant of Yahweh, Yahweh said to Joshua son of Nun, the assistant of Moses, saying,

firstLine: Spies View the Land
rest: Then Joshua son of Nun secretly sent two men from Acacia Grove as spies, saying, “Go, view the land, especially Jericho.” So they went, and entered the house of a prostitute whose name was Rahab, and spent the night there.

firstLine: The Israelites Cross the Jordan
rest: Joshua rose early in the morning, and they set out from Acacia Grove. And they came up to the Jordan, he and all the Israelites, and they spent the night there before they crossed over.

firstLine: The Israelites Make a Memorial
rest: After all the nation finished crossing the Jordan, Yahweh said to Joshua,

firstLine: The Israelites Are Circumcised
rest: And it happened, when all the kings of the Amorites who were beyond the Jordan to the west, and all the kings of the Canaanites who were by the sea heard that Yahweh dried up the waters of the Jordan in front of the Israelites until they crossed over, their hearts melted, and there was no courage left in them because of the presence of the Israelites.

firstLine: The Israelites Celebrate Passover in Canaan
rest: And it happened, when all the nation had finished circumcising, they remained where they were in the camp until they recovered.

firstLine: The Commander of Yahweh’s Army Appears Before Joshua
rest: And it happened, when Joshua was by Jericho, he looked up, and he saw a man standing opposite him with his sword drawn in his hand. And Joshua went to him and said, “Are you with us, or with our adversaries?”

firstLine: The Battle of Jericho
rest: Now Jericho was shut up inside and out because of the presence of the Israelites; no one was going out or coming in.

firstLine: The Sin of Achan
rest: But the Israelites broke faith concerning the devoted things. Achan son of Carmi son of Zabdi son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took from the devoted things; and Yahweh’s anger was kindled against the Israelites.

firstLine: Ai Is Destroyed
rest: Then Yahweh said to Joshua, “Do not fear or be dismayed. Take all the fighting men with you and go up immediately to Ai. Look, I am giving into your hand the king of Ai, his city, and his land.

firstLine: Israel Renews the Covenant
rest: Then Joshua built an altar on Mount Ebal for Yahweh the God of Israel,

firstLine: The Gibeonites Act with Cunning
rest: Now when all the kings who were beyond the Jordan in the hill country and in the Shephelah, and on all the coast of the great sea toward Lebanon—the Hittites, the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites—heard of this,

firstLine: The Sun Stands Still at Gibeon
rest: And it happened that when Adoni-Zedek king of Jerusalem heard that Joshua captured Ai and had utterly destroyed it (just as he had done to Jericho and its king, so he did to Ai and its king) and that the inhabitants of Gibeon had made peace with Israel and were among them,

firstLine: And the sun stood still, and the moon stopped,
rest:
until the nation took vengeance on its enemies.
Is it not written in the scroll of Jashar? The sun stood still in the middle of the heaven and was not in haste to set for about a full day.

firstLine: The Kings of the Amorites Are Killed
rest: But these five kings fled and hid themselves in the cave at Makkedah.

firstLine: Joshua’s Conquest of the South
rest: And Joshua passed on, and all of Israel with him, from Makkedah to Libnah, and he fought against Libnah.

firstLine: Joshua’s Conquest of the North
rest: And it happened, when Jabin king of Hazor heard this, he sent to Jobab king of Madon, to the king of Shimron, to the king of Acshaph,

firstLine: A Review of Joshua’s Conquests
rest: So Joshua took all this land: the hill country, all the Negev, all the land of Goshen, the Shephelah, the Arabah, and the hill country of Israel and its Shephelah,

firstLine: The Kings Conquered by Joshua
rest: These are the kings of the land whom the Israelites defeated, and of whose land they took possession beyond the Jordon to the east, from the wadi of Arnon up to Mount Hermon, and all the Arabah to the east:

firstLine: The Kings Conquered by Moses
rest: These are the kings of the land whom Joshua and the Israelites defeated beyond to the Jordan to the west, from Baal Gad in the valley of Lebanon, and up to Mount Halak, which rises to Seir. And Joshua gave it as a possession to the tribes of Israel according to their allotments,

firstLine: Land Still Remains to be Conquered
rest: Now Joshua was old and advanced in years, and Yahweh said to him, “You are old and advanced in years, and very much of the land remains to be possessed.

firstLine: Reuben’s Inheritance
rest: Moses gave an inheritance to the tribe of the descendants of Reuben according to their families.

firstLine: Gad’s Inheritance
rest: Moses gave an inheritance to the tribe of Gad, to the descendants of Gad, according to their families.

firstLine: The Half-Tribe of Manasseh’s Inheritance
rest: Moses gave an inheritance to the half-tribe of Manasseh; it was for the half-tribe of the descendants of Manasseh according to their families.

firstLine: The Land Allotted West of the Jordan
rest: These are the territories that the Israelites inherited in the land of Canaan, which Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the heads of the families of the tribes of the Israelites gave as an inheritance to them.

firstLine: Caleb Receives Hebron
rest: Then the descendants of Judah came to Joshua at Gilgal; and Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite said to him, “You know the word that Yahweh said to Moses the man of God at Kadesh Barnea concerning you and me.

firstLine: The Allotment of Judah
rest: The allotment for the tribe of the descendants of Judah according to their families reached to the border of Edom, to the wilderness of Zin, to the far south.

firstLine: The Cities of Judah
rest: This is the inheritance of the tribe of the descendants of Judah according to their families:

firstLine: The Allotment of Ephraim and Manasseh
rest: The allotment of the descendants of Joseph went from the Jordan by Jericho, at the waters of Jericho to the east, into the wilderness, going up from Jericho into the hill country to Bethel;

firstLine: The Allotment of the Other Half-Tribe of Manasseh
rest: Then the allotment was made for the tribe of Manasseh, because he was the firstborn of Joseph. To Makir, the firstborn of Manasseh, the father of Gilead, were allotted Gilead and Bashan, because he was a warrior.

firstLine: The Tribes of Joseph Object
rest: The descendants of Joseph spoke with Joshua, saying, “Why have you given us one allotment and one share as an inheritance? We are many people, which Yahweh has blessed.”

firstLine: The Last of the Land Is Divided
rest: The entire congregation of the Israelites assembled at Shiloh, and they set up there the tent of meeting, and the land was subdued before them.

firstLine: The Allotment of Benjamin
rest: And the allotment of the tribe of Benjamin came up according to their families, and the border of their allotment fell between the descendants of Judah and the descendants of Joseph.

firstLine: The Allotment of Simeon
rest: The second allotment fell for Simeon, for the tribe of the descendants of Simeon, according to their families. And their inheritance was in the midst of the inheritance of the descendants of Judah.

firstLine: The Allotment of Zebulun
rest: The third allotment came up for the descendants of Zebulun according to their families. The border of their inheritance went up to Sarid.

firstLine: The Allotment of Issachar
rest: The fourth allotment fell for Issachar, for the descendants of Issachar, according to their families.

firstLine: The Allotment of Asher
rest: The fifth allotment fell for the tribe of the descendants of Asher according to their families.

firstLine: The Allotment of Naphtali
rest: The sixth allotment fell for the children of Naphtali, for the children of Naphtali according to their families.

firstLine: The Allotment of Dan
rest: The seventh lot fell for the tribe of the descendants of Dan according to their families.

firstLine: The Allotment Is Completed
rest: They finished assigning the land according to its borders, and the Israelites gave an inheritance from among them to Joshua son of Nun.

firstLine: Cities of Refuge Are Established
rest: And Yahweh spoke to Joshua, saying,

firstLine: The Allotment of the Levites
rest: Then the heads of the families of the Levites came to Eleazar the priest, to Joshua son of Nun, and to the heads of the families of the tribes of the Israelites.

firstLine: The Eastern Tribes Return
rest: Then Joshua summoned the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh,

firstLine: Joshua’s Farewell Address
rest: And it happened, after a long time, after Yahweh had given rest to Israel from all their surrounding enemies, and after Joshua was old and well-advanced in years,

firstLine: Joshua Recounts Their History
rest: And Joshua gathered all the tribes of Israel to Shechem; he summoned the elders of Israel, their heads, their judges, and their officials, and they presented themselves before God.

firstLine: The Israelites Promise to Serve Yahweh
rest: “So now, revere Yahweh and serve him in sincerity and faithfulness; remove the gods that your ancestors served beyond the river and in Egypt, and serve Yahweh.

firstLine: Israel Continues Its Conquest
rest: After the death of Joshua, the Israelites inquired of Yahweh, saying, “Who will go up first for us against the Canaanites to fight against them?”

firstLine: Israel Disobeys Yahweh
rest: And the angel of Yahweh went up from Gilgal to Bokim and said, “I brought you up from Egypt, and I brought you to the land that I had promised to your ancestors. I said, ‘I will never break my covenant with you.

firstLine: Joshua Dies
rest: And Joshua sent the people away, and the Israelites went each to their own inheritance to take possession of the land.

firstLine: Israel Worships the Baals
rest: The Israelites did evil in the eyes of Yahweh, and they served the Baals.

firstLine: Some Nations Remain in the Land
rest: These are the nations that Yahweh left, to test Israel by them (that is, to test all those who had not experienced any of the wars of Canaan,

firstLine: Othniel
rest: The Israelites did evil in the eyes of Yahweh. They forgot Yahweh their God, and they served the Baals and the Asheroth.

firstLine: Ehud
rest: And again the Israelites did evil in the eyes of Yahweh. So Yahweh strengthened Eglon king of Moab against Israel, because they did evil in the eyes of Yahweh.

firstLine: Shamgar
rest: And Shamgar son of Anath came after him, and he killed six hundred Philistines with the goad of an ox; he also delivered Israel.

firstLine: Deborah and Barak
rest: And again the Israelites did evil in the eyes of Yahweh, and Ehud died.

firstLine: The Song of Deborah and Barak
rest: And Deborah and Barak son of Abinoam sang on that day:

firstLine: “When long hair hangs loosely in Israel,
rest:
when the people willingly offer themselves,
bless Yahweh!

firstLine: Yahweh, when you went down from Seir,
rest:
when you marched from the region of Edom,
the earth trembled, the heavens poured down,
the clouds poured down water.

firstLine: The mountains trembled before Yahweh,
rest: this Sinai, at the presence of Yahweh, the God of Israel.

firstLine: “In the days of Shamgar son of Anath,
rest:
in the days of Jael, the caravans had ceased,
the travelers, they kept to the byways.

firstLine: The warriors ceased;
God chose new leaders,
My heart goes out to the commanders of Israel,
rest:
those offering themselves willingly among the people;
bless Yahweh!

firstLine: The riders of white female donkeys,
rest:
those sitting on saddle blankets,
and those going on the way, talk about it!

firstLine: At the sound of those dividing the sheep
rest:
among the watering places,
there they will recount the righteous deeds of Yahweh,
the righteous deeds for his warriors in Israel.
Then the people of Yahweh went down to the gates.

firstLine: “Wake up, wake up, Deborah!
rest:
Wake up, wake up, sing a song!
Get up, Barak!
Take captive your captives, O son of Abinoam.

firstLine: Then the remnant went down to the nobles;
rest: the people of Yahweh went down for him against the mighty.

firstLine: From Ephraim is their root into Amalek,
And the chiefs in Issachar were with Deborah;
rest:
and Issachar likewise was with Barak;
into the valley he was sent to get him from behind.
Among the clans of Reuben
were great decisions of the heart.

firstLine: Why do you sit among the sheepfolds,
rest:
to hear the calling sounds of the herds?
For the clans of Reuben,
there were great searchings of the heart.

firstLine: Zebulun is a people who scorned death,
rest: and Naphtali, on the heights of the field.

firstLine: “The kings came, they fought;
The stars fought from heaven;
rest: from their courses they fought against Sisera.

firstLine: The wadi torrent of Kishon swept them away,
rest:
the raging wadi torrent,
the wadi torrent of Kishon.
March on, my soul, with strength!

firstLine: “Then the hooves of the horse beat loudly,
rest: because of galloping, galloping of his stallions.

firstLine: ‘Curse Meroz,’ says the angel of Yahweh;
rest:
‘curse bitterly its inhabitants,
because they did not come to the help of Yahweh,
to the help of Yahweh against the mighty.’

firstLine: “Most blessed of women is Jael,
rest:
the wife of Heber the Kenite;
most blessed is she of women among tent dwellers.

firstLine: He asked for water, and she gave milk;
rest: in a drinking bowl for nobles, she brought curds.

firstLine: She reached out her hand to the peg,
“Through the window she looked down;
rest:
the mother of Sisera cried out through the lattice,
‘Why is his chariot delayed in coming?
Why do the hoof beats of his chariot tarry?’

firstLine: The wisest of her ladies answer her;
rest: she also answers the question herself:

firstLine: ‘Are they not finding and dividing the plunder?
rest:
A bedmate or two bedmates for every man;
colorful garments for Sisera,
plunder of colorful garments,
beautifully finished colorful garments,
on the neck of the plunderer?’

firstLine: So may all your enemies perish, O Yahweh,
rest:
but those who love him are like the rising sun at its brightest.”
And the land had rest for forty years.

firstLine: The Midianites Oppresses Israel
rest: The Israelites did evil in the eyes of Yahweh, and Yahweh gave them into the hand of the Midianites for seven years.

firstLine: The Angel of Yahweh Calls Gideon
rest: The angel of Yahweh came and sat under the oak that was at Ophrah that belonged to Jehoash the Abiezrite; and Gideon his son was threshing wheat in the winepress to hide it from the Midianites.

firstLine: Gideon Destroys the Altar of Baal
rest: When the men of the city got up early in the morning, look, the altar of Baal and the Asherah that was beside it were cut down, and the second bull was offered on the altar that had been built.

firstLine: Gideon Tests Yahweh With the Fleece
rest: Then Gideon said to God, “In order to see that you will deliver Israel by my hand, just as you have said,

firstLine: Gideon’s Three Hundred Men
rest: Then Jerub-Baal (that is, Gideon) rose early, and all the army that was with him. They were camped beside the spring of Harod; the camp of Midian was north of the hill of Moreh, in the valley.

firstLine: Gideon Pursues Zebah and Zalmunna
rest: The men of Ephraim said to him, “What is this thing you have done to us, not calling us when you went to fight against the Midianites?” And they quarreled with him severely.

firstLine: The Death of Gideon
rest: Jerub-Baal son of Joash lived in his own house.

firstLine: Abimelech Attempts to Become King
rest: And Abimelech son of Jerub-Baal went to Shechem, to the relatives of his mother, and he said to them and to the house of his mother’s father,

firstLine: “The trees went certainly,
rest:
to anoint a king over themselves.
And they said to the olive tree,
‘Rule over us.’

firstLine: And the olive tree replied,
rest:
‘Should I stop producing my oil,
which by me gods and men are honored,
to go sway over the trees?’

firstLine: Then the trees said to the fig tree,
rest: ‘You, come rule over us.’

firstLine: But the fig tree said to them,
rest:
‘Should I stop producing my sweetness,
and my good crop,
to go sway over the trees?’

firstLine: And the trees said to the vine,
rest: ‘You, come rule over us.’

firstLine: But the vine said to them,
rest:
‘Should I stop producing my wine
that makes the gods and men happy,
to go sway over the trees?’

firstLine: So all the trees said to the thornbush,
rest: ‘You, come rule over us.’

firstLine: And the thornbush said to the trees,
rest:
‘If in good faith you are anointing
me as king over you,
then come and take refuge in my shade;
if not, may fire go out from the thornbush
and devour the cedars of Lebanon.’

firstLine: The Downfall of Shechem and Abimelech
rest: Abimelech ruled over Israel three years.

firstLine: The Philistines and Ammonites Afflict the Israelites
rest: After Abimelech, Tola son of Puah son of Dod, a man of Issachar, rose up to deliver Israel; and he was living at Shamir in the hill country of Ephraim.

firstLine: Jephthah
rest: Jephthah the Gileadite was a mighty warrior; he was the son of a prostitute, and Gilead was his father.

firstLine: Jephthah Makes a Vow
rest: And the Spirit of Yahweh came upon Jephthah, and he passed through Gilead and Manasseh. He passed through Mizpah of Gilead, and from Mizpah of Gilead he passed through to the Ammonites.

firstLine: Tribal Conflict Between Gilead and Ephraim
rest: The men of Ephraim were called to arms, and they crossed over to Zaphon and said to Jephthah, “Why did you cross over and make war against the Ammonites, and why did you not call us to go with you? We will burn down your house over you with fire.”

firstLine: Ibzan, Elon, and Abdon
rest: After him Ibzan from Bethlehem judged Israel.

firstLine: Samson’s Parents
rest: And again, the Israelites did evil in the eyes of Yahweh, and Yahweh gave them into the hand of the Philistines forty years.

firstLine: Samson Marries
rest: And Samson went down to Timnah, and he saw a woman in Timnah from the daughters of the Philistines.

firstLine: He said to them,
rest:
“From the eater came out food,
From the strong came out sweet.”
But they were unable to explain the riddle for three days.

firstLine: The men of the city said to him on the seventh day before the sun went down,
rest:
“What is sweeter than honey?
What is stronger than a lion?”
And he said to them,
“If you had not plowed with my heifer,
you would not have found out my riddle.”

firstLine: Samson Defeats the Philistines
rest: After a while, at the time of the wheat harvest, Samson visited his wife with a young goat. He said, “I want to go to my wife’s private room.” But her father would not allow him to enter.

firstLine: And Samson said,
rest:
“With the jawbone of the donkey,
heap upon heap;
with the jawbone of the donkey,
I struck dead one thousand men.”

firstLine: Samson and Delilah
rest: Samson went down to Gaza; there he saw a prostitute and had sex with her.

firstLine: Samson’s Revenge
rest: And Samson called to Yahweh and said, “My Lord Yahweh, remember me! Please give me strength this one time, O God, so that I can repay with one act of revenge to the Philistines for my eyes.”

firstLine: Micah’s Idolatry
rest: There was a man from the hill country of Ephraim; his name was Micah.

firstLine: The Tribe of Dan Seeks Territory
rest: In those days there was no king in Israel. And in those days the tribe of the Danites was seeking territory for itself to live in, because until that day it had not been allotted territory among the tribes of Israel.

firstLine: The Concubine and the Levite
rest: In those days there was no king in Israel; there was a man, a Levite, who dwelled as a foreigner in the remote areas of the hill country of Ephraim. And he took for himself a concubine from Bethlehem in Judah.

firstLine: The Punishment of Benjamin
rest: All the Israelites went out, from Dan to Beersheba, including the land of Gilead, and they gathered as one body to Yahweh at Mizpah.

firstLine: A Decision Is Made About the Tribe of Benjamin
rest: The men of Israel had sworn at Mizpah, saying, “None of us will give his daughter to Benjamin as a wife.”

firstLine: Elimelech Takes His Family to Live in Moab
rest: And it happened in the days when the judges ruled, there was a famine in the land, and a man from Bethlehem of Judah went to reside in the countryside of Moab—he and his wife and his two sons.

firstLine: Naomi Returns with Ruth
rest: And she got up, she and her daughters-in-law, and returned from the countryside of Moab, because she had heard in the countryside of Moab that Yahweh had come to the aid of his people to give food to them.

firstLine: Ruth Meets Boaz
rest: Now Naomi had a relative of her husband, a prominent rich man from the clan of Elimelech, whose name was Boaz.

firstLine: Ruth Meets Boaz at the Threshing Floor
rest: Now Naomi her mother-in-law said to her, “My daughter, should I not seek for you security that things may be good for you?

firstLine: Boaz Redeems Ruth
rest: And Boaz had gone up to the city gate and sat there. And look, the redeemer of whom Boaz had spoken was passing by. And he said, “Come over here to sit, friend.” And he came over and sat.

firstLine: The Lineage of King David
rest: So Boaz took Ruth and she became his wife. And he went in to her, and Yahweh enabled her to conceive, and she bore a son.

firstLine: The Family of Elkanah
rest: There was a certain man from Ramathaim Zophim, from the hill country of Ephraim, whose name was Elkanah the son of Jeroham, the son of Elihu, the son of Tohu, the son of Zuph, an Ephraimite.

firstLine: The Birth of Samuel
rest: Then they rose early in the morning and worshiped before Yahweh and returned to their house at Ramah. Then Elkanah had sexual relations with Hannah his wife, and Yahweh remembered her.

firstLine: Then Hannah prayed and said,
rest: “My heart exults in Yahweh, my strength is exalted in Yahweh; I grin over my enemies, for I rejoice over your salvation.

firstLine: There is no one holy like Yahweh, for there is no one besides you,
rest: and there is no rock like our God.

firstLine: The bows of mighty warriors are shattered,
rest: but those who stumble gird themselves with strength.

firstLine: Those who were full must hire themselves out for bread,
rest:
but those who are hungry will become fat.
As for the infertile, she will bear seven,
but she who has many sons withers away.

firstLine: Yahweh kills and restores alive,
rest: he brings down to Sheol and raises up.

firstLine: Yahweh makes poor and makes rich;
rest: he brings low and also exalts.

firstLine: He will guard the feet of his faithful ones,
rest:
but the wicked will be destroyed in the darkness,
because a man will not prevail by his might.

firstLine: Yahweh will shatter his adversaries;
rest:
he will thunder against them in the heavens.
Yahweh will judge the ends of the earth.
He will give strength to his king
and will exalt the might of his anointed one.

firstLine: The Family of Eli the Priest
rest: Now the sons of Eli were worthless scoundrels; they did not know Yahweh.

firstLine: Samuel’s Life in the Tabernacle
rest: Now Samuel was serving before Yahweh, as a boy wearing a linen ephod.
