firstLine: Eli Rebukes His Evil Sons
rest: Now Eli was very old, and he heard all that his sons were doing to all Israel and that they were having sexual relations with the women who were serving at the entrance of the tent of assembly.

firstLine: Yahweh Rebukes Eli
rest: Now a man of God came to Eli and said to him: “Thus says Yahweh: ‘Did I not clearly reveal myself to the house of your ancestor when they were in Egypt under the house of Pharaoh?

firstLine: Samuel’s First Encounter with Yahweh
rest: Now the boy Samuel was serving Yahweh in the presence of Eli. The word of Yahweh was rare in those days; visions were not widespread.

firstLine: The Battle of Aphek
rest: And the word of Samuel came to all Israel. Now Israel went out to meet the Philistines for battle, and they encamped at Ebenezer, and the Philistines encamped at Aphek.

firstLine: The Ark of the Covenant among the Philistines
rest: Now the Philistines had captured the ark of God and brought it from Ebenezer to Ashdod.

firstLine: The Return of the Ark of Covenant
rest: Now the ark of Yahweh had been in the territory of the Philistines for seven months,

firstLine: Revival and Victory at Mizpah
rest: The men of Kiriath Jearim came and brought up the ark of Yahweh, and they brought it to the house of Abinadab in Gibeah. They consecrated Eleazer his son to guard the ark of Yahweh.

firstLine: The Circuit Ministry of Samuel
rest: Samuel judged Israel all the days of his life.

firstLine: Israel’s Demand for a King
rest: When Samuel grew old he appointed his sons as judges over Israel.

firstLine: Saul, the Requested King, Introduced
rest: Now there was a man from Benjamin whose name was Kish, the son of Abiel, the son of Zeror, the son of Becorath, the son of Aphiah, the son of a Benjaminite, a very wealthy man.

firstLine: Saul Is Anointed as King
rest: Then Samuel took a flask of oil and poured it over his head and kissed him and said, “Has not Yahweh anointed you as leader over his inheritance?

firstLine: Saul Defeats the Ammonites
rest: Now Nahash the Ammonite went up and encamped against Jabesh Gilead. All the men of Jabesh said to Nahash, “Make a treaty with us and we will serve you.”

firstLine: Samuel’s Charge to Israel
rest: Then Samuel said to all Israel, “Look, I have listened to your voice regarding all that you have said to me, so I have set a king over you.

firstLine: Saul Rules over Israel
rest: Saul was thirty years old at the beginning of his reign, and he reigned forty-two years over Israel.

firstLine: Saul’s Blunder
rest: And the Philistines assembled to fight with Israel, thirty thousand chariots and six thousand horsemen and an army as numerous as sand which is on the seashore. And they came up and encamped at Micmash, east of Beth Aven.

firstLine: Jonathan Leads the Counterattack
rest: One day Jonathan the son of Saul said to his armor bearer, “Come and let us go over to the garrison of the Philistines which is over there.” But he did not tell his father.

firstLine: Saul’s Oath Leads to Trouble
rest: Now the men of Israel were hard pressed on that day, because Saul had made the army take an oath, saying, “Cursed be the man who eats any food until evening, when I will have avenged myself on my enemies!” So none of the army tasted any food.

firstLine: Jonathan Rescued from His Father Saul
rest: Then Saul built an altar to Yahweh; it was the first altar he built to Yahweh.

firstLine: Israel Defeats the Amalekites
rest: Then Samuel said to Saul, “Yahweh sent me to anoint you as king over his people Israel. So then, listen to the words of Yahweh!

firstLine: Samuel Announces the Downfall of Saul
rest: Then the word of Yahweh came to Samuel, saying,

firstLine: Then Samuel said,
rest:
“Is there as much delight for Yahweh in burnt offerings and sacrifices
as there is in obeying Yahweh?
Look! To obey is better than sacrifice;
to give heed than the fat of rams.

firstLine: For rebellion is like the sin of divination;
rest:
arrogance is like iniquity and idolatry.
Because you have rejected the word of Yahweh,
he has rejected you from being king!”

firstLine: Samuel said,
rest:
“Just as your sword bereaved women,
so will your mother be bereaved among women!”
Then Samuel hacked Agag to pieces in the presence of Yahweh at Gilgal.

firstLine: David Is Anointed
rest: Then Yahweh said to Samuel, “How long will you mourn about Saul? I have rejected him from being king over Israel! Fill up your horn with oil and go. I will send you to Jesse the Bethlehemite, for I have chosen a king for myself among his sons.”

firstLine: Saul in Torment
rest: Now the Spirit of Yahweh departed from Saul and an evil spirit from Yahweh tormented him.

firstLine: The Philistine Champion Taunts Israel
rest: The Philistines gathered their camps for battle and they were gathered at Socoh which belongs to Judah. They camped between Socoh and Azekah in Ephes Dammim.

firstLine: David Enters the Scene of Battle
rest: Now David was the son of an Ephrathite. This man was from Bethlehem of Judah, and his name was Jesse. He had eight sons; in the days of Saul this man was old, yet he still walked among the men.

firstLine: David Appears before Saul
rest: Now the words which David had spoken were heard and they reported them to Saul, and he summoned him.

firstLine: David Defeats Goliath
rest: When the Philistine got up and came and drew near to meet David, David ran quickly to the battle line to meet the Philistine.

firstLine: The Friendship of David and Jonathan
rest: When he finished speaking to Saul, the soul of Jonathan became attached to the soul of David, and Jonathan loved him as his own soul.

firstLine: David’s Successes Arouse Saul’s Suspicions
rest: David went out whenever Saul sent him, and he succeeded. So Saul appointed him over the men of the war, and it pleased all the people and even pleased the servants of Saul.

firstLine: And the women sang as they danced, and they said,
rest:
“Saul has struck down his thousands,
but David his ten thousands!”

firstLine: David Marries Saul’s Daughter Michal
rest: Then Saul said to David, “Here is my older daughter Merab. I will give her to you as your wife. Only be a brave warrior for me and fight the battles of Yahweh.” For Saul thought, “My hand will not be against him, but let the hand of the Philistines be against him.”

firstLine: Jonathan Intercedes for David
rest: Now Saul spoke to Jonathan his son and to all his servants about killing David, but Saul’s son Jonathan liked David very much.

firstLine: David Has to Flee Again
rest: War came again, so David went out and fought against the Philistines and defeated them thoroughly so that they fled before him.

firstLine: Jonathan Supports David over Saul
rest: Then David fled from Naioth in Ramah and came and said before Jonathan, “What have I done? What is my guilt and what is my sin before your father that he is trying to kill me?

firstLine: David Encounters the Priests of Nob
rest: Now David came to Nob, to Ahimelech the priest. And Ahimelech came trembling to meet David, and he said to him, “Why are you alone and there are no men with you?”

firstLine: David Flees to Achish in Gath
rest: So David got up and fled on that day from the presence of Saul, and he came to Achish the king of Gath.

firstLine: Saul Takes Revenge on the Priests Who Helped David
rest: David went from there and escaped to the cave of Adullam. When his brothers and all his father’s household heard, they came down to him there.

firstLine: David Defeats the Philistines at Keilah
rest: Now they told David, “Look, the Philistines are fighting in Keilah and they are raiding the threshing floors.”

firstLine: David Flees from Saul at Keilah
rest: Now when Abiathar the son of Ahimelech fled to David at Keilah, he went down with an ephod in his hand.

firstLine: David Eludes Saul’s Pursuit
rest: David remained in the wilderness, in the strongholds, and in the hill country in the wilderness of Ziph. And Saul sought him continually, but God did not give him into his hand.

firstLine: David Spares Saul in the Cave at En Gedi
rest: When Saul returned from pursuing the Philistines, they told him, “Look, David is in the wilderness of En Gedi.”

firstLine: Samuel’s Death
rest: Now Samuel died, and all Israel assembled and mourned for him. They buried him at his house at Ramah. Then David got up and went down to the wilderness of Paran.

firstLine: David and Abigail
rest: Now there was a man in Maon, whose business was in Carmel. The man was very rich and owned three thousand sheep and a thousand goats. Now the shearing of his sheep was taking place in Carmel.

firstLine: David Again Spares Saul
rest: The Ziphites came to Saul at Gibeah, saying, “Is not David hiding on the hill of Hakilah opposite Jeshimon?”

firstLine: David Returns to Achish
rest: Then David thought to himself, “Now I will perish one day by the hand of Saul! There is nothing better for me but that I must certainly escape to the land of the Philistines. Then Saul will desist from searching for me further in all of the territories of Israel, and so I will escape from his hand.”

firstLine: Saul Inquires of the Medium at Endor
rest: (Now Samuel had died, and all Israel had mourned for him, and they had buried him in Ramah, his own city. And Saul had expelled the mediums and the soothsayers from the land.)

firstLine: David Leaves the Service of Achish
rest: Now the Philistines assembled all their forces at Aphek, and Israel was encamped at the spring that is in Jezreel.

firstLine: Is this not David about whom they sing in the dances, saying,
rest:
‘Saul has killed his thousands,
but David his ten thousands’?”

firstLine: David Recovers His Loved Ones
rest: Now when David and his men came to Ziklag on the third day, the Amalekites had raided the Negev and Ziklag. When they attacked Ziklag, they burned it with fire.

firstLine: Saul and Jonathan Die on Mount Gilboa
rest: Now the Philistines were fighting against Israel, and the men of Israel fled before the Philistines, and they fell slain on Mount Gilboa.

firstLine: The Report of Saul’s Death by the Amalekite
rest: After the death of Saul, David returned from defeating the Amalekites and he stayed at Ziklag two days.

firstLine: David Laments Jonathan with the “Song of the Bow”
rest: Then David sang this funeral song over Saul and over Jonathan his son.

firstLine: Do not tell it in Gath; do not proclaim it in the streets of Ashkelon,
rest:
lest the daughters of the Philistines rejoice,
lest the daughters of the uncircumcised exult.

firstLine: O mountains of Gilboa, let there be no dew or rain upon you
From the blood of the slain, from the fat of the mighty,
rest:
the bow of Jonathan did not turn back,
and the sword of Saul did not return without effect.

firstLine: Saul and Jonathan were beloved and pleasant in their lives
rest:
and were not separated in their death.
They were swifter than eagles, stronger than lions.

firstLine: O daughters of Israel, weep over Saul,
rest:
the one who clothed you with crimson,
the one who adorned your clothing with golden ornaments.

firstLine: How the mighty have fallen in the midst of the battle;
rest: Jonathan lies slain on your high places.

firstLine: David Moves to Hebron
rest: It happened after this that David inquired of Yahweh, saying, “Shall I go up into one of the cities of Judah?” And Yahweh said to him, “Go up.” David asked, “Where shall I go up?” And he said, “To Hebron.”

firstLine: David Anointed King over Judah at Hebron
rest: Then the men of Judah came, and they anointed David there as king over the house of Judah, and they told David, “The men of Jabesh-Gilead buried Saul.”

firstLine: Ish-Bosheth over Israel
rest: But Abner the son of Ner, the commander of Saul’s army, had taken Ish-Bosheth the son of Saul and brought him over to Mahanaim.

firstLine: War between Judah and Israel
rest: Abner the son of Ner and the servants of Ish-Bosheth the son of Saul went out from Mahanaim to Gibeon.

firstLine: The House of David Grows Stronger
rest: The battle was prolonged between the house of Saul and the house of David, but David was growing stronger and stronger while the house of Saul was becoming weaker and weaker.

firstLine: Abner Pledges Support for David
rest: Abner sent messengers to David where he was, saying, “To whom does the land belong? Make your covenant with me! Look, my hand is with you to bring all of Israel over to you!”

firstLine: Joab Assassinates Abner
rest: Then Joab came to the king and said, “What have you done? Abner came here to you? Why have you dismissed him that he actually went away?

firstLine: Ish-Bosheth is Assassinated
rest: When the son of Saul heard that Abner had died in Hebron, his courage failed and all of Israel was horrified.

firstLine: David Anointed as King over All of Israel
rest: So all the tribes of Israel came to David at Hebron, and they said, “Here we are, we are your flesh and blood.

firstLine: The Capture and Growth of Jerusalem
rest: The king and his men went to Jerusalem, to the Jebusites, the inhabitants of the land. They said to David, “You will not come here, for even the blind and the lame can turn you back, saying, ‘David cannot come here.’”

firstLine: War with the Philistines
rest: When the Philistines heard that they had anointed David as king over Israel, all the Philistines went up to seek David, but David heard and went down to the stronghold.

firstLine: David Brings the Ark of Yahweh to Jerusalem
rest: David again gathered all the chosen men in Israel, thirty thousand.

firstLine: Yahweh Makes a Covenant with David
rest: It happened that the king settled in his house. (Now Yahweh had given rest to him from all his enemies all around.)

firstLine: David Responds to Yahweh’s Covenant
rest: According to all these words and according to all this vision, this Nathan spoke to David.

firstLine: David’s Military Victories Continue
rest: It happened afterwards that David attacked the Philistines and subdued them, and he took Metheg Ammah from the hands of the Philistines.

firstLine: David Cares for Mephibosheth
rest: Then David said, “Is there still anyone who is left for the house of Saul that I may show loyal love to him for the sake of Jonathan?”

firstLine: The Ammonites Refuse David’s Loyal Love
rest: Afterwards the king of the Ammonites died, and his son Hanun ruled in his place.

firstLine: Israel Fights Ammon and Aram
rest: When the Ammonites saw that they had become odious to David, the Ammonites sent word and hired Aram Beth-Rehob and Aram-Zobah, twenty thousand infantry; and they also hired the king of Maacah, a thousand men, and the men of Tob, twelve thousand men.

firstLine: The Arameans Regroup for Attack
rest: When the Arameans saw that they were defeated before Israel, they gathered themselves together.

firstLine: David Commits Adultery with Bathsheba
rest: It came about in the spring, at the time kings go out, David sent Joab and his servants with him and all of Israel. They ravaged all of the Ammonites and besieged Rabbah, but David was remaining in Jerusalem.

firstLine: Nathan Reproves David
rest: So Yahweh sent Nathan to David, and he came to him and said, “Two men were in a certain city; one was rich and the other was poor.

firstLine: David Repents, But the Child Dies
rest: Then David said to Nathan, “I have sinned against Yahweh!” Nathan said to David, “Yahweh has also forgiven your sin; you shall not die.

firstLine: Battle with the Ammonites
rest: And Joab fought against Rabbah of the Ammonites, and he captured the royal city.

firstLine: Amnon Assaults His Sister Tamar
rest: It happened afterwards that Absalom the son of David had a beautiful sister whose name was Tamar, and Amnon the son of David fell in love with her.

firstLine: Absalom Kills Amnon
rest: Now King David heard all these things, and he became very angry.

firstLine: Absalom Flees
rest: So Absalom fled, and the young man who was keeping watch lifted up his eyes and saw, and there were many people coming from the road behind him from the side of the mountain.

firstLine: Joab Plots to Reconcile David with Absalom
rest: Joab the son of Zeruiah realized that the mind of the king was on Absalom.

firstLine: Absalom Returns to Jerusalem
rest: Then Joab got up and went to Geshur and brought Absalom to Jerusalem.

firstLine: Absalom Leads a Rebellion
rest: It happened afterward that Absalom made himself a chariot with horses and fifty men running before him.

firstLine: David Flees from Jerusalem
rest: Then the messenger came to David, saying, “The hearts of the men of Israel have gone after Absalom.”

firstLine: The Priests Offer Sacrifices for David
rest: Suddenly Zadok was there, and all of the Levites with him, carrying the ark of the covenant of God. They set the ark of God down, and Abiathar offered sacrifices until all the people passed out of the city.

firstLine: Hushai Offers to Serve King David
rest: Now David was going up on the Ascent of the Olives, weeping as he went, with his head covered and going barefoot. All the people who were with him each covered their head and wept as they went.

firstLine: Ziba Brings Provisions
rest: Now David passed a little from beyond the summit, and suddenly Ziba the servant of Mephibosheth was there to meet him with a pair of saddled donkeys; on them were two hundred loaves of bread and a hundred raisin cakes, with a hundred summer fruits and a skin of wine.

firstLine: Shimei Curses David
rest: King David came up to Bahurim and suddenly a man from there was coming out from the family of the house of Saul, and his name was Shimei the son of Gera. He was cursing as he came out.

firstLine: Hushai Comes to Absalom
rest: Now Absalom and all the people, the men of Israel, had come to Jerusalem, and Ahithophel was with him.

firstLine: Hushai Frustrates the Counsel of Ahithophel
rest: Then Ahithophel said to Absalom, “Please let me choose twelve thousand men, and I will set out and pursue after David tonight.

firstLine: Hushai Sends Word to David
rest: Hushai said to Zadok and to Abiathar the priests, “Thus and so Ahithophel advised Absalom and the elders of Israel, but thus and so I have advised.

firstLine: Absalom Dies in Battle
rest: Then David mustered the people who were with him, and he appointed over them commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds.

firstLine: King David Weeps for Absalom
rest: And it was told to Joab that the king was weeping and he mourned over Absalom,

firstLine: David Returns from Exile
rest: Then it happened that all the people were disputing among all the tribes of Israel, saying, “The king delivered us from the hand of our enemies, and he saved us from the hand of the Philistines, but now he has fled from the land because of Absalom.

firstLine: Sheba Leads a Revolt
rest: Now a man of wickedness was found there whose name was Sheba the son of Bichri, a Benjaminite. He blew the horn and said, “There is no share for us in David, and there is no inheritance for us in the son of Jesse; each to his tents, O Israel!”

firstLine: Joab Assassinates Amasa
rest: Then the king said to Amasa, “Summon for me the men of Judah within three days, and be here yourself.”

firstLine: Wisdom from a Woman under Siege
rest: (He had passed through all the tribes of Israel to Abel and Beth Maacah; now all of the Berites had been treated badly, so they also followed after him.)

firstLine: The Famine Brings Justice
rest: There was a famine in the days of David for three years, year after year. And David inquired of Yahweh, and Yahweh said, “The bloodguilt is on Saul and on his household, because he killed the Gibeonites.”

firstLine: Battles with the Philistines Recounted
rest: There was war again for the Philistines with Israel, and David and his servants with him went down, and they fought the Philistines, and David grew weary.

firstLine: The Victory Song of David
rest: Then David spoke to Yahweh the words of this song, on the day Yahweh delivered him from the hand of all his enemies and from the hand of Saul.

firstLine: And he said:
rest: “Yahweh is my rock, my fortress, and my deliverer.

firstLine: I call upon Yahweh who is praiseworthy,
rest: and I am saved from those who hate me.

firstLine: For the breaker waves of death engulfed me;
rest: the currents of chaos overwhelmed me.

firstLine: The ropes of Sheol entangled me;
rest: the snares of death confronted me.

firstLine: The earth heaved and shook,
rest:
the foundations of heaven trembled and heaved
because he was angry.

firstLine: He bowed the heavens and came down;
rest: a very thick cloud was under his feet.

firstLine: He rode upon a cherub and flew;
rest: he was seen on the wings of the wind.

firstLine: He put darkness as a canopy all around him,
rest: a collection of thick rain clouds.

firstLine: From the brightness before him
rest: flamed burning coals of fire.

firstLine: Yahweh thundered from heaven,
rest: and the Most High uttered his voice.

firstLine: He sent arrows and he scattered them,
rest: lightning, and he directed them.

firstLine: Then the channels of water of the sea were exposed,
rest:
the foundations of the world,
at the rebuke of Yawheh,
from the blast of the breath of his nostrils.

firstLine: He sent from a high position and took me;
rest: he drew me from mighty waters.

firstLine: He delivered me from my strong enemies,
rest: from those who hate me, for they were mightier than I.

firstLine: They approached me on the day of my disaster,
rest: but Yahweh was my support.

firstLine: Yahweh rewarded me according to my righteousness,
rest: according to the cleanness of my hands he recompensed me.

firstLine: For I have kept the ways of Yahweh;
rest: I have not acted wickedly against my God.

firstLine: For all of his ordinances were before me,
rest: and I did not turn aside from his statutes.

firstLine: I was blameless before him,
rest: and I kept myself from my iniquity.

firstLine: Yahweh has recompensed me according to my righteousness,
rest: according to my cleanness before his eyes.

firstLine: With the loyal, you act as loyal,
rest: and with the blameless, you show yourself blameless.

firstLine: With the pure, you show yourself pure,
rest: but with the crooked, you appear as a fool.

firstLine: Humble people you will deliver,
rest: but your eyes are on the haughty, whom you bring down.

firstLine: For you, O Yahweh are my lamp,
rest: and Yahweh lightens my darkness.

firstLine: For by you I can run a raid;
rest: by my God I can leap over a wall.

firstLine: This God, his way is blameless;
rest:
the promise of Yahweh is flawless.
He is a shield to all who take refuge in him.

firstLine: God is my strong refuge,
rest: he has fully opened my way.

firstLine: He makes my feet like a doe deer,
rest: and on my high places he has set me.

firstLine: He trains my hands for the war,
rest: so that my arms can bend a bow of bronze.

firstLine: You have given me the shield of your salvation;
rest: your willingness to help has made me great.

firstLine: You have broadened my steps beneath me;
rest: my ankles have not wobbled.

firstLine: I wiped them out and I smashed them;
rest: they did not get up; they fell under my feet.

firstLine: You have girded me with physical strength for the battle;
rest: you caused those who rose up against me to kneel under me.

firstLine: My enemies you cause to retreat from me;
rest: I destroy those who hate me.

firstLine: They looked out, but there was no deliverer,
rest: even to Yahweh, but he did not answer them.

firstLine: I beat them fine, like the dust of the earth;
rest: like the mire of the streets, I crushed them, I stamped them down.

firstLine: You delivered me from the strife of my people;
rest:
you preserved me as the head of the nations.
A people I had not known served me.

firstLine: Children of a foreign land came cringing to me;
rest: when they heard of me, they became obedient to me.

firstLine: Children of a foreign land lost heart
rest: and came trembling from their strongholds.

firstLine: God does vengeance for me,
rest: bringing down peoples under me.

firstLine: He brings me out from my enemies,
rest:
and from those who rose up against me you lift me up,
and from men of violence you rescue me.

firstLine: He makes great salvation for his king
rest:
and shows loyal love to his anointed one, David
and to his descendants forever.”

firstLine: David Extols Yahweh
rest: These are the last words of David, the declaration of David the son of Jesse, and the declaration of the man exalted by the Most High, the anointed one of the God of Jacob and the darling of the songs of Israel.

firstLine: David’s Faithful Soldiers
rest: These are the names of the mighty warriors who were David’s: Josheb-Basshebeth a Tahkemonite was chief of three officers; first Adino, whose spear was against eight hundred slain on one occurrence.

firstLine: The Mighty Men of David
rest: Among the thirty were Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan the son of Dodo of Bethlehem,

firstLine: David and the Census of the People
rest: Again Yahweh was angry with Israel, and he incited David against them, saying, “Go count Israel and Judah.”

firstLine: David’s Last Days
rest: Now King David had become old, advanced in years, and they covered him with garments, but he was not warm.

firstLine: Adonijah Seeks David’s Throne
rest: Now Adonijah the son of Haggith was exalting himself, saying, “I will be king,” so he prepared for himself a chariot and horsemen and fifty men running before him.

firstLine: Solomon’s Intercessors
rest: Then Nathan said to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon, “Have you not heard that Adonijah the son of Haggith has become king, but our lord David does not know?

firstLine: Solomon Is Crowned King
rest: Then King David said, “Summon Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada,” and they came before the king.

firstLine: Adonijah’s Response to the Coronation of Solomon
rest: And Adonijah and all the invited guests who were with him heard it. Now they were finished eating when Joab heard the sound of the trumpet and said, “Why is there such a noise in the city?”

firstLine: David’s Instructions for Solomon
rest: The days of David came near for him to die, and he charged Solomon his son, saying,

firstLine: Adonijah’s Persistence
rest: Adonijah the son of Haggith came to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon, and she said, “Are you coming in peace?” He said, “Peace.”

firstLine: Solomon’s Responses to Adonijah, Joab, and Shimei
rest: Bathsheba came to King Solomon to speak to him concerning Adonijah, and the king got up to meet her, bowed down to her, and then sat on his throne. Then he set up a throne for the king’s mother, and she sat on his right.

firstLine: Solomon’s Walk with Yahweh
rest: Solomon intermarried with Pharaoh the king of Egypt, and he took the daughter of Pharaoh and brought her to the city of David until he finished building his house, the house of Yahweh, and the walls of Jerusalem all around.

firstLine: Solomon’s Request for Wisdom
rest: Yahweh appeared to Solomon at Gibeon in a dream at night, and God said, “Ask what I should give to you.”

firstLine: Solomon’s Wisdom Tested: The Two Prostitutes
rest: Then two prostitutes came to the king, and they stood before him.

firstLine: Solomon’s Wisdom: Political Administration
rest: King Solomon was king over all Israel.

firstLine: Solomon’s Wisdom: Prosperity
rest: Now Solomon was ruling over all the kingdoms from the River to the land of the Philistines, and up to the border of Egypt, who were bringing tribute and were serving Solomon all the days of his life.

firstLine: Solomon’s Wisdom: Literature, Zoology, Biology, Dendrology
rest: God gave wisdom to Solomon and very great discernment, as well as breadth of understanding, as the sand which is on the edge of the seashore.

firstLine: Solomon’s Wisdom: Architecture
rest: Hiram king of Tyre sent his servants to Solomon when he heard that they had anointed him as king in place of his father, for Hiram had always been a friend for David.

firstLine: Solomon Builds the Temple for Yahweh
rest: It happened in the four hundred and eightieth year after the Israelites went out from the land of Egypt, in the fourth year of Solomon’s rule over Israel, the month of Ziv (that is the second month), that he began to build the house for Yahweh.

firstLine: Solomon Continues to Build
rest: Solomon built his house over thirteen years, and he finished all of his house.

firstLine: The Dedication of the Temple
rest: At that time, Solomon assembled the elders of Israel, all the heads of the tribes, and the leaders of the families of the Israelites before King Solomon, in order to bring up the ark of the covenant of Yahweh from the city of David, that is, Zion.

firstLine: Solomon’s Proclamation to the Assembly of Israel
rest: Then Solomon said, “Yahweh has said that he would dwell in the very thick cloud.

firstLine: Solomon’s Prayer to Yahweh
rest: Then Solomon stood before the altar of Yahweh in the presence of all of the assembly of Israel, and he spread out his hands to the heavens,

firstLine: Solomon Charges the People Israel
rest: It happened that when Solomon finished praying to Yahweh all of the prayer and this plea, he got up from before the altar of Yahweh, from kneeling down on his knees with his palms outstretched to heaven.

firstLine: The Great Confirming Sacrifice
rest: Then the king and all of Israel with him offered a sacrifice in the presence of Yahweh.

firstLine: Yahweh’s Challenge to Solomon
rest: It happened that as Solomon finished the building of the house of Yahweh, the king’s house, and all the things Solomon desired to do,

firstLine: Solomon and Hiram Complete Their Agreement
rest: It happened at the end of twenty years in which Solomon had built the two houses, the house of Yahweh and the house of the king,

firstLine: Solomon’s Accomplishments
rest: This is the account of the forced labor that King Solomon conscripted to build the house of Yahweh and his house, the Millo, the walls of Jerusalem, Hazor, Megiddo, and Gezer.

firstLine: The Visit of the Queen of Sheba
rest: Now the queen of Sheba had heard of the fame of Solomon regarding the name of Yahweh, and she came to test him with hard questions.

firstLine: Solomon’s Foreign Wives
rest: King Solomon loved many foreign women: the daughter of Pharaoh, Moabite, Ammonite, Edomite, Sidonian, Hittite;

firstLine: Solomon’s Apostasy
rest: It happened at the time of Solomon’s old age that his wives guided his heart after other gods, and his heart was not fully with Yahweh his God as the heart of David his father had been.

firstLine: Yahweh’s Judgment on Solomon
rest: Yahweh was angry with Solomon, for he had turned his heart from Yahweh, the God of Israel who had appeared to him twice.

firstLine: Yahweh Raises Up Jeroboam
rest: Now Jeroboam the son of Nebat, an Ephraimite from Zeredah (now the name of his mother was Zeruah, a widow woman), a servant of Solomon rebelled against the king.

firstLine: Israel’s Appeal to Rehoboam
rest: Then Rehoboam went to Shechem, for all of Israel had come to Shechem to make him king.

firstLine: Rehoboam Seeks Counsel to Respond
rest: Then King Rehoboam consulted with the old men who had been serving before Solomon his father when he was alive, saying, “How are you advising me to answer this people?”

firstLine: Rehoboam Responds Unwisely with Disastrous Results
rest: Jeroboam and all of the people came to Rehoboam on the third day, as the king had spoken: “Return to me on the third day.”

firstLine: Civil War Averted
rest: It happened that just when all of Israel heard that Jeroboam had returned, they sent and called him to the assembly and made him king over all of Israel. Not one followed after the house of David except the tribe of Judah alone.

firstLine: Jeroboam Becomes King over Israel
rest: Then Jeroboam built Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim, and he resided in it. Then he went out from there and built Penuel.

firstLine: A Man of God Proclaims Judgment against the False Altar
rest: Suddenly a man of God from Judah came to Bethel, by the word of Yahweh, while Jeroboam was standing at the altar to offer incense.

firstLine: The Man of God Disobeys
rest: Now a certain older prophet was living in Bethel, and his son came and recounted to him all of the things that the man of God had done that day in Bethel and the words he had spoken to the king, and they told them to their father.

firstLine: The Disobedient Man of God Dies
rest: It happened after he ate food and drank water that he saddled the donkey for the prophet whom he had brought back.

firstLine: Jeroboam Continues in His Sin
rest: After this event, Jeroboam did not turn from his evil way, but he returned and again made priests for the high places of people from all walks of life. He filled his hand with all his desire and became one of the priests of the high places himself.

firstLine: Judgment for Jeroboam Continues
rest: At that time, Abijah son of Jeroboam became ill.

firstLine: Rehoboam Reigns in Judah
rest: Now Rehoboam the son of Solomon reigned in Judah. He was forty-one years old when he began to reign, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city which, from all of the tribes of Israel, Yahweh chose to place his name. And the name of his mother was Naamah the Ammonitess.

firstLine: Pharaoh Shishak of Egypt Raids Jerusalem
rest: It happened in the fifth year of King Rehoboam that Shishak the king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem,

firstLine: The Reign of Abijam in Judah
rest: In the eighteenth year of King Jeroboam the son of Nebat, Abijam began to reign over Judah.

firstLine: The Reign of Asa in Judah
rest: In the twentieth year of Jeroboam the king of Israel, Asa became the king of Judah.

firstLine: The Reign of Nadab in Israel
rest: Nadab the son of Jeroboam began to reign over Israel in the second year of Asa king of Judah, and he reigned over Israel two years.

firstLine: The Reign of Baasha in Israel
rest: There was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.

firstLine: The Reign of Elah in Israel
rest: In the twenty-sixth year of Asa king of Judah, Elah the son of Baasha became king over Israel for two years.

firstLine: The Very Brief Reign of Zimri in Israel
rest: In the twenty-seventh year of Asa king of Judah, Zimri reigned seven days in Tirzah. Now the army was encamping against Gibbethon which belonged to the Philistines.

firstLine: The Reign of Omri in Israel
rest: At that time, the people of Israel were divided into two parts: half of the people went after Tibni the son of Ginath to make him king, and the other half went after Omri.

firstLine: The Reign of Ahab in Israel
rest: Now Ahab son of Omri became king over Israel in the thirty-eighth year of Asa king of Judah. Ahab son of Omri reigned over Israel in Samaria twenty-two years.

firstLine: The Prophet Elijah Arises
rest: Elijah the Tishbite from Tishbe of Gilead said to Ahab, “As Yahweh lives, the God of Israel before whom I stand, there shall surely not be dew nor rain these years except by my command.”

firstLine: War between Elijah and the Prophets of Baal
rest: It happened many days later that the word of Yahweh came to Elijah in the third year, saying, “Go, present yourself to Ahab so that I may give rain on the surface of the earth.”

firstLine: Elijah Flees to Horeb
rest: Then Ahab told Jezebel all that Elijah had done and how he had killed all the prophets with the sword.

firstLine: Elijah Encounters Yahweh at Horeb
rest: He came to the cave there and spent the night there. Suddenly the word of Yahweh came to him and asked him, “Elijah, what are you doing here?”

firstLine: The Vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite
rest: It happened after these things that Naboth the Jezreelite had a vineyard which was in Jezreel beside the palace of Ahab king of Samaria.

firstLine: Elijah Responds to Ahab
rest: The word of Yahweh came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying,

firstLine: Jehoshaphat of Judah Allies with Ahab of Israel
rest: They lived three years, and there was no war between Aram and Israel.

firstLine: King Jehoshaphat of Judah
rest: Jehoshaphat the son of Asa became king over Judah in the fourth year of Ahab king of Israel.

firstLine: King Ahaziah of Israel
rest: Ahaziah son of Ahab became king over Israel in Samaria in the seventeenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, and he reigned over Israel two years.

firstLine: Elijah and the Messengers of Ahaziah
rest: Moab rebelled against Israel after the death of Ahab.

firstLine: Epitaph for Ahaziah
rest: So he died, according to the word of Yahweh which Elijah had spoken, and Joram became king in his place in the second year of Joram the son of Jehoshaphat, the king of Judah, because he had no son.

firstLine: Elijah Taken Away from Elisha
rest: When Yahweh was about to take Elijah up in the storm to heaven, Elijah and Elisha went from Gilgal.

firstLine: Elisha Begins His Ministry
rest: When the sons of the prophets who were at Jericho saw him from the other side, they declared, “The spirit of Elijah rests upon Elisha,” and they came to meet him and bowed down to him to the ground.

firstLine: Joram Meets Moab in Battle
rest: Now Joram the son of Ahab had become king over Israel in Samaria in the eighteenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah. He reigned twelve years

firstLine: Elisha Answers a Widow’s Request
rest: A certain woman from the wives of the sons of the prophets cried out to Elisha, saying, “Your servant my husband is dead. Now you know that your servant was a fearer of Yahweh, but the creditor came to take two of my children for himself as slaves.

firstLine: Elisha at Shunem
rest: It happened one day that Elisha passed through to Shunem where there was a wealthy woman, and she urged him to eat bread; so it happened each time he passed through, he would stop there to eat.

firstLine: Elisha Restores the Shunammite’s Son
rest: The child grew older, and it happened one day that he went out to his father and to the reapers.

firstLine: Elisha Secures the Food
rest: So Elisha returned to Gilgal. Now the famine was in the land, and the sons of the prophets were sitting before him. He said to his servant, put on the large pot and cook a stew for the sons of the prophets.

firstLine: The Healing of Naaman the Syrian
rest: Now Naaman was the commander of the army of the king of Aram. He was a great man before his master and highly regarded, for by him Yahweh had given victory to Aram. Now the man was a mighty warrior, but he was afflicted with a skin disease.

firstLine: Elisha’s Greedy Servant Gehazi
rest: When he returned to the man of God, he and all of his army, he came and stood before him and said, “Please now, I know that there is no God in all of the world except in Israel. So then, please take a gift from your servant.”

firstLine: Elisha Recovers a Lost Axe Head
rest: Then the sons of the prophets said to Elisha, “Please look; the place where we are living before you is too cramped for us.

firstLine: Arameans Plot to Take Elisha
rest: The king of Aram was fighting with Israel, so he consulted with his officers, saying, “My camp is at such and such a place.”

firstLine: Besieged Samaria Resorts to Cannibalism
rest: It happened after this that Ben-Hadad king of Aram assembled all of his army and marched up and laid siege against Samaria.

firstLine: Elisha Prophesies Hope for Relief
rest: Elisha said, “Hear the word of Yahweh: ‘Thus says Yahweh, “At this time tomorrow a seah of wheat bread flour will sell for a shekel, and two seahs of barley for a shekel in the gate of Samaria.’”

firstLine: Four Lepers Report the Departure of the Arameans
rest: Now four men who had a skin disease were at the entrance of the gate, and they said to each other, “Why are we sitting here until we die?

firstLine: Prophecy Fulfilled
rest: So the people went out and plundered the camp of the Arameans. A seah of wheat flour went for a shekel and two seahs of barley went for a shekel according to the word of Yahweh.

firstLine: Joram Restores the Shunammite’s Land
rest: Elisha spoke to the woman whose son he had restored to life, saying, “Get up and go, you and your household, and dwell as an alien wherever you can, for Yahweh has called for a famine, and it will come to the land for seven years.”

firstLine: Joram Reigns in Judah
rest: Now in the fifth year of Joram son of Ahab, king of Israel, and Jehoshaphat king of Judah, Joram son of Jehoshaphat became the king of Judah.

firstLine: Ahaziah Succeeds Joram in Judah
rest: In the twelfth year of Joram the son of Ahab, king of Israel, Ahaziah the son of Joram became king of Judah.

firstLine: Jehu Anointed Prophetically to Rule in Place of Joram of Israel
rest: Now Elisha the prophet called for one of the sons of the prophets, and he said to him, “Gird your loins, and take this flask of olive oil in your hand, and go to Ramoth-Gilead.

firstLine: Jehu Assassinates Joram
rest: Then Jehu came out to the officers of his master, and they said to him, “Peace? Why did this madman come to you?” And he said to them, “You know the man and his foolish talk.”

firstLine: Jehu Orders the Assassination of Ahaziah
rest: When Ahaziah king of Judah saw, he fled the way of Beth-Haggen. Jehu pursued after him and said, “Shoot him also, in the chariot.” They shot him at the ascent of Gur which is in Ibleam, and he fled to Megiddo, but he died there.

firstLine: Jezebel Loses Her High Position
rest: When Jehu came to Jezreel, Jezebel heard of it, so she painted her eyes with black eye paint and adorned her head and looked through the window.

firstLine: Jehu Continues Purging the House of Ahab
rest: Ahab had seventy sons in Samaria, and Jehu wrote letters, and he sent them to Samaria to the officials of Jezreel, to the elders and to the guardians of Ahab, saying,

firstLine: Jehu Purges the Baal Worshipers
rest: Then Jehu assembled all of the people and said to them, “Ahab served Baal a little, but Jehu will worship him greatly.

firstLine: Athaliah Usurps the Throne in Judah
rest: Now Athaliah the mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead, so she prepared to destroy all of the offspring of the royal family.

firstLine: Jehoash/Joash Reigns in Judah
rest: In the seventh year of Jehu, Jehoash became king. He reigned in Jerusalem forty years, and the name of his mother was Zibiah from Beersheba.

firstLine: Temple Repairs Planned
rest: Jehoash said to the priests, “All of the money for the sacred things that is brought to the temple of Yahweh, the money taxed at its proper value for each person and all of the money which comes upon the heart of a man to bring to the temple of Yahweh,

firstLine: Hazael Threatens Judah
rest: At that time, Hazael king of Aram went up and fought against Gath and captured it; then Hazael set his face to go up against Jerusalem.

firstLine: Jehoahaz and Jehoash in Israel
rest: In the twenty-third year of Joash the son of Ahaziah, king of Judah, Jehoahaz the son of Jehu became king over Israel in Samaria, reigning seventeen years.

firstLine: Elisha Passes Away
rest: Elisha became ill with the illness with which he would die, so Jehoash king of Israel went down to him and wept before him, and said, “My father, my father; the chariot of Israel and its horsemen!”

firstLine: Amaziah Reigns in Judah; Jeroboam II in Israel
rest: In the second year of Jehoash the son of Jehoahaz king of Israel, Amaziah the son of Jehoash king of Judah began to reign.

firstLine: Azariah Succeeds Amaziah in Jerusalem; Zechariah Succeeds Jeroboam II in Samaria
rest: Amaziah the son of Jehoash king of Judah lived fifteen years after the death of Jehoash the son of Jehoahaz king of Israel.

firstLine: The Acts of Azariah (Uzziah) in Judah
rest: In the twenty-seventh year of Jeroboam king of Israel, Azariah the son of Amaziah king of Judah began to reign.

firstLine: Zechariah in Israel
rest: In the thirty-eighth year of Azariah king of Judah, Zechariah the son of Jeroboam reigned over Israel in Samaria for six months.

firstLine: Shallum Reigns only a Month in Israel
rest: Shallum the son of Jabesh began to reign in the thirty-ninth year of Uzziah king of Judah, and he reigned a full month in Samaria.

firstLine: Menahem Reigns in Israel
rest: In the thirty-ninth year of Azariah king of Judah, Menahem the son of Gadi began to reign over Israel for ten years in Samaria.

firstLine: Pekahiah Reigns in Israel
rest: In the fiftieth year of Azariah king of Judah, Pekahiah the son of Menahem began to reign over Israel in Samaria for two years.

firstLine: Pekah Reigns in Israel
rest: In the fifty-second year of Azariah king of Judah, Pekah the son of Remaliah began to reign over Israel in Samaria for twenty years.

firstLine: Jotham Reigns in Judah
rest: In the second year of Pekah the son of Remaliah, king of Israel, Jotham the son of Uzziah king of Judah began to reign.

firstLine: Ahaz Reigns in Judah and Seeks Help against the Assyrians
rest: In the seventeenth year of Pekah the son of Remaliah, Ahaz the son of Jotham king of Judah began to reign.

firstLine: Damascus Falls to the Assyrians
rest: So King Ahaz went to meet Tiglath-Pileser the king of Assyria in Damascus, and he saw the altar which was in Damascus, so King Ahaz sent to Uriah the priest the builder’s plan of the altar and the exact model of how it had been made.

firstLine: Hoshea Reigns in Israel
rest: In the twelfth year of Ahaz the king of Judah, Hoshea the son of Elah began to reign over Israel in Samaria, reigning nine years.

firstLine: Israel Deported to Assyria and the Reasons It Fell
rest: In the ninth year of Hoshea, the king of Assyria captured Samaria and deported Israel to Assyria. He placed them in Halah, in Habor, in the river regions of Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes.

firstLine: Israel Repopulated with Foreign Captives
rest: The king of Assyria brought from Babylonia, from Cush, from Arva, from Hamath, and Sepharvaim, and he settled them in the cities of Samaria in place of the Israelites, so they took possession of Samaria and lived in her cities.

firstLine: Hezekiah Reigns in Judah
rest: It happened in the third year of Hoshea the son of Elah king of Israel, that Hezekiah the son of Ahaz king of Judah became king.

firstLine: Sennacherib of Assyria Invades Judah
rest: In the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah, Sennacherib king of Assyria came up against all of the fortified cities of Judah and captured them.

firstLine: Assyrians Advise against Trust in Yahweh
rest: Then the chief advisor said to them, “Please say to Hezekiah: ‘Thus says the great king, the king of Assyria: “What is this confidence that you trust?

firstLine: Isaiah Sends Encouragement to Hezekiah
rest: It happened that when King Hezekiah heard, he tore his clothes and covered himself with sackcloth and went to the temple of Yahweh.

firstLine: The Assyrians Defy God
rest: When the chief commander returned, he found the king of Assyria fighting against Libnah, for he had heard that he had departed from Lachish.

firstLine: Hezekiah Prays to Yahweh
rest: Hezekiah took the letters from the hand of the messengers and read them. Then he went up to the temple of Yahweh, and Hezekiah spread them out before the presence of Yahweh.

firstLine: Isaiah Brings a Prophetic Response
rest: Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent to Hezekiah, saying, “Thus says Yahweh the God of Israel, ‘What you have prayed to me about Sennacherib king of Assyria I have heard.

firstLine: This is the word that Yahweh has spoken concerning him:
rest:
She despises you, she scorns you,
the virgin daughter of Zion.
Behind you the daughter of Jerusalem
shakes her head.

firstLine: By the hand of your messengers you have mocked the Lord,
rest:
and you have said,
‘With my many chariots I have gone up
to the height of the mountains.
To the remote areas of Lebanon,
I have felled the tallest of its cedars,
the choicest of its cypresses.
I have entered the place of overnight lodging.
Even to the edge of forest of its fertile land.

firstLine: I dug wells and I drank foreign water,
rest:
and I dried up with the sole of my steps
all the canals of Egypt.’

firstLine: Their inhabitants, short of hand, shall be dismayed;
rest:
and they shall be ashamed.
They have become green plants of the open field,
and tender grass,
green grass of the roof
and blight before the standing grain.

firstLine: Your sitting, your going out, and your coming in I know,
rest: and your raging against me.

firstLine: Because you are raging against me,
rest:
and your arrogance has come up in my ears,
I will put my nose ring in your nose
and my bridle in your mouth.
And I will turn you back
on the way that you have come.

firstLine: An Angel Neutralizes the Assyrian Army
rest: It happened in that night that an angel of Yahweh went out, and he struck down one hundred and eighty-five thousand in the camp of Assyria. When they got up early in the morning, look! All of them were dead corpses.

firstLine: Hezekiah Loses Health and Regains It through Prayer
rest: In those days Hezekiah became deathly ill, and Isaiah the son of Amoz the prophet came to him and said to him, “Thus says Yahweh, ‘Command your house, for you are about to die; you will not recover.’”

firstLine: Hezekiah Reveals Too Much to a Babylonian Envoy
rest: At that time, Berodak-Baladan the son of Baladan king of Babylon sent letters and a gift to Hezekiah, for he had heard that Hezekiah had been ill.

firstLine: Evil Manasseh Reigns after Godly Hezekiah
rest: Manasseh was twelve years old when he began to reign, and he reigned fifty-five years in Jerusalem. The name of his mother was Hephzibah.

firstLine: Yahweh Sends a Rebuke to Manasseh
rest: So Yahweh spoke by the hand of his servants the prophets, saying,

firstLine: Amon Reigns in Judah Only Two Years
rest: Amon was twenty-two years old when he began to reign, and he reigned two years in Jerusalem. The name of his mother was Meshullemeth the daughter of Haruz from Jotbah.

firstLine: Josiah Becomes King in Judah
rest: Josiah was eight years old when he began to reign, and he reigned thirty-one years in Jerusalem. The name of his mother was Jedidah the daughter of Adaiah from Bozkath.

firstLine: A Scroll of the Torah Discovered in the Temple
rest: Then Hilkiah the high priest said to Shaphan the secretary, “I have found the scroll of the Torah in the temple of Yahweh,” and Hilkiah gave the scroll to Shaphan and he read it.

firstLine: The Prophetess Huldah Predicts Doom for Judah
rest: So Hilkiah the priest, Ahikam, Acbor, Shaphan, and Asaiah went to Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum the son of Tikvah the son of Harhas, the keeper of the robes. Now she was living in Jerusalem in the second district. Then they spoke to her,

firstLine: Josiah’s Covenantal Reforms
rest: So the king sent word, and all of the elders of Judah and Jerusalem gathered to him.

firstLine: Passover Renewed
rest: Then the king commanded all of the people, saying, “Keep the Passover to Yahweh your God, as has been written on the scroll of this covenant.”

firstLine: Jehoahaz Reigns in Judah
rest: Jehoahaz was twenty-three years old when he became king, and he reigned three months in Jerusalem. The name of his mother was Hamutal the daughter of Jeremiah from Libnah.

firstLine: Jehoiakim Replaces Jehoahaz
rest: Then Pharaoh Neco made Eliakim the son of Josiah king in place of Josiah his father, and he changed his name to Jehoiakim. Then he took Jehoahaz and brought him to Egypt, and he died there.

firstLine: First Invasion of Nebuchadnezzar; Jehoiakim Submits
rest: In his days, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up because Jehoiakim had become his servant for three years; then he turned and rebelled against him.

firstLine: Jehoichin Succeeds Jehoiakim
rest: Jehoiachin was eighteen years old when he began to reign, and he reigned three months in Jerusalem. The name of his mother was Nehushta daughter of Elnathan from Jerusalem.

firstLine: Second Invasion of Nebuchadnezzar
rest: At that time, the servants of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came to Jerusalem, and the city came under the siege.

firstLine: Zedekiah Replaces Jehoiachin
rest: Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. The name of his mother was Hamutal daughter of Jeremiah from Libnah.

firstLine: The Final Invasion of Nebuchadnezzar
rest: It happened that in the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, on the tenth of the month, Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon came, he and his army, against Jerusalem. He encamped against it and built siege works against it all around.

firstLine: Jerusalem Is Sacked and the Temple Burned
rest: In the fifth month, on the seventh of the month, that is, the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, Nebuzaradan, a commander of the imperial guard, a servant of the king of Babylon, came to Jerusalem.

firstLine: Plunder Taken by the Chaldeans
rest: The bronze pillars which were in the temple of Yahweh, the water carts, and the bronze sea that was in the temple of Yahweh, the Chaldeans broke into pieces and carried their bronze to Babylon.

firstLine: Gedaliah Appointed Governor
rest: Now as far as the people left in Judah whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon left behind, he appointed Gedaliah the son of Ahikam the son of Shaphan over them.

firstLine: Elderly Jehoiachin Cared for in Babylon
rest: It happened in the thirty-seventh year of the exile of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month on the twenty-seventh of the month, lifted Evil-Merodach king of Babylon in the year that he became king, the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah from the house of imprisonment.

firstLine: From Adam to Abraham
rest: Adam, Seth, Enosh;

firstLine: The Genealogy of David
rest: These are the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,

firstLine: The Descendants of David
rest: These were the sons of David who were born to him in Hebron: the firstborn, Amnon, by Ahinoam the Jezreelite; the second, Daniel, by Abigail the Carmelite;

firstLine: The Descendants of David
rest: The sons of Judah: Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal.

firstLine: Descendants of Simeon
rest: The sons of Simeon: Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, Shaul.

firstLine: The Descendants of Reuben
rest: The sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel (for he was the firstborn, but when he defiled the couch of his father, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph, the son of Israel, so that he was not enrolled in the genealogy as the firstborn,

firstLine: The Descendants of Gad
rest: And the sons of Gad lived near to them in the land of Bashan as far as Salecah:

firstLine: The Half-Tribe of Manasseh
rest: And the sons of the half-tribe of Manasseh lived in the land from Bashan to Baal-Hermon, Senir, and Mount Hermon. They were numerous.

firstLine: The Descendants of Levi
rest: The sons of Levi: Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.

firstLine: David’s Appointees for Music in the Temple
rest: Now these are the men whom David appointed for control of singing in the house of Yahweh where the ark rested.

firstLine: The Descendants of Aaron
rest: Now these are the sons of Aaron: Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son,

firstLine: The Descendants of Issachar
rest: The sons of Issachar: Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron, four.

firstLine: The Descendants of Benjamin
rest: The sons of Benjamin: Bela, Beker, and Jediael, three.

firstLine: The Descendants of Naphtali
rest: The sons of Naphtali: Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, and Shallum, the descendants of Bilhah.

firstLine: The Descendants of Manasseh
rest: The sons of Manasseh: Asriel, whom his Aramean concubine bore; she gave birth to Makir the father of Gilead.

firstLine: The Descendants of Ephraim
rest: The sons of Ephraim: Shuthelah and Bered his son, Tahath his son, Eleadah his son, Tahath his son,

firstLine: The Descendants of Asher
rest: The sons of Asher: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, Beriah, and their sister Serah.

firstLine: The Genealogy of Saul
rest: Now Benjamin fathered Bela his firstborn, Ashbel the second, Aharah the third,

firstLine: The Genealogy of Returned Exiles
rest: So all Israel was enrolled in genealogy. And behold, they were written in the book of the kings of Israel. And Judah was taken away to Babylon on account of their sin.

firstLine: Saul’s Genealogy Repeated
rest: And these lived in Gibeon: Jeiel the father of Gibeon. And the name of his wife was Maacah.

firstLine: The Death of Saul and His Sons
rest: Now the Philistines fought against Israel, and every Israelite fled away from before the Philistines. And they fell slain upon Mount Gilboa.

firstLine: The Anointing of David as King
rest: Then all Israel gathered to David in Hebron, saying, “Look—we are your flesh and bones.

firstLine: David’s Mighty Men
rest: Now these are the chiefs of the mighty men who were for David, who gave him strong support in his kingdom, together with all Israel to make him king according to the word of Yahweh concerning Israel.

firstLine: David and His Mighty Men at Ziklag
rest: Now these are the ones who came to David at Ziklag while he was still shut up because of Saul, the son of Kish. And they were the mighty warriors helping with the war.

firstLine: Then the Spirit came upon Amasai, chief of the thirty who said:
rest:
“We are yours, O David!
And we are with you, O son of Jesse!
Peace! Peace to you, and peace to those who help you,
for your God helps you.”
So David appointed them as heads of the troops.

firstLine: The Ark of the Covenant Brought from Kiriath-Jearim
rest: And David consulted with the commanders of thousands and hundreds, with every leader.

firstLine: David’s Wives and Children
rest: And Hiram, king of Tyre, sent messengers to David and cedar trees, masons, and carpenters to build a house for him.

firstLine: David Defeats the Philistines
rest: When the Philistines heard that David had been anointed as king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up to search for David. But David heard and went out from before them.

firstLine: David’s Wives and Children
rest: And David built houses for himself in the city of David, and he established a place for the ark of God. And he pitched a tent for it.

firstLine: The Ark of the Covenant Placed in Its Tent
rest: And they brought the ark of God and set it inside the tent that David had pitched for it. And they offered burnt offerings and fellowship offerings before God.

firstLine: David’s Song of Thanks
rest:
Give thanks to Yahweh; call upon his name;
make known his deeds among the nations!

firstLine: Sing to him; sing praises to him;
rest: tell of his wondrous works!

firstLine: Glory in his holy name;
rest: let the hearts of those seeking Yahweh rejoice!

firstLine: Seek Yahweh and his strength;
rest: seek his face continually!

firstLine: Remember his wonderful works that he has done,
rest: his wonders and the judgments of his mouth,

firstLine: O offspring of Israel, his servant,
rest: O sons of Jacob, his chosen ones!

firstLine: He is Yahweh our God;
rest: his judgments are in all the earth.

firstLine: Remember his covenant forever,
rest: the word he commanded for a thousand generations,

firstLine: that he made with Abraham,
rest: his sworn oath to Isaac.

firstLine: And he confirmed it to Jacob as a statute,
rest: an everlasting covenant to Israel,

firstLine: saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan,
rest: the portion of your inheritance.”

firstLine: When you were few in number, little,
rest: and sojourners were in it,

firstLine: when they wandered from nation to nation,
rest: and from one kingdom to another people,

firstLine: he did not allow anyone to oppress them,
rest: and he rebuked kings on their account,

firstLine: saying, “You must not touch my anointed
rest: nor do harm to my prophets!”

firstLine: Proclaim his glory among the nations,
rest: his wondrous works among the peoples!

firstLine: For Yahweh is great and greatly praised,
rest: and he is feared among all gods.

firstLine: For all the gods of the nations are idols,
rest: but Yahweh made the heavens.

firstLine: Splendor and majesty are before him;
rest: strength and joy are in his place.

firstLine: Ascribe to Yahweh, O clans of the nations,
rest: ascribe to Yahweh glory and strength!

firstLine: Tremble before him, all the earth;
rest: surely the world shall not be shaken.

firstLine: Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad,
rest: and let them tell the peoples, “Yahweh reigns!”

firstLine: Let the sea roar and its fullness;
rest: let the field rejoice and all that is in it.

firstLine: Then the trees of the forest shall sing for joy before Yahweh,
rest: for he comes to judge the earth.

firstLine: Oh give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good;
rest: his loyal love is everlasting.

firstLine: Then say, “Save us, O God of our salvation;
rest:
gather us and rescue us from the nations
that we may give thanks to your holy name
and glory in your praise.

firstLine: Blessed be Yahweh the God of Israel,
rest:
from everlasting to everlasting!”
Then all the people said, “Amen!” and praised Yahweh.

firstLine: Worship and the Ark
rest: So he left Asaph and his brothers there before the ark of the covenant of Yahweh to minister before the ark regularly as each day required,

firstLine: Yahweh’s Covenant with David
rest: And as David lived in his house, David said to Nathan the prophet, “Look, I live in a house of cedar, but the ark of the covenant of Yahweh is under tent curtains.”

firstLine: David’s Prayer
rest: Then King David went and sat before Yahweh and said, “Who am I, O Yahweh God, and what is my house that you have brought me thus far?

firstLine: David’s Victory over His Enemies
rest: And it happened that after David struck the Philistines and subdued them, he captured Gath and its villages out of the hand of the Philistines.

firstLine: David’s Administration
rest: So David reigned over all Israel, and he administered justice and righteousness to all his people.

firstLine: The Ammonites Humiliate David’s Messengers
rest: And it happened that after this Nahash the king of the Ammonites died, and his son reigned in his place.

firstLine: The Capture of Rabbah
rest: And it happened that in the spring time of year, the time when kings go out to battle, Joab led the troops of the army and destroyed the land of the Ammonites. And he came and besieged Rabbah, but David remained in Jerusalem. And Joab struck Rabbah and destroyed it.

firstLine: The Philistine Giants Slain
rest: And after this there arose a war in Gezer with the Philistines. Then Sibbecai the Hushathite struck down Sippai, one of the descendants of the Rephaim. And they were subdued.

firstLine: The Census of David
rest: Then Satan stood against Israel and urged David to count Israel.

firstLine: David Builds an Altar
rest: Now the angel of Yahweh had spoken to Gad to say to David that David should go up and erect an altar for Yahweh.

firstLine: David’s Preparations for Building the Temple
rest: And David commanded to assemble the resident aliens who were in the land of Israel and appointed stone craftsmen to cut dressed stones to build the house of God.

firstLine: Solomon Charged with Building the Temple of Yahweh
rest: Then he called to Solomon his son and commanded him to build a house for Yahweh, the God of Israel.

firstLine: David Organizes the Levites
rest: Now David was old and full of days. And he made Solomon his son king over Israel.

firstLine: David Organizes the Priests
rest: And as for the sons of Aaron, these were their divisions. The sons of Aaron were Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.

firstLine: David Organizes the Musicians
rest: And David and the commanders of the army set apart for the service the sons of Asaph, of Heman, and of Jeduthun, who prophesied with stringed instruments, with harps, and with cymbals. And their inventory of the men of the work and for their duty was:

firstLine: The Divisions of the Gatekeepers
rest: As for the working groups of the gatekeepers: of the Korahites, Meshelemiah the son of Kore, from the sons of Asaph.

firstLine: Treasurers and Other Officials
rest: And of the Levites: Ahijah was over the treasuries of the house of God and over the treasuries of the sanctified objects.

firstLine: Military Divisions
rest: And as for the number of the Israelites, the heads of families, the commanders of thousands and hundreds, and their officials who serve the king in all matters of the working groups that came and went, month by month, throughout all the months of the year, each working group: twenty-four thousand.

firstLine: Leaders of the Tribes and Other High Ranking Officials
rest: And over the tribes of Israel, for the Reubenites: the commander was Eliezer the son of Zikri. For the Simeonites: Shephatiah the son of Maacah.

firstLine: David’s Charge to Israel
rest: Then David assembled all the commanders of Israel, the commanders of the tribes and the commanders of working groups who served the king, and the commanders of thousands, the commanders of hundreds, and the commanders over all the property of the king and his sons, with the court officials and mighty warriors, and all the mighty warriors of ability, at Jerusalem.

firstLine: David’s Charge to Solomon
rest: “And you, Solomon my son, know the God of your father and serve him with a whole heart and a willing mind, for Yahweh searches all hearts and understands every plan and all thoughts. If you seek him, he will be found by you, but if you abandon him, he will reject you forever.

firstLine: Offerings for the Temple
rest: Then David the king said to all the assembly, “God has chosen Solomon my son alone, a young man and inexperienced, and the work is great, for the citadel is not for humankind, but for Yahweh God.

firstLine: Solomon’s Coronation
rest: And they offered sacrifices to Yahweh, and on that next day they offered burnt offerings to Yahweh: one thousand bulls, one thousand rams, one thousand lambs, with their libations and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel.

firstLine: The Death of King David
rest: And David the son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.

firstLine: Solomon Worships at Gibeon
rest: And Solomon the son of David strengthened himself concerning his kingdom, and Yahweh his God was with him and made him exceedingly great.

firstLine: Solomon’s Prayer for Wisdom
rest: On that night God appeared to Solomon and said to him, “Ask what I shall give to you.”

firstLine: Solomon’s Wealth
rest: And Solomon gathered chariots and horsemen. And he had one thousand four hundred chariots and twelve thousand horsemen, and he placed them in the chariot cities and with the king in Jerusalem.

firstLine: Solomon Petitions the King of Tyre
rest: And Solomon planned to build a house for the name of Yahweh and a royal palace for himself.

firstLine: Solomon Builds the Temple
rest: Then Solomon began to build the house of Yahweh in Jerusalem, on Mount Moriah, where Yahweh had appeared to David his father, at the place that David had established, on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.

firstLine: The Furnishings of Solomon’s Temple
rest: And he made an altar of bronze, twenty cubits was its length, and twenty cubits was its width, and ten cubits was its height.

firstLine: The Ark Installed in the Temple
rest: When all the work that Solomon did for the house of Yahweh was finished, Solomon brought the holy objects of David his father: the silver, the gold, and all the objects he had put into the storehouses of the house of God.

firstLine: Solomon Blesses the People
rest: Then Solomon said, “Yahweh has decided to dwell in the deep gloom.

firstLine: Solomon’s Prayer to Dedicate the Temple
rest: Then Solomon stood before the altar of Yahweh before all the assembly of Israel and spread out his hands.

firstLine: God Answers with Fire from Heaven
rest: And when Solomon finished praying, then fire came down from heaven and consumed the burnt offering and the sacrifices, and the glory of Yahweh filled the house.

firstLine: The Temple Dedication
rest: Then the king and all the people were offering a sacrifice before Yahweh.

firstLine: God’s Charge to Solomon
rest: Then Yahweh appeared to Solomon at night and said to him, “I have heard your prayer and have chosen this place for myself as a house of sacrifice.

firstLine: Solomon’s Accomplishments and Deeds
rest: And it happened that at the end of twenty years in which Solomon had built the house of Yahweh and his own house,

firstLine: Solomon and the Queen of Sheba
rest: Now the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon, and she came to Jerusalem to test Solomon with hard questions, with much wealth and camels, bearing spices and much gold and precious stones. And she came to Solomon and told him all that was on her mind.

firstLine: Solomon’s Great Wealth
rest: And it happened that the weight of the gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred and sixty-six talents of gold,

firstLine: The Death of Solomon
rest: As for the remainder of the words of Solomon from the first to the last, are they not written in the chronicles of Nathan the prophet and in the prophecy of Ahijah the Shilonite, and in the visions of Iddo the seer, concerning Jeroboam the son of Nebat?

firstLine: Rehoboam’s Debacle
rest: Then Rehoboam went to Shechem, for all Israel had come to Shechem to make him king.

firstLine: Rehoboam’s Kingdom
rest: When Rehoboam came to Jerusalem he assembled the house of Judah and Benjamin, one hundred and eighty thousand chosen warriors, to fight against Israel to restore the kingdom to Rehoboam.

firstLine: The Priests and Levites Come to Jerusalem
rest: Now the priests and the Levites who were throughout all Israel took their stand with him from all their territories.

firstLine: Rehoboam’s Harem and Family
rest: Then Rehoboam took to himself as a wife Mahalath, the daughter of Yerimot son of David, and of Abihail the daughter of Eliab the son of Jesse.

firstLine: Shishak of Egypt Invades Jerusalem
rest: And when the kingdom of Rehoboam was established and when he was strengthened, he forsook the law of Yahweh, and all Israel with him.

firstLine: The Death of Rehoboam
rest: So King Rehoboam was strengthened in Jerusalem, and he reigned there. Now, Rehoboam was forty-one years old when he became king, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city where Yahweh had chosen to put his name out of all the tribes of Israel. And the name of his mother was Naamah the Ammonite.

firstLine: Abijah and Civil War
rest: In the eighteenth year of King Jeroboam, Abijah reigned over Judah.

firstLine: The Reign of Asa in Judah
rest: And Abijah slept with his ancestors, and they buried him in the city of David. And Asa his son became king in his place. In his days the land was at rest ten years.

firstLine: Asa’s Religious Reforms
rest: Now Azariah the son of Oded—the Spirit of God came upon him.

firstLine: The End of Asa’s Reign
rest: In the thirty-sixth year of the reign of Asa, Baasha the king of Israel went up against Judah. And he built Ramah in order not to allow anyone to go out or come in to Asa, king of Judah.

firstLine: Jehoshaphat Reigns in Judah
rest: And Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his place, and he strengthened himself against Israel.

firstLine: Jehoshaphat’s Alliance with Ahab
rest: Now Jehoshaphat had much wealth and honor, and he became son-in-law to Ahab.

firstLine: The Death of Ahab
rest: Then the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat king of Judah went up to Ramoth-Gilead.

firstLine: Jehoshaphat’s Reforms
rest: Then Jehoshaphat king of Judah returned to his house in peace to Jerusalem.

firstLine: The Prayer of Jehoshaphat
rest: And it happened that afterward, the Moabites, the Ammonites, and some of the Meunites came against Jehoshaphat for war.

firstLine: God Delivers Judah and Jerusalem
rest: And they rose up early in the morning and went out to the desert of Tekoa. And when they went out, Jehoshaphat stood and said, “Hear me, O Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem! Believe in Yahweh your God, and you shall be established! Believe in his prophets, and you shall succeed!”

firstLine: The End of Jehoshaphat’s Reign
rest: So Jehoshaphat reigned over Judah. He was thirty-five years old when he began to reign. And he reigned twenty-five years in Jerusalem. The name of his mother was Azubah, the daughter of Shilhi.

firstLine: The Reign of Jehoram
rest: And Jehoshaphat slept with his ancestors and was buried with his ancestors in the city of David, and Jehoram his son reigned in his place.

firstLine: The Reign of Ahaziah
rest: And the inhabitants of Jerusalem made Ahaziah his youngest son king in his place, for the band of men who had come with the Arabs to the camp had murdered all the older sons. And Ahaziah the son of Jehoram, the king of Judah, reigned.

firstLine: The Reign of Athaliah
rest: Now when Athaliah the mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead, she arose and murdered all the royal descendants of the house of Judah.

firstLine: Joash Is Made King
rest: And in the seventh year Jehoiada strengthened himself and took with him into a covenant relationship the commanders of hundreds: Azariah the son of Jeroham, Ishmael the son of Jehohanan, Azariah the son of Obed, Maaseiah the son of Adaiah, and Elishaphat the son of Zicri.

firstLine: Joash Repairs the Temple
rest: Joash was seven years old when he became king, and he reigned forty years in Jerusalem. And the name of his mother was Zibiah from Beersheba.

firstLine: The Death of Joash
rest: And it happened at the turn of the year that the army of Aram went up against him, and they came to Judah and Jerusalem and destroyed all the commanders of the people from among the people, and all the war booty they sent to the king of Damascus.

firstLine: The Reign of Amaziah
rest: Amaziah was twenty-five years old when he became king. And he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem, and the name of his mother was Jehoaddan from Jerusalem.

firstLine: The Reign of Uzziah
rest: Then all the people of Judah took Uzziah (now he was sixteen years old) and made him king in the place of his father Amaziah.

firstLine: The Reign of Jotham
rest: Jotham was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem. And the name of his mother was Jerusha the daughter of Zadok.

firstLine: The Reign of Ahaz
rest: Ahaz was twenty years old when he became king, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem. And he did not do what is right in the eyes of Yahweh like David his ancestor.

firstLine: The Reign of Hezekiah
rest: Hezekiah became king when he was twenty-five years old, and he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. And the name of his mother was Abijah the daughter of Zechariah.

firstLine: Hezekiah Celebrates Passover
rest: Then Hezekiah sent to all Israel and Judah, and he also wrote letters to Ephraim and Manasseh, to come to the house of Yahweh in Jerusalem to make a Passover feast to Yahweh the God of Israel.

firstLine: Hezekiah Organizes the Priesthood
rest: And when all this was finished, all Israel who were found in the cities of Judah went out and shattered the stone pillars, cut down the Asherahs, and destroyed the high places and the altars from all Judah, Benjamin, Ephraim, and Manasseh to the very last one. Then all the Israelites returned, each to his own property and to their cities.

firstLine: Sennacherib’s Invasion of Judah
rest: After these things and these acts of faithfulness, Sennacherib the king of Assyria came, and he came against Judah. And he encamped against the fortified cities and planned to break them down for himself.

firstLine: Yahweh’s Deliverance of Jerusalem
rest: Then King Hezekiah and Isaiah the son of Amoz, the prophet, prayed concerning this. And they cried to the heavens.

firstLine: The Rest of Hezekiah’s Reign
rest: In those days Hezekiah fell ill unto death, and he prayed to Yahweh. And he answered him and gave him a sign.

firstLine: The Reign of Manasseh
rest: Manasseh was twelve years old when he began to reign, and he reigned fifty-five years in Jerusalem.

firstLine: Manasseh’s Repentance
rest: And Yahweh spoke to Manasseh and to his people, but they would not listen.

firstLine: Amon’s Reign
rest: And Manasseh slept with his ancestors, and they buried him in his house. And Amon his son became king in his place.

firstLine: The Reign of Josiah
rest: Josiah was eight years old when he became king, and he reigned thirty-one years in Jerusalem.

firstLine: The Scroll of the Law Discovered
rest: Now in the eighteenth year of his reign after he purged the land and the house, he sent Shaphan the son of Azaliah, Maaseiah the commander of the city, and Joah the son of Joahaz, the recorder, to repair the house of Yahweh his God.

firstLine: Josiah Observes the Passover
rest: Josiah kept the Passover to Yahweh in Jerusalem. And they slaughtered the Passover sacrifice on the fourteenth day of the first month.

firstLine: The Death of Josiah
rest: After all of this that Josiah had prepared for the temple, Neco the king of Egypt went up to make war at Carchemish on the Euphrates, and Josiah went up to meet him.

firstLine: The Decline of Judah
rest: And the people of the land took Jehoahaz the son of Josiah and made him king in place of his father in Jerusalem.

firstLine: The Destruction of Jerusalem
rest: Therefore he brought against them the king of the Chaldeans, and he killed their young men with the sword in the house of their sanctuary. He showed no mercy on a young man, a virgin, the elderly, or decrepit. He delivered all into his hand.

firstLine: The Decree of Cyrus
rest: And in the first year of Cyrus, the king of Persia, in order to fulfill the word of Yahweh by the mouth of Jeremiah, Yahweh stirred up the spirit of Cyrus, king of Persia, so that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom and also in writing, saying:

firstLine: The Decree of Cyrus
rest: In the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, in order to accomplish the word of Yahweh by the mouth of Jeremiah, Yahweh stirred the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia and he sent a message to all of his kingdom and also put the message in writing:

firstLine: The List of Returned Exiles
rest: Now these were the people of the province who came up from the captivity of the exile whom Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon carried captive to Babylonia. They returned to Jerusalem and Judah, each to his own city.

firstLine: Gifts Given for Temple Work
rest: When some of the heads of families came to the house of Yahweh that is in Jerusalem, they gave freewill offerings for the house of God to erect it on its place.

firstLine: Worship in Jerusalem Restored
rest: Now the seventh month drew near and the Israelites were in the cities, so the people gathered as one in Jerusalem.

firstLine: Foundation of the Temple is Laid
rest: In the second year after their coming to the house of God at Jerusalem, in the second month, Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel and Jeshua son of Jehozadak began their work, and the remainder of their brothers the priests and the Levites and all who came from the captivity to Jerusalem. They appointed the Levites from twenty years and older to direct the work of the house of Yahweh.

firstLine: Resistance to Rebuilding the House of God
rest: Now the enemies of Judah and Benjamin heard that the returned exiles were building a temple for Yahweh the God of Israel.

firstLine: Resistance to Rebuilding Jerusalem
rest: In the reign of Ahasuerus, at the beginning of his reign, they wrote an accusation against the inhabitants of Judah and Jerusalem.

firstLine: this is the copy of the letter which they sent to him:
rest: “To King Artaxerxes from your servants, the men of the province Beyond the River. And now,
