firstLine: and I was secretly enticed,
rest: and my hand threw them a kiss,

firstLine: this also is an iniquity to be judged,
rest: for I have deceived God above.

firstLine: “If I have rejoiced at the ruin of the one who hated me
rest: or have exulted when evil overtook him—

firstLine: no, I have not allowed my mouth to sin,
rest: to ask his life with a curse.

firstLine: Have the people of my tent not said,
rest: ‘O that someone had not been satisfied with his meat’?

firstLine: An alien has not lodged in the street;
rest: I have opened my door to the traveler.

firstLine: Have I concealed my transgressions as other human beings
rest: to hide my iniquity in my bosom

firstLine: because I dreaded the great multitude,
rest:
and the contempt of clans terrified me,
so that I kept quiet, I did not go out of the doorway?

firstLine: I would surely carry it on my shoulder;
rest: I would bind it on me like a crown.

firstLine: I would give him an account of my steps;
rest: I would approach him like a noble.

firstLine: If my land has cried out against me,
rest: and its furrows have wept together,

firstLine: if I have eaten its yield without payment,
rest: or I have caused the breath of its owners to die,

firstLine: let thorns grow in place of wheat
rest:
and noxious weeds in place of barley.”
The words of Job are ended.

firstLine: Elihu Rebukes Job and His Three Friends
rest: Then these three men ceased from answering Job because he was righteous in his own eyes.

firstLine: Then Elihu the son of Barakel the Buzite spoke up and said,
rest:
“I am young, but you are old;
therefore I feared and became afraid of explaining my knowledge to you.

firstLine: I thought, ‘Let days speak,
rest: and let many years teach wisdom.’

firstLine: “Truly, it is a spirit in a human being,
rest: and the breath of Shaddai teaches them.

firstLine: It is not the aged who are wise,
rest: or it is not the elders who understand justice.

firstLine: Therefore I say, ‘Listen to me;
rest: let me also declare my knowledge myself.’

firstLine: “Look, I waited for your words;
rest:
I listened for your insight,
until you searched out what to say.

firstLine: And I directed my attention to you;
rest:
and, look, there is no one for Job who refuted,
answering his words among you.

firstLine: So do not say, ‘We have found wisdom;
rest: let God refute him, not a man.’

firstLine: But he did not direct his words to me,
rest: and I will not answer him with your words.

firstLine: “They are dismayed; they no longer answer;
rest: they have nothing to say.

firstLine: And I have waited because they do not speak,
rest: because they stand there and no longer answer.

firstLine: I myself will answer my share also;
rest: I myself will declare my knowledge also,

firstLine: for I am full of words;
rest: the spirit within me urges me.

firstLine: “Look, my internal organs are like unopened wine,
rest: like new wineskins it is ready to burst open.

firstLine: Let me speak that I may find relief;
rest: let me open my lips, and let me answer.

firstLine: Please let me not show partiality to anyone,
rest: and let me not show flattery to human beings,

firstLine: for I do not know how to flatter,
rest: else my Maker would soon put an end to me.

firstLine: Elihu Rebukes Job
rest:
“But now, please hear my speeches, Job,
and hear all my words.

firstLine: Please look, I open my mouth;
rest: my tongue in my mouth speaks.

firstLine: My words declare my heart’s uprightness,
rest: and my lips sincerely speak what my lips know.

firstLine: The Spirit of God has made me,
rest: and the breath of Shaddai gives life to me.

firstLine: “If you are able, answer me.
rest: Present your argument before me; take your stand.

firstLine: Look, before God I am like you;
rest: I myself was also formed from clay.

firstLine: Look, dread of me should not terrify you,
rest: and my hand will not be heavy upon you.

firstLine: “Surely you have spoken in my ears,
rest: and I have heard the sound of your words:

firstLine: ‘I am clean, without transgression;
rest: I am pure, and there is no guilt in me.

firstLine: Look, he finds fault against me;
rest: he reckons me as his enemy;

firstLine: he puts my feet in the block;
rest: he watches all my paths.’

firstLine: “Look, in this you are not right—I will answer you:
rest: Indeed, God is greater than a human being.

firstLine: Why do you contend against him,
rest: that he will not answer all a person’s words?

firstLine: Indeed, God speaks in one way,
rest: even in two, yet someone does not perceive it.

firstLine: “In a dream, a vision of the night,
rest: when a deep sleep falls on men slumbering on their bed,

firstLine: then he opens the ear of men,
rest: and he frightens them with a warning

firstLine: to turn human beings aside from their deeds,
rest: and he keeps man from pride.

firstLine: He spares his life from the pit
rest: and his life from passing over the river of death.

firstLine: “And he is reproved with pain on his bed,
rest: even with the strife of his bones continually,

firstLine: so that his life loathes bread,
rest: and his inner self loathes appetizing food.

firstLine: His flesh is wasted away from sight,
rest: and his bones, which are invisible, are bared.

firstLine: And he draws near to the pit
rest: and his life to the killers.

firstLine: “If there is a messenger beside him, a mediator, one of a thousand,
rest: to declare to a human being his uprightness

firstLine: so that he is gracious to him, and he says,
rest:
‘Deliver him from descending into the pit;
I have found a ransom.’

firstLine: His flesh is renewed with his youth;
rest: he returns to the days of his youthful strength.

firstLine: He prays to God, then he accepts him,
rest:
and he sees his face with a shout of joy,
and he repays to the human being his righteousness.

firstLine: “He will sing to men, and he will say,
rest:
‘I have sinned and have perverted what is right,
and it was not paid back to me.

firstLine: He redeemed my life from going down into the pit,
rest: so I will enjoy the light.’

firstLine: Look, God does all these things
rest: twice, three times with a person

firstLine: to bring his life back from the pit
rest: so that he may enjoy the light of life.

firstLine: “Listen attentively, Job; listen to me;
rest: be silent, and I will speak.

firstLine: If you have anything to say, answer me;
rest: speak, for I desire to justify you.

firstLine: If not, you listen to me;
rest: be silent, and I will teach you wisdom.”

firstLine: Elihu Asserts God’s Justice
rest: Thus Elihu spoke up and said,

firstLine: “Hear my words, you wise men,
rest: and listen to me, you who know,

firstLine: for the ear tests words,
rest: and the palate tastes food.

firstLine: Let us choose justice for ourselves;
rest: let us determine among ourselves what is good—

firstLine: for Job has said, ‘I am righteous,
rest: but God has taken away my justice.

firstLine: What man is like Job,
rest: who drinks scorn like water?

firstLine: And he goes on the road in company with instigators of mischief,
rest: and walks with men of wickedness.

firstLine: Indeed, he says, ‘A man does not profit
rest: when he takes delight in God.’

firstLine: “Therefore, listen to me, people who have sense:
rest:
far be it from God that he should commit wickedness
and that Shaddai should do wrong.

firstLine: Indeed, he will repay according to a human being’s deeds,
rest: and according to a man’s way he will let it happen to him.

firstLine: What’s more, God truly does not act wickedly,
rest: and Shaddai does not pervert justice.

firstLine: If he should set his heart to it,
rest: and he should gather his spirit and his breath to himself,

firstLine: all flesh would perish together,
rest: and humankind would return to dust.

firstLine: “But if you have understanding, hear this;
rest: listen to what I say.

firstLine: the one who says to a king,
rest: ‘You worthless man,’ to noblemen, ‘You wicked man,’

firstLine: who shows no partiality to officials
rest:
and who does not take note of the noble more than of the insignificant,
for all of them are the work of his hands?

firstLine: In a moment they die,
rest:
and in the middle of the night the people are shaken, and they pass away,
and they take away the mighty effortlessly.

firstLine: “Indeed, his eyes are upon the ways of man,
rest: and he sees all his steps.

firstLine: There is no darkness, and there is no deep shadow
rest: where instigators of mischief might hide themselves.

firstLine: Indeed, he has not yet appointed a time for man
rest: to go to God in the judgment.

firstLine: He shatters the mighty without investigation,
rest: and he sets others in their place.

firstLine: Therefore he knows their works,
rest:
and he overturns them in the night
so that they are crushed.

firstLine: He strikes them where the wicked stood,
rest: where there are onlookers,

firstLine: because they have turned aside from him
rest: and have not understood any of his ways,

firstLine: so that they cause the cry of distress from the helpless to come to him,
rest: and he hears the cry of distress from the needy,

firstLine: so that godless human beings should not reign,
rest: nor those who ensnare the people.

firstLine: “Indeed, does anyone say to God, ‘I have endured chastisement;
rest: I will not act corruptly again;

firstLine: teach me yourself what I cannot see;
rest: if I have done wrong, I will not repeat it’?

firstLine: Those who have sense say to me,
rest: and the wise man hearing me says:

firstLine: ‘Job speaks without knowledge,
rest: and his words are without insight.

firstLine: Would that Job were tested up to the end
rest: because his answers are like those from men of mischief,

firstLine: for he adds transgression to his sin;
rest:
he claps hands among us,
and he multiplies his words against God.’”

firstLine: Elihu Condemns Job
rest: Moreover, Elihu spoke up and said,

firstLine: “Do you think this is justice when you say,
rest: ‘I am right before God’?

firstLine: If you ask what it profits you:
rest: ‘How do I benefit by refraining from my sin?’

firstLine: I myself will give answer to you
rest: and to your friends with you.

firstLine: “Look at the heavens, and see;
rest: and observe the clouds that are higher than you.

firstLine: If you are righteous, what do you give to him,
rest: or what does he receive from your hand?

firstLine: Your wickedness affects a person like yourself,
rest: and your righteousness affects humans.

firstLine: “Because of the multitude of oppressions, they cry out;
rest: they cry for help because of the arm of the mighty.

firstLine: But no one says, ‘Where is God my Maker,
rest: who gives songs in the night,

firstLine: who teaches us more than the animals of the earth
rest: and makes us wiser than the birds of the heavens?’

firstLine: There they cry out, but he does not answer
rest: because of the pride of evildoers.

firstLine: “Surely God does not hear an empty plea,
rest: and Shaddai does not regard it.

firstLine: How much less when you say that you do not see him,
rest: that the case is before him, and you are waiting for him!

firstLine: But now, because his anger does not punish,
rest: and he does not acknowledge the transgression at all,

firstLine: therefore Job opens his mouth in empty talk—
rest: without knowledge he multiplies words.”

firstLine: Elihu Extols God’s Greatness
rest: Then Elihu continued and said,

firstLine: “Bear with me a little longer, and I will explain,
rest: for I still have something to say on God’s behalf.

firstLine: I will bring my knowledge from far away,
rest: and I will ascribe righteousness to my maker,

firstLine: for truly my words are not falsehood;
rest: one who has perfect knowledge is with you.

firstLine: Look, God is mighty but does not despise anyone;
rest: he is mighty and good in understanding.

firstLine: He does not keep the wicked alive
rest: but grants justice to the afflicted.

firstLine: He does not withdraw his eyes from the righteous,
rest: but he sets them forever with kings on the throne, and they are exalted.

firstLine: “And if they are tied up with fetters,
rest: if they are caught in the cords of misery,

firstLine: then he declares their work to them,
rest: and their transgressions, that they are behaving arrogantly.

firstLine: So he opens their ear to the discipline,
rest: and he commands that they return from mischief.

firstLine: If they listen and serve him,
rest: they complete their days in prosperity and their years in pleasantness.

firstLine: But if they do not listen, they perish by the sword,
rest: and they pass away without knowledge.

firstLine: And the godless of heart cherish anger;
rest: they do not cry for help when he binds them.

firstLine: They die in their youth,
rest: and their life ends among the male shrine prostitutes.

firstLine: He delivers the afflicted by his misery,
rest: and he opens their ears by the adversity.

firstLine: And what’s more, he allured you out of distress
rest:
into a broad place, where in place of it was no constraint;
and what was set on your table is full of fatness.

firstLine: But you are obsessed with the judgment of the wicked;
rest: judgment and justice take hold of you.

firstLine: Yes, it is wrath, so that it will not incite you into mockery;
rest: and do not let the ransom’s greatness turn you aside.

firstLine: Will your cry for help sustain you without distress,
rest: or all the efforts of your strength?

firstLine: You must not long for the night,
rest: to cut off people in their place.

firstLine: Take care, you must not turn to mischief,
rest: for because of this you have been tried by misery.

firstLine: “Look, God is exalted in his power;
rest: who is a teacher like him?

firstLine: Remember that you should extol his work,
rest: of which people have sung.

firstLine: All human beings have looked on it;
rest: everyone watches from afar.

firstLine: “Look, God is exalted, and we do not know him;
rest: the number of his years is unsearchable.

firstLine: Indeed, he draws up the drops of water;
rest: he distills the rain into its mist,

firstLine: which the clouds pour down;
rest: they shower abundantly on human beings.

firstLine: “Moreover, can anyone understand the spreading of clouds,
rest: the thundering of his dwelling place?

firstLine: Look, he scatters his lightning around him,
rest: and he covers the roots of the sea.

firstLine: Indeed, he judges people by them;
rest: he gives food in abundance.

firstLine: He covers his hands with lightning,
rest: and he commands it the place at which to strike.

firstLine: His thundering tells about him;
rest: the livestock also tell concerning what rises.

firstLine: Elihu Extols God’s Majesty
rest:
“About this also my heart trembles,
and it leaps from its place.

firstLine: Listen carefully to his voice’s thunder
rest: and the rumbling that goes out from his mouth.

firstLine: He lets it loose under all the heavens,
rest: and his lightning to the earth’s corners.

firstLine: After it, his voice roars;
rest:
it thunders with his majestic voice,
and he does not restrain it when his voice is heard.

firstLine: “God thunders with his voice in marvelous ways;
rest: he does great things, and we cannot comprehend.

firstLine: For to the snow he says, ‘Fall on the earth’;
rest: and the shower of rain, his heavy shower of rain—

firstLine: he stops all human beings from working
rest: so that everyone whom he has made may know it.

firstLine: Then the animal goes into its den,
rest: and it remains in its den.

firstLine: “The storm wind comes from its chamber
rest: and cold from the north wind.

firstLine: By God’s breath, ice is given,
rest: and the broad waters are frozen.

firstLine: Also, he loads down thick clouds with moisture;
rest: his lightning scatters the clouds.

firstLine: And they turn around by his guidance
rest:
to accomplish all that he has commanded them
on the face of the habitable world.

firstLine: Whether as correction or for his land,
rest: or as loyal love, he lets it happen.

firstLine: “Hear this, Job;
rest: stand still and consider carefully God’s wondrous works.

firstLine: Do you know how God commands them
rest: and how he causes his cloud’s lightning to shine?

firstLine: Do you know about the hovering of the clouds,
rest: the marvelous works of the one with perfect knowledge?

firstLine: You whose garments are hot,
rest: when the earth is being still because of the south wind,

firstLine: with him can you spread out the skies,
rest: hard as a molten mirror?

firstLine: “Teach us what we should say to him;
rest: we cannot draw up our case because of the presence of darkness.

firstLine: So then, they do not look at the light when it is bright in the skies,
rest: when the wind has passed and has cleansed them.

firstLine: From the north comes gold—
rest: awesome majesty is around God.

firstLine: As for Shaddai, we cannot attain him;
rest:
he is exalted in power,
and he does not oppress justice and abundant righteousness.

firstLine: Therefore people revered him;
rest: he does not regard any who think that they are wise.”

firstLine: Yahweh Challenges Job
rest: Then Yahweh answered Job from the storm, and he said,

firstLine: “Who is this darkening counsel
rest: by words without knowledge?

firstLine: Prepare yourself for a difficult task like a man,
rest: and I will question you, and you shall declare to me.

firstLine: Yahweh Interrogates Job
rest:
“Where were you at my laying the foundation of the earth?
Tell me, if you possess understanding.

firstLine: when the morning stars were singing together
rest: and all the sons of God shouted for joy?

firstLine: “Or who shut the sea in with doors
rest: at its bursting, when it went out of the womb,

firstLine: at my making the clouds its garment
rest: and thick darkness its swaddling band,

firstLine: and I prescribed my rule for it,
rest: and I set bars and doors,

firstLine: and I said, ‘You shall come up to here, but you shall not go further,
rest: and here it will set a boundary for your proud surging waves’?

firstLine: “Have you ever in your life commanded the morning?
rest: Have you made the dawn know its place,

firstLine: to take hold of the earth’s skirts
rest: so that the wicked might be shaken off from it?

firstLine: It is changed like clay under a seal,
rest: and they appear like a garment.

firstLine: And their light is withheld from the wicked,
rest: and their uplifted arm is broken.

firstLine: “Have you entered into the sea’s sources?
rest: Or have you walked around in the recesses of the deep?

firstLine: “Where then is the way where the light dwells?
rest: And where then is its place,

firstLine: that you may take it to its territory,
rest: and that you might discern the paths to its home?

firstLine: You know, for you were born then,
rest: and the number of your days is great.

firstLine: Have you entered into the storehouses of the snow,
rest: or have you seen the storehouses of the hail,

firstLine: which I have reserved for the time of trouble,
rest: for the day of battle and war?

firstLine: Where then is the way where the light is distributed,
rest: where he scatters the east wind upon the earth?

firstLine: “Who has cut open a channel for the torrents
rest: and a way for the thunder bolts,

firstLine: to bring rain on a land where no one lives,
rest: a desert where no humans live,

firstLine: to satisfy desert and wasteland,
rest: and to cause the ground to put forth the rising of grass?

firstLine: Is there a father for the rain,
rest: or who fathered the drops of dew?

firstLine: From whose womb did the ice come forth,
rest: and who fathered the frost of heaven?

firstLine: Like stone the waters become hard,
rest: and the faces of the deep freeze.

firstLine: “Can you bind the chains of the Pleiades,
rest: or can you loosen the cords of Orion?

firstLine: Can you lead forth the southern constellations at their appointed time,
rest: or can you lead the Bear with its children?

firstLine: Do you know heaven’s statutes,
rest: or can you establish their rule on the earth?

firstLine: Can you lift up your voice to the clouds
rest: so that a flood of water may cover you?

firstLine: Who has put wisdom in the ibis,
rest: or who has given understanding to the rooster?

firstLine: at the flowing of the dust into a cast
rest: and the clods cling together?

firstLine: “Can you hunt prey for the lion?
rest: And can you satisfy the hunger of strong lions

firstLine: when they are crouched in the dens,
rest: when they lie in the thicket in an ambush?

firstLine: Who prepares for the crow its prey,
rest:
when its young ones cry to God for help,
and they wander around for lack of food?

firstLine: “Do you know the time when the goats of the rocks give birth?
rest: Do you observe the doe deer’s giving birth?

firstLine: Can you number the months they fulfill,
rest: and do you know the time of its giving birth?

firstLine: When they crouch, they bring forth their young ones;
rest: they get rid of their labor pains.

firstLine: Their young ones grow strong; they grow up in the open;
rest: they go forth and do not return to them.

firstLine: “Who has sent forth the wild ass free?
rest: And who has released the wild donkey’s bonds,

firstLine: to which I have given the wilderness as its house
rest: and the salt flat as its dwelling place?

firstLine: It scorns the city’s turmoil;
rest: it does not hear the driver’s shouts.

firstLine: It explores the mountains as its pasture
rest: and searches after every kind of green plant.

firstLine: “Is the wild ox willing to serve you,
rest: or will he spend the night at your feeding trough?

firstLine: Can you tie the wild ox with its rope to a furrow,
rest: or will it harrow the valleys after you?

firstLine: Can you trust it because its strength is great,
rest: or will you hand your labor over to it?

firstLine: Can you rely on it that it will return your grain
rest: and that it will gather it to your threshing floor?

firstLine: “The wings of the female ostrich flap—
rest: are they the pinions of the stork or the falcon?

firstLine: Indeed, it leaves its eggs to the earth,
rest: and it lets them be warmed on the ground,

firstLine: and it forgets that a foot might crush an egg,
rest: and a wild animal might trample it.

firstLine: It deals cruelly with its young ones, as if they were not its own,
rest: as if without fear that its labor were in vain,

firstLine: because God made it forget wisdom,
rest: and he did not give it a share in understanding.

firstLine: When it spreads its wings aloft,
rest: it laughs at the horse and its rider.

firstLine: “Do you give power to the horse?
rest: Do you clothe its neck with a mane?

firstLine: They paw in the valley, and it exults with strength;
rest: it goes out to meet the battle.

firstLine: It laughs at danger and is not dismayed,
rest: and it does not turn back from before the sword.

firstLine: Upon it the quiver rattles
rest: along with the flash of the spear and the short sword.

firstLine: With roar and rage it races over the ground,
rest: and it cannot stand still at the sound of the horn.

firstLine: “Does the hawk soar by your wisdom?
rest: Does it spread its wings to the south?

firstLine: Or does the eagle fly high at your command
rest: and construct its nest high?

firstLine: It lives on the rock and spends the night
rest: on the rock point and the mountain stronghold.

firstLine: From there it spies out the prey;
rest: its eyes look from far away.

firstLine: And its young ones lick blood greedily,
rest: and where the dead carcasses are, there they are.”

firstLine: “Shall a faultfinder contend with Shaddai?
rest: Anyone who argues with God must answer it.”

firstLine: Job Responds to Yahweh
rest: So Job answered Yahweh and said,

firstLine: “Look, I am insignificant.
rest:
What shall I answer you?
I lay my hand on my mouth.

firstLine: Once I have spoken, and I will not answer;
rest: even twice, but I will not proceed.”

firstLine: Yahweh Challenges Job Again
rest: Then Yahweh answered Job from the storm, and he said,

firstLine: “Prepare yourself for a difficult task like a man,
rest: and I will question you, and you shall declare to me.

firstLine: Yahweh Interrogates Job Again
rest:
“Indeed, would you annul my justice?
Would you condemn me, so that you might be righteous?

firstLine: Or do you have an arm like God,
rest: and can you thunder with a voice like his?

firstLine: Adorn yourself with pride and dignity,
rest: and clothe yourself with splendor.

firstLine: Pour out the overflowing of your anger,
rest: and look at all the proud, and humble them.

firstLine: Look at all the proud, humble them,
rest: and tread down the wicked where they stand.

firstLine: Hide them in the dust together;
rest: bind their faces in the grave.

firstLine: And I will also praise you,
rest: that your own right hand can save you.

firstLine: “Look, Behemoth, which I have made just as I made you;
rest: it eats grass like the ox.

firstLine: Look, its strength is in its loins
rest: and its power in the muscles of its stomach.

firstLine: It keeps its tail straight like a cedar;
rest: the sinews of its thighs are tightly wound.

firstLine: Its bones are tubes of copper,
rest: its limbs like rods of iron.

firstLine: “It is the first of God’s actions;
rest: the one who made him furnishes it with his sword.

firstLine: Yes, the mountains yield produce for it,
rest: and all wild animals play there.

firstLine: Under the lotus tree it lies,
rest: in the hiding place of the reeds and in the marsh.

firstLine: The lotus trees cover it with their shade;
rest: the wadi’s poplar trees surround it.

firstLine: Look, if the river is turbulent, it is not frightened;
rest: it is confident even though the Jordan rushes against its mouth.

firstLine: “Can you draw out Leviathan with a fishhook?
rest: Or can you tie down its mouth with a cord?

firstLine: Will you play with it as with birds
rest: and put it on a leash for your girls?

firstLine: Can you fill its kin with harpoons
rest: or its head with fish spears?

firstLine: Lay your hands on it;
rest: think about the battle—you will not do it again!

firstLine: “Look, the hope of capturing it is false.
rest: Will one be hurled down even at its sight?

firstLine: “I will not keep quiet concerning its limbs
rest: or concerning the extent of its might and the gracefulness of its frame.

firstLine: Its back has scales of shields;
rest: it is shut up closely as with a seal.

firstLine: They are close to one another—
rest: even the air cannot come between them.

firstLine: They are joined one to another;
rest: they cling together and cannot be separated.

firstLine: “Its snorting flashes forth light,
rest: and its eyes are red like dawn.

firstLine: Torches go from its mouth;
rest: sparks of fire shoot out.

firstLine: Smoke comes from its nostrils
rest: as from a kettle boiling and burning bulrushes.

firstLine: Its breath kindles charcoal,
rest: and a flame comes from its mouth.

firstLine: “Strength abides in its neck,
rest: and dismay dances before it.

firstLine: Its flesh’s folds of skin cling together;
rest: it is cast on it—it will not be moved.

firstLine: Its heart is cast as stone;
rest: yes, it is cast as the lower millstone.

firstLine: When it raises itself, the mighty ones are terrified;
rest: they retreat because of its thrashing.

firstLine: Reaching it with the sword does not avail,
rest: nor with the spear, the dart, or the javelin.

firstLine: It regards iron as straw,
rest: bronze as rotten wood.

firstLine: An arrow will not make it flee;
rest: sling stones are turned to stubble for it.

firstLine: Clubs are regarded as stubble,
rest: and it laughs at the short sword’s rattle.

firstLine: “Its underparts are shards of a potsherd;
rest: it moves over mud like a threshing sledge.

firstLine: It makes the deep boil like a cooking pot;
rest: it makes the sea like a pot of ointment.

firstLine: Behind it, it leaves a glistening wake;
rest: one would think that the deep has gray hair.

firstLine: “On the ground it has no equal—
rest: a creature without fear.

firstLine: It observes all the lofty;
rest: it is king over all that are proud.”

firstLine: Job’s Repentance and Restoration
rest: Then Job answered Yahweh and said,

firstLine: “I know that you can do all things,
rest: and any scheme from you will not be thwarted.

firstLine: ‘Who is this darkening counsel without knowledge?’
rest:
Therefore I uttered, but I did not understand;
things too wonderful for me, but I did not know.

firstLine: ‘Hear and I will speak;
rest: I will question you, then inform me.’

firstLine: By the ear’s hearing I heard of you,
rest: but now my eye has seen you.

firstLine: Therefore I despise myself
rest: and repent in dust and ashes.”

firstLine: The Ways of the Righteous and the Wicked
Instead, in the law of Yahweh is his delight,
rest: and on his law he meditates day and night.

firstLine: And so, he is like a tree planted by streams of water
Therefore the wicked will not stand in the judgment,
rest: nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous;

firstLine: for Yahweh knows the way of the righteous,
rest: but the way of the wicked will perish.

firstLine: The Messiah’s Reign
rest:
Why are nations in tumult,
and countries plotting in vain?

firstLine: The kings of the earth establish themselves,
rest:
and the rulers conspire together
against Yahweh and his anointed:

firstLine: “Let us tear off their bonds,
rest: and cast their cords from us!”

firstLine: Then he speaks to them in his wrath,
rest: and in his fury he terrifies them:

firstLine: “But as for me, I have set my king
rest: on Zion, my holy mountain.”

firstLine: I will tell the decree;
Ask from me and I will make the nations your heritage,
rest: and your possession the ends of the earth.

firstLine: Serve Yahweh with fear,
rest: and rejoice with trembling.

firstLine: Kiss the Son
rest:
lest he be angry and you perish on the way,
for his anger burns quickly.
Blessed are all who take refuge in him.

firstLine: A Call to Yahweh in Distress
Many are saying about my soul,
rest: “There is no deliverance for him from God. Selah

firstLine: But you, Yahweh, are a shield around me,
rest: my glory and the one who lifts up my head.

firstLine: With my voice I call to Yahweh
rest: and he answers me from his holy hill. Selah

firstLine: I lay down and slept;
rest: I woke up because Yahweh sustains me.

firstLine: I am not afraid of the ten thousands of people
rest: who all around have set themselves against me.

firstLine: Rise up, O Yahweh; deliver me, O my God;
rest:
for you strike all my enemies on the cheek.
The teeth of the wicked you break.

firstLine: To Yahweh belongs deliverance;
rest: may your blessing be over your people. Selah

firstLine: Safety in Yahweh
rest:
For the music director; with stringed instruments. A psalm of David.
When I call, answer me, O God of my righteousness.
In trouble deliver me.
Be gracious to me and hear my prayer.

firstLine: Offer correct sacrifices,
rest: and trust in Yahweh.

firstLine: You have put gladness in my heart
rest: more than when their grain and their wine abound.

firstLine: In peace I will lie down and sleep at once,
rest: for you alone, O Yahweh, make me dwell safely.

firstLine: A Prayer for Guidance and Protection
rest:
For the music director; with the flutes. A psalm of David.
Hear my words, O Yahweh.
Give heed to my sighing.

firstLine: Listen to the sound of my pleading, my king and my God,
rest: for to you I pray.

firstLine: But as for me, through the abundance of your steadfast love
rest:
I will enter your house.
I will bow down toward your holy temple in awe of you.

firstLine: O Yahweh, lead me in your righteousness because of my enemies;
rest: make straight before me your way.

firstLine: For there is not anything reliable in his mouth;
Treat them as guilty, O God;
rest:
let them fall because of their plans.
Because of the abundance of their transgressions cast them out,
for they have rebelled against you.

firstLine: An Appeal for Forgiveness and Deliverance
rest:
For the music director; with stringed instruments, on the Sheminith.
A psalm of David.
O Yahweh, do not rebuke me in your anger,
and do not discipline me in your wrath.

firstLine: I am weary with my groaning;
rest:
I flood my bed every night.
With my tears I drench my couch.

firstLine: My eye wastes away because of vexation;
rest: it grows old because of all my oppressors.

firstLine: Depart from me, all workers of evil,
rest: for Yahweh has heard the sound of my weeping.

firstLine: Yahweh has heard my plea;
rest: Yahweh has accepted my prayer.

firstLine: Prayer for Deliverance from Enemies
rest:
A Shiggaion of David which he sang to Yahweh
on account of Cush, a Benjaminite.
O Yahweh, my God, in you I have taken refuge.
Save me from all who pursue me, and deliver me.

firstLine: Or else he will tear me apart like a lion,
rest: ripping to pieces, with none to deliver.

firstLine: O Yahweh, my God, if I have done this,
rest: if there is wrong in my hands,

firstLine: if I have repaid my ally with harm,
rest: or if I have plundered my enemy without cause,

firstLine: let the enemy of my soul pursue,
rest:
and overtake and trample my life into the ground,
and lay my honor in the dust. Selah

firstLine: Rise up, O Yahweh, in your anger,
rest:
and lift yourself up against the wrath of my oppressors,
and awake for me,
since you have commanded judgment.

firstLine: And let the assembly of peoples surround you,
rest: and over it return on high.

firstLine: Let the evil of the wicked come to an end,
rest:
but establish the righteous,
and test the hearts and innermost being, O righteous God.

firstLine: My shield is with God
rest: who saves the upright of heart.

firstLine: God is a righteous judge,
rest: and a God who has indignation every day.

firstLine: He makes a pit and digs it out,
rest: then falls in the trap he has made.

firstLine: His trouble comes back on his head,
rest: and his violence comes down on his skull.

firstLine: I will thank Yahweh according to his righteousness,
rest: and I will sing praise to the name of Yahweh, the Most High.

firstLine: Yahweh’s Glory in Creation
rest:
For the music director, on the Gittith. A psalm of David.
Yahweh, our Lord, how majestic is your name in all the earth,
who put your splendor above the heavens.

firstLine: From the mouth of children and infants you have founded strength
rest:
on account of your enemies,
to silence the enemy and the avenger.

firstLine: When I look at your heavens, the work of your fingers,
rest: the moon and the stars which you set in place—

firstLine: And you made him a little lower than heavenly beings,
rest: and with glory and with majesty you crowned him.

firstLine: You make him over the works of your hands;
rest: all things you have placed under his feet:

firstLine: sheep and cattle, all of them,
rest: and also the wild animals of the field,

firstLine: the birds of the sky and the fish of the sea,
rest: everything that passes along the paths of seas.

firstLine: Yahweh, our Lord,
rest: how majestic is your name in all of the earth!

firstLine: Praise for Yahweh’s Justice
rest:
For the music director, according to Muth-labben. A psalm of David.
I will thank Yahweh with all my heart.
I will tell of all your wonderful deeds.

firstLine: When my enemies turn back,
rest: they will stumble and perish because of your presence.

firstLine: For you have maintained my just cause;
rest: you have sat on the throne judging correctly.

firstLine: You have rebuked the nations;
rest:
you have destroyed the wicked.
Their name you have blotted out
forever and ever.

firstLine: The enemies are destroyed in ruins forever,
rest:
and you have uprooted their cities;
their very memory has perished.

firstLine: And Yahweh will be a stronghold for the oppressed,
rest: a stronghold in times of distress.

firstLine: And those who know your name will trust in you,
rest: for you do not forsake those who seek you, O Yahweh.

firstLine: The nations have fallen in the pit that they made;
rest: their foot is caught in the net that they hid.

firstLine: Yahweh has made himself known;
rest:
he has executed judgment.
The wicked is snared by the work of his hands. Higgaion Selah

firstLine: The wicked shall turn back to Sheol,
rest: all the nations forgetting God,

firstLine: for the needy shall not always be forgotten;
rest: the hope of the poor shall never perish.

firstLine: Rise up, O Yahweh, let not humans prevail;
rest: let the nations be judged before you.

firstLine: A Prayer for God to Throw down the Wicked
rest:
Why, O Yahweh, do you stand far off?
Why do you hide during times of distress?

firstLine: for the wicked boasts about the desire of his heart,
rest: and the one greedy for gain curses and treats Yahweh with contempt.

firstLine: He says in his heart, “I shall not be moved
rest: throughout all generations, during which I will have no trouble.”

firstLine: His mouth is filled with cursing,
rest:
with deceits and oppression;
under his tongue are trouble and evil.

firstLine: He sits in ambush in villages;
rest:
in the hiding places he kills the innocent.
His eyes lurk for the helpless.

firstLine: He is crushed; he is bowed down;
rest: so the helpless host falls by his might.

firstLine: Rise up, O Yahweh;
rest:
O God, lift up your hand.
Do not forget the afflicted.

firstLine: But you have seen; indeed you have noted trouble and grief
Break the arm of the wicked,
rest:
and as for the evil man—
seek out his wickedness until you find none.

firstLine: Yahweh is king forever and ever;
rest: the nations have perished from his land.

firstLine: to render judgment for the fatherless and the oppressed
rest: so that a mere mortal from the earth will no longer cause terror.

firstLine: Confidence in Yahweh’s Righteousness
rest:
For the music director. Of David.
In Yahweh I have taken refuge;
how can you say to my soul,
“Flee to your mountain like a bird”?

firstLine: When the foundations are destroyed
rest: what can the righteous do?

firstLine: Yahweh is in his holy temple;
Yahweh tests the righteous,
rest:
but the wicked and the lover of violence
his soul hates.

firstLine: For Yahweh is righteous;
rest:
he loves righteous deeds.
The upright shall see his face.

firstLine: Human Faithlessness and God’s Faithfulness
rest:
For the music director; on the Sheminith. A psalm of David.
Save, O Yahweh, for the pious have ceased to be;
for the faithful have vanished
from among the children of humankind.

firstLine: May Yahweh cut off all flattering lips,
rest: the tongue speaking great boasts—

firstLine: “Because of the oppression of the afflicted,
rest:
because of the groaning of the poor,
now I will rise up,” Yahweh says.
“I shall put them in the safety for which they long.”

firstLine: The words of Yahweh are pure words
rest:
like silver refined in the crucible on the ground,
refined seven times.

firstLine: The wicked prowl about
rest: when vileness is exalted among the children of humankind.

firstLine: Trust in the Salvation of Yahweh
rest:
For the music director. A psalm of David.
How long, O Yahweh? Will you forget me forever?
How long will you hide your face from me?

firstLine: How long must I take counsel in my soul,
rest:
and sorrow in my heart all the day?
How long will my enemy be exalted over me?

firstLine: and lest my enemy should say, “I have overcome him,”
rest: lest my enemies rejoice because I am shaken.

firstLine: I will sing to Yahweh
rest: because he has dealt bountifully with me.

firstLine: The Folly of the Godless and God’s Final Triumph
rest:
For the music director. Of David.
The fool says in his heart, “There is no God.”
They are corrupt.
They do abominable deeds.
There is none who does good.

firstLine: Yahweh looks down from heaven upon the children of humankind
rest:
to see whether there is one who has insight,
one who cares about God.

firstLine: All have gone astray;
All who do evil—do they not know,
rest:
they who eat my people as though they were eating bread?
They do not call on Yahweh.

firstLine: There they are very fearful
rest: because God is with the generation of the righteous.

firstLine: You would put to shame the plan of the poor,
rest: because Yahweh is his refuge.

firstLine: A Description of Those Who May Dwell with Yahweh
rest:
A psalm of David.
O Yahweh, who may reside in your tent?
Who may dwell on your holy mountain?

firstLine: In his eyes a rejected one is contemptible,
rest:
but he honors those who respect Yahweh.
He takes an oath to his own injury and does not retract it.

firstLine: He does not lend his money at interest,
rest:
and does not take a bribe against the innocent.
He who does these things
will never be shaken.

firstLine: Confidence in Yahweh
rest:
A miktam of David.
Protect me, O God,
for I take refuge in you.

firstLine: With regard to the saints who are in the land,
rest: they are the noble ones in whom is all my desire.

firstLine: I will bless Yahweh who advises me;
rest: yes, at night my innermost being instructs me.

firstLine: for you will not abandon my soul to Sheol;
rest: you will not give your faithful one to see the grave.

firstLine: Prayer for Vindication and Protection
rest:
A prayer of David.
O Yahweh, hear a just cause.
Hear my cry; heed my prayer
I make without deceitful lips.

firstLine: Let my vindication come forth from you;
rest: let your eyes see fairness.

firstLine: You have tried my heart;
As for the works of humankind,
rest:
by the word of your lips,
I have kept from the ways of the violent.

firstLine: I have held my steps in your path
rest: My feet will not slip.

firstLine: As for me, I have called on you
rest:
because you will answer me, O God.
Incline your ear to me.
Hear my words.

firstLine: Show wondrously your acts of loyal love,
rest:
O Savior of those who take refuge
at your right hand
from those who rise up against them.

firstLine: from the presence of the wicked who destroy me,
rest:
those enemies against my life,
they that surround me.

firstLine: They have shut off their calloused heart;
rest: with their mouth they speak arrogantly.

firstLine: He is like a lion; he longs to tear apart,
rest: and like a strong lion crouching in hiding places.

firstLine: Praise to God for His Deliverance
rest:
For the music director. Of David, the servant of Yahweh,
who spoke to Yahweh the words of this song
when Yahweh delivered him from the hand of all his enemies,
and from the hand of Saul.
And he said:
“I love you, O Yahweh, my strength.”

firstLine: Yahweh is my rock and my fortress and my deliverer,
rest:
my God, my rock in whom I have taken refuge,
my shield and the horn of my deliverance, my stronghold.

firstLine: I called upon Yahweh, who is worthy to be praised,
rest: and I was saved from my enemies.

firstLine: The ropes of death encircled me,
rest: and streams of ruin overwhelmed me.

firstLine: The ropes of Sheol surrounded me;
rest: the snares of death confronted me.

firstLine: In my trouble I called on Yahweh,
rest:
and to my God I cried for help.
He heard my voice from his temple,
and my cry for help
came up before his presence into his ears.

firstLine: Then the earth shook and quaked,
rest:
and the foundations of the mountains trembled,
and they staggered because he was angry.

firstLine: Smoke went forth from his nose,
rest:
and fire from his mouth consumed.
Burning coals blazed from him.

firstLine: So he bowed the heavens and came down
rest: with a thick cloud under his feet.

firstLine: And he mounted a cherub and flew,
rest: and he swooped down on wings of wind.

firstLine: He made darkness his hiding place;
rest:
all about him his covering
was a darkness of waters, thick clouds.

firstLine: From the brightness before him
rest:
his clouds passed over
with hail and coals of fire.

firstLine: And Yahweh thundered from the heavens,
rest:
and the Most High uttered his voice
with hail and coals of fire.

firstLine: And he shot his arrows and scattered them,
rest: and many lightning bolts and routed them.

firstLine: Then the channels of the sea became visible,
rest:
and the foundations of the world were uncovered
by your rebuke, O Yahweh,
by the blast of the wind of your nose.

firstLine: He delivered me from my strong enemy,
rest:
and from those who hated me
because they were stronger than I.

firstLine: They confronted me on the day of disaster,
rest: but Yahweh was my support.

firstLine: Yahweh has rewarded me according to my righteousness;
rest:
According to the cleanness of my hands
he has repaid me.

firstLine: Because I have kept the ways of Yahweh,
rest: and have not acted wickedly against my God,

firstLine: because all his ordinances are before me,
rest: and his statutes I have not removed from me,

firstLine: and I was blameless before him,
rest: and I kept myself from my guilt.

firstLine: Therefore Yahweh has repaid me according to my righteousness,
rest: according to the cleanness of my hands in his sight.

firstLine: For you deliver humble people,
rest: but haughty eyes you humiliate.

firstLine: For you light my lamp;
rest: Yahweh, my God, lights up my darkness.

firstLine: For with you I can charge a troop,
rest: and with my God I can scale a wall.

firstLine: For who is God apart from Yahweh,
rest: and who is a rock except our God?

firstLine: The God who girded me with strength,
rest: and made safe my way,

firstLine: he made my feet like the deer’s,
rest: and on my high places he makes me stand.

firstLine: He trains my hands for war,
rest: so that my arms can bend a bow of bronze.

firstLine: You also gave me the shield of your salvation,
rest:
and your right hand supported me,
and your humility made me great.

firstLine: You enlarged my step under me,
rest: and my ankles did not slip.

firstLine: I chased my enemies and overtook them;
rest: I did not turn back until they were finished off.

firstLine: I struck them and they were not able to stand up;
rest: they fell under my feet.

firstLine: And you girded me with strength for the battle;
rest: those rising against me you made to kneel under me.

firstLine: And you made my enemies turn their backs,
rest: then I destroyed those who hated me.

firstLine: They cried out but there was no rescuer,
rest: even to Yahweh, but he did not answer them.

firstLine: And I ground them like dust in the wind,
rest: I emptied them out like mud of the streets.

firstLine: You rescued me from strife with people;
rest:
you set me as head (over) nations.
People I did not know served me;

firstLine: The children of a foreign land lost heart,
rest: and they came trembling from their strongholds.

firstLine: Yahweh lives, and blessed be my rock,
rest: and may the God of my salvation be exalted—

firstLine: the God who executed vengeance for me,
rest: and subdued peoples under me,

firstLine: Therefore I will give thanks to you among the nations, O Yahweh,
rest: and I will sing the praise of your name:

firstLine: the one who makes great victories for his king,
rest:
and who shows loyal love for his anointed,
to David and to his descendants forever.

firstLine: Yahweh’s Creation and Law
rest:
For the music director. A psalm of David.
The heavens are telling the glory of God,
and the firmament proclaims the work of his hands.

firstLine: Every day they pour forth speech,
rest: and every night they tell knowledge.

firstLine: There is no speech and there are no words;
rest: their sound is inaudible.

firstLine: Yet in all the world their line goes out,
rest:
and their words to the end of the world.
In them he has pitched a tent for the sun,

firstLine: and it is like a bridegroom
rest:
who comes out of his bridal chamber.
It is glad like a strong man
to run its course.

firstLine: Its rising is from one end of the heavens
rest:
and its circuit to the other end of them;
and nothing is hidden from its heat.

firstLine: more desirable than gold, even much fine gold;
rest: and sweeter than honey, even honey in the comb.

firstLine: Moreover, your servant is warned by them;
rest: in keeping them is great reward.

firstLine: Also, keep back your servant from arrogant sins;
rest:
let them not rule over me.
Then I shall be blameless,
and I shall be innocent of great transgression.

firstLine: Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart
rest:
be acceptable in your presence,
O Yahweh, my rock and my redeemer.

firstLine: God’s Blessing on the King
rest:
For the music director. A psalm of David.
May Yahweh answer you in the day of trouble.
May the name of Jacob’s God protect you.

firstLine: May he send you help from the sanctuary,
rest: and from Zion may he sustain you.

firstLine: May he remember all your offerings,
rest: and your burnt offering may he regard favorably.

firstLine: May he give to you your heart’s desire,
rest: and your every plan may he fulfill. Selah

firstLine: May we shout for joy over your victory,
rest:
and in the name of our God may we set up banners.
May Yahweh fulfill all your requests.

firstLine: Some boast in chariots and others in horses,
rest: but we boast in the name of Yahweh, our God.

firstLine: They will collapse and fall,
rest: and we will rise and stand firm.

firstLine: Joy in the Salvation of Yahweh
rest:
For the music director. A psalm of David.
O Yahweh, the king will rejoice in your strength,
and how greatly he will delight in your help.

firstLine: You have given him the desire of his heart,
rest: and have not withheld the request of his lips. Selah

firstLine: He asked life from you; you gave it to him—
rest: length of days forever and ever.

firstLine: Because the king trusts Yahweh,
rest:
and through the steadfast love of the Most High
he shall not be moved.

firstLine: Your hand will find all your enemies;
rest: your right hand will find those who hate you.

firstLine: You will make them like your fiery furnace
rest:
at the time of your appearance.
Yahweh will swallow them in his wrath
and fire will consume them.

firstLine: You will destroy their offspring from the earth,
rest: and their descendants from among the children of humankind.

firstLine: Though they have plotted evil against you,
rest: though they have planned a scheme, they will not prevail.

firstLine: For you will turn them to flight;
rest: you will aim arrows on your bowstrings at their faces.

firstLine: Be exalted, O Yahweh, in your strength,
rest: and we sing and praise your power.

firstLine: Suffering and Waiting for Deliverance
rest:
For the music director; according to The Doe of the Dawn. A psalm of David.
My God, my God why have you forsaken me?
Why are you far from helping me, far from the words of my groaning?

firstLine: O my God, I call by day and you do not answer,
rest: and by night but I have no rest.

firstLine: Yet you are holy,
rest: enthroned on the praises of Israel.

firstLine: Our ancestors trusted you;
rest: they trusted and you delivered them.

firstLine: They cried to you and were saved;
rest: they trusted you and were not ashamed.

firstLine: But I am a worm and not a man,
rest: scorned by humankind and despised by people.

firstLine: “He trusts Yahweh. Let him rescue him.
rest: Let him deliver him because he delights in him.”

firstLine: Yet you took me from the belly;
rest: you made me trust while on my mother’s breasts.

firstLine: Do not be far from me
rest:
because trouble is near;
because there is no helper.

firstLine: Many bulls have encircled me;
rest: mighty bulls of Bashan have surrounded me.

firstLine: They open their mouth against me
rest: like a lion tearing and roaring.

firstLine: I am poured out like water,
My strength is dry like a potsherd,
rest:
and my tongue is sticking to my jaws;
and you have placed me in the dust of death.

firstLine: Because dogs have surrounded me;
rest:
a gang of evildoers has encircled me.
Like the lion they are at my hands and my feet.

firstLine: I can count all my bones;
rest: they gaze, they look at me.

firstLine: They divide my garments among them,
rest: and for my clothing they cast lots.

firstLine: Rescue my life from the sword,
rest: my only life from the power of the dogs.

firstLine: Save me from the mouth of the lion,
rest: and from the horns of the wild oxen answer me.

firstLine: I will tell your name to my brothers;
rest: inside the assembly I will praise you.

firstLine: because he has not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted,
rest:
and has not hid his face from him;
but he listened to him when he cried for help.

firstLine: All the ends of the earth
rest:
will remember and turn to Yahweh.
All the families of the nations
will worship before you.

firstLine: Because the kingship belongs to Yahweh,
rest: and he rules over the nations.

firstLine: They will come and tell his saving deeds
rest: to a people yet to be born, that he has done it.

firstLine: Yahweh the Shepherd
In grassy pastures he makes me lie down;
rest: by quiet waters he leads me.

firstLine: Even when I walk in a dark valley, I fear no evil
rest:
because you are with me.
Your rod and your staff, they comfort me.

firstLine: You prepare before me a table
Surely goodness and loyal love will pursue me
rest:
all the days of my life,
and I will stay in the house of Yahweh
for a very long time.

firstLine: The King of Glory
rest:
A psalm of David.
The earth is Yahweh’s, with its fullness,
the world and those who live in it,

firstLine: because he has founded it on the seas,
rest: and has established it on the rivers.

firstLine: He who is innocent of hands and pure of heart,
rest:
who does not lift up his soul to falseness,
and does not swear deceitfully.

firstLine: He will receive blessing from Yahweh,
rest: and justice from the God of his salvation.

firstLine: Such is the sort of those who seek him,
rest: those who seek your face, even Jacob. Selah

firstLine: Lift up your heads, O gates,
rest:
and rise up, O ancient doorways,
that the king of glory may enter.

firstLine: Lift up your heads, O gates,
rest:
and lift up, O ancient doorways,
that the king of glory may enter.

firstLine: A Prayer for Guidance, Deliverance, and Forgiveness
rest:
Of David.
To you, O Yahweh, I lift up my soul.

firstLine: Cause me to walk in your truth and teach me,
rest:
because you are the God of my salvation.
I await you all day long.

firstLine: Remember your compassion, O Yahweh,
rest:
and your acts of loyal love,
because they are from of old.

firstLine: Do not remember
rest:
the sins of my youth or my transgressions.
According to your loyal love remember me if you will,
for the sake of your goodness, O Yahweh.

firstLine: Good and right is Yahweh;
rest: therefore he instructs sinners in the way.

firstLine: He causes the humble to walk in justice,
rest: and teaches the humble his way.

firstLine: All the paths of Yahweh are loyal love and faithfulness
rest: for those who keep his covenant and statutes.

firstLine: Also, for the sake of your name, O Yahweh,
rest: forgive my sin, because it is great.

firstLine: His soul will lodge in prosperity,
rest: and his offspring will possess the land.

firstLine: Intimate fellowship with Yahweh is for those who fear him,
rest: and he makes known his covenant to them.

firstLine: My eyes are continually toward Yahweh,
rest: because he will take my feet from the net.

firstLine: Turn to me and have mercy on me
rest: because I am lonely and afflicted.

firstLine: Remove the troubles of my heart;
rest: bring me out from my distresses.

firstLine: Consider my affliction and trouble,
rest: and forgive all my sins.

firstLine: Consider that my enemies are many,
rest: and they hate me with violent hatred.

firstLine: Let integrity and uprightness preserve me,
rest: because I wait for you.

firstLine: O God, redeem Israel
rest: from all its troubles.

firstLine: A Prayer for Vindication
rest:
Of David.
Judge me, O Yahweh, because I have walked in my integrity,
and I have trusted Yahweh and not wavered.

firstLine: Because your loyal love is before my eyes,
rest: and I walk about in your faithfulness.

firstLine: I do not sit with deceitful people,
rest: nor will I go about with hypocrites.

firstLine: I hate the crowd of evildoers,
rest: and with the wicked I will not sit.

firstLine: I will wash my hands in innocence,
rest: and I will walk about your altar, O Yahweh,

firstLine: to declare with a voice of thanksgiving,
rest: and tell of all your wondrous deeds.

firstLine: O Yahweh, I love the dwelling of your house,
rest: and the place where your glory abides.

firstLine: Do not destroy me with the sinners,
rest: nor my life with men of bloodshed,

firstLine: in whose hands is an evil plan,
rest: and whose right hand is full of bribes.

firstLine: A Declaration of Trust
When evildoers drew near against me to eat my flesh—
rest:
my adversaries and my enemies who drew near to me—
they themselves stumbled and fell.

firstLine: Though an army encamp against me,
rest:
my heart will not fear.
Though war arise against me,
even in this I will remain confident.

firstLine: One thing I have asked from Yahweh;
rest:
it I will seek:
that I may dwell in the house of Yahweh all the days of my life,
to behold the beauty of Yahweh,
and to consider his temple.

firstLine: Hear, O Yahweh, my voice when I call,
rest: and be gracious to me and answer me.

firstLine: Do not hide your face from me;
rest:
do not turn your servant away in anger.
You have been my help; do not abandon nor forsake me,
O God of my salvation.

firstLine: If my father or my mother forsake me,
rest: then Yahweh will receive me.

firstLine: Teach me, O Yahweh, your way,
rest: and lead me on a level path because of my enemies.

firstLine: Do not give me over to the desire of my enemies,
rest:
because false witnesses have arisen against me,
and each breathing out violence.

firstLine: Surely I believe that I will see the goodness of Yahweh
rest: in the land of the living.

firstLine: A Prayer for Help, and Joy in Its Answer
rest:
A psalm of David.
To you, O Yahweh, I call.
O my rock, do not be deaf to me.
Or else, if you are silent to me,
then I will become like those descending to the pit.

firstLine: Hear the voice of my supplications
rest:
when I cry to you for help,
when I lift up my hands
toward your holy inner sanctuary.

firstLine: Do not drag me away with the wicked
rest:
or with the workers of evil,
who speak of peace with their neighbors,
while evil is in their heart.

firstLine: Give to them according to their work,
Because they do not regard the works of Yahweh,
rest:
nor the work of his hands,
he will destroy them
and not rebuild them.

firstLine: Blessed is Yahweh,
rest: because he has heard the voice of my supplications.

firstLine: Yahweh is their strength,
rest: and he is the refuge for the salvation of his anointed one.

firstLine: Save your people
rest:
and bless your heritage.
Shepherd them also and carry them always.

firstLine: Praise to God for His Glory and Strength
rest:
A psalm of David.
Ascribe to Yahweh, O sons of God,
ascribe to Yahweh glory and strength.

firstLine: The voice of Yahweh is over the waters;
rest:
the God of glory thunders.
Yahweh is over many waters.

firstLine: And he makes them skip like a calf;
rest: Lebanon and Sirion like a young wild ox.

firstLine: The voice of Yahweh causes deer to give birth
rest:
and strips the forests bare.
And at his temple all in it say, “Glory!”

firstLine: Yahweh sits enthroned at the flood,
rest: and Yahweh sits as king forever.

firstLine: Thanksgiving for Answered Prayer
rest:
A psalm; a song for the dedication of the house. Of David.
I will exalt you, O Yahweh,
because you have drawn me up,
and have not made my enemies rejoice over me.

firstLine: O Yahweh, my God,
rest:
I cried for help to you,
and you healed me.

firstLine: Sing praises to Yahweh, you his faithful ones,
rest: and give thanks to his holy fame.

firstLine: For there is a moment in his anger;
rest:
there is a lifetime in his favor.
Weeping lodges for the evening,
but in the morning comes rejoicing.

firstLine: But as for me, I had said in my prosperity,
rest: “I shall not be moved ever.”

firstLine: O Yahweh, by your favor
rest:
you caused my strong mountain to stand.
You hid your face. I was bewildered.

firstLine: To you, O Yahweh, I called,
rest: and to the Lord I pleaded for grace saying,

firstLine: “What gain is there in my death,
rest:
in my going down into the pit?
Will the dust praise you?
Will it tell of your faithfulness?

firstLine: “O Yahweh, hear and be gracious to me.
rest: O Yahweh, be my helper.”

firstLine: so that I may sing praises to you
rest:
and not be quiet.
O Yahweh, my God,
I will give thanks to you forever.

firstLine: Yahweh Is a Fortress
rest:
For the music director. A psalm of David.
In you, O Yahweh, I have taken refuge.
Let me not be put to shame ever.
Deliver me by your righteousness.

firstLine: Bring me out of the net that they have secretly set for me,
rest: for you are my refuge.

firstLine: I hate those devoted to useless idols,
rest: but I trust Yahweh.

firstLine: And you have not delivered me
rest:
into the hand of the enemy.
You have set my feet in a broad place.

firstLine: Be gracious to me, O Yahweh,
rest:
because I have distress.
My eye wastes away because of vexation,
along with my soul and my body.

firstLine: For my life is at an end with sorrow,
rest:
and my years with sighing.
My strength stumbles because of my iniquity,
and my bones waste away.

firstLine: Because of all my adversaries I have become a disgrace,
rest:
especially to my neighbors,
and a dread to my acquaintances.
Those who see me in the street flee from me.

firstLine: For I hear the rumor of many,
rest:
“Terror on every side!”
When conspiring together against me,
they have plotted to take my life.

firstLine: Let lying lips be dumb,
rest:
that speak against the righteous unrestrained
with arrogance and contempt.

firstLine: How abundant is your goodness
rest:
that you have stored up for those who fear you,
that you perform for those who take refuge in you
before the children of humankind.

firstLine: You will hide them in the protection of your presence
rest:
from the plots of man.
You will hide them in a shelter from the strife of tongues.

firstLine: Blessed is Yahweh,
rest:
because he has worked marvelously his loyal love to me
in a besieged city.

firstLine: As for me, I said in my alarm,
rest:
“I am cut off from before your eyes.”
However you heard the voice of my supplications
when I cried to you for help.

firstLine: Be strong and let your heart show strength,
rest: all you who wait for Yahweh.

firstLine: Thanksgiving for Forgiveness of Sins
rest:
Of David. A maskil.
Happy is he whose transgression is taken away,
whose sin is covered.

firstLine: Happy is a person to whom Yahweh does not impute iniquity
rest: and in whose spirit there is not deceit.

firstLine: When I kept silent, my bones were worn out
rest: due to my groaning all the day.

firstLine: Therefore let all the faithful pray to you
rest:
at the time for finding you.
Surely at the flood of many waters they will not reach him.

firstLine: You are my hiding place;
rest:
from trouble you preserve me.
With cries of deliverance you surround me. Selah

firstLine: I will instruct you and teach you
rest:
in the way that you should go.
I will advise you with my eye upon you.

firstLine: Do not be like a horse or like a mule, without understanding;
rest:
that needs his tackle—bridle and rein—for restraint
or he would not come near you.

firstLine: Many are the pains of the wicked,
rest:
but for the one who trusts Yahweh
loyal love surrounds him.

firstLine: Be glad in Yahweh and rejoice, you righteous,
rest: and shout for joy, all you upright of heart.

firstLine: Praise to Yahweh for His Character and Creation
rest:
Exult in Yahweh, O you righteous,
for praise is fitting for the upright.

firstLine: Give thanks to Yahweh with the lyre;
rest: with a harp of ten strings play to him.

firstLine: Sing to him a new song;
rest: play skillfully with jubilant shout.

firstLine: For the word of Yahweh is upright,
rest: and all his work is done in faithfulness.

firstLine: By the word of Yahweh the heavens were made,
rest: and by the breath of his mouth all their host.

firstLine: Yahweh brings to nothing the plan of nations;
rest: he frustrates the intents of peoples.

firstLine: The plan of Yahweh stands firm forever,
rest: the intents of his heart from one generation to the next.

firstLine: Blessed is the nation whose God is Yahweh,
rest: the people he has chosen for his inheritance.

firstLine: From heaven Yahweh looks;
rest: he sees all the children of humankind.

firstLine: From his dwelling place he gazes
rest: on all the inhabitants of the earth,

firstLine: he who fashions altogether their heart,
rest: he who understands all their works.

firstLine: The horse is a false hope for victory,
rest: nor can it save by the greatness of its power.

firstLine: Behold, the eye of Yahweh is on those who fear him,
rest: on those who hope for his loyal love

firstLine: to deliver their soul from death
rest: and to keep them alive in famine.

firstLine: Our soul waits for Yahweh;
rest: he is our help and our shield.

firstLine: For in him our heart rejoices
rest: because in his holy name we trust.

firstLine: Let your loyal love, O Yahweh, be upon us,
rest: even as we hope in you.

firstLine: Thanksgiving for Yahweh’s Deliverance
rest:
Of David, when he pretended to be crazy in front of Abimelech
so that he drove him out, and so he departed.
I will bless Yahweh at all times;
his praise shall be in my mouth continually.

firstLine: My soul makes its boast in Yahweh;
rest: let the humble hear and be glad.

firstLine: Magnify Yahweh with me,
rest: and let us exalt his name together.

firstLine: I sought Yahweh and he answered me,
rest: and from all my terrors he delivered me.

firstLine: They looked to him and were radiant,
rest: and their faces shall not be ashamed.

firstLine: This poor man called and Yahweh heard,
rest: and saved him from all his troubles.

firstLine: The angel of Yahweh encamps
rest:
around those who fear him,
and he rescues them.

firstLine: Taste and see that Yahweh is good;
rest: blessed is the man who takes refuge in him.

firstLine: Fear Yahweh, you his saints,
rest: for there is no lack for those who fear him.

firstLine: The young lions are in want and suffer hunger,
rest: but those who seek Yahweh will not lack for any good thing.

firstLine: Come, you children, listen to me;
rest: I will teach you the fear of Yahweh.

firstLine: Who is the man who desires life,
rest: who loves many days in order to see good?

firstLine: Keep your tongue from evil
rest: and your lips from speaking deceit.

firstLine: The eyes of Yahweh are toward the righteous,
rest: and his ears toward their cry for help.

firstLine: The face of Yahweh is against evildoers,
rest: to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.

firstLine: They cry out and Yahweh hears
rest: and delivers them from all of their troubles.

firstLine: Yahweh is near to those who are heartbroken
rest: and saves those who are crushed in spirit.

firstLine: Many are the distresses of the righteous,
rest: but Yahweh delivers him out of them all.

firstLine: He protects all his bones;
rest: not one of them is broken.

firstLine: Evil will slay the wicked,
rest: and those who hate the righteous will incur guilt.

firstLine: Yahweh redeems the life of his servants,
rest: and none who take refuge in him will incur guilt.

firstLine: A Prayer for Rescue from Enemies
Grasp buckler and shield
rest: and rise to my aid.

firstLine: Let them be like chaff before the wind,
rest: with the angel of Yahweh driving them.

firstLine: Let their way be dark and slippery,
rest: with the angel of Yahweh pursuing them.

firstLine: For without cause they secretly hide the pit with their net for me;
rest: without cause they dug it for my life.

firstLine: Let unforeseen ruin come on him,
rest:
and his net that he hid, let it catch him.
Let him fall into it in ruin.

firstLine: Then my soul will rejoice in Yahweh;
rest: it will rejoice in his salvation.

firstLine: All of my bones shall say, “O Yahweh, who is like you,
rest:
who delivers the poor from one stronger than he
and the poor and needy from the one who robs him?”

firstLine: Violent witnesses rise up;
rest: they ask me concerning what I do not know.

firstLine: But at my stumbling they rejoiced and gathered together;
rest:
smiters whom I did not know gathered against me.
They tore and did not cease.

firstLine: Among the ungodly of the mockers at feasts,
rest: they gnashed at me with their teeth.

firstLine: I will give thanks to you in the great assembly;
rest: among the mighty people I will praise you.

firstLine: For they do not speak peace,
rest:
but against the quiet ones of the land
they plan deceitful words.

firstLine: Wake up and rouse yourself for my right,
rest: for my cause, O my God and my Lord.

firstLine: Vindicate me according to your righteousness,
rest:
O Yahweh my God,
and do not let them rejoice over me.

firstLine: Let them be shamed and abashed altogether,
rest:
who rejoice at my misfortune.
Let them put on shame and insult,
who magnify themselves against me.

firstLine: Let them shout for joy and be glad,
Then my tongue will proclaim your righteousness,
rest: and your praise all day.

firstLine: Human Wickedness and God’s Love
rest:
For the music director. Of David, the servant of Yahweh.
An oracle: the wicked has rebellion
in the midst of his heart.
There is no fear of God before his eyes.

firstLine: For he flatters himself in his eyes,
rest: hating to detect his iniquity.

firstLine: O Yahweh, your loyal love extends into the heavens,
rest: your faithfulness unto the clouds.

firstLine: Your righteousness is like the mighty mountains,
rest:
your judgments like the great deep.
You save man and beast, O Yahweh.

firstLine: How precious is your loyal love, O God,
rest:
and the children of humankind
take refuge in the shadow of your wings.

firstLine: They are refreshed with the fullness of your house,
rest: and you give them drink from the river of your delights.

firstLine: For with you is the fountain of life;
rest: in your light we see light.

firstLine: Prolong your loyal love to those who know you,
rest: and your righteousness to the upright of heart.

firstLine: Do not let a foot of pride come against me,
rest: nor let a wicked hand make me to wander homeless.

firstLine: There doers of evil have fallen;
rest: they are thrust down and not able to rise.

firstLine: The Protection of the Righteous and the Destruction of the Wicked
For like the grass they will dry up quickly,
rest: and like green vegetation they will wither.

firstLine: Take pleasure in Yahweh as well,
rest: and he will give to you the requests of your heart.

firstLine: Commit to Yahweh your way;
rest: Trust also on him and he will act.

firstLine: Then he will bring forth your righteousness like the light,
rest: and your justice like the noonday.

firstLine: For evildoers will be cut off,
rest:
but those who wait for Yahweh—
they will possess the land.

firstLine: And yet a little while and the wicked will not be,
rest: and you will look carefully upon his place, but he will not be.

firstLine: But the afflicted will possess the land,
rest: and they will take pleasure in an abundance of peace.

firstLine: The wicked plans evil against the righteous,
rest: and gnashes at him with his teeth.

firstLine: The Lord laughs at him,
rest: for he sees that his day is coming.

firstLine: The wicked have drawn the sword and have bent their bow
rest:
to throw down the poor and the needy,
to kill those upright in their way.

firstLine: Their sword will enter into their own heart,
rest: and their bows shall be broken.

firstLine: The little belonging to the righteous is better
rest: than the wealth of many wicked.

firstLine: For the arms of the wicked shall be broken,
rest: but Yahweh supports the righteous.

firstLine: Yahweh knows the days of the blameless,
rest: and their inheritance will be forever.

firstLine: They will not be put to shame in distressing times,
rest: and in the days of famine they will be satisfied.

firstLine: But the wicked will perish,
rest:
and the enemies of Yahweh will be like the splendor of the pastures.
They vanish; in smoke they vanish.

firstLine: The wicked borrows and does not repay,
rest: but the righteous is gracious and gives.

firstLine: For those blessed by him shall possess the land,
rest: but those cursed by him shall be cut off.

firstLine: The steps of a man are established by Yahweh,
rest: and he takes pleasure in his way.

firstLine: Though he fall, he will not be cast headlong,
rest: for Yahweh supports him with his hand.

firstLine: I was a youth, but I am now old;
rest:
yet I have not seen the righteous forsaken
or his children begging for bread.

firstLine: All the day he is gracious and lends,
rest: and his children are a blessing.

firstLine: Turn aside from evil and do good
rest: and so abide forever.

firstLine: For Yahweh loves justice
rest:
and will not forsake his faithful ones.
They are protected forever.
But the children of the wicked will be cut off.

firstLine: The righteous will possess the land
rest: and abide in it forever.

firstLine: The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom,
rest: and his tongue speaks justice.

firstLine: The wicked watches for the righteous
rest: and seeks to kill him.

firstLine: Yahweh will not abandon him into his hand,
rest: and he will not let him be condemned when he is judged.

firstLine: Wait for Yahweh and keep his way,
rest:
and he will exalt you to possess the land.
When the wicked are cut off, you will see it.

firstLine: I have seen the wicked acting violently
rest:
and spreading himself out
like a luxuriant native tree.

firstLine: Observe the blameless and look at the upright,
rest: for there is a future for a man of peace.

firstLine: And the salvation of the righteous is from Yahweh,
rest: their refuge in the time of trouble.

firstLine: A Prayer of Repentance
rest:
A psalm of David. To bring to remembrance.
O Yahweh, do not rebuke me in your anger
or chastise me in your wrath.

firstLine: For your arrows have sunk into me,
rest: and your hand has pressed down on me.

firstLine: For my iniquities have passed over my head;
rest: like a heavy burden they are too heavy for me.

firstLine: My wounds start to stink; they rot
rest: because of my foolishness.

firstLine: For my loins are full of burning,
rest: and there is no soundness in my flesh.

firstLine: I am faint and crushed greatly;
rest: I groan because of the roaring of my heart.

firstLine: O Lord, all my longing is before you,
rest: and my sighing is not hidden from you.

firstLine: My heart throbs violently, my strength leaves me;
rest: and the light of my eyes, that also is not with me.

firstLine: My friends and companions stand aloof from my affliction,
rest: and my relatives stand afar off.

firstLine: Those who seek my life lay snares as well,
rest:
and those intent on my harm speak threats.
They also plot deceit all day.

firstLine: But as for me, like the deaf I cannot hear,
rest: and I am like the mute who cannot open his mouth.

firstLine: And so I am like a man who hears not,
rest: and in whose mouth there are no retorts.

firstLine: For I said, “Help, lest they rejoice over me,
rest: lest they boast against me when my foot slips.”

firstLine: For I am ready to stumble,
rest: and my pain is before me continually.

firstLine: For my iniquity I confess;
rest: I am anxious because of my sin.

firstLine: And my enemies without cause are numerous,
rest: and those who hate me wrongfully are many.

firstLine: And those who repay evil in return for good
rest: accuse me in return for my pursuing good.

firstLine: Hurry to help me,
rest: O Lord, my salvation.

firstLine: The Brevity of Human Life
rest:
For the music director. For Jeduthun. A psalm of David.
I said, “I will guard my ways
that I may not sin with my tongue.
I will keep a muzzle over my mouth
as long as the wicked are before me.”

firstLine: My heart grew hot inside me;
rest:
in my sighing a fire burned.
Then I spoke with my tongue,

firstLine: “Let me know, O Yahweh, my end,
rest:
and what is the measure of my days.
Let me know how transient I am.”

firstLine: Look, you have made my days mere handbreadths,
rest:
and my lifespan as nothing next to you.
Surely every person standing firm is complete vanity. Selah

firstLine: Surely a man walks about as a mere shadow;
rest:
surely in vain they bustle about.
He heaps up possessions but does not know who will gather them in.

firstLine: From all my transgressions deliver me;
rest: do not make me the taunt of the fool.

firstLine: When with rebukes you chastise a man for sin,
rest:
you consume like a moth his delightful things.
Surely everyone is a mere vapor. Selah

firstLine: Hear my prayer, O Yahweh, and listen to my cry for help;
rest:
do not be deaf to my tears.
For I am an alien with you,
a sojourner like all my ancestors.

firstLine: Look away from me that I may be cheerful,
rest: before I depart and I am no more.

firstLine: God’s Faithfulness and Deliverance
rest:
For the music director. Of David. A psalm.
I waited patiently for Yahweh,
And he inclined to me
and heard my cry for help.

firstLine: And so he brought me up from the roaring pit,
Then he put a new song in my mouth,
rest:
a praise to our God.
Many will see and fear,
and will trust Yahweh.

firstLine: Blessed is the man who makes Yahweh his trust
rest: and does not turn to the proud and to those who fall away to a lie.

firstLine: Many things, O Yahweh my God, you have done—
rest:
your wonderful deeds and your thoughts toward us.
There is none to compare with you.
If I tried to proclaim and tell of them,
they would be too numerous to count.

firstLine: ‘I delight to do your will, O my God,
rest: and your law is deep within me.’”

firstLine: Let them be shamed and abashed altogether
rest:
who seek to take away my life.
Let them be repulsed and humiliated
who desire my harm.

firstLine: Let them be appalled because of their shame,
rest: those who say to me, “Aha! Aha!”

firstLine: Let them rejoice and be glad in you,
rest:
all those who seek you.
Let them say continually, “Yahweh is great!”
—those who love your salvation.

firstLine: Thanksgiving for God’s Provision in Time of Sickness
Yahweh protects him and keeps him alive;
rest:
he is blessed in the land,
and you do not give him
into the will of his enemies.

firstLine: My enemies speak evil about me,
rest: “When will he die and his name perish?”

firstLine: And when one comes to see me, he speaks falsely;
rest:
his heart gathers disaster for itself.
He goes out to the street; he speaks.

firstLine: “A ruinous thing is poured out on him,
rest: and now that he lies down, he will not rise up again.”

firstLine: Even my close friend, whom I trusted,
rest:
who ate my bread,
has lifted his heel against me.

firstLine: But you, O Yahweh, be gracious to me and raise me up
rest: that I may repay them.

firstLine: By this I know that you delight in me:
rest: because my enemy has not shouted in triumph over me.

firstLine: As for me, you have upheld me in my integrity,
rest: and you have set me in your presence forever.

firstLine: Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Israel,
rest:
from everlasting to everlasting.
Amen and Amen.

firstLine: Hope in God in the Midst of Despair
rest:
For the music director. A maskil of the sons of Korah.
As a deer longs for streams of water,
so my soul longs for you, O God.

firstLine: My tears have been my food day and night,
rest:
while they say to me all day long,
“Where is your God?”

firstLine: These I remember and I pour out my soul within me:
rest:
that I would go with the multitude;
I led them in procession to the house of God,
