with a voice of rejoicing and thanksgiving,
a crowd celebrating a festival.

firstLine: Why are you in despair, O my soul,
rest:
and disturbed within me?
Hope in God, because I will again praise him,
for the salvation of his presence.

firstLine: O my God, within me my soul is in despair;
rest:
therefore I remember you from the land of Jordan
and the heights of Hermon, from the mountain of Mizar.

firstLine: Deep is calling to deep
rest:
at the thunder of your waterfalls.
All your breakers and your waves
have passed over me.

firstLine: By day Yahweh commands his loyal love,
rest:
and in the night his song is with me,
a prayer to the God of my life.

firstLine: I say to God, my rock,
rest:
“Why have you forgotten me?
Why must I walk about mourning
because of the oppression of the enemy?”

firstLine: As with a shattering in my bones
A Prayer for Rescue
rest:
Judge me, O God, and plead my case
against an unfaithful nation.
From a man of deceit and wickedness rescue me,

firstLine: Send your light and your truth;
rest:
they shall lead me.
They shall bring me to your holy mountain
and to your dwelling places.

firstLine: Then I will go to the altar of God,
rest:
to God, my surpassing joy,
and I will praise you with lyre,
O God, my God.

firstLine: Present Defeat and Past Deliverance
rest:
For the music director. Of the sons of Korah. A maskil.
O God, we have heard with our ears;
our ancestors have told us
of work you worked in their days,
in days of old.

firstLine: You with your hand drove out the nations,
rest:
but them you planted.
You harmed the peoples,
but them you let spread out.

firstLine: For not with their sword
rest:
did they possess the land,
and their arm did not give them victory.
Rather it was your right hand and your arm
and the light of your presence,
because you delighted in them.

firstLine: By you we push down our enemies;
rest: by your name we tread down those who rise up against us.

firstLine: For I do not trust my bow,
rest: and my sword cannot give me victory.

firstLine: Rather you have saved us from our enemies,
rest: and have humiliated those who hate us.

firstLine: In God we boast all the day,
rest: and we will give thanks to your name forever. Selah

firstLine: Surely you have rejected and disgraced us,
rest: and have not gone out with our armies.

firstLine: You have caused us to pull back from the enemy,
rest: and so those who hate us have plundered for themselves.

firstLine: You have given us as sheep for food,
rest: and among the nations you have scattered us.

firstLine: You have sold your people cheaply,
rest: and did not profit by their price.

firstLine: You have made us a taunt to our neighbors,
rest: a derision and a scorn to those around us.

firstLine: You have made us a byword among the nations,
rest: a shaking of the head among the peoples.

firstLine: All day long my disgrace is before me,
rest: and the shame of my face covers me,

firstLine: because of the voice of the taunter and the reviler,
rest: because of the enemy and the avenger.

firstLine: All this has befallen us, though we have not forgotten you,
rest: and we have not been false to your covenant.

firstLine: Our heart has not turned back,
rest: and our steps have not turned aside from your way.

firstLine: But you have crushed us in a place of jackals,
rest: and have covered us with deep shadow.

firstLine: If we had forgotten the name of our God,
rest: or had spread out our hands in prayer to a foreign god,

firstLine: would not God discover this,
rest: for he knows the secrets of the heart?

firstLine: Rather, on account of you we are killed all day long;
rest: we are accounted as sheep for slaughter.

firstLine: Celebration of a Royal Wedding
rest:
For the music director; according to The Lilies. Of the sons of Korah.
A maskil. A song of love.
My heart is moved with a good word;
I recite my compositions to the king.
My tongue is the pen of a skilled scribe.

firstLine: You are the most handsome of the sons of humankind;
rest:
grace is poured out on your lips;
therefore God has blessed you forever.

firstLine: Gird your sword on your thigh, O mighty one,
rest: in your splendor and your majesty.

firstLine: And in your majesty ride victoriously,
rest:
because of truth and humility and righteousness.
And let your right hand teach you awesome deeds.

firstLine: Your arrows are sharp;
rest:
peoples fall under you
in the midst of the king’s enemies.

firstLine: Hear, O daughter, and discern and incline your ear,
rest: and forget your people and your father’s house.

firstLine: The king’s daughter is all glorious within;
rest: her garment is of gold embroidered cloth.

firstLine: I will cause your name to be remembered in all generations;
rest: therefore peoples will praise you forever and ever.

firstLine: God Provides for and Protects His People
rest:
For the music director. Of the sons of Korah.
According to Alamoth. A song.
God is our refuge and strength,
a very sufficient help in troubles.

firstLine: Therefore we will not fear though the earth change,
rest: and though the mountains totter into the midst of the sea,

firstLine: though its waters roar and foam,
rest: though mountains shake with its surging water. Selah

firstLine: There is a river whose streams gladden the city of God,
rest: the holiest of the dwellings of the Most High.

firstLine: God is in the midst of her;
rest:
she will not be made to totter.
God will help her at daybreak.

firstLine: Nations roar, kingdoms shake;
rest: he utters his voice, the earth melts.

firstLine: Yahweh of hosts is with us;
rest: our high stronghold is the God of Jacob. Selah

firstLine: Come, see the works of Yahweh,
rest: who has placed desolations on the earth.

firstLine: He makes wars cease to the ends of the earth;
rest:
he breaks the bow and cuts off the spear.
The wagons of war he burns with fire.

firstLine: Yahweh of Hosts is with us;
rest: the God of Jacob is our high stronghold.

firstLine: God Is King over All the Earth
rest:
For the music director. Of the sons of Korah. A psalm.
All you peoples, clap your hands.
Shout to God with a voice of rejoicing.

firstLine: For Yahweh Most High is awesome,
rest: a great king over all the earth.

firstLine: He subdues peoples under us
rest: and nations under our feet.

firstLine: He chooses for us our inheritance,
rest: the pride of Jacob whom he loves.

firstLine: God has gone up with a shout,
rest: Yahweh with the sound of a trumpet.

firstLine: God reigns over nations;
rest: God sits on his holy throne.

firstLine: The princes of the peoples are gathered together
rest:
with the people of Abraham’s God.
For the shields of the earth belong to God.
He is very exalted.

firstLine: The Greatness of God in Zion
rest:
A song. A psalm of the sons of Korah.
Yahweh is great and very worthy of praise
in the city of our God, in his holy mountain.

firstLine: Beautiful in elevation, the joy of the whole earth,
rest:
is Mount Zion, in the far north,
the city of the great king.

firstLine: God is in her citadels;
rest: he is known as a high stronghold.

firstLine: For see, the kings assembled;
rest: they advanced together.

firstLine: Trembling seized them there—
rest: pain as of a woman in labor.

firstLine: With an east wind
rest: you shatter the ships of Tarshish.

firstLine: As we have heard, so we have seen
rest:
in the city of Yahweh of hosts, in the city of our God.
God will establish her forever. Selah

firstLine: We have pondered your loyal love, O God,
rest: in the midst of your temple.

firstLine: As is your name, O God, so is your praise
rest:
to the ends of the earth.
Your right hand is full of righteousness.

firstLine: Let Mount Zion rejoice;
rest:
let the daughters of Judah rejoice
because of your judgments.

firstLine: Walk about Zion and circle it;
rest: count her towers.

firstLine: Wealth and the Fate of the Wicked
both low and high,
rest: rich and poor together.

firstLine: My mouth will speak wisdom,
rest: and the meditation of my heart will be understanding.

firstLine: I will incline my ear to a proverb;
rest: I will propound my riddle on a lyre.

firstLine: Why should I fear in times of calamity,
rest: when iniquity surrounds me at my heels,

firstLine: those who trust their wealth
rest: and boast about the abundance of their riches?

firstLine: (since the redemption price for their life is costly
rest: and it always fails),

firstLine: so that he may stay alive forever
rest: and not see the pit.

firstLine: For he sees that the wise die,
rest:
together with the fool and brute they perish,
and leave their wealth to the next generation.

firstLine: Within them they think their houses are forever,
rest:
their dwelling places from generation to generation.
They name their lands by their own names.

firstLine: This is the journey of those who have foolish confidence,
rest: and those after them who accept their sayings. Selah

firstLine: Like sheep they are destined to Sheol;
rest:
death will shepherd them.
But the upright will rule over them in the morning,
and their forms will be for Sheol to consume,
far from his lofty abode.

firstLine: Surely God will ransom my life
rest:
from the power of Sheol,
because he will receive me. Selah

firstLine: Do not fear when a man becomes rich,
rest: when the wealth of his house increases,

firstLine: Though he congratulated his soul while he was living
rest: —and people will praise you when you do well for yourself—

firstLine: Humankind in its pomp, but does not understand,
rest: is like the beasts that perish.

firstLine: An Oracle Concerning Sacrifices
rest:
A psalm of Asaph.
The Supreme God, God, Yahweh, has spoken
and summoned the earth,
from the rising of the sun
to its setting.

firstLine: From Zion, the perfection of beauty,
rest: God shines forth.

firstLine: He summons the heavens above
rest: and the earth that he might judge his people:

firstLine: “Gather to me my loyal ones,
rest: those who have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.”

firstLine: And the heavens declare his righteousness,
rest: because God himself is judge. Selah

firstLine: “Hear, O my people, and I will speak,
rest:
O Israel, and I will testify against you.
I am God, your God.

firstLine: It is not concerning a lack of your sacrifices that I rebuke you,
rest: and your burnt offerings are before me continually.

firstLine: I will not take from your house a bull
rest: or from your stalls a he-goat,

firstLine: because every animal of the forest is mine,
rest: the cattle on a thousand hills.

firstLine: I know every bird of the mountains,
rest: and every moving creature in the field is mine.

firstLine: If I were hungry I would not tell you,
rest: because the world and its fullness are mine.

firstLine: Do I eat the flesh of bulls
rest: or drink the blood of goats?

firstLine: Offer to God a thank offering
rest: and pay your vows to the Most High.

firstLine: And call me in the day of trouble;
rest: I will deliver you, and you will glorify me.”

firstLine: But to the wicked God says,
rest:
“What right have you to recite my statutes
and mention my covenant with your mouth,

firstLine: while you yourself hate discipline,
rest: and cast my words behind you?

firstLine: When you see a thief, then you are pleased with him,
rest: and your association is with adulterers.

firstLine: You give your mouth free rein for evil,
rest: and you harness your tongue to deceit.

firstLine: You sit and speak against your brother;
rest: you slander your mother’s son.

firstLine: These things you have done, and I have been silent;
rest:
You imagined that I was just like you.
I will rebuke you and present an argument before your eyes.

firstLine: Now consider this, you who forget God,
rest: lest I tear you apart, and there will be none to deliver.

firstLine: He who sacrifices a thank offering honors me,
rest:
and he who orders his way;
I will show him the salvation of God.”

firstLine: A Prayer of Repentance and Plea for Mercy
rest:
For the music director. A psalm of David.
When Nathan the prophet came to him, after he had gone in to Bathsheba.
Be gracious to me, O God, according to your loyal love.
According to your abundant mercies,
blot out my transgressions.

firstLine: Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity,
rest: and from my sin cleanse me.

firstLine: For I myself know my transgressions,
rest: and my sin is ever before me.

firstLine: Against you, only you, I have sinned
rest:
and have done this evil in your eyes,
so that you are correct when you speak,
you are blameless when you judge.

firstLine: Behold, in iniquity I was born,
rest: and in sin my mother conceived me.

firstLine: Behold, you delight in truth in the inward parts,
rest: and in the hidden parts you make me to know wisdom.

firstLine: Make me hear joy and gladness;
rest: let the bones you have crushed rejoice.

firstLine: Hide your face from my sins,
rest: and all my iniquities blot out.

firstLine: Create a clean heart for me, O God,
rest: and renew a steadfast spirit within me.

firstLine: Do not cast me away from your presence,
rest: and do not take your Holy Spirit from me.

firstLine: Restore to me the joy of your salvation,
rest: and with a willing spirit sustain me.

firstLine: Then I will teach transgressors your ways,
rest: and sinners will turn back to you.

firstLine: Deliver me from the guilt of bloodshed, O God,
rest:
the God of my salvation;
then my tongue will sing aloud of your righteousness.

firstLine: O Lord, open my lips,
rest: and my mouth will proclaim your praise.

firstLine: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit;
rest:
A broken and contrite heart,
O God, you will not despise.

firstLine: Then you will delight in righteous sacrifices,
rest:
burnt offering and whole burnt offering.
Then bulls will be offered on your altar.

firstLine: God’s Judgment on the Wicked and Love for the Faithful
rest:
For the music director. A maskil of David.
When Doeg the Edomite came and informed Saul.
And he said to him, “David has come to the house of Ahimelech.”
Why do you boast about evil, O mighty man?
The loyal love of God endures continually.

firstLine: Your tongue plans destruction,
rest: like a sharp razor, working deceit.

firstLine: You love evil more than good,
rest: a lie more than speaking what is right. Selah

firstLine: You love all devouring words,
rest: O deceitful tongue,

firstLine: And the righteous will see and fear,
rest: and will laugh at him, saying,

firstLine: “Look, the man who would not make God his refuge,
rest:
but he trusted in the greatness of his wealth;
he took refuge in his destructiveness.”

firstLine: But I am like an olive tree flourishing
rest:
in the house of God.
I trust the loyal love of God forever and ever.

firstLine: I will give thanks to you forever, because of what you have done,
rest:
and I will wait on your name, because it is good,
in the presence of your faithful ones.

firstLine: The Folly of the Godless and Salvation for Israel
rest:
For the music director, according to Mahalath.
A maskil of David.
The fool says in his heart, “There is no God.”
They are corrupt and they have done abominable iniquity.
There is none who does good.

firstLine: God looks down from heaven upon the children of humankind
rest:
to see whether there is one who has insight,
one who seeks God.

firstLine: Do not evildoers know,
rest:
they who eat my people as though they were eating bread?
They do not call on God.

firstLine: There they are very fearful
rest:
where no fear had been,
because God has scattered the bones of him who encamps against you.
You have put them to shame, because God has rejected them.

firstLine: Answered Prayer for Deliverance from Adversaries
rest:
For the music director, with stringed instruments.
A maskil of David,
when the Ziphites went and said to Saul,
“Is not David hiding himself among us?”
O God, by your name save me,
and by your power vindicate me.

firstLine: O God, hear my prayer;
rest: heed the words of my mouth.

firstLine: For foreigners have risen against me,
rest:
and ruthless men seek my life.
They have not set God before them. Selah

firstLine: See, God is my helper;
rest: The Lord is with those who sustain my life.

firstLine: He will repay my enemies for their evil;
rest: in your faithfulness destroy them.

firstLine: I will freely sacrifice to you;
rest:
I will give thanks to your name,
O Yahweh, because it is good.

firstLine: Because he has delivered me from all trouble,
rest: and my eye has looked with satisfaction on my enemies.

firstLine: Betrayal of a Friend and Trust in God
rest:
For the music director, with stringed instruments.
A maskil of David.
Give ear, O God, to my prayer,
and do not hide yourself from my plea.

firstLine: because of the voice of an enemy,
rest:
because of the oppression of the wicked,
because they bring down evil on me,
and in anger they hold a grudge against me.

firstLine: My heart trembles within me,
rest: and deathly terrors fall on me.

firstLine: Fear and trembling come on me,
rest: and horror overwhelms me.

firstLine: I would hurry to my refuge
rest: from the raging wind and storm.”

firstLine: Confuse, O Lord; divide their speech,
rest: because I see violence and strife in the city.

firstLine: Day and night they go around it on its walls,
rest: and iniquity and trouble are in its midst.

firstLine: Destruction is within it,
rest:
and oppression and deceit
do not depart from its public square.

firstLine: For it is not an enemy that taunts me,
rest:
or I could bear it.
It is not one who hates me that magnifies himself over me,
or I could hide myself from him.

firstLine: But it is you, a man my equal,
rest: my friend and confidant.

firstLine: We who would take sweet counsel together;
rest:
in the house of God
we would walk with the throng.

firstLine: As for me, I will call to God,
rest: and Yahweh will save me.

firstLine: Morning, noon and night I will lament and groan loudly,
rest: and he will hear my voice.

firstLine: He safely redeems my life from the battle against me,
rest: because those standing against me are among many.

firstLine: God will hear and answer them,
rest:
he who is enthroned from of old, Selah
Because they do not change,
and they do not fear God.

firstLine: He has put forth his hands against his friends;
rest: he has defiled his covenant.

firstLine: The buttery words of his mouth were smooth,
rest:
but there was battle in his heart.
His words were smoother than oil,
but they were drawn swords.

firstLine: Cast your burden on Yahweh,
rest:
and he will sustain you.
He will never allow the righteous to be moved.

firstLine: Prayer for Deliverance and Confidence in God
rest:
For the music director, according to The Silent Dove of Distant Lands.
Of David. A miktam.
When the Philistines seized him in Gath.
Be gracious to me, O God, because humankind has trampled me;
fighting all the day he oppresses me.

firstLine: My enemies trample all day,
rest: because many are attacking me proudly.

firstLine: God, whose word I praise,
rest:
God I trust; I do not fear.
What can mere flesh do to me?

firstLine: All day they twist my words;
rest: all their thoughts are against me for evil.

firstLine: They attack, they hide, they watch my steps,
rest: as they lie in wait for my life.

firstLine: God, whose word I praise,
rest: Yahweh, whose word I praise,

firstLine: Prayer for Rescue from Enemies
rest:
For the music director, according to Do Not Destroy.
Of David. A miktam.
When he fled from Saul into the cave.
Be gracious to me, O God, be gracious to me,
because in you my soul takes refuge.
In the shadow of your wings I will take refuge
until destruction passes by.

firstLine: I will call to God Most High,
rest: to God who accomplishes things concerning me.

firstLine: He will send from heaven and save me;
rest:
he will reproach the one who tramples me. Selah
God will send his loyal love and his faithfulness.

firstLine: They have set a net for my steps;
My heart is steadfast, O God;
rest:
My heart is steadfast.
I will sing and give praise.

firstLine: Awake, my glory;
rest:
Awake, harp and lyre.
I will awake the dawn.

firstLine: I will give you thanks among the peoples, O Lord;
rest: I will give you praise among the nations.

firstLine: Because your loyal love is high to the heavens,
rest: and your faithfulness to the clouds.

firstLine: Judgment on the Wicked
rest:
For the music director, according to Do not Destroy.
Of David. A miktam.
Do you really speak what is right when silent?
Do you judge fairly the children of humankind?

firstLine: No, in your heart you plan injustices;
rest: in the land you weigh out the violence of your hands.

firstLine: Their venom is like snake venom;
rest: They are like a deaf viper that closes its ear

firstLine: so that it does not hear the voice of charmers
rest: or the skilled caster of spells.

firstLine: Let them be like a snail that melts away as it goes;
rest: like the stillborn of woman that do not see the sun.

firstLine: Before your pots can feel the heat of a thornbush,
rest: whether green or dry, he will sweep it away.

firstLine: The righteous will rejoice when he sees the vengeance;
rest: he will wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.

firstLine: A Prayer for Protection
rest:
For the music director, according to Do Not Destroy.
Of David. A miktam.
When Saul dispatched men and they watched the house to kill him.
Deliver me from my enemies, O my God.
Protect me from those who rise up against me.

firstLine: Deliver me from workers of iniquity,
rest: and from men of bloodshed save me.

firstLine: They return at evening; they howl like dogs
rest: while they prowl the city.

firstLine: But you, O Yahweh, will laugh at them;
rest: you will mock all the nations.

firstLine: O my strength, I will watch for you,
rest: because you, O God, are my (high) stronghold.

firstLine: My God of loyal love will meet me;
rest: God will cause me to look in triumph on my enemies.

firstLine: By the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips,
rest:
even in their pride, let them be trapped,
and for the curses and lies they proclaim.

firstLine: Destroy in anger; destroy so they are no more,
rest:
so that they may know that God is ruling in Jacob
to the ends of the earth. Selah

firstLine: They return at evening; they howl like dogs
rest: while they prowl the city.

firstLine: But as for me, I will sing of your strength,
rest:
and I will hail your loyal love in the morning,
because you have been my high stronghold
and a refuge in my time of trouble.

firstLine: O my strength, to you I will give praise,
rest:
because God is my high stronghold,
my God of loyal love.

firstLine: A Lament After a Defeat and a Prayer for Restoration
rest:
For the music director, according to Shushan Eduth.
A miktam of David. To teach.
When he fought Mesopotamia and Aram Zobah, and Joab returned and struck Edom in the Valley of Salt, twelve thousand persons.
O God, you have rejected us. You have broken us.
You have been angry. Restore us!

firstLine: You have shown your people hard things;
rest: You have given us wine that staggers.

firstLine: You have rallied those who fear you round a banner
rest: out of bowshot, Selah

firstLine: God has spoken in his holiness,
Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine,
rest:
and Ephraim is the helmet for my head;
Judah is my scepter.

firstLine: Moab is my washing pot;
rest:
over Edom, I will cast my sandal.
On account of me, O Philistia, raise a shout.”

firstLine: Have not you yourself rejected us, O God,
rest: and not gone out with our armies, O God?

firstLine: Give us help against the adversary,
rest: for the help of humankind is futile.

firstLine: Through God we will do valiantly,
rest: and it is he who will tread down our enemies.

firstLine: Confidence in God’s Protection
From the end of the earth I call to you
rest:
when my heart grows faint.
You will lead me to a rock that is higher than I.

firstLine: For you have been my refuge,
rest: a strong tower from the enemy.

firstLine: You will add days to the days of the king,
rest: his years like those of many generations.

firstLine: So I will sing the praise of your name forever,
rest: that I may fulfill my vows daily.

firstLine: Confidence in God’s Salvation
rest:
For the music director, on Jeduthun.
A psalm of David.
Only for God my soul waits in silence.
From him is my salvation.

firstLine: Only he is my rock and my salvation,
rest: my high stronghold; I shall not be greatly shaken.

firstLine: They only plan to thrust him down from his high position;
rest:
they are pleased with deception.
With their mouths they bless,
but inwardly they curse. Selah

firstLine: Only for God wait in silence, O my soul,
rest: because my hope is from him.

firstLine: Only he is my rock and my salvation,
rest: my high stronghold; I shall not be shaken.

firstLine: On God rests my salvation and my glory;
rest: God is my strong rock, my refuge.

firstLine: Trust him at all times, O people;
rest:
pour out before him your heart.
God is a refuge for us. Selah

firstLine: Only a vapor are men of low degree,
rest:
a deception are men of high degree.
Weighed in a balance,
together they are lighter than a vapor.

firstLine: Do not trust in extortion,
rest:
and do not put vain confidence in robbery.
If wealth increases,
do not set your heart on it.

firstLine: Once God has spoken;
rest:
twice I have heard this:
that strength belongs to God.

firstLine: And to you belongs loyal love, O Lord,
rest: because you will render to each according to his work.

firstLine: Longing for God
rest:
A psalm of David, when he was in the wilderness of Judah.
O God, you are my God;
I will seek you diligently.
My soul thirsts for you; my flesh longs for you
as in a dry and weary land without water.

firstLine: Thus I have seen you in the sanctuary,
rest: beholding your strength and glory.

firstLine: Because your loyal love is better than life,
rest: my lips will praise you.

firstLine: My soul will be satisfied as with the best and richest food,
rest: and with joyful lips my mouth will praise.

firstLine: When I remember you on my bed,
rest: I meditate on you in the night watches.

firstLine: Because you have been my help,
rest: therefore in the shadow of your wings I will sing for joy.

firstLine: My soul clings to you;
rest: your right hand upholds me.

firstLine: But as for them who seek my life for ruin,
rest: they will go into the depths of the earth.

firstLine: They who would deliver him to the sword
rest: will become a portion for jackals.

firstLine: A Plea for Divine Retribution
rest:
For the music director. A psalm of David.
Hear my voice, O God, in my lamenting.
Preserve my life from the fear of the enemy.

firstLine: Hide me from the secret plots of evildoers,
rest: from the unrest of those who do iniquity,

firstLine: They carefully plot injustices saying,
rest:
“We have perfected the perfect plot!”
Both the inner thought and heart of a man are deep.

firstLine: But God will shoot them;
rest: with an arrow they will suddenly be wounded.

firstLine: And they who would cause him to stumble,
rest:
their own tongue will be against them.
All who gaze on them will shake.

firstLine: And then all men will fear,
rest:
and will declare the working of God,
and will understand his doing.

firstLine: The righteous will rejoice in Yahweh and take refuge in him,
rest: and all the upright in heart will boast.

firstLine: Thanksgiving for God’s Provision
rest:
For the music director. A psalm of David. A song.
Praise awaits you, O God, in Zion,
and to you the vow shall be fulfilled.

firstLine: O you who hear prayer,
rest: to you all flesh will come.

firstLine: Blessed is one whom you choose and bring near,
rest:
that he may abide in your courts.
We will be satisfied with the goodness of your house,
your holy temple.

firstLine: By awesome deeds in righteousness you will answer us,
rest:
O God of our salvation,
you who are the confidence of all the ends of the earth
and of the far-off seas,

firstLine: who established the mountains by his strength,
rest: the one who is girded with might,

firstLine: who stills the roar of the seas,
rest:
the roar of their waves,
and the commotion of the peoples,

firstLine: You care for the land and water it;
rest:
you greatly enrich it.
The stream of God is filled with waters.
You provide their grain,
for so you have established it.

firstLine: You drench its furrows,
You crown the year with your bounty,
rest: and your wagon paths drip with richness.

firstLine: They drop on the pastures of the wilderness,
rest: and the hills gird themselves with joy.

firstLine: The pasturelands put on flocks,
Thanksgiving to God for His Works
rest:
For the music director. A song. A psalm.
Shout joyfully to God, all the earth.

firstLine: All the earth will bow in worship to you,
rest:
and sing praise to you.
They will sing the praise of your name.” Selah

firstLine: Come and consider the works of God;
rest: he is awesome in his dealings with the children of humankind.

firstLine: He turned the sea into dry ground;
rest:
they passed through the river on foot.
There we rejoiced in him.

firstLine: He rules by his might forever;
rest:
his eyes keep watch on the nations.
Do not let the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah

firstLine: Bless our God, O peoples,
rest: and cause the sound of his praise to be heard,

firstLine: the one who has kept our soul among the living,
rest: and has not allowed our foot to slip.

firstLine: For you have tested us, O God;
rest: you have tried us as silver is tried.

firstLine: You brought us into the net;
rest: you placed a heavy burden on our backs.

firstLine: that my lips uttered,
rest: and my mouth spoke in my distress.

firstLine: Burnt offerings of fat animals I will offer to you,
rest:
with the smoke of rams.
I will do cattle with rams. Selah

firstLine: Come and hear, all you God-fearers, and I will tell
rest: what he has done for me.

firstLine: I called to him with my mouth,
rest: and he was extolled with my tongue.

firstLine: If I had considered evil in my heart,
rest: the Lord would not have listened.

firstLine: However, God has listened;
rest: he has attended to the sound of my prayer.

firstLine: Blessed be God,
rest:
who has not turned aside my prayer,
or his loyal love from me.

firstLine: A Prayer of Blessing
rest:
For the music director, with stringed instruments. A psalm. A song.
May God be gracious to us and bless us.
May he cause his face to shine toward us, Selah

firstLine: that your way may be known on the earth,
rest: your salvation among all nations.

firstLine: Let the peoples praise you, O God;
rest: let all of the peoples praise you.

firstLine: Let the nations be glad and sing for joy,
rest:
because you judge the peoples with equity
and guide the nations on the earth. Selah

firstLine: Let the peoples praise you, O God;
rest: let all the peoples praise you.

firstLine: God will bless us,
rest: and all the ends of the earth will fear him.

firstLine: Praise to God for Providing Victory
rest:
For the music director. Of David. A psalm. A song.
God will arise; his enemies will be scattered,
and those who hate him will flee from before him.

firstLine: But the righteous will be glad; they will exalt before God,
rest: and will rejoice with joy.

firstLine: A father to orphans and a judge for widows
rest: is God in his holy habitation.

firstLine: God settles the lonely in a home;
rest:
he brings prisoners out into prosperity.
But the rebellious abide in a barren land.

firstLine: O God, when you went out before your people,
rest: when you marched through the desert, Selah

firstLine: the earth shook; the heavens also dripped rain
rest:
at the presence of God who was at Sinai,
at the presence of God, the God of Israel.

firstLine: “The kings of armies flee, they flee,
rest: and she who remains at home divides the spoil.

firstLine: Though you men lie down between the sheepfolds,
rest:
you will be like the wings of a dove covered in silver
and its pinions in yellow gold.”

firstLine: When Shaddai scattered kings on it,
rest: on Zalmon it snowed.

firstLine: A mountain of God is the mountain of Bashan;
rest: a mountain of many peaks is the mountain of Bashan.

firstLine: The chariots of God
rest:
are twice ten thousand, with thousands doubled.
The Lord is among them at Sinai, distinctive in victory.

firstLine: Our God is a God of deliverances,
rest: and to the Yahweh the Lord belong escapes from death.

firstLine: But God will shatter the head of his enemies,
rest: the hairy scalp of the one who continues on in his guilt.

firstLine: The Lord said, “I will bring them back from Bashan;
rest: I will bring them back from the depths of the sea,

firstLine: so that your foot may shatter them bloody
rest: for the tongues of your dogs to have their share from the enemies.”

firstLine: They have seen your processions, O God,
rest: the processions of my God, my king, distinctive in victory.

firstLine: Singers went up front, those playing stringed instruments last,
rest: between them young women playing tambourines.

firstLine: Bless God in the assemblies,
rest: Yahweh from the fountain of Israel.

firstLine: There is little Benjamin ruling them,
rest:
with the princes of Judah in their throng,
the princes of Zebulun and the princes of Naphtali.

firstLine: Because your temple is above Jerusalem,
rest: kings will bring tribute to you.

firstLine: Rebuke the beasts in the reeds,
rest:
the herd of bulls with the calves of the peoples,
trampling the pieces of silver.
Scatter the nations who delight in battles.

firstLine: Ambassadors will come from Egypt;
rest: Cush will quickly stretch out her hands to God.

firstLine: O kingdoms of the earth, sing to God;
rest: sing praise to the Lord, Selah

firstLine: A Plea for Deliverance from Persecution
rest:
For the music director, according to The Lilies. Of David.
Save me, O God,
because waters have come up to my neck.

firstLine: More numerous than the hairs of my head
rest:
are those hating me without a cause.
Those who are destroying me—my enemies wrongfully— are mighty.
What I did not steal, I then must restore.

firstLine: O God, you yourself know my foolishness,
rest: and my guilty deeds are not hidden from you.

firstLine: Let those who wait for you not be put to shame because of me,
rest:
O Lord Yahweh of hosts.
Let those who seek you not be disgraced because of me,
O God of Israel.

firstLine: Because on account of you I have borne reproach;
rest: disgrace has covered my face.

firstLine: I have become a stranger to my brothers
rest: and a foreigner to my mother’s sons,

firstLine: because the zeal for your house has consumed me,
rest: and the reproaches of those reproaching you have fallen on me.

firstLine: When I wept in the fasting of my soul,
rest: it became reproaches for me.

firstLine: When I made sackcloth my clothing,
rest: I became for them a byword.

firstLine: Those sitting at the gate talk about me
rest: as also the songs of the drunkards.

firstLine: But as for me, my prayer is to you, O Yahweh, for a favorable time,
rest:
O God, according to the abundance of your loyal love.
Answer me with the faithfulness of your salvation.

firstLine: Do not let the torrent of waters flood over me,
rest:
or the deep swallow me,
or the pit close its mouth over me.

firstLine: Answer me, O Yahweh, because your loyal love is good;
rest: according to your abundant mercies, turn to me,

firstLine: They also gave me gall for food,
rest: and for my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.

firstLine: Let their table before them be a trap,
rest: and their times of peace a snare.

firstLine: Let their eyes be dark so they cannot see,
rest: and make their loins continually tremble.

firstLine: Pour out your indignation on them,
rest: and let your burning anger overtake them.

firstLine: because they persecute those whom you, yourself, have struck,
rest: and they tell of the pain of those you have wounded.

firstLine: Add guilt on top of their guilt,
rest: and do not let them be acquitted.

firstLine: Let them be blotted out of the book of the living,
rest: and let them not be recorded with the righteous.

firstLine: But as for me, though I am afflicted and pained,
rest: your salvation will protect me, O God.

firstLine: I will praise the name of God in song,
rest: and magnify him with thanksgiving.

firstLine: For Yahweh it will be better than an ox or bull,
rest: horned and hoofed.

firstLine: because Yahweh hears the needy
rest: and does not despise his own who are prisoners.

firstLine: Let heavens and earth praise him,
rest: the seas and all that moves in them,

firstLine: because God will save Zion
rest:
and build the cities of Judah,
that they may dwell there and possess it.

firstLine: And the offspring of his servants will inherit it,
rest: and those who love his name will abide in it.

firstLine: A Prayer for Deliverance from Enemies
rest:
For the music director. Of David. To bring to remembrance.
O God, make haste to deliver me.
O Yahweh, make haste to help me.

firstLine: Let them be ashamed and abashed
rest:
who seek my life.
Let them be repulsed and humiliated
who desire my harm.

firstLine: let them turn back because of their shame,
rest: those who say, “Aha! Aha!”

firstLine: Let them rejoice and be glad in you,
rest:
all those who seek you.
Let them say continually, “God is great!”
those who love your salvation.

firstLine: But I am poor and needy;
rest:
O God hasten to me.
You are my help and my deliverer.
O Yahweh, do not delay.

firstLine: A Prayer to God the Rock of Refuge
rest:
In you, O Yahweh, I have taken refuge;
let me never be put to shame.

firstLine: In your righteousness deliver me and rescue me;
rest: incline your ear to me and save me.

firstLine: Be for me a rock of refuge to resort to always;
rest:
you have ordained to save me,
because you are my rock and my fortress.

firstLine: My God, rescue me from the hand of the wicked,
rest: from the grasp of the evildoer and the oppressor,

firstLine: because you are my hope,
rest: O Lord Yahweh, my confidence from my youth.

firstLine: I have become a wonder to many,
rest: but you are my strong refuge.

firstLine: My mouth is filled with your praise,
rest: with your glory all the day.

firstLine: Do not cast me away in the time of old age;
rest: when my strength fails do not abandon me.

firstLine: For my enemies talk concerning me,
rest: and those who watch for my life conspire together,

firstLine: Let them be ashamed; let them perish
rest:
who are my adversaries.
Let them wrap themselves with scorn and disgrace
who seek my harm.

firstLine: But as for me, I will hope continually
rest: and increase your praise.

firstLine: My mouth will tell of your righteousness,
rest:
your salvation all day long,
though I do not know the full sum of them.

firstLine: O God, you have taught me from my youth,
rest: and up to now I have proclaimed your wonderful deeds.

firstLine: And even when I am old and gray,
rest:
O God, do not abandon me
until I proclaim your strength to this generation,
your power to every one that comes after.

firstLine: You who have caused me to see many troubles and evils,
rest:
you will again revive me.
And from the depths of the earth
you will again bring me up.

firstLine: You will increase my greatness,
rest: and you will comfort me all around.

firstLine: On my part, I will praise you with a stringed instrument,
rest:
and your faithfulness, O my God.
I will sing praises to you with a lyre,
O Holy One of Israel.

firstLine: My lips will sing for joy when I sing praises to you,
rest: and my soul, which you have redeemed.

firstLine: My tongue also
rest:
will speak of your righteousness all the day,
because they have been put to shame, because they have been humiliated
who seek my harm.

firstLine: A Prayer for the Prosperity of God’s Anointed King
rest:
Of Solomon.
O God, give your judgments to the king,
and your righteousness to the king’s son.

firstLine: May he judge your people with righteousness,
rest: and your poor with justice.

firstLine: Let the mountains yield prosperity for the people,
rest: and the hills in righteousness.

firstLine: May he provide justice for the poor of the people,
rest:
save the children of the needy,
and crush the oppressor.

firstLine: May he live long while the sun endures
rest: as long as the moon for all generations.

firstLine: May he descend like rain on mown grass,
rest: like showers watering the earth.

firstLine: May what is right blossom in his days
rest: and an abundance of peace, until the moon is no more.

firstLine: And may he rule from sea up to sea,
rest: and from the River to the edges of the land.

firstLine: Let the desert dwellers bow down before him,
rest: and his enemies lick the dust.

firstLine: Indeed he will deliver the needy who is crying for help,
rest: and the afflicted who has no helper.

firstLine: He will take pity on the helpless and needy,
rest: and the lives of the needy he will save.

firstLine: From oppression and from violence
rest:
he will redeem their lives,
and their blood will be precious in his eyes.

firstLine: So may he live, and may gold from Sheba be given to him,
rest:
and may prayers be offered for him continually.
May blessings be invoked for him all day long.

firstLine: May there be an abundance of grain in the land
rest:
even on the top of the mountains.
May his crop sway like the trees of Lebanon,
and may those from the city blossom like the grass of the earth.

firstLine: Blessed be Yahweh God, the God of Israel,
rest: who alone does wonderful things.

firstLine: And blessed be his glorious name forever,
rest:
and may the whole earth be filled with his glory.
Amen and Amen.

firstLine: The Wicked and the Righteous Contrasted
rest:
A song of Asaph.
Surely God is good to Israel,
to those pure of heart.

firstLine: because I envied the boastful
rest: when I saw the well-being of the wicked.

firstLine: For there are no pains up to their death,
rest: and their bodies are healthy.

firstLine: They do not have ordinary trouble,
rest: and they are not plagued as other people.

firstLine: Therefore pride is their necklace;
rest: an outfit of violence covers them.

firstLine: They mock and speak maliciously of oppression;
rest: they speak as though from on high.

firstLine: They set their mouth against the heavens,
rest: and their tongue roams the earth.

firstLine: Therefore his people turn there,
rest: and abundant waters are slurped up by them.

firstLine: See, these are the wicked,
rest: and they increase wealth, ever carefree.

firstLine: Surely in vain I have kept my heart pure,
rest: and washed my hands in innocence.

firstLine: And I have been plagued all day
rest: and rebuked every morning.

firstLine: If I had said, “I will speak thus,”
rest:
behold, I would have acted treacherously
against your children’s generation.

firstLine: When I thought about how to understand this,
rest: it was troubling in my eyes

firstLine: Like a dream upon awakening,
rest:
when you wake up, O Lord,
you will despise their fleeting form.

firstLine: When my heart was embittered
rest: and I felt stabbed in my kidneys,

firstLine: But I am continually with you;
rest: you have hold of my right hand.

firstLine: You will guide me with your advice,
rest: and afterward you will take me into honor.

firstLine: My flesh and heart failed,
rest: but God is the strength of my heart and my reward forever.

firstLine: A Lament in Time of National Defeat
rest:
A maskil of Asaph.
Why, O God, have you rejected us forever?
Why does your anger smoke
against the sheep of your pasture?

firstLine: Remember your congregation that you bought long ago,
rest:
when you redeemed the tribe of your inheritance.
Remember Mount Zion where you have dwelt.

firstLine: Lift your steps to the perpetual ruins,
rest: to all that the enemy has ruined in the sanctuary.

firstLine: Your enemies have roared in the midst of your meeting place;
rest: they have set up their signs for signs.

firstLine: They are known to be like those who wield
rest: axes in a thicket of trees.

firstLine: And now its carved works altogether
rest: they have smashed with axe and hammer.

firstLine: They have said in their heart,
rest:
“We will completely oppress them.”
They burned all the meeting places of God in the land.

firstLine: We do not see our signs,
rest:
and there is no longer a prophet.
No one with us knows how long.

firstLine: But God has been my king from long ago,
rest: working salvation in the midst of the earth.

firstLine: You split open the sea by your strength;
rest: You broke the heads of the sea monsters in the waters.

firstLine: You crushed the heads of Leviathan;
rest: you gave him as food to the desert dwelling creatures.

firstLine: You defined all the boundaries of the earth;
rest: Summer and winter—you formed them.

firstLine: O Yahweh, remember this: the enemy taunts,
rest: and foolish people treat your name with contempt.

firstLine: Do not give to beasts the life of your dove;
rest: do not ever forget the life of your afflicted ones.

firstLine: Have regard for the covenant,
rest:
because the dark places of the land are full of
the haunts of violence.

firstLine: Do not let the oppressed turn back humiliated;
rest: let the poor and needy praise your name.

firstLine: Rise up, O God, plead your cause;
rest: remember the reproaching of you by the foolish all day long.

firstLine: Do not forget the sound of your adversaries,
rest: the roar of those rising up against you ascending continually.

firstLine: Thanksgiving for God’s Future Help
rest:
For the music director, according to Do Not Destroy.
A psalm of Asaph. A song.
We give thanks to you, O God;
we give thanks, and your name is near.
Your wonderful deeds are told.

firstLine: “I will indeed set an appointed time;
rest: I will judge fairly.

firstLine: The earth and all its inhabitants are shaking;
rest: I steady its columns. Selah

firstLine: For it is not from the east or the west
rest: and not from the south that lifting up comes,

firstLine: rather God is the judge;
rest: one he brings low, and another he lifts up.

firstLine: For there is a cup in the hand of Yahweh
rest:
with wine that foams, fully mixed,
and he pours out from this.
Surely all the wicked of the land
will quaff it down to its dregs.

firstLine: But as for me, I will proclaim forever;
rest: I will sing praise to the God of Jacob.

firstLine: “And all the horns of the wicked I will cut off.
rest: The horns of the righteous will be lifted up.”

firstLine: Praise to God for His Rescue of Israel
rest:
For the music director, with stringed instruments.
A psalm of Asaph. A song.
God is known in Judah.
His name is great in Israel.

firstLine: His den has been in Salem,
rest: his lair in Zion.

firstLine: There he broke the flames of the bow,
rest: the shield and sword and battle. Selah

firstLine: Radiant you are, majestic,
rest: from the mountains of prey.

firstLine: The stouthearted are plundered;
rest:
they sleep their sleep,
and all the able men cannot use their hands.

firstLine: At your rebuke, O God of Jacob,
rest: both rider and horse slumber.

firstLine: You, indeed, are to be feared,
rest:
and who can stand before you
when you are angry?

firstLine: when God rose for justice,
rest: to save all the afflicted of the land. Selah

firstLine: Make vows and fulfill them to Yahweh, your God;
rest:
let all surrounding him
bring tribute to the one to be feared.

firstLine: Remembering God’s Help for Israel
rest:
For the music director, on Jeduthun.
Of Asaph. A psalm.
I cry out with my voice to God;
with my voice to God, that he may hear me.

firstLine: I remember God and I groan loudly;
rest: I meditate and my spirit grows faint.

firstLine: I think about the days from long ago,
rest: the years of ancient times.

firstLine: Will the Lord reject us forever,
rest: and will he never be pleased with us again?

firstLine: So I said, “This pierces me—
rest: the right hand of the Most High has changed.”

firstLine: I will also muse on all your work,
rest: and meditate on your deeds.

firstLine: You are the God who works wonders;
rest: you have made known your might among the peoples.

firstLine: With your arm you redeemed your people,
rest: the children of Jacob and Joseph. Selah

firstLine: Waters saw you, O God;
rest:
waters saw you and they trembled.
Surely the deeps shook.

firstLine: The sound of your thunder was in the whirlwind;
rest:
lightnings lit the world;
the earth shook and quaked.

firstLine: Your way was through the sea,
rest:
and your path through many waters.
Yet your footprints were not discerned.

firstLine: You led your people like a flock
rest: by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

firstLine: God’s Faithfulness in Israel’s History
rest:
A maskil of Asaph.
Listen, O my people, to my teaching.
Incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

firstLine: that we have heard and known,
rest: and our ancestors have told us.

firstLine: We will not hide them from their children,
rest:
telling the next generation the praises of Yahweh,
and his power and his wonders that he has done.

firstLine: For he established a testimony in Jacob,
rest:
and appointed a law in Israel,
which he commanded our ancestors
to teach to their children,

firstLine: so that the next generation might know—
rest:
children yet to be born—
that they might rise up and tell their children,

firstLine: that they might set their confidence in God,
rest:
and not forget the deeds of God,
but keep his commandments,

firstLine: and not be like their ancestors,
rest:
a stubborn and rebellious generation,
a generation that did not make ready its heart,
whose spirit was not faithful to God.

firstLine: The sons of Ephraim, armed with archers,
rest: turned back on the day of battle.

firstLine: They did not keep the covenant of God
rest: and refused to go in his law.

firstLine: They also forgot his deeds,
rest: and his wonders that he had shown them.

firstLine: In front of their ancestors he did a wonder,
rest: in the land of Egypt, in the region of Zoan.

firstLine: He split the sea and caused them to go over,
rest: and he caused waters to stand like a heap.

firstLine: And he led them with the cloud by day,
rest: and all night with a fiery light.

firstLine: He caused rocks to split in the wilderness
rest: and provided drink abundantly as from the depths.

firstLine: And he brought streams out of the rock
rest: and caused water to flow down like rivers.

firstLine: But they sinned still further against him
rest: by rebelling against the Most High in the desert.

firstLine: And they tested God in their heart
rest: by asking food for their craving.

firstLine: Yes, he struck the rock and water flowed
rest:
and streams gushed out,
but can he also give food
or provide meat for his people?”

firstLine: Therefore Yahweh heard
rest:
and he was very angry,
and a fire was kindled against Jacob,
and his anger also rose up against Israel,

firstLine: because they did not believe God,
rest: and they did not trust his salvation.

firstLine: Nevertheless, he commanded the skies above
rest: and opened the doors of heaven,

firstLine: and rained down on them manna to eat
rest: and gave them the grain of heaven.

firstLine: He caused the east wind to blow in the heavens
rest: and drove along the south wind by his strength.

firstLine: Then he rained meat on them like dust,
rest: even winged birds like the sand of the seas.

firstLine: He caused them to fall in the midst of his camp,
rest: all around his dwellings.

firstLine: So they ate and were well filled,
rest: and he brought about what they craved.

firstLine: They had not yet turned aside from their craving,
rest: while their food was still in their mouth,

firstLine: the anger of God rose against them,
rest:
and he killed some of the stoutest of them,
even the young men of Israel he caused to bow down in death.

firstLine: In spite of all this they sinned further
rest: and did not believe his wonders.

firstLine: And he consumed their days with futility
rest: their years with terror.

firstLine: When he killed some of them, then they sought him,
rest: and repented and earnestly sought God.

firstLine: And they remembered that God was their rock,
rest: and God Most High their redeemer.

firstLine: But they enticed him with their mouth
rest: and lied to him with their tongue.

firstLine: For their heart was not steadfast with him,
rest: nor were they faithful to his covenant.

firstLine: But he was compassionate; he pardoned their guilt
rest:
and did not destroy them.
And many times he turned back his anger
and did not stir up all his wrath,

firstLine: for he remembered that they were flesh,
rest: a passing wind that does not return.

firstLine: How often they rebelled against him in the wilderness
rest: and vexed him in the wasteland!

firstLine: So they again tested God
rest: and distressed the Holy One of Israel.

firstLine: And they did not remember his power
rest: when he redeemed them from the enemy,

firstLine: how he performed his signs in Egypt
rest: and his wonders in the region of Zoan,

firstLine: when he turned their rivers to blood
rest: so they could not drink from their streams.

firstLine: He sent among them flies that devoured them
rest: and frogs that destroyed them.

firstLine: And he gave their crop to the locusts
rest: and their labor to the locust.

firstLine: He destroyed their vines with hail
rest: and their sycamore trees with sleet.

firstLine: He also handed their cattle over to the hail
rest: and their livestock to the lightning bolts.

firstLine: He sent against them his fierce anger,
rest:
rage and indignation and trouble,
a band of destroying angels.

firstLine: And he struck down all the firstborn in Egypt,
rest: the first of their virility in the tents of Ham.

firstLine: Then he led out his people like sheep
rest: and guided them like a herd in the wilderness.

firstLine: And he led them safely and they were not afraid,
rest: but the sea covered their enemies.

firstLine: So he brought them to his holy territory,
rest: this mountain his right hand acquired.

firstLine: And he drove out nations before them
rest:
and allocated them for an inheritance by boundary line,
and settled the tribes of Israel in their tents.

firstLine: But they tested and rebelled against God Most High
rest: and did not keep his statutes.

firstLine: For they provoked him to anger with their high places,
rest: and made him jealous with their images.

firstLine: God heard and he was very angry
rest: and rejected Israel utterly.

firstLine: So he abandoned the dwelling place at Shiloh,
rest: the tent he had placed among humankind.

firstLine: And he gave his strength into captivity
rest: and his splendor into the hand of the enemy.

firstLine: He also handed his people over to the sword,
rest: and he was very angry with his inheritance.

firstLine: Fire devoured his young men,
rest: and his young women were not praised.

firstLine: His priests fell by the sword,
rest: and his widows did not weep.

firstLine: Then the Lord awoke like one who had been asleep,
rest: awoke like a warrior who had been drunk with wine.

firstLine: And he beat back his enemies;
rest: he gave them over to perpetual scorn.

firstLine: And he rejected the tent of Joseph,
rest: and did not chose the tribe of Ephraim,

firstLine: but chose the tribe of Judah,
rest: Mount Zion that he loved.

firstLine: And he built his sanctuary like the heights,
rest: like the earth that he established forever.

firstLine: And he chose David his servant
rest: and took him from the sheepfolds.

firstLine: He brought him from following nursing ewes
rest:
to shepherd Jacob, his people,
and Israel, his inheritance.

firstLine: And he shepherded them according to the integrity of his heart,
rest: and led them by the skillfulness of his hands.

firstLine: A Lament for Jerusalem after Its Destruction
They have given the bodies of your servants
rest:
as food for the birds of the heavens,
the flesh of your faithful to the beasts of the earth.

firstLine: They have poured out their blood like water
rest:
all around Jerusalem,
and there was none to bury them.

firstLine: We have become a taunt to our neighbors,
rest: a derision and a scorn to those around us.

firstLine: Pour out your anger on the nations
rest:
that do not know you,
and on the kingdoms
that do not call on your name,

firstLine: because they have devoured Jacob
rest: and have laid waste his habitation.

firstLine: Do not remember against us former iniquities;
rest:
let your mercies meet us quickly
because we are brought very low.

firstLine: Help us, O God of our salvation,
Why should the nations say,
rest:
“Where is their God?”
Let it be known among the nations before our eyes,
by the avenging of the blood of your servants
that was poured out.

firstLine: And return to our neighbors sevenfold upon them
rest: their taunts with which they taunted you, O Lord.

firstLine: Then we, your people and the flock of your pasture,
rest:
we will give thanks to you forever.
Generation after generation
we will tell of your praise.

firstLine: A Prayer to Restore Israel
rest:
For the music director, according to The Lilies.
A testimony. Of Asaph. A psalm.
Give ear, O shepherd of Israel,
who leads Joseph like a flock.
Shine forth, you who sits enthroned above the cherubim.

firstLine: Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh,
rest:
stir up your power
and come for our salvation.

firstLine: O God, restore us,
rest: and cause your face to shine that we may be saved.

firstLine: O Yahweh God of hosts,
rest:
how long will you be angry
against the prayer of your people?

firstLine: You have fed them the bread of tears;
rest: you have given them tears to drink in full measure.

firstLine: You have made us an object of strife to our neighbors,
rest: and our enemies mock among themselves.

firstLine: O God of hosts, restore us
rest: and cause your face to shine that we may be saved.

firstLine: You uprooted a vine from Egypt;
rest: you drove out the nations and planted it.

firstLine: You prepared a place before it,
rest: and it took deep root and filled the land.

firstLine: The mountains were covered with its shade,
rest: and the mighty cedars with its boughs.

firstLine: It spread its branches to the sea
rest: and its shoots to the river.

firstLine: Why have you broken down its walls,
rest: so that all who pass on the road pluck fruit from it?

firstLine: Swine from the forests devour it
rest: and creatures of the field feed on it.

firstLine: eventhe stalk that your right hand planted,
rest: and concerning the shoot you strengthened for yourself.

firstLine: Let your hand be on the man of your right hand,
rest: on the son of humankind whom you made strong for yourself.

firstLine: O Yahweh God of hosts, restore us;
rest: cause your face to shine that we may be saved.

firstLine: An Appeal from God to Israel
Lift up a song and strike the tambourine,
rest: the pleasant lyre, together with the harp.

firstLine: Blow the horn at new moon,
rest: at full moon, for our feast day,

firstLine: because it is a statute for Israel,
rest: an ordinance of the God of Jacob.

firstLine: He made it a statute in Joseph
rest:
when he went out against the land of Egypt,
where I heard a language I did not know.

firstLine: “I removed his shoulder from a burden.
rest: His hands were freed from the basket.

firstLine: Hear, O my people, and I will admonish you;
rest: O Israel, if you would but listen to me.

firstLine: There shall be no strange god among you,
rest: and you shall not bow down to a foreign god.

firstLine: I am Yahweh your God,
rest:
who brought you up from the land of Egypt.
Open wide your mouth and I will fill it.

firstLine: But my people did not listen to my voice,
rest: and Israel did not yield to me.

firstLine: So I let them go in the stubbornness of their heart;
rest: they walked in their counsels.

firstLine: Oh that my people would listen to me;
rest: that Israel would walk in my ways.

firstLine: I would subdue their enemies quickly,
rest: and turn my hand against their adversaries.

firstLine: Those who hate Yahweh would cringe before him,
rest: and their fate would be forever.

firstLine: But he would feed him from the choicest wheat,
rest: and I would satisfy you with honey from a rock.”

firstLine: God Commands Justice
“How long will you judge unjustly
rest: and show favoritism to the wicked? Selah

firstLine: Judge on behalf of the helpless and the orphan;
rest: provide justice to the afflicted and the poor.

firstLine: Rescue the helpless and the needy;
rest: deliver them from the hand of the wicked.”

firstLine: I have said, “You are gods,
rest: and sons of the Most High, all of you.

firstLine: However, you will die like men,
rest: and you will fall like one of the princes.”

firstLine: Rise up, O God, judge the earth,
rest: because you shall inherit all the nations.

firstLine: A Request to Act against Israel’s Neighbors
rest:
A song. A psalm of Asaph.
O God, do not rest silently.
Do not keep silent or be still, O God.

firstLine: For look, your enemies roar,
rest: and those who hate you have lifted their head.

firstLine: They devise cunning schemes against your people,
rest: and consult together against your protected ones.

firstLine: They say, “Come, let us annihilate them from being a nation,
rest: so that the name of Israel will be remembered no more.”

firstLine: the tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites,
rest: Moab and the Hagrites,

firstLine: Gebal and Ammon and Amalek,
rest: Philistia, with the inhabitants of Tyre.

firstLine: Do to them as you did with Midian,
rest: as with Sisera, as with Jabin at the wadi of Kishon.

firstLine: They were destroyed at En-dor;
rest: they became dung for the ground.

firstLine: Make their leaders like Oreb and Zeeb,
rest: and all their chiefs like Zebah and Zalmunna,

firstLine: who said, “Let us take as our possession
rest: the pastures of God.”

firstLine: O my God, make them like the tumbleweed,
rest: like the chaff before wind.

firstLine: As fire burns a forest,
rest: and as a flame sets afire mountains,

firstLine: so pursue them with your tempest
rest: and terrify them with your storm.

firstLine: Fill their faces with shame,
rest: that they may seek your name, O Yahweh.

firstLine: Let them be ashamed and terrified forever,
rest: and let them be humiliated and perish

firstLine: that they may know that you,
rest:
whose name is Yahweh, you alone,
are the Most High over the whole earth.

firstLine: The Joy of Worshiping in the Temple
rest:
For the music director; on the Gittith.
Of the sons of Korah. A psalm.
How lovely are your dwelling places,
O Yahweh of hosts!

firstLine: My soul longs and even fails
rest:
for the courtyards of Yahweh.
My heart and flesh sing for joy
to the living God.

firstLine: Even a bird finds a home, and a swallow a nest for herself,
rest:
where she may lay her young,
near your altars, O Yahweh of hosts,
my king and my God.

firstLine: Blessed are those who dwell in your house;
rest: they can ever praise you. Selah

firstLine: Blessed is the man whose strength is in you;
rest: in their heart are the highways to Zion.

firstLine: Passing through the Valley of Baca,
rest:
they make it a spring.
The early rain covers it with blessings as well.

firstLine: They go from strength to strength,
rest: until each appears before God in Zion.

firstLine: O Yahweh, God of hosts, hear my prayer;
rest: give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah

firstLine: Look at our shield, O God,
rest: and have regard for the face of your anointed one.

firstLine: Because better is a day in your courtyards
rest:
than a thousand elsewhere.
I would rather be at the threshold of the house of my God
than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.

firstLine: Because Yahweh God is a sun and a shield;
rest:
Yahweh gives grace and honor.
He does not withhold good from those who walk blamelessly.

firstLine: O Yahweh of hosts,
rest: blessed is the man who trusts you.

firstLine: Hope in God’s Future Help
rest:
For the music director. Of the sons of Korah. A psalm.
O Yahweh, you favored your land.
You restored the fortunes of Jacob.

firstLine: You took away the guilt of your people;
rest: you covered all their sin. Selah

firstLine: You withdrew all your wrath;
rest: you turned from your burning anger.

firstLine: Restore us, O God of our salvation,
rest: and annul your vexation with us.

firstLine: Will you not again revive us,
rest: that your people might rejoice in you?

firstLine: Show us, O Yahweh, your loyal love,
rest: and grant us your salvation.

firstLine: I will hear what God, Yahweh, will speak,
rest:
because he will speak peace
to his people, even his faithful ones,
but let them not return to folly.

firstLine: Surely his salvation is near for those who fear him,
rest: that glory may abide in our land.

firstLine: Loyal love and faithfulness will meet one another;
rest: righteousness and peace will kiss.

firstLine: Faithfulness will sprout from the ground,
rest: and righteousness will look down from heaven.

firstLine: Yes, Yahweh will give what is good,
rest: and our land will give its produce.

firstLine: Righteousness will go before him,
rest: and it will make his steps a pathway.

firstLine: A Prayer for Help against Ruthless Men
rest:
A prayer of David.
Incline, O Yahweh, your ear and answer me,
because I am poor and needy.

firstLine: Be gracious to me, O Lord,
rest: because I call to you all day long.

firstLine: Make glad the soul of your servant,
rest: because I desire you, O Lord.

firstLine: For you, O Lord, are good and forgiving,
rest: and abundant in loyal love for all who call to you.

firstLine: Heed, O Yahweh, my prayer,
rest: and attend to the voice of my supplications.

firstLine: In the day of my trouble I call to you,
rest: because you answer me.

firstLine: There is none like you among the gods, O Lord,
rest: and there are no works like yours.

firstLine: All the nations that you have made will come
rest:
and bow down before you, O Lord,
and glorify your name.

firstLine: For you are great and doing wondrous things;
rest: you alone are God.

firstLine: Teach me, O Yahweh, your way,
rest:
that I may walk in your truth.
Unite my heart to fear your name.

firstLine: I will give you thanks, O Lord my God, with all my heart,
rest: and glorify your name forever,

firstLine: because your loyal love is great toward me,
rest: and you will have delivered my life from Sheol below.

firstLine: O God, arrogant men have risen up against me,
rest:
even a gang of ruthless men seek my life,
but they do not set you before them.

firstLine: But you, O Lord, are a compassionate and gracious God,
rest: slow to anger and abundant in loyal love and faithfulness.

firstLine: Do a sign that benefits me,
rest:
that those who hate me may see and be put to shame,
because you, O Yahweh, have helped me and comforted me.

firstLine: Foreign Nations Come to Worship in Jerusalem
rest:
Of the sons of Korah. A psalm. A song.
His foundation is on the holy mountains.

firstLine: Yahweh loves the gates of Zion
rest: more than all the dwellings of Jacob.

firstLine: Glorious things are spoken about you,
rest: O city of God. Selah

firstLine: I will record those who know me
rest:
in Rahab and Babylon,
behold in Philistia and Tyre with Cush,
“This one was born there.”

firstLine: But with respect to Zion it shall be said,
rest:
“Each one was born in her,”
for the Most High himself will establish her.

firstLine: Yahweh will record in writing the peoples,
rest: “This one was born there.” Selah

firstLine: And while dancing, singers will sing,
rest: “All my springs are in you.”

firstLine: A Prayer for Help in Despair
rest:
A song. A psalm of the sons of Korah.
For the music director; according to Mahalath Leannoth.
A maskil of Heman the Ezrahite.
O Yahweh, God of my salvation,
I cry out by day and through the night before you.

firstLine: Let my prayer come before you;
rest: incline your ear to my cry.

firstLine: For my soul is full with troubles,
rest: and my life approaches Sheol.

firstLine: set free among the dead,
rest:
like the slain lying in the grave,
whom you no longer remember,
even those cut off from your hand.

firstLine: You have set me in the pit below,
rest: in dark places, in the depths.

firstLine: Your wrath presses upon me,
rest: and you afflict me with all your waves. Selah

firstLine: Is your loyal love told in the grave,
rest: or your faithfulness in the underworld?

firstLine: Are your wonders known in the darkness,
rest: or your righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?

firstLine: But as for me, I cry for help to you, O Yahweh,
rest: and in the morning my prayer comes before you.

firstLine: Your burning anger has passed over me;
rest: your sudden fears have destroyed me.

firstLine: They surround me like water all the day;
rest: they circle about me altogether.

firstLine: You have removed loved one and friend far from me,
rest: my acquaintances far from my darkness.

firstLine: Remembering the Covenant with David, and Sorrow for Lost Blessings
rest:
A maskil of Ethan the Ezrahite.
I will sing forever of Yahweh’s acts of loyal love.
From generation to generation
I will make known your faithfulness with my mouth.

firstLine: “I made a covenant with my chosen one;
rest: I swore an oath to David my servant:

firstLine: ‘I will establish your descendants forever,
rest: and I will build up your throne from generation to generation.’” Selah

firstLine: And so the heavens will praise your wonderful deed, O Yahweh,
rest: even your faithfulness, in the assembly of the holy ones.

firstLine: a God feared greatly in the council of the holy ones,
rest: and awesome above all surrounding him?

firstLine: O Yahweh God of hosts,
rest:
who is mighty like you, O Yah,
with your faithfulness surrounding you?

firstLine: You yourself crushed Rahab like one who is slain;
rest: you scattered your enemies with your strong arm.

firstLine: The heavens are yours, the earth yours as well,
rest: the world with its fullness, because you founded them.

firstLine: North and south, you created them;
rest: Tabor and Hermon shout joyfully over your name.

firstLine: You have a mighty arm;
rest: Your hand is strong; your right hand reaches high.

firstLine: Blessed are the people who know the joyful shout;
rest: O Yahweh, they walk about in the light of your countenance.

firstLine: In your name they rejoice all the day,
rest: and in your righteousness they rise up.

firstLine: For you are the glory of their strength,
rest: and by your favor our horn rises up,

firstLine: because our shield belongs to Yahweh,
rest: and our king to the Holy One of Israel.

firstLine: Formerly you spoke in a vision
The enemy will not deceive him,
rest: and no evil man will afflict him.

firstLine: But I will crush his adversaries before him,
rest: and I will strike those who hate him.

firstLine: And so my faithfulness
rest:
and my loyal love will be with him,
and in my name his horn will rise up.

firstLine: And I will set his hand on the sea
rest: and his right hand on the rivers.

firstLine: He will call out to me, ‘You are my Father,
rest: my God, and the rock of my salvation.’

firstLine: I will also make him the firstborn,
rest: the highest of the kings of the earth.

firstLine: Forever I will keep my loyal love for him,
rest: and my covenant will be reliable for him.

firstLine: I will also establish his offspring forever,
rest: and his throne as the days of the heavens.

firstLine: If his sons forsake my law
rest: and do not walk in my judgments,

firstLine: if they defile my statutes
rest: and do not keep my commandments,

firstLine: then I will punish their transgression with a rod,
rest: and their guilt with wounds.

firstLine: But I will not break off my loyal love from him,
rest: and I will not be false against my faithfulness.

firstLine: I will not defile my covenant,
rest: or alter what proceeded from my lips.

firstLine: Once I have sworn by my holiness,
rest: ‘I will surely not lie to David,

firstLine: His offspring will endure forever,
rest: and his throne as the sun before me.

firstLine: Like the moon it will be steadfast forever,
rest: and like an enduring witness in the sky.’” Selah

firstLine: But you have spurned and rejected;
rest: you are very angry with your anointed one.

firstLine: You have repudiated the covenant with your servant;
rest: you have defiled his crown in the dirt.

firstLine: You have broken down all his walls;
rest: you have made his fortifications a ruin.

firstLine: All passing along the road plunder him;
rest: he has become a taunt to his neighbors.

firstLine: You have also turned back the edge of his sword
rest: and have not helped him stand his ground in the battle.

firstLine: You have made his splendor to cease,
rest: and cast his throne to the ground.

firstLine: You have cut short the days of his youth;
rest: you have covered him with shame. Selah

firstLine: Where are your former acts of loyal love, O Lord,
rest: that you swore to David by your faithfulness?

firstLine: Remember, O Lord the taunting of your servants,
rest: how I bear in my bosom the taunts of all the many peoples,

firstLine: by which your enemies taunt, O Yahweh,
rest: by which they taunt the steps of your anointed one.

firstLine: God’s Eternity and Human Frailty
rest:
A prayer of Moses, the man of God.
O Lord, you have been our help in all generations.

firstLine: Before the mountains were born
rest:
and you brought forth the earth and the world,
even from everlasting to everlasting, you are God.

firstLine: You return man to the dust,
rest: saying, “Return, O sons of man.”

firstLine: For a thousand years in your eyes
rest:
are like yesterday when it passes,
or like a watch in the night.

firstLine: In the morning it blossoms and sprouts anew;
rest: by evening it withers and dries up.

firstLine: For we are brought to an end by your anger,
rest: and we hasten off by your wrath.

firstLine: You have put our iniquities before you,
rest: our hidden sins into the light of your countenance.

firstLine: For all of our days dwindle away in your rage;
rest: we complete our years like a sigh.

firstLine: As for the days of our years, within them are seventy years
rest:
or if by strength eighty years, and their pride is trouble and disaster,
for it passes quickly and we fly away.

firstLine: Who knows the strength of your anger,
rest: and your rage consistent with the fear due you?

firstLine: So teach us to number our days
rest: that we may gain a heart of wisdom.

firstLine: Satisfy us in the morning with your loyal love,
rest: that we may sing for joy and be glad all our days.

firstLine: Make us glad for as many days as you have afflicted us,
rest: for as many years as we have seen calamity.

firstLine: Let your work be visible to your servants,
rest: and your majesty to their children.

firstLine: And let the beauty of the Lord our God be upon us,
rest:
and establish for us the work of our hands,
yes, the work of our hands, establish it.

firstLine: God’s Protection in Times of Crisis
rest:
One who lives in the secret place of the Most High
will lodge in the shadow of Shaddai.

firstLine: I will say to Yahweh, “You are my refuge and my fortress,
rest: my God in whom I trust.”

firstLine: For he will deliver you from the snare of the fowler,
rest: from the plague of destruction.

firstLine: With his feathers he will cover you,
rest:
and under his wings you can take refuge.
His faithfulness will be a shield and a buckler.

firstLine: You need not fear the terror of the night,
rest: or the arrow that flies by day,

firstLine: or the plague that spreads in the darkness,
rest: or the destruction that devastates at noon.

firstLine: A thousand may fall at your side,
rest:
and ten thousand at your right hand,
but it will not come near you.

firstLine: You will only look with your eyes,
rest: and see the punishment of the wicked.

firstLine: No harm will befall you,
rest: and no plague will come near your tent.

firstLine: For he will command his angels concerning you,
rest: to watch over you in all your ways.

firstLine: In their hands they will bear you up,
rest: lest you strike your foot against a stone.

firstLine: You will tread on lion and viper;
rest: you will trample young lion and serpent.

firstLine: Because he loves me, therefore I will deliver him;
rest: I will protect him because he knows my name.

firstLine: He will call upon me and I will answer him;
rest:
I will be with him in trouble;
I will rescue and honor him.

firstLine: With long life I will satisfy him,
rest: and show him my salvation.

firstLine: Thanksgiving to Yahweh for Victory
to declare in the morning your loyal love
rest: and your faithfulness in the night,

firstLine: on the ten string, and on the harp,
rest: with a melody on the lyre.

firstLine: For you, O Yahweh, have made me glad by your work;
rest: by the deeds of your hands I sing for joy.

firstLine: How great are your deeds, O Yahweh;
rest: how very deep are your thoughts.

firstLine: The brutish man does not know,
rest: and the fool cannot understand this.

firstLine: When the wicked flourish like grass
rest:
and all the workers of evil blossom,
it is so they can be destroyed forever.

firstLine: For behold, your enemies, O Yahweh,
rest:
for behold, your enemies will perish.
All the workers of evil will be scattered.

firstLine: But you have exalted my horn like that of a wild ox;
rest: you have anointed me with fresh oil.

firstLine: Planted in the house of Yahweh,
rest: they will flourish in the courts of our God.

firstLine: Yahweh Is King Over All the Earth
rest:
Yahweh is king; he clothes himself with majesty.
Yahweh clothes himself; he girds himself with might.
Yes, the world is established so that it will not be moved.

firstLine: Your throne is established from of old;
rest: you are from everlasting.

firstLine: The rivers have lifted up, O Yahweh;
rest:
the rivers have lifted up their rumbling;
the rivers have lifted up their pounding.

firstLine: Mightier than the rumblings of many waters,
rest:
mightier than the mighty breakers of the sea,
Yahweh on high is mighty.

firstLine: A Prayer for Retribution against Oppressors
rest:
O Yahweh, God of vengeance,
God of vengeance, shine forth.

firstLine: How long will the wicked, O Yahweh,
rest: how long will the wicked exult?

firstLine: They crush your people, O Yahweh;
rest: they oppress your inheritance.

firstLine: They kill widow and stranger,
rest: and they murder orphans,

firstLine: while they say, “Yah does not see,”
rest: and “The God of Jacob does not pay attention.”

firstLine: Will the one who instructs nations not rebuke,
rest: the one who teaches humankind knowledge?

firstLine: Yahweh knows the thoughts of humankind,
rest: that they are to no purpose.

firstLine: Blessed is the man, O Yah, whom you instruct
rest: and teach from your law,

firstLine: to give him rest from days of trouble,
rest: until a pit is dug for the wicked.

firstLine: For Yahweh will not abandon his people,
rest: nor forsake his inheritance.

firstLine: For judgment will return to righteousness,
rest: and all the upright in heart will follow after it.

firstLine: If Yahweh had not been my help,
rest: my soul would soon have dwelt in silence.

firstLine: When I thought, “My foot is slipping,”
rest: your loyal love, O Yahweh, supported me.

firstLine: When my troubled thoughts were many within me,
rest: your consolations cheered my soul.

firstLine: Can there be allied with you a throne of destruction,
rest: one that forms trouble based on statute?

firstLine: They band together against the life of the righteous,
rest: and declare the blameless guilty of blood.

firstLine: But Yahweh has become my high stronghold,
rest: and my God has become my rock of refuge.

firstLine: And he will repay on them their iniquity,
rest:
