and by their evil he will destroy them.
Yahweh our God will destroy them.

firstLine: A Call to Worship and Obey
rest:
Come, let us sing for joy to Yahweh;
let us shout joyfully to the rock of our salvation.

firstLine: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving;
rest: with songs let us shout joyfully to him.

firstLine: For Yahweh is the great God,
rest: and the great king over all gods,

firstLine: in whose hand are the unexplored places of the earth,
rest: and the heights of the mountains are his,

firstLine: to whom belongs the sea that he made,
rest: and the dry land that his hands formed.

firstLine: Come in, let us worship and bow down;
rest: let us kneel before Yahweh, our maker.

firstLine: For he is our God,
rest:
and we are the people of his pasture
and the sheep of his hand.
Today if you will hear his voice:

firstLine: “Do not harden your heart as at Meribah,
rest: as in the day of Massah in the wilderness,

firstLine: For forty years I loathed that generation,
rest:
and said, ‘They are a people whose heart wanders.
And my ways they do not know.’

firstLine: Therefore I swore in my anger,
rest: ‘They shall surely not enter into my rest.’”

firstLine: Yahweh the King Comes in Judgment
rest:
Sing to Yahweh a new song;
sing to Yahweh, all the earth.

firstLine: Tell his glory among the nations,
rest: his marvelous works among all the peoples.

firstLine: For Yahweh is great and very worthy of praise;
rest: he is to be feared above all gods.

firstLine: For all the gods of the peoples are idols,
rest: but Yahweh made the heavens.

firstLine: Splendor and majesty are before him;
rest: strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.

firstLine: Ascribe to Yahweh, you families of the peoples,
rest: ascribe to Yahweh glory and strength.

firstLine: Ascribe to Yahweh the glory due his name;
rest: bring an offering and come into his courts.

firstLine: Worship Yahweh in holy array;
rest: tremble before him, all the earth.

firstLine: before Yahweh, for he is coming;
rest:
for he is coming to judge the earth.
He will judge the world with righteousness,
and the peoples with his faithfulness.

firstLine: Yahweh’s Glorious Reign
rest:
Yahweh is king! Let the earth rejoice;
let many coastlands be glad.

firstLine: Cloud and thick darkness are surrounding him;
rest: righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne.

firstLine: Fire goes before him,
rest: and devours his enemies round about.

firstLine: His lightnings light the world;
rest: the earth sees and trembles.

firstLine: The mountains melt like wax at the presence of Yahweh,
rest: at the presence of the Lord of all the earth.

firstLine: The heavens declare his righteousness,
rest: and all the peoples see his glory.

firstLine: Let all who serve an image be ashamed,
rest:
those who boast about idols.
Worship him, all you gods.

firstLine: Zion hears and is glad,
rest:
and the daughters of Judah rejoice
because of your judgments, O Yahweh.

firstLine: Light is sown for the righteous,
rest: and joy for the upright in heart.

firstLine: Be glad in Yahweh, you righteous,
rest: and give thanks to his holy name.

firstLine: Praise to Yahweh for His Salvation and Judgment
rest:
A psalm.
Sing to Yahweh a new song, for he has done wonders.
His right hand and his holy arm have secured his victory.

firstLine: Yahweh has made known his salvation;
rest: to the eyes of the nations he has revealed his righteousness.

firstLine: He has remembered his loyal love and his faithfulness
rest:
to the house of Israel.
All the ends of the earth have seen
the salvation of our God.

firstLine: Sing praises to Yahweh with lyre,
rest: with lyre and melodious sound.

firstLine: With trumpets and sound of horn,
rest: shout joyfully before the king, Yahweh.

firstLine: Let the sea with its fullness roar,
rest: the world and those who live in it.

firstLine: before Yahweh, for he is coming
rest:
to judge the earth.
He will judge the world with righteousness
and the peoples with equity.

firstLine: Yahweh Is a Holy King
rest:
Yahweh is king; let the peoples tremble.
He sits enthroned between the cherubim. Let the earth shake.

firstLine: Yahweh is great in Zion,
rest: and he is exalted over all the peoples.

firstLine: Exalt Yahweh our God,
rest:
and worship at his footstool.
He is holy.

firstLine: Moses and Aaron were among his priests;
rest:
Samuel also was among those who called on his name.
They called to Yahweh, and he answered them.

firstLine: Exalt Yahweh our God,
rest:
and worship at his holy mountain,
for Yahweh our God is holy.

firstLine: Worship God with Joy
rest:
A psalm of thanksgiving.
Shout in triumph to Yahweh, all the earth.

firstLine: Serve Yahweh with joy;
rest: come into his presence with exultation.

firstLine: Know that Yahweh, he is God;
rest:
he made us and we are his.
We are his people and the sheep of his pasture.

firstLine: Enter his gates with thanksgiving,
rest:
his courts with praise.
Give thanks to him; bless his name.

firstLine: For Yahweh is good; his loyal love is forever,
rest: and his faithfulness is from generation to generation.

firstLine: A Promise to Act with Integrity
I will not set before my eyes
A perverse heart will depart from me;
rest: I will not know evil.

firstLine: One who slanders his neighbor in secret,
rest:
him I will destroy.
One haughty of eyes and arrogant of heart,
him I will not endure.

firstLine: My eyes will be on the faithful of the land,
rest:
that they may live with me.
He who walks in the way of integrity,
he shall minister to me.

firstLine: There will not live in the midst of my house
rest:
a worker of deceit.
One who speaks lies
will not remain before my eyes.

firstLine: Each morning,
rest:
I will destroy all the wicked of the land,
cutting off from the city of Yahweh all evildoers.

firstLine: A Plea for Personal and National Help
rest:
A prayer of one afflicted, when he grows faint
and pours out his lament before Yahweh.
O Yahweh, hear my prayer,
and let my cry for help come to you.

firstLine: Do not hide your face from me
rest:
in the day of my trouble.
Incline your ear to me.
In the day I call, answer me quickly,

firstLine: for my days vanish in smoke,
rest: and my bones are charred like a hearth.

firstLine: Because of the sound of my groaning
rest: my bones cling to my skin.

firstLine: I am like an owl of the wilderness;
rest: I am like a little owl of the ruins.

firstLine: I lie awake and I am
rest: like a lone bird on a roof.

firstLine: All the day my enemies reproach me;
rest: those who mock me swear oaths against me.

firstLine: Indeed, I eat ashes like bread
rest: and mix my drink with tears

firstLine: because of your indignation and anger,
rest: for you have picked me up and thrown me away.

firstLine: My days are like a lengthened shadow,
rest: and I wither like grass.

firstLine: But you, O Yahweh, abide forever,
rest: and your remembrance from generation to generation.

firstLine: You rise up and take pity on Zion,
rest:
because it is time to favor it,
for the appointed time has come.

firstLine: Your servants take pleasure in her stones,
rest: and show favor to its dust.

firstLine: Then the nations will fear the name of Yahweh,
rest: and all the kings of the earth your glory.

firstLine: For Yahweh will rebuild Zion;
rest: he will appear in his glory.

firstLine: He will turn his attention to the prayer of the destitute
rest: and will not despise their prayer.

firstLine: Let this be written for the next generation,
rest: so that a people yet to be created may praise Yah,

firstLine: to hear the groaning of the prisoner,
rest: to liberate those destined to die,

firstLine: so that they may make known in Zion the name of Yahweh,
rest: and his praise in Jerusalem,

firstLine: when the peoples assemble,
rest: together with kingdoms, to serve Yahweh.

firstLine: He has broken my strength along the way;
rest: he has cut short my days.

firstLine: I say, “My God, do not carry me off
rest:
from my life in the middle of my days.”
Your years continue throughout all generations.

firstLine: Long ago you laid the foundation of the earth,
rest: and the heavens are the work of your hands.

firstLine: But you are the same,
rest: and your years do not end.

firstLine: The children of your servants will continue,
rest: and their descendants will be established before you.

firstLine: Thanksgiving for Yahweh’s Compassion
rest:
Of David.
Bless Yahweh, O my soul,
and all within me, bless his holy name.

firstLine: Bless Yahweh, O my soul,
rest: and do not forget all his benefits:

firstLine: who forgives all your iniquity,
rest: who heals all your diseases,

firstLine: who redeems your life from the pit,
rest: who crowns you with loyal love and mercies,

firstLine: who satisfies your life with good
rest: so that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.

firstLine: Yahweh does deeds of justice
rest: and judgments for all who are oppressed,

firstLine: who made known his ways to Moses,
rest: his deeds to the people of Israel.

firstLine: Yahweh is compassionate and gracious,
rest: slow to anger and abundant in loyal love.

firstLine: He does not dispute continually,
rest: nor keep his anger forever.

firstLine: He has not dealt with us according to our sins,
rest: nor repaid us according to our iniquities.

firstLine: For as the heavens are high above the earth,
rest: so his loyal love prevails over those who fear him.

firstLine: As far as east is from west,
rest: so he has removed far from us the guilt of our transgressions.

firstLine: As a father pities his children,
rest: so Yahweh pities those who fear him.

firstLine: When the wind passes over it, it is no more,
rest: and its place knows it no longer.

firstLine: But the loyal love of Yahweh
rest:
is from everlasting to everlasting on those who fear him,
and his righteousness to their children’s children,

firstLine: to those who keep his covenant
rest: and remember to do his precepts.

firstLine: Yahweh has established his throne in the heavens,
rest: and his kingdom rules over all.

firstLine: Bless Yahweh, you his angels,
rest:
you mighty heroes who do his word
by obeying the sound of his word.

firstLine: Bless Yahweh, all you his hosts,
rest: you his attendants who do his will.

firstLine: Bless Yahweh, all his works,
rest:
in all the places of his dominion.
Bless Yahweh, O my soul.

firstLine: Praise to Yahweh for His Creation and Providence
rest:
Bless Yahweh, O my soul.
O Yahweh my God, you are very great.
You clothe yourself with splendor and majesty,

firstLine: you who cover yourself with light as with a garment,
rest: who stretch out the heavens like a tent curtain,

firstLine: the one who sets beams in the waters for his upper chambers,
rest:
who makes clouds his chariot,
who rides on the wings of the wind,

firstLine: who makes his messengers the winds,
rest: his attendants a flame of fire.

firstLine: He established the earth on her foundations,
rest: so that it will not be moved forever and ever.

firstLine: At your rebuke they fled;
rest: at the sound of your thunder they ran off.

firstLine: They ascended the mountains and drained though the valleys
rest: to the place that you established for them.

firstLine: You set a boundary that they may not cross over,
rest: so that they would not return to cover the earth.

firstLine: You are the one who sends forth springs into the valleys;
rest: they flow between the mountains.

firstLine: You are the one who waters the mountains
rest:
from his upper chambers.
The earth is full with the fruit of your labors:

firstLine: who causes grass to grow for the cattle
rest:
and herbs for the service of humankind,
to bring forth food from the earth,

firstLine: and wine that makes glad the heart of man,
rest:
so that their faces shine from oil,
and bread that strengthens the heart of man.

firstLine: The trees of Yahweh drink their fill,
rest: the cedars of Lebanon that he planted,

firstLine: The high mountains are for the wild goats;
rest: the cliffs are a refuge for the rock badgers.

firstLine: He made the moon for appointed times;
rest: the sun knows its time for setting.

firstLine: You make darkness, and it is night,
rest: when all the animals of the forest creep about.

firstLine: The young lions are roaring for the prey
rest: and seeking their food from God.

firstLine: When the sun rises, they gather together
rest: and lie down in their dens.

firstLine: Humankind goes out to its work,
rest: and to its labor until evening.

firstLine: How many are your works, O Yahweh;
rest:
all of them you have done in wisdom.
The earth is full of your creatures.

firstLine: This is the great and wide sea,
rest:
in which are moving animals without number,
living things small and great.

firstLine: They all wait for you
rest: to give them their food at the proper time.

firstLine: You send forth your Spirit, they are created,
rest: and you renew the face of the ground.

firstLine: the one who looks at the earth and it quakes,
rest: and touches the mountains and they smoke.

firstLine: I will sing to Yahweh throughout my life;
rest: I will sing praise to my God while I remain alive.

firstLine: Let sinners perish completely from the earth,
rest:
and the wicked not remain alive.
Bless Yahweh, O my soul.
Praise Yah.

firstLine: Praise to Yahweh for His Work on Behalf of Israel
rest:
Give thanks to Yahweh; proclaim his name;
make known his deeds among the peoples.

firstLine: Sing to him; sing praises concerning him;
rest: tell of all his wonderful works.

firstLine: Make supplication to Yahweh and his might;
rest: seek his face continually.

firstLine: Remember his wonders that he has done,
rest: his signs and the judgments of his mouth,

firstLine: O offspring of Abraham his servant,
rest: you descendants of Jacob, his chosen ones.

firstLine: He is Yahweh our God;
rest: his judgments are in all the earth.

firstLine: He remembers his covenant forever,
rest:
the word that he commanded
for a thousand generations,

firstLine: that he made with Abraham,
rest: and by his oath swore to Isaac.

firstLine: He then confirmed it to Jacob as a statute,
rest: to Israel as an everlasting covenant,

firstLine: saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan
rest: as the allotment that is your inheritance.”

firstLine: When they were few in number—
rest: a trifle—and were sojourners in it,

firstLine: and they wandered about among the nations,
rest: from one kingdom to another people,

firstLine: he allowed no one to oppress them,
rest: and he rebuked kings on account of them,

firstLine: “Do not touch my anointed ones,
rest: nor harm my prophets.”

firstLine: Then he called for a famine upon the land;
rest: he broke every supply of bread.

firstLine: He sent a man on ahead of them;
rest: Joseph was sold as a slave.

firstLine: Until the time his word came about,
rest: the word of Yahweh tested him.

firstLine: The king sent and he freed him;
rest: the ruler of the peoples sent and let him loose.

firstLine: He made him lord of his house
rest: and ruler of all his possessions,

firstLine: to obligate his officials as he saw fit
rest: and teach his elders wisdom.

firstLine: Then Israel came to Egypt,
rest: and Jacob was a sojourner in the land of Ham.

firstLine: He turned their heart to hate his people,
rest: to deal deceitfully against his servants.

firstLine: He sent his servant Moses,
rest: together with Aaron whom he had chosen.

firstLine: They set before them the words concerning his signs
rest: and portents in the land of Ham.

firstLine: He sent darkness and made it dark,
rest: and they did not rebel against his words.

firstLine: He turned their waters into blood
rest: and it killed their fish.

firstLine: Their land swarmed with frogs,
rest: even in the chambers of their kings.

firstLine: He spoke, and there came flies
rest: and gnats throughout all their territory.

firstLine: He gave hail for their rains
rest: and the fire of lightning in their land.

firstLine: And he struck their vines and fig trees,
rest: and shattered the trees of their territory.

firstLine: He spoke and there came locusts
rest: and young locusts without number.

firstLine: And they ate up all the vegetation in their land,
rest: and they ate up the fruit of their ground.

firstLine: And he struck down all the firstborn in their land,
rest: the first of all their virility.

firstLine: Then he brought them out with silver and gold,
rest: and there was none among his tribes who stumbled.

firstLine: Egypt was glad when they departed,
rest: because the fear of them had fallen upon them.

firstLine: He spread out a cloud for a covering,
rest: and fire to give light at night.

firstLine: They asked, and he brought quail,
rest: and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.

firstLine: He opened the rock and waters flowed;
rest: they coursed through the dry places like a river.

firstLine: For he remembered his holy promise;
rest: he remembered Abraham his servant.

firstLine: And so he brought out his people with joy,
rest: his chosen ones with rejoicing.

firstLine: And he gave to them the lands of the nations,
rest: and they inherited the labor of the peoples,

firstLine: so that they might observe his statutes,
rest:
and keep his laws.
Praise Yah.

firstLine: Praise to Yahweh for His Faithfulness in Israel’s History
rest:
Praise Yah. Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good,
for his loyal love is forever.

firstLine: Who can utter the mighty deeds of Yahweh,
rest: or proclaim all his praise?

firstLine: Blessed are those who observe justice,
rest: he who does righteousness at all times.

firstLine: that I may see the good done your chosen ones,
rest:
to be glad in the joy of your nation,
to glory together with your inheritance.

firstLine: Yet he saved them for the sake of his name,
rest: to make known his might.

firstLine: So he rebuked the Red Sea, and it dried up,
rest: and he led them through the deep as through a desert.

firstLine: Thus he saved them from the hand of the hater
rest: and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

firstLine: But waters covered their adversaries;
rest: not one of them survived.

firstLine: Then they believed his words;
rest: they sang his praise.

firstLine: They quickly forgot his works;
rest: they did not wait for his counsel.

firstLine: And they craved intensely in the wilderness,
rest: and tested God in the desert.

firstLine: So he gave to them their request,
rest: but he sent leanness into their souls.

firstLine: And they were jealous of Moses in the camp,
rest: and of Aaron, the holy one of Yahweh.

firstLine: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan,
rest: and it covered over the gang of Abiram.

firstLine: Also fire burned in their assembly;
rest: the flame devoured the wicked.

firstLine: They made a calf at Horeb
rest: and bowed down to a cast image.

firstLine: And so they exchanged their glory
rest: for an image of an ox that eats grass.

firstLine: They forgot God their Savior,
rest: who had done great things in Egypt,

firstLine: wonders in the land of Ham,
rest: awesome deeds by the Red Sea.

firstLine: So he said he would exterminate them,
rest:
had not Moses, his chosen one,
stood in the breach before him,
to reverse his wrath from destroying them.

firstLine: Then they refused the desirable land;
rest: they did not believe his word,

firstLine: So he made an oath against them,
rest: to make them drop in the wilderness,

firstLine: and to disperse their descendants among the nations
rest: and to scatter them among the lands.

firstLine: They also attached themselves to Baal of Peor,
rest: and they ate sacrifices offered to the dead.

firstLine: Thus they provoked to anger by their deeds,
rest: and a plague broke out among them.

firstLine: Then Phinehas stood up and intervened,
rest: and so the plague was stopped,

firstLine: and it was reckoned to him as righteousness
rest: throughout all generations.

firstLine: They also angered God at the waters of Meribah,
rest: and it went badly for Moses on account of them,

firstLine: because they rebelled against his Spirit,
rest: and he spoke thoughtlessly with his lips.

firstLine: They did not exterminate the peoples,
rest: as Yahweh had commanded them,

firstLine: but they mingled with the nations
rest: and learned their works,

firstLine: and served their idols,
rest: which became a snare to them.

firstLine: They even sacrificed their sons and daughters
rest: to the demons,

firstLine: and they poured out innocent blood,
rest:
the blood of their sons and daughters,
whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan,
and so the land was defiled with the blood.

firstLine: And they became unclean by their works,
rest: and were unfaithful in their deeds.

firstLine: So Yahweh’s anger burned against his people,
rest: and he abhorred his inheritance.

firstLine: Then he gave them into the hand of the nations,
rest: and those who hated them ruled over them.

firstLine: And their enemies oppressed them,
rest: and they were subdued under their hand.

firstLine: Many times he delivered them,
rest:
but they rebelled in their counsel,
and were brought low by their iniquity.

firstLine: Yet he looked upon their distress
rest: when he heard their cry.

firstLine: And he remembered his covenant with them,
rest: and relented based on the abundance of his loyal love.

firstLine: And he let them find compassion
rest: before all their captors.

firstLine: Save us, O Yahweh our God,
rest:
and gather us from the nations,
so that we may give thanks to your holy name
and boast in your praise.

firstLine: Blessed is Yahweh, the God of Israel,
rest:
from everlasting and to everlasting.
And let all the people say, “Amen!”
Praise Yah.

firstLine: Thanksgiving to Yahweh for His of Deliverance
rest:
Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good,
for his loyal love is forever.

firstLine: Let the redeemed of Yahweh declare it,
rest: those whom he has redeemed from the hand of the enemy

firstLine: and gathered from the lands,
rest: from east and from west, from north and from south.

firstLine: Hungry and thirsty,
rest: their soul grew faint within them.

firstLine: and led them by a straight way
rest: to get to a city to inhabit.

firstLine: Let them give thanks to Yahweh for his loyal love,
rest: and his wonderful deeds for the children of humankind,

firstLine: for he satisfies the longing soul,
rest: and the hungry soul he fills with good.

firstLine: Those who sat in darkness and gloom,
rest: prisoners of misery and iron—

firstLine: because they rebelled against the words of God
rest: and spurned the counsel of the Most High,

firstLine: Then they called to Yahweh for help in their trouble;
rest: he saved them from their distresses.

firstLine: He brought them out of darkness and gloom,
rest: and tore off their bonds.

firstLine: Let them give thanks to Yahweh for his loyal love
rest: and his wonderful deeds for the children of humankind,

firstLine: for he shatters the doors of bronze,
rest: and cuts through the bars of iron.

firstLine: Fools, because of their rebellious way
rest: and their iniquities, were afflicted.

firstLine: Their soul abhorred all food,
rest: and they approached the gates of death.

firstLine: He sent his word and healed them,
rest: and he delivered them from their pits.

firstLine: Let them give thanks to Yahweh for his loyal love,
rest: and his wonderful deeds for the children of humankind,

firstLine: and let them offer sacrifices of thanksgiving,
rest: and tell of his works with rejoicing.

firstLine: Those who went down to the sea into ships,
rest: doing business on the high seas,

firstLine: they saw the works of Yahweh,
rest: and his wonderful deeds in the deep.

firstLine: For he spoke and raised up a stormy wind,
rest: and it whipped up its waves.

firstLine: They reeled and staggered like a drunkard,
rest: and they were at their wits’ end.

firstLine: Then they cried out to Yahweh in their trouble,
rest: and he brought them out of their distresses.

firstLine: He made the storm be still
rest: and their waves became calm.

firstLine: Then they were glad because they grew silent,
rest: so he guided them to their desired harbor.

firstLine: Let them give thanks to Yahweh for his loyal love
rest: and his wonderful deeds for the children of humankind,

firstLine: and let them exalt him in the congregation of the people,
rest: and praise him in the assembly of the elders.

firstLine: He turns rivers into a wilderness
rest: and springs of water into thirsty ground,

firstLine: a fruitful land into a salty place,
rest: because of the evil of its inhabitants.

firstLine: He turns a wilderness into a pool of water
rest: and a dry land into springs of water.

firstLine: And he settles the hungry there,
rest: so that they may establish a city to inhabit,

firstLine: and sow fields and plant vineyards,
rest: that they may yield fruit at harvest.

firstLine: And he blesses them and they multiply greatly,
rest: and he does not let their cattle become few.

firstLine: When they become few and they are bent down
rest: from the oppression of calamity and grief,

firstLine: he pours contempt on princes
rest: and causes them to wander in a trackless waste.

firstLine: But he protects the needy from misery,
rest: and he makes their families like a flock.

firstLine: The upright see it and are glad,
rest: and all wickedness shuts its mouth.

firstLine: Whoever is wise, then let him observe these things,
rest: and let them consider Yahweh’s acts of loyal love.

firstLine: Prayer to Yahweh for Victory over Enemies
rest:
A song. A psalm of David.
My heart is steadfast, O God.
I will sing and give praise, even with my glory.

firstLine: I will give you thanks among the peoples, O Yahweh;
rest: I will give you praise among the nations,

firstLine: because your loyal love is great above the heavens,
rest: and your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.

firstLine: Be exalted above the heavens, O God,
rest: and let your glory be above all the earth,

firstLine: God has spoken in his holiness,
rest:
“I will exult, I will divide up Shechem,
and portion out the valley of Succoth.

firstLine: Have you not rejected us, O God,
rest: and not gone out with our armies, O God?

firstLine: Give us help against the enemy,
rest: for the help of humankind is futile.

firstLine: Through God we will do valiantly,
rest: and it is he who will tread down our enemies.

firstLine: A Prayer for Help against Enemies
rest:
For the music director. A psalm of David.
O God of my praise, do not keep silent,

firstLine: for wicked and deceitful mouths
rest:
have opened against me.
They speak to me with a lying tongue.

firstLine: They also surround me with words of hate,
rest: and fight me without cause.

firstLine: In return for my love they accuse me,
rest: though I am in prayer.

firstLine: So they inflicted evil against me in return for good
rest: and hatred in return for my love.

firstLine: Appoint over him a wicked man,
rest: and let an accuser stand at his right hand.

firstLine: When he is judged, let him come out guilty,
rest: and let his prayer become as sin.

firstLine: Let his days be few;
rest: let another take his office.

firstLine: Let his children be orphans,
rest: and his wife a widow,

firstLine: and let his children wander aimlessly and beg,
rest: and let them plead from their ruins.

firstLine: Let the creditor seize all that is his,
rest: and let strangers plunder his property.

firstLine: Let there be none who extend to him loyal love,
rest: nor any who pities his orphans.

firstLine: Let the iniquity of his ancestors be remembered before Yahweh,
rest: and let the sin of his mother not be blotted out.

firstLine: Let them be before Yahweh continually,
rest: that he may cut off their memory from the earth,

firstLine: because he did not remember to show loyal love,
rest:
but he pursued anyone, poor or needy
or brokenhearted, to slay them.

firstLine: Because he wore a curse as his robe,
rest:
let it enter his body like water,
and into his bones like oil.

firstLine: May it be for him like a garment in which he wraps,
rest: and a belt he continually wears.

firstLine: Let this be the punishment for my accusers from Yahweh,
rest: even those who speak evil against my life.

firstLine: But you, O Yahweh my Lord,
rest:
deal with me for your name’s sake.
Because your loyal love is good, deliver me,

firstLine: for I am poor and needy,
rest: and my heart is wounded within me.

firstLine: Like a lengthening shadow I am passing away;
rest: I am shaken off like a locust.

firstLine: My knees buckle from fasting,
rest: and my body grows lean without fat.

firstLine: And so I am a disgrace to them;
rest: when they see me, they shake their heads.

firstLine: Help me, O Yahweh my God;
rest: save me according to your loyal love,

firstLine: that they may know that this is your hand,
rest: that you, O Yahweh, you have done it.

firstLine: Let my accusers put on disgrace,
rest: and let them cover themselves with their shame as with a robe.

firstLine: I will give thanks to Yahweh exceedingly with my mouth,
rest: and in the midst of many I will praise him,

firstLine: for he stands at the right hand of the needy,
rest: to save him from those judging his life.

firstLine: Yahweh Gives Authority to His Messiah
rest:
Of David. A psalm.
A declaration of Yahweh to my lord,
“Sit at my right hand
until I make your enemies your footstool.”

firstLine: Yahweh will send out your mighty scepter from Zion;
rest: rule in the midst of your enemies.

firstLine: Yahweh has sworn and he will not change his mind,
rest:
“You are a priest forever
according to the manner of Melchizedek.”

firstLine: O Lord, at your right hand
rest: he will shatter kings in the day of his anger.

firstLine: He will judge among the nations;
rest:
he will fill them with corpses.
He will shatter the rulers of many countries.

firstLine: He will drink from the stream by the road;
rest: therefore he will lift up his head.

firstLine: Praise to God for His Work and Commands
rest:
Praise Yah!
I will give thanks to Yahweh with all my heart,
in the assembly of the upright and the congregation.

firstLine: The works of Yahweh are great,
rest: studied by all who delight in them.

firstLine: Full of splendor and majesty is his work,
rest: and his righteousness endures forever.

firstLine: He has made his wonders to be remembered;
rest: Yahweh is gracious and compassionate.

firstLine: He gives food to those who fear him;
rest: he remembers his covenant forever.

firstLine: He has declared the power of his works for his people,
rest: by giving to them the inheritance of the nations.

firstLine: The works of his hands are faithfulness and justice;
rest: all his precepts are reliable.

firstLine: They are sustained forever and ever,
rest: done with faithfulness and uprightness.

firstLine: He has sent redemption to his people;
rest:
he has commanded his covenant forever;
holy and fearful is his name.

firstLine: The fear of Yahweh is the beginning of wisdom;
rest:
all who do them have a good understanding.
His praise endures forever.

firstLine: The Path of the Righteous and the Path of the Wicked
His descendants will be mighty in the land;
rest: the generation of the upright will be blessed.

firstLine: Wealth and riches are in his house,
rest: and his righteousness endures forever.

firstLine: His light rises in the darkness for the upright;
rest: he is gracious and compassionate and righteous.

firstLine: It goes well for a man who is gracious and lends,
rest: who conducts his business properly.

firstLine: For he will not be shaken forever;
rest: the righteous will be remembered forever.

firstLine: He is not afraid of bad news;
rest: his heart is steadfast, secure in Yahweh.

firstLine: His heart is sustained; he will not be afraid,
rest: until he looks in triumph on his enemies.

firstLine: He gives lavishly to the needy;
rest:
his righteousness endures forever.
His horn rises high in honor.

firstLine: God’s Majesty and Care for the Needy
rest:
Praise Yah!
Praise, O servants of Yahweh,
praise the name of Yahweh.

firstLine: Let the name of Yahweh be blessed,
rest: from now until forever.

firstLine: From the rising of the sun to its setting,
rest: let the name of Yahweh be blessed.

firstLine: Yahweh is high above all nations;
rest: his glory is above the heavens.

firstLine: Who is like Yahweh our God,
rest: who is enthroned on high,

firstLine: who condescends to look at
rest: what is in the heavens and in the earth?

firstLine: He raises the helpless from the dust;
rest: he lifts the needy from the ash heap,

firstLine: to seat them with princes,
rest: with the princes of his people.

firstLine: He causes the barren woman of the house to dwell
rest:
as the happy mother of children.
Praise Yah!

firstLine: Praise to God for His Works During the Exodus
rest:
When Israel went out from Egypt,
the house of Jacob from a people of a strange language,

firstLine: Judah became his sanctuary,
rest: Israel his dominion.

firstLine: The sea looked and fled;
rest: the Jordan turned back.

firstLine: The mountains skipped like rams,
rest: the hills like lambs.

firstLine: At the presence of the Lord writhe, O earth,
rest: at the presence of the God of Jacob,

firstLine: who turned the rock into a pool of water,
rest: flinty stone into a spring of water.

firstLine: Dead Idols and the Living God
rest:
Not to us, O Yahweh, not to us,
but to your name give glory,
because of your loyal love,
because of your faithfulness.

firstLine: Why should the nations say,
rest: “Where, pray tell, is their God?”

firstLine: But our God is in the heavens;
rest: all that he desires, he does.

firstLine: Their idols are silver and gold,
rest: the work of human hands.

firstLine: They have mouths, but cannot speak;
rest: they have eyes, but cannot see;

firstLine: they have ears, but cannot hear;
rest: they have noses, but cannot smell;

firstLine: they have their hands, but they cannot feel,
rest:
their feet, but they cannot walk;
they cannot utter a sound in their throats.

firstLine: Those who make them become like them,
rest: as does everyone who trusts in them.

firstLine: O Israel, trust Yahweh;
rest: he is their help and their shield.

firstLine: O house of Aaron, trust in Yahweh;
rest: he is their help and their shield.

firstLine: You who fear Yahweh, trust in Yahweh;
rest: he is their help and their shield.

firstLine: He will bless those who fear Yahweh,
rest: the small with the great.

firstLine: May Yahweh give you increase,
rest: you and your children.

firstLine: May you be blessed by Yahweh,
rest: who made heaven and earth.

firstLine: The heavens are Yahweh’s heavens,
rest: but the earth he has given to the children of humankind.

firstLine: The dead do not praise Yah,
rest: nor any descending into silence.

firstLine: It is we, we will bless Yah
rest:
from now until forever.
Praise Yah!

firstLine: Thanksgiving for God’s Deliverance
rest:
I love him, because Yahweh has heard
the voice of my supplications.

firstLine: Because he has inclined his ear to me,
rest: I will call all my days.

firstLine: The ropes of death encircled me,
rest:
and the distresses of Sheol found me.
I found trouble and grief.

firstLine: Then I called on the name of Yahweh:
rest: “O Yahweh, please save my life!”

firstLine: Gracious is Yahweh and righteous,
rest: and our God is merciful.

firstLine: Return, O my soul, to your repose,
rest: for Yahweh has dealt bountifully with you.

firstLine: For you have rescued me from death,
rest: my eyes from tears, my feet from stumbling.

firstLine: I will walk before Yahweh
rest: in the land of the living.

firstLine: I believed when I spoke,
rest: “I am afflicted greatly.”

firstLine: I said in my haste,
rest: “Everyone is a liar.”

firstLine: What shall I give back to Yahweh
rest: for all his benefits to me?

firstLine: I will lift up the cup of salvation
rest: and proclaim the name of Yahweh.

firstLine: I will pay my vows made to Yahweh
rest: in the presence of all his people.

firstLine: Costly in Yahweh’s view is
rest: the death of his faithful ones.

firstLine: Ah, Yahweh, I am indeed your servant;
rest:
I am your servant, the child of your maidservant.
You have loosed my bonds.

firstLine: I will offer to you a sacrifice of thanksgiving,
rest: and proclaim the name of Yahweh.

firstLine: I will pay my vows made to Yahweh
rest: in the presence of all his people,

firstLine: in the courts of the house of Yahweh,
rest:
in the midst of you, O Jerusalem.
Praise Yah!

firstLine: Let All Peoples Praise Yahweh
rest:
Praise Yahweh, all you nations;
extol him, all you peoples.

firstLine: For his loyal love is mighty on our behalf,
rest:
and the faithfulness of Yahweh is forever.
Praise Yah!

firstLine: Praise to God for His Loyal Love
rest:
Give thanks to Yahweh for he is good,
for his loyal love is forever.

firstLine: Let Israel say,
rest: “His loyal love is forever.”

firstLine: Let the house of Aaron say,
rest: “His loyal love is forever.”

firstLine: Let those who fear Yahweh say,
rest: “His loyal love is forever.”

firstLine: Yahweh is for me as my helper,
rest: and so I will look in triumph on those who hate me.

firstLine: It is better to take refuge in Yahweh
rest: than to trust in humans.

firstLine: It is better to take refuge in Yahweh
rest: than to trust princes.

firstLine: They surrounded me like bees;
rest:
they were extinguished like a fire of thorns.
In the name of Yahweh I opposed them indeed.

firstLine: You pushed me hard to make me fall,
rest: but Yahweh helped me.

firstLine: Yah is my strength and my song,
rest: and he has become my salvation.

firstLine: The sound of rejoicing and salvation
rest:
is in the tents of the righteous;
the right hand of Yahweh has done valiantly.

firstLine: The right hand of Yahweh has exalted;
rest: the right hand of Yahweh has done valiantly.

firstLine: I will not die but live,
rest: and tell of the works of Yah.

firstLine: Yah has disciplined me severely,
rest: but he did not consign me to death.

firstLine: Open to me the gates of righteousness,
rest:
that I may enter through them
and give thanks to Yah.

firstLine: This is the gate of Yahweh,
rest: through which the righteous will enter.

firstLine: I will give thanks to you for you have answered me,
rest: and you have become my salvation.

firstLine: The stone the builders rejected
rest: has become the chief cornerstone.

firstLine: This is from Yahweh;
rest: it is wonderful in our eyes.

firstLine: This is the day Yahweh has worked;
rest: let us rejoice and be glad in him.

firstLine: O Yahweh, please save;
rest: O Yahweh, please grant success.

firstLine: Give thanks to Yahweh for he is good,
rest: for his loyal love is forever.

firstLine: Aleph
rest:
Blessed are those whose way is blameless,
who walk in the law of Yahweh.

firstLine: Blessed are those who keep his testimonies;
rest: they seek him with a whole heart.

firstLine: They also do no wrong;
rest: they walk in his ways.

firstLine: You have commanded your precepts,
rest: that we should keep them diligently.

firstLine: Oh that my ways were steadfast,
rest: to keep your statutes!

firstLine: Then I would not be ashamed
rest: when I look to all your commands.

firstLine: I will give you thanks with an upright heart,
rest: when I learn your righteous laws.

firstLine: I will heed your statutes;
rest: do not utterly forsake me.

firstLine: Beth
rest:
How can a young man keep his way pure?
By taking heed according to your word.

firstLine: With my whole heart I have sought you;
rest: do not let me stray from your commands.

firstLine: In my heart I have hidden your word,
rest: so that I may not sin against you.

firstLine: With my lips I have told of
rest: all the ordinances of your mouth.

firstLine: In the way of your testimonies I have rejoiced
rest: as I would over all riches.

firstLine: I will meditate on your precepts
rest: and look at your ways.

firstLine: I will take delight in your statutes;
rest: I will not forget your word.

firstLine: Gimel
rest:
Deal bountifully with your servant, that I may live
and heed your word.

firstLine: Uncover my eyes, that I may look at
rest: wonderful things from your law.

firstLine: I am a sojourner on the earth;
rest: do not hide your commands from me.

firstLine: My soul is crushed with longing
rest: for your ordinances at all times.

firstLine: You rebuke the arrogant, the accursed,
rest: who stray from your commands.

firstLine: Remove from me scorn and contempt,
rest: for I have kept your testimonies.

firstLine: Even though princes sit and speak against me,
rest: your servant meditates on your statutes.

firstLine: Your testimonies are my delight,
rest: my counselors.

firstLine: Daleth
rest:
My soul clings to the dust;
revive me according to your word.

firstLine: I told of my ways, and you answered me;
rest: teach me your statutes.

firstLine: Make me understand the way of your precepts,
rest: that I may meditate on your wonderful things.

firstLine: My soul weeps because of grief;
rest: strengthen me according to your word.

firstLine: Remove from me the deceptive way,
rest: and graciously give me your law.

firstLine: I have chosen the faithful way;
rest: I have set your ordinances before me.

firstLine: I cling to your testimonies;
rest: O Yahweh, do not let me be put to shame.

firstLine: I will run the way of your commands,
rest: for you will enlarge my heart.

firstLine: Heʼ
rest:
Teach me, O Yahweh, the way of your statutes,
and I will keep it to the end.

firstLine: Give me understanding, that I may keep your law
rest: and heed it with my whole heart.

firstLine: Cause me to walk in the path of your commands,
rest: for I delight in it.

firstLine: Incline my heart to your testimonies,
rest: and not to dishonest gain.

firstLine: Turn away my eyes from looking at what is worthless;
rest: revive me in your ways.

firstLine: Fulfill your word to your servant,
rest: which is to bring about a reverence for you.

firstLine: Turn away my disgrace that I dread,
rest: for your ordinances are good.

firstLine: Look, I have longed for your precepts;
rest: revive me in your righteousness.

firstLine: Waw
rest:
Let your acts of loyal love also come to me, O Yahweh,
your salvation according to your word.

firstLine: Then I will have an answer for the one who taunts me,
rest: for I trust your word.

firstLine: And do not snatch the word of truth utterly from my mouth,
rest: for I hope in your ordinances.

firstLine: So I will heed your law continually,
rest: forever and ever.

firstLine: And I will go about freely,
rest: for I have sought your precepts.

firstLine: And I will speak of your testimonies before kings,
rest: and will not be ashamed.

firstLine: And I will take delight in your commands,
rest: which I love.

firstLine: And I will lift up my hands to your commands, which I love,
rest: and I will meditate on your statutes.

firstLine: Zayin
rest:
Remember your word to your servant,
upon which you have caused me to hope.

firstLine: This is my comfort in my misery:
rest: that your word preserves my life.

firstLine: The arrogant utterly deride me;
rest: I have not turned aside from your law.

firstLine: I remember your ordinances of old, O Yahweh,
rest: and I take comfort.

firstLine: Rage seizes me because of the wicked,
rest: those who forsake your law.

firstLine: Your statutes have been my songs
rest: in the house of my sojourning.

firstLine: I remember your name in the night, O Yahweh,
rest: and I heed your law.

firstLine: This has been mine,
rest: that I have kept your precepts.

firstLine: Heth
rest:
Yahweh is my portion;
I intend to heed your words.

firstLine: I seek your favor with my whole heart;
rest: be gracious to me according to your word.

firstLine: I think about my ways,
rest: and turn my feet to your testimonies.

firstLine: I hurry and do not delay
rest: to heed your commands.

firstLine: The cords of the wicked surround me,
rest: but I do not forget your law.

firstLine: In the middle of the night I rise to give you thanks,
rest: because of your righteous ordinances.

firstLine: I am a companion of all who fear you
rest: and heed your precepts.

firstLine: Teth
rest:
You have dealt well with your servant,
O Yahweh, according to your word.

firstLine: Teach me good discernment and knowledge,
rest: for I believe your commands.

firstLine: Before I was afflicted, I was going astray,
rest: but now I heed your word.

firstLine: You are good and do good;
rest: teach me your statutes.

firstLine: The arrogant smear me with lies;
rest: I keep your precepts with my whole heart.

firstLine: Their heart is insensitive like fat;
rest: As for me, I take delight in your law.

firstLine: It is good for me that I was afflicted,
rest: so that I might learn your statutes.

firstLine: The law of your mouth is better to me
rest: than thousands of gold and silver coins.

firstLine: Yod
rest:
Your hands have made me and established me;
give me understanding that I may learn your commands.

firstLine: Those who fear you will see me and be glad,
rest: because I hope in your word.

firstLine: I know, O Yahweh, that your judgments are right,
rest: and that in faithfulness you afflicted me.

firstLine: Please let your loyal love comfort me,
rest: according to your word to your servant.

firstLine: Let your mercies come to me, that I may live,
rest: for your law is my delight.

firstLine: Let the arrogant be put to shame,
rest:
because they have wronged me with lies.
As for me, I will meditate on your precepts.

firstLine: Let those who fear you turn to me,
rest: even those who know your testimonies.

firstLine: May my heart be blameless in your statutes,
rest: so that I may not be ashamed.

firstLine: Kaph
rest:
My soul languishes for your salvation;
I hope in your word.

firstLine: My eyes long for your word,
rest: saying, “When will you comfort me?”

firstLine: For I have become like a wineskin in the smoke,
rest: yet I have not forgotten your statutes.

firstLine: The arrogant have dug pits for me,
rest: which is not according to your law.

firstLine: They have almost destroyed me on the earth,
rest: but I have not forsaken your precepts.

firstLine: According to your loyal love preserve me alive,
rest: so that I may heed the testimony from your mouth.

firstLine: Lamed
rest:
Forever, O Yahweh,
your word is settled in heaven.

firstLine: By your ordinances they stand today,
rest: for all are your servants.

firstLine: Unless your law had been my delight,
rest: then I would have perished in my misery.

firstLine: I will not ever forget your precepts,
rest: for by them you revive me.

firstLine: I have seen a limit to every perfection;
rest: your command is very broad.

firstLine: Mem
rest:
How I love your law!
The whole day it is my meditation.

firstLine: Your commands make me wiser than my enemies,
rest: because they are ever with me.

firstLine: I have more insight than all my teachers,
rest: for your testimonies are my meditation.

firstLine: I understand more than the elders,
rest: for I keep your precepts.

firstLine: I have restrained my feet from every evil way,
rest: so that I may heed your word.

firstLine: I have not turned aside from your ordinances,
rest: for you have taught me.

firstLine: How smooth are your words to my palate,
rest: more than honey in my mouth.

firstLine: From your precepts I get understanding,
rest: therefore I hate every false way.

firstLine: Nun
rest:
Your word is a lamp to my feet
and a light to my path.

firstLine: I have sworn an oath and confirmed it,
rest: to heed your righteous ordinances.

firstLine: I am very much afflicted;
rest: O Yahweh, revive me according to your word.

firstLine: Please accept the freewill offerings of my mouth, O Yahweh,
rest: and teach me your ordinances.

firstLine: My life is in danger continually,
rest: yet I do not forget your law.

firstLine: The wicked have laid a snare for me,
rest: yet I do not wander from your precepts.

firstLine: I have taken as my own your testimonies forever,
rest: for they are the joy of my heart.

firstLine: I have inclined my heart to do your statutes
rest: forever, to the end.

firstLine: Samek
rest:
I hate the double-minded,
but I love your law.

firstLine: You are my hiding place and my shield;
rest: I hope in your word.

firstLine: Turn aside from me, you evildoers,
rest: for I will keep the commands of my God.

firstLine: Sustain me according to your word, that I may live,
rest: and do not let me be ashamed of my hope.

firstLine: Uphold me, that I may be delivered,
rest: and have regard for your statutes continually.

firstLine: You reject all who stray from your statutes,
rest: for their deceit is a breach of faith.

firstLine: You remove all the wicked of the earth like dross,
rest: therefore I love your testimonies.

firstLine: My flesh trembles for fear of you,
rest: and I am afraid of your judgments.

firstLine: ʽAyin
rest:
I have done justice and righteousness;
do not leave me to my oppressors.

firstLine: Pledge good for your servant;
rest: do not let the arrogant oppress me.

firstLine: My eyes long for your salvation,
rest: and your righteous word.

firstLine: Deal with your servant according to your loyal love,
rest: and teach me your statutes.

firstLine: I am your servant; give me understanding,
rest: that I may know your statutes.

firstLine: It is time for Yahweh to act,
rest: for they have broken your law.

firstLine: Therefore I love your commands
rest: more than gold, even fine gold.

firstLine: Therefore all your precepts of everything I regard as right;
rest: I hate every false way.

firstLine: Pe
rest:
Your testimonies are miracles,
therefore my soul keeps them.

firstLine: The unfolding of your words gives light,
rest: giving understanding to the simple.

firstLine: I open my mouth and pant,
rest: because I long for your commands.

firstLine: Turn to me and be gracious to me,
rest: as is proper for those who love your name.

firstLine: Direct my steps in your word,
rest: and do not let any iniquity gain power over me.

firstLine: Redeem me from the oppression of humankind,
rest: that I may heed your precepts.

firstLine: Shine your face on your servant,
rest: and teach me your statutes.

firstLine: Streams of water flow down from my eyes,
rest: because people do not heed your law.

firstLine: Tsade
rest:
You are righteous, O Yahweh,
and your ordinances are upright.

firstLine: You have ordained your testimonies in righteousness,
rest: and in exceeding faithfulness.

firstLine: My zeal consumes me,
rest: because my enemies have forgotten your words.

firstLine: Your word is very pure,
rest: and your servant loves it.

firstLine: I am small and despised,
rest: yet I do not forget your precepts.

firstLine: Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness,
rest: and your law is truth.

firstLine: Trouble and anguish have found me;
rest: your commands delight me.

firstLine: The righteousness of your testimonies is forever;
rest: give me understanding that I may live.

firstLine: Qoph
rest:
I call with my whole heart; answer me, O Yahweh.
I will keep your statutes.

firstLine: I rise early in the dawn and cry for help;
rest: I hope in your word.

firstLine: My eyes anticipate the night watches,
rest: that I may meditate on your word.

firstLine: Hear my voice according to your loyal love;
rest: O Yahweh, preserve my life according to your justice.

firstLine: Those who pursue a wicked purpose draw near;
rest: they are far from your law.

firstLine: You are near, O Yahweh,
rest: and all your commands are truth.

firstLine: Concerning your testimonies, I knew long ago
rest: that you have established them forever.

firstLine: Resh
rest:
See my misery and rescue me,
for I do not forget your law.

firstLine: Plead my cause and redeem me;
rest: preserve my life according to your word.

firstLine: Salvation is far from the wicked,
rest: for they do not seek your statutes.

firstLine: Your mercies are great, O Yahweh;
rest: preserve my life according to your ordinances.

firstLine: My persecutors and enemies are many,
rest: yet I do not turn aside from your testimonies.

firstLine: I see the treacherous and I feel disgust,
rest: because they do not heed your word.

firstLine: Consider that I love your precepts;
rest: O Yahweh, according to your loyal love preserve my life.

firstLine: The whole of your word is truth,
rest: and your every righteous judgment endures forever.

firstLine: Sin/Shin
rest:
Princes persecute me without cause,
but my heart trembles because of your word.

firstLine: I am rejoicing over your word,
rest: like one who finds great spoil.

firstLine: I hate and abhor falsehood;
rest: I love your law.

firstLine: I praise you seven times in the day
rest: for your righteous ordinances.

firstLine: Great peace is for those who love your law,
rest: and they do not have a cause for stumbling.

firstLine: I hope for your salvation, O Yahweh,
rest: and do your commands.

firstLine: My soul heeds your testimonies,
rest: and I love them exceedingly.

firstLine: I heed your precepts and testimonies,
rest: because all my ways are before you.

firstLine: Taw
rest:
Let my cry come before you, O Yahweh;
give me understanding according to your word.

firstLine: Let my plea come before you;
rest: Deliver me according to your word.

firstLine: Let my lips pour out praise,
rest: because you teach me your statutes.

firstLine: Let my tongue sing of your word,
rest: because all your commands are right.

firstLine: Let your hand be my help,
rest: because I have chosen your precepts.

firstLine: I long for your salvation, O Yahweh,
rest: and your law is my delight.

firstLine: Let my soul live that it may praise you,
rest: and let your ordinances help me.

firstLine: I have wandered like a lost sheep; seek your servant,
rest: because I do not forget your commands.

firstLine: Prayer for Deliverance from Enemies
rest:
A song of ascents.
In my distress I called to Yahweh,
and he answered me.

firstLine: “Deliver my life, O Yahweh, from lying lips,
rest: from a deceitful tongue.”

firstLine: What shall be given to you,
rest:
and what more shall be done to you,
deceitful tongue?

firstLine: The sharpened arrows of a warrior,
rest: with burning charcoals from broom trees.

firstLine: Woe to me, that I sojourn in Meshech,
rest: that I dwell among the tents of Kedar.

firstLine: Too long my soul has had its dwelling
rest: near one who hates peace.

firstLine: I am for peace, but when I speak,
rest: they are for war.

firstLine: Trust in God’s Protection
My help is from Yahweh,
rest: maker of heaven and earth.

firstLine: He will not allow your foot to be moved;
rest: he who protects you will not slumber.

firstLine: Look, he will not slumber and he will not sleep—
rest: he who protects Israel.

firstLine: Yahweh is your protector;
rest: Yahweh is your shade at your right hand.

firstLine: The sun will not strike you by day,
rest: nor the moon by night.

firstLine: Yahweh will protect you from all evil;
rest: he will protect your life.

firstLine: Yahweh will protect your going out and your coming in
rest: from now until forever.

firstLine: Jerusalem the Site of God’s Presence
rest:
A song of ascents. Of David.
I rejoiced in those who said to me,
“Let us go to the house of Yahweh.”

firstLine: Our feet are standing
rest: within your gates, O Jerusalem—

firstLine: Jerusalem that is built
rest: as a city that is joined together,

firstLine: where the tribes go up,
rest:
the tribes of Yah as a testimony for Israel,
to give thanks to the name of Yahweh.

firstLine: For there the thrones sit for judgment,
rest: thrones of David’s house.

firstLine: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem:
rest: “May those who love you be at ease.

firstLine: May peace be within your walls,
rest: security within your palaces.”

firstLine: For the sake of my brothers and my friends,
rest: I will say, “Peace be within you.”

firstLine: For the sake of the house of Yahweh our God,
rest: I will seek your good.

firstLine: Prayer for Yahweh’s Action in the Face of Scorn
rest:
A song of ascents.
I lift up my eyes to you,
the one enthroned in the heavens.

firstLine: Behold, as the eyes of servants
rest:
look to the hand of their master,
as the eyes of a maid to the hand of her mistress,
so our eyes look to Yahweh our God,
until he is gracious to us.

firstLine: Be gracious to us, O Yahweh, be gracious to us,
rest: for long enough we have had our fill of contempt.

firstLine: For long enough our soul has had its fill of
rest:
the derision of the self-confident,
the contempt of the arrogant.

firstLine: Thanksgiving for Yahweh’s Help
rest:
A song of ascents. Of David.
“If it had not been Yahweh who was on our side,”
do let Israel say,

firstLine: “If it had not been Yahweh who was on our side,
rest: when men rose up against us,

firstLine: then they would have swallowed us alive,
rest: when their anger was kindled against us.

firstLine: Then the waters would have flooded over us,
rest: the torrent would have passed over our soul.

firstLine: Then over our soul would have passed
rest: the raging waters.”

firstLine: Blessed be Yahweh,
rest: who has not made us prey for their teeth.

firstLine: Our soul has escaped like a bird
rest:
from the snare of fowlers.
The snare is broken, and we have escaped.

firstLine: Our help is in the name of Yahweh,
rest: maker of heaven and earth.

firstLine: Confidence in Yahweh’s Protection
rest:
A song of ascents.
Those who trust in Yahweh
are like Mount Zion, which cannot be moved,
but abides forever.

firstLine: As mountains are round about Jerusalem,
rest:
so Yahweh is round about his people,
from now until forever.

firstLine: For the scepter of wickedness shall not rest
rest:
on the land of the righteous,
lest the righteous stretch out
their hands to do wickedness.

firstLine: Do good, O Yahweh, to the good,
rest: and to those upright in their hearts.

firstLine: But regarding those who turn aside to their crooked ways,
rest:
Yahweh will lead them away with the evildoers.
Peace be upon Israel.

firstLine: A Prayer for Restoration
rest:
A song of ascents.
When Yahweh restored the fortunes of Zion,
we were like dreamers.

firstLine: Then our mouth was filled with laughter,
rest:
and our tongue with rejoicing.
Then they said among the nations,
“Yahweh has done great things for these people.”

firstLine: Yahweh has done great things for us;
rest: we are glad.

firstLine: Restore, O Yahweh, our fortunes
rest: like the streams in the Negeb.

firstLine: Those who sow with tears
rest: shall reap with rejoicing.

firstLine: He who diligently goes out with weeping,
rest:
carrying the seed bag,
shall certainly come in with rejoicing,
carrying his sheaves.

firstLine: A Prayer for Protection and Prosperity
rest:
A song of ascents. Of Solomon.
Unless Yahweh builds a house,
its builders labor at it in vain.
Unless Yahweh guards a city,
a guard watches in vain.

firstLine: It is in vain for you who rise early and sit late,
rest:
eating the bread of anxious toil,
when thus he provides for his beloved in his sleep.

firstLine: Look, children are the heritage of Yahweh;
rest: the fruit of the womb is a reward.

firstLine: Like arrows in the hand of a warrior,
rest: so are the children of one’s youth.

firstLine: Blessed Is Everyone Who Fears Yahweh
rest:
A song of ascents.
Blessed is everyone who fears Yahweh,
who walks in his ways.

firstLine: You will indeed eat of the labor of your hands;
rest: you will be happy and it will be well with you.

firstLine: Your wife will be like a fruitful vine
rest:
within your house.
Your children will be like olive shoots
about your table.

firstLine: Look, for thus shall a man be blessed
rest: who fears Yahweh.

firstLine: May Yahweh bless you from Zion,
rest:
that you may see the good of Jerusalem
all the days of your life,

firstLine: Victory Over the Enemies of Zion
rest:
A song of ascents.
“Too often they have attacked me from my youth.”
Let Israel say,

firstLine: “Too often they have attacked me from my youth,
rest: yet they have not prevailed against me.

firstLine: Let all be put to shame and repulsed
rest: who hate Zion.

firstLine: Let them be like grass on the housetops,
rest: that withers before it grows up,

firstLine: with which a reaper cannot fill his hand,
rest: nor the binder of sheaves his arms,

firstLine: so that passersby do not say,
rest:
“The blessing of Yahweh be upon you.
We bless you in the name of Yahweh.”

firstLine: Hope for the Redemption of Yahweh
rest:
A song of ascents.
Out of the depths I call to you, O Yahweh.

firstLine: “O Lord, hear my voice.
rest:
Let your ears be attentive
to the voice of my supplications.

firstLine: If you, O Yah, should keep track of iniquities,
rest: O Lord, who could stand?

firstLine: But with you is forgiveness,
rest: so that you may be feared.”

firstLine: I await Yahweh; my soul awaits,
rest: and I wait for his word.

firstLine: My soul waits for the Lord
rest:
more than watchmen for the morning.
Yes, more than watchmen for the morning.

firstLine: And he will redeem Israel
rest: from all its iniquities.

firstLine: Calm Trust in Yahweh
rest:
A song of ascents. Of David.
My heart is not haughty nor my eyes arrogant.
And I do not concern myself
with things too great and difficult for me.

firstLine: Rather I have soothed and quieted my soul,
rest:
like a weaned child with its mother,
like the weaned child is my soul with me.

firstLine: O Israel, hope in Yahweh
rest: from now until forever.

firstLine: Yahweh Dwells in Zion
rest:
A song of ascents.
O Yahweh, remember with regard to David
all his affliction.

firstLine: How he swore to Yahweh,
rest: he vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob:

firstLine: “I will not enter into the tent of my house,
rest: I will not go up to the couch of my bed,

firstLine: I will give no sleep to my eyes,
rest: no slumber to my eyelids,

firstLine: until I find a place for Yahweh,
rest: a dwelling place for the Mighty One of Jacob.”

firstLine: Look, we heard of it in Ephrathah;
rest: we found her in the fields of Jaar.

firstLine: Let us go to his dwelling places;
rest: Let us worship at his footstool.

firstLine: Arise, O Yahweh, to your resting place,
rest: you and your mighty ark.

firstLine: Let your priests clothe themselves with righteousness,
rest: and let your faithful sing for joy.

firstLine: For the sake of your servant David,
rest: do not turn away the face of your anointed one.

firstLine: Yahweh swore in truth to David;
rest:
he will not turn back from it.
“One from the fruit of your body
I will set on your throne.

firstLine: If your sons will heed my covenant
rest:
and my testimonies that I will teach them,
their sons also forever
will sit on your throne.”

firstLine: For Yahweh has chosen Zion;
rest: he has desired it for his habitation.

firstLine: “This is my resting place forever;
rest: here I will dwell, for I have desired it.

firstLine: I will bless its provisions abundantly;
rest: I will satisfy its poor with bread.

firstLine: I will also clothe its priests with salvation,
rest: and its faithful will shout exuberantly for joy.

firstLine: There I will cause a horn to grow for David;
rest: I will set a lamp for my anointed one.

firstLine: I will clothe his enemies with shame,
rest: but on him his crown will flourish.”

firstLine: The People of God Dwell in Unity
rest:
A song of ascents. Of David.
Look, how good and how pleasant it is
when brothers dwell together in unity.

firstLine: It is like the fragrant oil upon the head,
rest:
running down upon the beard, the beard of Aaron,
that runs down upon the edges of his robes.

firstLine: It is like the dew of Hermon that runs down
rest:
upon the mountains of Zion,
because there Yahweh commanded the blessing—
life forever.

firstLine: Praising Yahweh in the Temple at Night
rest:
A song of ascents.
Look, bless Yahweh, all you the servants of Yahweh,
who serve in the house of Yahweh by night.

firstLine: Lift up your hands in the sanctuary
rest: and bless Yahweh.

firstLine: May Yahweh bless you from Zion,
rest: he who made heaven and earth.

firstLine: Praise to God for His Power and Redemption
rest:
Praise Yah! Praise the name of Yahweh.
Praise him, O servants of Yahweh,

firstLine: who stand in the house of Yahweh,
rest: in the courts of the house of our God.

firstLine: For Yah has chosen Jacob for himself,
rest: Israel as his special possession.

firstLine: For I know that Yahweh is great,
rest: and our Lord is greater than all gods.

firstLine: All that Yahweh desires, he does,
rest:
in heaven and on earth,
in the seas and all the depths.

firstLine: He causes clouds to rise from the edge of the earth;
rest:
he makes lightnings for the rain;
he brings out the wind from his storehouses.

firstLine: Who struck the firstborn of Egypt,
rest: both of humans and animals.

firstLine: He sent signs and wonders into your midst, O Egypt,
rest: against Pharaoh and all his servants.

firstLine: Who struck many nations
rest: and killed mighty kings—

firstLine: Sihon the king of the Amorites,
rest:
and Og the king of Bashan,
and all the kingdoms of Canaan—

firstLine: and he gave their land as an inheritance,
rest: an inheritance for his people Israel.

firstLine: O Yahweh, your name endures forever,
rest: your renown throughout all generations,

firstLine: for Yahweh will plead the cause of his people
rest: and will have compassion on his servants.

firstLine: The idols of the nations are silver and gold,
rest: the work of the hands of humankind.

firstLine: They have mouths, but cannot speak;
rest: they have eyes, but cannot see;

firstLine: they have ears, but cannot hear;
rest: there is not even breath in their mouths.

firstLine: Those who make them become like them,
rest: as does everyone who trusts in them.

firstLine: Blessed be Yahweh from Zion,
rest: who dwells in Jerusalem. Praise Yah!

firstLine: Praise to God for His Creation and Deliverance
rest:
Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good,
for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: Give thanks to the God of gods,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: Give thanks to the Lord of lords,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: To him who alone does great wonders,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: To him who made the heavens with skill,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: To him who spread out the earth above the waters,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: To him who made the great lights,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: The sun to rule the day,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: The moon and stars to rule the night,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: To him who struck Egypt through their firstborn,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: And he brought Israel out from among them,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: With a strong hand and an outstretched arm,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: To him who divided the Red Sea in two,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: And he let Israel cross over through the midst of it,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: But he tossed Pharaoh and his army into the Red Sea,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: To him who led his people through the wilderness,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: To him who struck great kings,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: And he killed mighty kings,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: Sihon the king of the Amorites,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: And Og the king of Bashan,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: And he gave their land as an inheritance,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: An inheritance to Israel his servant,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: Who remembered us in our low estate,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: And he rescued us from our enemies,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: The one who gives food to all flesh,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: Give thanks to the God of heaven,
rest: for his loyal love endures forever.

firstLine: Lament During the Babylonian Exile
rest:
By the rivers of Babylon,
there we sat, yes, we wept,
when we remembered Zion.

firstLine: On the willows in her midst,
rest: we hung up our lyres.

firstLine: For there our captors asked of us
rest:
words of a song,
and our tormentors asked of us jubilation,
“Sing for us from a song of Zion.”

firstLine: How could we sing the song of Yahweh
rest: in a foreign land?

firstLine: If I forget you, O Jerusalem,
rest: let my right hand forget.

firstLine: Let my tongue cling to the roof of my mouth,
Remember, O Yahweh, against the sons of Edom
rest:
the day of Jerusalem,
the ones who said, “Lay it bare! Lay it bare
to its foundation!”

firstLine: O daughter of Babylon, about to be devastated,
rest:
happy shall be he who pays back to you
what you paid out to us.

firstLine: Happy shall be he who seizes
rest:
and smashes your children
against the rock.

firstLine: Thanksgiving for Yahweh’s Goodness
I bow down toward your holy temple
rest:
and give thanks to your name,
because of your loyal love and faithfulness,
for you have magnified your word according to all your name.

firstLine: When I called and you answered me,
rest: you emboldened me in my soul with strength.

firstLine: All the kings of the earth
rest:
will praise you, O Yahweh,
when they have heard the words of your mouth,

firstLine: and they will sing of the ways of Yahweh,
rest: because Yahweh’s glory is great.

firstLine: Though Yahweh is high, yet he sees the lowly,
rest: but the proud he perceives at a distance.

firstLine: Though I walk in the midst of trouble,
rest:
you preserve me alive.
You stretch out your hand against the anger of my enemies,
and you save me with your right hand.

firstLine: The Knowledge of God
rest:
For the music director. Of David. A psalm.
O Yahweh, you have searched me, and you know me.

firstLine: You search out my wandering and my lying down,
rest: and are acquainted with all my ways.

firstLine: For there is not a word yet on my tongue,
rest: but behold, O Yahweh, you know it completely.

firstLine: You barricade me behind and in front,
rest: and set your hand upon me.

firstLine: Where I can go from your Spirit,
rest: or where can I flee from your presence?

firstLine: If I ascend to heaven, there you are,
rest: and if I make my bed in Sheol, look! There you are.

firstLine: If I lift up the wings of the dawn,
rest: and I alight on the far side of the sea,

firstLine: even there your hand would lead me,
rest: and your right hand would hold me fast.

firstLine: And if I should say, “Surely darkness will cover me,
rest: and the light around me will be as night,”

firstLine: even the darkness is not too dark for you,
rest:
and the night shines as the day—
the darkness and the light are alike for you.

firstLine: Indeed you created my inward parts;
rest: you wove me in my mother’s womb.

firstLine: I praise you, because I am fearfully
rest:
and wonderfully made.
Wonderful are your works,
and my soul knows it well.

firstLine: My frame was not hidden from you,
rest:
when I was created secretly,
and intricately woven
in the depths of the earth.

firstLine: Your eyes saw my embryo,
rest:
and in your book they all were written—
days fashioned for me when there was not one of them.

firstLine: And to me, how precious are your thoughts, O God;
rest: how vast is their sum.

firstLine: If I should count them,
rest:
they would outnumber the sand.
I awaken, and I am still with you.

firstLine: If only you would kill the wicked, O God—
rest: so get away from me, you bloodthirsty men—

firstLine: I hate them with a complete hatred;
rest: they have become my enemies.

firstLine: Search me, O God, and know my heart;
rest: test me and know my anxious thoughts.

firstLine: And see if there is in me the worship of false gods,
rest: and lead me in the way everlasting.

firstLine: Prayer for Help in the Face of Enemies
rest:
For the music director. A psalm of David.
Rescue me, O Yahweh, from evil men.
Preserve me from violent men,

firstLine: They sharpen their tongue as sharp as a snake’s;
rest: the venom of a viper is under their lips. Selah

firstLine: O Yahweh, my Lord, the strength of my salvation,
rest: you have covered my head in the day of battle.

firstLine: With respect to the head of those who surround me,
rest: may the harm of their lips cover them.

firstLine: Let burning coals fall on them;
rest:
let them be dropped into the fire,
into bottomless pits from which they cannot rise.

firstLine: Do not let a slanderer be established in the land;
rest: as for the man of violence, let evil hunt him quickly.

firstLine: I know that Yahweh will maintain the cause of the afflicted,
rest: and justice for the needy.

firstLine: Surely the righteous will give thanks to your name;
rest: the upright will dwell in your presence.

firstLine: Prayer for God’s Help in Maintaining Integrity
rest:
A psalm of David.
I call on you, O Yahweh; hasten to me.
Listen to my voice when I call to you.

firstLine: Let my prayer be set before you as incense,
rest: the lifting up of my palms as the evening offering.

firstLine: Set a guard, O Yahweh, over my mouth;
rest: keep watch over the door of my lips.

firstLine: Do not incline my heart to any evil thing,
Let a righteous one strike me in kindness,
rest:
and let him chasten me.
It is oil for my head; let not my head refuse.
For still my prayer is against their evil deeds.

firstLine: When their judges are thrown down the sides of a cliff,
rest: then they will understand that my words were pleasant.

firstLine: As when one plows and breaks up the earth,
rest: so our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol.

firstLine: But my eyes are toward you, O Yahweh, my Lord;
rest: I have taken refuge in you. Do not lay bare my soul.

firstLine: Protect me from the grasp of the trap they have laid for me,
rest: and from the snares of evildoers.

firstLine: Let the wicked fall into their nets,
rest: while I escape altogether.

firstLine: A Prayer for Deliverance from Pursuers
rest:
A maskil of David.
When he was in the cave. A prayer.
I cry out with my voice to Yahweh;
I implore favor with my voice to Yahweh.

firstLine: I pour out my complaint before him;
rest: I declare my trouble before him.

firstLine: When my spirit faints within me,
Attend to my cry,
rest:
for I am brought very low.
Deliver me from my pursuers,
for they are stronger than I.

firstLine: Bring me out of prison,
rest:
that I may give thanks to your name.
The righteous will encircle me,
because you will deal bountifully with me.

firstLine: A Prayer for Rescue from Enemies
rest:
A psalm of David.
O Yahweh, hear my prayer;
listen to my supplications.
In your faithfulness answer me,
and in your righteousness.

firstLine: And do not enter into judgment with your servant,
rest: because no one alive is righteous before you.

firstLine: For the enemy has pursued my soul;
rest:
he has crushed my life to the ground.
He has made me dwell in dark places
like those long dead.

firstLine: And so my spirit grows faint within me;
rest: my heart within me is desolate.

firstLine: I remember the days of long ago;
rest:
I meditate on all your doings.
I muse on the labor of your hands.

firstLine: I stretch out my hands to you;
rest: my soul longs for you like a dry land. Selah

firstLine: Quickly answer me, O Yahweh;
rest:
my spirit fails.
Do not hide your face from me,
or I will become
like those descending to the pit.

firstLine: Cause me to hear your loyal love in the morning,
rest:
for I trust you.
Cause me to know the way that I should go,
for I lift up my soul to you.

firstLine: Teach me to do your will, for you are my God;
rest:
your Spirit is good.
Lead me onto level ground.

firstLine: For your name’s sake, O Yahweh, preserve my life;
rest: in your righteousness bring me out of trouble.

firstLine: And in your loyal love destroy my enemies,
rest:
and exterminate all the adversaries of my soul,
for I am your servant.

firstLine: A Prayer for National Safety
rest:
Of David.
Blessed be Yahweh, my rock,
the one who trains my hands for battle,
my fingers for war—

firstLine: my loyal love and my fortress,
rest:
my stronghold and my deliverer,
my shield, and one in whom I take refuge,
the one who subdues peoples under me.

firstLine: O Yahweh, what is humankind that you take knowledge of him,
rest: or the son of man that you take thought of him?

firstLine: Humankind is like a breath,
rest: his days like a passing shadow.

firstLine: O Yahweh, bow the heavens and come down;
rest: touch the mountains so that they smoke.

firstLine: Flash forth lightning and scatter them;
rest: dispatch your arrows and rout them.

firstLine: Stretch out your hands from on high;
rest:
Rescue me and deliver me from many waters,
from the hand of foreigners,

firstLine: whose mouth speaks falsely,
rest: and their right hand is a false right hand.

firstLine: who gives victory to kings,
rest:
who rescues David his servant
from the evil sword.

firstLine: Rescue me and deliver me
that our sons may be like plants,
rest:
full grown in their youth,
our daughters like corner pillars,
carved in the style of a palace,

firstLine: that our granaries may be full,
rest:
providing produce of all kinds,
that our sheep may produce by the thousands,
by the tens of thousands in our open fields,

firstLine: that our cattle may be pregnant;
rest:
that there be no breach in our walls,
and no going out in exile,
and no outcry in our plazas.

firstLine: A Song of God’s Majesty and Love
rest:
A praise of David.
I will exalt you, my God, O king,
and I will bless your name forever and ever.

firstLine: Every day I will bless you
rest: and praise your name forever and ever.

firstLine: Great is Yahweh, and very worthy of praise,
rest: and his greatness is unsearchable.

firstLine: One generation will laud your works to another,
rest: and will declare your mighty deeds.

firstLine: On the splendor of the glory of your majesty,
rest: and on your wonderful deeds, I will meditate.

firstLine: And they will speak of the power of your awesome deeds,
rest: and I will tell of your greatness.

firstLine: They will utter  the renown of your abundant goodness,
rest: and they will proclaim with joy your righteousness.

firstLine: Yahweh is gracious and compassionate,
rest: slow to anger and great in loyal love.

firstLine: Yahweh is good to all,
rest: and his mercies are over all his works.

firstLine: All your works will praise you, O Yahweh,
rest: and your faithful ones will bless you.

firstLine: They will speak of the glory of your kingdom,
rest: and talk of your power,

firstLine: to make known to the children of humankind his mighty deeds,
rest: and the glory of the majesty of his kingdom.

firstLine: Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom,
rest: and your dominion endures throughout all generations.

firstLine: Yahweh upholds all who are falling,
rest: and raises up all who are bowed down.

firstLine: The eyes of all look hopefully to you,
rest: and you give them their food in due time,

firstLine: opening your hand,
rest: and satisfying the desire of every living creature.

firstLine: Yahweh is righteous in all his ways,
rest: and loyal in all his works.

firstLine: Yahweh is near to all who call on him,
rest: to all who call on him in truth.

firstLine: He fulfills the desire of those who fear him;
rest: he also hears their cry for help, and saves them.

firstLine: Yahweh protects all those who love him,
rest: but all the wicked he will exterminate.

firstLine: My mouth will speak the praise of Yahweh,
rest:
