and all flesh will bless his holy name
forever and ever.

firstLine: Praise to Yahweh for His Help
rest:
Praise Yah.
Praise Yahweh, O my soul.

firstLine: I will praise Yahweh while I live;
rest: I will sing praises to my God while I am still alive.

firstLine: Do not place trust in princes,
rest: in a son of humankind with whom there is no deliverance.

firstLine: His breath departs; he returns to his plot;
rest: on that day his plans perish.

firstLine: Blessed is the one whose help is the God of Jacob,
rest: whose hope is on Yahweh as his God,

firstLine: who made heaven and earth,
rest:
the sea and all that is in them,
the one who keeps faith forever,

firstLine: who executes justice for the oppressed,
rest:
who gives food for the hungry.
Yahweh sets prisoners free;

firstLine: Yahweh opens the eyes of the blind;
rest:
Yahweh raises up those bowed down;
Yahweh loves the righteous;

firstLine: Yahweh will reign forever,
rest:
Your God, O Zion, throughout all generations.
Praise Yah.

firstLine: Praise to Yahweh for His Providence
Yahweh is building Jerusalem;
rest: he gathers the scattered ones of Israel.

firstLine: He is the one who heals the brokenhearted,
rest: and binds up their wounds.

firstLine: He counts the number of the stars;
rest: he gives names to all of them.

firstLine: Great is our Lord, and abundant in power;
rest: his understanding is unlimited.

firstLine: Yahweh helps the afflicted up;
rest: he brings the wicked down to the ground.

firstLine: Sing to Yahweh with thanksgiving;
rest: sing praises to our God with lyre,

firstLine: who covers the heavens with clouds,
rest:
who provides rain for the earth,
who causes grass to grow on the mountains.

firstLine: He gives to the animal its food,
rest: and to the young ravens that cry.

firstLine: He does not delight in the strength of the horse;
rest: he takes no pleasure in the legs of the man.

firstLine: Yahweh takes pleasure in those who fear him,
rest: the ones who hope for his loyal love.

firstLine: Laud Yahweh, O Jerusalem;
rest: praise your God, O Zion,

firstLine: he makes your border peaceful;
rest: he satisfies you with the finest of wheat.

firstLine: He sends out his command to the earth;
rest: his word runs swiftly.

firstLine: He gives snow like wool;
rest: he scatters frost like ashes;

firstLine: He sends out his word and melts them;
rest: he blows his breath, the water flows.

firstLine: He declares his word to Jacob,
rest: his statutes and his ordinances to Israel.

firstLine: He has not done so for any nation,
rest:
and they do not know his ordinances.
Praise Yah.

firstLine: Let All Creation Praise Yahweh
Praise him, all his angels;
rest: praise him, all his hosts.

firstLine: Praise him, sun and moon;
rest: praise him, all stars of light.

firstLine: Praise him, highest heavens,
rest: and waters above the heavens.

firstLine: Let them praise the name of Yahweh,
rest: because he commanded and they were created.

firstLine: And he put them in place forever and ever,
rest: by a decree he gave that will not pass away.

firstLine: Praise Yahweh from the earth—
rest: great sea creatures and all deeps,

firstLine: fire and hail, snow and cloud,
rest: stormy wind doing his bidding,

firstLine: the mountains and all hills,
rest: fruit trees and all cedars,

firstLine: beasts and all cattle,
rest: creeping things and flying birds,

firstLine: kings of the earth and all peoples,
rest: princes and all judges of the earth,

firstLine: young men and young women as well,
rest: the old together with the young—

firstLine: let them praise the name of Yahweh,
rest:
because his name alone is is exalted.
His splendor is above earth and heavens.

firstLine: And he has raised high a horn for his people,
rest:
praise for all his faithful—
for the children of Israel,
a people close to him.
Praise Yah.

firstLine: Praise to God for His Future Judgment
rest:
Praise Yah.
Sing to Yahweh a new song,
his praise in the assembly of the faithful.

firstLine: Let Israel be glad in its maker;
rest: let the children of Zion rejoice in their king.

firstLine: Let them praise his name with dancing;
rest: let them sing praises to him with tambourine and lyre.

firstLine: For Yahweh takes pleasure in his people;
rest: he glorifies the afflicted with salvation.

firstLine: Let the faithful exult in glory;
rest: let them sing for joy on their beds.

firstLine: Let the extolling of God be in their throat,
rest: and a double-edged sword in their hand,

firstLine: to execute vengeance on the nations
rest: and punishment on the peoples,

firstLine: to bind their kings with chains
rest: and their nobles with fetters of iron,

firstLine: Let Everything Praise Yahweh
Praise him for his mighty deeds;
rest: praise him according to the abundance of his greatness.

firstLine: Praise him with blast of horn;
rest: praise him with harp and lyre.

firstLine: Praise him with tambourine and dancing;
rest: praise him with strings and flute.

firstLine: Praise him with sounding cymbals;
rest: praise him with clashing cymbals.

firstLine: Every breathing thing,
rest:
let it praise Yah.
Praise Yah.

firstLine: Prologue
rest: Proverbs of Solomon, son of David, king of Israel:

firstLine: To know wisdom and instruction,
rest: to understand sayings of understanding,

firstLine: to gain insightful instruction,
rest: righteousness and justice and equity,

firstLine: to give shrewdness to the simple,
rest: knowledge and purpose to the young,

firstLine: may the wise hear and increase learning,
rest: and the one who understands gain direction,

firstLine: to understand a proverb and an expression,
rest: words of wisdom and their riddles.

firstLine: Fear of Yahweh is the beginning of knowledge;
rest: wisdom and instruction, fools despise.

firstLine: Lecture Against Gang Behavior
rest:
My child, may you keep your father’s instruction,
and do not reject your mother’s teachings,

firstLine: for they are a garland of favor for your head,
rest: and pendants for your neck.

firstLine: If they say,
Like Sheol, we will swallow them alive
rest: and whole, like those who descend to the pit.

firstLine: We shall find all precious wealth,
rest: we shall fill our houses with booty,

firstLine: you shall throw your lot in our midst,
rest: there will be one purse for all of us.”

firstLine: for their feet run to evil,
rest: and they hurry to shed blood,

firstLine: for “in vain is the net scattered,
rest: in the sight of any winged bird.”

firstLine: Thus are the ways of all who are greedy for gain—
rest: it will take the life of its possessors.

firstLine: The Call of Lady Wisdom
rest:
Wisdom calls out in the streets,
in the squares she raises her voice.

firstLine: On a busy corner she cries out,
rest: at the entrances of the gates in the city, she speaks her sayings:

firstLine: “How long, O simple ones, will you love simplicity?
rest:
And how long will scoffers delight in their scoffing,
and fools hate knowledge?

firstLine: Because I called out and you refused me,
rest: I stretched out my hand, yet there is none who heeds.

firstLine: You have ignored all my counsel,
rest: and my reproof you are not willing to accept.

firstLine: I will also laugh at your calamity;
rest: I will mock when panic comes upon you.

firstLine: When your panic comes like a storm,
rest:
and your calamity arrives like a whirlwind,
when distress and anguish come upon you,

firstLine: then they will call me, but I will not answer;
rest: they will seek me diligently but not find me.

firstLine: Since they hated knowledge,
rest: and did not choose the fear of Yahweh,

firstLine: they were not willing to accept my counsel,
rest: they despised all my reproof.

firstLine: They shall eat from the fruit of their way,
rest: and they shall be sated from their own schemes,

firstLine: for the waywardness of the simple ones will kill them,
rest: and the complacency of fools will destroy them.

firstLine: Whoever listens to me will dwell in security
rest: and rest securely from dread and disaster.”

firstLine: The Benefits of Wisdom
rest:
My child, if you will receive my sayings,
and hide my commands with you,

firstLine: in order to incline your ear toward wisdom,
rest: then you shall apply your heart to understanding.

firstLine: For if you cry out for understanding,
rest: if you lift your voice for insight,

firstLine: if you seek her like silver
rest: and search her out like treasure,

firstLine: then you will understand the fear of Yahweh,
rest: and the knowledge of God you will find.

firstLine: For Yahweh will give wisdom;
rest: from his mouth come knowledge and understanding.

firstLine: in order to guard paths of justice
rest: and keep the way of his faithful ones.

firstLine: Then you will understand righteousness and justice
rest: and uprightness—every good course—

firstLine: for wisdom will enter your heart,
rest: and knowledge will be pleasing to your soul.

firstLine: Discretion will watch over you;
rest: understanding will protect you,

firstLine: in order to deliver you from the way of evil,
rest: from a man who speaks devious things—

firstLine: those who forsake the paths of uprightness
rest: to walk in ways of darkness,

firstLine: those who are happy to do evil,
rest: for they delight in the deviousness of evil,

firstLine: who are crooked in their ways,
rest: and devious in their paths;

firstLine: in order to deliver you from a strange woman,
rest: from a foreign woman who flatters with her sayings,

firstLine: she who forsakes the partner of her youth
rest: and has forgotten the covenant of her God,

firstLine: for her house sinks to death,
rest: and to the dead are her paths.

firstLine: Of all who go to her, none shall return,
rest: nor do they reach paths of life.

firstLine: So that you will walk on the road of those who are good,
rest: and the paths of those who are righteous you shall keep.

firstLine: For those who are upright will dwell in the land,
rest: and those who are blameless will remain in it.

firstLine: And those who are wicked will be cut off from the land,
rest: and those who are treacherous will be uprooted from it.

firstLine: Wisdom and Piety
rest:
My child, do not forget my instruction,
and may your heart guard my commands.

firstLine: For length of days, years of life,
rest: and peace they shall add to you.

firstLine: May loyal love and truth not forsake you;
rest:
bind them around your neck,
write them upon your heart.

firstLine: And you shall find favor and good sense
rest: in the eyes of God and humankind.

firstLine: Trust Yahweh with all your heart;
rest: do not lean toward your own understanding.

firstLine: In all your ways acknowledge him,
rest: and he will straighten your paths.

firstLine: Do not be wise in your own eyes;
rest: fear Yahweh and retreat from evil.

firstLine: There shall be healing for your flesh,
rest: and refreshment for your body.

firstLine: Honor Yahweh from your substance,
rest: and from the firstfruits of all that will come to you,

firstLine: and your barns shall be full of plenty,
rest: and your vats shall burst with new wine.

firstLine: Happy Is the One Who Finds Wisdom
rest:
Do not despise the discipline of Yahweh, my child.
Do not be weary of his reproof

firstLine: because whomever Yahweh will love, he will rebuke,
rest: as a father delights in his son.

firstLine: Happy is the one who finds wisdom,
rest: and one who obtains understanding.

firstLine: For her income is better than the income of silver,
rest: and her revenue than that of gold.

firstLine: She is more precious than rubies,
rest: and all your desires shall not compare with her.

firstLine: Length of days is in her right hand;
rest: in her left hand are riches and honor.

firstLine: Her ways are ways of pleasantness,
rest: and all her paths are peace.

firstLine: She is a tree of life for those who seize her;
rest: those who take hold of her are considered happy.

firstLine: Role of Wisdom in Creation and Society
rest:
Yahweh in wisdom founded the earth;
he established the heavens in understanding.

firstLine: With his knowledge, depths broke open,
rest: and clouds dropped dew.

firstLine: My child, may they not escape from your sight;
rest: may you keep sound wisdom and prudence.

firstLine: They shall be life for your soul
rest: and adornment for your neck.

firstLine: Then you will walk in the confidence of your ways,
rest: and your foot will not stumble.

firstLine: If you sit down, you will not panic,
rest: and if you lie down, then your sleep shall be sweet.

firstLine: Do not be afraid of sudden panic,
rest: or the storm of wickedness that will come.

firstLine: Yahweh will be your confidence
rest: and guard your foot from capture.

firstLine: Do not withhold good from its owner
rest: when it is in the power of your hand to do.

firstLine: Do not say to your neighbor,
rest:
“Go and return and tomorrow I will give it,”
when it is with you.

firstLine: Do not plot harm against your neighbor
rest: who dwells in confidence beside you.

firstLine: Do not quarrel with anyone without cause,
rest: when he did not do you harm.

firstLine: Do not envy a man of violence,
rest: and do not choose any of his ways,

firstLine: for he who is perverse is an abomination of Yahweh,
rest: but those who are upright are his confidence.

firstLine: The curse of Yahweh is on the house of the wicked,
rest: and the abode of the righteous ones he blesses.

firstLine: With those who scorn, he is scornful,
rest: but to those who are humble, he gives favor.

firstLine: They will inherit the honor of the wise,
rest: but stubborn fools, disgrace.

firstLine: The Father’s Wisdom
rest:
Children, listen to the instruction of a father,
and be attentive in order to know insight.

firstLine: For I have given you good instruction;
rest: do not forsake my teaching.

firstLine: When I was a son to my father,
rest: tender and alone before my mother,

firstLine: he taught me and said to me,
rest:
“May your heart hold fast to my words;
guard my commandments and live.

firstLine: Get wisdom and insight;
rest: do not forget and do not turn from the sayings of my mouth.

firstLine: Do not forsake her—then she will guard you;
rest: love her and she will keep you.

firstLine: Cherish her and she will exalt you;
rest: she will honor you if you embrace her.

firstLine: She will give a garland for your head;
rest: she shall bestow a crown of glory upon you.”

firstLine: The Right Path
rest:
Listen, my child, take my sayings,
and the years of your life shall be great.

firstLine: In the way of wisdom I have instructed you;
rest: I have led you in the path of uprightness.

firstLine: When you walk, your step will not be hampered,
rest: and if you run, you will not stumble.

firstLine: In the path of the wicked do not go;
rest: do not walk in the way of those who do evil.

firstLine: Avoid it; do not transgress it;
rest: turn away from it and pass by.

firstLine: For they will not sleep if they have not done wrong,
rest: and they are robbed of their sleep if they do not cause stumbling.

firstLine: For they ate the bread of wickedness,
rest: and they drank the wine of violence.

firstLine: But the path of the righteous ones is like the light of dawn,
rest: leading and shining until the day is full.

firstLine: The way of the wicked ones is like deep darkness;
rest: they do not know what they stumble over.

firstLine: Staying the Course
rest:
My child, be attentive to my words;
to my sayings incline your ear.

firstLine: May they not escape from your sight;
rest: keep them in the midst of your heart.

firstLine: For they are life to those who find them
rest: and healing to the entire body.

firstLine: With all vigilance, keep your heart,
rest: for from it comes the source of life.

firstLine: Remove from yourself deceitful speech,
rest: and abolish devious talk from yourself.

firstLine: May your eyes look forward
rest: and your gaze be straight before you.

firstLine: May the path of your foot be balanced
rest: and all your ways be sure.

firstLine: Do not swerve right or left;
rest: remove your foot from evil.

firstLine: My child, be attentive to my wisdom,
rest: and to my understanding incline your ear;

firstLine: in order to keep prudence,
rest: and knowledge will guard your lips.

firstLine: For the lips of the strange woman will drip honey,
rest: and smoother than oil is her mouth.

firstLine: But her end is bitter as the wormwood,
rest: sharp as a two-edged sword.

firstLine: Her feet go down to death;
rest: her steps take hold of Sheol.

firstLine: She does not observe the path of life;
rest: her ways wander, and she does not know it.

firstLine: Do Not Commit Adultery Against Wisdom
rest:
Now, O children, listen to me;
do not depart from the sayings of my mouth.

firstLine: Keep your paths far from her,
rest: and do not go near to the door of her house,

firstLine: lest you give your honor to the others,
rest: and your years to the merciless,

firstLine: lest strangers take their fill of your strength,
rest: and your labors go to the house of a foreigner,

firstLine: and you groan at your end,
rest: when your flesh and body are consumed,

firstLine: and say “How I hated discipline,
rest: and I despised reproof!”

firstLine: and “I did not listen to the voice of my teachers,
rest: and I did not incline my ear to my instructors!

firstLine: I was almost at utter ruin
rest: in the midst of the assembly and congregation.”

firstLine: Drink water from your own cistern
rest: and flowing waters from inside your own well.

firstLine: May they be yours alone,
rest: and not for strangers who are with you.

firstLine: May your fountain be blessed,
rest: and rejoice in the wife of your youth.

firstLine: She is a deer of love and a doe of grace;
rest:
may her breasts satisfy you always;
by her love may you be intoxicated continually.

firstLine: Why should you be intoxicated, my child, by a strange woman,
rest: and embrace the bosom of a foreigner?

firstLine: For before the eyes of Yahweh are human ways,
rest: and all his paths he examines.

firstLine: His iniquities shall ensnare him, the evildoer,
rest: and in the vanity of his sin he shall be caught.

firstLine: He shall die for lack of discipline,
rest: and in the greatness of his folly he shall be lost.

firstLine: Against Pledges
rest:
My child, if you have pledged to your neighbor,
if you have bound yourself to the stranger,

firstLine: if you are snared by the sayings of your mouth,
rest: if you are caught by the sayings of your mouth,

firstLine: do this, then, my child, and save yourself,
rest:
for you have come into the palm of your neighbor’s hand:
Go, humble yourself, plead with your neighbor.

firstLine: Do not give sleep to your eyes,
rest: or slumber to your eyelids.

firstLine: Save yourself like a gazelle from a hand,
rest: or like a bird from the hand of a fowler.

firstLine: Against Sloth
rest:
Go to the ant, lazy!
Consider its ways and be wise.

firstLine: It has no chief,
rest: officer, or ruler.

firstLine: In the summer, it prepares its food;
rest: in the harvest, it gathers its sustenance.

firstLine: A little sleep, a little slumber,
rest: a little folding of the hands for rest—

firstLine: like a robber shall your poverty come,
rest: and what you lack like an armed man.

firstLine: Against Worthlessness
rest:
A worthless man, an evil man,
goes around with deceitful speech.

firstLine: Winking in his eye, shuffling in his foot,
rest: pointing in his fingers,

firstLine: perversion in his heart, he devises evil;
rest: at all times he will send out discord.

firstLine: Upon such a man, suddenly shall his calamity come;
rest: in a moment he will be damaged and there is no healing.

firstLine: What Yahweh Hates
rest:
There are six things Yahweh hates,
and seven things are abominations of his soul:

firstLine: haughty eyes, a lying tongue,
rest: and hands that shed innocent blood,

firstLine: a devising heart, plans of deception,
rest: feet that hurry to run to evil,

firstLine: a false witness who breathes lies
rest: and sends out discord between brothers.

firstLine: Commandment and Instruction as Guardians
rest:
My child, keep the commandment of your father,
and do not disregard the instruction of your mother.

firstLine: Bind them on your heart continually;
rest: tie them upon your neck.

firstLine: When you walk, she will lead you,
rest:
When you lie down, she will watch over you,
and when you awake, she will converse with you.

firstLine: For like a lamp is a commandment, and instruction is light,
rest: and the way of life is the reproof of discipline,

firstLine: in order to preserve you from an evil woman,
rest: from the smoothness of the tongue of an adulteress.

firstLine: Do not desire her beauty in your heart;
rest: may she not capture you with her eyelashes.

firstLine: For the price of a woman, a prostitute, is the price of a loaf of bread,
rest: but the woman belonging to a man hunts precious life.

firstLine: Warning Against Relations with a Married Woman
rest:
Can a man carry fire in his lap,
and his clothes not burn?

firstLine: If a man walks upon the hot coals,
rest: will his feet not be burned?

firstLine: Thus, he who goes to the wife of his neighbor,
rest: any who touches her shall not go unpunished.

firstLine: People do not despise a thief when he steals
rest: to fill himself when he is hungry.

firstLine: But if he is found, he will pay sevenfold,
rest: every possession of his house he shall give.

firstLine: He who commits adultery with a woman lacks sense,
rest: he destroys himself who does it.

firstLine: A wound and dishonor he will find,
rest: and his disgrace will not be wiped out.

firstLine: For jealousy is the fury of a husband,
rest: and he will not show restraint on the day of revenge.

firstLine: He will not accept any compensation,
rest: and he will not be willing, though the bribe is large.

firstLine: Warning Against the Strange Woman
rest:
My child, guard my sayings;
store my commandments with you.

firstLine: Keep my commands and live,
rest: and my teaching like the apple of your eye.

firstLine: Bind them on your fingers;
rest: write them on the tablet of your heart.

firstLine: Say to wisdom, “you are my sister,”
rest: and you shall call insight, “intimate friend.”

firstLine: In order to guard yourself from an adulteress,
rest: from the foreigner who makes her words smooth.

firstLine: For at the window of my house,
rest: through my lattice, I looked down.

firstLine: And I saw among the simple,
rest:
I observed among the youth,
a young man lacking sense,

firstLine: passing on the street at her corner,
rest: and he takes the road to her house,

firstLine: at twilight, at the day’s evening,
rest: in the midst of night and the darkness.

firstLine: She is loud and stubborn;
rest: her feet do not stay at her house.

firstLine: Now in the street, now in the square,
rest: at every corner she lies in wait.

firstLine: “Sacrifices of peace offerings are upon me;
rest: today I completed my vows.

firstLine: So I have come out to meet you,
rest: to seek your face, and I have found you.

firstLine: With coverings I have adorned my couch,
rest: spreads of the linen of Egypt;

firstLine: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh,
rest: aloes, and cinnamon.

firstLine: Come, let us take our fill of love making,
rest: until the morning let us delight in love.

firstLine: For there is no man in his home;
rest: he has gone on a long journey.

firstLine: The bag of money he took in his hand,
rest: for on the day of the full moon he will come home.”

firstLine: She persuades him with the greatness of her teachings;
rest: with her smooth lips she compels him.

firstLine: He goes after her suddenly;
rest:
like an ox to the slaughter he goes,
and like a stag to the instruction of a fool,

firstLine: until an arrow pierces his entrails,
rest:
like a bird rushing into a snare,
but he does not know that it will cost him his life.

firstLine: Reiteration of the Warning Against a Strange Woman
rest:
And now, my children, listen to me,
and be attentive to the sayings of my mouth.

firstLine: May your heart not turn aside to her ways;
rest: do not stray into her path.

firstLine: For many slain she has laid low,
rest: and countless are all of her killings.

firstLine: The ways of Sheol are her house,
rest: descending to chambers of death.

firstLine: Wisdom Calls
rest:
Does not wisdom call,
and understanding raise its voice?

firstLine: Atop the heights beside the road,
rest: at the crossroads she stands.

firstLine: Beside gates, before towns,
rest: at the entrance of doors, she cries out:

firstLine: “To you, O people, I call,
rest: and my cry is to the children of humankind.

firstLine: Learn prudence, O simple ones;
rest: fools, learn intelligence.

firstLine: My mouth will utter truth,
rest: and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.

firstLine: All sayings of my mouth are in righteousness;
rest: none of them are twisted and crooked.

firstLine: All of them are straight to him who understands,
rest: and upright to those who find knowledge.

firstLine: Take my teaching and not silver;
rest: may you choose knowledge rather than choice gold.

firstLine: For wisdom is better than jewels,
rest: and all desires shall not compare with her.

firstLine: I, wisdom, live with prudence,
rest: and I find knowledge and discretion.

firstLine: The fear of Yahweh is hatred of evil,
rest:
pride, and arrogance and an evil way.
And I hate a mouth of perversity.

firstLine: Advice and sound judgment are mine;
rest: I am understanding, strength is mine.

firstLine: By me kings reign,
rest: and rulers decree righteousness.

firstLine: By me rulers rule,
rest: and nobles—all judges of righteousness.

firstLine: I love those who love me,
rest: and those who seek me diligently shall find me.

firstLine: Fortune and glory are with me,
rest: enduring wealth and righteousness.

firstLine: My fruit is better than gold, even refined gold,
rest: and my yield than choice silver.

firstLine: In the way of righteousness I walk,
rest: in the midst of paths of justice,

firstLine: in order to endow those who love me with wealth,
rest: and I will fill their treasuries.

firstLine: Wisdom at Creation
rest:
“Yahweh possessed me, the first of his ways,
before his acts of old.

firstLine: From eternity, I was set up from the first,
rest: from the beginning of the earth.

firstLine: When there were no depths, I was brought forth,
rest: when there were no springs of abounding water.

firstLine: Before mountains had been shaped,
rest: before hills, I was brought forth.

firstLine: When he had not yet made earth and fields,
rest: or the first dust of the world,

firstLine: when he established the heavens, there I was,
rest: when he drew a circle upon the face of the deep,

firstLine: when he made skies from above,
rest: when he founded fountains of the deep,

firstLine: when he assigned his limits to the sea,
rest:
that waters shall not transgress his command,
when he marked the foundations of the earth,

firstLine: I was beside him, a master workman,
rest:
and I was delighting day by day,
rejoicing before him always,

firstLine: rejoicing in the world of his earth,
rest: and my delight was with the children of humankind.

firstLine: Benefits of Following Wisdom
rest:
“And now, children, listen to me;
happy are those who will keep my ways.

firstLine: Hear teaching and be wise;
rest: do not neglect it.

firstLine: Happy is the person who listens to me,
rest:
in order to keep watch at my doors day by day,
in order to guard the frames of my entrances.

firstLine: For he who finds me is he who finds life,
rest: and he obtains favor from Yahweh.

firstLine: Wisdom’s Banquet
rest:
Wisdom has built her house;
she has hewn her seven pillars.

firstLine: She has slaughtered her slaughtering, mixed her wine,
rest: and also set her table.

firstLine: She has sent her servant girls, she calls
rest: upon the wings of the high places of town,

firstLine: “Whoever is simple, let him turn here.”
rest: As for the one who lacks sense, she says to him,

firstLine: “Come, eat with my bread;
rest: drink with the wine I have mixed.

firstLine: Lay aside simplicity and live;
rest: walk in the way of understanding.”

firstLine: He who corrects a scoffer gains abuse for himself,
rest: and he who rebukes the wicked gets hurt.

firstLine: Do not rebuke a scoffer, lest he hate you;
rest: rebuke the wise and he will love you.

firstLine: Give to a wise one and he will become more wise;
rest: teach a righteous one and he will increase learning.

firstLine: Foolishness’ Banquet
rest:
The start of wisdom is fear of Yahweh,
and knowledge of the Holy One, insight.

firstLine: For by me your days shall increase,
rest: and years of life shall multiply for you.

firstLine: If you are wise, you are wise for yourself,
rest: and if you scoff, alone you shall bear it.

firstLine: A woman of foolishness is loud,
rest: simple, and does not know it.

firstLine: She sits at the door of her house,
rest: upon a throne at the high places of town,

firstLine: in order to call to those who pass by the road,
rest: those who go straight on their way:

firstLine: “Whoever is simple, may he turn here!”
rest: As for he who lacks sense, she says to him,

firstLine: “Stolen waters are sweet,
rest: and bread of secrecy is pleasant.”

firstLine: But he does not know that the dead are there,
rest: in the depths of Sheol are her guests.

firstLine: Proverbs of Solomon
rest:
The proverbs of Solomon:
A wise child makes a father glad,
but a foolish child grieves his mother.

firstLine: Treasures of wickedness do not profit,
rest: but righteousness delivers from death.

firstLine: Yahweh will not cause a righteous person to go hungry,
rest: but the craving of the wicked he will thwart.

firstLine: A slack hand causes poverty,
rest: but the hand of the diligent enriches.

firstLine: He who gathers in the summer is a child who is prudent;
rest: he who sleeps at the harvest is a child who brings shame.

firstLine: Blessings belong to the head of the righteous,
rest: but the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.

firstLine: The memory of righteousness is like a blessing,
rest: but the name of the wicked will rot.

firstLine: A heart of wisdom will heed commandments,
rest: but a babbling fool will come to ruin.

firstLine: Whoever walks in integrity will walk securely,
rest: but whoever follows perversity, his ways will be made known.

firstLine: The winking of an eye causes trouble,
rest: and the foolishness of lips comes to ruin.

firstLine: A fountain of life is a mouth of righteousness,
rest: and a mouth of wickedness conceals violence.

firstLine: Hatred stirs up strife,
rest: but love covers over all offenses.

firstLine: On the lips of one who has understanding, wisdom is found,
rest: but a rod is for the back of one who lacks sense.

firstLine: Those who are wise lay up knowledge,
rest: but to the mouth of the fool, ruin draws near.

firstLine: The wealth of the rich is the city of his strength;
rest: the ruin of the poor is their poverty.

firstLine: The wage of the righteous leads to life;
rest: the gain of the wicked to sin.

firstLine: On the path to life is he who guards instruction,
rest: but he who rejects rebuke goes astray.

firstLine: He who conceals hatred has lips of deceit,
rest: and he who utters slander—he is a fool.

firstLine: In many words, transgression is not lacking,
rest: but he who restrains his lips is prudent.

firstLine: Choice silver is a tongue of righteousness,
rest: a heart of wickedness is of little worth.

firstLine: Lips of righteousness feed many,
rest: but fools die for lack of sense.

firstLine: The blessing of Yahweh makes one rich,
rest: and he does not increase sorrow with it.

firstLine: It is like a sport for a fool to do wrong,
rest: wisdom for a person of understanding.

firstLine: The dread of the wicked will come upon him,
rest: but the desire of the righteous will be granted.

firstLine: With the passing of the tempest, there is no wickedness,
rest: but the righteous have a foundation forever.

firstLine: Like vinegar to the tooth and like smoke to the eyes,
rest: thus is the lazy to one who employs him.

firstLine: The fear of Yahweh adds life,
rest: but the years of the wicked are shortened.

firstLine: The hope of the righteous is gladness,
rest: but the expectation of the wicked comes to nothing.

firstLine: A stronghold for the upright is the way of Yahweh,
rest: but ruin belongs to evildoers.

firstLine: The mouth of the righteous brings forth wisdom,
rest: but a tongue of perversity will be cut off.

firstLine: The lips of the righteous know the acceptable,
rest: but the mouth of the wicked, the perverse.

firstLine: Balances of deceit are an abomination of Yahweh,
rest: but an accurate weight delights him.

firstLine: Pride comes, then disgrace comes,
rest: but wisdom is with the humble.

firstLine: The integrity of the upright guides them,
rest: but the crookedness of the treacherous destroys them.

firstLine: Wealth does not profit on the day of wrath,
rest: but righteousness will deliver from death.

firstLine: The righteousness of the blameless will keep his ways straight,
rest: but the wicked will fall by his wickedness.

firstLine: The righteousness of the upright will save them,
rest: but by a scheme the treacherous will be taken captive.

firstLine: With the death of a wicked person, hope will die,
rest: and the expectation of the godless perishes.

firstLine: The righteous is delivered from trouble,
rest: but the wicked enters into it.

firstLine: With a mouth, the godless shall destroy his neighbor,
rest: but by knowledge the righteous are delivered.

firstLine: When good is with the righteous, the city rejoices,
rest: and with the perishing of the wicked, jubilation.

firstLine: By the blessing of the upright, a city will be exalted,
rest: but by the mouth of the wicked, it will be overthrown.

firstLine: He who lacks sense belittles his neighbor,
rest: but a person of intelligence will remain silent.

firstLine: A gossip walks about telling a secret,
rest: but the trustworthy in spirit keeps the matter.

firstLine: Where there is no guidance, a nation shall fall,
rest: but there is safety in an abundance of counsel.

firstLine: He will suffer trouble when he loans to a stranger,
rest: but he who refuses a pledge is safe.

firstLine: A woman of grace receives honor,
rest: but the ruthless gets wealth.

firstLine: A person of kindness rewards himself,
rest: but a cruel person harms his own flesh.

firstLine: The wicked earns deceptive gain,
rest: but he who sows righteousness, a true reward.

firstLine: He who is steadfast in righteousness is to life
rest: as he who pursues evil is to death.

firstLine: An abomination of Yahweh are the crooked of heart,
rest: but his delight are those with blameless ways.

firstLine: Rest assured, the wicked will not go unpunished,
rest: but the offspring of the righteous will escape.

firstLine: A ring of gold in the snout of a pig
rest: is a woman who is beautiful but without discretion.

firstLine: The desire of the righteous is only good,
rest: but the expectation of the wicked, wrath.

firstLine: There is one who gives yet grows richer,
rest: but he who withholds what is right only finds need.

firstLine: A person of blessing will be enriched,
rest: and he who gives water also will be refreshed.

firstLine: He who withholds grain, the people curse him,
rest: but a blessing is for the head of him who sells.

firstLine: He who diligently seeks good seeks favor,
rest: but he who inquires of evil, it will come to him.

firstLine: He who trusts in his wealth is he who will fall,
rest: but like a green leaf the righteous will flourish.

firstLine: He who brings trouble to his household, he will inherit wind,
rest: and a fool will serve the wise of heart.

firstLine: The fruit of righteousness is a tree of life,
rest: and he who captures souls is wise.

firstLine: If the righteous on earth will be repaid,
rest: how much more the wicked and sinner.

firstLine: He who loves discipline loves knowledge,
rest: but he who hates rebuke is stupid.

firstLine: The good obtains favor from Yahweh,
rest: but anyone who schemes, he condemns.

firstLine: A person will not be established by wickedness,
rest: but the root of the righteous will not be moved.

firstLine: A woman of strength is the crown of her master,
rest: but like rot in his bones is she who brings shame.

firstLine: The thoughts of the righteous are just;
rest: the advice of the wicked is treacherous.

firstLine: The words of the wicked are an ambush of blood,
rest: but the mouth of the upright delivers them.

firstLine: The wicked are overthrown and are no more,
rest: but the house of the righteous shall stand.

firstLine: For his mouth of good sense, a man will be recommended,
rest: but he who is of perverse mind will be despised.

firstLine: It is better to be lowly and a servant to someone
rest: than self-glorifying and lacking food.

firstLine: The righteous knows the life of his animal,
rest: but the compassion of the wicked is cruel.

firstLine: He who works his land will have plenty of food,
rest: but he who follows worthless things lacks sense.

firstLine: The wicked covets the proceeds of evil,
rest: but the root of the righteous bears fruit.

firstLine: By the transgression of lips, evil is ensnared,
rest: but the righteous escapes from trouble.

firstLine: From the fruit of the mouth of a man, he is filled with good,
rest: and the reward of a man’s labor will return to him.

firstLine: The way of a fool is upright in his own eyes,
rest: but he who listens to advice is wise.

firstLine: As for a fool, on that very day he makes his anger known,
rest: but he who ignores an insult is prudent.

firstLine: He who will speak truth will reveal righteousness,
rest: but the witness of falsehood, deceit.

firstLine: There is one who speaks rashly, like the thrust of a sword,
rest: but the tongue of the wise brings healing.

firstLine: A lip of truth endures forever,
rest: but a tongue of deception lasts only a moment.

firstLine: Deceit is in the heart of those who plan evil,
rest: but to those who plan peace, there is joy.

firstLine: No evil will happen to the righteous,
rest: but the wicked are filled with trouble.

firstLine: An abomination of Yahweh are lips of deceit,
rest: but they who act faithfully are his delight.

firstLine: A clever person conceals knowledge,
rest: but the heart of a fool announces folly.

firstLine: The hand of the diligent ones will rule,
rest: but the lazy will belong to forced labor.

firstLine: Anxiety in the heart of a man will weigh him down,
rest: but a good word will cheer him.

firstLine: A righteous person will seek out his neighbor,
rest: but the way of the wicked will lead them astray.

firstLine: The lazy will not roast his game,
rest: but diligence is the precious wealth of a man.

firstLine: On the road of righteousness is life,
rest: and on the way of the path, may there be no death.

firstLine: A wise child hears the discipline of a father,
rest: but a scoffer does not listen to a rebuke.

firstLine: From the fruit of the mouth of a man, he shall eat what is good,
rest: but the desire of the treacherous, wrongdoing.

firstLine: He who keeps his mouth guards his life;
rest: he who opens his lips, ruin belongs to him.

firstLine: The soul of the lazy craves, but there is nothing,
rest: but the person of diligence is richly supplied.

firstLine: The righteous hates a word of falsehood;
rest: the wicked will bring shame and disgrace.

firstLine: Righteousness will guard the upright of way,
rest: but wickedness will overthrow sin.

firstLine: There is one who acts rich but has nothing;
rest: another who pretends to be poor but has wealth.

firstLine: The ransom of the life of a man is his wealth,
rest: but the poor does not receive a threat.

firstLine: The light of the righteous will rejoice,
rest: but the lamp of the wicked will die out.

firstLine: Only by insolence is strife set up,
rest: and wisdom is with those who take advice.

firstLine: Wealth gained from haste will dwindle,
rest: but he who gathers little by little will increase it.

firstLine: Hope that is deferred makes the heart sick,
rest: but a desire fulfilled is a tree of life.

firstLine: He who despises a word will bring destruction on himself,
rest: but he who respects a commandment will be rewarded.

firstLine: The teaching of the wise is a fountain of life,
rest: in order to avoid the snares of death.

firstLine: Good sense grants favor,
rest: but the way of the faithless is coarse.

firstLine: Anyone who is clever will act with intelligence,
rest: but the fool will display folly.

firstLine: A messenger of wickedness will fall into trouble,
rest: but an envoy of the faithful brings healing.

firstLine: Poverty and disgrace belong to him who ignores instruction,
rest: but he who guards reproof will be honored.

firstLine: A desire fulfilled will be sweet to the soul,
rest: but an abomination of fools is turning from evil.

firstLine: Walk with the wise and be wise,
rest: but as for the companion of fools, he will suffer harm.

firstLine: Misfortune will pursue sinners,
rest: but the righteous will be rewarded with prosperity.

firstLine: He who is good will leave an inheritance to his grandchildren,
rest: and stored up for the righteous is the wealth of a sinner.

firstLine: There is much food in the field of the poor,
rest: but it is swept away by injustice.

firstLine: He who withholds his rod hates his child,
rest: but he who loves him gives him discipline.

firstLine: The righteous eats to satisfy his life,
rest: but the belly of the wicked will lack.

firstLine: The wisest of women builds her house,
rest: but the foolish tears it down with her hands.

firstLine: He who walks in uprightness fears Yahweh,
rest: but he who is devious in his ways displeases him.

firstLine: In the mouth of a fool is the rod of pride,
rest: but the lips of the wise preserve them.

firstLine: When there are no oxen the manger is empty,
rest: but an abundance of crops comes by the strength of an ox.

firstLine: A faithful witness does not lie,
rest: but he who breathes out falsehood is a witness of deceit.

firstLine: A scoffer seeks wisdom, but there is none,
rest: but knowledge comes easily to him who understands.

firstLine: Leave the presence of a foolish man,
rest: for you will not come to know words of knowledge.

firstLine: The wisdom of the clever is understanding his ways,
rest: but the folly of fools is deceit.

firstLine: Fools mock the guilt offering,
rest: but among the upright, it is favorable.

firstLine: The heart knows the bitterness of its soul,
rest: but in its joy, it will not share itself with a stranger.

firstLine: The house of the wicked will be destroyed,
rest: but the tent of the upright will flourish.

firstLine: There is a way that seems upright to a man,
rest: but its end is the way of death.

firstLine: Even in laughter, a heart may be sad,
rest: and the end of joy may be grief.

firstLine: From his ways, the perverse of heart will be satisfied,
rest: and from his own, so shall a good man.

firstLine: The simple will believe every word,
rest: but the clever will consider his step.

firstLine: The wise is cautious and turns from evil,
rest: but the fool throws off restraint and is confident.

firstLine: He who is short of temper will act foolishly,
rest: and the man who schemes will be hated.

firstLine: The simple are adorned with folly,
rest: but the clever are crowned with knowledge.

firstLine: The evil bow down before the good,
rest: and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.

firstLine: The poor is disliked even by his neighbor,
rest: but the lovers of the rich are many.

firstLine: He who despises his neighbor is a sinner,
rest: but he who has mercy on the poor blesses him.

firstLine: In all toil, there is profit,
rest: but the talk of lips leads only to poverty.

firstLine: The crown of the wise is their wealth;
rest: the folly of fools is folly.

firstLine: He who saves lives is a witness of truth,
rest: but he who utters lies is a betrayer.

firstLine: In the fear of Yahweh, there is confidence of strength,
rest: and for his children, there will be refuge.

firstLine: The fear of Yahweh is a fountain of life,
rest: in order to turn from the snares of death.

firstLine: In the multitude of people is the glory of the king,
rest: but without a population, a prince is ruined.

firstLine: He who is slow to anger has great understanding,
rest: but the hasty of spirit exalts folly.

firstLine: A heart of tranquility is life to the flesh,
rest: but causes bones of passion to rot.

firstLine: He who oppresses the poor insults him who made him,
rest: but he who has mercy on the poor honors him.

firstLine: By his evildoing, the wicked will be overthrown,
rest: and the righteous will find refuge in his death.

firstLine: In the heart of him who has understanding, wisdom rests,
rest: but even in the midst of fools it becomes known.

firstLine: Righteousness will exalt a nation,
rest: but sin is a reproach to a people.

firstLine: The favor of a king is for the servant who deals wisely,
rest: but his wrath will be on him who acts shamefully.

firstLine: A soft answer will turn away wrath,
rest: but a word of trouble will stir anger.

firstLine: The tongue of the wise will dispense knowledge,
rest: but the mouth of fools will pour out folly.

firstLine: In every place, the eyes of Yahweh
rest: keep watch over the evil and the good.

firstLine: Gentleness of tongue is a tree of life,
rest: but perverseness in it causes a break in spirit.

firstLine: A fool will despise the instruction of his father,
rest: but he who guards reproof is prudent.

firstLine: In the house of the righteous there is much treasure,
rest: but the income of the wicked brings trouble.

firstLine: The lips of the wise will spread knowledge,
rest: but the heart of fools, not so.

firstLine: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination of Yahweh,
rest: but the prayer of the upright is his delight.

firstLine: An abomination of Yahweh is the way of the wicked,
rest: but he who pursues righteousness he will love.

firstLine: Severe discipline belongs to him who forsakes the way;
rest: he who hates a rebuke will die.

firstLine: Sheol and Abaddon are before Yahweh,
rest: how much more the hearts of the children of men!

firstLine: A scoffer does not like his rebuke;
rest: to the wise he will not go.

firstLine: A heart of gladness will make good countenance,
rest: but in sorrow of heart a spirit is broken.

firstLine: The heart of him who understands will seek knowledge,
rest: but the faces of fools, they will feed on folly.

firstLine: All the days of the poor are hard,
rest: but goodness of heart is a continuous feast.

firstLine: Better is little with the fear of Yahweh
rest: than great treasure and trouble with it.

firstLine: Better is a dinner of vegetables when love is there
rest: than a fattened ox and hatred with it.

firstLine: A man who is hot-tempered will stir up strife,
rest: but he who is slow to anger, he will calm contention.

firstLine: The way of the lazy is like a hedge of thorns,
rest: but the path of the upright is a highway.

firstLine: A child of wisdom will make a father glad,
rest: but a foolish person, he despises his mother.

firstLine: Folly is a joy to him who lacks sense,
rest: and a person of understanding will walk upright.

firstLine: Plans go wrong when there is no counsel,
rest: but with many advisors it will succeed.

firstLine: Joy belongs to a man with answers in his mouth,
rest: and a word in its time, how good it is!

firstLine: The path of life leads upward for him who has insight,
rest: in order to turn away from Sheol below.

firstLine: The house of the proud, Yahweh will tear it down,
rest: but he will maintain the property line of the widow.

firstLine: Plans of evil are an abomination of Yahweh,
rest: but gracious words are pure.

firstLine: He who makes trouble for his house is he who is greedy for unjust gain,
rest: but he who hates bribes will live.

firstLine: A heart of righteousness will ponder the answer,
rest: but a mouth of wickedness will pour out deceit.

firstLine: Yahweh is far from the wicked,
rest: but the prayers of the righteous he will hear.

firstLine: From the light of the eyes, the heart will rejoice,
rest: and good news will enliven the bones.

firstLine: The ear of him who listens to admonitions of life,
rest: in the midst of the wise it will lodge.

firstLine: He who ignores instruction despises himself,
rest: but he who hears admonition gains heart.

firstLine: Fear of Yahweh is the instruction of the wise,
rest: and before honor comes humility.

firstLine: To mortals belong the plans of the heart,
rest: but from Yahweh comes the answer of the tongue.

firstLine: All the ways of a man are pure in his own eyes,
rest: but Yahweh weighs the spirit.

firstLine: Commit your work to Yahweh,
rest: and your plans will be established.

firstLine: All Yahweh has made is for his purpose,
rest: and even the wicked for the day of trouble.

firstLine: An abomination of Yahweh are all who are arrogant of heart;
rest: rest assured, he will not go unpunished.

firstLine: By loyalty and faithfulness, iniquity will be covered over,
rest: and by fear of Yahweh one turns from evil.

firstLine: When the ways of a man are pleasing to Yahweh,
rest: even his enemies he will cause to make peace with him.

firstLine: Better is little with righteousness
rest: than great income with no justice.

firstLine: The mind of a person will plan his ways,
rest: and Yahweh will direct his steps.

firstLine: A decision is upon the lips of a king;
rest: in judgment his mouth will not sin.

firstLine: A balance and scales of justice belong to Yahweh;
rest: all the weights of the bag are his work.

firstLine: An abomination to kings is doing evil,
rest: for by righteousness the throne will be established.

firstLine: The delight of kings are the lips of righteousness,
rest: and he who speaks what is upright he will love.

firstLine: The wrath of a king is a messenger of death,
rest: but one who is wise will appease it.

firstLine: In the light of the face of the king there is life,
rest: and his favor is like a cloud of spring rain.

firstLine: The highway of the upright, it turns from evil,
rest: he who guards himself keeps his way.

firstLine: Before destruction comes pride,
rest: and before a fall, a haughty spirit.

firstLine: Better a lowly spirit with the poor
rest: than dividing the spoil with the proud.

firstLine: He who is attentive to a matter will find goodness,
rest: and he who trusts in Yahweh, his own happiness.

firstLine: The wise of heart is called perceptive,
rest: but he who is pleasant of lips will increase persuasiveness.

firstLine: A fountain of life is wisdom for its owner,
rest: but the instruction of fools is folly.

firstLine: The heart of the wise will make his mouth judicious,
rest: and upon his lips, it will add persuasiveness.

firstLine: Pleasant sayings are a honeycomb,
rest: sweetness to the soul and healing to the bones.

firstLine: There is a way that seems upright to a man,
rest: but its end is the way of death.

firstLine: The life of a worker works for him,
rest: for his hunger urges him.

firstLine: A man of wickedness concocts evil,
rest: and his lips are like a scorching fire.

firstLine: A person of perversity will spread dissent,
rest: and he who whispers separates a close friend.

firstLine: A person of violence will entice his neighbor
rest: and cause him to walk on a way that is not good.

firstLine: He who winks his eyes does so in order to plan perverse things;
rest: he who purses his lips will bring evil to pass.

firstLine: A crown of glory is gray hair;
rest: by a righteous life it is gained.

firstLine: He who is slow to anger is better than him who is mighty,
rest: and he who controls his spirit than him who captures a city.

firstLine: The lot will be cast into the lap,
rest: but all of its decisions are from Yahweh.

firstLine: Better a dry morsel and quiet with it
rest: than a house filled with feasts of strife.

firstLine: A slave who deals wisely will rule over a child who acts shamefully,
rest: and in the midst of brothers he will share his inheritance.

firstLine: A crucible is for the silver, and a furnace is for the gold,
rest: but Yahweh will test hearts.

firstLine: He who does evil listens to lips of wickedness,
rest: and the liar gives heed to the tongue of mischief.

firstLine: He who mocks the poor insults him who made him;
rest: he who rejoices at calamity will not go unpunished.

firstLine: The crown of the elderly are grandchildren,
rest: and the glory of children is their fathers.

firstLine: Fine speech is not becoming a fool,
rest: still less is false speech for a ruler.

firstLine: The bribe is a stone of magic in the eyes of its owner;
rest: everywhere he will turn, he will prosper.

firstLine: He who forgives an affront fosters love,
rest: but he who waits on a matter will alienate a friend.

firstLine: A rebuke strikes him who understands
rest: deeper than one hundred blows to a fool.

firstLine: An evil person will seek only rebellion,
rest: and a cruel messenger will be sent against him.

firstLine: May a man meet a she-bear robbed of offspring
rest: and not a fool in his folly.

firstLine: For he who returns evil for good,
rest: evil will not depart from his house.

firstLine: Like the release of water is the beginning of strife;
rest: before it breaks out, stop the quarrel.

firstLine: He who justifies the wicked and he who condemns the righteous,
rest: the two of them are both abominations of Yahweh.

firstLine: The friend loves at all times,
rest: but a brother is born for adversity.

firstLine: A person who lacks sense pledges;
rest: he becomes security before his neighbor.

firstLine: He who loves transgression loves strife;
rest: he who builds his high thresholds seeks destruction.

firstLine: He who is crooked of heart will not find goodness,
rest: and he who is perverse, by his tongue he will fall into calamity.

firstLine: He who begets a fool, there is trouble for him;
rest: the father of a fool will not rejoice.

firstLine: A cheerful heart is good medicine,
rest: but a downcast spirit will dry out bones.

firstLine: The wicked will accept a bribe from the lap,
rest: in order to pervert the ways of justice.

firstLine: He who understands sets his face toward wisdom,
rest: but the eyes of a fool, to the end of the earth.

firstLine: A grief to his father is the child of a fool,
rest: and bitterness to her who bore him.

firstLine: Also, imposing a fine on the righteous is not good,
rest: nor to flog nobles for uprightness.

firstLine: He who spares his sayings knows knowledge,
rest: and a cool spirit is a man of understanding.

firstLine: Even a fool who keeps silent shall be considered wise;
rest: he who closes his lips is intelligent.

firstLine: He who is selfish seeks a craving;
rest: against all sound judgment he shows contempt.

firstLine: A fool will not take pleasure in understanding,
rest: but in expressing his heart.

firstLine: With the coming of wickedness comes contempt also,
rest: and with dishonor, disgrace.

firstLine: Deep waters are words of the mouth of a man;
rest: a gushing stream is a fountain of wisdom.

firstLine: Being partial to faces of evil is not good,
rest: nor to subvert the righteous at the judgment.

firstLine: The lips of a fool will bring strife,
rest: and his mouth calls out for a flogging.

firstLine: The mouth of a fool is ruin to him,
rest: and his lips are a snare to his soul.

firstLine: The words of a whisper are like delicious morsels,
rest: and they themselves go down to inner parts of the body.

firstLine: Even he who is slack in his work,
rest: he is brother to a master of destruction.

firstLine: A tower of strength is the name of Yahweh;
rest: into him the righteous will run and be safe.

firstLine: The wealth of the rich is his strong city,
rest: and like a wall, it is high in his imagination.

firstLine: In the presence of destruction, the heart of a man will be haughty,
rest: but in the presence of honor, humble.

firstLine: He who returns a word before he will hear,
rest: folly itself belongs to him as well as shame.

firstLine: The spirit of a man will endure his sickness,
rest: but a broken spirit, who may bear it?

firstLine: An intelligent mind will acquire knowledge,
rest: and the ear of the wise will seek knowledge.

firstLine: The gift of a person will open doors for him,
rest: and before the great, it gives him access.

firstLine: The first in his dispute is deemed righteous,
rest: but his neighbor will come and examine him.

firstLine: The lot will put an end to disputes,
rest: and between powerful contenders it will decide.

firstLine: A brother who is offended is worse than a city of strength,
rest: and quarrels are like the bars of a fortification.

firstLine: From the fruit of a man’s mouth, his stomach will be satisfied,
rest: as for the yield of his lips, it will satisfy.

firstLine: Death and life are in the power of the tongue,
rest: and those who love her will eat of her fruit.

firstLine: He who finds a wife finds good,
rest: and he will obtain favor from Yahweh.

firstLine: The poor may speak entreaties,
rest: but the rich will answer roughly.

firstLine: A man of many friends will come to ruin,
rest: but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.

firstLine: Better a poor person walking in integrity
rest: than one who is perverse in his speech and is a fool.

firstLine: Also, a life without knowledge is not good,
rest: and he who moves quickly with his feet misses the mark.

firstLine: As for the folly of humankind, its way leads to ruin,
rest: and against Yahweh his heart will rage.

firstLine: Wealth adds many friends,
rest: but the poor will be left by his friends.

firstLine: A witness of falsehood will not go unpunished,
rest: and he who breathes lies will not escape.

firstLine: Many will seek favor before the generous,
rest: and everyone is the friend of a man of gifts.

firstLine: All the brothers of the poor, if they hate him,
rest:
how much more will his friends keep away from him.
He pursues them with words, and they are gone.

firstLine: He who acquires wisdom loves himself;
rest: he who guards understanding loves to find good.

firstLine: A false witness will not go unpunished,
rest: and he who breathes lies will perish.

firstLine: For a fool living in luxury is not fitting,
rest: any more than it is for a slave to rule over princes.

firstLine: The understanding of a person makes him slow to his anger,
rest: and his glory overlooks offense.

firstLine: The rage of a king growls like a lion,
rest: but his favor is like dew on the grass.

firstLine: A foolish child is a ruin to his father,
rest: and the quarreling of a woman is a continuous dripping.

firstLine: A house and wealth are an inheritance from fathers,
rest: but from Yahweh comes a woman who is prudent.

firstLine: Laziness will bring on a deep sleep,
rest: and a person of idleness will suffer hunger.

firstLine: He who guards commandments guards his life;
rest: he who is careless of his ways will be killed.

firstLine: He who lends to Yahweh is he who is kind to the poor,
rest: and his benefits he will repay to him.

firstLine: Discipline your child, for there is hope,
rest: but on his destruction do not set your desire.

firstLine: A hot-tempered person pays a penalty;
rest: if you rescue him, you will do it yet again.

firstLine: Listen to advice and accept instruction
rest: so that you will gain wisdom for your future.

firstLine: Many plans are in the heart of a man,
rest: but the purpose of Yahweh will be established.

firstLine: The craving of a man is his steadfast loyalty,
rest: and it is better to be poor than a liar.

firstLine: Fear of Yahweh leads to life;
rest: he who is filled with it will rest—he will not suffer harm.

firstLine: A lazy person buries his hand in the dish,
rest: and even to his mouth he will not bring it back.

firstLine: The scoffer you shall strike, and the simple, may they learn prudence,
rest: and reprove the intelligent and he will gain knowledge.

firstLine: He who does violence to a father, he who chases away a mother,
rest: is a child who causes shame and brings reproach.

firstLine: Cease to listen to instruction, my child,
rest: and you will stray from sayings of knowledge.

firstLine: A worthless witness will mock justice,
rest: and the mouth of the wicked will devour iniquity.

firstLine: Judgments are prepared for the scoffers,
rest: and flogging for the back of fools.

firstLine: Wine is a mocker, strong drink a brawler,
rest: and any who go astray by it are not wise.

firstLine: Roaring like the lion is the dreaded anger of a king;
rest: he who provokes him forfeits his life.

firstLine: It is honorable for the man to refrain from strife,
rest: but every fool will be quick to quarrel.

firstLine: The lazy person will not plow in season;
rest: he will expect at the harvest, but there will be nothing.

firstLine: Deep waters are like purpose in the heart of a man,
rest: and a man of understanding will draw it out.

firstLine: Many a person will proclaim his loyalty for himself,
rest: but a man who is trustworthy, who can find?

firstLine: He who walks in his integrity is righteous;
rest: happy are his children who follow him.

firstLine: A king who sits on the throne of judgment
rest: winnows all evil with his eyes.

firstLine: Who will say “I have made my heart clean;
rest: I am pure from my sin”?

firstLine: Stone and stone, measure and measure,
rest: both of them are an abomination of Yahweh.

firstLine: Even by his acts, a young man will make himself known,
rest: whether his acts are pure and upright.

firstLine: The ear that hears and the eye that sees,
rest: Yahweh has made them both.

firstLine: Do not love sleep, lest you become poor;
rest: open your eyes and have plenty bread.

firstLine: “Bad, bad,” the buyer will say,
rest: but when one goes to him, then he will boast.

firstLine: There is gold and many costly stones,
rest: but precious jewels are lips of knowledge.

firstLine: Take his garment, for he has given security to a stranger,
rest: and on behalf of a foreigner—take it as pledge.

firstLine: Bread gained by deceit is sweet for the man,
rest: but afterward, his mouth will be filled with gravel.

firstLine: A plan will be established by advice,
rest: and with guidance make war.

firstLine: He reveals a secret, he who walks about with gossip,
rest: and do not associate with a babbler’s lips.

firstLine: He who curses his father and his mother,
rest: his lamp will be extinguished in the midst of darkness.

firstLine: An inheritance acquired hastily at the beginning
rest: will not be blessed at its end.

firstLine: Do not say “I will repay evil”;
rest: wait for Yahweh and he will deliver you.

firstLine: An abomination of Yahweh is a stone and a weight,
rest: and scales of falsehood are not good.

firstLine: Away from Yahweh are the steps of a strong man,
rest: and how will humankind understand his ways?

firstLine: It is a snare to humankind to say rashly “It is holy,”
rest: and after vows, to scrutinize.

firstLine: A wise king winnows the wicked,
rest: and he will drive a wheel over them.

firstLine: The lamp of Yahweh is the spirit of humankind,
rest: he who searches every innermost part.

firstLine: Loyalty and faithfulness will preserve a king,
rest: and he is upheld with the righteousness of his throne.

firstLine: The glory of young men is their strength,
rest: but the beauty of the aged is gray hair.

firstLine: The blows of a wound will cleanse evil,
rest: as will beatings of the innermost part.

firstLine: Streams of water are the heart of a king in the hand of Yahweh;
rest: wherever he will desire, he will turn.

firstLine: Every way of a man is upright in his own eyes,
rest: but Yahweh weighs hearts.

firstLine: Doing righteousness and justice is more acceptable
rest: to Yahweh than sacrifice.

firstLine: Haughtiness of the eyes and pride of heart,
rest: the lamp of the wicked are sin.

firstLine: The plans of the diligent only lead to abundance,
rest: but all who are hasty, only to want.

firstLine: He who makes treasure by a lying tongue
rest: is a fleeting vapor and seeker of death.

firstLine: The violence of the wicked will sweep them away,
rest: for they refuse to do justice.

firstLine: Crooked is the way of a man and a foreigner,
rest: but the pure is upright in his conduct.

firstLine: Better to dwell on the corner of a roof
rest: than to share a house with a woman of contention.

firstLine: The soul of the wicked desires evil;
rest: his neighbor will not find mercy in his eyes.

firstLine: With the punishment of a scoffer, the simple will become wise,
rest: and with the instruction of the wise, he will obtain knowledge.

firstLine: The righteous observes the house of the wicked;
rest: he throws the wicked to ruin.

firstLine: He who closes his ear from the cry of the poor,
rest: he also will cry out and not be heard.

firstLine: A gift in secret will avert anger,
rest: and a concealed bribe, strong wrath.

firstLine: It is a joy to the righteous to do justice,
rest: but dismay to those who do evil.

firstLine: Whoever wanders from the way of understanding,
rest: in the assembly of the dead he will rest.

firstLine: A man of want is he who loves pleasure;
rest: he who loves wine and oil will not become rich.

firstLine: A ransom for the righteous is the wicked,
rest: and the faithless instead of the upright.

firstLine: Better to live in a land of wilderness
rest: than with a wife of quarrels and provocation.

firstLine: Precious treasure and oil are in the house of the wise,
rest: but the foolish person will devour them.

firstLine: He who pursues righteousness and kindness
rest: will find life, righteousness, and honor.

firstLine: To a city of warriors, the wise ascends,
rest: and he will bring down the stronghold—its object of trust.

firstLine: He who guards his mouth and his tongue,
rest: he guards his life from danger.

firstLine: The proud, haughty one: “scoffer” is his name;
rest: he acts with arrogance of pride.

firstLine: The craving of a lazy person will kill him,
rest: for his hands refuse to work.

firstLine: All day he craves a craving,
rest: but the righteous will give and not hold back.

firstLine: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination;
rest: how much more when he brings it in divisiveness!

firstLine: A false witness will perish,
rest: but a man who listens will testify with success.

firstLine: A wicked man is strong in his countenance,
rest: but the upright will appoint his paths.

firstLine: There is no wisdom, nor understanding,
rest: nor counsel to oppose Yahweh.

firstLine: A horse is prepared for the day of battle,
rest: but to Yahweh belongs the victory.

firstLine: A reputation is to be chosen rather than great riches;
rest: favor is better than silver and gold.

firstLine: Rich and poor have much in common;
rest: Yahweh is the maker of all of them.

firstLine: The clever sees danger and hides,
rest: but the simple go on and suffer.

firstLine: The reward of humility is the fear of Yahweh—
rest: wealth and honor and life.

firstLine: Thorns and snares are in the way of the perverse;
rest: he who guards himself will keep away from them.

firstLine: Train the child concerning his way;
rest: even when he is old, he will not stray from it.

firstLine: The rich will rule over the poor,
rest: and the borrower is a slave of the lender.

firstLine: He who sows injustice will reap calamity,
rest: and the rod of his anger will fail.

firstLine: He who is generous will be blessed,
rest: for he gives to the poor from his own bread.

firstLine: Drive out a scoffer and strife will go out;
rest: quarrel and abuse will cease.

firstLine: He who loves purity of heart
rest: and hasgracious speech, his friend is the king.

firstLine: The eyes of Yahweh keep watch over knowledge,
rest: but he will overthrow the words of the faithless.

firstLine: A deep pit is the mouth of an adulteress,
rest: he with whom Yahweh is angry will fall there.

firstLine: Folly is bound up in the heart of a boy;
rest: the rod of discipline will drive it from him.

firstLine: He who oppresses the poor in order to enrich himself,
rest: or gives to the rich, will come to poverty.

firstLine: Words of the Wise
rest:
Incline your ear and hear the words of the wise;
you shall apply your heart to my teaching.

firstLine: For it is pleasant if you guard them within you;
rest: together they will be ready upon your lips.

firstLine: In order for your trust to be in Yahweh,
rest: I have made them known to you today—even you.

firstLine: Have I not written for you thirty sayings
rest: with admonitions and knowledge?

firstLine: In order to show you what is right—sayings of truth—
rest: in order to return a true saying to him who sent you.

firstLine: Do not rob the poor because he is poor,
rest: and do not crush the afflicted at the gate;

firstLine: For Yahweh will plead their case
rest: and despoil those who despoil them of life.

firstLine: Do not befriend an owner of anger,
rest: and with a man of wrath you shall not associate;

firstLine: lest you learn his way
rest: and become entangled in a snare to yourself.

firstLine: Do not be with those who give a pledge
rest: by becoming surety.

firstLine: If there is nothing for you to pay,
rest: why will he take your bed from under you?

firstLine: Do not remove an ancient boundary marker
rest: which your ancestors made.

firstLine: A man who is skillful in his work, you shall see:
rest:
before kings, he will serve;
he will not serve before the commoners.

firstLine: When you sit to eat with a ruler,
rest: you shall surely observe what is before you,

firstLine: and you shall put a knife to your throat
rest: if you have a big appetite.

firstLine: Do not desire his delicacies,
rest: for it is food of deception.

firstLine: Do not tire in order to become rich;
rest: out of your understanding, may you desist.

firstLine: Your eyes will alight on it, but there is nothing to it,
rest:
for suddenly it will make for itself wings
like an eagle and it will be exhausted in the heavens.

firstLine: Do not eat the bread of the stingy,
rest: and do not desire his delicacies.

firstLine: Your morsel you have eaten, you will vomit it up,
rest: and you will waste your pleasant words.

firstLine: In the ears of a fool do not speak,
rest: for he will despise the wisdom of your words.

firstLine: Do not remove an ancient boundary marker,
rest: and on the fields of orphans do not encroach;

firstLine: For their redeemer is strong,
rest: he himself will plead their cause against you.

firstLine: Apply your heart to instruction,
rest: and your ear to sayings of knowledge.

firstLine: Do not withhold discipline from a child,
rest: if you will beat him with the rod, he will not die.

firstLine: As for you, with the rod you shall beat him,
rest: and his life you will save from Sheol.

firstLine: My child, if your heart is wise,
rest: my heart will be glad—even me!

firstLine: And my insides will rejoice
rest: when your lips speak what is upright.

firstLine: May your heart not envy the sinners,
rest: but live in fear of Yahweh all day.

firstLine: Surely there is a future,
rest: and your hope will not be cut off.

firstLine: You, my child, hear and be wise,
rest: and direct your heart on the road.

firstLine: Do not be among drinkers of wine,
rest: among gluttonous eaters of their meat.

firstLine: For the drunkard and gluttonous, they will become poor,
rest: and with rags, drowsiness will clothe them.

firstLine: Listen to your father—he who gave you life,
rest: and do not despise your mother when she is old.

firstLine: Buy truth and do not sell it,
rest: wisdom and instruction and understanding.

firstLine: The father of the righteous will surely rejoice;
rest: he who bears a wise person will be happy with him.

firstLine: May your father and your mother be glad,
rest: and may she who bore you rejoice.

firstLine: My child, may you give your heart to me,
rest: and may your eyes delight in my ways.

firstLine: For a deep pit is a prostitute,
rest: and a narrow well is an adulteress.

firstLine: She is also like a robber lying in wait,
rest: and the faithless among mankind she increases.

firstLine: To those who linger over wine,
rest: to those who come to try mixed wine.

firstLine: Do not look at wine when it is red,
rest:
when it sparkles on the cup,
going down smoothly.

firstLine: In the end, it will bite like a serpent,
rest: and it will sting like an adder.

firstLine: Your eyes will see strange things,
rest: and your heart will speak perverse things.

firstLine: And you will be like him who lies down in the heart of the sea,
rest: and like him who lies down on top of a mast.

firstLine: “They struck me; I was not hurt. They beat me; I did not know it.
rest: When I will awake, I will continue; I will seek it again.”

firstLine: Do not envy men of evil,
rest: and do not desire to be with them.

firstLine: For their minds will devise violence,
rest: and their lips will speak mischief.

firstLine: By wisdom a house is built,
rest: and by understanding it is established.

firstLine: And by knowledge, rooms are filled
rest: with all riches, precious and pleasant.

firstLine: The warrior of wisdom is in strength,
rest: and a man of knowledge is strong in power.

firstLine: For with wise guidance you shall make war for yourself,
rest: and victory is in an abundance of counsel.

firstLine: Wisdom is too high for fools;
rest: at the gate he will not open his mouth.

firstLine: He who plans to do evil for himself,
rest: they will call him “master of mischief.”

firstLine: Devising folly is a sin,
rest: and an abomination to humankind is a scoffer.

firstLine: If you faint on the day of adversity,
rest: little is your strength.

firstLine: Rescue those who are led away to the death
rest: and those who stagger to the slaughter. If you hold back,

firstLine: if you say, “Look, we do not know this,”
rest:
does not he who weighs hearts perceive it?
And he who keeps your soul,
he knows and will repay humankind according to his deeds.

firstLine: My child, eat honey, for it is good,
rest: and the dripping of the honeycomb is sweet to your taste.

firstLine: Thus know wisdom for the sake of your soul,
rest:
if you find it, then there is a future,
and your hope will not be cut off.

firstLine: Do not lie in wait like an outlaw against the home of the righteous;
rest: do not do violence to his dwelling place.

firstLine: For seven times the righteous will fall, but he will rise,
rest: but the wicked will be overthrown by calamity.

firstLine: While your enemies are falling, do not rejoice;
rest: when he trips himself, may your heart not be glad

firstLine: lest Yahweh see and it be evil in his eyes,
rest: and turn his anger away from him.

firstLine: Do not fret because of the evildoers;
rest: do not envy the wicked.

firstLine: For there will not be a future for the evil;
rest: the lamp of the wicked will die out.

firstLine: Fear Yahweh, my son, and the king;
rest: with those who change, do not associate.

firstLine: For suddenly their disaster will come,
rest: and the ruin of both of them, who knows?

firstLine: These sayings are also for the wise:
rest: Partiality in judgment is not good.

firstLine: Whoever says to the guilty, “You are righteous,” the people will curse him;
rest: the nations will abhor him.

firstLine: But they who rebuke will have delight,
rest: and upon them blessings of goodness will come.

firstLine: He will kiss the lips,
rest: he who gives an honest answer.

firstLine: Prepare your work in the street and get it ready for yourself in the field;
rest: afterward, then you shall build your house.

firstLine: Do not be a witness without cause against your neighbor
rest: nor deceive with your lips.

firstLine: Do not say, “Just as he has done to me, so shall I do to him;
rest: I will pay back the man according to his deed.”

firstLine: I passed by the field of a lazy person,
rest: and over the vineyard of a person lacking sense;

firstLine: and behold, it was overgrown—all of it was covered with thorns, its surface with nettles,
rest: and its stone wall was broken down.

firstLine: Then I myself saw and my heart considered;
rest: I looked, and I took hold of instruction:

firstLine: A little sleep, a little slumber,
rest: a little folding of the hands for rest,

firstLine: and your poverty will come running,
rest: and your lack like an armed warrior.

firstLine: More Proverbs of Solomon
rest: These are also proverbs of Solomon which officials of Hezekiah king of Judah copied:

firstLine: The glory of God conceals things,
rest: but the glory of kings searches out things.

firstLine: As heaven is to height and the earth is to depth,
rest: so is the heart of kings—there is no searching.

firstLine: Remove the dross from silver,
rest: and it will become a vessel for the smith.

firstLine: Remove the wicked before a king,
rest: and his throne will be established in righteousness.

firstLine: Do not promote yourself before the king,
rest: and in the place of the great ones do not stand.

firstLine: For it is better that he say to you, “Ascend here,”
rest:
than he humble you before a noble.
What your eyes have seen,

firstLine: do not hastily bring out to court,
rest:
for what will you do at its end,
when your neighbor puts you to shame?

firstLine: Argue your argument with your neighbor himself,
rest: the secret of another do not disclose,

firstLine: lest he who hears shame you
rest: and your ill repute will not end.

firstLine: Apples of gold in a setting of silver
rest: is a matter spoken at its proper time.

firstLine: A ring of gold and an ornament of fine gold
rest: is a rebuke of the wise to the ear of a listener.

firstLine: Like the cold of snow on a day of harvest
rest:
is a faithful messenger to those who send him,
and the soul of his master is refreshed.

firstLine: Like clouds and wind when there is no rain,
rest: so too is a man who boasts in a gift of deception.

firstLine: With patience a ruler may be persuaded,
rest: and a soft tongue will break a bone.

firstLine: If you find honey, eat what is sufficient for you,
rest: lest you have your fill of it and vomit it out.

firstLine: Make your foot scarce in the house of your neighbor,
rest: lest he become weary of you and hate you.

firstLine: Like a club and sword and a sharp arrow
rest: is a man who bears false witness against his neighbor.

firstLine: A bad tooth and a lame foot
rest: is the trust of a faithless person in a time of trouble.

firstLine: Like one who removes a garment on a cold day, or like vinegar on natron,
rest: is he who sings songs to a heavy heart.

firstLine: If your enemy is hungry, feed him bread,
rest: and if thirsty, let him drink water.

firstLine: For coals of fire you will heap upon his head,
rest: and Yahweh will reward you.

firstLine: The wind of the north produces rain,
rest: and a backbiting tongue, angry faces.

firstLine: Better to live upon the corner of a roof
rest: than with a woman of contention and in a shared house.

firstLine: Like cold water upon a weary soul,
rest: so too is good news from a distant place.

firstLine: Like a muddied spring or a polluted fountain
rest: is the righteous who gives way before the wicked.

firstLine: To eat much honey is not good,
rest: nor is seeking one’s honor honorable.

firstLine: A breached city where there is no wall
rest: is like a man who has no self-control for his spirit.
