and they will attach themselves to the house of Jacob.

firstLine: And the nations will take them
rest:
and bring them to their place,
and the house of Israel will take possession of them in the land of Yahweh
as slaves and female slaves.
And this will happen:
they will take their captors captive
and rule over their oppressors.

firstLine: The Downfall of the King of Babylon
rest: And it shall happen on the day Yahweh gives you rest from your pain and turmoil and hard labor which you had to perform,

firstLine: that you will take this taunt against the king of Babylon,
rest:
and you will say:
“How the oppressor has ceased!
his insolence has ceased.

firstLine: Yahweh has broken the staff of the wicked,
rest: the scepter of rulers,

firstLine: that struck the peoples in wrath, a blow without ceasing,
rest:
that ruled the nations in anger
with unrestrained persecution.

firstLine: All of the earth rests and is quiet;
rest: they break forth into singing.

firstLine: Even the cypresses rejoice over you,
rest:
the cedars of Lebanon:
‘Since you were laid down,
no wood cutter comes up against us.’

firstLine: Sheol below is getting excited over you,
rest:
to meet you when you come;
it arouses the dead spirits for you,
all of the leaders of the earth.
It raises all of the kings of the nations from their thrones.

firstLine: All of them will respond and say to you,
rest:
‘You yourself also were made weak like us!
You have become the same as us!’

firstLine: Your pride is brought down to Sheol,
And you yourself said in your heart,
I will ascend to the high places of the clouds,
rest: I will make myself like the Most High.’

firstLine: But you are brought down to Sheol,
rest: to the depths of the pit.

firstLine: Those who see you will stare at you,
rest:
they will look closely at you:
‘Is this the man who made the earth tremble,
who caused kingdoms to shake,

firstLine: who made the world like the desert
rest:
and destroyed its cities,
who would not let his prisoners go home?’

firstLine: All the kings of the nations, all of them, lie in glory,
rest: each one in his house.

firstLine: But as for you, you are thrown away from your grave,
rest:
like an abhorrent shoot,
clothed with the slain,
those pierced by the sword,
those who go down to the stones of the pit,
like a corpse that is trodden down.

firstLine: You will not be united with them in burial
rest:
because you have destroyed your land,
you have killed your people.
The descendants of evildoers will not be mentioned for eternity!

firstLine: Prepare a place of slaughter for his sons
rest:
because of the sin of their ancestors.
Let them not rise and take possession of the earth
or fill up the face of the world with cities.”

firstLine: “And I will rise up against them,”
rest:
declares Yahweh of hosts,
“and I will cut off name and a remnant from Babylon,
and offspring and posterity,”
declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “And I will make her a possession of the hedgehog,
rest:
and pools of water,
and I will sweep her away with the broom of destruction,”
declares Yahweh of hosts.

firstLine: Oracle of Judgment on Assyria
rest:
Yahweh of hosts has sworn, saying,
“Surely just as I have intended, so it shall be.
And just as I have planned, it shall stand:

firstLine: to break Assyria in my land,
This is the plan that is planned concerning all of the earth;
rest: and this is the hand that is stretched out over all of the nations.

firstLine: Oracle of Judgment on Philistia
rest: In the year of the death of king Ahaz there was this oracle:

firstLine: You must not rejoice, all you Philistines,
And the firstborn of the poor will graze,
Oracle of Judgment on Moab
It has gone up to the house,
rest:
and Dibon to the high places
for weeping over Nebo,
and Moab wails over Medeba.
Every head is bald,
every beard is shaved.

firstLine: They gird themselves with sackcloth in its streets;
rest:
on its roofs and public squares everyone wails,
going down in weeping.

firstLine: And Heshbon and Elealeh cry out,
My heart cries out for Moab;
rest:
its fugitives flee up to Zoar,
to Eglath-shelishiyah.
For at the ascent of Luhith it goes up it with weeping;
for on the road of Horonaim they raise up a cry of destruction.

firstLine: For the waters of Nimrim are wastelands;
Therefore they carry the abundance it has made
rest: and their store of goods over the river of the poplars.

firstLine: For a cry for help has encircled the territory of Moab,
rest:
her wailing is heard as far as Eglaim,
and her wailing as far as Beer Elim.

firstLine: For the waters of Dimon are full of blood;
rest:
but I will place added things upon Dimon:
a lion for the survivors of Moab
and for the remnant of the land.

firstLine: Send a ram to the ruler of the land,
rest: from Sela across the desert to the mountain of daughter Zion.

firstLine: And this shall be:
rest:
like a bird fleeing from a thrust away nest
shall be the daughters of Moab at the fords of Arnon.

firstLine: “Bring counsel,
Let my outcasts of Moab dwell as aliens among you;
rest:
be a hiding place for them from the presence of the destroyer.”
When the oppressor is no more, destruction has stopped,
the one who tramples has disappeared from the land,

firstLine: then a throne shall be established in steadfast love,
rest:
and one shall sit on it in faithfulness, in the tent of David,
judging and seeking justice
and zealous for righteousness.

firstLine: We have heard of the pride of Moab—exceedingly proud—
rest: of his arrogance, pride, and insolence; his boasting is not true.

firstLine: Therefore Moab wails;
rest:
all of it wails for Moab,
for the raisin cakes of Kir-hareseth you moan, utterly devastated.

firstLine: For Heshbon withers the fields, the vine of Sibmah;
rest:
rulers of nations have broken down her tendrils,
they reached up to Jazer,
they wandered to the desert;
her shoots spread abroad,
they crossed over the sea.

firstLine: And joy and gladness are taken away from the fruitful land,
Therefore my heart moans like a harp for Moab
rest: and my inner parts for Kir-heres.

firstLine: And this shall happen:
rest:
when Moab appears, when it is weary upon the high place
and it comes to its sanctuary to pray, it will not prevail.

firstLine: Oracle of Judgment on Damascus
rest:
An oracle of Damascus:
“Look! Damascus will cease being a city
and will become a heap of ruins.

firstLine: The cities of Aroer will be deserted;
rest:
they will be for the flocks,
and they will lie down and no one will frighten them.

firstLine: And the fortified city will disappear from Ephraim,
“And this shall happen:
rest:
On that day, the glory of Jacob will be brought low,
and the fat of his flesh will become lean.

firstLine: And it shall be as when a reaper gathers standing grain
rest:
and he reaps grain with his arm,
and it shall be like one who gathers ears of grain
in the valley of Rephaim.

firstLine: And gleanings will be left over in it, as when an olive tree is beaten,
rest:
two or three ripe olive berries in the top of a branch,
four or five on its fruitful branches,”
declares Yahweh, the God of Israel.

firstLine: On that day, mankind will look to its maker,
rest: and its eyes will look to the holy one of Israel;

firstLine: it will not look to the altars,
rest:
the work of its hands,
and it will not see what its fingers made
and the poles of Asherah worship and the incense altars.

firstLine: For you have forgotten the God of your salvation,
On your planting day you make them grow,
rest:
and in the morning of your sowing you bring them into bloom,
yet the harvest will flee in a day of sickness and incurable pain.

firstLine: The Roar of the Peoples
rest:
Ah! The noise of many peoples, they make a noise like the noise of the seas!
And the roar of nations, they roar like the roar of mighty waters!

firstLine: The nations roar like the roar of many waters,
rest:
but he will rebuke him, and he will flee far away.
And they are chased like chaff of the mountains before the wind
and like tumbleweed before the storm.

firstLine: Oracle of Judgment on Cush
rest:
Ah! land of the whirring of wings,
which is beyond the rivers of Cush,

firstLine: that sends messengers by the sea
rest:
and in vessels of papyrus on the surface of the waters!
Go, swift messengers, to a tall and smooth nation,
to a people feared near and far,
a mighty, mighty and trampling nation,
whose land rivers divide.

firstLine: All you inhabitants of the world
rest:
and dwellers of the earth,
when a signal is raised on the mountains, you must look,
and when a trumpet is blown, you must listen!

firstLine: For Yahweh said this to me:
rest:
“I will be quiet,
and I will look from my dwelling place
like clear heat because of light,
like a cloud of dew in the heat of harvest.”

firstLine: For before the harvest, when the blossom is complete
rest:
and a blossom becomes ripening fruit,
and one cuts off the shoots with pruning hooks,
and one removes, tears away the tendrils.

firstLine: They shall all be left for birds of prey of the mountains
rest:
and for the animals of the earth.
And the birds of prey will pass the summer on it,
and every animal of the earth will winter on it.

firstLine: At that time, a gift will be brought to Yahweh of hosts
rest:
from a tall and smooth people,
and from a people feared near and far,
a mighty, mighty and trampling nation,
whose land the rivers divide,
to the place of the name of Yahweh of hosts,
the mountain of Zion.

firstLine: Oracle of Judgment on Egypt
rest:
An oracle of Egypt:
Look! Yahweh is riding on a swift cloud
and is coming to Egypt.
And the idols of Egypt will tremble in front of him,
and the heart of Egypt melts in his inner parts.

firstLine: “And I will stir up Egyptians against Egyptians,
rest:
and each one will fight against his brother
and each one against his neighbor,
city against city, kingdom against kingdom.

firstLine: And the spirit of the Egyptians will be disturbed in his midst,
rest:
and I will confuse his plans,
and they will consult the idols and the spirits of the dead,
and the ghosts and the spiritists.

firstLine: And I will hand over the Egyptians into the hand of a hard master,
rest:
and a powerful king will rule over them,”
declares the Lord Yahweh of hosts.

firstLine: And the waters will be dried up from the sea,
rest: and the river will be parched and dry.

firstLine: And the rivers will become foul-smelling;
rest:
the branches of the Nile of Egypt will become little and dry up;
reed and rush will wither.

firstLine: Bare places by the Nile will be dried up,
rest:
by the edge of the Nile and all the sown land of the Nile;
it will be driven about, and it will be no more.

firstLine: And the fishers will mourn,
rest:
and all of those who cast fishhooks in the Nile will lament,
and those who spread out fishing nets on the surface of the water will languish.

firstLine: And the workers of combed flax will be ashamed,
rest: and those who weave white linen.

firstLine: And her weavers will be crushed;
rest: all the hired workers will be grieved of heart.

firstLine: Surely the princes of Zoan are foolish;
rest:
the wise of the counselors of Pharaoh give senseless counsel.
How can you say to Pharaoh,
“I myself am a son of sages,
a descendant of ancient kings”?

firstLine: The princes of Zoan have become foolish;
rest:
the princes of Memphis are deceived;
the leaders of her tribes have led Egypt astray.

firstLine: Yahweh has mixed a spirit of confusion into her midst,
rest:
and they have caused Egypt to stagger in all of its doings,
as when a drunkard staggers in his vomit.

firstLine: And there will be nothing for Egypt to do,
rest: head or tail, palm branch or reed.

firstLine: The Future Blessing of Egypt, Assyria, and Egypt
rest: On that day, Egypt will be like women, and will tremble and be afraid before the waving hand of Yahweh of hosts that he is waving against it.

firstLine: A Sign regarding Egypt and Cush
rest: In the year the commander-in-chief came to Ashdod, when Sargon the king of Assyria sent him, and he fought against Ashdod and he took it,

firstLine: at that time, Yahweh had spoken by the hand of Isaiah son of Amoz, saying,
rest:
“Go and loosen the sackcloth from your loins,
and take off your sandals from your feet,”
and he had done so, walking naked and barefoot.

firstLine: And they shall be dismayed,
rest:
and they shall be ashamed
because of Cush, their hope,
and because of Egypt, their pride.

firstLine: And the inhabitant of the coastland will say this on that day:
rest: ‘Look! This is our hope to whom we fled for help, to be delivered from the king of Assyria, and how shall we escape?’”

firstLine: The Fall of Babylon
rest:
The oracle of the wilderness of the sea:
As storm winds passing over in the Negev,
it comes from the desert,
from a frightful land.

firstLine: A hard revelation is told to me;
rest:
the treacherous deals treacherously,
and the destroyer destroys.
Go up, Elam;
lay siege, Media!
I put an end to all of her sighing.

firstLine: Therefore my loins are filled with anguish;
rest:
pangs have seized me, like the pangs of a woman giving birth.
I am too bent to hear,
I am too dismayed to see.

firstLine: My mind staggers; fear terrifies me;
rest: the twilight I desired brought me fear.

firstLine: For the Lord said this to me:
rest:
“Go, set a watchman in position.
He must announce what he sees.

firstLine: When he sees riders,
rest:
a pair of horsemen,
riders of donkeys,
riders of camels,
then he must listen attentively,
paying attention, paying special attention.”

firstLine: Then the watchman called,
rest:
“Lord, I am standing on the watchtower continually by day,
and I am standing at my post throughout the night.

firstLine: My downtrodden people
rest:
and the son of my threshing floor,
I will announce to you what I have heard from Yahweh of hosts, the God of Israel.

firstLine: Oracle regarding Dumah
rest:
The oracle of Dumah:
One is calling to me from Seir,
“Watchman, what of the night?
Watchman, what of the night?”

firstLine: The watchman says,
rest:
“Morning comes,
and also the night.
If you will inquire, inquire;
come back again.”

firstLine: Oracle against Arabia
rest:
An oracle concerning Arabia:
You will spend the night in the thicket in a desert-plateau,
caravans of Dedanites.

firstLine: For they have fled from the swords,
rest:
from the drawn sword and the bent bow,
and from the heaviness of the battle.

firstLine: For the Lord said this to me:
rest:
“In one more year, like the years of a hired worker,
all the glory of Kedar will come to an end.

firstLine: Oracle against Jerusalem
rest:
The oracle of the valley of vision:
What business do you have going up, all of you, to the roofs,

firstLine: noisy, tumultuous city,
rest:
exultant town?
Your slain are not slain by the sword,
nor are they dead from battle.

firstLine: All of your rulers have fled together without a bow;
Therefore I said,
rest:
“Look away from me,
let me weep bitterly;
you must not insist on comforting me
for the destruction of the daughter of my people.”

firstLine: For the Lord Yahweh of hosts has a day of tumult and trampling and confusion in the valley of vision,
rest: a tearing down of walls and a cry for help to the mountains.

firstLine: And Elam lifted up the quiver,
rest:
with chariots of men and cavalry.
And Kir uncovered the shield.

firstLine: And this happened:
rest:
the choicest of your valleys were full of chariots,
and the cavalry confidently stood at the gate.

firstLine: and you saw that the breaches in the walls of the city of David were many,
rest: and you gathered the waters of the lower pool.

firstLine: And you counted the houses of Jerusalem,
rest: and you broke down the houses to fortify the wall.

firstLine: And the Lord, Yahweh of hosts, called on that day
rest:
for weeping and mourning,
and for baldness and girding with sackcloth.

firstLine: And it was revealed in my ears by Yahweh of hosts:
rest:
“Surely this sin will not be atoned for you until you die!”
says the Lord, Yahweh of hosts.

firstLine: Oracle regarding Shebna
rest:
The Lord, Yahweh of hosts, says this:
“Go! Go to this steward, to Shebna,
who is over the house:

firstLine: ‘What business do you have here,
rest:
and who do you have here,
that you have cut a grave cutting here for yourself,
carving his grave on the height,
a dwelling place for him in the rock?

firstLine: And I will push you from your office,
rest: and he will throw you down from your position.

firstLine: And this shall happen:
rest: On that day I will call to my servant, Eliakim son of Hilkiah,

firstLine: and I will clothe him with your tunic,
rest:
and I will bind your sash firmly about him,
and I will put your authority into his hand,
and he shall be like a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem
and to the house of Judah.

firstLine: And I will put the key of the house of David on his shoulder,
rest:
and he shall open and no one will be able to shut;
and he shall shut and no one will be able to open.

firstLine: And I will drive him in like a peg into a secure place,
rest: and he will become like a throne of glory to the house of his father.

firstLine: And they will hang all of the heaviness of his father’s house on him,
rest:
the offspring and the offshoot,
all of the small vessels,
from the bowls to the jars.

firstLine: Oracle against Tyre
Be still, inhabitants of the coast,
rest: merchant of Sidon, who travels over the sea, they filled you.

firstLine: And on the great waters is the seed of Shihor,
rest:
the harvest of the Nile is its produce,
and she was the merchandise of the nations.

firstLine: Be ashamed, Sidon, for the sea,
rest:
the fortress of the sea said, saying,
“I was not in labor,
and I have not given birth,
and I have not reared young men,
brought up young women.”

firstLine: When the report comes to Egypt,
rest: they will be in anguish at the report about Tyre.

firstLine: Who has planned this against Tyre, the bestower of crowns,
rest:
whose merchants were princes,
her traders the honored ones of the earth?

firstLine: Yahweh of hosts has planned it:
rest:
to defile the pride of all glory,
to humble all the honored ones of the earth.

firstLine: Cross over your own land like the Nile, daughter of Tarshish;
rest: there is no longer a harbor.

firstLine: He has stretched his hand out over the sea;
rest:
he has made kingdoms shake.
Yahweh has commanded concerning Canaan
to destroy her fortresses.

firstLine: And he said,
rest:
“You will not continue to exult, crushed one, virgin daughter of Sidon.
Arise, cross over to Cyprus! There will be no rest for you even there.”

firstLine: And this will happen on that day: And Tyre will be forgotten seventy years,
rest: like the days of one king. At the end of seventy years, it will be for Tyre like the song of the prostitute:

firstLine: “Take a harp,
rest:
go around the city, forgotten prostitute!
Do it well, playing a stringed instrument!
Make numerous songs, that you may be remembered.”

firstLine: And this shall happen:
rest:
at the end of seventy years, Yahweh will visit Tyre,
and she will return to her harlot’s wages,
and she will commit fornication
with all the kingdoms of the world on the face of the earth.

firstLine: And this shall happen:
rest:
her merchandise and her harlot’s wages will be set apart for Yahweh;
it will not be stored up,
and it will not be hoarded,
but her merchandise will be for those who live before the presence of Yahweh,
for eating to satiation and for fine clothing.

firstLine: The Judgment on the Earth
rest:
Look! Yahweh is about to lay the earth waste
and is about to devastate it,
and he will twist her surface,
and he will scatter her inhabitants.

firstLine: And it shall be as with the people, so with the priest;
The earth shall be utterly laid waste,
rest:
and it shall be utterly plundered,
for Yahweh has spoken this word.

firstLine: The earth dries up, it withers;
rest:
the world languishes, it withers.
The elevated of the people of the earth languish,

firstLine: Therefore a curse devours the earth,
rest:
and the inhabitants in it suffer for their guilt.
Therefore the inhabitants of the earth burn,
and few men are left.

firstLine: The new wine dries up;
rest:
the vine languishes.
All the merry of heart sigh;

firstLine: They do not drink wine with song;
rest: strong drink is bitter to those who drink it.

firstLine: The city of emptiness is broken;
rest: every house is shut so that no one can enter;

firstLine: Desolation is left in the city;
rest: the gate is crushed into a state of ruin.

firstLine: For it shall be like this in the midst of the earth,
rest:
among the nations,
like the beating of an olive tree,
like gleanings when a grape harvest is at an end.

firstLine: They lift up their voices; they sing for joy;
rest: they shout out from the west over the majesty of Yahweh.

firstLine: Therefore glorify Yahweh in the east,
rest: the name of Yahweh the God of Israel in the coastlands of the sea.

firstLine: We hear songs from the edge of the earth:
rest:
“Glory to the righteous one!”
But I say, “Ruin to me!
Ruin to me! Woe to me!
The treacherous ones deal treacherously,
and the treacherous ones deal treacherously with treachery!”

firstLine: And this shall happen:
rest:
The one who flees from the sound of the terror shall fall into the pit,
and the one who goes up from inside the pit shall be caught in the snare,
for the windows from heaven are opened,
and the foundations of the earth tremble.

firstLine: The earth is utterly broken;
rest:
the earth is torn asunder;
the earth is shaken violently.

firstLine: The earth staggers to and fro like the drunkard,
rest:
and it sways like a hut,
and its transgression is heavy upon it,
and it falls and does not rise again.

firstLine: And this shall happen on that day:
rest:
Yahweh will punish the host of heaven in heaven,
and the kings of the earth on the earth.

firstLine: And the full moon will be ashamed
Praise for Salvation
rest:
Yahweh, you are my God; I will exalt you.
I will praise your name,
for you have done wonderful things,
plans of old, in faithfulness, trustworthiness.

firstLine: For you have made the city a heap,
Therefore strong peoples will glorify you;
rest: a city of ruthless nations, they will fear you.

firstLine: For you have been a refuge to the poor,
rest:
a refuge to the needy in his distress,
a shelter from the rainstorm,
a shade from the heat.
For the breath of the ruthless was like a rainstorm against a wall,

firstLine: And on this mountain Yahweh of hosts will make for all peoples a rich feast,
rest: a feast of aged wines, fat filled with marrow, filtered aged wine.

firstLine: And on this mountain he will destroy the face of the shroud,
rest:
the shroud over all peoples,
and the woven covering over all nations.

firstLine: He will destroy death forever,
rest:
and the Lord Yahweh will wipe off the tears from all faces,
and he will remove the disgrace of his people from all the earth,
for Yahweh has spoken.

firstLine: And one will say, on that day,
rest:
“Look! This is our God! We have waited for him and he saved us!
This is Yahweh; we waited for him!
Let us be glad,
and let us rejoice in his salvation.”

firstLine: For the hand of Yahweh will rest on this mountain,
rest:
and Moab shall be trampled down under him
as a heap of straw is trampled down in waters of a dung heap.

firstLine: And it will spread out its hands in the midst of it,
rest:
just as the swimmer spreads out to swim,
and its pride will be brought low with the movement of its hands.

firstLine: And he will throw down the fortification of the high point of your walls;
Judah’s Song of Praise
You will protect a firm inclination in peace,
rest: in peace because he trusts in you.

firstLine: Trust in Yahweh forever,
rest: for in Yah, Yahweh you have an everlasting rock.

firstLine: For he has thrown down the inhabitants of the height,
The foot tramples it,
rest: the feet of the poor, the steps of the needy.”

firstLine: Yahweh’s People Vindicated
rest:
The way of the righteous is a straight path;
you clear the level path of the righteous.

firstLine: Surely we wait for you in the path of your judgments, Yahweh,
rest: for your name and renown are the desire of the soul.

firstLine: I desire you with all my soul in the night;
Though the wicked person is shown compassion, he does not learn righteousness;
rest:
he acts unjustly in the land of uprightness,
and he does not see the majesty of Yahweh.

firstLine: Yahweh, you will establish peace for us,
rest: for you have done even all of our works for us.

firstLine: Yahweh, our God, lords besides you ruled over us,
rest: but we praise your name alone.

firstLine: The dead do not live;
rest:
dead spirits do not rise
because you have punished and destroyed them,
and you have destroyed all memory of them.

firstLine: Yahweh, in distress they have visited you;
rest:
they poured out an incantation;
your discipline was on them.

firstLine: Like a pregnant woman on the point of giving birth, she writhes;
rest:
she cries in her labor pains.
So we were because of your presence, Yahweh.

firstLine: We became pregnant, we writhed;
rest:
we gave birth to wind.
We cannot bring about deliverance on the earth,
and no inhabitants of the world are born.

firstLine: Go, my people, enter into your chambers
Israel Rescued
rest: On that day, Yahweh will punish with his cruel, great and strong sword Leviathan, the fleeing serpent, and Leviathan, the twisting serpent, and he will kill the sea monster that is in the sea.

firstLine: On that day:
rest: “A vineyard of beauty! Sing in praise of it!

firstLine: I, Yahweh, am her keeper;
Or let it grasp at my protection;
rest:
let it make peace with me;
peace let it make with me.”

firstLine: Days are coming, let Jacob take root;
rest:
Israel will blossom and send out shoots,
and they will fill the face of the world with fruit.

firstLine: Therefore by this he will make atonement for the guilt of Jacob,
rest:
and this will be all of the fruit of the removal of his sin:
when he makes all the stones of the altar like crushed stones of chalk,
no poles of Asherah worship or incense altars will stand.

firstLine: For the fortified city is solitary,
When its branches are dry, they are broken;
rest:
women are coming and setting light to it.
For it is not a people of understanding;
therefore his maker will not have compassion on him,
and his creator will not show him favor.

firstLine: And this shall happen:
rest: on that day, Yahweh will thresh from the floodwaters of the Euphrates to the wadi of Egypt, and as for you, you will be gathered one by one, sons of Israel.

firstLine: And this shall happen:
rest:
on that day, a great trumpet will be blown,
and those who were lost in the land of Assyria will come,
and those who were scattered in the land of Egypt,
and they will bow down to Yahweh on the holy mountain at Jerusalem.

firstLine: Judgment against the Leaders of Ephraim
rest:
Ah! The garland of the pride of the drunkards of Ephraim
and the withering flower of the glory of his beauty,
which is at the head of the rich valley,
ones overcome with wine!

firstLine: The garland of the pride of the drunkards of Ephraim
rest: will be trampled by feet,

firstLine: and the withering flower of the glory of its beauty
rest:
which is at the head of the rich valley
will be like its early fig before summer,
which the one who sees it swallows while it is still in his hand.

firstLine: In that day, Yahweh of hosts will become a garland of glory
rest: and a diadem of beauty to the remnant of his people,

firstLine: and a spirit of justice to the one who sits over judgment,
rest: and strength to those who turn back the battle at the gate.

firstLine: And these also stagger because of wine
To whom will he teach knowledge,
rest:
and to whom will he explain the message?
Those who are weaned from milk,
those taken from the breast?

firstLine: For it is blah-blah upon blah-blah,
rest:
blah-blah upon blah-blah,
gah-gah upon gah-gah,
gah-gah upon gah-gah,
a little here, a little there.

firstLine: to whom he has said,
rest:
“This is rest; give rest to the weary;
and this is repose”; yet they were not willing to hear.

firstLine: And to them the word of Yahweh will be
rest:
blah-blah upon blah-blah
blah-blah upon blah-blah
gah-gah upon gah-gah
gah-gah upon gah-gah,
a little here, a little there,
so that they may go and stumble backward
and be broken and ensnared and captured.

firstLine: The Cornerstone of Zion
rest:
Therefore hear the word of Yahweh, men of mockery,
rulers of these people in Jerusalem:

firstLine: Because you have said,
rest:
“We have made a covenant with death,
and we have made an agreement with Sheol.
The overwhelming flood, when it passes through, will not come to us,
for we have made lies our refuge,
and we have hidden ourselves in falsehood.”

firstLine: Therefore the Lord Yahweh says this:
rest:
“Look! I am laying a stone in Zion,
a tested stone,
a precious cornerstone,
a founded foundation:
‘The one who trusts will not panic.’

firstLine: And I will make justice the measuring line,
And your covenant with death will be annulled,
rest:
and your agreement with Sheol will not stand;
you will become a trampling place for the overwhelming flood when it passes through.

firstLine: As often as it passes through, it will take you,
For the bed is too short to stretch out on,
rest: and the covering is too narrow when wrapping oneself.

firstLine: For Yahweh will rise up as at Mount Perazim;
rest:
he will rave as in the valley at Gibeon
to do his deed—his deed is strange—
and to work his work—his work is alien!

firstLine: And now you must not scoff,
rest:
or your bonds will be strong,
for I have heard from the Lord, Yahweh of hosts:
complete destruction
decreed upon all the land.

firstLine: A Parable of Yahweh’s Work
rest:
Listen, and hear my voice!
Listen attentively, and hear my word!

firstLine: Is it all day that the plowman plows,
rest: opens to sow seed, harrows his ground?

firstLine: When he has leveled its surface, does he not scatter dill,
rest:
and sow cumin seed,
and plant wheat in planted rows,
and barley in an appointed place,
and spelt grain as its border?

firstLine: And his God instructs him about the prescription;
rest: he teaches him.

firstLine: For dill is not threshed with a threshing sledge,
rest:
nor is a wheel of a utility cart rolled over cumin,
but dill is beaten out with a stick,
and cumin with a rod.

firstLine: Grain is crushed fine,
Woe to Jerusalem
rest:
Ah! Ariel, Ariel, the city where David encamped!
Add year to year,
let festivals recur.

firstLine: Yet I will inflict Ariel,
rest:
and there shall be mourning and lamentation,
and it shall be to me like an altar hearth.

firstLine: And I will encamp in a circle against you,
rest:
and I will lay siege to you with towers
and I will raise up siegeworks against you.

firstLine: Then you shall be low;
rest:
you shall speak from the earth,
and your words will be low, from dust.
And your voice will be from the earth, like a ghost,
and your word will whisper from the dust.

firstLine: But the multitude of your strangers shall be like fine dust,
rest:
and the multitude of tyrants like chaff that passes by.
And it will happen in an instant, suddenly.

firstLine: You will be punished by Yahweh of hosts
rest:
with thunder and earthquake and great sound,
storm wind and tempest and the flame of a devouring fire.

firstLine: And the multitude of all the nations who fight against Ariel,
rest:
all those who fight against her and her stronghold,
and those who inflict her shall be like a dream, a vision of the night.

firstLine: For Yahweh has poured out upon you a spirit of deep sleep,
rest:
and he has shut your eyes, the prophets,
and he has covered your heads, the seers.

firstLine: And the Lord said,
rest:
“Because this people draw near with its mouth,
and with its lips it honors me,
and its heart is far from me,
and their fear of me is a commandment of men that has been taught,

firstLine: therefore look, I am again doing something spectacular
rest:
and a spectacle with this spectacular people.
And the wisdom of its wise men shall perish,
and the discernment of its discerning ones shall keep itself hidden.”

firstLine: Blessing after Punishment
rest:
In a very little while shall not Lebanon change into a fruitful land,
and the fruitful land be regarded as a forest?

firstLine: And on that day, the deaf shall hear the words of a scroll,
rest: and the eyes of the blind shall see out of gloom and darkness.

firstLine: And the meek have joy after joy in Yahweh,
rest: and the needy of the people shall rejoice in the holy one of Israel.

firstLine: For the tyrant shall be no more,
rest:
and the scoffer shall come to an end.
And all those lying in wait for evil shall be cut off;

firstLine: those who mislead a person into sin with a word
rest:
and set a trap for the arbitrator in the gate
and guide away the righteous by emptiness.

firstLine: Therefore Yahweh, who redeemed Abraham, says this to the house of Jacob:
rest:
“Jacob will no longer be ashamed,
and his face will no longer grow pale.

firstLine: For when he sees his children,
rest:
the work of my hands, in his midst,
they will treat my name as holy,
and they will treat the holy one of Jacob as holy,
and they will stand in awe of the God of Israel.

firstLine: And those who err in spirit will acquire understanding,
rest: and those who grumble will learn instruction.

firstLine: Warning against Alliance with Egypt
rest:
“Oh rebellious children!” declares Yahweh,
“to make a plan, but not from me,
and pour out a libation, but not from my Spirit,
so as to add sin to sin.

firstLine: Who go to go down to Egypt,
rest:
but they do not ask of my mouth,
to take refuge in the protection of Pharaoh
and to take refuge in the shadow of Egypt.

firstLine: And the protection of Pharaoh shall be shame to you,
rest: and the refuge in the shadow of Egypt, humiliation.

firstLine: For his officials are at Zoan,
rest: and his envoys reach to Hanes.

firstLine: Everyone will start to stink because of a people that cannot profit them,
rest:
not for help and not for profiting,
but for shame and also for disgrace.”

firstLine: Oracle regarding the Negev
rest:
An oracle of the animals of the Negev:
Through a land of trouble and distress,
of lioness and lion,
among them are snake and flying serpent;
they carry their wealth on the backs of male donkeys
and their treasures on the humps of camels,
to a people that cannot profit them.

firstLine: For Egyptians help with vanity and emptiness,
rest: therefore I have called this one “Rahab, they are sitting.”

firstLine: Now go, write it on a tablet with them,
rest:
and inscribe it on a scroll,
that it may be for the time to come,
forever, forever.

firstLine: For it is a people of rebellion, deceitful children,
rest: children who are not willing to hear the instruction of Yahweh,

firstLine: turn aside from the way, turn aside from the path,
rest: put an end to the holy one of Israel from our face.”

firstLine: Therefore the holy one of Israel says this:
rest:
“Because you are rejecting this word
and you trust in oppression and cunning
and you rely on it,

firstLine: therefore this iniquity shall come for you like a breach about to fall,
rest: bulging out on a high wall that breaks suddenly, in an instant.

firstLine: And he breaks it like a vessel of a potter breaks,
rest:
that is crushed; he has no compassion,
and no potsherd is found among its fragments to take fire from the hearth,
or to skim water from the cistern.”

firstLine: For the Lord Yahweh, the holy one of Israel, said this:
and you said,
rest:
“No! For we will flee on horses!” Therefore you shall flee!
And, “We will ride on swift horses!” Therefore your pursuers shall be swift!

firstLine: One thousand because of a threat of one,
rest:
because of a threat of five you shall flee,
until you are left like a flagstaff on top of a mountain,
and like a signal on a hill.

firstLine: Yahweh Will Show Mercy
rest:
Therefore Yahweh waits to be gracious to you,
and therefore he will rise up to show you mercy,
for Yahweh is a God of justice;
blessed are all those who wait for him.

firstLine: For people will live in Zion;
And the Lord will give you the bread of distress
rest:
and the water of oppression,
but your teachers will not hide themselves any longer.
And your eyes shall see your teachers.

firstLine: And your ears shall hear a word from behind you, saying,
rest:
“this is the way; walk in it,”
when you go to your right
and when you go to your left.

firstLine: And you will defile the plating of your silver idols
And he will give rain for your seed with which you sow the ground,
rest:
and grain, the produce of the ground, and it will be rich and fertile.
On that day, your cattle will graze in broad pastures;

firstLine: and the oxen and the donkeys that till the ground will eat fodder, sorrel
rest: that has been winnowed with shovel and pitchfork.

firstLine: And there will be streams on every high mountain and elevated hill,
rest: watercourses of water, on a day of great slaughter, when towers fall.

firstLine: And the light of the full moon will be like the light of the sun,
rest:
and the light of the sun will be sevenfold, like the light of seven days,
on the day when Yahweh binds up the breakage of his people,
and he heals the wound of his blow.

firstLine: Judgment against Assyria
rest:
Look! The name of Yahweh comes from afar,
burning with his anger and heaviness of cloud.
His lips are full of indignation,
and his tongue is like a devouring fire.

firstLine: And his breath is like an overflowing river;
You shall have a song as in the night when a holy festival is kept,
rest:
and a gladness of heart like one who goes with the flute,
to go to the mountain of Yahweh, to the rock of Israel.

firstLine: And Yahweh will cause the majesty of his voice to be heard,
rest:
and he will cause the descent of his arm to be seen,
in furious anger and a flame of devouring fire,
with a cloudburst and a rainstorm and stones of hail.

firstLine: Indeed, Assyria will be shattered by the voice of Yahweh;
rest: he strikes with the rod.

firstLine: And every stroke of the staff of foundation that Yahweh lays will be on it with timbrels and lyres,
rest: and he will fight against it with battles of brandishing.

firstLine: For Topheth has been prepared from yesterday;
rest:
indeed, it is made ready for the king.
He makes its pile of wood deep and wide;
he makes fire and wood abundant.
The breath of Yahweh burns in it like a stream of sulfur.

firstLine: The Egyptians are No Help
rest:
Ah! Those who go down to Egypt for help!
They rely on horses
and trust in chariots because they are many,
and in horsemen because they are very numerous,
and they do not look to the holy one of Israel,
and they do not consult Yahweh.

firstLine: And indeed, he is wise, and he brings disaster,
rest:
and he does not remove his words,
and he will rise against the house of evildoers
and against the help of workers of iniquity.

firstLine: And the Egyptians are human and not God,
rest:
and their horses are flesh and not spirit.
And Yahweh stretches out his hand,
and the helper will stumble,
and the one being helped will fall,
and together all of them will come to an end.

firstLine: For Yahweh said this to me:
rest:
“As which a lion growls
and a young lion over its prey
when a full group of shepherds is called against him,
it is not terrified by their voice,
and to their noise it does not respond,
so Yahweh of hosts will come down to fight upon Mount Zion
and upon its hill.

firstLine: Like birds flying overhead, so Yahweh of hosts will protect Jerusalem;
rest:
he will protect and deliver it;
he will pass over and rescue it.

firstLine: For on that day, each one will reject his idols of silver
rest: and his idols of gold which your hands have made in sin for you.

firstLine: And Assyria shall fall by a sword not of a man,
And his rock will pass over because of terror,
rest:
and his officers will be terrified because of the flag,”
declares Yahweh,
who has a fire in Zion
and has a furnace in Jerusalem.

firstLine: The Kingdom of Righteousness
rest:
See, a king will rule according to righteousness,
and princes will rule according to justice.

firstLine: And each one will be like a hiding place from the wind
rest:
and a covering from the rainstorm,
like streams of water in a dry region,
like the shade of a large rock in a weary land.

firstLine: And the eyes of those who see will not gaze,
rest: and the ears of those who hear will listen.

firstLine: And the minds of the rash will understand knowledge,
rest: and the tongues of stammerers will hasten to speak clearly.

firstLine: A fool will no longer be called noble,
rest: and a scoundrel will not be said to be eminent.

firstLine: For a fool speaks folly,
rest:
and his mind does iniquity:
to behave wickedly,
and to speak error concerning Yahweh,
to leave the throat of the hungry empty,
and he deprives the thirsty of drink.

firstLine: And a scoundrel, his weapons are evil;
rest:
he plans evil devices
to ruin the poor with words of deception
even when the speech of the needy is right.

firstLine: But the nobleman plans noble things,
rest: and he stands upon noble things.

firstLine: Against the Carefree Women
rest:
Women who are at ease, rise up; hear my voice!
Carefree daughters, listen to my word!

firstLine: In a year you will tremble, carefree ones,
rest:
for the vintage will come to an end;
the harvest will not come.

firstLine: Tremble, you who are at ease;
mourning over breasts,
rest:
over fields of delight,
over the fruitful vine,

firstLine: For the palace will be forsaken,
Until a spirit is poured out on us from on high,
rest:
and the wilderness becomes a fruitful field,
and the fruitful field is reckoned as the forest.

firstLine: Then justice will dwell in the wilderness,
rest: and righteousness will live in the fruitful field.

firstLine: And the work of righteousness will be peace,
rest: and the work of righteousness, quietness and security forever.

firstLine: And my people will dwell in a settlement of peace
rest:
and in a dwelling place of security
and in undisturbed resting places.

firstLine: And it hails when the forest comes down,
rest: and the city will become low in humiliation.

firstLine: Happy are you who sow by all waters,
rest: who let the foot of the ox and the donkey go free.

firstLine: Yahweh’s Judgment and Help
rest:
Ah, destroyer, and yourself not destroyed!
And treacherous one, and no one has dealt treacherously with him!
When you cease destroying, you will be destroyed.
When you stop dealing treacherously, one will deal treacherously with you.

firstLine: At the sound of tumult, peoples fled;
rest: because of your exaltation, nations scattered.

firstLine: And your spoil is gathered,
rest:
as the gathering of the locust,
as a swarm of locusts storming on it.

firstLine: Yahweh is exalted, for he dwells on high;
rest: he filled Zion with justice and righteousness,

firstLine: and he will be the security of your times,
rest:
an abundance of salvation, wisdom, and knowledge.
The fear of Yahweh is his treasure.

firstLine: Highways are deserted;
rest:
the traveler on the road ceases.
One breaks a treaty,
he rejects the cities,
he does not hold man in high regard.

firstLine: “Now I will arise,” says Yahweh.
rest:
“Now I will lift myself up proudly;
now I will raise myself.

firstLine: You conceive dry grass, you bring forth stubble;
rest: your breath is a fire; it will consume you.

firstLine: And the peoples will be burning to lime—
rest: they are burned like thorns that have been cut down in the fire.

firstLine: You who are far away, hear what I have done;
rest: and you who are near, know my might!”

firstLine: Sinners are afraid in Zion;
rest:
trembling has seized the godless:
“Who of us can live with devouring fire?
Who of us can live with everlasting consuming hearths?”

firstLine: He who walks in righteousness
rest:
and speaks uprightness,
who rejects the gain of extortion,
who refuses a bribe,
who stops up his ears from hearing bloodshed
and shuts his eyes from seeing evil.

firstLine: That one will live on the heights;
Your eyes will see the king in his beauty;
rest: they will see a distant land.

firstLine: Your mind will meditate on the terror:
rest:
“Where is the one who counted?
Where is the one who weighed out?
Where is the one who counted the towers?”

firstLine: You will not see the insolent people,
rest:
the people whose language is too obscure to understand,
whose stammering of tongue cannot be understood.

firstLine: Rather, there Yahweh will be mighty for us,
rest:
a place of rivers and broad streams,
a galley ship with oars cannot go in it,
and a mighty ship cannot pass through it.

firstLine: Your riggings hang slack;
rest:
they do not hold the base of their mast firm,
they do not spread out the sail.
Then the prey of spoil in abundance will be divided;
the lame will take plunder.

firstLine: And no inhabitant will say, “I am sick”;
rest: the people who live in it, their iniquity will be taken away.

firstLine: Judgment on the Nations
For the anger of Yahweh is against all the nations,
And their slain shall be cast out;
rest:
as for their corpses, their stench shall go up.
And the mountains shall melt with their blood,

firstLine: When my sword is drenched in the heavens,
rest:
look! It will descend upon Edom,
and upon the people of my ban, for judgment.

firstLine: Yahweh has a sword;
rest:
it is full of blood.
It is covered with fat,
with the blood of lambs and goats,
with the fat of the kidneys of rams,
for Yahweh has a sacrifice in Bozrah
and a great slaughter in the land of Edom.

firstLine: And wild oxen shall go down with them,
rest:
and steers with strong bulls.
And their land shall be drenched with blood,
and their soil shall be fattened with fat.

firstLine: For Yahweh has a day of vengeance,
rest: a year of retribution for the strife of Zion.

firstLine: And its streams shall be changed to pitch and its soil to sulfur,
rest: and its land shall become like burning pitch.

firstLine: Night and day it shall not be quenched;
But the large bird and the hedgehog shall take possession of it,
rest:
and the owl and the raven shall live in it.
And he shall stretch the measuring line of confusion out over it,
and the plumb line of emptiness.

firstLine: Its nobles—but no kingdom is there—shall call,
rest: and all its princes shall be nothing.

firstLine: And thorns shall go up her citadel fortress,
And desert creatures shall meet with hyenas,
There the owl shall nest and lay
Seek from the book of Yahweh and read;
rest:
none of these shall be missing;
none shall miss her mate.
For my mouth is the one that has commanded,
and his spirit is the one that has gathered them.

firstLine: And he is the one that has cast the lot for them,
The Ransomed Return to Zion
rest:
Wilderness and dry land shall be glad,
and desert shall rejoice and blossom like the crocus.

firstLine: It shall blossom abundantly,
rest:
and it shall rejoice indeed with rejoicing and exulting.
The glory of Lebanon shall be given to it,
the majesty of Carmel and Sharon.
They are the ones who shall see the glory of Yahweh,
the majesty of our God.

firstLine: Strengthen the weak hands
rest: and make the staggering knees firm.

firstLine: Say to those who are hasty of heart,
rest:
“Be strong; you must not fear!
Look! your God will come with vengeance,
with divine retribution.
He is the one who will come and save you.”

firstLine: Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened,
rest: and the ears of the deaf shall be opened.

firstLine: Then the lame shall leap like the deer,
rest:
and the tongue of the dumb shall sing for joy,
for waters shall break forth in the wilderness
and streams in the desert.

firstLine: And the parched ground shall become a pool,
And a highway shall be there, and a way,
rest:
and it shall be called the way of holiness.
The unclean shall not travel through it,
but it is for them, he who walks on the way;
and fools shall not wander about.

firstLine: No lion shall be there,
rest:
and no ferocious wild beast shall go up it.
It shall not be found there,
but the redeemed shall walk there.

firstLine: And the ransomed of Yahweh shall return,
rest:
and they shall come to Zion with rejoicing.
And everlasting joy shall be on their head;
joy and gladness shall overtake them,
and sorrow and sighing shall flee.

firstLine: Sennacherib Threatens Jerusalem
rest: And this happened: In the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah, Sennacherib king of Assyria went up against all the fortified cities of Judah, and he captured them.

firstLine: Hezekiah Consults Isaiah
rest: And this happened: When King Hezekiah heard, he tore his garments, covered himself with sackcloth, and entered the temple of Yahweh.

firstLine: Hezekiah’s Prayer
rest: And Hezekiah took the letter from the hand of the messengers, and he read it. Then he went up to the temple of Yahweh, and Hezekiah spread it out before the presence of Yahweh.

firstLine: God’s Answer
rest: And Isaiah son of Amoz sent to Hezekiah, saying, “Thus says Yahweh the God of Israel: ‘Because you have prayed to me concerning Sennacherib, king of Assyria,

firstLine: this is the word that Yahweh has spoken concerning him:
rest:
She shows contempt for you; she derides you, virgin daughter of Zion;
she shakes her head behind you, daughter of Jerusalem.

firstLine: Whom have you taunted and blasphemed,
rest:
and against whom have you raised up your voice and lifted your eyes upward?
To the holy one of Israel!

firstLine: By the hand of your servants you have taunted the Lord,
rest:
and you have said, “With my many chariots,
I myself have gone up the height of the mountains,
to the remote areas of Lebanon.
And I cut off its tall cedars,
the choicest of its junipers.
And I came to the height of its limit,
the forest of its orchard.

firstLine: I myself dug and drank waters,
rest: and I caused all the streams of Egypt to dry up by the sole of my feet.”

firstLine: And their inhabitants are weak;
rest:
they are dismayed, and they are ashamed;
they have become like plants of the field,
and like greens of grass,
like grass on the roofs
and a cultivated field before the standing grain.

firstLine: And I know your sitting down and your going out,
rest: and your coming in, and your raging against me.

firstLine: Because you were enraged against me,
rest:
and your noise has come up to my ears,
I will put my hook in your nose
and my bridle on your lips,
and I will turn you back
on the way by which you came.

firstLine: For a remnant shall go out from Jerusalem
rest:
and survivors from mountain Zion.
The zeal of Yahweh of hosts will do this.’

firstLine: Therefore thus says Yahweh concerning the king of Assyria:
rest:
‘He shall not come to this city,
and he shall not shoot an arrow there,
and he shall not meet it with a shield,
and he shall not heap a siege ramp up against her.

firstLine: He shall return by the way that he came,
rest:
and he shall not come to this city,’
declares Yahweh.

firstLine: Sennacherib’s Defeat
rest: And the angel of Yahweh set out and struck one hundred and eighty-five thousand in the camp of the Assyrians. When they rose in the morning, look! All of them were dead corpses.

firstLine: Hezekiah’s Illness
rest: In those days, Hezekiah became sick to death, and Isaiah son of Amoz, the prophet, came to him and said to him, “Thus says Yahweh: ‘Order your house, for you are about to die, and you shall not recover.’”

firstLine: I was the one who said, “I must go in the quiet of my days;
rest: I am summoned through the gates of Sheol for the rest of my years.”

firstLine: My dwelling place is pulled up and removed from me like the tent of my shepherd;
I lie down until morning;
rest:
like a lion, so he breaks all my bones;
from day to night you bring me to an end.

firstLine: Like a horse or a crane, so I chirp;
rest:
I moan like a dove.
My eyes are weak toward the height.
Lord, I have oppression; lend me support!

firstLine: The living, the living one praises you like me today;
rest: a father will make your faithfulness known to children.

firstLine: The Delegation from Babylon
rest: At that time, Merodach-Baladan, son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a present to Hezekiah, for he heard that he had been sick and recovered.

firstLine: Comfort for God’s People
rest: “Comfort; comfort my people,” says your God.

firstLine: “Speak to the heart of Jerusalem, and call to her,
rest:
that her compulsory labor is fulfilled, that her sin is paid for,
that she has received from the hand of Yahweh double for all her sins.”

firstLine: Every valley shall be lifted up,
rest:
and every mountain and hill shall become low,
And the rough ground shall be like a plain,
and the rugged ground like a valley-plain.

firstLine: And the glory of Yahweh shall be revealed,
rest:
and all humankind together shall see it,
for the mouth of Yahweh has spoken.”

firstLine: Grass withers; the flower withers
rest:
when the breath of Yahweh blows on it.
Surely the people are grass.

firstLine: Grass withers; the flower withers,
rest: but the word of our God will stand forever.

firstLine: He will feed his flock like a shepherd;
Who has measured the waters in the hollow of his hand
rest:
and marked off the heavens with a span,
comprehended the dust of the earth in a third of a measure
and weighed out the mountains in the scales, and the hills in a balance?

firstLine: Who has measured up the spirit of Yahweh
rest: or informed him as his counselor?

firstLine: With whom has he consulted, that he enlightened him
rest:
and taught him the path of justice,
and taught him knowledge,
and made the way of understanding known to him?

firstLine: And Lebanon is not enough to light a fire,
rest: and its animals not enough for a burnt offering.

firstLine: All the nations are like nothing before him;
rest: they are counted by him as nothing and emptiness.

firstLine: A craftsman pours out the idol,
rest:
and a goldsmith overlays it with gold,
and he smelts chains of silver.

firstLine: The one who is too impoverished for a gift chooses wood that will not rot;
rest: he seeks a skillful artisan for himself to set up an image that will not be knocked over.

firstLine: He is the one who sits above the circle of the earth,
the one who brings princes to nothing;
rest: he makes rulers of the earth like nothing.

firstLine: Indeed, hardly are they planted; indeed, hardly are they sown;
rest:
indeed, hardly has their shoot taken root in the earth
when he blows on them and they wither,
and the tempest carries them like stubble.

firstLine: Why do you say, Jacob,
rest:
and you speak, Israel,
“My way is hidden from Yahweh,
and my judgment is passed over by my God?”

firstLine: Have you not known,
rest:
or have you not heard?
Yahweh is the God of eternity,
the creator of the ends of the earth!
He is not faint, and he does not grow weary!
There is no searching his understanding.

firstLine: He gives power to the weary,
rest: and he increases power for the powerless.

firstLine: Even young people will be faint and grow weary,
rest: and the young will stumble, exhausted.

firstLine: God Helps Israel
rest:
Listen to me in silence, coastlands,
and let nations renew their strength.
Let them approach, then let them speak;
let us draw near together for judgment.

firstLine: Who has roused salvation from the east,
rest:
summoned him to his foot,
gives nations in his presence,
and subjugates kings?
He makes them like the dust with his sword,
like scattered stubble with his bow.

firstLine: He pursues them and passes on in peace;
rest: he does not enter the path with his feet.

firstLine: Who has accomplished and done this,
The coastlands have seen and are afraid;
rest:
the ends of the earth tremble.
They have drawn near,
and they have come.

firstLine: Each one helps his neighbor;
rest: he says to his brother, “Take courage!”

firstLine: And the artisan encourages the goldsmith,
rest:
the one who makes smooth with the hammer encourages the one who strikes the anvil,
saying of the soldering, “It is good!”
And they strengthen it with nails so it cannot be knocked over.

firstLine: But you, Israel, my servant, Jacob, whom I have chosen,
rest: you, the offspring of Abraham my friend,

firstLine: you whom I grasped from the ends of the earth
You must not fear, for I am with you;
rest:
you must not be afraid, for I am your God.
I will strengthen you, indeed I will help you,
indeed I will take hold of you with the right hand of my salvation.

firstLine: You shall seek them,
For I, Yahweh your God, am grasping your right hand;
You must not fear, O worm of Jacob;
rest:
people of Israel,
I myself, I will help you,” declares Yahweh,
“and your redeemer is the holy one of Israel.

firstLine: You shall winnow them and the wind shall carry them,
The poor and the needy are seeking water and there is none;
I will open rivers on the barren heights
rest:
and fountains in the midst of the valleys.
I will make the wilderness like a pool of water
and the land of dryness like springs of water.

firstLine: I will put the cedar, acacia, myrtle, and olive oil tree in the wilderness;
rest: I will set the cypress, elm, and box tree together in the desert

firstLine: so that they may see and know,
rest:
and take to heart and understand together
that the hand of Yahweh has done this,
and the holy one of Israel has created it.”

firstLine: “Present your legal case,” says Yahweh.
rest: “Bring your evidence,” says the king of Jacob.

firstLine: Let them bring them,
rest:
and let them tell us what will happen.
Tell us what the former things are
so that we may take them to our heart
and know their outcome.
Declare to us the things to come;

firstLine: tell us the things coming hereafter,
rest:
that we may know that you are gods.
Indeed, do good or do evil,
that we may be afraid and see together.

firstLine: I stirred up one from the north,
rest:
and he has come from the rising of the sun.
He shall call on my name,
and he shall come on officials as on mortar,
and as the potter treads clay.

firstLine: Who declared it from the beginning so that we might know,
rest:
and beforehand so that we might say, “He is right!”
Indeed, there was no one who declared it;
Indeed, there was no one who proclaimed it.
Indeed there was no one who heard your words.

firstLine: But I look and there is no man,
rest:
and I look among these and there is no counselor,
that I might ask them and they might answer a word.

firstLine: The Mission of Yahweh’s Servant
rest:
Look! here is my servant; I hold him,
my chosen one, in whom my soul delights.
I have put my spirit on him;
he will bring justice forth to the nations.

firstLine: He will not cry out and lift up
rest: and make his voice heard in the street.

firstLine: He will not break a broken reed,
rest:
and he not will extinguish a dim wick.
He will bring justice forth in faithfulness.

firstLine: He will not grow faint,
rest:
and he will not be broken
until he has established justice in the earth.
And the coastlands wait for his teaching.

firstLine: Thus says the God, Yahweh,
rest:
who created the heavens
and stretched them out,
who spread out the earth and its offspring,
who gives breath to the people upon it
and spirit to those who walk in it.

firstLine: “I am Yahweh; I have called you in righteousness,
to open the blind eyes,
rest:
to bring the prisoner out from the dungeon,
those who sit in darkness from the house of imprisonment.

firstLine: I am Yahweh; that is my name,
rest:
and I do not give my glory to another,
nor my praise to the idols.

firstLine: A Song of Praise to Yahweh
rest:
Sing a new song to Yahweh;
praise him from the end of the earth,
you who go down to the sea and that which fills it,
the coastlands and their inhabitants.

firstLine: Let the desert and its towns lift up their voice,
Let them give glory to Yahweh
rest: and declare his praise in the coastlands.

firstLine: Yahweh goes forth like a mighty warrior;
I have been silent for a long time;
I will cause mountains and hills to dry up,
And I will lead the blind by a road they do not know;
rest:
I will cause them to tread on paths they have not known.
I will make darkness in their presence into light
and rough places into level ground.
These are the things I will do,
and I will not forsake them.

firstLine: They shall turn back;
rest:
they shall be greatly ashamed,
those who trust in an image,
who say to a cast image, “You are our gods.”

firstLine: Blind and Deaf Israel
rest:
Deaf people, listen!
And blind people, look to see!

firstLine: Who is blind but my servant
rest:
or deaf like my messenger whom I sent?
Who is blind like the one who is repaid
or blind like the servant of Yahweh?

firstLine: Yahweh was willing for the sake of his righteousness;
rest: he showed his teaching to be great and proved it to be glorious.

firstLine: But this is a people plundered and looted; all of them are trapped in holes,
Who among you will heed this,
rest: will listen attentively and listen, for the time to come?

firstLine: Who gave Jacob to a plunderer
rest:
and Israel to those who plunder?
Was it not Yahweh, against whom we have sinned?
And they were not willing to walk in his ways,
and they would not obey his law.

firstLine: So he poured the wrath of his anger upon him
The Restorer of Israel
rest:
But now thus says Yahweh,
he who created you, Jacob,
and he who formed you, Israel:
“You must not fear, for I have redeemed you.
I have called you by your name; you are mine.

firstLine: When you pass through the waters, I will be with you,
rest:
and through the rivers, they shall not flow over you.
When you walk through fire, you shall not be burned,
and the flame shall not scorch you.

firstLine: For I am Yahweh, your God,
rest:
the holy one of Israel, your savior.
I give you Egypt as ransom,
Cush and Seba in place of you.

firstLine: Because you are precious in my eyes,
rest:
you are honored, and I myself love you,
and I give people in place of you,
and nations in place of your life.

firstLine: You must not fear,
rest:
for I am with you.
I will bring your offspring from the east,
and I will gather you from the west.

firstLine: everyone who is called by my name,
rest:
and whom I created for my glory,
whom I formed,
indeed whom I made.”

firstLine: Bring out the people blind yet with eyes,
rest: and deaf, though they have ears.

firstLine: Let all the nations gather together,
rest:
and let the peoples assemble.
Who among them has declared this,
and declared the former things to us?
Let them bring their witnesses, that they may be in the right,
and let them hear and say, “It is true!”

firstLine: “You are my witnesses,” declares Yahweh,
rest:
“and my servant whom I have chosen
so that you may know and believe in me
and understand that I am he.
No god was formed before me,
and none shall be after me.

firstLine: I myself am Yahweh,
rest: and there is no savior besides me!

firstLine: I myself declared and saved,
rest:
and I proclaimed. And there was no strange god among you.
And you are my witnesses,” declares Yahweh,
“and I am God.

firstLine: Indeed, from this day I am the one,
rest:
and no one can deliver from my hand.
I perform, and who can cancel it?”

firstLine: Yahweh Rescues His People
rest:
Thus says Yahweh, your redeemer,
the holy one of Israel:
“For your sake I will send to Babylon,
and I will cause all of them to fall down as fugitives,
and the Chaldeans, their rejoicing on the ships.

firstLine: I am Yahweh, your holy one,
rest: the creator of Israel, your king.”

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh, who makes a way in the sea
rest: and a path in the mighty waters,

firstLine: who brings out chariot and horse,
rest:
army and mighty one.
Together they lie down;
they cannot rise.
They are extinguished,
quenched like a wick.

firstLine: “You must not remember the former things,
rest: and you not must consider the former things.

firstLine: The animals of the field will honor me,
rest:
jackals and daughters of the ostrich,
for I give water in the wilderness,
rivers in the desert,
to give a drink to my chosen people,

firstLine: this people whom I formed for myself,
rest: so they might make known my praise.

firstLine: But you did not call me, Jacob;
rest: for you have become weary of me, Israel.

firstLine: You have not brought me your sheep for a burnt offering
rest:
nor honored me with your sacrifice.
I have not made you serve with offerings,
nor have I made you weary with frankincense.

firstLine: You have not bought me spice reed with money
I, I am the one who blots out your transgressions for my sake,
rest: and I will not remember your sins.

firstLine: Your first ancestor sinned,
rest: and your representatives transgressed against me.

firstLine: And I profaned the princes of the sanctuary,
rest: and I gave Jacob to destruction, and Israel to reviling.

firstLine: Yahweh Blesses Chosen Israel
rest:
“But now hear, Jacob my servant,
and Israel, whom I have chosen.

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh, who made you,
rest:
and who formed you in the womb and will help you:
you must not fear, my servant Jacob,
and Jeshurun whom I have chosen.

firstLine: For I will pour out water on a thirsty land
rest:
and streams on dry ground.
I will pour my spirit out on your descendants
and my blessing on your offspring.

firstLine: And they shall sprout among the grass
rest: like willows by a watercourse of water.

firstLine: Yahweh the Only God
rest:
Thus says Yahweh, the king of Israel,
and its redeemer, Yahweh of hosts:
“I am the first, and I am the last,
and there is no god besides me.

firstLine: You must not tremble,
rest:
and you must not be paralyzed with fear.
Have I not made you hear from of old
and declared it, and you are my witnesses?
Is there a god besides me?
And there is no rock! I know none!”

firstLine: Idolatry Is Ridiculous
rest:
All those who form an idol are nothing,
and their delightful things do not profit.
And their witnesses do not see or know,
so they will be ashamed.

firstLine: Who would form a god
rest: and cast an image of which he cannot profit?

firstLine: The ironsmith works in the coals with his tool
The woodworker stretches out a line;
rest:
he makes an outline of it with a marker.
He makes it with a knife
and makes an outline of it with a compass.
He makes it like the image of a man,
like the beauty of a human, to dwell in a temple.

firstLine: Cutting down cedars for himself,
rest:
he chooses a holm tree and an oak,
and he lets it grow strong for him among the trees of the forest.
He plants a cedar, and the rain makes it grow.

firstLine: And it becomes fuel for a human,
He burns half of it in the fire;
rest:
he eats meat over half of it;
he roasts a roast and is satisfied.
Also he grows warm and says, “Ah!
I am warm! I see the fire!”

firstLine: They do not know,
And no one takes it to heart, and there is no knowledge
rest:
and no understanding to say, “I burned half of it in the fire
and also I baked bread on its coals;
I roasted meat, and I have eaten.
And I shall make the rest of it into an abomination!
I shall bow down to a block of wood!”

firstLine: Yahweh Remembers Israel
rest:
“Remember these things, Jacob,
and Israel, for you are my servant:
I formed you; you are my servant;
Israel, you will not be forgotten by me!

firstLine: I have wiped your transgressions out like a cloud
rest:
and your sins like mist.
Return to me,
for I have redeemed you!”

firstLine: Jerusalem Restored through Cyrus
rest:
Thus says Yahweh, your redeemer,
and he who formed you in the womb:
“I am Yahweh, who made everything,
who stretched out the heavens alone,
who spread out the earth—who was with me?—

firstLine: who frustrates the signs of oracle priests
rest:
and makes a fool of diviners,
who drives the wise men back
and makes their knowledge foolish,

firstLine: who keeps the word of his servant
rest:
and carries out the plan of his messengers,
who says of Jerusalem, ‘It shall be inhabited,’
and of the cities of Judah, ‘They shall be rebuilt,
and I will restore its ruins’;

firstLine: who says of Cyrus, ‘My shepherd,’
Thus says Yahweh to his anointed one,
rest:
to Cyrus, whose right hand I have grasped
to subjugate nations before him,
and I uncover the loins of kings
to open doors before him,
and the gates shall not be shut:

firstLine: “I myself will go before you,
rest:
and I will level the mountains.
I will break the doors of bronze
and cut throughthe bars of iron.

firstLine: And I will give you the treasures of darkness
rest:
and treasures of secret places
so that you may know that I am Yahweh,
the one who calls you by your name, the God of Israel,

firstLine: for the sake of my servant Jacob,
I am Yahweh, and there is none besides me;
rest:
besides me there is no god.
I gird you though you do not know me,

firstLine: so that they may know from the rising of the sun
rest:
and from the west that there is none besides me;
I am Yahweh and there is none besides me.

firstLine: I form light and I create darkness;
rest:
I make peace and I create evil;
I am Yahweh; I do all these things.

firstLine: Trickle, O heavens, from above,
Woe to the one who strives with his maker,
rest:
a potsherd among potsherds of earth!
Does the clay say to the one who fashions it,
‘What are you making?’
and ‘Your work has no hands’?

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh, the holy one of Israel,
rest:
and its maker:
“Ask me of the things to come about my children,
and you command me about the work of my hands.

firstLine: I myself made the earth,
rest:
and I created humankind upon it.
I, my hands, stretched out the heavens,
and I commanded all their host.

firstLine: I myself have stirred him up in righteousness,
rest:
and I will make all his paths smooth.
He himself shall build my city,
and he shall set my exiles free,
not for price or a gift,” says Yahweh of hosts.

firstLine: Yahweh the Only Savior
rest:
Thus says Yahweh:
“The acquisition of Egypt
and the merchandise of Cush
and the Sabeans, tall men,
shall pass over to you;
they shall be yours,
and they shall walk behind you.
They shall pass over in chains,
and they shall bow down to you;
they will pray to you:
‘Surely God is with you, and there is no other.
Besides him there is no God.’”

firstLine: Surely you are a God who keeps yourself hidden,
rest: God of Israel, the savior.

firstLine: All of them are ashamed and indeed humiliated;
rest: the craftsmen of idols go together in insult.

firstLine: Israel is saved by Yahweh with everlasting salvation;
rest:
you shall not be ashamed,
and you shall not be humiliated to all eternity.

firstLine: For thus says Yahweh, who created the heavens,
rest:
he is God, who formed the earth
and who made it.
He himself established it;
he did not create it as emptiness—
he formed it for inhabiting.
“I am Yahweh and there is none besides me.

firstLine: I have spoken not in secrecy, in a place, a land, of darkness,
rest:
I have not said to the descendants of Jacob, ‘Seek me in vain!’
I, Yahweh, am speaking righteousness,
declaring uprightness.

firstLine: Assemble and come;
rest:
draw near together, survivors of the nations!
They do not know, those who carry their wooden idols
and pray to a god who cannot save.

firstLine: Declare and present your case,
rest:
also let them consult together!
Who made this known from former times,
declared it from of old?
Was it not I, Yahweh?
And there is no other god besides me,
a righteous God besides me,
and no savior besides me.

firstLine: Turn to me and be saved, all the ends of the earth,
rest: for I am God and there is none besides me.

firstLine: I have sworn by myself;
‘Only in Yahweh,’ one shall say to me, ‘are righteousness and strength.’
rest: He shall come to him, and all those who were angry with him shall be ashamed.

firstLine: In Yahweh all the offspring of Israel shall be in the right,
rest: and they shall boast.”

firstLine: Babylon’s Idols
They stoop;
rest:
they bow down together.
They are not able to save the burden,
but they themselves go in captivity.

firstLine: “Listen to me, house of Jacob,
rest:
and all the remnant of the house of Israel
who have been carried from the belly,
who have been carried from the womb:

firstLine: Even to your old age I am he;
rest:
even to your advanced age I myself will support you.
I myself have made you,
and I myself will carry you,
and I myself will support you,
and I will save you.

firstLine: To whom will you liken me,
rest:
and count as equal,
and compare with me,
as though we were alike?

firstLine: Those who lavish gold from the purse
They carry it on their shoulder;
rest:
they support it and they set it in its place,
and it stands in position.
It cannot be removed from its place;
even when he cries out to it, it does not answer.
It does not save him from his trouble.

firstLine: Remember the former things from a long time ago,
rest:
for I am God and there is none besides me,
God and there is none like me,

firstLine: who from the beginning declares the end,
rest:
and from before, things that have not been done,
who says, ‘My plan shall stand,’
and, ‘I will accomplish all my wishes,’

firstLine: who calls a bird of prey from the east,
rest:
the man of his plan from a country from afar.
Indeed I have spoken; indeed I will bring it to being.
I have formed it; indeed I will do it.

firstLine: Listen to me, strong of heart,
rest: far from righteousness!

firstLine: Babylon’s Fall
rest:
Come down and sit on the dust, virgin daughter of Babylon!
Sit on the ground without a throne, daughter of Chaldea!
For they shall no longer call you tender and delicate.

firstLine: Your nakedness shall be exposed;
rest:
indeed, your shame shall become visible.
I will take vengeance
and I will not spare a person.

firstLine: Sit silently and go into the darkness, daughter of Chaldea,
rest: for they shall no longer call you mistress of kingdoms.

firstLine: I was angry with my people;
rest:
I profaned my inheritance,
and I gave them into your hand.
You did not give them mercy;
on the aged you made your yoke very heavy.

firstLine: Therefore now hear this, luxuriant one who sits in security,
rest:
who says in her heart, “I am, and besides me there is no one.
I shall not sit as a widow,
and I shall not know the loss of children.”

firstLine: And these two shall come to you in a moment, in one day:
rest:
the loss of children and widowhood shall come on you completely,
in spite of your many sorceries,
in spite of the power of your great enchantments.

firstLine: And you felt secure in your wickedness;
rest:
you said, “No one sees me.”
Your wisdom and your knowledge led you astray,
and you said in your heart, “I am, and besides me there is no one.”

firstLine: And evil shall come upon you, you will not know;
rest:
it will be on the lookout for her.
And disaster shall fall upon you; you will not be able to avert it.
And ruin shall come on you suddenly; you do not know.

firstLine: Stand, now, in your enchantments,
You struggle with your many consultations;
rest:
let them stand, now, and save you—
those who see the stars, divide the celestial sphere,
who inform by new moons—
from those things that are coming upon you.

firstLine: So are to you those with whom you have labored,
Yahweh Refines Stubborn Israel
rest:
Hear this, house of Jacob,
who are called by the name of Israel
and came out from the waters of Judah,
who swear by the name of Yahweh,
and invoke the God of Israel,
but not in truth
and not in righteousness.

firstLine: For they call themselves after the holy city,
rest:
and they lean on the God of Israel—
Yahweh of hosts is his name.

firstLine: “I declared the former things from of old,
because I know that you are obstinate,
rest:
and your neck an iron sinew,
and your forehead bronze.

firstLine: And I declared them to you from of old;
rest:
I  announced them to you before they came to pass
so that you would not say, ‘My idol did them,
and my image and my cast image commanded them.’

firstLine: Now they are created, and not from of old,
rest:
and before today, and you have not heard them
so that you could not say, “Look! I knew them.”

firstLine: Neither have you heard, nor have you known,
rest:
nor from of old has your ear been opened.
For I knew you would deal treacherously, very treacherously,
and you are called a rebel from the womb.

firstLine: For the sake of my name I refrain from my anger,
rest:
and for my praise I restrain it for you
so as not to cut you off.

firstLine: For my own sake, for my own sake I do it;
rest:
for why should it be defiled?
And I will not give my glory to another.”

firstLine: Yahweh Frees Israel
rest:
“Listen to me, Jacob,
and Israel, whom I called:
I am he. I am the first;
also I am the last.

firstLine: Indeed, my hand founded the earth,
rest:
and my right hand spread out the heavens;
when I summon them, they stand in position together.

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh, your redeemer, the holy one of Israel:
rest:
“I am Yahweh your God, who teaches you to profit,
leads you in the way you should go.

firstLine: And your offspring would have been like the sand,
rest:
and the descendants of your body like its grains.
It would not be cut off,
and its name would not be destroyed from my presence.”

firstLine: And when he led them through the deserts, they were not thirsty;
rest:
he made water flow from the rock for them,
and he split the rock,
and the water gushed out.

firstLine: Yahweh’s Servant Brings Salvation
rest:
Listen to me, coastlands,
and listen attentively, peoples from far away!
Yahweh called me from the womb;
from the body of my mother he made my name known.

firstLine: And he made my mouth like a sharp sword;
And he said to me, “You are my servant,
rest: Israel, in whom I will show my glory.”

firstLine: But I myself said, “I have labored in vain;
rest:
I have used up my strength for nothing and vanity!
Nevertheless, my justice is with Yahweh,
and my reward is with my God.”

firstLine: And now Yahweh says,
rest:
who formed me from the womb as a servant for him,
to bring Jacob back to him,
and that Israel might not be gathered,
for I am honored in the eyes of Yahweh,
and my God has become my strength.

firstLine: And he says, “It is trivial for you to be a servant for me,
rest:
to raise up the tribes of Jacob
and to bring back the preserved of Israel.
I will give you as a light to the nations,
to be my salvation to the end of the earth.”

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh, the redeemer of Israel, his holy one,
rest:
to the one who despises life,
to the one who abhors the nation,
to the slave of rulers:
“Kings shall see and stand up;
princes, and they shall bow down,
for the sake of Yahweh, who is faithful,
the holy one of Israel, and he has chosen you.”

firstLine: Yahweh Restores the Afflicted
rest:
Thus says Yahweh:
“I have answered you in a time of favor,
and helped you on a day of salvation,
and watched over you,
and given you as a covenant of the people,
to raise up the land,
to give the desolate hereditary property as an inheritance,

firstLine: They shall not be hungry or thirsty,
And I will make all my mountains like a road,
rest: and my highways shall lead up.

firstLine: Yahweh Remembers Zion
rest:
But Zion said, “Yahweh has forsaken me,
and the Lord has forgotten me!”

firstLine: Can a woman forget her suckling,
rest:
refrain from having compassion on the child of her womb?
Indeed, these may forget,
but I, I will not forget you!

firstLine: Look, I have inscribed you on the palms of my hands;
rest: your walls are continually before me.

firstLine: Your children hasten;
rest: your destroyers and those who laid you waste depart from you.

firstLine: Lift your eyes up all around and see;
rest:
all of them gather; they come to you.
As surely as I live,
declares Yahweh,
surely you shall put on all of them like an ornament,
and you shall bind them on like a bride.
