firstLine: Surely your sites of ruins and desolate places and land of ruins,
rest:
surely now you will be too cramped for your inhabitants,
and those who engulfed you will be far away.

firstLine: Yet the children born when you were bereaved will say in your hearing,
rest:
“The place is too cramped for me;
make room for me so that I can dwell.”

firstLine: Then you will say in your heart,
Thus says the Lord Yahweh:
rest:
“Look! I will lift my hand up to the nations,
and I will raise my signal to the peoples,
and they shall bring your sons in their bosom,
and your daughters shall be carried on their shoulders.

firstLine: And kings shall be your guardians,
rest:
and their queens your nurses.
They shall bow down, faces to the ground, to you,
and they will lick up the dust of your feet.
Then you will know that I am Yahweh;
those who await me shall not be ashamed.

firstLine: But thus says Yahweh:
rest:
“Indeed a captive of the mighty shall be taken,
and the war-booty of the tyrant shall be rescued,
for I myself will dispute with your opponent,
and I myself will save your children.

firstLine: And I will feed your oppressors their own flesh,
rest:
and they shall be drunk with their blood as with wine.
Then all flesh shall know that I am Yahweh,
your savior and redeemer, the strong one of Jacob.”

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh:
rest:
“Where is this divorce document of your mother’s divorce, with which I dismissed her?
or to whom of my creditors did I sell you?
Look! you were sold because of your sin,
and your mother was dismissed because of your transgressions.

firstLine: Why was there no man when I came,
rest:
no one who answered when I called?
Do I lack the strength to save?
Or is there no power in me to deliver?
Look! by my rebuke I dry up the sea;
I make the rivers a desert;
their fish stink because there is no water,
and they die because of thirst.

firstLine: I clothe the heavens with darkness,
rest: and I make their covering sackcloth.”

firstLine: The Servant’s Vindication
rest:
The Lord Yahweh has given me the tongue of a pupil,
to know how to help the weary with a word.
He awakens morning by morning,
awakens an ear for me to listen as do the pupils.

firstLine: The Lord Yahweh has opened an ear for me,
rest:
and I, I was not rebellious.
I did not turn backwards;

firstLine: I gave my back to those who struck me,
rest:
and my cheeks to those who pulled out my beard;
I did not hide my face from insults and spittle.

firstLine: And the Lord Yahweh helps me,
Who among you is in fear of Yahweh,
rest:
obeys the voice of his servant?
Who walks in darkness
and has no light,
trusts in the name of Yahweh
and depends on his God?

firstLine: Yahweh Comforts Zion
rest:
“Listen to me, you who pursue righteousness,
who seek Yahweh.
Look to the rock from which you were hewn,
and to the excavation of the pit from which you were quarried.

firstLine: Look to Abraham your father,
rest:
and to Sarah; she brought you forth.
For I called him alone,
but I blessed him and made him numerous.”

firstLine: For Yahweh will comfort Zion;
rest:
he will comfort all its sites of ruins.
And he will make its wilderness like Eden,
and its desert like the garden of Yahweh.
Joy and gladness will be found in it,
thanksgiving and the sound of song.

firstLine: “Listen attentively to me, my people,
rest:
and my nation, listen to me!
For a teaching will go out from me,
and I will cause my justice to rest for a light to the peoples.

firstLine: My righteousness is near; my salvation has gone out,
rest:
and my arms will judge the peoples.
The coastlands wait for me,
and for my arm they wait.

firstLine: Lift up your eyes to the heavens
rest:
and look to the earth beneath,
for the heavens will be torn to pieces like smoke,
and the earth will be worn out like a garment,
and those who inhabit her will die like gnats.
But my salvation will be forever,
and my righteousness will not be broken to pieces.

firstLine: Listen to me, you who know righteousness,
For a moth will eat them like garments;
rest:
a moth will devour them like wool,
but my righteousness will be forever,
and my salvation for generation after generation.”

firstLine: Are you not the one who dried up the sea,
rest:
the waters of the great deep,
the one who made the depths of the sea a way
for those who are redeemed to cross over?

firstLine: So the redeemed ones of Yahweh shall return,
rest:
and they shall come to Zion with singing,
and everlasting joy shall be on their heads.
Joy and gladness shall appear;
sorrow and sighing shall flee away!

firstLine: “I, I am he who comforts you;
rest:
who are you that you are afraid of man? He dies!
And of the son of humankind? He is sacrificed as grass!

firstLine: And you have forgotten Yahweh, your maker,
rest:
who stretched out the heavens,
and founded the earth.
And you tremble continually, all day,
because of the wrath of the oppressor
when he takes aim to destroy.
But where is the wrath of the oppressor?

firstLine: For I am Yahweh, your God,
rest:
who stirs up the sea, so that its waves roar;
Yahweh of hosts is his name.

firstLine: And I have put my words in your mouth,
rest:
and I have covered you in the shadow of my hand,
to plant the heavens
and to found the earth,
saying to Zion, ‘You are my people.’”

firstLine: There is no one who guides her among all the children she has borne,
rest: and there is no one who grasps her by the hand among all the children she raised.

firstLine: Your children have fainted;
rest:
they lie at the head of all the streets, like an antelope in a snare,
those who are full of the wrath of Yahweh,
the rebuke of your God.

firstLine: Therefore hear now this afflicted one
rest: and drunken one but not from wine.

firstLine: Thus says your Lord, Yahweh,
rest:
and your God pleads the cause of his people:
“Look! I have taken from your hand the cup of staggering.
You shall not continue to drink the goblet, the cup of my wrath, any longer.

firstLine: And I will put it in the hand of your tormenters,
rest:
who have said to you, ‘Bow down that we may pass over you!’
And you have made your back like the ground,
and like the street for those who pass over you.”

firstLine: Yahweh Redeems Zion
rest:
Awake! Awake; put on your strength, Zion!
Put on the garments of your beauty, Jerusalem, holy city!
For the uncircumcised and the unclean shall not continue to enter you any longer.

firstLine: For thus says Yahweh:
rest:
“You were sold for nothing,
and you shall be redeemed without money.”

firstLine: For thus says the Lord Yahweh:
rest: “My people went down to Egypt in the beginning, to dwell as aliens there, and Assyria oppressed him without cause.

firstLine: How delightful on the mountains are the feet of him who brings good news,
rest:
who announces peace, who brings good news, who announces salvation,
who says to Zion, “Your God reigns as a king.”

firstLine: Break forth,
Yahweh has bared his holy arm to the eyes of all the nations,
rest: and all the ends of the earth shall see the salvation of our God.

firstLine: For you shall not go out in haste,
The Servant’s Suffering and Exaltation
rest:
Look, my servant shall achieve success;
he shall be exalted,
and he shall be lifted up,
and he shall be very high.

firstLine: Just as many were appalled at you—
rest:
such was his appearance beyond human disfigurement,
and his form beyond the sons of mankind—

firstLine: so he shall sprinkle many nations;
rest:
because of him, kings shall shut their mouths.
For they shall see what has not been told them,
and they shall consider with full attention what they have not heard.

firstLine: Who has believed our message,
rest: and to whom has the arm of Yahweh been revealed?

firstLine: For he went up like a shoot before him,
rest:
and like a root from dry ground.
He had no form and no majesty that we should see him,
and no appearance that we should take pleasure in him.

firstLine: He was despised and rejected by men,
rest:
a man of suffering, and acquainted with sickness,
and like one from whom others hide their faces, he was despised,
and we did not hold him in high regard.

firstLine: However, he was the one who lifted up our sicknesses,
rest:
and he carried our pain,
yet we ourselves assumed him stricken,
struck down by God and afflicted.

firstLine: But he was pierced because of our transgressions,
All of us have wandered about like sheep;
He was oppressed and afflicted,
rest:
yet he did not open his mouth;
he was brought like a lamb to the slaughter,
and like a sheep is dumb before its shearers,
so he did not open his mouth.

firstLine: He was taken by restraint of justice,
He made his grave with the wicked,
rest:
and with the rich in his death,
although he had done no violence,
and there was no deceit in his mouth.

firstLine: Yet Yahweh was pleased to crush him;
rest:
he made him sick.
If she places his life a guilt offering,
he will see offspring.
He will prolong days,
and the will of Yahweh will succeed in his hand.

firstLine: From the trouble of his life he will see;
rest:
he will be satisfied.
In his knowledge, the righteous one, my servant, shall declare many righteous,
and he is the one who will bear their iniquities.

firstLine: Therefore, I will divide to him a portion among the many,
rest:
and with the strong ones he will divide bounty,
because he poured his life out to death
and was counted with the transgressors;
and he was the one who bore the sin of many
and will intercede for the transgressors.

firstLine: The Fertile Wife of Yahweh
rest:
“Sing for joy, barren woman; who has not borne!
Burst forth into rejoicing and rejoice, she who has not been in labor!
For the children of the desolate woman are more than the children of the married woman,” says Yahweh.

firstLine: “Enlarge the site of your tent,
rest:
and let them stretch out the tent curtains of your dwelling place.
You must not spare; make your tent cords long
and strengthen your pegs,

firstLine: You must not fear, for you will not be ashamed,
For your husband is your maker, his name is Yahweh of hosts;
rest: and your redeemer is the holy one of Israel, he is called the God of all of the earth.

firstLine: For Yahweh has called you like a wife forsaken and hurt of spirit,
rest: like the wife of childhood when she is rejected, says your God.

firstLine: I abandoned you for a short moment,
rest: but I will gather you with great compassion.

firstLine: I hid my face from you for a moment, in the flowing of anger,
rest: but I will have compassion on you with everlasting faithfulness” says your redeemer, Yahweh.

firstLine: “For this is like the waters of Noah to me,
rest:
when I swore that the waters of Noah would never again pass over the earth,
so I swore that I would not be angry at you and rebuke you.

firstLine: For the mountains may depart,
rest:
and the hills may sway,
but my faithfulness shall not depart from you,
and my covenant of peace shall not sway,”
says Yahweh, who has compassion on you,

firstLine: And I will make your battlements of ruby,
rest:
and your gates of stones of beryl,
and all your wall of precious stones.

firstLine: And all your children shall be pupils of Yahweh,
rest: and the peace of your children shall be great.

firstLine: If indeed one attacks, it is not from me;
rest: whoever attacks you shall fall because of you.

firstLine: Every weapon formed against you shall not succeed,
rest:
and you shall declare guilty every tongue that rises against you for judgment.
This is the inheritance of the servants of Yahweh,
and their legal right from me,”
declares Yahweh.

firstLine: Invitation to True Rewards
rest:
“Ho! Everyone thirsty, come to the waters!
And whoever has no money, come, buy and eat,
and come, buy without money,
wine and milk without price!

firstLine: Why do you weigh out money for what is not food,
rest:
and your labor for what cannot satisfy?
Listen carefully to me, and eat what is good,
and let your soul take pleasure in rich food.

firstLine: Seek Yahweh while he lets himself be found;
rest: call him while he is near.

firstLine: Let the wicked forsake his way,
rest:
and the man of sin his thoughts.
And let him return to Yahweh, that he may take pity on him,
and to our God, for he will forgive manifold.

firstLine: “For my thoughts are not your thoughts,
rest:
and your ways are not my ways,”
declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “For as the heavens are higher than the earth,
rest:
so my ways are higher than your ways,
and my thoughts than your thoughts.

firstLine: For just as the rain and the snow come down from heaven,
rest:
and they do not return there
except they have watered the earth thoroughly
and cause it to bring forth and sprout,
and give seed to the sower
and bread to the eater,

firstLine: For you shall go out in joy,
rest:
and you shall be led in peace.
The mountains and the hills shall break forth before you, rejoicing
and all the trees of the field shall clap hands.

firstLine: Instead of the thorn bush, the juniper shall go up;
rest:
instead of the brier, the myrtle shall go up,
and it shall serve as a memorial to Yahweh,
for an everlasting sign that shall not be cut off.”

firstLine: Salvation for All Who Obey
rest:
Thus says Yahweh:
“Observe justice
and do righteousness,
for my salvation is close to coming,
and my justice to being revealed.

firstLine: Happy is the man who does this,
rest:
and the son of humankind who keeps hold of it,
who keeps the Sabbath so as not to profane it,
and who keeps his hand from doing any evil.”

firstLine: For thus says Yahweh, “To the eunuchs who keep my Sabbaths,
rest:
and choose that in which I delight,
and who keep hold of my covenant.

firstLine: And I will give them a monument and a name in my house and within my walls,
And the foreigners who join themselves to Yahweh to serve him
rest:
and to love the name of Yahweh, to become his servants,
every one who keeps the Sabbath, so as not to profane it,
and those who keep hold of my covenant,

firstLine: I will bring them to my holy mountain;
rest:
I will make them merry in my house of prayer.
their burnt offerings and their sacrifices will be accepted on my altar,
for my house shall be called a house of prayer for all peoples,”

firstLine: Wicked Leaders
rest:
All wild animals in the field, come,
to devour, all wild animals in the forest!

firstLine: His watchmen are blind,
rest:
none of them know.
They are all dumb dogs;
they are unable to bark,
panting, lying down,
loving to slumber.

firstLine: And the dogs have a greedy appetite;
rest:
they are never satisfied.
And they are the shepherds!
They do not have understanding.
They all turn to their own way,
each one for his own gain, every one of them.

firstLine: “Come, let me take wine,
rest:
and let us carouse with intoxicating drink,
and tomorrow will be like today,
very great indeed.”

firstLine: Idolatry is Adultery
rest:
The righteous one perishes, and there is no one who takes it to heart.
And men of faithfulness are gathered, while there is no one who understands,
for the righteous is gathered from the presence of wickedness.

firstLine: he enters into peace;
rest:
they will rest on their beds,
walking straight ahead of him.

firstLine: “But you, come near here, you children of a soothsayer,
rest: offspring of an adulterer and she who commits fornication.

firstLine: who burn with lust among the oaks,
rest:
under every leafy tree,
who slaughter children in the valleys,
under the clefts of the rocks?

firstLine: Your portion is among the smooth stones of the valley;
rest:
they, they are your lot;
indeed, to them you have poured out a drink offering,
you have brought a food offering.
Shall I relent concerning these things?

firstLine: You have set your bed upon a high and lofty mountain;
rest: indeed, you went up there to slaughter sacrifice.

firstLine: And you have set your symbol behind the door and the doorpost;
And you climbed down to the king with oil,
rest:
and you made your perfumes numerous,
and you sent your envoys far away,
and you sent down deep to Sheol.

firstLine: You grow weary by the greatness of your way,
rest:
but you did not say, ‘Despairing!’
You found the renewal of your strength,
therefore you do not grow weak.

firstLine: And of whom were you afraid and feared, that you deceived
rest:
and did not remember me?
Did you not place it on your heart?
Have I not been silent, even from long ago,
and so you do not fear me?

firstLine: I myself will declare your righteousness and your works,
rest: but they will not benefit you.

firstLine: When you cry, let your collection deliver you,
rest:
and the wind will carry all of them away;
a breath will take them away.
But he who takes refuge in me shall take possession of the land,
and he shall inherit my holy mountain.”

firstLine: Peace for the Contrite
rest:
And one shall say, “Build up, build up! Clear the way!
Remove the obstacles from the way of my people!”

firstLine: For thus says the high and lofty one who resides forever, and whose name is holy:
rest:
“I reside in a high and holy place,
and with the contrite and humble of spirit,
to revive the spirit of the humble,
and to revive the heart of the contrite.

firstLine: For I will not attack forever,
I was angry because of his sin of gain, and I struck him;
rest: I hid and I was angry, but he walked apostate, in the ways of his heart.

firstLine: I have seen his ways, but I will heal him;
rest: and I will lead him and give him and his mourners comfort as a recompense,

firstLine: But the wicked are like the churning sea,
rest:
that is not able to keep quiet,
and its waters toss up mire and mud.

firstLine: True Fasts and Sabbaths
rest:
“Call with the throat; you must not keep back!
lift up your voice like a trumpet,
and declare to my people their rebellion,
and to the house of Jacob their sins.

firstLine: Yet they seek me day by day,
rest:
and they desire the knowledge of my ways
like a nation that practiced righteousness,
and had not forsaken the judgment of its God;
they ask me for righteous judgments,
they desire the closeness of God.

firstLine: ‘Why do we fast, and you do not see it?
rest:
We humiliate our soul, and you do not notice it?’
Look! You find delight on the day of your fast,
and you oppress all your workers!

firstLine: Is the fast I choose like this,
rest:
a day for humankind to humiliate himself?
To bow his head like a reed,
and make his bed on sackcloth and ashes;
you call this a fast
and a day of pleasure to Yahweh?

firstLine: Is this not the fast I choose: to release the bonds of injustice,
rest:
to untie the ropes of the yoke,
and to let the oppressed go free,
and tear every yoke to pieces?

firstLine: Then your light shall break forth like the dawn,
if you offer your soul to the hungry,
rest:
and you satisfy the appetite of the afflicted,
then your light shall rise in the darkness,
and your darkness will be like noon.

firstLine: And Yahweh will lead you continually, and satisfy your soul in a barren land,
rest:
and he will strengthen your bones,
and you shall be like a well-watered garden,
and like a spring of water whose water does not fail.

firstLine: And they shall rebuild ancient ruins from you;
rest:
you shall erect the foundations of many generations,
and you shall be called the bricklayer of the breach,
the restorer of paths to live in.

firstLine: If you hold your foot back from the Sabbath,
then you shall take your pleasure in Yahweh,
rest:
and I will make you ride upon the heights of the earth,
and I will feed you the heritage of Jacob your ancestor,
for the mouth of Yahweh has spoken.”

firstLine: Rampant Transgression
rest:
Look! The hand of Yahweh is not too short to save,
and his ear is not too dull to hear.

firstLine: Rather, your iniquities have been barriers between you and your God,
rest: and your sins have hidden his face from you, from hearing.

firstLine: For your hands are defiled with blood,
rest:
and your fingers with iniquity.
Your lips have spoken lies,
your tongue speaks wickedness.

firstLine: There is nobody who pleads with justice,
rest:
and there is nobody who judges with honesty.
They rely on nothing
and speak vanity.
They conceive trouble
and beget iniquity;

firstLine: they hatch viper eggs,
rest:
and they weave a spider web.
One who eats their eggs dies,
and that which is pressed is hatched as a serpent.

firstLine: Their webs cannot become clothing,
rest:
and they cannot cover themselves with their works.
Their works are works of iniquity,
and deeds of violence are in their hands.

firstLine: Their feet run to evil,
They do not know the way of peace,
Therefore justice is far from us,
We grope like the blind along a wall,
We all groan like bears,
For our transgressions are numerous before you,
rest:
and our sins testify against us.
Indeed, our transgressions are with us,
and we know our iniquities:

firstLine: transgressing and denying Yahweh,
And justice is pushed back,
and truth is missing,
rest:
and he who turns aside from evil is plundered.
And Yahweh saw,
and it was displeasing in his eyes that there was no justice

firstLine: And he saw that there was no man,
rest:
and he was appalled that there was no one who intercedes,
so his arm came to assist him,
and his righteousness was what sustained him.

firstLine: And he put on righteousness like a breastplate,
rest:
and a helmet of salvation on his head,
and he put on garments of vengeance for clothing,
and he wrapped himself in zeal as in a robe.

firstLine: According to deeds, so he will repay;
rest:
wrath to his enemies, requital to those who are his enemies.
He will repay requital to the coastlands.

firstLine: So they shall fear the name of Yahweh from the west,
“And a redeemer will come to Zion,
rest:
to those in Jacob who turn away from transgression,”
declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “And as for me, this is my covenant with them, says Yahweh:
rest:
my spirit that is upon you,
and my words that I have placed in your mouth
shall not depart from your mouth,
or from the mouths of your children,
or from the mouths of your children’s children,”
says Yahweh, “from now on and forever.”

firstLine: Zion Glorified
rest:
“Arise, shine! For your light has come,
and the glory of Yahweh has risen on you.

firstLine: And nations shall come to your light,
rest: and kings to the bright light of your sunrise.

firstLine: Then you shall see
A multitude of camels shall cover you,
rest:
the young male camels of Midian and Ephah.
All those from Sheba shall come;
they shall bring gold and frankincense,
and they shall proclaim the praise of Yahweh.

firstLine: All the flocks of Kedar shall be gathered to you;
rest:
the rams of Nebaioth shall serve you.
They shall present a sacrifice for favor on my altar,
and I will glorify my honorable house.

firstLine: Because the coastlands wait for me,
rest:
and the ships of Tarshish are first
to bring your children from afar,
their silver and gold with them,
for the name of Yahweh your God,
and for the holy one of Israel, because he has glorified you.

firstLine: And foreigners shall build your walls,
And your gates shall continually be open,
rest:
day and night they shall not be shut,
to bring you the wealth of nations,
and their kings shall be led.

firstLine: For the nation and the kingdom that will not serve you shall perish,
rest: and the nations shall be utterly devastated.

firstLine: The glory of Lebanon shall come to you;
rest:
the cypress, the plane, and the pine together,
to glorify the place of my sanctuary,
and I will do honor to the place of my feet.

firstLine: And the children of those who oppressed you shall come to you bending low,
rest:
and all those who treated you disrespectfully shall bow down at the soles of your feet.
And they shall call you the city of Yahweh,
Zion of the holy one of Israel.

firstLine: Instead of you being forsaken
rest:
and hated with no one passing through,
I will make you an everlasting object of pride,
a joy of coming generations.

firstLine: And you shall suck the milk of nations,
rest:
and suck the breast of kings,
and you shall know that I am Yahweh your Savior,
and your Redeemer, the Strong One of Jacob.

firstLine: Instead of bronze I will bring gold,
rest:
and instead of iron I will bring silver,
and instead of wood, bronze,
and instead of stones, iron.
And I will appoint peace as your overseer,
and righteousness as your ruling body.

firstLine: Violence shall no longer be heard in your land;
rest:
devastation or destruction on your borders.
And you shall call your walls Salvation,
and your gates, Praise.

firstLine: The sun shall no longer be your light by day,
rest:
and for bright light the moon shall not give you light,
but Yahweh will be your everlasting light,
and your God your glory.

firstLine: Your sun shall no longer go down,
And all your people shall be righteous;
rest:
they shall take possession of the land forever,
the shoot of his planting,
the work of my hands, to show my glory.

firstLine: The small one shall become a tribe,
rest:
and the smallest one a mighty nation.
I am Yahweh; I will hasten it in its time.”

firstLine: The Year of Yahweh’s Favor
rest:
The Spirit of the Lord Yahweh is upon me,
because Yahweh has anointed me,
he has sent me to bring good news to the oppressed,
to bind up the brokenhearted,
to proclaim release to the captives
and liberation to those who are bound,

firstLine: to proclaim the year of Yahweh’s favor,
rest:
and our God’s day of vengeance,
to comfort all those in mourning,

firstLine: to give for those in mourning in Zion,
rest:
to give them a head wrap instead of ashes,
the oil of joy instead of mourning,
a garment of praise instead of a faint spirit.
And they will be called oaks of righteousness,
the planting of Yahweh, to show his glory.

firstLine: And they shall build the ancient ruins,
rest:
they shall erect the former deserted places.
And they shall restore the devastated cities,
the deserted places of many generations.

firstLine: And strangers shall stand and feed your flocks,
rest: and foreigners shall be your farmers and vinedressers.

firstLine: But you shall be called the priests of Yahweh,
rest:
you will be called servers of our God.
You shall eat the wealth of the nations,
and you shall boast in their riches.

firstLine: Instead of your shame, a double portion,
For I, Yahweh, love justice,
rest:
hate robbery and injustice,
and I will faithfully give their reward,
and I will make an everlasting covenant with them.

firstLine: And their descendants will be known among the nations,
rest:
and their offspring in the midst of the peoples.
All those who see them shall recognize them,
that they are descendants whom Yahweh has blessed.

firstLine: I will rejoice greatly in Yahweh;
rest:
my being shall shout in exultation in my God.
For he has clothed me with garments of salvation,
he has covered me with the robe of righteousness,
as a bridegroom adorns himself with a head wrap like a priest,
and as a bride adorns herself with her jewelry.

firstLine: For as the earth produces its sprout,
rest:
and as a garden makes its plants sprout,
so the Lord Yahweh will make righteousness sprout,
and praise before all the nations.

firstLine: Zion’s New Identity
rest:
For the sake of Zion I will not be silent,
and for the sake of Jerusalem I will not maintain a quiet attitude,
until her righteousness goes out like the bright light,
and her salvation burns like a torch.

firstLine: And the nations shall see your righteousness,
rest:
and all the kings your glory,
and you will be called a new name
that the mouth of Yahweh will designate.

firstLine: And you shall be a crown of beauty in the hand of Yahweh,
rest: and a headband of royalty in the hand of your God.

firstLine: It shall no longer be said of you, “Forsaken,”
rest:
and it shall no longer be said of your land, “Desolation!”
but you will be called “My Delight Is In Her,”
and your land, “Married,”
for Yahweh delights in you,
and your land shall be married.

firstLine: For as a young man marries a virgin,
rest:
so shall your sons marry you,
and as is the joy of the bridegroom over the bride,
so shall your God rejoice over you.

firstLine: I have appointed watchmen upon your walls, Jerusalem;
rest:
all day and all night they shall never be silent.
You who profess Yahweh have no rest.

firstLine: And you must not give him rest until he establishes,
rest: and until he makes Jerusalem an object of praise in the earth.

firstLine: Yahweh has sworn by his right hand,
rest:
and by his mighty arm,
“Surely I will never again give your grain as food to your enemies,
and surely foreigners shall not drink your new wine at which you have labored.”

firstLine: But those who gather it shall eat it, and they shall praise Yahweh,
rest: and those who gather it shall drink it in my holy courts.

firstLine: And they shall call them “The Holy People, The Redeemed Of Yahweh,”
rest: and you shall be called “Sought After, A City Is Not Forsaken.”

firstLine: Yahweh’s Day of Vengeance
rest:
Who is this, coming from Edom,
from Bozrah in bright red garments?
Who is this honored in his garment,
lying down in his great strength?
“It is I, speaking in justice,
mighty to save!”

firstLine: Why are your garments red,
rest: and your garments like he who treads in the winepress?

firstLine: “I have trodden the winepress alone,
rest:
and there was no man from the peoples with me.
And I trod them in my anger,
and I trampled them in my wrath,
and spattered their juice on my garments,
and stained all my clothing,

firstLine: for the day of vengeance was in my heart,
rest: and the year of my blood-vengeance has come!

firstLine: And I looked, but there was no helper,
rest:
and I was appalled, but there was no one who sustains,
so my arm came to assist me,
and my wrath was what sustained me.

firstLine: And I trampled peoples in my anger,
rest:
and I made them drunk in my wrath,
and I brought their juice down to the earth.”

firstLine: Remembering Yahweh’s Mercy
rest:
I will mention the loyal love of Yahweh, the praises of Yahweh, according to all that Yahweh has done for us,
and the greatness of goodness to the house of Israel that he has done to them according to his mercy and the abundance of his loyal love.

firstLine: In all their distress, there was no distress,
rest:
and the messenger of his presence saved them,
in his love and compassion he himself redeemed them,
and he lifted them up,
and he supported them all the days of old.

firstLine: But they were the ones who rebelled,
who made his magnificent arm move at the right hand of Moses,
rest:
who divided the waters before them,
to make an everlasting name for himself,

firstLine: like cattle in the valley that goes down, the Spirit of Yahweh gave him rest,
rest: so you lead your people to make a magnificent name for yourself.

firstLine: Prayer for Mercy
rest:
Look from heaven,
and see from the lofty residence of your holiness and glory.
Where are your zeal and strength?
Your compassion and mercy to me hold themselves back.

firstLine: For you are our father, although Abraham does not know us,
rest:
and Israel does not acknowledge us.
You, Yahweh are our father,
Our Redeemer from of old is your name.

firstLine: Your holy people took possession for a little while;
rest: our adversaries have trampled down your sanctuary.

firstLine: We have been since antiquity; you did not rule them;
rest: they were not called by your name.

firstLine: Would that you would tear the heavens and come down;
rest: the mountains would quake before you,

firstLine: as fire kindles brushwood,
rest:
the fire causes water to boil,
to make your name known to your adversaries,
that the nations might tremble from your presence.

firstLine: When you did terrible deeds which we did not expect, you came down;
rest: the mountains quaked because of your presence.

firstLine: And since ancient times they have not heard,
You meet with the one who rejoices,
rest:
one who does righteousness.
In your ways they remember you.
Look! You were angry and we sinned against them in ancient times and we were saved.

firstLine: And we all have become like the unclean,
rest:
and all our deeds of justice like a menstrual cloth,
And we all wither like a leaf,
and our iniquities take us away like the wind.

firstLine: And there is no one who calls on your name,
Yet now Yahweh, you are our father;
rest:
we are the clay and you are our potter,
and we all are the work of your hand.

firstLine: You must not be exceedingly angry, Yahweh,
rest:
and you must not remember iniquity forever!
Look! Behold, now! We all are your people!

firstLine: Your holy cities have become a wilderness;
rest: Zion has become a wilderness, Jerusalem a desolation.

firstLine: Our holy and beautiful temple, where our ancestors praised you has been burned by fire,
rest: and all our precious objects have become ruins.

firstLine: Judgment and Salvation
I spread out my hands all day to a stubborn people,
rest: those who walk after their thoughts in the way that is not good,

firstLine: the people who provoke me to anger continually to my face,
rest:
slaughtering for sacrifices in the garden,
and making smoke offerings on bricks,

firstLine: who sit in graves
rest:
and spend the night in secret places,
who eat the flesh of swine
with a fragment of impurity in their vessels,

firstLine: your iniquities and the iniquities of your ancestors together, says Yahweh,
rest:
because they made smoke offerings on the mountains
and they taunted me on the hills,
I will measure their punishment from the beginning into the fold of their garment.”

firstLine: And I will bring descendant s out from Jacob,
rest:
and a people from Judah to take possession of my mountain,
and my chosen ones shall inherit it,
and my servants shall settle there.

firstLine: And Sharon shall become a pasture for flocks,
rest:
and the valley of Achor a resting place for herds
for my people who have sought me.

firstLine: But you who forsake Yahweh,
rest:
forgetting my holy mountain,
who set a table for Fortune,
and who pour out a jug of mixed wine for Destiny,

firstLine: and I will remit you to the sword,
rest:
and all of you shall bow down to the slaughter,
because I called, but you did not answer;
I spoke, but you did not listen,
but you did the evil in my eyes,
and you chose that in which I do not delight.”

firstLine: Therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh:
rest:
“Look! My servants shall eat but you, you shall be hungry.
Look! My servants shall drink but you, you shall be thirsty.
Look! My servants shall rejoice but you, you shall be ashamed.

firstLine: And you shall leave your name to my chosen ones as a curse,
rest: and the Lord Yahweh will kill you, and he will give his servants another name.

firstLine: Whoever blesses himself in the land shall bless himself by the God of trustworthiness,
rest:
and the one who swears an oath in the land shall swear by the God of trustworthiness,
because the former troubles are forgotten,
and they are hidden from my eyes.

firstLine: New Creation
rest:
For look! I am about to create new heavens and a new earth,
and the former things shall not be remembered,
and they shall not come to mind.

firstLine: And I will shout in exultation over Jerusalem,
rest:
and I will rejoice over my people,
and the sound of weeping shall no longer be heard in it,
or the sound of a cry for help.

firstLine: There will no longer be a nursing infant who lives only a few days,
And they shall build houses and inhabit them,
rest: and they shall plant vineyards and eat their fruit.

firstLine: They shall not build and another inhabit;
rest:
they shall not plant and another eat.
For the days of my people shall be like the days of a tree,
and my chosen ones shall enjoy the work of their hands.

firstLine: They shall not labor for nothing,
And this will happen: before they call, I myself will answer;
rest: while still they are speaking, I myself will hear.

firstLine: The wolf and the lamb shall feed like one,
rest:
and the lion shall eat straw like the ox,
but dust shall be the serpent’s food.
They shall do no evil,
and they shall not destroy on all my holy mountain,” says Yahweh.

firstLine: Proper Worship
rest:
Thus says Yahweh:
“Heaven is my throne,
and the earth is the footstool for my feet.
Where is this house that you would build for me?
And where is this resting place for me?

firstLine: And my hand has made all these things,
rest:
and all these came to be,”
declares Yahweh, “but I look to this one:
to the humble and the contrite of spirit
and the one frightened at my word.

firstLine: The one who slaughters a bull strikes a man;
rest:
the one who slaughters a lamb for sacrifice breaks the neck of a dog.
The one who offers an offering, the blood of swine;
the one who offers frankincense blesses an idol.
Indeed, they themselves have chosen their ways,
and their soul delights in their abhorrence.

firstLine: Indeed, I myself I will choose their ill treatment,
rest:
and I will bring them objects of their dread,
because I called, and no one answered;
I spoke and they did not listen,
but they did the evil in my eyes,
and they chose that in which I do not delight.”

firstLine: Hear the word of Yahweh, you who are frightened at his word:
rest:
Your brothers who hate you,
who exclude you for my name’s sake have said,
“Let Yahweh be honored so that we may see your joy!”
But they themselves shall be ashamed.

firstLine: Zion’s Delivery
rest:
Before she was in labor she gave birth;
before labor pains came to her, she gave birth to a son.

firstLine: “Rejoice with Jerusalem
rest:
and shout in exultation with her, all those who love her!
Rejoice with her in joy, all those who mourn over her,

firstLine: so that you may suck and be satisfied from her consoling breast,
rest: so that you may drink deeply and refresh yourselves from her heavy breast.”

firstLine: For thus says Yahweh:
rest:
“Look! I am about to spread prosperity out to her like a river,
and the wealth of the nations like an overflowing stream,
and you shall suck and be carried on the hip;
and you shall you shall be played with on the knees.

firstLine: As a man whose mother comforts him, so I myself will comfort you,
rest: and you shall be comforted in Jerusalem.

firstLine: Yahweh’s Final Judgment
rest:
And you shall see and your heart shall rejoice,
and your bones shall flourish like the grass,
and the hand of Yahweh shall make itself known to his servants,
and he shall curse his enemies.

firstLine: For Yahweh enters into judgment on all flesh with fire and his sword,
rest: and those slain by Yahweh shall be many.

firstLine: Those who sanctify themselves
rest:
and those who cleanse themselves to go into the gardens after the one in the middle,
eating the flesh of swine
and detestable things and rodents together
shall come to an end!” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “And I—their works and thoughts!—am about to come to gather all nations and tongues,
rest: and they shall come and see my glory.

firstLine: And I will set a sign among them,
rest:
and I will send survivors from them to the nations:
Tarshish, Pul, and Lud, who draw the bow;
Tubal and Javan, the faraway coastlands
that have not heard of my fame,
and have not seen my glory.
And they shall declare my glory among the nations,

firstLine: “And they shall go out and look at the corpses of the people who have rebelled against me,
Yahweh Appoints Jeremiah as a Prophet to the Nations
rest: The words of Jeremiah, the son of Hilkiah, among the priests who were in Anathoth, in the land of Benjamin,

firstLine: “Before I formed you in the womb I knew you,
rest:
and before you came out from the womb I consecrated you;
I appointed you as a prophet to the nations.”

firstLine: Then Yahweh stretched out his hand and he touched my mouth, and Yahweh said to me,
rest: “Look, I have put my words in your mouth.

firstLine: See, I appoint you this day over the nations
rest:
and over the kingdoms,
to pluck up and to pull down,
and to destroy and to tear down,
to build and to plant.”

firstLine: Yahweh Confirms Jeremiah’s Call
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying, “What are you seeing, Jeremiah?” And I said, “I am seeing a branch of an almond tree.”

firstLine: Yahweh Remembers Israel’s Faithfulness
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: “Go and proclaim in the ears of Jerusalem, saying, ‘Thus says Yahweh,
rest:
“I remember concerning you the loyal love of your childhood,
the love of your betrothal-time,
your going after me in the desert,
in the land not sown.

firstLine: Israel was holy to Yahweh,
The Unfaithfulness of Israel’s Ancestors
rest: Hear the word of Yahweh, O house of Jacob, and all the clans of the house of Israel.

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh:
rest:
“What injustice did your ancestors find in me
that they were far from me,
and they went after the vanity,
and they became vain?

firstLine: And they did not say,
rest:
‘Where is Yahweh,
the one who brought us up from the land of Egypt,
the one who led us in the desert,
in a land of desert plains and gorges,
in a land of dryness and deep darkness,
in a land that no one passes through,
and no human lives there?’

firstLine: And I brought you to the land of the orchard,
rest:
to eat its fruit, and its good things.
But you entered and defiled my land,
and my inheritance you made a detestable thing.

firstLine: The Unfaithfulness of Contemporary Israel
rest:
Therefore I again bring a lawsuit against you,” declares Yahweh,
“and with your children I bring a lawsuit.

firstLine: For go over to the coasts of Cyprus and look,
rest:
and send to Kedar and consider very closely,
and see if there has been a thing like this:

firstLine: Be appalled, O heavens, at this, and shudder;
rest: be utterly desolate,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “For my people have committed two evils:
rest:
they have forsaken me, the source of living water,
to hew out for themselves cisterns, cracked cisterns that can hold no water.

firstLine: The young lions have roared against him,
Moreover, people of Memphis and Tahpanhes
rest: will shave your skull.

firstLine: Did you not do this to yourself,
rest:
by forsaking Yahweh, your God,
at the time of your leading in the way?

firstLine: And now why do you go the way of Egypt
rest:
to drink the waters of the Shihor?
And why do you go the way of Assyria
to drink the waters of the Euphrates?

firstLine: Your wickedness will chastise you,
rest:
and your apostasies will reprove you.
Therefore know and see that it is evil and bitter,
your forsaking of Yahweh, your God,
and fear of me is not in you,”
declares the Lord, Yahweh of hosts.

firstLine: “For from long ago you have broken your yoke,
rest:
you tore to pieces your bonds.
And you said, ‘I will not serve!’
But on every high hill and under every leafy tree
you were lying down as a prostitute.

firstLine: Yet I planted you as a choice vine,
rest:
all of it a seed of trustworthiness.
How then have you altered before me
into something that is degenerate, the foreign vine?

firstLine: For if you wash with natron,
rest:
and you use much soap,
your guilt is sticking as a stain before me,”
declares the Lord Yahweh.

firstLine: “How can you say, ‘I have not defiled myself,
rest:
I have not gone after the Baals?’
Look at your way in the valley,
know what you have done.
You are a young she-camel,
interweaving her ways.

firstLine: A wild ass accustomed to the desert,
rest:
in the desire of her soul.
She gasps for wind in her rutting time.
Who can quell her lust?
All those who seek her will not grow weary,
in her month they will find her.

firstLine: Restrain your foot from being barefoot,
rest:
and your throat from thirst.
But you said, ‘It is hopeless.
No! For I have loved strangers,
and after them I will go.’

firstLine: As the shame of a thief when he is caught in the act,
rest:
so the house of Israel will be ashamed.
They, their kings, their officials,
and their priests, and their prophets.

firstLine: Those who say to the tree, ‘You are my father,’
rest:
and to the stone, ‘You gave birth to me.’
For they have turned their backs to me, and not their faces.
But in the time of their trouble they say, ‘Arise and save us.’

firstLine: “For in vain I have struck your children.
rest:
They accepted no discipline.
Your sword devoured your prophets,
like a ravening lion.

firstLine: Also on your skirts is found
rest:
the blood of the life of the innocent, the poor.
You did not find them in the act of breaking into a house.
But in spite of all these things,

firstLine: yet you say, ‘But I am innocent,
rest:
surely his anger has turned away from me.’
Look, I am entering into judgment with you
because of your saying, ‘I have not sinned.’

firstLine: Also from there you will come out
A saying: ‘Look, if a man divorces his wife,
rest:
and she goes from him and she becomes another man’s wife,
will he return to her again?’
Will not that land be greatly defiled?
And you have prostituted yourself with many lovers,
would you now return to me?” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “Lift up your eyes at the barren heights,
rest:
and see where you have not been ravished.
Beside the roads you sat for them like an Arab in the desert,
and you have defiled the land
with your fornication
and with your wickedness.

firstLine: Therefore rain showers have been withheld,
rest:
and the spring rain has not come.
Yet you have the forehead of a woman prostitute,
you refuse to be ashamed.

firstLine: Have you not just now called to me,
rest: ‘My father, you are the close friend of my youth?

firstLine: Yahweh Gives Israel a Letter of Divorce
rest: Then Yahweh said to me in the days of Josiah, the king, “Have you seen what apostate Israel has done? She has gone on every high hill and under every leafy tree and she has prostituted herself there.

firstLine: A Call for Repentance
rest: Then Yahweh said to me, “Apostate Israel has proved herself more upright than treacherous Judah.

firstLine: Go, and proclaim these words toward the north, and say,
rest:
‘Return, apostate Israel,’ declares Yahweh.
‘I will not cause my anger to fall on you.
For I am loyal,’ declares Yahweh.
‘I will not be angry forever.

firstLine: Only acknowledge your guilt,
rest:
that against Yahweh your God you have rebelled,
and have scattered your ways to the strangers under every leafy tree,
and you have not obeyed my voice,’ declares Yahweh.”

firstLine: Then I thought, ‘How I would set you among the children,
rest:
and I would give you a land of desire,
an inheritance of the glory of the hosts of nations.’
And I thought, ‘You would call me, “My father,”
and you would not turn back from behind me.’

firstLine: However, as a wife departs treacherously from her lover,
rest:
so you have dealt treacherously with me,
O house of Israel,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “A voice is heard on the barren heights,
rest:
the weeping of the pleas for mercy of the children of Israel,
because they have perverted their way,
they have forgotten Yahweh their God.

firstLine: Return, O apostate children,
rest:
I will heal your backsliding.
‘Look, we come to you,
for you are Yahweh our God.

firstLine: Surely, an illusion comes from the hills,
rest:
the turmoil on the mountains.
Surely, in Yahweh our God
is the salvation of Israel.

firstLine: But the shameful thing has devoured
rest:
the labor of our ancestors from our youth,
their flocks, and their cattle,
their sons and their daughters.

firstLine: Let us lie down in our shame,
rest:
and let our disgrace cover us.
For against Yahweh our God we have sinned,
we and our ancestors,
from our youth and until this day.
and we have not obeyed the voice of Yahweh our God.’

firstLine: If you return, O Israel,” declares Yahweh,
rest:
“you return to me.
And if you remove your abominations from my presence,
and you do not wander,

firstLine: and you swear, ‘As Yahweh lives,’
rest:
in truth, in justice, and in righteousness,
then nations will be blessed by him,
and in him they will boast.”

firstLine: For thus says Yahweh
rest:
to the men of Judah and to Jerusalem,
“Break up for yourselves prepared virgin soil,
and you must not sow among thornbushes.

firstLine: Circumcise yourselves to Yahweh,
rest:
and remove the foreskins of your hearts,
men of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem,
lest my wrath goes forth like the fire and burns,
and there is no one who extinguishes it,
because of the evil of your deeds.”

firstLine: An Invasion from the North
rest:
Declare in Judah and proclaim in Jerusalem and say,
“Blow a horn through the land,
call with a loud voice and say,
‘Be gathered and let us go into the fortified cities.’

firstLine: Lift up a signal toward Zion,
A lion has gone up from his thicket,
rest:
and a destroyer of nations has set out.
He has gone out from his place to make your land as a horror,
your cities will go to ruin without inhabitant.

firstLine: Because of this gird yourselves with sackcloth, lament and wail,
rest: for the burning anger of Yahweh has not turned back from us.

firstLine: And then on that day,” declares Yahweh,
rest:
“the heart of the king and the heart of the officials will be destroyed,
and the priests will be appalled,
and the prophets will be astonished.”

firstLine: At that time it will be said to this people and to Jerusalem,
rest:
“A hot wind from the barren heights in the desert,
in the direction of the daughter of my people,
not to winnow and not to cleanse,

firstLine: a wind too strong for these will come for me,
rest: now also I speak judgments against them.”

firstLine: Look, he comes up like the clouds,
rest:
and his chariots are like the whirlwind,
his horses are swifter than eagles,
woe to us, for we are devastated.

firstLine: Cleanse your heart from wickedness, O Jerusalem,
rest:
so that you may be saved.
How long will your thoughts of mischief
dwell in your inner part?

firstLine: For a voice is declaring from Dan,
rest: and is proclaiming disaster from the mountain of Ephraim.

firstLine: “Report to the nations, ‘Here they are!’
rest:
Proclaim against Jerusalem,
‘Besiegers are coming from a distant land,
and they raise their voice against the cities of Judah.’

firstLine: Like watchers of a field they were against her from all around,
rest: because she has rebelled against me,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “You obtained this for yourself
rest:
because of your way and your deeds.
This is your doom, for it is bitter,
yes, it has reached up to your heart.”

firstLine: Destruction on destruction is proclaimed,
rest:
for all of the land is devastated.
Suddenly my tents are devastated,
my tent curtains in a moment.

firstLine: How long must I see the banner,
rest: and hear the sound of a horn?

firstLine: “For my people are foolish,
rest:
they have not known me.
They are foolish children,
and they do not have insight.
They are skillful at doing evil,
and they do not know how to do good.”

firstLine: I looked at the earth, and behold, it was wasteland and emptiness,
rest: and to the heavens, and they were without their light.

firstLine: I looked at the mountains, and behold, they were quaking,
rest: and all of the hills were jolted to and fro.

firstLine: I looked and behold, there was no person,
rest: and all of the birds of the sky had fled.

firstLine: I looked and behold, the fruitful land was a desert,
rest:
and all of its cities were ruined before Yahweh,
before the face of his burning anger.

firstLine: For thus says Yahweh, “All of the land will be a desolation,
rest: yet I will not make a complete desolation.

firstLine: Because of this the earth will mourn,
rest:
and the heavens above will become dark.
Because I have spoken, I have planned,
and I have not relented, and I will not turn back from it.”

firstLine: From the sound of a horseman and an archer every town flees,
rest:
they enter in the thickets and among the rocks they climb.
Every town is forsaken,
and there is no person who lives in them.

firstLine: And you, O devastated one, what do you do,
rest:
that you put on crimson,
that you adorn yourself with ornaments of gold,
that you make your eyes look bigger with the eye make-up?
In vain you beautify yourself.
Your lovers reject you;
they seek your life.

firstLine: For I heard a voice like an ill woman,
rest:
anxiety like a woman who bears her first child,
the voice of the daughter of Zion.
She is gasping for breath,
she is spreading out her hands:
“Woe is me, for I am becoming tired before killers.”

firstLine: “Roam about through the streets of Jerusalem,
rest:
and look please, and take note,
and search at its public squares,
if you can find a person who does justice,
who seeks honesty,
so that I may forgive it.

firstLine: And though they say, ‘As Yahweh lives,’
rest: therefore they swear falsely.”

firstLine: Then I said, “They are just simple people,
Let me go to the great,
rest:
and let me speak with them,
for they know the way of Yahweh,
the law of their God.”
However, they together have broken the yoke,
they have torn to pieces the bonds.

firstLine: Therefore a lion from the forest will kill them,
rest:
A wolf from the desert plains will devastate them.
A leopard is watching their cities,
everyone who goes out from there will be torn,
because their transgressions are many,
their apostasies are numerous.

firstLine: “How can I forgive you?
rest:
Your children have forsaken me,
and they have sworn by those who are not gods.
But I fed them to the full,
and they committed adultery,
and flocked to the house of a prostitute.

firstLine: They were well-fed lusty horses,
rest: they neighed each to the wife of his neighbor.

firstLine: Go up through her vineyards and destroy,
rest:
but you must not make complete destruction.
Remove her branches,
for they are not to Yahweh.

firstLine: For the house of Israel and the house of Judah
rest: have dealt utterly treacherously with me,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “They have denied Yahweh, and have said,
rest:
‘Not he, for evil will not come on us,
we will see neither sword nor famine.

firstLine: And the prophets are like wind,
rest:
and the word is not in them.’
Thus it will be done to them.”

firstLine: Therefore thus says Yahweh, the God of hosts,
rest:
“Because you have spoken this word,
look, I am making my words in your mouth like a fire,
and this people wood, and it will devour them.

firstLine: Look, I am about to bring on you a nation from afar,
rest:
O house of Israel,” declares Yahweh.
“It is an enduring nation, it is an ancient nation.
A nation whose language you do not know,
and you cannot understand what they speak.

firstLine: Their quiver is like an open tomb,
rest: all of them are warriors.

firstLine: And they will eat your harvest and your food,
rest:
they will eat your sons and your daughters,
they will eat your flock and your herd,
they will eat your vine and your fig tree,
they will smash with the sword your fortified cities,
in which you trust.

firstLine: “Declare this in the house of Jacob,
rest: and proclaim it in Judah, saying,

firstLine: ‘Hear this please, O foolish and senseless people,
rest:
who have eyes but do not see,
who have ears but do not hear.’

firstLine: But for this people is a stubborn and rebellious heart,
rest: they have turned aside and have gone away.

firstLine: And they do not say in their hearts,
rest:
‘Let us fear please Yahweh our God,
the one who gives the autumn rain and the spring rain in its season,
the set times of the harvest he keeps for us.’

firstLine: Your iniquities have disturbed these,
rest: and your sins have kept away the good from you.

firstLine: For wicked people are found among my people,
rest:
they lie in wait like the hiding of fowlers,
they set up a trap,
they catch humans.

firstLine: Like a cage full of birds,
rest:
so their houses are full of fraud.
Therefore they have become great,
and they have become rich.

firstLine: They have grown fat,
rest:
they have grown sleek,
also, their evil deeds have no limit.
They do not judge with justice,
the legal cause of the orphan,
or allow it to succeed,
and the legal case of the poor,
they do not defend.

firstLine: The prophets prophesy falsely,
rest:
and the priests rule by their own authority,
and my people love it so much.
But what will you do when the end comes?

firstLine: Flee for safety, O children of Benjamin,
rest:
from the midst of Jerusalem.
And in Tekoa blow a horn,
and on Beth-haccherem lift up a signal,
for evil looks down from the north,
and a great destruction.

firstLine: The lovely and the delicate,
rest: the daughter of Jerusalem, I will destroy.

firstLine: Shepherds and their flocks will come against her,
rest:
they will pitch their tents against her all around,
they will pasture, each his portion.

firstLine: Arise, and let us attack by night,
rest: and let us destroy her citadel fortresses.”

firstLine: For thus says Yahweh of hosts,
rest:
“Cut down trees and heap up a siege ramp against Jerusalem.
This is the city that must be punished,
its oppression is in its midst.

firstLine: As a water well keeps its water cool,
rest:
so she keeps cool her wickedness.
Violence and destruction are heard within her,
sickness and wounds are continually before me.

firstLine: Be warned, O Jerusalem,
rest:
lest I turn away from you in disgust,
lest I make you a desolation,
a land that is not inhabited.”

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh of hosts:
rest:
“They will thoroughly glean the remnant of Israel as a vine,
turn back your hand over the branches like a grape-gatherer.

firstLine: To whom shall I speak and admonish,
rest:
that they may hear?
Look, their ears are closed,
and they are not able to listen attentively.
Look, the word of Yahweh is to them an object of scorn,
they do not delight in it.

firstLine: But I am full with the wrath of Yahweh,
rest:
I struggle to hold it in.
Pour it out on the children in the street,
and on the assemblies of young men at the same time.
For even husband with wife will get trapped,
the old with him who is full of days.

firstLine: And their houses will be turned over to others,
rest:
their fields and their wives together.
For I will stretch out my hand
against the inhabitants of the land,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “For from the smallest of them to the greatest of them,
rest:
everyone makes profit for unlawful gain.
And from the prophet to the priest,
everyone practices deceit.

firstLine: And they have treated the wound of my people lightly,
rest: saying, ‘Peace, peace,’ but there is no peace.

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh: “Stand at the roads and look,
rest:
and ask for the ancient paths, where the way of the good is,
and walk in it, and find rest for your inner selves.
But they said, ‘We will not walk in it.’

firstLine: And I raised up watchmen over you:
rest:
‘Listen attentively to the sound of a horn.’
But they said, ‘We will not listen attentively.’

firstLine: Therefore hear, O nations, and know, O community,
rest: what will happen to them.

firstLine: Hear, O earth,
rest:
look, I am about to bring disaster to this people,
the fruit of their plans,
because they have not listened attentively to my words,
and my teaching, they have rejected it also.

firstLine: Therefore thus says Yahweh:
rest:
“Look, I am about to put before this people stumbling blocks,
and they will stumble against them,
fathers and children together,
neighbor and his friend will perish.”

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh:
rest:
“Look, a people is coming from the land of the north,
a great nation is woken up from the farthest part of the earth.

firstLine: The bow and the short sword they grasp are cruel,
rest:
and they show no mercy.
Their sound roars like the sea, and on horses they ride,
drawn up like a man for battle against you, O daughter of Zion.”

firstLine: We have heard news of it,
rest:
our hands grow slack,
anxiety has grasped us,
pain as a woman who gives birth.

firstLine: You must not go out into the field,
O daughter of my people,
rest:
gird yourself with sackcloth,
and roll about in the ashes in mourning,
a mourning ceremony as for an only child.
Make for yourself wailing of bitterness,
for suddenly the destroyer will come upon us.

firstLine: “I have made you an assayer among my people, a fortification,
rest: so that you may know and put to the test their ways.

firstLine: All of them are stubborn rebels,
rest:
going about talking slander.
They are bronze and iron,
they are all behaving corruptly.

firstLine: The bellows are burned up,
rest:
lead is consumed by fire.
In vain he keeps on refining,
but the wicked are not torn apart.

firstLine: They are called rejected silver,
rest: For Yahweh has rejected them.”

firstLine: Jeremiah’s Proclamation at the Gate of the House of Yahweh
rest: The word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, saying,

firstLine: The Valley of the Slaughter
rest: “And you shall say to them, ‘This is the nation that has not obeyed the voice of Yahweh their God, and they have not accepted discipline. The truth has perished, and it is cut off from their mouths.

firstLine: Yahweh Questions His People
rest:
“And you shall say to them, ‘Thus asks Yahweh:
“Do men fall and not stand up?
If one turns away does he not return?

firstLine: I have listened attentively,
rest:
and I have listened.
They do not speak honestly,
there is no man who regrets his wickedness, saying, ‘What have I done?’
All of them are turning to their ways of running,
like a horse plunging into battle.

firstLine: Even the stork in heaven knows its appointed time,
rest:
and the turtledove, and the swallow, and the song bird,
they observe the time of their coming.
But my people do not know the ordinance of Yahweh.

firstLine: The wise will be put to shame,
rest:
they will be dismayed,
and they will get taken.
Look, they have rejected the word of Yahweh,
and what is wisdom to them?

firstLine: Therefore I will give their wives to others,
rest:
their fields to conquerors,
because from the smallest to the greatest,
all of them make profit for unlawful gain,
from prophet to priest,
all of them practice deceit.

firstLine: And they have treated the wound of the daughter of my people lightly,
rest: saying, ‘Peace, peace,’ but there is no peace.

firstLine: “I will take away their harvest,” declares Yahweh.
rest:
“There are no grapes on the vine,
and there are no figs on the fig tree,
and the leaves wither,
and what I gave to them passed over them.”’”

firstLine: The Nation Longs for Yahweh’s Help
rest:
Why are we sitting?
Gather, and let us go into the fortified cities,
and let us perish there,
for Yahweh our God has caused us to perish,
and has provided drink for us, water of poison,
because we have sinned against Yahweh.

firstLine: We hope for peace,
“From Dan is heard the snorting of their horses,
For look, I am letting loose among you snakes,
rest:
adders for which there is no incantation,
and they will bite you,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “My comfort is gone from me,
rest:
sorrow is on me,
my heart is sick.

firstLine: Look, the sound of the cry for help of the daughter of my people
rest:
from a distant land,
‘Is Yahweh not in Zion?
Is her king not in her?’
Why have they provoked me to anger with their images,
with idols of a foreign land?”

firstLine: The harvest has passed,
rest:
the summer has come to an end,
and we have not received help.

firstLine: Yahweh’s Lament
rest:
“Because of the wound of the daughter of my people I am broken down,
I mourn, horror has seized me.

firstLine: Oh that my head were waters,
rest:
and my eyes a fountain of tears,
so that I might weep day and night,
for the slain of the daughter of my people.

firstLine: Oh that I had in the desert a place of overnight lodging for travelers,
And they bend their tongue like their bow,
A Nation Characterized by Deceit
rest:
“Let everyone be on your guard against his neighbor,
and you must not trust in any brother,
for everyone surely betrays,
and every neighbor goes about with slander.

firstLine: And everyone deceives his neighbor,
rest:
and they do not speak the truth,
they have taught their tongues to speak lies,
they are tired from going astray.

firstLine: Your dwelling is in the midst of deceit,
rest: upon deceit they refuse to know me,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: Therefore, thus says Yahweh of hosts:
rest:
“Look, I am about to refine them,
and I will test them,
for what else can I do,
because of the presence of the daughter of my people?

firstLine: Their tongue is a murderous arrow,
rest:
it speaks deceit.
With his mouth he speaks peace with his neighbor,
but in his inner parts he sets up his ambush.

firstLine: For the mountains I lift up weeping and wailing,
rest:
and for the pastures of the desert a lament,
because they are laid waste so that no man passes through.
And the sounds of cattle are not heard,
from the birds of heaven to the animals
they have fled, they are gone.

firstLine: And I will make Jerusalem as heaps of ruins, a lair of jackals,
rest: and the towns of Judah I will make a desolation, without inhabitants.

firstLine: The Nation is Judged by Yahweh
rest: And Yahweh said, “Because of their forsaking my law that I set before them, and they have not obeyed my voice, and have not walked in it,

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh of hosts:
rest:
“Consider closely, and call for the wailing women, so that they come,
and for the skillful women, so that they come.

firstLine: And let them hasten,
rest:
and let them lift up wailing over us,
so that our eyes may melt with tears,
and our eyelids may flow with water.

firstLine: For a sound of wailing is heard from Zion,
rest:
‘How we are devastated!
We are very ashamed because we have left the land,
because they have overthrown our dwelling places.’

firstLine: For hear, O women, the word of Yahweh,
rest:
and let your ear receive the word of his mouth,
and teach your daughters a lamentation,
and each woman her neighbor a lament.

firstLine: For death has come into our windows,
rest:
it has entered into our fortresses,
to cut off the children from the streets,
the young men from the public squares.

firstLine: Speak, ‘thus declares Yahweh:
rest:
“The dead body of the human will fall
like dung upon the surface of the field,
and like cut grain behind the reaper,
and there is no one who gathers.”’”

firstLine: The Things in Which Yahweh Delights
rest:
Thus says Yahweh,
“The wise man must not boast in his wisdom,
and the warrior must not boast in his might,
the wealthy man must not boast in his wealth.

firstLine: But only in this must the one who boasts boast,
rest:
that he has insight,
and that he knows me,
that I am Yahweh,
showing loyal love, justice, and righteousness on the earth,
for in these things I delight,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: The Way of the Nations
rest: “Look, days are coming,” declares Yahweh, “and I will call into account all those who are circumcised in the foreskin:

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh:
rest:
“You must not learn the way of the nations,
and you must not be dismayed by the signs of the heavens,
for the nations are dismayed by them.

firstLine: For the statutes of the peoples are vanity,
rest:
for it is a tree cut down from the forest,
the work of the hands of a craftsman with the tool.

firstLine: He decorates it with silver and gold,
rest:
they strengthen it with nails and hammers,
so that it does not stagger.

firstLine: They are like scarecrows in a cucumber field,
rest:
they cannot speak.
Indeed, they must be carried,
for they cannot march.
You must not be afraid of them,
for they cannot do evil;
furthermore, to do good is not in them.”

firstLine: There is none like you, O Yahweh,
rest: you are great and your name is great in might.

firstLine: At the same time they are stupid and foolish,
rest: in the instruction of idols, it is wood.

firstLine: Silver beaten from Tarshish is brought,
rest:
and gold from Uphaz,
the work of the craftsman and the hands of the goldsmith.
Blue and purple are their clothing,
all of them are the work of skillful people.

firstLine: But Yahweh is the true God,
rest:
he is the living God,
and an everlasting king.
Because of his wrath the earth quakes,
and the nations cannot endure his anger.

firstLine: “Thus you shall say to them,
rest:
‘Gods who did not make the heavens and the earth
will perish from the earth and from under these heavens.

firstLine: He is the maker of the earth by his power,
rest:
who created the world by his wisdom,
and by his understanding he stretched out heaven.

firstLine: When he utters his voice there is a noise of water in the heavens,
rest:
and he causes the mist to rise from the ends of the earth.
He makes lightning for the rain,
and he causes the wind to go out from his storehouses.

firstLine: Everyone is stupid, without knowledge,
They are vanity, a work of mockery,
rest: at the time of their punishment, they will perish.

firstLine: The portion of Jacob is not like these,
Gather your bundle from the ground,
rest: you who live under the siege.’”

firstLine: For thus says Yahweh,
rest:
“Look, I am about to sling out the inhabitants of the land at this time,
and I will bring distress to them, so that they may feel it.”

firstLine: The Nation Accepts Its Judgment
rest:
Woe to me, because of my wound.
My wound is incurable.
But I said, “Surely this is my sickness,
and I must bear it.”

firstLine: My tent is devastated,
rest:
and all my tent cords are torn.
My children have gone out from me,
and they are not.
There is no one who pitches my tent again,
or one who puts up my tent curtains.

firstLine: For the shepherds have become stupid,
rest:
they do not seek Yahweh.
Therefore they do not have insight,
and all of their flock are scattered.

firstLine: Listen, news:
rest:
Look, it is coming,
a great roar from the land of the north,
to make the cities of Judah a desolation,
a lair of jackals.

firstLine: I know, O Yahweh, that to the human is not his own way,
rest: nor to a person is the walking and the directing of his own step.

firstLine: Chastise me, O Yahweh, but in moderation,
rest: not in your anger, lest you eradicate me.

firstLine: Pour out your wrath on the nations that do not know you,
rest:
and on the peoples that do not call on your name,
for they have devoured Jacob,
they have devoured and consumed him,
and they have caused his settlement to be desolate.

firstLine: The Broken Covenant
rest: The word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, saying,

firstLine: What rights has my beloved in my house
rest:
when she has done many wicked things?
Can the flesh of holiness pass over you?
For you engage in your wickedness, then you exult.

firstLine: And Yahweh of hosts, the one who planted you,
rest:
has spoken evil against you,
because of the evil of the house of Israel and the house of Judah,
that they have done to themselves,
to provoke me to anger by making smoke offerings to Baal.”

firstLine: A Warning for the People of Anathoth
rest:
Moreover, Yahweh let it be made known to me, and I knew.
Then you showed me their deeds.

firstLine: And I was like a gentle ram-lamb that is brought to slaughter,
rest:
and I did not know that they planned plans against me, saying,
“Let us destroy the tree with its fruit,
and let us cut him off from the land of the living,
so that his name will no longer be remembered.”

firstLine: But O Yahweh of hosts, who judges in righteousness,
Jeremiah’s Complaint
rest:
You will be in the right, O Yahweh, when I complain to you.
Even so, let me speak my claims with you.
Why does the way of the wicked succeed?
All those who deal treacherously with treachery are at ease.

firstLine: But you, O Yahweh, you know me,
rest:
you see me, and you test that my heart is with you.
Tear them apart like sheep for the slaughtering,
and set them apart for the day of slaughter.

firstLine: How long will the land mourn, and the vegetation of every field dry up,
rest:
because of the wickedness of those who live in it?
The animals and the birds are swept away,
because they have said, “He does not see our future.”

firstLine: The Lord’s Reply
rest:
“If you run with foot soldiers and they have made you weary,
then how will you compete with horses?
If you have fallen in a peaceful land,
then how will you do in the thickets of the Jordan?

firstLine: For even your relatives, and the house of your father,
rest:
even they have dealt treacherously with you,
even they call loudly after you.
You must not trust in them, though they speak kindly to you.

firstLine: The lair of the hyena is my inheritance to me,
rest:
the birds of prey are all around her.
Go, gather all of the animals of the field,
bring them to come and devour.

firstLine: Many shepherds have destroyed my vineyard,
rest:
they have trampled down my plot of land.
They have made my pleasant field
like the desert of desolation.

firstLine: Upon all the barren heights in the desert destroyers have come,
The Linen Loincloth
rest: Thus Yahweh said to me: “Go and buy for yourself a loincloth of linen and put it on your loins, but you must not place it in water.”

firstLine: Listen, and pay attention,
rest: you must not be haughty, for Yahweh has spoken.

firstLine: Give glory to Yahweh your God before he brings darkness,
rest:
and before your feet stumble on the mountains at twilight.
And you will hope for light, but he makes it as gloom,
he makes it as thick darkness.

firstLine: But if you will not listen to it,
rest:
my inner self will weep in secret places,
because of the presence of your pride.
And my eyes will weep bitterly,
and they will melt in tears,
because the flock of Yahweh has been taken captive.

firstLine: A Message for the King and the Queen Mother
rest:
“Say to the king and to the queen mother, ‘Take a lower seat,
for your beautiful crown has come down from your head.’

firstLine: The towns of the Negev are shut up,
Lift up your eyes
rest:
and see those coming from the north.
Where is the flock that was given to you,
your magnificent flock?

firstLine: What will you say when he sets over you—
rest:
and you have taught them—allies as head over you?
Will not labor pains take hold of you,
like a woman giving birth?

firstLine: And if you say in your heart,
Can a Cushite change his skin,
rest:
or a leopard his spots?
Then you also will be able to do good,
who are accustomed to doing evil.

firstLine: And I will scatter them
rest: like stubble scattered by the wind of the desert.

firstLine: This is your lot,
rest:
the portion of your measure from me,” declares Yahweh,
“because you have forgotten me,
and you have trusted in the lie.

firstLine: So in turn I will bare your skirts over your face,
rest: and your shame will become visible.

firstLine: Your adulteries, and your neighings,
rest:
the shameful behavior of your fornications
on the hills in the countryside,
I have seen your abominations.
Woe to you, O Jerusalem!
How long will you continue to be unclean?”

firstLine: The Severe Drought
rest: That which came as the word of Yahweh to Jeremiah concerning the matter of the severe drought.

firstLine: “Judah mourns, and her gates languish,
rest:
they are in mourning on the ground,
and the cry of lament of Jerusalem goes up.

firstLine: Because of the ground, which is cracked
rest:
because there was no rain on the ground.
The farmers are ashamed,
they cover their heads.

firstLine: For even the doe in the field gives birth and forsakes her young,
rest: because there is no green growth.

firstLine: And wild asses stand on the barren heights,
rest:
they gasp for breath like the jackals.
Their eyes fail
because there is no vegetation.”

firstLine: Although our iniquities testify against us, O Yahweh,
You are the hope of Israel,
rest:
its savior in time of distress.
Why should you be like an alien in the land,
or like a traveler who spreads out his tent  to spend the night?

firstLine: Why should you be like a confused man,
rest:
like a warrior who is not able to help?
Yet you are in our midst, O Yahweh,
and your name is called upon us.
You must not leave us!

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh concerning this people:
rest:
“They have loved so much to wander,
they have not spared their feet.
Therefore Yahweh is not favorable to them,
now he will remember their iniquity and punish their sins.”

firstLine: Lying Prophets
rest: So Yahweh said to me, “You must not pray for this people, for their happiness.

firstLine: The Nation Hopes in Yahweh
rest:
“And you shall say to them this word,
‘Let my eyes melt with tears night and day,
and let them not cease,
for with a great wound the virgin daughter of my people is broken,
with a very incurable wound.

firstLine: If I go out into the field,
rest:
then look, those slain by the sword.
And if I enter the city,
then look, the sickness of the famine.
For both prophet and priest wander around through the land,
they do not know what is going on.’”

firstLine: We know, O Yahweh, our wickedness,
rest:
the iniquity of our ancestors,
for we have sinned against you.

firstLine: You must not spurn us for the sake of your name,
rest:
you must not dishonor your glorious throne.
Remember us!
You must not break your covenant with us.

firstLine: Four Types of Calamity
rest: Then Yahweh said to me, “Even if Moses and Samuel stood before me, my heart would not be to this people. Send them away from my sight, and let them go out.

firstLine: “For who will have compassion on you, O Jerusalem,
rest:
or who will show sympathy to you,
or who will turn aside to ask about your welfare?

firstLine: Jeremiah’s Lament and Yahweh’s Response
rest:
Woe to me, O my mother, that you gave birth to me,
a man of contention and quarreling to the whole land.
I have not lent out and I have not borrowed.
All of them are cursing me.

firstLine: Yahweh said,
rest:
“Surely I will set you free to be good for you,
surely I will cause the enemy to intercede with you
in a time of trouble,
and in a time of distress.

firstLine: Can anyone break iron,
rest: iron from the north, or bronze?

firstLine: I will give your wealth and your treasures
rest:
as plunder without price,
even because of all your sins,
and throughout all your territories.

firstLine: And I will make you serve your enemies
rest:
in a land that you do not know,
for a fire will kindle in my anger.
Upon you it will be kindled.”

firstLine: You who know, O Yahweh, remember me, and attend to me,
rest:
and take revenge for me against my persecutors in your forbearance.
You must take me away.
Know that I am carrying disgrace because of you.

firstLine: Your words were found and I ate them,
rest:
and your words became to me as jubilation,
even as the joy of my heart,
for your name is called on me, O Yahweh God of hosts.

firstLine: I sat not in the assembly of jokers,
rest:
nor did I exult.
Because of the presence of your hand I sat alone,
for you filled me with indignation.

firstLine: Therefore thus says Yahweh,
rest:
“If you turn back, then I will take you back.
You will stand before me.
And if you utter what is precious and not what is worthless,
you will be as my mouth.
They will turn back to you,
and you will not turn back to them.

firstLine: And I will make you to this people
rest:
a wall of fortified bronze,
and they will fight against you,
but they will not prevail over you,
for I am with you, to save you,
and to deliver you,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “And I will deliver you from the hand of the wicked,
rest: and I will redeem you from the hand of the tyrant.”

firstLine: Jeremiah is Commanded Not to Marry
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: The Nation’s Return to the Land
rest: Therefore look, days are coming,’ declares Yahweh, ‘and it will no longer be said, “As Yahweh lives, who led up the Israelites from the land of Egypt,”

firstLine: O Yahweh, my strength, and my stronghold,
rest:
and my refuge in the day of distress,
to you the nations will come from the ends of the earth,
and they will say, “Our ancestors have inherited only lies,
vanity, and there is no profit in them.

firstLine: “Therefore look, I am about to let them know,
rest:
this time I am going to let them know
my power and my might,
