and they will know that my name is Yahweh.”

firstLine: The Sin of Judah
rest:
“The sin of Judah is written with an iron stylus,
with a point of diamond it is engraved
on the tablet of their heart,
and on the horns of their altars.

firstLine: As the remembering of their children,
rest:
so is the remembering of their altars
and their poles of Asherah worship
beside the leafy trees on the high hills.

firstLine: O my mountain in the open country,
rest:
I will give your wealth, all your treasures, for spoil,
your high places, because of your sin,
throughout all your territories.

firstLine: And you will let go your hand from your inheritance
rest:
that I gave to you,
and I will make you serve your enemies
in the land that you do not know,
for you kindled a fire in my anger,
until eternity it will be kindled.”

firstLine: The One Who Trusts in Humankind Contrasted With the One Who Trusts in Yahweh
rest:
Thus says Yahweh,
“Cursed is the person who trusts in humankind
and makes flesh his strength,
and turns aside his heart from Yahweh.

firstLine: And he will be like a juniper in the wilderness,
rest:
and he will not see when good comes,
and he will dwell in the parched places in the desert,
in a land of salt flats, where no one lives.

firstLine: Blessed be the person who trusts in Yahweh,
rest: and Yahweh is his trust.

firstLine: For he will be like a tree planted by water,
rest:
and to the stream it sends its roots,
and it will not fear when heat comes,
and its leaves will be luxuriant,
and in the year of drought it will not be anxious,
and it will not cease from the bearing of fruit.

firstLine: The heart is deceitful more than anything else,
rest: and it is disastrous. Who can understand it?

firstLine: I, Yahweh, examine the mind,
rest:
I test the heart,
and give to each one according to his way,
according to the fruit of his deeds.

firstLine: Like a partridge that hatches eggs it did not lay
rest:
is one who amasses wealth without justice.
In the middle of his days it will leave him,
and at his end he will prove to be a fool.”

firstLine: The Fountain of Living Water
rest:
A lofty throne of glory from the beginning
is the place of our sanctuary.

firstLine: O Yahweh, the hope of Israel,
rest:
all those who forsake you will be put to shame,
and those who turn aside from you in the earth will be recorded,
for they have forsaken the fountain of living water, Yahweh.

firstLine: Heal me, O Yahweh, and I will be healed,
rest:
save me, and I will be saved,
for you are my praise.

firstLine: Look, they are saying to me,
rest:
“Where is the word of Yahweh?
Please let it come.”

firstLine: But I, I have not run away from being a shepherd who follows you,
rest:
and I have not desired the disastrous day.
You, you know the pronouncement of my lips,
it was before your face.

firstLine: You must not become to me a terror,
rest: you are my refuge in the day of disaster.

firstLine: Let my persecutors be put to shame,
rest:
but as for me, do not let me be put to shame.
Let them be dismayed,
but as for me, do not let me be dismayed.
Bring on them the day of disaster,
and with double destruction, destroy them.

firstLine: The Sabbath Day
rest: Thus said Yahweh to me, “Go, and you must stand in the People’s Gate through which the kings of Judah enter, and through which they go out, and in all the gates of Jerusalem.

firstLine: The Potter and the Clay
rest: The word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, saying,

firstLine: “Therefore thus says Yahweh,
rest:
‘Please ask among the nations, “Who has heard the like of this?”
The virgin of Israel has done something very horrible.

firstLine: To make their land a horror,
rest:
an object of whistling for eternity.
All who pass by it will be appalled,
and he will shake his head.

firstLine: Like the wind from the east
rest:
I will scatter them before the enemy.
I will show them my back and not my face
in the day of their disaster.’”

firstLine: Jeremiah’s Imprecatory Prayer
rest: Then they said, “Come and let us plan plans against Jeremiah, for instruction will not be lost from the priest, nor advice from the wise man, nor the word from the prophet. Come and let us bring charges against him, and let us not listen attentively to any of his words.”

firstLine: Listen attentively to me, O Yahweh,
rest: and listen to the voice of my opponents.

firstLine: Therefore give their children to the famine,
rest:
and hand them over to the power of the sword,
and let their wives be bereaved and widows,
and let their men be killed by death,
their young men struck dead
by the sword in the battle.

firstLine: Let a cry for help be heard from their houses
But you, O Yahweh, you know
rest:
all their plans of assassination against me.
You must not make atonement for their iniquity,
and you must not cause their sin to be blotted out from before you.
But let them be overthrown before you.
Deal with them in the time of your anger.

firstLine: The Valley of the Slaughter
rest: Thus said Yahweh, “Go and buy a potter’s earthenware jar, and take some of the elders of the people, and some of the leaders of the priests,

firstLine: A Message for Pashhur
rest: Now Pashhur, the son of Immer, the priest who was officer in charge in the temple of Yahweh, heard Jeremiah prophesying these things.

firstLine: Jeremiah’s Lament
rest:
You have persuaded me, O Yahweh, and I was persuaded.
You have overpowered me, and you have prevailed.
I have become a laughingstock all day long.
Everyone is mocking me.

firstLine: For as often as I speak,
rest:
I must cry out violence and destruction.
I must shout, for the word of Yahweh has become for me
a disgrace and derision all day long.

firstLine: But if I say, “I will not mention him
rest:
and I will no longer speak in his name,”
then it becomes in my heart like a fire burning,
locked up in my bones,
and I struggle to contain it,
and I am not able.

firstLine: For I hear the rumor of many,
rest:
“Terror is from all around, denounce him,
yes, let us denounce him!”
All my close friends are watchers of my stumbling,
saying, “perhaps he can be persuaded,
and we can prevail over him,
and we can take our revenge on him.”

firstLine: Yet, O Yahweh of hosts, who tests the righteous,
Sing to Yahweh, praise Yahweh,
rest: for he has delivered the life of the poor from the hand of evildoers.

firstLine: Cursed be the day on which I was born,
rest: let not the day on which my mother gave birth to me be blessed.

firstLine: Cursed be the man who brought the news to my father,
rest:
saying, “A child is born to you, a son!”
and he made him very glad.

firstLine: And let that man be like the cities
rest:
that Yahweh demolished without regret,
and let him hear a cry for help in the morning,
and an alarm at the time of noon.

firstLine: Because he did not kill me in the womb,
rest:
so that my mother would have been for me my grave,
and her womb would be pregnant forever.

firstLine: Why did I come out from the womb,
rest: to see toil, and sorrow, and to end my days in shame?

firstLine: A Message for Zedekiah
rest: The word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh when King Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur, the son of Malchiah, and Zephaniah, the son of Maaseiah, the priest, saying,

firstLine: The Way of Life and the Way of Death
rest: “And to this people you shall say, ‘Thus says Yahweh, “Look, I am setting before you the way of life and the way of death.

firstLine: A Series of Messages for the House of the King of Judah
rest: “And to the house of the king of Judah, ‘Hear the word of Yahweh,

firstLine: O house of David, thus says Yahweh,
rest:
“Execute judgment in the morning, justice,
and deliver the one who has been seized
from the hand of the oppressor,
lest my wrath goes forth like the fire and it burns,
and there is no one who quenches it
because of the evil of your deeds.

firstLine: Look, I am against you,
rest:
O inhabitants of the valley,
O rock of the plain,” declares Yahweh;
“you who say, ‘Who can descend against us,
or who can enter into our hiding place?’

firstLine: And I will punish you
rest:
according to the fruit of your deeds,” declares Yahweh,
“And I will kindle a fire in its forest,
and it will devour all its surroundings.”’”

firstLine: For thus says Yahweh concerning the house of the king of Judah,
rest:
“You are like Gilead to me,
like the head of the Lebanon.
Surely I will make you a desert,
like cities that are not inhabited.

firstLine: And I will consecrate against you destroyers,
rest:
everyone with his weapons,
and they will cut down your choicest cedars,
and cast them on the fire.

firstLine: You must not weep for the dead person,
rest:
and you must not show sympathy for him.
Weep bitterly for the one who goes away,
for he will not return, or see the land of his birth again.

firstLine: Woe to the one who builds his house without righteousness,
rest:
and his upper rooms without justice.
His fellow countryman, he works for nothing,
and he does not give to him his wages.

firstLine: Who says ‘I will build for myself
rest:
a spacious house with large upper rooms,’
and he cuts windows for it,
and it is paneled with cedar,
and he paints it with vermilion.

firstLine: He judged the legal cause of the needy and the poor,
rest:
and then it was well.
Is that not what it means to know me?” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “But there is nothing in your eyes and your heart
Therefore thus says Yahweh concerning Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah, the king of Judah:
rest:
“They will not lament for him,
‘Alas, my brother,’ or ‘Alas, sister.’
They will not lament for him,
‘Alas, lord,’ or ‘alas, his majesty.’

firstLine: Go up to Lebanon and cry out,
rest:
and in Bashan lift up your voice,
and cry out from Abarim,
for all your lovers are shattered.

firstLine: I spoke to you in the times you were secure,
rest:
and you said, ‘I will not listen!’
This was your way from your youth,
for you have not obeyed my voice.

firstLine: All your shepherds will shepherd the wind,
rest:
and your lovers will go into captivity.
Yes, then you will be ashamed and humiliated
because of all your wickedness.

firstLine: Inhabitants of Lebanon,
rest:
nestled among the cedars,
how you will groan when labor pains come to you,
fear and pain as the woman who gives birth.

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh:
rest:
“Record this man as childless,
a man who will not succeed in his days,
for no man from his offspring will succeed him,
sitting on the throne of David and ruling again in Judah.”

firstLine: Woe to the Evil Shepherds
rest: “Woe to the shepherds who destroy and scatter the flock of my pasture,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: The Righteous Branch
rest:
“Look, days are coming,” declares Yahweh,
“when I will raise up for David a righteous branch,
and he will reign as king, and he will achieve success,
and he will do justice and righteousness in the land.

firstLine: In his days Judah will be saved,
rest:
and Israel will dwell in safety,
and this is his name by which he will be called:
‘Yahweh is our righteousness.’

firstLine: The Unfaithful Prophets
rest:
Concerning the prophets:
My heart is broken in my midst.
All my bones tremble.
I have become like a drunken man,
even like a man over whom wine has passed,
because of Yahweh,
and because of his holy words.

firstLine: For the land is full of adulterers;
rest:
for the land mourns because of a curse.
The pastures of the desert are dry,
and their evil has been their way of running,
and their power is not right.

firstLine: “For both prophet as well as priest are godless,
rest: even in my temple I have found their wickedness,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “Therefore their way will be to them like the slippery places,
rest:
they will be pushed in the darkness,
and they will fall into it,
for I will bring disaster on them in the year of their punishment,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “Now in the prophets of Samaria I saw a disgusting thing.
rest: They prophesied by Baal and they caused my people Israel to err.

firstLine: Therefore thus says Yahweh concerning the prophets,
rest:
“Look, I am going to let them eat wormwood
and I will give them water of poison to drink,
for from the prophets of Jerusalem
went out ungodliness to all the land.”

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh of hosts,
rest:
“You must not listen to the words of the prophets who prophesy to you.
They are deluding you with visions of their mind,
They do not speak from the mouth of Yahweh.

firstLine: They are continually saying to those who disregard the word of Yahweh,
rest:
‘Peace it will be to you,’
and to each one who walks in the stubbornness of his heart they say,
‘Calamity will not come upon you.’

firstLine: For who has stood in the council of Yahweh,
rest:
that he has seen and heard his word?
Who has listened attentively to his word
and heard it?

firstLine: Look, the storm of Yahweh has gone forth in wrath,
rest:
even a whirling tempest.
It will whirl upon the head of the wicked.

firstLine: The anger of Yahweh will not turn back
rest:
until his doing and until his keeping the plans of his mind.
In latter days you will look closely at it with understanding.

firstLine: But if they had stood in my council,
rest:
then they would have proclaimed my words to my people,
and they would have caused them to turn from their evil way,
and from the evil of their deeds.

firstLine: Am I a God from near,” declares Yahweh,
rest: “and not a God from far?

firstLine: Or can a person hide himself in secret places
rest:
and I cannot see him?” declares Yahweh.
“Do I not fill up the heaven and the earth?” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: Two Baskets of Figs
rest: Yahweh showed me, and look, there were two baskets of figs placed before the temple of Yahweh—after Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon had deported Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, the king of Judah, with the officials of Judah, and the craftsmen, and the smiths, from Jerusalem and had brought them to Babylon.

firstLine: Seventy Years of Servitude
rest: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, the king of Judah, that was the first year of Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon,

firstLine: The Cup of Wrath
rest: And then when the seventy years are fulfilled, I will punish the king of Babylon and that nation,’ declares Yahweh, ‘for their iniquity, and the land of the Chaldeans, and I will make it an everlasting waste.

firstLine: And you yourself shall prophesy against them all these words, and you shall say to them:
rest:
‘Yahweh will roar from on high,
and from his holy dwelling place he will give his voice.
He will roar mightily against his settlement,
a jubilant shout like those who tread grapes,
he will answer against all the inhabitants of the earth.

firstLine: The rage of battle will resound to the end of the earth,
rest:
for there is a lawsuit of Yahweh against the nations.
He is entering into judgment with all wicked flesh,
he will give them to the sword,’ declares Yahweh.”

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh of hosts,
rest:
“Look, disaster is going out from nation to nation,
and a great tempest is stirred up from the farthest parts of the earth.

firstLine: And the slain ones of Yahweh will be on that day
rest:
from one end of the earth to the other end of the earth,
and they will not be mourned,
and they will not be gathered,
and they will not be buried.
They will become like dung on the surface of the ground.

firstLine: And flight will perish from the shepherds,
rest: and escape from the leaders of the flock.

firstLine: A sound, the cry of distress of the shepherds
rest:
and the wailing of the leaders of the flock,
for Yahweh is despoiling their pasture.

firstLine: And the peaceful settlements are devastated
rest: because of the burning anger of Yahweh.

firstLine: He has left his den like a lion,
Jeremiah Escapes Death
rest: At the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, the king of Judah, this word came from Yahweh, saying,

firstLine: Jeremiah Uses Fetters and Yokes to Illustrate His Message of Submission
rest: In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah, the king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, saying—

firstLine: The Vessels of the Temple
rest: Then I spoke to the priests and to all this people, saying, “Thus says Yahweh, ‘You must not listen to the words of your prophets who are prophesying to you, saying, “Look, the vessels of the house of Yahweh are about to be quickly brought back from Babylon”, for they are prophesying a lie to you.

firstLine: Hananiah, the False Prophet
rest: And it was in that same year, at the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah, the king of Judah, in the fourth year, in the fifth month, that Hananiah, the son of Azzur, the prophet who was from Gibeon, said to me in the house of Yahweh before the eyes of the priests and all the people, saying,

firstLine: Jeremiah’s Letter to the Exiles in Babylon
rest: And these are the words of the letter that Jeremiah the prophet sent from Jerusalem to the remainder of the exiles, and to the priests, and to the prophets, and to all the people whom Nebuchadnezzar had deported from Jerusalem to Babylon,

firstLine: Shemaiah’s Letter to Zephaniah the Priest
rest: And to Shemaiah the Nehelamite you shall say, saying,

firstLine: Jeremiah’s Response to Shemaiah’s Letter
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to Jeremiah, saying,

firstLine: Israel and Judah Will Be Delivered from Their Distress
rest: The word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, saying,

firstLine: “For thus says Yahweh:
rest:
‘We have heard a sound of trembling,
terror, and there is no peace.

firstLine: And it will happen on that day,’ declares Yahweh of hosts,
rest:
‘I will break his yoke from your neck
and your bonds I will tear to pieces.
And strangers will no longer let him work as a slave.

firstLine: But they will serve Yahweh their God,
rest: and David their king, whom I will raise up for them.

firstLine: But you must not fear, my servant Jacob,’ declares Yahweh,
rest:
‘and you must not be dismayed, Israel,
for look, I am going to save you from far,
and your offspring from the land of their captivity.
And Jacob will return,
and he will be at rest,
and he will be at ease,
and there will be no one who makes him afraid.

firstLine: For thus says Yahweh,
rest:
‘Your injury is incurable,
your wound is overcome by sickness.

firstLine: There is no one who pleads your cause,
rest: for your boil there is no healing for you.

firstLine: All your lovers have forgotten you,
rest:
they do not care for you.
I have struck you with the blow of an enemy,
the punishment of the cruel,
because of the greatness of your guilt,
your sins are numerous.

firstLine: Therefore all those who devour you will be devoured,
rest:
and all your foes, all of them will go into captivity,
and those who plunder you will be as plunder,
and all those who plunder you I will make as plunder.

firstLine: For I will present healing to you,
rest:
and I will heal you of your wounds,’ declares Yahweh.
‘Because they have called you an outcast, saying,
“It is Zion, there is no one who cares for her.”’

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh:
rest:
‘Look, I will restore the fortunes of the tents of Jacob,
and I will have compassion on his dwellings,
and the city will be rebuilt upon its mound,
and the citadel fortress will stand on its rightful site.

firstLine: And thanksgiving and the sound of merrymakers
rest:
will come out from them,
and I will make them numerous,
and they will not be few.
And I will make them honored,
and they will not be lowly.

firstLine: And their children will be as of old,
rest:
and their community will be established before me.
And I will punish all their oppressors.

firstLine: And their noble will be from them,
rest:
and their ruler will come out from their midst.
And I will bring him near and he will approach me.
For who is he that would pledge his heart to approach me?’ declares Yahweh.

firstLine: ‘And you will be to me a people,
rest: and I will be to you God.’”

firstLine: The burning anger of Yahweh will not turn back until his doing,
rest:
and until his accomplishing the plans of his mind.
In the last of the days you will understand it.

firstLine: “At that time,” declares Yahweh,
rest:
“I will be the God of all the clans of Israel,
and they will be to me a people.”

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh:
rest:
“The people of the survivors of the sword found grace in the desert;
Israel going to find their rest.”

firstLine: From afar Yahweh appeared to me, saying,
rest:
“I have loved you with an everlasting love.
Therefore I have drawn you with loyal love.

firstLine: I will again build you,
rest:
and you will be built, O virgin Israel.
You will again adorn yourself with your tambourines,
and you will go forth in the dancing in a ring of the merrymakers.

firstLine: For there will be a day when watchmen will call in the hill country of Ephraim,
rest: ‘Stand up, and let us go up to Zion, to Yahweh our God.’”

firstLine: For thus says Yahweh,
rest:
“Sing for joy for Jacob with gladness,
and shout out for the head of the nations.
Proclaim, praise, and say,
‘Save, O Yahweh, your people, the remnant of Israel.’

firstLine: Look, I am going to bring them from the land of the north,
rest:
and I will gather them from the remotest part of the earth.
Among them the blind, and the lame,
those who are pregnant, and those who give birth,
together, a great assembly,
they will return here.

firstLine: With weeping they will come,
Hear the word of Yahweh, O nations,
rest:
and declare in the coastlands from afar, and say,
“The scatterer of Israel will gather him,
and he will keep him as a shepherd his flock.

firstLine: For Yahweh has ransomed Jacob,
rest: and he has redeemed him from the hand of the person stronger than he.

firstLine: And they will come,
rest:
and they will sing for joy on the height of Zion,
and they will be radiant over the goodness of Yahweh,
over the grain, and over the wine, and over the olive oil,
and over the young ones of the flock, and over the cattle.
And their life will become like a well-watered garden,
and they will never languish again.”

firstLine: “Then the young woman will rejoice in the dancing in a ring,
rest:
and the young men and the old men together.
And I will turn their mourning to jubilation,
and I will comfort them,
and I will gladden them from their sorrow.

firstLine: And I will saturate the appetite of the priests with fatness,
rest: and my people will be satisfied with my goodness,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh,
rest:
“A voice is heard in Ramah,
lamentation, the weeping of bitterness.
Rachel is weeping for her children;
she refuses to be comforted because of her children,
for they are no more.”

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh:
rest:
“Restrain your voice from weeping,
and your eyes from tears,
for there is a reward for your work,” declares Yahweh,
“and they will return from the land of the enemy.

firstLine: And there is hope for your future,” declares Yahweh,
rest: “and your children will return to their territory.

firstLine: Indeed I heard Ephraim pitying themselves,
rest:
‘You disciplined me, and I was disciplined,
like a calf that is not trained.
Bring me back and let me return,
for you are Yahweh my God.

firstLine: For after my turning back I repented,
rest:
and after coming to understand I struck my thigh.
I was ashamed and also humiliated,
because I bore the disgrace of my youth.’

firstLine: Is Ephraim my dear son,
rest:
or the child of my delight?
For as often as I have earnestly spoken against him,
I still remember him.
Therefore my bowels are turbulent for him,
surely I will have compassion on him,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “Set up for yourself road markers,
rest:
make for yourself signposts,
set your mind to the main road,
the road by which you went.
Return, O virgin of Israel,
return to these your cities.

firstLine: And Judah and all of its towns together will live in it,
rest: farmers and those who travel with the flocks.

firstLine: For I will saturate the thirst of the weary,
rest: and every person who languishes I will replenish.”

firstLine: At this I awoke and looked,
rest: and my sleep was pleasant to me.

firstLine: The New Covenant
rest: “Look, the days are coming,” declares Yahweh, “and I will sow the house of Israel and the house of Judah with the seed of humankind, and with the seed of animals.

firstLine: Jeremiah Buys a Field
rest: The word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh in the tenth year of Zedekiah the king of Judah, that was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar.

firstLine: The Fortunes of Judah and Israel Will Be Restored
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to Jeremiah a second time while he was still held back in the courtyard of the guard, saying,

firstLine: A Message for Zedekiah
rest: The word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, when Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, and all his army, with all the kingdoms of the earth under the dominion of his hand, and all the peoples were fighting against Jerusalem and against all its cities, saying,

firstLine: Zedekiah’s Covenant Concerning Slaves
rest: The word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh after king Zedekiah made a covenant with all the people who were in Jerusalem to proclaim release to them,

firstLine: The Faithfulness of the Rechabites
rest: The word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh in the days of Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah, the king of Judah, saying,

firstLine: Jehoiakim Burns the Scroll of Jeremiah’s Prophecies
rest: And then in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, the king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, saying,

firstLine: The Babylonians Withdraw to Meet a Threat from Egypt
rest: And king Zedekiah, the son of Josiah, whom Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, had made king, reigned as king in the land of Judah in place of Coniah, the son of Jehoiakim.

firstLine: Jeremiah is Arrested and Put in Prison
rest: And then, at the withdrawing of the army of the Chaldeans from Jerusalem before the army of Pharaoh,

firstLine: Jeremiah is Thrown into the Pit of Malchiah
rest: Now Shephatiah the son of Mattan, and Gedaliah the son of Pashhur, and Jehucal the son of Shelemiah, and Pashhur the son of Malchiah heard the words that Jeremiah was saying to all the people, saying,

firstLine: The Fall of Jerusalem
rest: In the ninth year of Zedekiah, the king of Judah, in the tenth month, Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon and all his army came against Jerusalem and laid siege to it.

firstLine: Ebed-melech is Rewarded for His Faith
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to Jeremiah at his confinement in the courtyard of the guard, saying,

firstLine: Jeremiah Decides to Remain in the Land
rest: The word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh after Nebuzaradan, the captain of the guard, had let him go from Ramah, where he had been taken bound in chains in the midst of all the exiles of Jerusalem and Judah who were being deported to Babylon.

firstLine: The Assassination of Gedaliah
rest: When all the commanders of the armies who were in the open country and their men heard that the king of Babylon had appointed Gedaliah the son of Ahikam in an official position in the land, and that he had put him in charge of men, and women, and little children, and of the poor of the land, of all those who had not been deported to Babylon,

firstLine: The Massacre of the Mourners
rest: And then on the second day of the killing of Gedaliah—and no one knew—

firstLine: The Remnant Asks Jeremiah to Pray to Yahweh for Direction
rest: Then all the commanders of the armies, and Johanan the son of Kareah, and Jezaniah the son of Hoshaiah, and all the people from the smallest to the greatest, approached

firstLine: The Remnant Rejects the Word of Yahweh
rest: And then at the end of ten days the word of Yahweh came to Jeremiah.

firstLine: The Throne of Nebuchadnezzar Will be Set Up at Tahpanhes
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to Jeremiah in Tahpanhes, saying,

firstLine: A Message of Rebuke for the Rebellious Remnant
rest: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the Judeans who were living in the land of Egypt, who were living at Migdol, and Tahpanhes, and Memphis, and in the land of Pathros, saying,

firstLine: A Message for Baruch
rest: The word that Jeremiah the prophet spoke to Baruch, the son of Neriah, at his writing these words on a scroll from the mouth of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah, the king of Judah, saying,

firstLine: Messages Concerning Egypt
rest: The word of Yahweh that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the nations.

firstLine: “Prepare small shield and shield,
rest: and approach for the battle!

firstLine: The swift cannot flee,
rest:
and the warrior cannot escape.
They have stumbled and they have fallen,
by the bank of the Euphrates River.

firstLine: Who is this that rises like the Nile,
rest: like the rivers whose waters surge?

firstLine: Egypt rises like the Nile,
Go up, O horses,
rest:
and drive madly, O chariots,
and let the warriors go forth;
Cush and Put, who wield the small shield,
and Lud, who wield and bend the bow.

firstLine: For that day is to the Lord Yahweh of hosts
rest:
a day of retribution,
to take revenge on his foes.
And the sword will devour and be satisfied,
and it will drink its fill of their blood,
for a sacrifice is for the Lord Yahweh of hosts
in the land of the north by the Euphrates River.

firstLine: Go up to Gilead and take balm,
The nations have heard your shame,
rest:
and your cry of lament fills the earth.
For warrior has stumbled against warrior,
together they have fallen, the two of them.

firstLine: “Declare in Egypt, and proclaim in Migdol,
rest:
and proclaim in Memphis and in Tahpanhes,
say, ‘Take your stand and be prepared,
for the sword will devour those all around you.’

firstLine: They will call there,
rest:
‘Pharaoh, the king of Egypt is but a roar,
he missed the opportunity.’

firstLine: As I live,” declares the king,
rest:
Yahweh of hosts is his name,
“one will come like Tabor among the mountains
and like Carmel by the sea.

firstLine: Pack your baggage for exile,
Egypt is a beautiful heifer,
rest: but a gadfly from the north will come against her.

firstLine: Even her mercenaries in her midst are like calves of fattening,
Her sound is like a snake that glides away,
rest:
for they march in force.
And with axes they come to her
like those who chop trees.

firstLine: They will cut down her forest,” declares Yahweh,
rest:
“for it is impenetrable.
Yes, they are more numerous than locusts,
and they are without number.

firstLine: The daughter of Egypt will be ashamed,
rest: she will be given into the hand of the people of the north.”

firstLine: “But as for you, my servant Jacob, you must not be afraid,
rest:
and Israel, you must not be dismayed,
for look, I am going to save you from far,
and your offspring from the land of their captivity.
And Jacob will return,
and he will be quiet,
and he will be at ease,
and without one who makes him afraid.

firstLine: You must not be afraid, my servant Jacob,” declares Yahweh,
rest:
“for I am with you.
For I will make a complete destruction in all the nations where I scattered you,
but you I will not make a complete destruction,
though I will chastise you to the measure,
and I will certainly not leave you unpunished.”

firstLine: A Message Concerning the Philistines
rest: The word of Yahweh that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning the Philistines before Pharaoh attacked Gaza.

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh:
rest:
“Look, waters are rising from the north,
and they will become as a raging torrent,
and they will overflow the land,
and that which fills it,
the city and those who live in it.
And the people will cry out,
and every inhabitant of the land will wail,

firstLine: from the sound of the stamping of the hoofs of his stallions,
rest:
from the clattering of his chariots,
the noise of their wheels.
Fathers do not turn to their children
because of the slackness of their hands.

firstLine: Because of the day that is coming
rest:
to destroy all the Philistines,
to cut off from Tyre and from Sidon
every survivor who could help,
for Yahweh is destroying the Philistines,
the remnant of the coastland of Caphtor.

firstLine: Baldness has come upon Gaza,
rest:
Ashkelon is destroyed.
O remnant of their valley,
how long will you cut yourself with a blade?

firstLine: Ah, sword of Yahweh,
rest:
how long will you not be quiet?
Gather to your sheath,
keep quiet and stand still.

firstLine: How can you be quiet
rest:
when Yahweh has given an order to it?
Against Ashkelon and against the shore of the sea,
there he has appointed it.”

firstLine: A Message Concerning Moab
rest:
Concerning Moab, thus says Yahweh of hosts, the God of Israel:
“Woe to Nebo,
for it is devastated.
It is ashamed,
Kiriathaim is captured.
Misgab is ashamed,
and it is filled with terror.

firstLine: The sound of a cry of distress arises from Horonaim,
rest: devastation and great destruction.

firstLine: Moab is broken,
rest: her little ones make heard a cry for help.

firstLine: For the ascent of Luhith,
rest:
in weeping they go weeping,
For on the slope of Horonaim they have heard
the distresses of the cry of distress of the destruction.

firstLine: For because of your trusting in your works and in your treasures,
rest:
even you yourselves will be taken,
and Chemosh will go out into the exile,
his priests and his officials together.

firstLine: And the destroyer will come to every town,
rest:
and a town will not escape.
And the valley will be destroyed,
and the plain will be destroyed, as Yahweh has spoken.

firstLine: Give salt for Moab,
The one who does the work of Yahweh with slackness is cursed,
rest: and the one who keeps away blood from his sword is cursed.

firstLine: Moab has been at ease from his youth,
rest:
and he has been quiet on his dregs,
and he has not been poured out from vessel to vessel,
and he has not gone into exile.
Therefore his taste has remained unchanged,
and his fragrance has not changed.

firstLine: Therefore look, days are coming,” declares Yahweh,
rest:
“and I will send to him decanters,
and they will decant him,
and his vessels they will empty out,
and their jars they will smash.

firstLine: Then Moab will be ashamed of Chemosh,
rest: just as the house of Israel were ashamed of Bethel, their trust.

firstLine: How can you say, ‘we are warriors,
rest: and men of might for the battle.’

firstLine: Moab is destroyed,
rest:
and his towns have gone up,
and the choice of his young men have gone down to the slaughtering,”
declares the King, Yahweh of hosts is his name.

firstLine: “The disaster of Moab is near to come,
rest: and his disaster approaches very quickly.

firstLine: Mourn for him, all his surroundings,
rest:
and all those who knew his name.
Say, ‘How the staff of might is broken,
the staff of glory.’

firstLine: Come down from glory and sit on the parched ground,
Stand by the road and watch,
rest:
O inhabitant of Aroer.
Ask the man who is fleeing and the woman who is escaping,
say, ‘What has happened?’

firstLine: Moab is ashamed,
rest:
for it is filled with terror.
Wail and cry out,
tell it by Arnon that Moab is devastated.

firstLine: “Make him drunk,
rest:
because he magnified himself against Yahweh,
and let Moab wallow in his vomit.
And he also will become a laughingstock.

firstLine: Leave the towns and dwell on the rock,
rest:
O inhabitants of Moab,
and be like the dove,
it nests on the sides of the mouth of a ravine.

firstLine: We have heard of the pride of Moab
rest:
—he is very proud—
his height, and his pride, and his arrogance,
and the haughtiness of his heart.

firstLine: I know his insolence,” declares Yahweh,
rest:
“and his boastings are false;
they act falsely.

firstLine: Therefore over Moab I wail,
rest:
and for all of Moab I cry out,
for the people of Kir-heres I moan.

firstLine: More than the weeping of Jazer
rest:
I weep for you, O vine Sibmah.
Your branches cross over the sea,
up to the sea of Jazer they reach.
Upon your summer fruit and upon your vintage
the destroyer has fallen.

firstLine: And joy and rejoicing have been taken away from the fruitful land,
rest:
even from the land of Moab.
And the wine from the wine presses
I have caused to disappear.
He will not tread with exuberant shouts.
Exuberant shouts will not be exuberant shouts.

firstLine: From the cry for help of Heshbon, up to Elealeh,
And I will cause to disappear for Moab,” declares Yahweh,
rest:
“the one who presents a sacrifice at a high place,
and the one who burns a smoke offering to his gods.

firstLine: For on every head is baldness,
rest:
and every beard is trimmed.
On all the hands, slashes,
and on the loins, sackcloth.

firstLine: On all the roofs of Moab, and in its public squares,
rest:
there is wailing everywhere.
For I have broken Moab like a vessel,
there is no delight in it,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “How it is filled with terror! How they wail!
rest:
How Moab has turned his back! He is disgraced!
So Moab has become as a derision,
and as a terror for all his surrounding peoples.”

firstLine: For thus says Yahweh,
rest:
“Look, like an eagle he will swoop down,
and he will spread out his wings against Moab.

firstLine: Kerioth will be taken,
rest:
and the strongholds will be conquered,
and the hearts of the warriors of Moab will be on that day
like the heart of a woman who is in labor.

firstLine: And Moab will be destroyed from being a people,
rest: because against Yahweh he magnified himself.

firstLine: Dread, and pit, and a trapping net are against you,
rest: O inhabitant of Moab,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “He who flees before the dread
rest:
will fall into the pit,
and the one who climbs up from the pit
will be caught in the trapping net,
for I will bring on Moab
the year of their punishment,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “In the shadow of Heshbon
rest:
fugitives stand without strength,
for a fire has gone out from Heshbon,
and a flame from Sihon.
And it has eaten the forehead of Moab,
and the skulls of the people of tumult.

firstLine: Yet I will restore the fortunes of Moab
rest:
in the last of the days,” declares Yahweh.
Thus far is the judgment of Moab.

firstLine: A Message Concerning Ammon
rest:
Concerning the Ammonites: Thus says Yahweh,
“Are there no sons for Israel?
Or is there no heir for him?
Why has Milcom taken possession of Gad,
and his people dwelled in its towns?

firstLine: Therefore look, days are coming,” declares Yahweh,
rest:
“and I will sound against Rabbah, the Ammonites,
the alarm of the war,
and it will become as a mound of desolation,
and its daughters will burn in the fire.
Then Israel will dispossess his dispossessors,” says Yahweh.

firstLine: “Wail, Heshbon, for Ai is devastated.
rest:
Cry out, O daughters of Rabbah, put on sackcloth.
Lament and run back and forth among the walls.
For Milcom will go into exile,
his priests and his officials together.

firstLine: Look, I am going to bring dread on you,”
rest:
declares Lord Yahweh of hosts,
“from all your surrounding neighbors.
And you will be scattered,
each one before it,
and there is no one who gathers the fugitives.

firstLine: Yet afterward I will restore
rest: the fortunes of the Ammonites,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: A Message Concerning Edom
rest:
Concerning Edom, thus says Yahweh of hosts:
“Is there no longer wisdom in Teman?
Has counsel become lost from those who understand?
Is their wisdom rotting?

firstLine: If grape-gatherers come to you,
rest:
would they not leave gleanings?
If thieves in the night,
they destroy only enough for them.

firstLine: I have heard a message from Yahweh,
rest:
and a messenger has been sent among the nations.
“Gather and come against her,
and rise for the battle.”

firstLine: “For look, I will make you small among the nations,
rest: despised by the humankind.

firstLine: Your terror has deceived you,
rest:
the pride of your heart,
O you who dwell in the clefts of the rock,
you who seize the height of the hill.
Though you make your nest high like the eagle,
from there I will bring you down,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “And Edom will become as a horror,
rest:
everyone who passes by it will be appalled,
and will hiss because of all its blows.

firstLine: As the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah
rest:
and their neighbors,” says Yahweh,
“no one will live there,
and the son of humankind will not dwell as an alien in it.

firstLine: Look, like a lion he comes up from the thickets of the Jordan
rest:
to a pastureland by a constantly flowing stream.
So I will chase him away hurriedly from it.
And whoever is chosen I will appoint over it.
For who is like me, and who can summon me?
And who is this, the shepherd who can stand before me?”

firstLine: Therefore hear the plan of Yahweh that he has planned against Edom,
rest:
and his plans that he has planned against the inhabitants of Teman.
Surely they will drag them away,
the little ones of the flock.
Surely he will cause to be desolated over them
their grazing place.

firstLine: Look, like an eagle he will go up and he will swoop down,
rest:
and he will spread out his wings against Bozrah.
And the heart of the warriors of Edom will be in that day
like the heart of a woman who is in labor.

firstLine: A Message Concerning Damascus
rest:
Concerning Damascus:
“Hamath and Arpad are ashamed,
for they have heard bad news;
they melt.
There is concern in the sea.
It is not able to keep quiet.

firstLine: Therefore her young men will fall in her public squares,
rest: and all the soldiers will perish in that day,” declares Yahweh of hosts.

firstLine: “And I will kindle a fire at the wall of Damascus,
rest: and it will devour the citadel fortresses of Ben-hadad.”

firstLine: A Message Concerning Kedar and the Kingdoms of Hazor
rest:
Concerning Kedar and concerning the kingdoms of Hazor that Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon defeated. Thus says Yahweh:
“Rise up, go up against Kedar
and destroy the people of the east.

firstLine: They will take their tents, and their flocks,
rest:
their tent curtains, and all their equipment,
and their camels they will carry away for themselves,
and they will call to them, ‘Terror is from all around.’

firstLine: Rise up, go up against a nation which is at ease,
rest:
living securely,” declares Yahweh.
“There are no gates and there are no bars for them,
they dwell alone.

firstLine: And their camels will become as plunder,
rest:
and the multitude of their livestock as spoil.
And I will scatter to every wind those who are trimmed to the side,
and from every side I will bring their disaster,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “And Hazor will become as a lair of jackals,
A Message Concerning Elam
rest: The word of Yahweh that came to Jeremiah the prophet concerning Elam at the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah the king of Judah, saying,

firstLine: “Thus says Yahweh of hosts:
rest:
‘Look, I am going to break the bow of Elam,
the first and best of their might.

firstLine: And I will bring to Elam four winds,
rest:
from the four corners of heaven,
and I will scatter them to all these winds,
and there will not be a nation
where the scattered people of Elam will not go.

firstLine: So I will shatter Elam before their enemies,
rest:
and before the seekers of their life.
And I will bring disaster upon them,
my burning anger,’ declares Yahweh.
‘And I will send after them the sword
until I have destroyed them.

firstLine: And I will set my throne in Elam
rest: and I will destroy from there king and officials,’ declares Yahweh.

firstLine: ‘And then in the last of the days
rest: I will restore the fortunes of Elam,’ declares Yahweh.”

firstLine: A Message Concerning Babylon
rest: The word that Yahweh spoke concerning Babylon, concerning the land of the Chaldeans, by the hand of Jeremiah the prophet:

firstLine: “Declare among the nations and proclaim,
rest:
and lift up a banner.
Proclaim, you must not conceal it.
Say, ‘Babylon is captured,
Bel is ashamed,
Merodach is filled with terror,
her idols are ashamed,
her idols are filled with terror.

firstLine: In those days and in that time,’” declares Yahweh,
rest:
“the people of Israel will come,
they and the people of Judah together.
Weeping as they go, they will go,
and Yahweh their God they will seek.

firstLine: They will ask the way to Zion,
rest:
turning their faces there.
They will come and join themselves to Yahweh
by an everlasting covenant that will not be forgotten.

firstLine: My people have become lost sheep,
rest:
their shepherds have caused them to go astray.
They led them away to the mountains.
From mountain to hill they have gone,
they have forgotten their resting place.

firstLine: Flee from the midst of Babylon,
rest:
and from the land of the Chaldeans.
Go out and be like he-goats
before the flock.

firstLine: For look, I am going to stir up,
rest:
and I am going to bring against Babylon
a contingent of great nations
from the land of the north.
And they will draw up a battle formation against her,
from there she will be captured.
Their arrows are like a warrior who has achieved success,
he does not return without success.

firstLine: And Chaldea will be as booty,
rest: all those who plunder her will be satisfied,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “Though you rejoice, though you exult,
rest:
O plunderers of my inheritance,
though you frisk about like a heifer on the grass,
and you neigh like the powerful stallions,

firstLine: Because of the anger of Yahweh she will not be inhabited,
rest:
but she will be a wasteland, all of her.
Everyone who passes by Babylon will be appalled
and will hiss because of all her wounds.

firstLine: Draw up a battle formation at Babylon all around,
rest:
all those who bend the bow, shoot at her.
You must not spare arrows,
for she has sinned against Yahweh.

firstLine: Cut off the sower from Babylon,
rest:
and the one who uses the sickle in the time of harvest.
Because of the sword of the oppressor
each one will turn to their people,
and each one will flee to their land.

firstLine: Israel is a sheep scattered,
rest:
lions drove them away.
The first who devoured it was the king of Assyria,
and now at the end Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, gnawed its bones.”

firstLine: Therefore thus says Yahweh of hosts, the God of Israel,
rest:
“Look, I am going to punish the king of Babylon and his land
just as I punished the king of Assyria.

firstLine: And I will restore Israel to its pasture,
rest:
and it will feed on Carmel, and in Bashan,
and on the hills of Ephraim, and in Gilead
its hunger will be satisfied.

firstLine: In those days and at that time,” declares Yahweh,
rest:
“the guilt of Israel will be sought, but there is none,
and the sins of Judah, but they will not be found,
for I will forgive those I left behind.

firstLine: To the land of Merathaim,
rest:
go up against her,
and against the inhabitants of Pekod,
massacre and destroy them,” declares Yahweh,
“and do according to all that I have commanded you.

firstLine: The sound of battle is in the land,
rest: and great destruction.

firstLine: Yahweh has opened his armory,
rest:
and he has brought out the weapons of his wrath,
for it is a word for my Lord Yahweh of hosts
in the land of the Chaldeans.

firstLine: Come against her from the end,
rest:
open her granaries.
Pile her up like heaps and destroy her.
Let there be no remnant for her.

firstLine: Massacre all her bulls,
rest:
let them go down to the slaughtering.
Woe to them, for their day has come,
the time of their punishment.

firstLine: There is the sound of fugitives and survivors
Summon archers against Babylon,
rest:
all those who bend the bow.
Encamp all around her,
there must not be for her an escape.
Take revenge on her according to her deeds.
According to all that she has done, so do to her.
For against Yahweh she has behaved insolently,
against the Holy One of Israel.

firstLine: Therefore her young men will fall in her public squares,
rest: and all her soldiers will perish on that day,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “Look, I am against you, O arrogant one,”
rest:
declares Lord Yahweh of hosts,
“for your day has come,
the time when I will punish you.

firstLine: And the arrogant one will stumble and fall,
rest:
and there is no one who raises him up.
And I will kindle a fire in his cities,
and it will devour everything around him.”

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh of hosts:
rest:
“The people of Israel are oppressed,
and the people of Judah likewise,
for all their captors have seized them,
they refuse to let them go free.

firstLine: Their redeemer is strong,
rest:
his name is Yahweh of hosts.
Surely he will plead their case,
in order to make peace for the earth,
but to cause unrest to the inhabitants of Babylon.

firstLine: A sword against the Chaldeans,” declares Yahweh,
rest:
“and against the inhabitants of Babylon,
and against her officials,
and against her wise men.

firstLine: A sword against the oracle priests,
rest:
and they will become foolish.
A sword against her warriors,
and they will be filled with terror.

firstLine: A sword against his horses,
rest:
and against his chariots,
and against all the foreign troops who are in the midst of her,
so that they may become as women.
A sword against her treasures,
so that they may be plundered.

firstLine: A drought will come against her waters,
Therefore desert creatures will live there with jackals,
rest:
and daughters of ostriches will inhabit her.
And she will not be inhabited again forever,
and she will not be dwelt in for all generations.

firstLine: As when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah
rest:
and their neighbors,” declares Yahweh,
“no one will live there,
and the son of humankind will not dwell as an alien in her.

firstLine: Look, a people is about to come
The king of Babylon heard their report
rest:
and his hands grew slack.
Anxiety has seized him,
fear and pain like the woman who gives birth.

firstLine: Look, like a lion he comes up from the thickets of the Jordan
rest:
against a pastureland by a constantly flowing stream,
so I will chase them away quickly from her,
and I will appoint whoever is chosen over her.
For who is like me, and who can summon me,
and who is this shepherd who can stand before me?

firstLine: Therefore hear the plan of Yahweh
rest:
that he has planned against Babylon,
and his plans
that he has planned against the land of the Chaldeans.
Surely they will drag them away,
the little ones of the flock.
Surely he will cause their grazing place
to be desolate over them.

firstLine: At the sound, ‘Babylon has been captured,’
rest:
the earth will quake,
and a cry for help among the nations
will be heard.”

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh:
rest:
“Look, I am going to stir up against Babylon
and against the inhabitants of Leb-qamai a destructive wind.

firstLine: And I will send winnowers to Babylon,
rest:
and they will winnow her,
and they will lay waste her land,
for they will be against her from all sides on the day of disaster.

firstLine: Let not him who bends the bow shoot his bow,
And they will fall slain in the land of the Chaldeans,
rest: and pierced through in her streets.

firstLine: For neither Israel nor Judah is a widower from their God,
Babylon was a cup of gold in the hand of Yahweh,
rest:
making drunk all the earth.
The nations drank of her wine.
Therefore the nations acted like madmen.

firstLine: Against the walls of Babylon raise a banner;
rest:
post a strong watch, post watchmen, prepare the ambushes,
for Yahweh has both planned as well as performed
what he has spoken concerning the inhabitants of Babylon.

firstLine: O you who live by mighty waters, rich in treasures,
rest: your end has come, the measure of your life.

firstLine: Yahweh of hosts has sworn by himself,
rest:
“Surely I will fill you with troops like the creeping locusts,
and they will sing over you a war cry.”

firstLine: He is the one who made the earth by his power,
rest:
the one who created the world by his wisdom,
and by his understanding he stretched out the heavens.

firstLine: At the giving of his voice
rest:
there is a roar of waters in the heavens,
and he causes the patches of mist
to go up from the end of the earth.
He makes lightning for the rain,
and he brings out the wind from his storehouses.

firstLine: All humankind turns out to be stupid,
rest:
without knowledge.
Every goldsmith is put to shame
by the divine image.
For his cast image is a lie,
and there is no breath in them.

firstLine: They are worthless,
rest:
a work of mockery.
At the time of their punishment,
they will perish.

firstLine: The portion of Jacob is not like these,
He says, “You are a war club for me,
rest:
a weapon of battle,
and I smash nations with you,
and I destroy kingdoms with you.

firstLine: And I smash the horse with you,
rest:
and its rider,
and I smash the chariot with you,
and its rider.

firstLine: And I smash man and woman with you,
rest:
and I smash the old man and the boy with you,
and I smash the young man and the young woman with you.

firstLine: And I smash the shepherd and his flock with you,
rest:
and I smash the farmer and his team with you,
and I smash the governors and the officials with you.

firstLine: And I will repay Babylon,
rest:
and all the inhabitants of Chaldea,
all their wickedness that they have done in Zion
before your eyes,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “Look, I am against you,
rest:
O mountain of the destruction,” declares Yahweh,
“the one that destroys the whole earth.
And I will stretch out my hand against you,
and I will roll you down from the cliffs,
and I will make you as a mountain burned away.

firstLine: They will not take from you
rest:
a stone for a corner,
and a stone for a foundation,
for you will be an everlasting desolation,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: Raise a banner in the land;
Prepare the nations for holy war against her,
rest:
the kings of the Medes,
with their governors and all their officials,
and every land of their dominion.

firstLine: And the land quakes and writhes,
The warriors of Babylon have ceased to fight,
rest:
they remain in the strongholds,
their power has dried up,
they have become as women.
Her dwelling places are set on fire,
her bars are broken.

firstLine: one runner runs to meet another runner,
rest:
and one messenger to meet another messenger,
to tell the king of Babylon that his city has been captured,
from end to end.

firstLine: And the fords have been seized,
rest:
and the reed marshes have been burned with fire,
and the soldiers are horrified.

firstLine: For thus says Yahweh of hosts, the God of Israel,
rest:
“The daughter of Babylon is like a threshing floor
at the time it is trodden down,
just a little while
and the time of the harvest will come for her.”

firstLine: Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon
“May the violence done to me and to my flesh be on Babylon,”
Therefore thus says Yahweh,
rest:
“Look, I am going to contend your case,
and I will avenge your vengeance,
and I will cause her sea to dry up,
and I will cause her fountain to dry up.

firstLine: And Babylon will become as a heap of stones,
rest:
a lair of jackals,
an object of horror, and an object of hissing,
without inhabitants.

firstLine: They will roar together like the young lions,
rest: they will growl like the cubs of lions.

firstLine: At their becoming hot I will set their banquets,
rest:
and I will make them drunk,
so that they will fall into a swoon,
and they will sleep an everlasting sleep,
and they will not wake up,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: “I will bring them down like young rams to slaughter,
rest: like rams and goats.

firstLine: How Sheshach is captured,
rest:
and the glory of all the earth is seized!
How Babylon has become as an object of horror
among the nations!

firstLine: The sea has risen over Babylon,
rest: she has been covered by the roar of its waves.

firstLine: Her cities have become as an object of horror,
rest:
a dry land and a wilderness,
a land in which no person lives,
nor does a son of humankind pass through it.

firstLine: And I will punish Bel in Babylon,
rest:
and I will wrench out from his mouth what he has swallowed.
And the nations will not stream towards him any longer
what’s worse, the wall of Babylon has fallen.

firstLine: Come out from her midst, my people,
rest:
and save each one his life
from the burning anger of Yahweh.

firstLine: Now so that you are not fainthearted,
rest:
and you are afraid at the rumors that are heard in the land—
and in the year the rumor comes,
and in the year after it the rumor,
and violence is in the land,
with ruler against ruler—

firstLine: therefore look, days are coming,
rest:
and I will punish the images of Babylon,
and all her land will be put to shame,
and all her slain ones will fall in the midst of her.

firstLine: Then the heaven and the earth and all that is in them
rest:
will shout for joy over Babylon,
for from the north
the destroyers will come to it,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: Babylon must fall not only because of the slain ones of Israel,
rest: but also because of Babylon the slain ones of all the earth have fallen.

firstLine: We are ashamed,
“Therefore look, days are coming,” declares Yahweh,
rest:
“and I will punish her images,
and the fatally wounded will sigh through all her land.

firstLine: Though Babylon goes up to the heavens,
rest:
and though she fortifies the high place of her strength,
from me destroyers will come to her,” declares Yahweh.

firstLine: The sound of a cry for help from Babylon,
rest: and a great collapse from the land of the Chaldeans.

firstLine: For Yahweh is devastating Babylon,
rest:
and he obliterates her loud noise from her.
Their waves roar like mighty waters,
the roar of their voices resounds.

firstLine: For a destroyer is coming against her, against Babylon,
“And I will make drunk her officials, and her wise men,
rest:
her governors, and her officials, and her warriors,
and they will sleep an everlasting sleep,
and they will not wake up,”
declares the King, Yahweh of hosts is his name.

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh of hosts:
rest:
“The broad walls of Babylon will be utterly demolished,
and her high gates will burn with fire,
and the peoples will labor for nothing,
and the nations for fire,
and they will grow weary.”

firstLine: The Scroll Concerning Babylon is Thrown into the Euphrates
rest: The word that Jeremiah the prophet commanded Seraiah, the son of Neriah, the son of Mahseiah, at his going with Zedekiah, the king of Judah, to Babylon in the fourth year of his reign. Now Seraiah was the quartermaster.

firstLine: The Fall of Jerusalem
rest: Zedekiah was twenty-one years old at his beginning to reign, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. And the name of his mother was Hamutal, the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.

firstLine: An Allowance for Jehoiachin
rest: And then in the thirty-seventh year of the exile of Jehoiachin, the king of Judah, in the twelfth month, on the twenty-fifth day of the month, Evil-merodach, the king of Babylon, in the first year of his reign, lifted up the head of Jehoiachin, the king of Judah, and brought him out from prison.

firstLine: The Desolate City
rest:
How desolate the city sits
that was full of people!
She has become like a widow,
once great among the nations!
Like a woman of nobility in the provinces,
she has become a forced laborer.

firstLine: She weeps bitterly in the night,
Judah has gone into exile with misery
The roads of Zion are mourning
rest:
because no one comes to the festival.
All her gates are desolate,
her priests groan;
her young women are worried,
and she herself suffers bitterly.

firstLine: Her foes have become her master,
rest:
her enemies are at ease;
Yahweh has made her suffer
because of the greatness of her transgressions.
Her children have gone away,
captive before the foe.

firstLine: All her majesty has gone away
Jerusalem remembers
rest:
the days of her misery and wanderings,
all her treasures
that were from the days of long ago.
When her people fell into the hand of the enemy,
there was no one helping her;
the enemies saw her, they mocked
at her destruction.

firstLine: Jerusalem sinned grievously,
rest:
thus she became an objection of derision;
all those who honored her despise her
because they have seen her nakedness.
She herself groans
and turns away.

firstLine: Her uncleanness was in her skirts;
rest:
she did not remember her future,
she has descended beyond understanding,
there is no comforter for her.
See, O Yahweh, my persecution!
My enemy has been made great!

firstLine: The enemy has stretched out his hand
All her people groan,
rest:
they are searching for bread.
They give their treasures for food,
to bring back life.
See, O Yahweh, and look,
how I am despised.

firstLine: From heaven he sent fire,
rest:
into my bones he let it descend.
He spread out a net for my feet;
he turned me back,
he gave me devastation,
fainting all day.

firstLine: My rebellion was bound as a yoke,
rest:
with his hand it was fastened together;
it was put on my neck
and caused my strength to fail.
The Lord gave me into the hands
of those whom I cannot withstand.

firstLine: The Lord has rejected
rest:
all my mighty ones in my midst.
He called an assembly against me,
to crush my young men;
like in a wine press,
the Lord has trodden on
the virgin daughter of Judah.

firstLine: For these things, I am weeping,
rest:
my eyes flow with tears;
because a comforter is far from me,
one to restore my life.
My sons are desolate
because the enemy has prevailed.

firstLine: Zion stretches out her hands;
rest:
there is no one to comfort her.
Yahweh has commanded against Jacob,
that those surrounding him should be his enemies;
Jerusalem has become
a defilement among them.

firstLine: Yahweh is righteous;
rest:
I have rebelled against his word.
Please hear, all the nations,
And see my pain;
My young women and young men
went into captivity.

firstLine: I have called to my lovers,
rest:
they themselves deceived me;
my priests and elders perished in the city
when they sought food for themselves
to revive their life.

firstLine: See, O Yahweh, that I am in distress;
rest:
my stomach is in torment,
my heart has turned inside me
because I have certainly rebelled.
From outside a sword brings bereavement,
inside the house it is like death.

firstLine: They hear that I was groaning;
rest:
there is no comforter for me.
All my enemies have heard my misery,
they are pleased that you have done it.
Bring that day that you have proclaimed,
And let them be like me.

firstLine: Let all their evil come before you;
rest:
and deal with them
just as you have dealt with me
because of all my crimes;
for my groaning is much and my heart is faint.

firstLine: The Lord is Angry
rest:
How, in his anger,
the Lord has covered the daughter of Zion in a cloud!
He has thrown down from heavens to earth
the splendor of Israel,
and he has not remembered his footstool
in the day of his anger.

firstLine: The Lord has devoured; he has not shown mercy
He has cut down in fierce anger
He has bent his bow like an enemy;
rest:
he has set his right hand
like a foe, and he has slain
all the treasures of the eye;
in the tent of the daughter of Zion,
he has poured out his anger like fire.

firstLine: The Lord has become like an enemy;
He has broken down his dwelling place like the garden;
rest:
he has ruined his appointed feasts;
Yahweh has made them forget in Zion
festival and Sabbath,
and he has despised in his anger
king and priest.

firstLine: The Lord has rejected his altar;
rest:
he has rejected his sanctuary;
he has delivered into the hands of the enemy
the walls of its citadel fortresses.
They have cried out in the house of Yahweh
like a day of an appointed feast.

firstLine: Yahweh has planned to destroy
Her gates have sunk into the earth;
rest:
he has ruined and broken her bars,
her kings and its princes are among the nations;
there is no more law.
Also, her prophets have not found
a revelation from Yahweh.

firstLine: They sit on the ground,
rest:
the elders of the daughter of Zion are silent.
They cast dust on their head,
they have put on sackcloth;
the young women of Jerusalem
have bowed their head down to the ground.

firstLine: My eyes have spent all their tears;
rest:
my stomach is in torment,
my heart is poured out on the earth
because of the destruction of the daughter of my people,
because child and babe faint
in the public squares of a city.

firstLine: To their mothers they say,
rest:
“Where is the bread and wine?”
as they faint like the wounded
in the public squares of a city,
as their life is being poured out
onto the bosom of their mothers.

firstLine: Your prophets had a vision for you,
They clap hands over you,
rest:
all who pass along the way;
they hiss and they shake their head,
at the daughter of Jerusalem.
Is this the city of which it is said,
“A perfection of beauty, a joy for all the earth?”

firstLine: They have opened their mouths against you,
rest:
all your enemies.
They hiss and gnash a tooth,
and they say, “We have destroyed her!
Surely this is the day we have hoped for;
we have found it, we have seen it!”

firstLine: Yahweh has done what he has planned;
Their heart cried to the Lord,
rest:
“O wall of the daughter of Zion,
let tears stream down like a river;
day and night,
do not give yourself relief,
do not give your eyes rest.

firstLine: “Arise, cry out in the night,
rest:
at the beginning of the night watches;
pour out your heart like water,
before the face of the Lord.
Lift to him your hands,
for the life of your children,
who faint in starvation,
at the head of all streets.”

firstLine: They lie in the soil of the streets,
You have summoned my horror from all around,
Israel’s Affliction
rest:
I am a man who has seen misery,
under the rod of his wrath.

firstLine: He has driven me along, he brought
rest: darkness and not light.

firstLine: Surely he has turned his hand against me,
rest: all day long.

firstLine: He has worn out my flesh and skin,
rest: he has broken my bones.

firstLine: He has besieged and engulfed me
rest: with bitterness and hardship.

firstLine: In darkness he has let me dwell
rest: like the dead of long ago.

firstLine: He has built a wall around me, I cannot go out;
rest: he has made my bronze fetters heavy.

firstLine: Though I cry out for help,
rest: he shuts out my prayers.

firstLine: He has blocked my ways with dressed stones;
rest: he has made my paths crooked.

firstLine: To me he is like a bear lying in wait,
rest: a lion in hiding.

firstLine: He has forsaken my way and torn me to pieces;
rest: he has caused me desolation.

firstLine: He has bent his bow and set me
rest: as the target for the arrow.

firstLine: He shot the arrows of his quiver
rest: into my kidneys.

firstLine: I have become a laughingstock for all the people,
rest: their mocking song all day long.

firstLine: He has filled me with bitterness,
rest: he has drenched me with wormwood.

firstLine: He has broken my teeth on grit,
rest: he has trampled me down in ash.

firstLine: My life has been removed from peace,
rest: I have forgotten goodness.

firstLine: And I have said, “My glory is ruined,
rest: my expectation from Yahweh.”

firstLine: Remember my misery and bitterness,
rest: the wormwood and venom!

firstLine: Surely my soul remembers
rest: and bows down within me.

firstLine: This I have reminded myself,
rest: therefore I will hope.

firstLine: The loyal love of Yahweh does not cease;
rest: his compassions do not come to an end.

firstLine: They are new in the morning,
rest: great is your faithfulness.

firstLine: “Yahweh is my portion,”
rest:
says my soul,
“Thus I will hope on him.”

firstLine: Yahweh is good to those who wait on him,
rest: to the person that seeks him.

firstLine: It is good to wait in silence
rest: for the salvation of Yahweh.

firstLine: It is good for a man who carries
rest: the yoke of his childhood.

firstLine: Let him sit alone and be silent
rest: when he has laid it on him.

firstLine: Let him put his mouth in the dust;
rest: perhaps there is hope.

firstLine: Let him give a cheek to his smiter,
rest: let him be filled with disgrace.

firstLine: For the Lord will not reject
rest: forever.

firstLine: For even though he causes grief he has compassion
rest: according to the greatness of his royal love.

firstLine: He does not afflict willingly,
rest: or grieve anyone.

firstLine: To crush under his feet
rest: all the prisoners of the earth;

firstLine: to deprive one of justice
rest: before the face of the Most High;

firstLine: to subvert a person in a legal dispute
rest: —the Lord has not found delight in these things.

firstLine: Who can speak and it will happen
rest: if the Lord has not commanded it?

firstLine: Is it not from the mouth of the Most High
rest: that disaster and good will come?

firstLine: Why should any living person complain
rest: about his sin?

firstLine: Let us test and examine our ways;
rest: let us return to Yahweh.

firstLine: Let us lift up our hearts with our hands
rest: to God in the heavens.

firstLine: We ourselves have transgressed and rebelled,
rest: you have not forgiven.

firstLine: You have covered yourself in anger and pursued us,
rest: you have slain and not shown mercy.

firstLine: You have covered yourself in a cloud
rest: so that prayer cannot pass through.

firstLine: You have made us scum and refuse
rest: in the midst of the nations.

firstLine: All our enemies
rest: have opened their mouth against us.

firstLine: Fear and a pit have come upon us,
rest: desolation and destruction.

firstLine: Channels of water run down my eyes
rest: because of the destruction of the daughter of my people.

firstLine: My eyes have poured down unceasingly
rest: without respite,

firstLine: until Yahweh looks down
rest: and sees from heaven.

firstLine: My eyes inflict my soul
rest: because of all the daughters of my city.

firstLine: My enemies hunt me without cause,
rest: like a bird.

firstLine: They have silenced me in a pit,
rest: they have thrown a stone at me.

firstLine: Water has flown over my head,
rest: I said, “I am cut off.”

firstLine: I have called your name, O Yahweh,
rest: from the depths of the pit.

firstLine: You have heard my cry, “Do not shut your ear
rest: to my cry for help, for my relief!”

firstLine: You came near on a day when I called you,
rest: you said, “Do not fear!”

firstLine: O Lord, you have pleaded for my cause,
rest: you have redeemed my life.

firstLine: You have seen my injustice, O Yahweh;
rest: judge my case.

firstLine: You have seen all their vengeance,
rest: all there plans against me.

firstLine: You have heard their disgrace, O Yahweh,
rest: all their plans against me.

firstLine: The lips and meditation of my assailants
rest: are against me all day long.

firstLine: Look at their sitting and their standing,
rest: I am their mocking song.

firstLine: Return to them what is deserved, O Yahweh,
rest: according to the work of their hands.

firstLine: Give them a stubborn heart;
rest: curse them!

firstLine: Pursue them in anger and destroy them
rest: from under the heavens of Yahweh.

firstLine: Zion Is Punished
rest:
How the gold has grown dim,
the pure gold has changed.
The stones of holiness are scattered
at the head of every street.

firstLine: The precious sons of Zion
rest:
weighed against fine gold,
how they are thought of as earthen vessels of clay,
the work of the potter’s hands.

firstLine: Even the jackal bears the beast
The tongue of the nursling cleaves
rest:
to its palate in thirst.
Children beg for food,
no one lays it out before them.

firstLine: The ones who eat delicacies,
The iniquity of the daughter of my people is greater
Her princes were purer than snow,
Now their appearance is blacker than soot,
Happier were the victims of the sword
The hands of compassionate women,
Yahweh has completed his anger,
The kings of the earth did not believe,
rest:
and all the inhabitants of the world,
that a foe and an enemy could enter
into the gates of Jerusalem.

firstLine: Because of the sins of her prophets,
rest:
the guilt of her priests,
who shed blood in her midst,
of righteous people.

firstLine: They wander blindly in the streets;
rest:
they were defiled with the blood,
their clothes
could not be touched.

firstLine: “Go away! Defiled!” they shout to them.
rest:
“Go away! Go away! Do not touch!”
so they left, they left; it was said among the nations,
“They will no longer dwell with us.”

firstLine: The presence of Yahweh has scattered them,
Still our eyes failed,
They hunted our steps,
Our pursuers were swifter
The breath of our nostrils, the anointed one of Yahweh,
Rejoice and be glad, O daughter of Edom,
The punishment of your iniquity is completed, O daughter of Zion,
A Request for Mercy
rest:
Remember, O Yahweh, what has become of us;
take note, and see our disgrace!

firstLine: Our inheritance has been turned over to strangers,
rest: our houses, to foreigners.

firstLine: We have become orphans, fatherless,
rest: our mothers are like widows.

firstLine: We pay for water with money,
rest: our wood comes to us at a price.

firstLine: We are driven on our necks;
rest: we are weary, there is no rest for us.

firstLine: We have made a deal with Egypt and Assyria
rest: to be satisfied with food.

firstLine: Our fathers have sinned, they are no more;
rest: we bear their iniquity.

firstLine: Slaves rule over us;
rest: there is no one to deliver us from their hand.

firstLine: We risk our life for food
rest: because of the sword of the desert.

firstLine: Our skin is hot like an oven
rest: because of the scorching famine.

firstLine: They raped women in Zion,
rest: young women in the cities of Judah.

firstLine: They hang princes by their hand;
rest: they do not show respect before elders.

firstLine: Young men must carry a hand-mill
rest: and boys stumble under the wood.

firstLine: Elders are no longer at the gate,
rest: young men no longer play stringed instruments.

firstLine: The joy of our hearts has stopped;
rest: our circle-dancing has changed to a mourning ceremony.

firstLine: The crown has fallen from our head;
rest: woe to us, for we have sinned!

firstLine: Because of this, our heart has become faint,
rest: because of these, our eyes have become dim.

firstLine: Because of Mount Zion, which lies desolate,
rest: foxes tread on it.

firstLine: You, O Yahweh, will sit forever
rest: on your throne for generation to generation.

firstLine: Restore us to you, O Yahweh, that we will be restored;
rest: renew our days as of old.

firstLine: Unless you have utterly rejected us,
rest: unless you are angry with us beyond measure.

firstLine: Date of Vision of Living Creatures and Glory of the Throne of Yahweh
rest: And it was in the thirtieth year, in the fourth month, on the fifth day of the month, and I was in the midst of the exiles by the Kebar River. The heavens were opened, and I saw visions of God.

firstLine: The Call of Ezekiel to Speak God’s Words
rest: And he said to me, “Son of man, stand on your feet, so that I can speak with you.”

firstLine: Siege of Jerusalem Illustrated on a Brick
rest: “Now, son of man, take for yourself a brick, and you must put it before you, and you must portray on it a city, Jerusalem.

firstLine: Ezekiel’s Strange Defiled Meal
rest: “And you, take for yourself wheat and barley and beans and lentils and millet and spelt, and you must put them in one vessel, and you must make them for yourself into a food during the number of days that you are lying on your side; three hundred and ninety days you shall eat it.

firstLine: Idolatrous Worship and Idolatrous Objects Denounced
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: Punishment for Abominations Throughout the Land
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: Judgment for the Profanation of the Temple and Sanctuary
rest: “‘And the beauty of its ornament he made into a prideful thing and made with it their detestable things and their vile idols; therefore I will make it into an impure thing for them.

firstLine: Abominations in the Temple and in Jerusalem
rest: And then in the sixth year, in the sixth month, on the fifth day of the month, I was sitting in my house, and the elders of Judah were sitting before me. And the hand of the Lord Yahweh fell on me there,

firstLine: Yahweh’s Avenging Messenger Destroys the Wicked in the City
rest: And he called in my ears with a loud voice, saying, “They have come near, the punishers of the city, and each with his weapon of destruction in his hand.

firstLine: God’s Presence Leaves the Temple
rest: And I looked, and look! On the expanse that was above the head of the cherubim something like a stone of sapphire, and like the appearance of the shape of a throne it appeared above them.

firstLine: Judgment On Evil Rulers
rest: And the Spirit lifted me up, and it brought me to the eastern gate, the one facing east, of the temple of Yahweh. And look, there were twenty-five men in the doorway of the gate, and I saw Jaazaniah the son of Azzur in the midst of them, and Pelatiah the son of Benaiah, the commanders of the people.

firstLine: The Announcement of the Imminent Coming of the Exile
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: Condemnation of False Prophets
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: Condemnation of Israel’s Idolatrous Elders
rest: And men from the elders of Israel came to me, and they sat before me.

firstLine: Jerusalem will not be Spared
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: Jerusalem a Useless Vine
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: God’s Covenant Grace to Unfaithful and Rebellious Israel
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: Parable of Two Eagles and a Vine
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: God’s Just Treatment of Individuals, Both Righteous and Wicked
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: Lament for the Leaders of Israel
rest: “And you, raise a lament about the leaders of Israel,

firstLine: and you must say,
rest:
‘What a lioness was your mother
among the lions.
She lay down in the midst of young lions,
and she reared her lion cubs.

firstLine: And she raised up one from her cubs;
And nations heard about him;
rest:
in their pit he was caught,
and they brought him with hooks
to the land of Egypt.

firstLine: And she saw that she was waiting in vain;
rest:
her hope was destroyed,
and she took one from her cubs,
and she made him a fierce lion.

firstLine: And he walked about in the midst of lions;
And he knew their widows,
rest:
and he devastated their cities,
and the land was appalled, and everyone in it
at the sound of his roar.

firstLine: And nations set out against him
And they put him in a collar with hooks,
rest:
and they brought him to the king of Babylon;
they brought him into a prison,
so that his voice would not be heard any longer
on the mountains of Israel.

firstLine: Your mother was like the vine in your vineyard;
rest:
planted fruitfully beside water,
and it was full of branches
from many waters.

firstLine: And she produced branches of strength
rest:
to scepters of rulers;
its height became tall
between thick foliage,
and it was seen because of its tallness
among the abundance of its branches.

firstLine: But it was uprooted in rage;
And now it is planted in the desert,
rest: in a dry and thirsty land.

firstLine: And so fire has gone out from the stem of its branches;
rest:
its fruit it has consumed,
and there was not in it a strong branch,
a scepter for ruling.’”
This is a lament, and it will be used as a lament.

firstLine: God’s Dealings with Israel for His Name’s Sake
rest: And then in the seventh year, in the fifth month, on the tenth day of the month, men from the elders of Israel came to consult Yahweh, and they sat before me.

firstLine: A Vision of the Avenging Sword of Yahweh
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,
