rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: Oholah and Oholibah as Symbols of God’s Corrupt People
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: The Boiling Pot and the Death of Ezekiel’s Wife
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me in the ninth year, in the tenth month, on the tenth day of the month, saying,

firstLine: Judgment upon Various Gentile Nations
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: Ezekiel Prophesies Against Tyre
rest: And it was in the eleventh year, on the first day of the month, the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: And they will raise a lament over you, and they will say to you,
rest:
‘How you have been lost who was inhabited from the seas;
the city that was praised, that was strong.
It is located on the sea,
and its inhabitants imposed their terror on all of its inhabitants.

firstLine: Now the coastlands will tremble
rest:
at the day of your downfall,
and the islands that are in the sea
will be horrified because of your departure.’”

firstLine: A Lament for Doomed Tyre
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: In the heart of the seas are your boundaries;
rest: your builders perfected your beauty.

firstLine: They built with pine trees from Senir
They made your oars
Your sail was fine linen with colorful weaving from Egypt
The inhabitants of Sidon and Arvan
The elders of Gebal and its skilled men were among you
Persia and Lud and Put
The people of Arvan and Helech
rest:
were on your walls all around,
and Gammadites
were in your towers.
They hung their quivers on your walls all around;
they perfected your beauty.

firstLine: “‘Into many waters
Your wealth and your merchandise, your wares,
rest:
your mariners, and your seamen,
your shipwrights and the barterers of your wares
and all of your soldiers who are in you,
along with all of your crew who are in the midst of you,
they will fall in the heart of the seas on the day of your downfall.

firstLine: At the sound of the shout of your seamen,
rest: the pasturelands will shake.

firstLine: And they will go down from their ships,
rest:
all of those holding an oar,
mariners, all of the seamen of the sea
will stand on the land,

firstLine: and they will lament over you with their voice,
rest:
and they will cry out bitterly,
and they will throw dust on their heads,
and they will roll in the dust.

firstLine: They will shave themselves bald for your sake,
rest:
and they will dress themselves in sackcloth,
and they will weep over you with a bitterness of soul
and with bitter wailing.

firstLine: And they will raise over you with their wailing a lament,
rest:
and they will chant a lament over you:
‘Who is like Tyre,
like this destruction in the midst of the sea?’

firstLine: When your merchandise went out from the seas,
rest:
you satisfied many peoples with the abundance of your wealth,
and by your wares
you made rich the kings of the world.

firstLine: Now you are broken by seas
All of the inhabitants of the coastlands
The traders among the peoples hiss over you;
rest:
you have become a horror,
and you shall be no more forever!’”

firstLine: A Prophecy Aimed at the King of Tyre
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: “Son of man, say to the leader of Tyre, ‘Thus says the Lord Yahweh:
rest:
“Because your heart was haughty,
and you said, ‘I am a god;
I sit in the seat of the gods,
I sit in the heart of the seas!’
But you are a human, not a god,
and you gave your heart to be like the heart of a god.

firstLine: Look, are you wiser than Daniel,
rest: so that no secret is hidden from you?

firstLine: By your wisdom and by your understanding
rest:
you have gained for yourself wealth,
and you have amassed gold and silver
in your treasuries.

firstLine: By the abundance of your wisdom in your trading
rest:
you have increased your wealth
and your heart was proud in your wealth.”’”

firstLine: Therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh:
rest:
“Because of your regarding your mind
like the mind of a god,

firstLine: They will thrust you down to the pit,
rest:
and you will die a violent death
in the heart of the seas.

firstLine: You will die the death of the uncircumcised
rest:
by the hand of strangers,
for I myself have spoken!” declares the Lord Yahweh.

firstLine: “Son of man, raise a lament over the king of Tyre, and you must say to him, ‘thus says the Lord Yahweh:
rest:
“You were a perfect model of an example,
full of wisdom and perfect of beauty.

firstLine: You were in Eden, the garden of God,
rest:
and every precious stone was your adornment:
carnelian, topaz and moonstone,
turquoise, onyx and jasper,
sapphire, malachite and emerald.
And gold was the craftsmanship of your settings
and your mountings in you;
on the day when you were created they were prepared.

firstLine: You were an anointed guardian cherub,
rest:
and I placed you on God’s holy mountain;
you walked in the midst of stones of fire.

firstLine: You were blameless in your ways
rest:
from the day when you were created,
until wickedness was found in you.

firstLine: In the abundance of your trading,
rest:
they filled the midst of you with violence, and you sinned;
and I cast you as a profane thing from the mountain of God,
and I expelled you, the guardian cherub,
from the midst of the stones of fire.

firstLine: Your heart was proud because of your beauty;
From the abundance of your iniquities
rest:
in the dishonesty of your trading,
I profaned your sanctuaries
and I brought fire from your midst;
it consumed you, and I have turned you to ashes on the earth
before the eyes of everyone who sees you.

firstLine: All who know you among the peoples
and you must say, ‘Thus says the Lord Yahweh:
rest:
“Look! I am against you, Sidon,
and I display my glory in the midst of you,
and they will know that I am Yahweh
when I execute my judgments,
and I will show myself holy within it.

firstLine: And I will send into it a plague,
rest:
and blood will be in its streets.
And the dead will fall in the midst of her
by the sword that is against it from all around;
and they will know that I am Yahweh.

firstLine: Yahweh’s Judgment upon Egypt
rest: In the tenth year, in the tenth month, on the twelfth day of the month, the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: Speak, and you must say, ‘thus says the Lord Yahweh:
rest:
“Look! I am against you,
Pharaoh, king of Egypt,
the great sea monster,
the one lying down
in the midst of his Nile streams,
who says to me, “It is my Nile, and I made it for myself.”

firstLine: And so I will put hooks in your jawbones,
rest:
and I will make the fish of your Nile streams stick to your scales,
and I will bring you up from the midst of your Nile streams,
and all of the fish of your Nile streams which cling to your scales.

firstLine: And I will fling you to the desert,
rest:
you and all the fish of your Nile streams.
On the surface of the field you will fall;
you will not be gathered,
and you will not be assembled.
To the animals of the field
and to the birds of the heavens
I will give you as food.

firstLine: And all of the inhabitants of Egypt will know that I am Yahweh,
rest: because of their being a staff of reed for the house of Israel.

firstLine: When they took hold of you with the hand, you snapped,
rest:
and you split their every shoulder.
And when they leaned on you, you broke,
and you caused all of their loins to wobble.”

firstLine: A Lament over the Nation and Land of Egypt
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: “Son of man, prophesy, and you must say, ‘thus says the Lord Yahweh:
rest: “Wail, alas! For the day!

firstLine: For a day is near;
rest:
indeed, a day is near for Yahweh.
A day of cloud,
a time of the nations it will be.

firstLine: And a sword will come in Egypt,
rest:
and anguish will be in Cush,
at the falling of the slain in Egypt.
And they will take its wealth,
and its foundation will be demolished.

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh:
rest:
“And the supporters of Egypt will fall,
and the majesty of its strength will go down
from Migdol to Syene;
by the sword they will fall in it,”
declares the Lord Yahweh.

firstLine: “And they will be desolate in the midst of desolate countries,
rest: and its cities will be in the midst of ruined cities.

firstLine: And they will know that I am Yahweh
rest:
when I put my fire in Egypt,
and all of its helpers are broken.

firstLine: Thus says the Lord Yahweh:
rest:
“And I will put an end to the crowds of Egypt
by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon.

firstLine: He and his people with him, the most ruthless of nations,
rest:
will be brought to destroy the land.
And they will draw their swords against Egypt,
and they will fill the land with the slain,

firstLine: and I will make the Nile streams dry land,
rest:
and I will sell the land into the hand of bad people,
and I will lay waste the land and its fullness
by the hand of strangers.
I, Yahweh, I have spoken.”

firstLine: Thus says the Lord Yahweh:
rest:
“And I will destroy the idols,
and I will put an end to the worthless idols from Memphis.
And there will no longer be a prince from the land of Egypt,
and I will put fear in the land of Egypt.

firstLine: And I will lay waste Pathros,
rest:
and I will set fire in Zoan,
and I will execute judgments in No.

firstLine: I will pour out my rage over Sin,
rest:
the stronghold of Egypt,
and I will cut off the crowd of No.

firstLine: And I will set fire in Egypt,
rest:
certainly Sin will writhe,
and No will be breached,
and Memphis will face enemies daily.

firstLine: The young men of On and Pi Beseth will fall by the sword,
rest: and they will go into captivity.

firstLine: And at Tahpanhes the day will become dark
rest:
when I break the yoke of Egypt,
and in it the majesty of its strength
will come to an end.
A cloud will cover it,
and its daughters will go into captivity.

firstLine: And I will execute judgments in Egypt,
rest: and they will know that I am Yahweh.”

firstLine: Pharaoh Is Warned Through Assyria’s Destruction
rest: And then in the eleventh year, in the third month, on the first day of the month, the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: “Son of man, say to Pharaoh, the king of Egypt, and to his crowd,
rest: ‘To whom are you like in your greatness?

firstLine: Waters made it great,
rest:
the deep made it grow high;
its rivers were going all around its planting area,
and its channels it sent out
to all of the trees of the field.

firstLine: Therefore it became tall,
rest:
with its height more than all of the trees of the field,
and its branches became numerous,
and its branches became long
from its sending its shoots from abundant water.

firstLine: In its branches all the birds of the heaven made their nest,
rest:
and under its branches all the animals of the field gave birth,
and in its shadow all the many nations lived.

firstLine: And it was beautiful in its greatness,
rest:
in the length of its branches,
for its root was toward much water.

firstLine: Cedars in the garden of God
I made it beautiful with the abundance of its branches,
rest: and all of the trees of Eden that were in the garden of God envied it.’”

firstLine: A Lament for Pharaoh, King of Egypt
rest: And then in the twelfth year, in the twelfth month, on the first day of the month, the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: “Son of man, raise a lament over Pharaoh, the king of Egypt, and you must say to him,
rest:
‘With a fierce, strong lion among nations you compared yourself,
and you are like the sea monster in the seas,
and you thrash about in your rivers,
and you make water turbid with your feet,
and you make your rivers muddy.

firstLine: Thus says the Lord Yahweh:
rest:
Now I will spread my net over you
in the assembly of many peoples,
and I will bring you up in my dragnet.

firstLine: And I will throw you on the ground;
rest:
on the surface of the open field I will hurl you,
and I will cause every bird of the heaven to dwell on you,
and I will satisfy the animals of all of the world from you.

firstLine: And I will put your flesh on the mountains,
rest: and I will fill the valleys with your carcass.

firstLine: And I will water the land with your discharge from your blood
rest:
on the mountains,
and valleys will be filled from you.

firstLine: And I will cover you at extinguishing your heavens,
rest:
and I will make dark their stars,
and I will cover the sun with the cloud,
and the moon will not give its light.

firstLine: All sources of light in the heavens,
rest:
I will make them dark over you,
and I will put darkness on your land,’”
declares the Lord Yahweh.

firstLine: “And I will disturb the hearts of many peoples
rest:
at my bringing about your captivity among the nations,
to countries that you do not know.

firstLine: And I will cause many peoples to be awestruck over you,
rest:
and their kings will shudder over you in horror,
at my brandishing my sword before their faces,
and they will tremble continually,
each person for his life,
on the day of your downfall.”

firstLine: For thus says the Lord Yahweh:
rest:
“The sword of the king of Babylon,
it will come to you.

firstLine: By the swords of warriors I will cause to fall your hordes
rest:
by the most ruthless of the nations, all of them,
and they will devastate the majesty of Egypt,
and all of its hordes will be destroyed.

firstLine: And I will destroy all her domestic livestock
rest:
beside many waters.
The feet of humans will not make them turbid again,
and the hooves of domestic livestock will not make them turbid.

firstLine: Then I will make their waters settle,
rest:
and their rivers as the olive oil I will let flow,”
declares the Lord Yahweh.

firstLine: “Then I make the land of Egypt a desolation,
rest:
so that the land will be stripped from its fullness
when I strike all of those dwelling in it,
and they will know that I am Yahweh.

firstLine: Ezekiel Appointed as a Watchman and His Responsibility
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: Prophecy Concerning Israel’s Shepherds and Sheep
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: Prophecy Directed at Edom
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: Prophecy to the Mountains of Israel and of Israel’s Restoration
rest: “And you, son of man, prophesy to the mountains of Israel; and so you must say, ‘Mountains of Israel, hear the word of Yahweh;

firstLine: A Valley of Dried Bones; A Renewed Nation of Israel
rest: The hand of Yahweh was upon me, and he brought me by the Spirit of Yahweh, and he let me rest in the midst of the valley, and it was full of bones.

firstLine: God’s Message to Gog
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: God’s Destruction of Gog and His Hordes
rest: “And you, son of man, prophesy against Gog, and you must say, ‘Thus says the Lord Yahweh: “Look! I am against you Gog, the head leader of Meshech and Tubal,

firstLine: A Vision of the New Temple
rest: In the twenty-fifth year of our exile, at the beginning of the year, on the tenth day of the month, in the fourteenth year after the city was destroyed, in this day exactly, the hand of Yahweh was on me, and he brought me there

firstLine: The Eastern Gate
rest: And there was a wall on the outside of the temple all the way around it, and in the hand of the man the reed for measurement was six long cubits, according to the cubit and a handbreadth, and he measured the width of the outer wall as one reed, and the height as one reed.

firstLine: The Outer Courtyard
rest: And he brought me to the outer courtyard, and there were chambers and a pavement made for the courtyard all around it, and thirty chambers were facing to the pavement.

firstLine: Measurement of the North Gate
rest: And as for the gate that had its face toward the north of the outer courtyard, he measured its length and its width.

firstLine: The Gate to the South
rest: And then he took me toward the south, and look, a gate toward the south, and he measured its pilasters and its porticos; they had measurements just like the others.

firstLine: Gates to the Inner Courtyard
rest: And he brought me to the inner courtyard through the gate of the south, and he measured the south gate, and it had measurements like the others.

firstLine: Rooms for Sacrificial Preparations
rest: And a chamber with its doorway was in the pilasters at the gates, and there they rinsed off the burnt offering.

firstLine: Rooms for Priests and Other Worship Leaders
rest: And on the outside of the inner gate, there were chambers for singers in the inner courtyard, which was to the side of the north gate, and their faces were to the south with respect to one, and on the side of the east gate one facing to the north.

firstLine: Inner Courtyard and Temple Measurements
rest: And he measured the courtyard as to its length, a hundred cubits, and a hundred cubits wide, squared, and the altar is in front of the temple.

firstLine: Sanctuary and Temple
rest: And he brought me to the temple sanctuary, and he measured the pilasters, six cubits wide on each side; this was the width of the tent.

firstLine: Description of Rooms for the Priests
rest: And he brought me out to the outer courtyard to the north, and he brought me to the chamber which was opposite the courtyard and which is opposite the building to the north.

firstLine: Return of the Lord’s Glory and Description of Sacrifices and Worship
rest: And he brought me to the gate which was facing east.

firstLine: The Prince, the Levites, and the Priests Described
rest: And he brought me back by the way of the outer gate of the sanctuary that is facing east, and it was shut.

firstLine: Instructions about Divisions of the Renewed Land
rest: And when you allocate the land as an inheritance, you shall provide a contribution for Yahweh as a holy portion from the land, its length being twenty-five thousand cubits and its width ten thousand cubits; it is holy in all its territory, all around.

firstLine: River of the Temple, Division of the Land and Its Boundaries
rest: And he brought me back to the doorway of the temple and, look! There was water coming out from under the threshold of the temple eastward, because the face of the temple was eastwards; and the water was coming down from under the south side of the temple, from south of the altar.

firstLine: The Allotment of the Land and the Gates of the City
rest: And these are the names of the tribes: At the end of the north, along the way to Hethlon from Lebo-hamath to Hazar Enan on the boundary of Damascus beside Hamath northward, there will be one portion for Dan from the eastern border to the west.

firstLine: Daniel’s Development in the King’s Court
rest: In the third year of the reign of Jehoiakim king of Judah, Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon came to Jerusalem and besieged it.

firstLine: Daniel’s Resolve
rest: Now Daniel resolved that he would not defile himself with the fine food of the king, and with the wine that he drank, and so he requested from the commander of the court officials permission so that he would not defile himself.

firstLine: The King’s Troubling Dream
rest: Now in the second year of the reign of Nebuchadnezzar, Nebuchadnezzar dreamed dreams; and his spirit was troubled and his sleep left him.

firstLine: Daniel said:
rest:
“Let his name, the name of God, be blessed throughout the ages,
for the wisdom and the power are his.

firstLine: And he changes the times and the seasons,
He reveals the deep and the hidden things;
rest:
he knows what is in the darkness,
and the light dwells with him.

firstLine: To you, O God of my ancestors,
rest:
I give thanks and I give praises,
for the wisdom and the power you gave to me,
and now you have made known to me
what we have asked from you,
for you have made known to us the matter of the king.”

firstLine: Daniel Praises God and Interprets the King’s Dream
rest: Therefore Daniel went to Arioch, whom the king had appointed to destroy the wise men of Babylon; he went and thus he said to him: “You must not destroy the wise men of Babylon; take me in before the king and I will give the explanation to the king.”

firstLine: The King’s Response to Daniel and His God
rest: Then the king, Nebuchadnezzar, fell on his face and he paid homage to Daniel; and he commanded them to offer a grain offering and incense offering to him.

firstLine: The Faithfulness of Three Young Israelites and God’s Deliverance
rest: Nebuchadnezzar the king made a statue of gold. Its height was sixty cubits and its width was six cubits; he set it up in the valley of Dura in the province of Babylon.

firstLine: The Wrath of the King and His Fiery Furnace of Death
rest: Then Nebuchadnezzar was filled with anger and the image of his face was changed toward Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego, so he ordered and said to heat up the one furnace seven times what was usual to heat it up.

firstLine: The King’s Praise for the Great Deliverance of the Three Young Israelites
rest: Nebuchadnezzar responded, saying, “Blessed be their God, the God of Shadrach, Meshach and Abednego, who sent his angel and rescued his servants who trusted in him, and the command of the king they disobeyed, and they gave their bodies so that they did not serve and did not worship any god except their God.

firstLine: Nebuchadnezzar Declares What the Most High God Has Done for Him
rest: Nebuchadnezzar the king to all of the nations, the peoples and languages that live in the whole earth: “May your prosperity increase!

firstLine: The Dream and the King’s Search for an Interpreter
rest: “I, Nebuchadnezzar, was content in my house and prospering in my palace.

firstLine: The tree grew and it became strong,
rest:
and its height reached to heaven,
and it was visible to the end of the whole earth.

firstLine: Its foliage was beautiful,
rest:
and its fruit abundant,
and in it was provision for all.
Under it the animals of the field sought shade,
and in its branches the birds of heaven nested,
and from it all the living beings were fed.

firstLine: He cried aloud and so he said:
rest:
“Cut down the tree and chop off its branches;
shake off its foliage and scatter its fruit.
Let the animals flee from under it,
and the birds from its branches.

firstLine: But the stump of its roots
rest:
leave in the earth,
along with a band of iron and bronze;
leave it in the grass of the field.
And in the dew of heaven
let it be watered,
and with the animals
let his lot be in the grass of the earth.

firstLine: Let his mind be changed from that of a human,
rest:
and let the mind of an animal be given to him,
and let seven times pass over him.

firstLine: The sentence is by the decree of the watchers,
rest:
and the decision by the command of the holy ones,
in order that the living will know
that the Most High is sovereign over the kingdom of humankind,
and to whomever he wills he gives it,
and he even sets the humblest of men over it.”

firstLine: Daniel Relates and Interprets the Dream
rest: “Then Daniel, whose name was Belteshazzar, was distressed for some time, and his thoughts disturbed him. The king answered and he said, ‘Belteshazzar, let the dream and its explanation not disturb you.’ Belteshazzar answered and said, ‘My lord, may the dream and its explanation be for those who hate you and for your enemies.

firstLine: God Judges the King for His Hubris
rest: All this happened to Nebuchadnezzar the king.

firstLine: The King Praises and Extols the Most High God
rest:
“But at the end of that period, I, Nebuchadnezzar, lifted up my eyes to heaven, and then my reason returned to me; and I blessed the Most High and the one who lives forever I praised and I honored.
“For his sovereignty is an everlasting sovereignty,
and his kingdom continues from generation to generation.

firstLine: And all the dwellers of the earth
rest:
are regarded as nothing,
and he does according to his desire
in the host of heaven and among the dwellers of earth,
and there is not one who can hold back his hand,
or ask him, ‘What are you doing?’

firstLine: The Mysterious Writing on the Wall
rest: Belshazzar the king made a great festival for a thousand of his lords, and in the presence of the thousand lords he was drinking wine.

firstLine: Daniel Deciphers and Interprets the Writing
rest: Then Daniel was brought in before the king, and the king spoke and said to Daniel, “You are Daniel who are one of the exiles of Judah whom my predecessor, the king, brought from Judah.

firstLine: Daniel’s Integrity and His Entrapment by His Enemies
rest: It pleased Darius, and he set up one hundred and twenty satraps over the kingdom, that they were throughout the whole kingdom,

firstLine: God’s Miraculous Deliverance of Daniel Again
rest: Then they responded and said before the king, “Daniel, who is from the exiles of Judah, is not paying any attention to you, O king, or to the decree that you have signed, and three times daily he says his prayer.”

firstLine: The King Praises the God of Daniel and Daniel Prospers
rest: Then Darius the king wrote to all the people, the nations, and the languages living in the whole earth, “May your prosperity become great!

firstLine: Daniel’s Vision of Four Beasts and the Son of Man
rest: In the first year of Belshazzar the king of Babylon, Daniel saw a dream and visions of his head as he lay on his bed; then he wrote down the dream and the summary of the words as follows:

firstLine: Daniel Explains and Interprets the Vision
rest: “As for me, Daniel, my spirit was troubled within me, and the visions of my head terrified me.

firstLine: The Vision of a Small Horn that Oppresses Israel and Threatens the Temple
rest: In the third year of the kingdom of Belshazzar the king, a vision appeared to me, Daniel, after the one that appeared to me previously.

firstLine: Gabriel Gives Angelic Help and Interprets the Vision
rest: And then when I, Daniel, saw the vision, and I was seeking understanding, there was one standing before me with the appearance of a man.

firstLine: Daniel’s Prayer for His People
rest: In the first year of Darius, the son of Ahasuerus, from the offspring of the Medes, who became king over the kingdom of the Chaldeans—

firstLine: Gabriel’s Announcement and Presentation of the Seventy Sets of Seven
rest: Now I was still speaking and praying, and confessing my sin and the sin of my people Israel, and presenting my plea before Yahweh my God, on behalf of the holy mountain of my God.

firstLine: The Seventy Sets of Seven Detailed
rest: “Seventy weeks is decreed for your people and for your holy city, to put an end to the transgression and to seal up sin and to make atonement for guilt and to bring in everlasting righteousness and to seal vision and prophet and to anoint the most holy place.

firstLine: Daniel’s Vision of a Dazzling Heavenly Messenger
rest: In the third year of Cyrus the king of the Persians, a word was revealed to Daniel, who was called by his name Belteshazzar, and the word was reliable and it concerned a great tribulation, and he understood the word and he received understanding.

firstLine: A Survey of the Kings of the North and South
rest: “And I, in the first year of Darius the Mede, I stood as a support and as a protection for him.

firstLine: The Time of the Judgment and the Resurrection of Two Groups
rest: “Now at that time, Michael, the great prince, will arise, the protector over the sons of your people, and it will be a time of distress that has not been since your people have been a nation until that time. And at that time your people will escape, everyone who is found written in the scroll.

firstLine: Daniel Seeks Additional Insights
rest: Now I myself heard, but I did not understand, and I said, “My lord, what will be the outcome of these things?”

firstLine: God Commands Hosea to Start a Family
rest: The word of Yahweh that came to Hosea son of Beeri, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, the kings of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash, king of Israel.

firstLine: At the beginning when Yahweh spoke through Hosea,
rest:
Yahweh said to Hosea,
“Go, take for yourself a wife and children of whoredom,
because the land commits great whoredom
forsaking Yahweh.”

firstLine: So he went and took Gomer daughter of Diblaim,
rest: and she conceived and bore him a son.

firstLine: And Yahweh said to him,
On that day
rest:
I will break the bow of Israel
in the Valley of Jezreel.”

firstLine: And she conceived again and bore a daughter, and he said to him,
rest:
“Name her Lo-ruhamah,
for I will no longer have pity
on the house of Israel
or forgive them.

firstLine: But I will have pity on the house of Judah
rest:
and I will save them by Yahweh their God,
and will not deliver them
by bow, sword, war,
horses, or horsemen.

firstLine: And he said, “Name him Lo-ammi,
rest:
for you are not my people
and I am not your God.

firstLine: The number of the children of Israel
rest:
will be like the sand of the sea
that cannot be measured or counted;
and in the place where it is said to them,
“You are not my people,”
it will be said to them,
“Children of the living God.”

firstLine: Then the children of Judah
rest:
and Israel will be gathered together,
and they will appoint for themselves
one head;
and they will take possession of the land,
for great is the day of Jezreel.

firstLine: The Unfaithful Wife
rest:
Say to your brother, “Ammi,”
and to your sister, “Ruhamah.”

firstLine: Plead with your mother, plead—
rest:
because she is not my wife,
and I am not her husband.
Let her put away her whoring from before her,
and her adultery from between her breasts.

firstLine: Lest I strip her naked
And I will not have pity on her children,
rest: because they are children of whoredom.

firstLine: Because their mother was unfaithful;
rest:
she who conceived them has acted shamefully,
for she said:
“I will go after my lovers,
the ones who give me my bread, my water,
my wool, and my flax,
my oil, and my drink.”

firstLine: Then she will pursue her lovers,
But she did not know
rest:
that it was I who gave her
grain, new wine, and oil,
and who gave her silver in abundance,
and gold which they made into a Baal.

firstLine: Therefore I will take again
rest:
my grain in its time,
and my wine in its season;
and I will take away my wool and my flax,
which were to cover her nakedness.

firstLine: And now I will uncover her nakedness
rest:
before the eyes of her lovers,
and no one will rescue her from my hand.

firstLine: And I will put an end to all her mirth,
rest:
her festivals, her new moons, and her Sabbaths,
and all her appointed festivals;

firstLine: and I will lay waste to her vines and her fig trees,
rest:
of which she said,
“They are my payment for prostitution,
which my lovers gave to me.”
I will make them a forest,
and the wild animals of the field will devour them.

firstLine: I will punish her for the days of the Baals,
rest:
to whom she burns incense,
and she decked herself with her ornamental ring and jewelry,
and she went after her lovers, and forgot me
—a declaration of Yahweh.

firstLine: From there I will give her
rest:
her vineyards,
and the Valley of Achor as a doorway of hope.
And there she will respond,
as in the days of her youth,
just as in the day of her coming out of
the land of Egypt.

firstLine: And on that day—
rest:
a declaration of Yahweh—
you will call me, “My husband;”
you will no longer call me, “My Baal.”

firstLine: I will remove the names
rest:
of the Baals from her mouth,
and they will no longer be mentioned by their name.

firstLine: I will make a covenant for them on that day,
rest:
with the animals of the field,
with the birds of the heaven, and
with the creeping things of the ground;
the bow, the sword, and the war I will abolish from the land, and I will let them lie down in safety.

firstLine: And I will take you as my wife forever;
rest:
I will take you as a wife for myself in righteousness and in justice,
in steadfast love and in mercy.

firstLine: I will take you as my wife in faithfulness,
rest: and you will know Yahweh.

firstLine: On that day I will answer, declares Yahweh,
rest:
I will answer the heavens,
and they will answer the earth.

firstLine: And the earth will answer
rest:
the grain, the wine, and the oil,
and they will answer Jezreel.

firstLine: I will sow her for myself in the land;
rest:
I will have pity on Lo-ruhama;
I will say to Lo-ammi,
“You are my people,”
and he himself will say, “you are my God.”

firstLine: Another Symbolic Marriage
rest:
And Yahweh said to me again,
“Go, love a woman
who has a lover and is committing adultery,
just like the love of Yahweh for the children of Israel,
but they are turning to other gods
and love raisin cakes.”

firstLine: So I bought her for fifteen shekels of silver
rest: and a homer of barely and a measure of wine.

firstLine: And I said to her,
rest:
“You must remain as mine for many days,
and you will not play the whore;
you will not belong to a man,
and I will belong to you.”

firstLine: The children of Israel will remain for many days
rest:
without a king and prince,
without sacrifice and stone pillar, ephod and teraphim.

firstLine: Afterward the children of Israel will return
rest:
and seek Yahweh their God and David their king.
They will come in fear to Yahweh
and to his goodness at the end of days.

firstLine: Yahweh Has an Indictment
rest:
Hear the word of Yahweh, O children of Israel,
for Yahweh has an indictment against the inhabitants of the land.
There is no faithfulness or loyalty,
there is no knowledge of God in the land.

firstLine: Swearing and lying,
rest:
murdering and stealing,
and adultery break out,
and bloodshed follows bloodshed.

firstLine: Therefore the land mourns,
rest:
and all those living in it languish
with the animals of the field,
and the birds of the heaven,
and even the fish of the sea
are being swept away.

firstLine: Yet, let no one contend,
rest:
and let no one accuse,
for with you, O priest, is my contention.

firstLine: You will stumble by day,
My people are destroyed
rest:
for lack of knowledge;
because you have rejected knowledge,
I reject you from acting as a priest for me.
And since you have forgotten the law of your God,
I will also forget your children.

firstLine: When they became many, their sin increased against me;
rest: they changed their glory into shame.

firstLine: They feed on the sin of my people,
rest: they are greedy for their iniquity.

firstLine: And it will be like people, like priest;
rest:
I will punish them for their ways,
and I will requite them for their deeds.

firstLine: They will eat and not be satisfied;
rest:
they will play the whore and not multiply,
because they have forsaken Yahweh to devote themselves to

firstLine: My people,
rest:
consult their wooden idols,
and their divining rod gives them oracles;
because a spirit of whoredom led them astray,
and they played the whore from under their God.

firstLine: On the tops of the mountains they sacrifice,
rest:
and on the hills they make offerings,
under oak, poplar, and terebinth,
because their shade is good.
Therefore your daughters play the whore,
and all your daughters-in-law commit adultery.

firstLine: I will not punish your daughters when they play the whore,
rest:
or your daughters-in-law when they commit adultery;
because they go aside with whores,
and they sacrifice with temple prostitutes,
a people that does not understand comes to ruin.

firstLine: Even though you, O Israel, are playing the whore,
Indeed, like a stubborn heifer,
Ephraim is joined to idols;
rest: let him alone.

firstLine: When their drinking has ended,
rest:
they surely indulge in sexual orgies.
They love lewdness more than their glory.

firstLine: A wind has wrapped them in its wings,
rest: and they will be ashamed because of their altars.

firstLine: The Priests Are a Snare
they dug a deep pit in Shittim,
rest: but I am a punishment for all of them.

firstLine: I myself know Ephraim,
Their deeds do not permit them
rest:
to return them to God.
Because a spirit of whoredom is in their midst,
they do not know Yahweh.

firstLine: The pride of Israel testifies against him,
rest:
and Israel and Ephraim stumble in their guilt,
and Judah stumbles with them.

firstLine: With their flocks and herds they will go
rest:
to seek Yahweh, but they will not find him;
he has withdrawn from them.

firstLine: They have dealt faithlessly with Yahweh
rest:
because they have borne illegitimate children.
Now the new moon will devour them with their fields.

firstLine: Blow the horn in Gibeah,
Ephraim will be a desolation
The princes of Judah have become
Ephraim is oppressed,
rest:
crushed in judgment,
because he was determined
to go after filth.

firstLine: But I am like a maggot to Ephraim
rest: and like rottenness to the house of Judah.

firstLine: And when Ephraim saw his illness,
rest:
and Judah his wound,
Ephraim went to Assyria,
he sent to the great king.
But he was unable to cure you
and heal your wound.

firstLine: Because I will be like a lion to Ephraim
I will return again to my place
A Call to Yahweh
He will revive us after two days;
rest:
on the third day he will raise us up,
that we may live in his presence.

firstLine: Let us know, let us press on to know Yahweh;
rest:
his rising is sure like the dawn.
He will come like the showers to us,
like the spring rain that waters the earth.

firstLine: Therefore, I have hewn them by the prophets;
rest:
I have killed them by the words of my mouth,
and my judgment goes forth like the light.

firstLine: Because I desire steadfast love and not sacrifice,
rest: and knowledge of God rather than burnt offerings.

firstLine: But like Adam, they transgressed the covenant;
rest: there they dealt faithlessly with me.

firstLine: Gilead is a city of evil,
rest: a cunning city because of blood.

firstLine: Like bandits lying in wait,
In the house of Israel I have seen something horrible;
rest:
Ephraim’s unfaithfulness is there.
Israel is defiled.

firstLine: Ephraim’s Guilt
rest:
For you also, O Judah, a harvest is appointed,
when I restore the fortunes of my people,

firstLine: when I would heal Israel,
rest:
and the corruption of Ephraim is revealed,
and the wicked deeds of Samaria;
because they deal in falsehood,
the thief breaks in,
and the bandit raids the outside.

firstLine: But they did not consider
By their wickedness they make the king glad,
rest: and the officials by their treacheries.

firstLine: All of them commit adultery,
rest:
like a burning oven
whose baker has stopped from stirring the fire,
and from kneading the dough until it is leavened.

firstLine: On the day of our king, the princes
rest:
became sick with the heat of wine;
he stretched out his hand with mockers.

firstLine: Because they are kindled like an oven,
All of them are hot as an oven,
Ephraim mixes himself
Foreigners devour his strength,
The pride of Israel testifies against him—
rest:
they do not return to Yahweh their God;
they do not seek him for all of this.

firstLine: Ephraim was like a dove,
Just as they go, I will cast my net
They do not cry out to me from their heart,
And I myself trained
rest:
and strengthened their arms;
but they plan evil against me.

firstLine: They turn, not to the Most High,
rest:
like a slack bow;
their officials will fall by the sword
because of the anger of their tongue.
This is their scorn
in the land of Egypt.

firstLine: Israel Rejects the Good
rest:
Put to your lips the trumpet
like a vulture over the house of Yahweh,
because they have broken my covenant
and rebelled against my law.

firstLine: They cry out to me,
rest: “My God! We, Israel, know you!”

firstLine: Israel has spurned the good;
rest: the enemy will pursue him.

firstLine: They appointed kings, but not through me;
rest:
they made officials, but without my knowledge.
With their silver and gold
they made idols for themselves
for their own destruction.

firstLine: Your calf is rejected, O Samaria;
rest:
my anger burns against them.
How long will they be incapable of innocence?

firstLine: Because it is from Israel,
rest:
an artisan made it,
it is not a god;
for the calf of Samaria
will be broken to pieces.

firstLine: Because they sow the wind,
rest:
they will reap the whirlwind.
The standing grain does not have heads;
it will not yield flour.
And if it would yield,
strangers would devour it.

firstLine: Israel is swallowed up;
rest:
now they are among the nations,
like an object that no one desires.

firstLine: For they have gone up to Assyria,
rest:
a wild donkey alone to itself;
Ephraim has sold itself for lovers.

firstLine: Even though they have sold themselves to the nations,
rest:
now I will gather them.
They will soon writhe
from the burden of kings and princes.

firstLine: When Ephraim multiplied altars
rest:
to expiate sins,
they became to him altars to sin on.

firstLine: I write for him myriads of my instruction;
rest: they are regarded as a strange thing.

firstLine: They offer sacrifices of my choice
Israel has forgotten his maker and built palaces,
Ephraim Faces Punishment
rest:
Do not rejoice, O Israel,
do not exult like the nations!
For you played the whore, departing from your God;
you loved a harlot’s wage
on all the threshing floors of grain.

firstLine: Threshing floor and wine vat will not feed them,
rest: and new wine will fail her.

firstLine: They will not remain
rest:
in the land of Yahweh.
But Ephraim will return to Egypt,
and in Assyria they will eat unclean food.

firstLine: They will not pour drink offerings of wine to Yahweh,
What will you do on the day of the appointed time,
rest: and on the day of the festival of Yahweh?

firstLine: The days of punishment have come;
rest:
the days of retribution have come;
Israel knows!
The prophet is a fool,
the man of the spirit is acting like a madman.
Because of the greatness of your sin,
your hostility is great.

firstLine: The prophet keeps watch over Ephraim for my God;
rest:
the snare of a fowler is on all his ways,
and hostility in the house of his God.

firstLine: They deeply corrupted themselves
Like the grapes in the wilderness,
rest:
I found Israel.
Like early ripened fruit on the fig tree in the first season,
I saw your ancestors.
They themselves came to Baal Peor,
and they consecrated themselves to shame.
And they became detestable things,
like the thing they love.

firstLine: Ephraim’s glory is like a bird;
rest:
it will fly away—
no birth, no pregnancy, and no conception.

firstLine: Even though they bring up their children,
rest:
I will bereave them before maturity.
Woe to them indeed,
when I depart from them!

firstLine: Ephraim, as I see it,
Give them, O Yahweh—
rest:
what will you give them?
Give them a miscarrying womb
and dry breasts.

firstLine: Every evil of theirs began at Gilgal,
Ephraim is stricken,
rest:
their root is dried up,
they shall not bear fruit.
Even if they give birth,
I will kill the cherished offspring of their womb.

firstLine: My God will reject them
rest:
because they did not listen to him,
and they will be wanderers among the nations.

firstLine: Israel Is Punished
rest:
Israel is a luxuriant vine;
he yields fruit for himself.
The more his fruit increased,
the more he made numerous altars.
The more his land prospered,
the more he improved his stone pillars.

firstLine: Their heart is false;
For now they will say,
They utter words of vain oaths
rest:
when making covenants,
and judgment blossoms like a poisonous plant
on the furrows of the field.

firstLine: The inhabitants of Samaria tremble
rest:
for the calf of Beth-aven.
Indeed, his people will mourn for it,
and his idolatrous priests will wail over it—
over its glory because it has departed from it.

firstLine: It will also be brought to Assyria,
rest:
as tribute to the great king.
Ephraim will obtain disgrace
and Israel will be ashamed from his advice.

firstLine: Samaria will be destroyed;
rest: her king is like a chip on the surface of the water.

firstLine: The high places of Aven,
rest:
the sin of Israel, will be destroyed.
Thorn and thistle will grow
on their altars.
They will say to the mountains, “Cover us,”
and to the hills, “Fall on us.”

firstLine: From the days of Gibeah you have sinned, O Israel;
rest:
there they have remained.
Will not war in Gibeah overtake them
against the children of evil?

firstLine: In my desire I will punish them;
rest:
nations will be gathered against them
when they are punished for their double iniquities.

firstLine: Ephraim was a trained heifer,
rest:
that loved to thresh grain,
and I myself spared
the fairness of her neck;
I will make Ephraim break the ground,
Judah will plow,
Jacob must till for himself.

firstLine: Sow for yourselves righteousness;
rest:
reap loyal love.
Break up for yourself fallow ground;
it is time to seek Yahweh
so he will come and rain
righteousness upon you.

firstLine: You have plowed wickedness,
rest:
you have reaped injustice,
you have eaten the fruit of lies,
because you have trusted in your strength,
in the multitude of your warriors.

firstLine: The tumult of war will rise up against your people,
rest:
and all your fortresses will be destroyed,
as Shalman destroyed Beth-arbel;
on the day of war
mothers were dashed to pieces with their children.

firstLine: So it will be done to you, O Bethel,
God Will Have Compassion
rest:
When Israel was a child, I loved him,
and out of Egypt I called my son.

firstLine: And I myself taught Ephraim to walk;
rest:
I took them in my arms,
but they did not know that I healed them.

firstLine: I drew them with human ties,
rest:
with the bands of love.
I was to them like one who lifted up a yoke on their jaws,
though I bent down to them and let them eat.

firstLine: He will return to the land of Egypt,
rest:
and Assyria will be his king,
because they refused to return.

firstLine: The sword rages in his cities;
rest:
it consumes his false prophets
and devours because of their plans.

firstLine: I will not execute my fierce anger,
They will go after Yahweh;
rest:
he roars like a lion.
When he roars,
his children will come trembling
from the sea.

firstLine: They will tremble like birds from Egypt,
Israel’s History
rest:
Ephraim has surrounded me with lies,
and the house of Israel with deceit;
and Judah is still wandering with God
and is faithful to the Holy One.

firstLine: Ephraim herds the wind
rest:
and is pursuing the east wind all day long;
he multiplies deception and violence
and he makes a treaty with Assyria,
and oil is brought to Egypt.

firstLine: Yahweh has a quarrel with Judah
rest:
and will punish Jacob according to his ways
and repay him according to his deeds.

firstLine: In the womb he deceived his brother,
rest: and in his manhood he struggled with God.

firstLine: He struggled with the angel and prevailed;
rest:
he pleaded for his mercy.
He met him at Bethel,
and there he spoke with him.

firstLine: Yahweh the God of hosts,
rest: Yahweh is his renowned name!

firstLine: But you, you must return to your God;
rest:
keep love and justice,
and wait continually for your God.

firstLine: The trader, in his hand are scales of deceit;
rest: he loves to oppress.

firstLine: And Ephraim said, “Surely, I am rich,
But I am Yahweh your God
I spoke to the prophets;
rest:
I myself multiplied revelations
and through the hand of the prophets I will destroy.

firstLine: If in Gilead there is evil,
rest:
surely they will come to nothing.
In Gilgal they sacrifice bulls,
also their altars will be like stone heaps
on furrows of the field.

firstLine: Jacob fled to the open field of Aram,
rest:
and Israel served for a wife,
and for a wife he watched over sheep.

firstLine: And by a prophet Yahweh brought
rest:
Israel up from Egypt,
and by a prophet
he was watched over.

firstLine: Ephraim has caused bitter provocation,
rest:
and his Lord will hold him responsible for his crimes
and pay back to him his insults.

firstLine: Yahweh’s Judgment on Idolatrous Israel
And now they sin again,
rest:
and they make for themselves a molten idol,
idols from their silver metal according to their understanding,
all of them the work of skilled craftsmen.
To these they say, “Sacrifice!”
People are kissing bull calves.

firstLine: Therefore, they will be like the morning cloud,
rest:
and like the dew of early morning going away,
like chaff swirling from the threshing floor,
or like smoke from a window.

firstLine: I am Yahweh your God
I fed you in the desert,
rest: in the land of drought.

firstLine: When I fed them, they were satisfied;
rest:
they were satisfied and their heart was lifted up;
therefore they forgot me.

firstLine: And I will be like a lion to them;
rest: I lie in wait beside the way, like a leopard.

firstLine: I will attack them like a bear robbed of her offspring,
I will destroy you, O Israel;
rest: who will help you?

firstLine: I gave you a king in my anger,
rest: and I took him in my wrath.

firstLine: The sin of Ephraim is wrapped up;
rest: his sin is concealed.

firstLine: The labor pains of childbirth come for him;
rest:
he is an unwise son
because at the proper time, he does not present himself
at the mouth of the womb.

firstLine: Although he may flourish among reeds,
rest:
the east wind will come, a wind of Yahweh
rising from the desert;
his fountain will dry up,
his spring will be parched.
It will plunder his treasury,
every object of desire.

firstLine: Samaria will be guilty,
rest:
because she has rebelled against her God;
they will fall by the sword,
their children will be dashed to pieces,
and their pregnant women will be ripped open.

firstLine: Return to Yahweh
rest:
Return to Yahweh your God, O Israel,
for you have stumbled because of your sin.

firstLine: Take words with you,
rest:
and return to Yahweh.
Say to him,
“Take away all guilt;
accept good, and we will offer
the fruit of our lips.

firstLine: Assyria will not save us;
rest:
we will not ride on horses,
and we will say no more, “Our God,”
to the work of our hands
because in you the fatherless child finds mercy.

firstLine: I will heal their disloyalty;
rest:
I will love them freely
because my anger has turned back
from them.

firstLine: I will be like the dew to Israel;
rest:
he will blossom like the lily plant,
and he will strike his roots like the trees of Lebanon.

firstLine: His new plant shoots will spread out;
rest:
his splendor will be like the olive tree,
and his scent like the trees of Lebanon.

firstLine: They will again dwell in my shadow;
A Lament Over the Land
rest:
Hear this, O elders,
and give ear, all the inhabitants of the land.
Has this happened in your days?
Or the days of your ancestors?

firstLine: Tell it to your children,
rest:
and your children to their children,
and their children to the following generation.

firstLine: What the cutting locust left,
rest:
the swarming locust has eaten.
What the swarming locust left,
the hopping locust has eaten.
And what the hopping locust left,
the destroying locust has eaten.

firstLine: Because a nation has invaded my land,
rest:
strong and beyond counting.
Its teeth are the teeth of a lion,
and its fangs are those of a lioness.

firstLine: It has made my vine a desolation,
Lament like a virgin girded in sackcloth
rest: for the husband of her youth.

firstLine: The offering and libation are withheld
rest:
from the house of Yahweh.
The priests mourn,
the ministers of Yahweh.

firstLine: The field is destroyed;
rest:
the earth mourns
because the grain is destroyed,
the new wine dries up,
the olive oil languishes.

firstLine: Be ashamed, farmers;
rest:
Wail, vinedressers,
over the wheat and over the barley,
because the harvest of the field is ruined.

firstLine: The vine withers
rest:
and the fig tree droops.
The pomegranate tree, and also the palm tree, the apple tree
—all the trees of the field—are dried up.
Indeed, joy is dried up
among the sons of men.

firstLine: Is not food cut off
The seeds shrivel under their clods;
rest:
the storehouses are desolate.
The grain storage places are destroyed
because grain has dried out.

firstLine: How the beasts groan;
To you, O Yahweh, I cry out,
rest:
because fire has devoured
the pastures of the desert,
and flames burned
all the trees of the field.

firstLine: Also, the beasts of the field
rest:
long for you,
because the courses of water
are dried up,
and fire has devoured
the pastures of the desert.

firstLine: The Day of Yahweh is Near
rest:
Blow the trumpet in Zion,
and sound the alarm on my holy mountain!
Let all the inhabitants of the land tremble,
for the day of Yahweh is coming
—it is indeed near.

firstLine: A day of darkness and gloom,
rest:
a day of cloud and thick darkness,
like the dawn spreads on the mountains,
a great and strong army!
There has been nothing like it from old,
and after it nothing will be again for generations to come.

firstLine: Before them a fire devours,
rest:
and behind them a flame burns.
Like the garden of Eden is the land before them,
and after them it is like a desolate desert,
and nothing can escape them.

firstLine: Like the appearance of horses is their appearance,
rest: and like horsemen they run;

firstLine: like the sound of chariots on the tops of the mountains, they leap about;
rest:
like the sound of a flame of fire
devouring stubble;
like a strong army arranged
in rows for battle.

firstLine: From before them nations writhe,
rest: all faces turn pale.

firstLine: They run like mighty warriors,
They do not jostle one another;
In the city they rush forth;
rest:
on the walls they run.
Into the houses they climb up;
through the windows
they enter like a thief.

firstLine: Before them the earth quakes;
And Yahweh utters his voice before his army,
rest:
because his encampment is very large;
strong is the one who carries out his decree,
for great is the day of Yahweh
and exceedingly fearful.
Who can endure it?

firstLine: A Call to Repentance
rest:
“And even now,” declares Yahweh,
“return to me with all your heart,
with fasting, and weeping, and wailing.”

firstLine: Rend your hearts and not your garments,
rest:
and return to Yahweh your God,
because he is gracious and compassionate,
slow to anger and great in loyal love,
and relenting from harm.

firstLine: Who knows whether he will turn and relent,
rest:
and leave a blessing behind him,
an offering and a libation,
for Yahweh your God?

firstLine: Blow the trumpet in Zion,
rest: sanctify a fast, call an assembly;

firstLine: gather the people, consecrate the assembly;
Between the colonnade and the altar,
rest:
let the priests, the ministers of Yahweh, weep.
And let them say, “Take pity, Yahweh, on your people.
Do not make your inheritance a reproach,
a byword among the nations.
Why should they say among the nations,
‘Where is their God?’”

firstLine: The Response and Promise of Yahweh
rest:
Then Yahweh became jealous for his land
and took pity on his people.

firstLine: And Yahweh answered and said to his people,
rest:
“Look at me, I am sending to you
grain, new wine, and olive oil,
and you will be satisfied by it.
I will not give you over any more
as a disgrace among the nations.

firstLine: The northerners
rest:
I will remove from you;
I will drive them to a desert
and desolate land,
its front to the eastern sea,
and its rear into the western sea;
its stench and odor will rise up
because he has done great things.

firstLine: Do not fear, O land,
rest:
rejoice and be glad,
because Yahweh has done great things.

firstLine: Do not fear, wild animals of the field,
rest:
because the pastures of the desert have put forth new green shoots,
because the tree has produced its fruit,
the fig tree and the vine
have yielded their produce.

firstLine: Be glad, O children of Zion,
rest:
be glad and rejoice in Yahweh your God,
because he has given for you
the autumn rains for your righteousness,
and he has poured down for you rainwater,
the autumn and spring rains, as before.

firstLine: The threshing floors will be full with grain,
rest:
and the vats will overflow
with new wine and olive oil.

firstLine: I will repay you the years
rest:
that the locust has eaten,
the hopper, the destroyer, and the cutter,
my mighty troops that I sent against you.

firstLine: And you will eat abundantly and be satisfied,
rest:
and praise the name of Yahweh your God,
who has dealt with you wondrously.
My people will never be ashamed.

firstLine: And you will know that I am in the midst of Israel,
rest:
and I am Yahweh,
your God, and there is no other.
My people will never be ashamed again.

firstLine: Yahweh’s Spirit Poured Out
rest:
And it will happen afterward thus:
I will pour out my Spirit on all flesh,
and your sons and your daughters will prophesy,
and your elders will dream dreams;
your young men shall see visions.

firstLine: And also on the male slaves and on the female slaves,
rest: I will pour out my Spirit in those days.

firstLine: Yahweh’s Judgment on the Nations
rest: For look! In those days, and in that time, when I will return the fortunes of Judah and Jerusalem,

firstLine: Yahweh’s Judgment in the Valley of Jehoshaphat
Beat your cutting tools of iron into swords
rest:
and your pruning hooks into spears;
let the weakling say, ‘I am a mighty warrior!’

firstLine: Hurry and come,
rest:
all the nations, from all around,
and gather yourselves there.
Bring down your mighty warriors, O Yahweh!

firstLine: Let the nations be roused and let them come up
rest:
to the valley of Jehoshaphat,
for there I will sit to judge
all the nations from all around.

firstLine: Send forth the sickle,
rest:
for the harvest is ripe!
Go tread,
for the winepress is full!
The vats overflow,
because their evil is great!

firstLine: Commotion, commotion
rest:
in the valley of decision!
For the day of Yahweh is near
in the valley of decision!

firstLine: The sun and the moon grow dark,
rest: and the stars have withheld their splendor.

firstLine: And Yahweh roars from Zion;
rest:
from Jerusalem he utters his voice,
and the heavens and the earth shake.
But Yahweh is a refuge for his people,
and a protection for the children of Israel.

firstLine: And you will know that I, Yahweh your God,
rest:
am dwelling in Zion, my holy mountain.
And Jerusalem will be a place of holiness,
and strangers will pass through it no longer.

firstLine: And it will happen on that day;
rest:
the mountains will drip new wine,
and the hills will flow with milk,
and all the channels of Judah will flow with water.
A spring from the house of Yahweh will come forth,
and it will water the valley of Acacia Trees.

firstLine: Egypt will become a desolation,
rest:
and Edom will become a desolate desert,
because of the violence they did against the children of Judah,
in whose land they have shed innocent blood.

firstLine: But Judah will be inhabited forever,
rest: and Jerusalem for all generations.

firstLine: I will cleanse their bloodguilt that I did not cleanse,
rest: for Yahweh is dwelling in Zion.

firstLine: Introduction
rest: The words of Amos, who was among the shepherds from Tekoa, which he saw concerning Israel in the days of Uzziah the king of Judah and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Jehoash, two years before the earthquake.

firstLine: Judgment on Israel’s Neighbors
rest: And he said, “Yahweh roars from Zion and he utters his voice from Jerusalem; the pastures of the shepherds wither and the top of Carmel dries up.”

firstLine: Judgment on Judah
rest: Thus says Yahweh: “For three transgressions of Judah and for four I will not revoke the punishment, because they have rejected the law of Yahweh and have not kept his rules, and their lies have led them astray, after which their ancestors walked!

firstLine: Judgment on Israel
rest: Thus says Yahweh: “For three transgressions of Israel and for four I will not revoke the punishment, because they sell the righteous for money and the poor for a pair of sandals!

firstLine: Israel’s Guilt and Punishment
rest: Hear this word that Yahweh has spoken against you, O people of Israel, against the whole clan that I brought up from the land of Egypt:

firstLine: Social and Spiritual Corruption
rest: Hear this word, you cows of Bashan who live on the mountain of Samaria, who oppress the powerless, who crush the poor, who say to their husbands, “Bring something so that we may drink!”

firstLine: A Lament and Call to Repentance
rest: Hear this word that I am going to intone over you as a lament, O house of Israel!

firstLine: The Day of Yahweh
rest: Alas, those who desire the day of Yahweh, why is this for you the day of Yahweh? It will be darkness and not light!

firstLine: Woe to the Complacent
rest: Alas for those being at ease in Zion, and those who feel secure on Mount Samaria, the notables of the best of the nations! The house of Israel resorts to them.

firstLine: Yahweh Abhors Israel’s Pride
rest: My Lord Yahweh has sworn by himself, declares Yahweh, the God of hosts: “I abhor the pride of Jacob and I hate his citadel fortresses and I will deliver the city and its fullness!”

firstLine: Warning Visions
rest: This is what my Lord Yahweh showed me, and look, he is going to form locusts at the beginning of the sprouting of the second crop, and look, after the mowings of the king.

firstLine: Amaziah’s Opposition
rest: Then Amaziah the priest of Bethel sent to Jeroboam the king of Israel, saying, “Amos has conspired against you in the midst of the house of Israel. The land is not able to endure all of his words.

firstLine: A Basket of Ripe Fruit
rest: My Lord Yahweh showed me this, and there was a basket of summer fruit.

firstLine: Destruction of Israel
rest: I saw my Lord standing by the altar and he said, “Strike the capitals so that the thresholds will shake, and shatter them on the head of all of them, and I will kill the rest of them with the sword. A fugitive belonging to them will not run away, and a survivor belonging to them will not escape.

firstLine: Restoration of Israel
rest: On that day I will raise up the booth of David that is fallen, and I will repair its breaches and will raise up its ruins and will build it like the days of old.

firstLine: God’s Judgment on Edom
rest:
The vision of Obadiah. Thus says my Lord Yahweh concerning Edom:
Edom’s Approaching Destruction
We have heard a report from Yahweh, and a messenger has been sent among the nations: “Rise up and let us rise against it for battle.”

firstLine: Edom’s Treachery against Judah
rest: “Because of the violence done to your brother Jacob, shame will cover you and you will be cut off forever.

firstLine: Future Judgment of the Nations
rest: “For the day of Yahweh is near against all the nations! Just as you have done, it will be done to you. Your deeds will return on your own head.

firstLine: Future Blessing for Israel
rest: Those of the Negev will take possession of the mountain of Esau, and those of the Shephelah will possess the land of the Philistines, and they shall take possession of the territory of Ephraim and the territory of Samaria, and Benjamin will take possession of Gilead.

firstLine: Jonah Disobeys Yahweh
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to Jonah the son of Amittai, saying,

firstLine: Jonah Is Swallowed by a Fish and Prays to Yahweh
rest: And Yahweh provided a large fish to swallow up Jonah, and Jonah was in the belly of the fish three days and three nights.

firstLine: and said,
rest:
“I called from my distress to Yahweh,
and he answered me;
from the belly of Sheol I cried for help—
you heard my voice.

firstLine: And you threw me into the deep,
rest:
into the heart of the seas,
and the sea currents surrounded me;
all your breakers and your surging waves
passed over me.

firstLine: And I said, ‘I am banished
The waters encompassed me up to my neck;
rest:
the deep surrounded me;
seaweed was wrapped around my head.

firstLine: I went down to the foundations of the mountains;
rest:
the Underworld—its bars were around me forever.
But you brought up my life from the pit,
Yahweh my God.

firstLine: When my life was ebbing away from me,
rest:
I remembered Yahweh,
and my prayer came to you,
to your holy temple.

firstLine: Those who worship vain idols
rest: forsake their loyal love.

firstLine: But I, with a voice of thanksgiving,
The People of Nineveh Repent at Jonah’s Proclamation
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to Jonah a second time, saying,

firstLine: The King’s Proclamation
rest: And the news reached the king of Nineveh, and he rose from his throne and removed his royal robe, put on sackcloth, and sat in the ashes.

firstLine: And he had a proclamation made, and said,
rest:
“In Nineveh, by a decree of the king and his nobles:
“No human being or animal, no herd or flock, shall taste anything! They must not eat, and they must not drink water!

firstLine: Jonah Is Angry at Yahweh’s Compassion
rest: And this was greatly displeasing to Jonah, and he became furious.

firstLine: The Impending Doom of Samaria and Jerusalem
rest: The word of Yahweh that came to Micah the Morashtite in the days of Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, the kings of Judah, that he saw concerning Samaria and Jerusalem:

firstLine: Hear, all you peoples;
rest:
give heed, O earth and its fullness.
And let the Lord Yahweh be against you as a witness,
the Lord from his holy temple.

firstLine: For behold, Yahweh is coming out from his place,
rest: and he will come down and tread upon the high places of the earth.

firstLine: The mountains will melt under him
rest:
and the valleys will burst open,
like wax before the fire,
like water rushing down a slope.

firstLine: All this is for the rebellion of Jacob,
rest:
and for the sins of the house of Israel.
What is the rebellion of Jacob?
Is it not Samaria?
And what are the high places of Judah?
Are they not Jerusalem?

firstLine: So I will make Samaria as a heap of rubble in the field,
rest:
a place for planting a vineyard.
And I will pour down her stones into the valley
and uncover her foundations.

firstLine: Then all her idols will be broken in pieces,
rest:
and all her prostitution wages will be burned in the fire,
and all her idols I will make a desolation,
For from the wage of a prostitute she gathered them,
and to the wage of a prostitute they will return.

firstLine: For her wounds are incurable,
rest:
because it has come to Judah.
It has reached to the gate of my people, to Jerusalem.

firstLine: Do not tell it in Gath;
rest:
you must not weep at all.
In Beth-le-Aphrah
roll yourself in dust.

firstLine: Pass on, you inhabitants of Shaphir,
For the inhabitants of Maroth
rest:
writhed for good,
because disaster has come down from Yahweh
to the gate of Jerusalem.

firstLine: Harness the chariot to the team of horses,
Therefore you will give parting gifts
I will again bring the conqueror upon you,
Make yourselves bald
rest:
and cut off your hair
for the children of your pleasure.
Expand your baldness as the eagle,
for they will go into exile away from you.

firstLine: Woe to the Oppressors of God’s People
rest:
Woe to those who plan wickedness
and evil deeds upon their beds!
In the light of the morning they did it,
because they have power in their hands.

firstLine: They covet fields and seize them,
In that day they will raise a proverb against you,
Therefore you will have no one casting a line by lot
rest: in the assembly of Yahweh.

firstLine: “Do not preach!” they are preaching.
rest:
They should not preach to these;
disgrace will not overtake us.

firstLine: But recently my people have risen up as an enemy;
You have driven out the women of my people
rest:
from the houses of their pleasure.
From their children you have taken away
my glory forever.

firstLine: Arise and go,
If a man walks about in a spirit of deception and lies,
rest:
saying “I will preach to you of wine and strong drink,”
then he would be a preacher for this people!

firstLine: I will surely gather all of you, O Jacob;
rest:
I will surely gather together the remainder of Israel.
I will set them like sheep of Bozrah.
Like a herd in the midst of their pasture
they will be in tumult from people.

firstLine: The one who breaks out before them goes up;
rest:
they break through and pass the gate,
going out through it.
Their king passes before them,
Yahweh at their head.

firstLine: Israel’s Leaders Denounced
rest:
And I said,
“Listen, O heads of Jacob
and leaders of the house of Israel!
Is it not for you to know justice?

firstLine: Those of you who are haters of good
rest:
and lovers of evil,
who tear their skin from them
and their flesh from their bones,

firstLine: and who eat the flesh of my people,
rest:
and strip their skin from them,
and break their bones,
and chop them like meat in the pot,
and like flesh in the midst of a cooking pot.”

firstLine: Then they will cry to Yahweh,
rest:
but he will not answer them.
He will hide his face from them at that time,
when they have made their deeds evil.

firstLine: Thus says Yahweh concerning the prophets
rest:
who are leading my people astray,
who are biting with their teeth
and proclaim, “Peace,”
but whoever puts nothing into their mouths
they declare war against.

firstLine: Therefore it will be as night to you, without vision,
rest:
and darkness to you, without divination.
And the sun will set on the prophets,
and the day will grow dark over them.

firstLine: Then the seers will be disgraced,
rest:
and those practicing divination will be put to shame.
All of them will cover their lips,
for there is no reply from God.

firstLine: But I, I am filled with power,
rest:
with the Spirit of Yahweh,
and with justice and might,
to declare to Jacob his rebellion,
and to Israel his sin.

firstLine: Hear this, O rulers of the house of Jacob
rest:
and leaders of the house of Israel,
those detesting justice
and perverting all that is right,

firstLine: he who builds Zion with blood
rest: and Jerusalem with wickedness.

firstLine: Its rulers judge for a bribe;
rest:
its priests teach for a price;
its prophets practice divination for money.
But they lean on Yahweh, saying,
“Is not Yahweh in our midst?
Disaster will not come upon us.”

firstLine: Therefore on account of you
rest:
Zion will be plowed as a field,
and Jerusalem will be a heap of rubble,
and the temple mount as a high place in a forest.

firstLine: The Mountain of Yahweh
rest:
And it will be that at the end of those days,
the mountain of Yahweh
will be established as the highest of the mountains,
and it will be lifted up above the hills,
and people will stream to it.

firstLine: And many nations will come and say,
rest:
“Come! Let us go up to the mountain of Yahweh,
and to the temple of the God of Jacob,
that he may teach us his ways,
and that we may walk in his paths,”
for the law will go out from Zion,
and the word of Yahweh from Jerusalem.

firstLine: And he will judge between many peoples
But they will sit, each under his vine
rest:
and under his fig tree,
and no one will make them afraid,
for the mouth of Yahweh of hosts has spoken.

firstLine: For all the nations walk,
rest:
each in the name of its god,
but we will walk in the name of Yahweh our God,
forever and ever.

firstLine: Yahweh Will Deliver Zion
rest:
“In that day,” declares Yahweh,
“I will assemble the one who limps,
and I will gather the one who has been scattered,
and those whom I have mistreated.

firstLine: And I will make the one who limps a remnant,
rest:
and the one driven far away a strong nation,
and Yahweh will reign over them on Mount Zion
from now to forever.

firstLine: And you, O Migdal-Eder,
rest:
hill of the daughter of Zion,
to you it will come,
and the former dominion will come,
the reign of the daughter of Jerusalem.

firstLine: Writhe and groan, O daughter of Zion,
rest:
like a woman in labor.
For now you will go forth from the city,
and you will camp in the field;
you will go to Babylon.
There you will be rescued;
there Yahweh will redeem you
from the hand of your enemies.

firstLine: And now, many nations are gathered against you
rest:
who are saying, ‘Let her be defiled,
and let our eyes gaze upon Zion.’

firstLine: But they do not know the thoughts of Yahweh,
rest:
and they do not understand his plan,
that he has gathered them as sheaves
to his threshing floor.

firstLine: Arise and thresh, O daughter of Zion,
rest:
for your horn I will make as iron
and your hooves as bronze.
And you will break many peoples in pieces,
and their gain you will devote to destruction to Yahweh,
and their wealth to the Lord of the whole earth.”

firstLine: A Ruler from Bethlehem
rest:
Now muster troops, O daughter of troops;
a siege he puts against us.
They strike the ruler of Israel
with a rod on the cheek.

firstLine: But you, O Bethlehem Ephrathah,
Therefore he will give them up
rest:
until the time of she who is with child has given birth.
And the rest of his brothers will return
to the children of Israel.

firstLine: And he will stand and shepherd his flock
rest:
in the strength of Yahweh,
in the majesty of the name of Yahweh his God.
And they will live,
for now he will be great unto the ends of the earth.

firstLine: And they will shepherd the land of Assyria with the sword,
rest:
and the land of Nimrod at its entrances.
And he will rescue us from the Assyrian
when he comes into our land,
and when they tread upon our border.

firstLine: A Remnant Delivered
rest:
And the remnant of Jacob will be
in the midst of many nations,
like dew from Yahweh,
like showers upon the grass
which does not wait for a man,
nor delays for the children of humankind.

firstLine: And the remnant of Jacob will be among the nations,
rest:
in the midst of many peoples,
like a lion among the wild animals of the forest,
like a young lion among the herds of sheep
which, when it passes through and treads down
and tears in pieces, there is none who can deliver.

firstLine: Your hand will be lifted high over your enemies,
rest: and all your foes will be cut off.

firstLine: “And it will happen that in that day,” declares Yahweh,
rest:
“then I will cut off your horses from among you,
and I will destroy your chariots.

firstLine: And I will cut off the cities of your land,
rest: and I will demolish all your fortifications.

firstLine: And I will cut off sorceries from your hand,
rest: and you will not have soothsayers.

firstLine: And I will cut off your idols
rest:
and your stone pillars from among you,
and you will no longer bow down
to the work of your hands.

firstLine: And I will uproot your Asherahs from among you,
rest: and I will destroy your cities.

firstLine: And in anger and in wrath I will execute vengeance
rest: on the nations who did not obey.”

firstLine: Yahweh Brings a Charge against Israel
rest:
Hear now what Yahweh says:
“Arise! Plead your case with the mountains,
and let the hills hear your voice.”

firstLine: Hear, O mountains, the indictment of Yahweh,
“O my people, what have I done to you,
rest: and how have I wearied you? Answer me!

firstLine: For I brought you up from the land of Egypt,
rest:
and from the house of slavery I redeemed you.
And I sent Moses, Aaron, and Miriam before you.

firstLine: O my people, remember what Balak the king of Moab devised,
rest:
and what Balaam the son of Beor answered him,
and what happened from Shittim to Gilgal,
so that you might know the righteous acts of Yahweh.”

firstLine: Will Yahweh be pleased with thousands of rams,
rest:
with myriads of rivers of oil?
Shall I give my firstborn for my transgression,
the fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?

firstLine: He has told you, O mortal, what is good,
rest:
and what does Yahweh ask from you
but to do justice, and to love kindness,
and to walk humbly with your God?

firstLine: The Destruction of the Wicked
rest:
The voice of Yahweh calls to the city
(it is sound judgment to fear your name):
“Hear, O staff! Now who has appointed it?

firstLine: Is there any longer a man in the house of the wicked
rest:
treasures of wickedness,
and the ephah of scarcity which is accursed?

firstLine: Shall I regard as pure the one with scales of wickedness,
rest: and with a bag of deceitful weights?

firstLine: Because her rich are full of violence,
rest:
and her inhabitants speak lies,
and their tongue is deceitful in their mouth.

firstLine: And I also have made you sick by striking you down,
rest: making you desolate because of your sins.

firstLine: You yourself will eat but not be satisfied;
rest:
your hunger will be in your midst,
and you will put away, but you will not save,
and what you save I will hand over to the sword.

firstLine: You yourself will sow, but you will not reap;
rest:
you will tread olives, but you will not anoint yourself with oil;
you will tread grapes, but you will not drink wine.

firstLine: For you have observed the regulations of Omri
rest:
and all the works of the house of Ahab.
And you have walked in their counsels,
so that I am making you a desolation
and your inhabitants an object of scorn.
So you will bear the scorn of my people.

firstLine: Wait Upon Yahweh
rest:
Woe is me! For I have become
like the gatherings of summer,
like the gleanings of the grape harvest,
when there is no cluster of grapes to eat
or early ripened fruit that my soul desires.

firstLine: The faithful person has perished from the land,
Their hands are upon evil, to do it well;
The best of them is like a brier;
Do not put faith in a friend;
rest:
put no trust in a close friend.
Guard the doorways of your mouth
from the one who lies in your lap.

firstLine: For a son treats a father with contempt;
But as for me, I will look to Yahweh;
rest:
I will wait for the God of my salvation.
My God will hear me.

firstLine: I will bear the rage of Yahweh,
Then my enemy will see,
rest:
and shame will cover her who said to me,
“Where is Yahweh your God?”
My eyes will look upon her;
now she will become a trampling place,
like mud in the streets.

firstLine: A day for building your walls;
rest: on that day he will extend your boundary.

firstLine: On that day he will come to you
rest:
from Assyria and the cities of Egypt,
and from Egypt to the River,
and from sea to sea
and mountain to mountain.

firstLine: But the earth will be a desolation
rest:
because of its inhabitants,
for the fruit of their deeds.

firstLine: Shepherd your people with your staff,
rest:
the flock of your inheritance,
those dwelling alone in a forest
in the midst of Carmel.
Let them feed in Bashan and Gilead,
as in the days of old.

firstLine: As in the days when you came out
rest:
from the land of Egypt
I will show him wondrous things.

firstLine: The nations will see and be ashamed
They will lick the dust like the serpent,
rest:
like the crawling things of the earth.
They will come trembling from their strongholds
to Yahweh our God.
Let them fear and be afraid of you.

firstLine: Who is a God like you, forgiving sin
rest:
and passing over rebellion for the remnant of his inheritance?
He does not retain his anger forever,
for he delights in loyal love.

firstLine: He will again have compassion on us;
rest:
he will trample our iniquities.
And you will hurl all their sins
in the depths of the sea.

firstLine: You will show faithfulness to Jacob,
rest:
and loyal love to Abraham,
as you have sworn to our ancestors
from the days of old.

firstLine: Superscription
rest:
The oracle concerning Nineveh—
the scroll of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite:

firstLine: Half-Acrostic: Yahweh Takes Vengeance against His Enemies
Yahweh is slow to anger but great in power;
He rebukes the sea and he dries up the rivers;
Mountains quake before him;
rest:
the hills shake apart.
The earth heaves before him—
the world and all her inhabitants.

firstLine: Yahweh is good—a refuge in the day of distress;
rest: he knows those who take refuge in him.

firstLine: But with a rushing torrent he will bring Nineveh to an end;
rest: he will chase his enemies into darkness.

firstLine: Yahweh Will Destroy Nineveh
For like entangled thorns,
rest:
and like their drink which is drunk,
they will be consumed like fully dry chaff.

firstLine: From you goes out one who plots evil against Yahweh,
