rest: one who plans wickedness.

firstLine: Yahweh Will Deliver Judah and Destroy Nineveh
rest:
Yahweh says this:
“Even though they are powerful and likewise many,
even so they will be cut off and pass away.
Though I have afflicted you,
I will afflict you no longer.

firstLine: And now, I will break his yoke from upon you;
rest: I will snap your bonds.”

firstLine: Yahweh has commanded concerning you:
The Divine Warrior Will Attack Nineveh
rest:
One who shatters has come up against you!
Guard the fortification!
Watch the road!
Gird your loins!
Muster all your strength!

firstLine: For Yahweh will restore the majesty of Jacob
The Enemy Army Conquers the City of Nineveh
rest:
The shields of his warriors are dyed red;
The powerful men are dressed in scarlet.
The metal of the chariots shines like fire on the day of battle,
and their spears quiver.

firstLine: The chariots race madly through the streets;
rest:
they rush back and forth in the public squares.
Their appearance like lightning bolts,
they dart about like flashes of lightning.

firstLine: He calls his officers;
The gates of the river are opened;
rest: the palace trembles.

firstLine: Her goddess is taken out and taken into exile;
rest:
her maidservants moan like doves;
they beat on their breasts.

firstLine: The Divine Warrior Will Hunt down the Mighty Lions
rest:
Where now is the den of the lions
and the cave of the fierce lions?
There the lioness, the cub, and the lion once prowled,
and no one disturbed them.

firstLine: The lion tore apart enough prey for his cubs,
“Look! I am against you!” declares Yahweh of hosts.
The Doom of the Wicked City is Certain
rest:
Woe to the city that has shed much blood!
She is a deceiver,
She is filled with plunder,
She has hoarded her spoils of war.

firstLine: Harlot Nineveh Will Get What She Deserves
rest:
“Because of the many idolatries of the prostitute,
the beautiful charm of a mistress of witchcraft,
she who enslaves nations by her harlotries,
and peoples by her sorceries,

firstLine: “Look! I am against you!” declaresYahweh.
rest:
“I will strip up your skirts over your face;
I will let nations look at your nakedness and your shame.

firstLine: “I will throw filth upon you,
rest:
I will treat you with contempt,
I will make you a spectacle.

firstLine: “And it will be that everyone who sees you will flee from you,
rest:
And they will say, ‘Nineveh is destroyed!’
Who will mourn for her?
From whence shall I seek comforters for you?”

firstLine: Nineveh Will Suffer the Same Fate She Inflicted on Thebes
rest:
Are you better than Thebes?
She who sits at the Nile, surrounded by her waters,
her rampart was the sea and water was her wall.

firstLine: Cush was her strength, Egypt without end;
rest: Put and Libya were among your allies.

firstLine: Yet she went into captivity as an exile;
You also will behave like a drunkard;
rest:
You also will hide yourself;
You also will seek refuge from the enemy.

firstLine: Nineveh’s Defenses Will Fail
rest:
All of your fortifications are like fig trees with ripe firstfruits—
if they are shaken, they will fall into the mouth of the eater.

firstLine: There fire will consume you;
rest:
the sword will cut you off.
It will consume you like the locust.
Nineveh’s Defenders Will Flee
Multiply yourself like the locust!
Multiply yourself like the grasshopper!

firstLine: You have increased your merchants more than the stars of heaven;
rest: like the locust they will shed their skin and fly away.

firstLine: Your officials are like locusts;
rest:
your commanders are like a swarm of locusts.
They encamp on the walls on a cold day;
when the sun rises, they fly away—
no one knows where they have gone.

firstLine: Nineveh Will Come to an End
rest:
Your shepherds are sleeping, O king of Assyria!
Your nobles slumber.
Your people are scattered on the mountains;
no one can gather them.

firstLine: There is no healing for your wound;
rest:
your injury is fatal.
All who hear the report of you will clap their hands for joy concerning you,
For who has not suffered at the hands of your endless cruelty?

firstLine: Habakkuk’s Complaint
rest: The oracle that Habakkuk the prophet saw.

firstLine: O Yahweh, how long shall I cry for help
rest:
and you will not listen?
How long will I cry out to you, “Violence!”
and you will not save?

firstLine: Why do you cause me to see evil
Therefore the law is paralyzed,
God’s Answer to Habakkuk
rest:
“Look among the nations and see;
be astonished and astounded.
For a work is about to be done in your days
that you will not believe if it is told.

firstLine: They are dreadful and awesome;
rest: their justice and their dignity proceed from themselves.

firstLine: Their horses are more swift than leopards;
All of them come for violence,
rest:
their faces pressing forward.
They gather captives like the sand.

firstLine: And they themselves scoff at kings
rest:
and rulers are a joke to them.
They laugh at every fortification,
and they heap up earth and take it.

firstLine: Then they sweep like the wind and pass on;
rest: they become guilty, whose might is their god!”

firstLine: Habakkuk’s Second Complaint
rest:
Are you not from of old,
O Yahweh my God, my Holy One?
You shall not die.
O Yahweh, you have marked them for judgment;
O Rock, you have established them for reproof.

firstLine: Your eyes are too pure to see evil,
rest:
and you are not able to look at wrongdoing.
Why do you look at the treacherous?
Why are you silent when the wicked swallows up
someone more righteous than him?

firstLine: You make humankind like fish of the sea,
rest: like crawling creatures that have no ruler among them.

firstLine: He brings up all of them with a fishhook;
Therefore he sacrifices to his fishnet
rest:
and makes offerings to his dragnet,
for by them he makes a good living
and his food is rich.

firstLine: Will he therefore empty his fishnet
rest: and continually kill nations without showing mercy?

firstLine: The Righteous Will Live by Faith
rest:
I will stand at my post,
and station myself on the rampart.
And I will keep watch to see what he will say to me,
and what he will answer concerning my complaint.

firstLine: Then Yahweh answered me and said,
rest:
“Write the vision and make it plain on the tablet
so that it might be read quickly.

firstLine: For there is yet a vision for the appointed time;
rest:
it will give witness to the end, and it will not lie.
If it tarries, wait for it,
for it will surely come and not delay.

firstLine: How much less the defiant;
rest:
the arrogant, treacherous man?
He who broadens his throat like Sheol,
and who, like death, is not satisfied,
and who gathers to himself all the nations,
and harvested for himself all the peoples,
will not succeed.

firstLine: Shall not all of these take up a taunt against him,
rest:
with ridicule and riddles against him, saying,
‘Woe to him who heaps up what is not his’?
For how long?
And, ‘Woe to him who makes himself heavy with pledges’?

firstLine: Will not your creditors suddenly rise up
rest:
and awaken those who make you tremble?
Then you shall be as plunder for them.

firstLine: Because you plundered many nations,
rest:
all the remaining nations will plunder you
on account of the blood of humanity
and violence against the land,
and against cities and all who live in them.

firstLine: Woe to him who obtains profit from evil gain for his house,
rest:
to set his nest on high,
to be saved from the hand of misfortune!

firstLine: You have plotted shame for your house,
rest:
cutting off many peoples
and sinning against your life.

firstLine: For the stone will cry out from the wall,
rest: and the plaster from the wood will answer it.

firstLine: Woe to him who builds a city by bloodguilt,
rest: and who founds a city by wickedness!

firstLine: For the earth will be filled
rest:
with the knowledge of the glory of Yahweh,
like the waters covering the sea.

firstLine: Woe to him who gives a drink to his neighbors,
rest:
pouring out your wrath and also making them drunk
in order to see their nakedness!

firstLine: For the violence of Lebanon will cover you,
rest:
and the destruction of wild animals will shatter them
on account of the blood of humanity,
and the violence against the land,
against a city and all the inhabitants in it.

firstLine: What value is an idol
rest:
when its carver has fashioned it,
a molten idol, a teacher of lies?
For he who fashioned his creation trusts in it,
though making mute idols!

firstLine: The Prayer of Habakkuk
rest: A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet, according to Shigionoth.

firstLine: O Yahweh, I have heard the report of you;
rest:
O Yahweh, I stand in awe of your works.
In the midst of the years, revive it!
In the midst of the years, make it known!
In wrath, may you remember to show compassion.

firstLine: God came from Teman;
rest:
the Holy One from Mount Paran. Selah
His splendor covers the heavens,
and his praise fills the earth.

firstLine: And his brightness was like the light;
rest:
flashing rays came from his hand for him;
And there is the covering of his strength.

firstLine: Before him went Disease,
rest: and Pestilence went out at his feet.

firstLine: He stood and measured the earth;
rest:
he looked and made the nations tremble.
Then the mountains of old were shattered;
the hills of old collapsed.
The ways of old belong to him.

firstLine: Under affliction I saw the tents of Cushan;
rest: the tent curtains of the land of Midian trembled.

firstLine: You laid bare the nakedness of your bow,
rest:
swearing oaths with the arrows of your word.
You split the earth with rivers.

firstLine: When the mountains saw you they writhed;
Sun and moon stood still in their place;
rest:
at the light of your arrows they moved about;
at the gleam of the flashing of your spear.

firstLine: In fury you marched through the earth;
rest: in anger you trampled the nations.

firstLine: You went forth for the salvation of your people,
rest:
for the salvation of your anointed.
You crushed the head of the house of wickedness,
laying bare from the foundation to the top.

firstLine: You pierced the head of his warriors with his own arrows;
rest:
they came like a whirlwind to scatter me,
their exultation like one who devours the afflicted in ambush.

firstLine: You trampled upon the sea with your horses,
rest: the churning of many waters.

firstLine: I hear and my stomach shakes;
Though the fig tree does not blossom,
Yet I will rejoice in Yahweh;
rest: I will exult in the God of my salvation.

firstLine: Yahweh, my Lord, is my strength;
Judah’s Impending Judgment
rest: The word of Yahweh that came to Zephaniah the son of Cushi, the son of Gedaliah, the son of Amariah, the son of Hezekiah, in the days of Josiah son of Amon, king of Judah.

firstLine: “I will surely destroy everything
rest: from the face of the earth”—a declaration of Yahweh.

firstLine: “I will destroy humanity and beast;
rest:
I will destroy the birds of the sky
and the fish of the sea,
and the stumbling blocks with the wicked.
And I will cut off humankind
from the face of the earth”—a declaration of Yahweh.

firstLine: “And I will stretch out my hand against Judah
rest:
and against all the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
And I will cut off from this place
the remnant of Baal,
and the name of idolatrous priests with the priests,

firstLine: and those who bow down on the rooftops
rest:
to the host of heaven,
and those who bow down, swearing to Yahweh
but also swearing by Milkom,

firstLine: and those who turned back from following Yahweh,
rest:
and who did not seek Yahweh,
and did not inquire of him.”

firstLine: Be silent before the Lord Yahweh,
And it shall be that on the day of the sacrifice of Yahweh,
rest:
I will punish the officials
and the sons of the king
and those who dress in foreign clothing.

firstLine: And on that day I will punish
rest:
all who leap over the threshold,
who fill up the house of their master
with violence and deceit.

firstLine: “And there shall be on that day”—a declaration of Yahweh—
rest:
“a loud outcry from the Fish Gate,
and a wailing from the Second District,
and a loud crashing from the hills.

firstLine: The inhabitants of the Mortar shall wail,
rest:
for all the traders have perished;
all who trade with silver have been cut off.

firstLine: And it shall be that at that time
rest:
I will search Jerusalem with lamps,
and I will punish the men
whose senses are dulled from drinking,
who say in their hearts,
‘Yahweh will not do good, nor will he do evil.’

firstLine: Then their wealth shall be as plunder,
rest:
and their homes as desolation.
And they shall build their houses and not inhabit them,
and they shall plant vineyards and not drink their wine.”

firstLine: The great day of Yahweh draws near;
That day will be a day of wrath,
rest:
a day of trouble and distress,
a day of disaster and ruination,
a day of darkness and deep gloom,
a day of clouds and thick clouds,

firstLine: a day of trumpet and trumpet blast
rest:
against the fortified cities
and against the high corner towers.

firstLine: And I will bring distress to all humankind,
rest:
and they shall walk about like the blind,
for they sinned against Yahweh;
their blood shall be poured out like dust
and their entrails like dung.

firstLine: Moreover, their silver and their gold
rest:
will not be able to save them
on the day of the wrath of Yahweh.
And in the fire of his zeal,
the whole land shall be consumed,
for a terrifying end he shall make
for all the inhabitants of the land.

firstLine: Judgment of Judah’s Enemies
rest:
Gather yourselves together! Now gather together,
O nation having no shame!

firstLine: Before the birth of the decree,
Seek Yahweh, all you afflicted of the land
For Gaza will be abandoned,
rest:
and Ashkelon as a desolation.
As for Ashdod, at noon they will drive her away,
and Ekron shall be uprooted.

firstLine: Woe to you, inhabitants of the region of the sea,
rest:
people of the Kerethites!
The word of Yahweh is against you,
O Canaan, land of the Philistines.
I will destroy you until there is no inhabitant.

firstLine: And you, O region of the sea, shall become
rest:
pastures and meadows for shepherds
and sheep pens for the flocks.

firstLine: And it shall become a region
rest:
for the remnant of the house of Judah;
upon them they shall graze,
and in the houses of Ashkelon
they shall lie down in the evening.
For Yahweh their God shall be mindful of them,
and he will restore their fortunes.

firstLine: I have heard the reproaches of Moab
rest:
and the scorning of the Ammonites,
with which they have taunted my nation
and made boasts against their territory.

firstLine: “Therefore, as I live”—a declaration of Yahweh of hosts,
rest:
the God of Israel—
“Moab shall be as Sodom,
and the Ammonites like Gomorrah,
a place of weeds and salt pits
and a desolation forever.
The remnant of my people shall plunder them,
and the remainder of my nation shall possess them.”

firstLine: This shall be for them in place of their pride
rest:
because they mocked and boasted
against the people of Yahweh of hosts.

firstLine: Yahweh will be awesome against them,
You also, O Cushites,
rest: they shall be killed by my sword.

firstLine: And he will stretch out his hand against the north,
rest:
and he will destroy Assyria
and will make Nineveh a desolation,
a dry wasteland like the desert.

firstLine: Herds shall lie down in her midst,
This is the city of rejoicing
rest:
that lived securely;
the one saying in her heart,
“I am, and there is none besides me.”
How she has become a desolation,
a lair for wild animals!
Everyone who passes by her hisses and shakes his fist.

firstLine: Judgment of Jerusalem and the Nations
rest:
Woe to you, O rebellious and defiled one!
The oppressing city!

firstLine: She listens to no voice;
Her officials in her midst are roaring lions;
rest:
her judges are evening wolves;
they leave nothing until the morning.

firstLine: Her prophets are arrogant men of treachery;
rest:
her priests have defiled that which is holy;
they do violence to the law.

firstLine: Yahweh is righteous in her midst;
rest:
he does not do wickedness.
Morning by morning he renders his judgment;
at dawn he does not fail,
but an evil one knows no shame.

firstLine: “I have cut off nations;
rest:
their strongholds are deserted.
I have laid waste their streets,
so that none pass through.
Their cities have been destroyed
and are without a man, without an inhabitant.

firstLine: I have said, ‘Surely she will fear me;
rest:
she will accept discipline.
Then her dwelling place will not be cut down,
nor all that I have brought upon her.’
Surely they rise early;
they make all their deeds corrupt.

firstLine: “Therefore, wait for me”—a declaration of Yahweh—
rest:
“for the day of my rising as a witness.
For my decision is to gather nations,
to assemble kingdoms,
to pour out my wrath upon them, all my burning anger.
For by the fire of my anger all the land shall be consumed.

firstLine: Because then I will make the speech of the nations pure;
rest:
that all of them might call on the name of Yahweh,
to serve him in unison.

firstLine: From beyond the rivers of Cush
rest:
my worshipers and the daughter of my scattered ones
shall bring my offering.

firstLine: On that day you shall not be humiliated
rest:
on account of all your deeds
by which you have rebelled against me.
For then I shall remove from your midst
those exulting in your pride,
and you shall no longer be haughty
in my holy mountain.

firstLine: And I will leave in your midst
rest:
a people afflicted and poor,
and they shall take refuge
in the name of Yahweh.

firstLine: The remnant of Israel
rest:
shall not do wickedness;
they shall not speak deception,
nor shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth.
For they shall graze and lie down,
and none shall frighten them.”

firstLine: Yahweh has annulled your judgments;
On that day it shall be said to Jerusalem,
rest:
“Fear not, O Zion;
your hands shall not hang limp.

firstLine: Yahweh your God is in your midst;
I will gather those of you grieving on account of the feast;
rest: they were raising against her a reproach.

firstLine: Behold, at that time I will deal with all your oppressors;
rest:
I will save the lame and gather the outcast.
I will change them from shame
to glory and renown throughout the whole world.

firstLine: At that time I will bring you in;
rest:
at the time of my gathering you together.
For I will make you renowned and praised
among all the nations of the earth
when I restore your fortunes before your eyes,”
says Yahweh.

firstLine: The Temple Lies in Ruins
rest: In the second year of King Darius, in the sixth month, on the first day, the word of Yahweh came through Haggai the prophet to Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and to Joshua the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, saying,

firstLine: A Promise to Rebuild
rest: In the seventh month on the twenty-first day, the word of Yahweh came through Haggai the prophet, saying,

firstLine: The Coming Kingdom
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to Haggai a second time on the twenty-fourth day of the month saying,

firstLine: Zechariah’s First Vision
rest: On the twenty-fourth day of the eleventh month, the month of Shebat, in the second year of Darius, the word of Yahweh came to Zechariah the prophet, son of Berekiah, son of Iddo, saying,

firstLine: Zechariah’s Second Vision
rest: And I looked up and I saw, and look, there were four horns!

firstLine: Zechariah’s Third Vision
rest: And I looked up and I saw, and look, a man, and in his hand was a measuring rope!

firstLine: Zechariah’s Fourth Vision
rest: And he showed me Joshua the high priest standing before the angel of Yahweh; and Satan was standing on his right to accuse him.

firstLine: Zechariah’s Fifth Vision
rest: And the angel who was talking with me returned, and he wakened me as one who is wakened from his sleep.

firstLine: Zechariah’s Sixth Vision
rest: I looked up again, and I saw, and look!—a flying scroll!

firstLine: Zechariah’s Seventh Vision
rest: And the angel who was speaking to me went out, and he said to me, “Please look up! See what this is going out.”

firstLine: Zechariah’s Eighth Vision
rest: I looked up again, and I saw, and look!—four chariots coming out from between two mountains, and the mountains were mountains of bronze.

firstLine: The Branch is Crowned
rest: And the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

firstLine: Yahweh’s Promise to Jerusalem
rest: And the word of Yahweh of hosts came, saying,

firstLine: and also Hamath, which borders on it;
rest: Tyre and Sidon—yes, they are very wise!

firstLine: Tyre has built a fortification for itself,
rest:
and it heaped up silver like dust,
and gold like the mud of the streets.

firstLine: Ashkelon will see and will be afraid,
rest:
and Gaza will writhe exceedingly,
and Ekron also, because its hope is ruined.
And the king from Gaza will perish,
and Ashkelon will not be inhabited.

firstLine: A mongrel people will dwell in Ashdod,
rest: and I will cut down the pride of the Philistines.

firstLine: I will remove its blood from its mouth,
rest:
and its abominations from between its teeth.
And it too will be a remnant for our God;
and it will be like a tribal chief in Judah,
and Ekron will be like the Jebusite.

firstLine: But I will encamp at my temple like a guard,
And I will cut off the chariot from Ephraim,
rest:
and the horse from Jerusalem;
the battle bow will be cut down,
and he will announce peace to the nations.
His dominion will be from sea to sea,
and from the River to the ends of the earth.

firstLine: As for you also, because of the blood of your covenant,
rest: I will release your prisoners from the waterless pit.

firstLine: Return to the fortress,
rest:
O prisoners of hope;
today I am declaring that I will repay you double.

firstLine: For I have bent Judah as my bow;
rest:
I have set Ephraim as an arrow.
I will set in motion your sons, O Zion,
against your sons, O Javan.
I will wield you like the sword of a warrior.

firstLine: Then Yahweh will appear over them,
Yahweh of hosts will defend them,
rest:
and they will devour and subdue the slingstones;
they will drink, they will make noise like wine,
and they will be full like the sacrificial basin,
drenched like the corners of an altar.

firstLine: And Yahweh their God will save them on that day,
Yahweh Gives Rain
rest:
Ask rain from Yahweh in the season of the spring rain—
Yahweh, who makes storm clouds,
and he gives showers of rain to them,
to everyone vegetation in the field.

firstLine: Because the household gods speak deceit,
rest:
and those who practice divination see a lie,
and the dreamers of vanity speak in vain.
Therefore the people wander like sheep;
they are afflicted because there is no shepherd.

firstLine: My anger burns against the shepherds,
rest:
and I will punish the leaders,
because Yahweh of hosts watches over his flock,
the house of Judah;
and he will make them like his majestic horse in war.

firstLine: From them the cornerstone will go out,
And they will be like warriors,
rest:
trampling in the mud of the streets in the battle.
They will fight, because Yahweh is with them,
and they will put to shame the riders on horses.

firstLine: And I will strengthen the house of Judah,
rest:
and the house of Joseph I will save.
And I will bring them back, because I have compassion on them,
and they will be as if I had not rejected them,
for I am Yahweh their God, and I will answer them.

firstLine: And the people of Ephraim will be like a warrior,
I will whistle to them and gather them,
rest:
for I have redeemed them,
and they will become numerous as they have been numerous before.

firstLine: Though I sow them among the nations,
rest:
in the distant places they will remember me,
and they will stay alive with their children, and they will return.

firstLine: And I will bring them back from the land of Egypt,
rest:
and from Assyria I will gather them.
To the land of Gilead and Lebanon I will bring them,
until no room will be found for them there.

firstLine: And he will pass through the sea of distress,
rest:
and he will strike the waves of the sea,
and all the depths of the Nile will dry up.
The pride of Assyria will be brought low,
and the scepter of Egypt will depart.

firstLine: I will make them strong in Yahweh,
rest:
and in his name they will walk,
declares Yahweh.

firstLine: Open your doors, O Lebanon,
rest: so that fire will devour your cedars!

firstLine: Wail, O juniper, for the cedar has fallen,
rest:
for the magnificent trees are ruined!
Wail, oaks of Bashan,
for the impenetrable forest has come down!

firstLine: Listen to the wailing of the shepherds,
rest:
for their splendor is ruined!
Listen to the roar of the young lions,
for the thickets of the Jordan are ruined!

firstLine: The Two Shepherds
rest: Thus says Yahweh my God: “Shepherd the flock doomed to slaughter.

firstLine: “Woe, my worthless shepherd
rest:
who deserts the flock!
May a sword fall on his arm
and on his right eye!
May his arm wither completely
and his right eye be utterly blinded!”

firstLine: The Day of Yahweh
rest: An oracle. The word of Yahweh concerning Israel. “Thus declares Yahweh, who stretches out the heavens, founds the earth, and forms the spirit of humankind in its midst:

firstLine: The Sword Shall Strike the Shepherd
rest:
“O sword, awake against my shepherd,
against the man who is my associate,”
declares Yahweh of hosts.
“Strike the shepherd,
so that the sheep may be scattered,
and I will turn my hand against the small ones.

firstLine: And then in all the land,” declares Yahweh,
rest:
“two thirds will be cut off and perish,
and one third will be left alive in it.

firstLine: And I will bring the remaining third into the fire,
rest:
and I will refine them like one refines silver,
and I will test them like one tests gold.
They will call my name,
and I will answer them.
I will say, ‘They are my people,’
and they will say, ‘Yahweh is my God.’”

firstLine: Zechariah’s Apocalyptic Vision
rest: Look! A day is coming for Yahweh, when your plunder will be divided in your midst.

firstLine: An Oracle Against Edom
rest: “I have loved you,” says Yahweh, but you say, “How have you loved us?” “Is Esau not Jacob’s brother?” declares Yahweh. “I have loved Jacob,

firstLine: An Oracle Against the Temple Priesthood
rest: “A son honors his father, and a slave his master; but if I am a father, where is my honor, and if I am a master, where is my reverence?” says Yahweh of hosts to you, O priests, who despise my name. “But you say, ‘How have we despised your name?’

firstLine: Yahweh Hates Faithlessness
rest: Do we not all have one father? Has not one God created us? Why then are we unfaithful to one another, profaning the covenant of our ancestors?

firstLine: Yahweh’s Messenger is Coming
rest: “Look! I am going to send my messenger, and he will prepare the way before me. And the Lord whom you are seeking will come suddenly to his temple, and the messenger of the covenant, in whom you are taking pleasure—look!—he is about to come,” says Yahweh of hosts.

firstLine: An Overflowing Blessing
rest: “For I, Yahweh, have not changed, and you, O children of Jacob, have not perished.

firstLine: A Book of Remembrance is Written
rest: Then those who revered Yahweh spoke with one another. And Yahweh listened attentively and heard, and a scroll of remembrance was written before him of those who revere Yahweh and ponder his name.

firstLine: The Genealogy of Jesus Christ
rest: The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.

firstLine: The Birth of Jesus Christ
rest: Now the birth of Jesus Christ occurred in this way. His mother Mary had been betrothed to Joseph, but before they came together, she was found to be pregnant by the Holy Spirit.

firstLine: “Behold, the virgin will become pregnant and will give birth to a son,
rest:
and they will call his name Emmanuel,”
which is translated, “God with us.”

firstLine: Wise Men Visit Jesus
rest: Now after Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of Herod the king, behold, wise men from the east came to Jerusalem,

firstLine: ‘And you, Bethlehem, land of Judah,
rest:
are by no means least among the rulers of Judah,
for from you will go out a ruler
who will shepherd my people Israel.’”

firstLine: Joseph, Mary, and Jesus Escape to Egypt
rest: Now after they had gone away, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph, saying, “Get up, take the child and his mother and flee to Egypt, and stay there until I tell you. For Herod is about to seek the child to destroy him.”

firstLine: Herod Has Innocent Children Murdered
rest: Then Herod, when he saw that he had been deceived by the wise men, became very angry, and he sent soldiers and executed all the children in Bethlehem and in all the region around it from the age of two years old and under, according to the time which he had determined precisely from the wise men.

firstLine: “A voice was heard in Ramah,
rest:
weeping and great mourning,
Rachel weeping for her children,
and she did not want to be comforted,
because they exist no longer.”

firstLine: Joseph, Mary, and Jesus Return to Nazareth
rest: Now after Herod had died, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt,

firstLine: John the Baptist Begins His Ministry
rest: Now in those days John the Baptist came preaching in the Judean wilderness

firstLine: For this is the one who was spoken about by the prophet Isaiah, saying,
rest:
“The voice of one crying out in the wilderness,
‘Prepare the way of the Lord,
make his paths straight.’”

firstLine: The Baptism of Jesus
rest: Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan to John in order to be baptized by him.

firstLine: The Temptation of Jesus
rest: Then Jesus was led up into the wilderness by the Spirit to be tempted by the devil,

firstLine: Public Ministry in Galilee
rest: Now when he heard that John had been arrested, he withdrew into Galilee.

firstLine: “Land of Zebulun and land of Naphtali,
rest:
toward the sea, on the other side of the Jordan,
Galilee of the Gentiles—

firstLine: the people who sit in darkness
rest:
have seen a great light,
and the ones who sit in the land and shadow of death,
a light has dawned on them.”

firstLine: Jesus Calls His First Disciples
rest: Now as he was walking beside the Sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon called Peter and his brother Andrew, throwing a casting net into the sea (for they were fishermen).

firstLine: Teaching, Preaching, and Healing throughout Galilee
rest: And he went around through all of Galilee, teaching in their synagogues and proclaiming the good news of the kingdom and healing every disease and every sickness among the people.

firstLine: The Sermon on the Mount: The Beatitudes
rest: Now when he saw the crowds, he went up the mountain and after he sat down, his disciples approached him.

firstLine: “Blessed are the poor in spirit,
rest: because theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

firstLine: Blessed are the ones who mourn,
rest: because they will be comforted.

firstLine: Blessed are the meek,
rest: because they will inherit the earth.

firstLine: Blessed are the ones who hunger and thirst for righteousness,
rest: because they will be satisfied.

firstLine: Blessed are the merciful,
rest: because they will be shown mercy.

firstLine: Blessed are the pure in heart,
rest: because they will see God.

firstLine: Blessed are the peacemakers,
rest: because they will be called sons of God.

firstLine: Blessed are those who are persecuted because of righteousness,
rest: because theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

firstLine: Blessed are you
rest: when they insult you and persecute you and say all kinds of evil things against you, lying on account of me.

firstLine: The Sermon on the Mount: Salt and Light
rest: “You are the salt of the earth. But if salt becomes tasteless, by what will it be made salty? It is good for nothing any longer except to be thrown outside and trampled under foot by people.

firstLine: The Sermon on the Mount: The Law and the Prophets Fulfilled
rest: “Do not think that I have come to destroy the law or the prophets. I have not come to destroy them but to fulfill them.

firstLine: The Sermon on the Mount: Anger Toward Others
rest: “You have heard that it was said to the people of old, ‘Do not commit murder,’ and ‘whoever commits murder will be subject to judgment.’

firstLine: The Sermon on the Mount: Adultery and Lust
rest: “You have heard that it was said, ‘Do not commit adultery.’

firstLine: The Sermon on the Mount: Divorce
rest: “And it was said, ‘Whoever divorces his wife must give her a certificate of divorce.’

firstLine: The Sermon on the Mount: Taking Oaths
rest: “Again you have heard that it was said to the people of old, ‘Do not swear falsely, but fulfill your oaths to the Lord.’

firstLine: The Sermon on the Mount: Retaliation
rest: “You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth.’

firstLine: The Sermon on the Mount: Love for Enemies
rest: “You have heard that it was said, ‘Love your neighbor’ and ‘Hate your enemy.’

firstLine: The Sermon on the Mount: Charitable Giving
rest: “And take care not to practice your righteousness before people to be seen by them; otherwise you have no reward from your Father who is in heaven.

firstLine: The Sermon on the Mount: How to Pray
rest: And whenever you pray, do not be like the hypocrites, because they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and on the corners of the streets, in order that they may be seen by people. Truly I say to you, they have received their reward in full!

firstLine: Therefore you pray in this way:
rest:
“Our Father who is in heaven,
may your name be treated as holy.

firstLine: May your kingdom come,
rest:
may your will be done
on earth as it is in heaven.

firstLine: and forgive us our debts,
rest: as we also have forgiven our debtors.

firstLine: And do not bring us into temptation,
rest: but deliver us from the evil one.

firstLine: The Sermon on the Mount: How to Fast
rest: “Whenever you fast, do not be sullen like the hypocrites, for they make their faces unrecognizable in order that they may be seen fasting by people. Truly I say to you, they have received their reward in full!

firstLine: The Sermon on the Mount: Treasure in Heaven
rest: “Do not store up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and consuming insect destroy and where thieves break in and steal,

firstLine: The Sermon on the Mount: Anxiety
rest: “For this reason I say to you, do not be anxious for your life, what you will eat, and not for your body, what you will wear. Is your life not more than food and your body more than clothing?

firstLine: The Sermon on the Mount: On Judging Others
rest: “Do not judge, so that you will not be judged.

firstLine: The Sermon on the Mount: Ask, Seek, Knock
rest: “Ask and it will be given to you; seek and you will find; knock and it will be opened for you.

firstLine: The Sermon on the Mount: The Narrow Gate
rest: “Enter through the narrow gate, because broad is the gate and spacious is the road that leads to destruction, and there are many who enter through it,

firstLine: The Sermon on the Mount: Recognizing False Prophets
rest: “Beware of false prophets who come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inside are ravenous wolves.

firstLine: The Sermon on the Mount: False Followers
rest: “Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will enter into the kingdom of heaven, but the one who does the will of my Father who is in heaven.

firstLine: The Sermon on the Mount: Two Houses and Two Foundations
rest: “Therefore everyone who hears these words of mine and does them will be like a wise man who built his house on the rock.

firstLine: The Sermon on the Mount: Response
rest: And it happened when Jesus finished these words the crowds were amazed at his teaching,

firstLine: A Leper Cleansed
rest: And when he came down from the mountain, large crowds followed him.

firstLine: A Centurion’s Slave Healed
rest: Now when he entered Capernaum, a centurion approached him, appealing to him

firstLine: Many at Capernaum Are Healed
rest: And when Jesus came into Peter’s house, he saw his mother-in-law lying down and suffering with a fever.

firstLine: in order that what was spoken through the prophet Isaiah would be fulfilled, who said,
rest:
“He himself took away our sicknesses,
and carried away our diseases.”

firstLine: Would-be Followers
rest: Now when Jesus saw many crowds around him, he gave orders to depart to the other side.

firstLine: Calming of a Storm
rest: And as he got into the boat, his disciples followed him.

firstLine: Demon-possessed Gadarenes Healed
rest: And when he came to the other side, to the region of the Gadarenes, two demon-possessed men coming from among the tombs met him, very violent, so that no one was able to pass by along that road.

firstLine: A Paralytic Healed
rest: And getting into a boat, he crossed over and came to his own town.

firstLine: Matthew Called to Follow Jesus
rest: And as Jesus was going away from there, he saw a man called Matthew sitting at the tax booth and said to him, “Follow me!” And he stood up and followed him.

firstLine: On Fasting
rest: Then the disciples of John approached him, saying, “Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but your disciples do not fast?”

firstLine: A Woman Healed and a Daughter Raised
rest: As he was saying these things to them, behold, one of the rulers came and knelt down before him, saying, “My daughter has just now died, but come, place your hand on her and she will live!”

firstLine: Two Blind Men Healed
rest: And as Jesus was going away from there, two blind men followed him, crying out and saying, “Have mercy on us, Son of David!”

firstLine: A Demon Expelled
rest: Now as they were going away, behold, they brought to him a demon-possessed man who was unable to speak.

firstLine: A Plentiful Harvest But Few Workers
rest: And Jesus was going around all the towns and the villages, teaching in their synagogues and proclaiming the good news of the kingdom and healing every disease and every sickness.

firstLine: The Twelve Commissioned and Sent Out
rest: And summoning his twelve disciples, he gave them authority over unclean spirits, so that they could expel them and could heal every disease and every sickness.

firstLine: Persecution of Disciples Predicted
rest: “Behold, I am sending you out like sheep in the midst of wolves. Therefore be wise as serpents and innocent as doves.

firstLine: Fear God Rather Than People
rest: “Therefore do not be afraid of them, because nothing is hidden that will not be revealed, and nothing secret that will not become known.

firstLine: Not Peace, But a Sword of Divisiveness
rest: “Do not think that I have come to bring peace on the earth! I have not come to bring peace, but a sword.

firstLine: On Rewards
rest: “The one who receives you receives me, and the one who receives me receives the one who sent me.

firstLine: A Question from John the Baptist
rest: And it happened that when Jesus had finished giving orders to his twelve disciples, he went on from there to teach and to preach in their towns.

firstLine: It is this man about whom it is written:
rest:
‘Behold, I am sending my messenger before your face,
who will prepare your way before you.’

firstLine: saying,
rest:
‘We played the flute for you and you did not dance;
we sang a lament and you did not mourn.’

firstLine: Woes Pronounced on Unrepentant Towns
rest: Then he began to reproach the towns in which the majority of his miracles had been done, because they did not repent:

firstLine: A Yoke That Is Easy
rest: At that time Jesus answered and said, “I praise you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hidden these things from the wise and intelligent, and have revealed them to young children.

firstLine: Plucking Grain on the Sabbath
rest: At that time Jesus went through the grain fields on the Sabbath. And his disciples were hungry, and they began to pluck off heads of grain and eat them.

firstLine: A Man with a Withered Hand Healed
rest: And going on from there he came into their synagogue.

firstLine: God’s Chosen Servant
rest: Now Jesus, when he learned of it, withdrew from there, and many followed him, and he healed them all.

firstLine: “Behold my servant whom I have chosen,
rest:
my beloved in whom my soul is well pleased.
I will put my Spirit on him,
and he will proclaim justice to the Gentiles.

firstLine: He will not quarrel or cry out,
rest: nor will anyone hear his voice in the streets.

firstLine: A crushed reed he will not break,
rest:
and a smoldering wick he will not extinguish,
until he brings justice to victory.

firstLine: A House Divided Cannot Stand
rest: Then a demon-possessed man who was blind and mute was brought to him. And he healed him so that the man who was mute could speak and see.

firstLine: Good Trees and Good Fruit or Bad Trees and Bad Fruit
rest: “Either make the tree good and its fruit is good, or make the tree bad and its fruit is bad, for the tree is known by its fruit.

firstLine: The Sign of Jonah
rest: Then some of the scribes and Pharisees answered him saying, “Teacher, we want to see a sign from you!”

firstLine: An Unclean Spirit Returns
rest: “Now whenever an unclean spirit has gone out of a person, it travels through waterless places searching for rest, and does not find it.

firstLine: Jesus’ Mother and Brothers
rest: And while he was still speaking to the crowds, behold, his mother and brothers were standing there outside, desiring to speak to him.

firstLine: The Parable of the Sower
rest: On that day Jesus went out of the house and was sitting by the sea.

firstLine: The Reason for the Parables
rest: And the disciples came up and said to him, “Why do you speak to them in parables?”

firstLine: and with reference to them the prophecy of Isaiah is fulfilled that says,
rest:
“You will listen carefully and will never understand,
and you will look closely and will never perceive.

firstLine: For the heart of this people has become dull,
rest:
and with their ears they hear with difficulty,
and they have shut their eyes,
so that they would not see with their eyes
and hear with their ears
and understand with their heart
and turn, and I would heal them.”

firstLine: The Parable of the Sower Interpreted
rest: “You, therefore, listen to the parable of the sower:

firstLine: The Parable of the Weeds Among the Wheat
rest: He put before them another parable, saying, “The kingdom of heaven may be compared to a man who sowed good seed in his field.

firstLine: The Parable of the Mustard Seed
rest: He put before them another parable, saying, “The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed that a man took and sowed in his field.

firstLine: The Parable of the Yeast
rest: He told them another parable: “The kingdom of heaven is like yeast that a woman took and put into three measures of wheat flour until the whole batch was leavened.”

firstLine: Parables Fulfill Prophecy
rest: Jesus spoke all these things to the crowds in parables, and he was saying nothing to them without a parable,

firstLine: in order that what was spoken through the prophet would be fulfilled, who said,
rest:
“I will open my mouth in parables;
I will proclaim what has been hidden since the creation.”

firstLine: The Parable of the Weeds Interpreted
rest: Then he left the crowds and came into the house, and his disciples came to him saying, “Explain the parable of the darnel in the field to us.”

firstLine: The Parable of the Treasure Hidden in a Field
rest: “The kingdom of heaven is like treasure hidden in a field, that a man found and concealed, and in his joy he goes and sells everything that he has and buys that field.

firstLine: The Parable of the Valuable Pearl
rest: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a merchant searching for fine pearls.

firstLine: The Parable of the Dragnet
rest: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a dragnet that was thrown into the sea and gathered fish of every kind,

firstLine: Rejected at Nazareth
rest: And it happened that when Jesus had finished these parables he went away from there.

firstLine: Herod Kills John the Baptist
rest: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard the report about Jesus

firstLine: The Feeding of Five Thousand
rest: Now when Jesus heard it, he withdrew from there in a boat to an isolated place by himself. And when the crowds heard it, they followed him by land from the towns.

firstLine: Jesus Walks on the Water
rest: And immediately he made the disciples get into the boat and go ahead of him to the other side, while he sent away the crowds.

firstLine: Many Healed at Gennesaret
rest: And after they had crossed over, they came to land at Gennesaret.

firstLine: Human Traditions and God’s Commandments
rest: Then Pharisees and scribes came to Jesus from Jerusalem, saying,

firstLine: ‘This people honors me with their lips,
rest: but their heart is far, far away from me,

firstLine: and they worship me in vain,
rest: teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.’”

firstLine: Defilement from Within
rest: And summoning the crowd, he said to them, “Hear and understand:

firstLine: A Canaanite Woman’s Great Faith
rest: And departing from there, Jesus went away to the region of Tyre and Sidon.

firstLine: Many Others Healed in Galilee
rest: And departing from there, Jesus went along the Sea of Galilee, and he went up on the mountain and was sitting there.

firstLine: The Feeding of Four Thousand
rest: And Jesus summoned his disciples and said, “I have compassion on the crowd, because they have remained with me three days already and do not have anything to eat, and I do not want to send them away hungry lest they give out on the way.”

firstLine: The Signs of the Times
rest: And when the Pharisees and Sadducees came to test him, they asked him to show them a sign from heaven.

firstLine: Beware the Leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees
rest: And when the disciples arrived at the other side, they had forgotten to take bread.

firstLine: Peter’s Confession at Caesarea Philippi
rest: Now when Jesus came to the region of Caesarea Philippi, he began asking his disciples, saying, “Who do people say that the Son of Man is?”

firstLine: Jesus Predicts His Death and Resurrection
rest: From that time on Jesus began to show his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things from the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and be raised on the third day.

firstLine: Taking Up One’s Cross to Follow Jesus
rest: Then Jesus said to his disciples, “If anyone wants to come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.

firstLine: The Transfiguration
rest: And after six days Jesus took along Peter and James and John his brother, and led them up on a high mountain by themselves.

firstLine: A Demon-possessed Boy Healed
rest: And when they came to the crowd, a man approached him, kneeling down before him

firstLine: Jesus Predicts His Death and Resurrection a Second Time
rest: Now as they were gathering in Galilee, Jesus said to them, “The Son of Man is going to be betrayed into the hands of men,

firstLine: Paying the Double Drachma Temple Tax
rest: Now when they arrived in Capernaum, the ones who collected the double drachma tax came up to Peter and said, “Does your teacher not pay the double drachma tax?”

firstLine: The Question About Who Is Greatest
rest: At that time the disciples came up to Jesus, saying, “Who then is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?”

firstLine: The Parable of the Lost Sheep
rest: “See to it that you do not despise one of these little ones, for I tell you that their angels in heaven constantly see the face of my Father who is in heaven.

firstLine: Confronting a Brother Who Sins Against You
rest: “Now if your brother sins against you, go correct him between you and him alone. If he listens to you, you have gained your brother.

firstLine: The Parable of the Unforgiving Slave
rest: Then Peter came up to him and said, “Lord, how many times will my brother sin against me and I will forgive him? Up to seven times?”

firstLine: On Divorce
rest: And it happened that when Jesus had finished these statements, he went away from Galilee and came into the region of Judea on the other side of the Jordan.

firstLine: Little Children Brought to Jesus
rest: Then children were brought to him so that he could lay his hands on them and pray, but the disciples rebuked them.

firstLine: A Rich Young Man
rest: And behold, someone came up to him and said, “Teacher, what good thing must I do so that I will have eternal life?”

firstLine: The Parable of the Workers in the Vineyard
rest: “For the kingdom of heaven is like a man—the master of the house—who went out early in the morning to hire workers for his vineyard.

firstLine: Jesus Predicts His Death and Resurrection a Third Time
rest: And as Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, he took the twelve disciples by themselves and said to them on the way,

firstLine: A Request by the Mother of James and John
rest: Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee came up to him with her sons, and kneeling down she asked something from him.

firstLine: Two Blind Men Healed at Jericho
rest: And as they were going out of Jericho, a large crowd followed him.

firstLine: The Triumphal Entry
rest: And when they drew near to Jerusalem and came to Bethphage at the Mount of Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples,

firstLine: “Say to the daughter of Zion,
rest:
‘Behold, your king is coming to you,
humble and mounted on a donkey,
and on a colt, the foal of a pack animal.’”

firstLine: And the crowds who went ahead of him and the ones who followed were shouting, saying,
rest:
“Hosanna to the Son of David!
Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord!
Hosanna in the highest heaven!”

firstLine: The Cleansing of the Temple
rest: And Jesus entered the temple courts and drove out all those who were selling and buying in the temple, and overturned the tables of the money changers and the chairs of those who were selling doves.

firstLine: A Barren Fig Tree Cursed
rest: Now early in the morning, as he was returning to the city, he was hungry.

firstLine: Jesus’ Authority Challenged
rest: And after he arrived at the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came up to him while he was teaching, saying, “By what authority are you doing these things? And who gave you this authority?”

firstLine: The Parable of the Two Sons
rest: “Now what do you think? A man had two sons. He approached the first and said, ‘Son, go work in the vineyard today.’

firstLine: The Parable of the Tenant Farmers in the Vineyard
rest: “Listen to another parable: There was a man—a master of a house—who planted a vineyard, and put a fence around it, and dug a winepress in it, and built a watchtower, and leased it to tenant farmers, and went on a journey.

firstLine: Jesus said to them, “Have you never read in the scriptures,
rest:
‘The stone which the builders rejected,
this has become the cornerstone.
This came about from the Lord,
and it is marvelous in our eyes’?

firstLine: The Parable of the Wedding Celebration
rest: And continuing, Jesus spoke to them again in parables, saying,

firstLine: Paying Taxes to Caesar
rest: Then the Pharisees went and consulted so that they could entrap him with a statement.

firstLine: A Question About Marriage and the Resurrection
rest: On that day Sadducees—who say there is no resurrection—came up to him and asked him,

firstLine: The Greatest Commandment
rest: Now when the Pharisees heard that he had silenced the Sadducees, they assembled at the same place.

firstLine: David’s Son and Lord
rest: Now while the Pharisees were assembled, Jesus asked them,

firstLine: ‘The Lord said to my Lord,
rest:
“Sit at my right hand
until I put your enemies
under your feet”’?

firstLine: Seven Woes Pronounced on the Scribes and Pharisees
rest: Then Jesus spoke to the crowds and to his disciples,

firstLine: The Lament over Jerusalem
rest: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, who kills the prophets and stones those who are sent to her! How many times I wanted to gather your children together the way a hen gathers her young together under her wings, and you were not willing!

firstLine: For I tell you, you will never see me from now on until you say,
rest: ‘Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord!’”

firstLine: The Destruction of the Temple Predicted
rest: And as Jesus went out of the temple courts he was going along, and his disciples came up to point out to him the buildings of the temple.

firstLine: Signs of the End of the Age
rest: And as he was sitting on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came up to him privately, saying, “Tell us, when will these things happen, and what will be the sign of your coming and of the end of the age?”

firstLine: Persecution of Disciples Predicted
rest: “Then they will hand you over to persecution and will kill you, and you will be hated by all the nations because of my name.

firstLine: The Abomination of Desolation
rest: “So when you see the abomination of desolation spoken about by the prophet Daniel standing in the holy place” (let the one who reads understand),

firstLine: The Arrival of the Son of Man
rest:
“And immediately after the tribulation of those days,
‘the sun will be darkened
and the moon will not give its light,
and the stars will fall from heaven,
and the powers of heaven will be shaken.’

firstLine: The Parable of the Fig Tree
rest: “Now learn the parable from the fig tree: Whenever its branch has already become tender and puts forth its leaves, you know that summer is near.

firstLine: The Unknown Day and Hour
rest: “But concerning that day and hour no one knows—not even the angels of heaven nor the Son—except the Father alone.

firstLine: A Faithful Slave and an Unfaithful Slave
rest: “Who then is the faithful and wise slave whom the master has put in charge of his household slaves to give them their food at the right time?

firstLine: The Parable of the Ten Virgins
rest: “Then the kingdom of heaven may be compared to ten virgins who took their lamps and went out to meet the bridegroom.

firstLine: The Parable of the Talents
rest: For it is like a man going on a journey. He summoned his own slaves and handed over his property to them.

firstLine: The Judgment of the Sheep and the Goats
rest: Now when the Son of Man comes in his glory and all the angels with him, then he will sit on his glorious throne.

firstLine: The Chief Priests and Elders Plot to Kill Jesus
rest: And it happened that when Jesus had finished all these sayings, he said to his disciples,

firstLine: Jesus’ Anointing at Bethany
rest: Now while Jesus was at Bethany in the house of Simon the leper,

firstLine: Judas Arranges to Betray Jesus
rest: Then one of the twelve, the one named Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests

firstLine: Jesus’ Final Passover with the Disciples
rest: Now on the first day of the feast of Unleavened Bread the disciples came up to Jesus, saying, “Where do you want us to prepare for you to eat the Passover?”

firstLine: The Lord’s Supper
rest: Now while they were eating Jesus took bread and, after giving thanks, he broke it, and giving it to the disciples, he said, “Take, eat, this is my body.”

firstLine: Jesus Predicts Peter’s Denial
rest:
Then Jesus said to them, “You will all fall away because of me during this night, for it is written,
‘I will strike the shepherd
and the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’

firstLine: The Prayer in Gethsemane
rest: Then Jesus went with them to a place called Gethsemane, and he said to the disciples, “Sit here while I go over there and pray.”

firstLine: The Betrayal and Arrest of Jesus
rest: And while he was still speaking, behold, Judas—one of the twelve—arrived, and with him a large crowd with swords and clubs, from the chief priests and elders of the people.

firstLine: Jesus Before the Sanhedrin
rest: Now those who had arrested Jesus led him away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders had gathered.

firstLine: Peter Denies Jesus Three Times
rest: Now Peter was sitting outside in the courtyard, and a female slave came up to him and said, “You also were with Jesus the Galilean.”

firstLine: Jesus Taken to Pilate
rest: Now when it was early morning, all the chief priests and the elders of the people took counsel against Jesus in order to put him to death.

firstLine: The Suicide of Judas Iscariot
rest: Then when Judas, the one who had betrayed him, saw that he had been condemned, he regretted what he had done and returned the thirty silver coins to the chief priests and elders,

firstLine: Jesus Before Pilate
rest: So Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor asked him, saying, “Are you the king of the Jews?” And Jesus said, “You say so.”

firstLine: Pilate Releases Barabbas
rest: Now at each feast, the governor was accustomed to release one prisoner to the crowd—the one whom they wanted.

firstLine: Jesus Is Mocked

firstLine: Righteousness through Faith Revealed

firstLine: Abraham’s Faith Counted as Righteousness

firstLine: “Blessed are they whose lawless deeds have been forgiven,

rest: For the promise to Abraham or to his descendants, that he would be heir of the world, was not through the law, but through the righteousness by faith.

firstLine: Reconciliation with God through Faith in Christ
rest: Therefore, because we have been declared righteous by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ,

firstLine: Death Came through Adam but Life Comes through Christ

firstLine: Formerly Dead to Sin, Now Alive in Christ
rest: What therefore shall we say? Shall we continue in sin, in order that grace may increase?

firstLine: Set Free from Sin

firstLine: Released from the Law through Death

firstLine: Knowledge of Sin Comes through the Law

firstLine: Internal Conflict with Sin
rest: Therefore, did that which is good become death to me? May it never be! Rather it was sin, in order that it might be recognized as sin, producing death through what is good for me, in order that sin might become sinful to an extraordinary degree through the commandment.

firstLine: Set Free from the Law of Sin and Death
rest: Consequently, there is now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus.

firstLine: The Glory that is to be Revealed
rest: For I consider that the sufferings of the present time are not worthy to be compared with the glory that is about to be revealed to us.

firstLine: Victory in Christ
rest: What then shall we say about these things? If God is for us, who can be against us?

firstLine: Just as it is written,
rest:
“On account of you we are being put to death the whole day long;
we are considered as sheep for slaughter.”

firstLine: Israel’s Rejection
rest: I am telling the truth in Christ—I am not lying; my conscience bears witness to me in the Holy Spirit—

“Even if the number of the sons of Israel is like the sand of the sea,
the remnant will be saved,

firstLine: And just as Isaiah foretold,
rest:
“If the Lord of hosts had not left us descendants,
we would have become like Sodom
and would have resembled Gomorrah.”

firstLine: just as it is written,
rest:
“Behold, I am laying in Zion a stone that causes people to stumble,
and a rock that causes them to fall,
and the one who believes in him will not be put to shame.”

firstLine: The Righteousness of God through Faith in Christ
rest: Brothers, the desire of my heart and my prayer to God on behalf of them is for their salvation.

firstLine: And Isaiah is very bold and says,
rest:
“I was found by those who did not seek me;
I became known to those who did not ask for me.”

firstLine: But about Israel he says,
rest:
“The whole day long I held out my hands
to a disobedient and resistant people.”

firstLine: A Remnant of Israel Remains
rest: Therefore I say, God has not rejected his people, has he? May it never be! For I also am an Israelite, from the descendants of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin.

firstLine: just as it is written,
rest:
“God gave them a spirit of stupor,
eyes that do not see and ears that do not hear,
until this very day.”

firstLine: And David says,
rest:
“Let their table become a snare and a trap,
and a cause for stumbling and a retribution to them;

firstLine: let their eyes be darkened so that they do not see,
rest: and cause their backs to bend continually.”

firstLine: Gentile Branches Grafted in
rest: Now I am speaking to you Gentiles. Therefore, inasmuch as I am apostle to the Gentiles, I promote my ministry,

firstLine: All Israel to be Saved
rest: For I do not want you to be ignorant, brothers, of this mystery, so that you will not be wise in your own sight, that a partial hardening has happened to Israel, until the full number of the Gentiles has come in,

firstLine: and so all Israel will be saved, just as it is written,
rest:
“The deliverer will come out of Zion;
he will turn away ungodliness from Jacob.

firstLine: And this is the covenant from me with them
rest: when I take away their sins.”

firstLine: Oh, the depth of the riches
rest:
and the wisdom and the knowledge of God!
How unsearchable are his judgments
and how incomprehensible are his ways!

firstLine: “For who has known the mind of the Lord,
rest: or who has been his counselor?

firstLine: Or who has given in advance to him,
rest: and it will be paid back to him?”

firstLine: A Life Dedicated to God
rest: Therefore I exhort you, brothers, through the mercies of God, to present your bodies as a living sacrifice, holy and pleasing to God, which is your reasonable service.

firstLine: A Variety of Gifts in the Body of Christ
rest: For by the grace given to me I say to everyone who is among you not to think more highly of yourself than what one ought to think, but to think sensibly, as God has apportioned a measure of faith to each one.

firstLine: Living in Love
rest: Love must be without hypocrisy. Abhor what is evil; be attached to what is good,

firstLine: Obedience to the Governing Authorities
rest: Let every person be subject to the governing authorities, for there is no authority except by God, and those that exist are put in place by God.

firstLine: Love Fulfills the Law
rest: Owe nothing to anyone, except to love one another, for the one who loves someone else has fulfilled the law.

firstLine: Do Not Pass Judgment on One Another
rest: Now receive the one who is weak in faith, but not for quarrels about opinions.

firstLine: For it is written,
rest:
“As I live, says the Lord, every knee will bow to me,
and every tongue will praise God.”

firstLine: Accept One Another according to Christ’s Example
rest: But we who are strong ought to bear the weaknesses of the weak, and not to please ourselves.

firstLine: and that the Gentiles may glorify God for his mercy, just as it is written,
rest:
“Because of this, I will praise you among the Gentiles,
and I will sing praise to your name.”

firstLine: And again it says,
rest: “Rejoice, Gentiles, with his people.”

firstLine: And again,
rest:
“Praise the Lord, all the Gentiles,
and let all the peoples praise him.”

firstLine: And again Isaiah says,
Paul’s Ministry to the Gentiles
rest: Now I myself also am convinced about you, my brothers, that you yourselves also are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge, able also to instruct one another.

firstLine: but just as it is written,
rest:
“Those to whom it was not announced concerning him will see,
and those who have not heard will understand.”

firstLine: Paul’s Travel Plans
rest: For this reason also I was hindered many times from coming to you,

firstLine: Many Personal Greetings
rest: Now I commend to you Phoebe our sister, who is also a servant of the church in Cenchrea,

firstLine: Concluding Exhortations
rest: Now I exhort you, brothers, to look out for those who cause dissensions and temptations contrary to the teaching which you learned, and stay away from them.

firstLine: Greetings from Paul’s Associates
rest: Timothy, my fellow worker, greets you, and Lucius and Jason and Sosipater, my compatriots.

firstLine: Benediction
rest: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with all of you. Amen.

firstLine: Greeting
rest: Paul, called to be an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, and Sosthenes our brother,

firstLine: Thanksgiving for the Corinthian Believers
rest: I give thanks to my God always concerning you, because of the grace of God which was given to you in Christ Jesus,

firstLine: Divisions in the Church at Corinth
rest: Now I exhort you, brothers, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you all say the same thing and there not be divisions among you, and that you be made complete in the same mind and with the same purpose.

firstLine: Christ Crucified, the Power and Wisdom of God
rest: For the message about the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing, but to us who are being saved it is the power of God.

firstLine: For it is written,
rest:
“I will destroy the wisdom of the wise,
and the intelligence of the intelligent I will confound.”

firstLine: Boast in the Lord
rest: For consider your calling, brothers, that not many were wise according to human standards, not many were powerful, not many were well born.

firstLine: Paul’s Approach to Ministry in Corinth
rest: And I, when I came to you, brothers, did not come with superiority of speech or of wisdom, proclaiming to you the testimony of God.

firstLine: The Wisdom Revealed by the Spirit
rest: Now we do speak wisdom among the mature, but wisdom not of this age or of the rulers of this age, who are perishing,

firstLine: But just as it is written,
rest:
“Things which eye has not seen and ear has not heard,
and have not entered into the heart of man,
all that God has prepared for those who love him.”

firstLine: Divisiveness and Immaturity
rest: And I, brothers, was not able to speak to you as to spiritual people, but as to fleshly people, as to infants in Christ.

firstLine: Christ’s Servant, God’s Steward
rest: Thus let a person consider us as servants of Christ and stewards of God’s mysteries.

firstLine: The Apostles’ Humility
rest: Now I have applied these things, brothers, to myself and Apollos for your sake, in order that in us you may learn not to go beyond what is written, lest someone be inflated with pride on behalf of one person against the other.

firstLine: Paul’s Concern for the Corinthian Believers
rest: I am not writing these things to shame you, but admonishing you as my dear children.

firstLine: Immoral Behavior and Church Discipline
rest: It is reported everywhere that there is sexual immorality among you, and sexual immorality of such a kind which does not even exist among the Gentiles, so that someone has the wife of his father.

firstLine: Lawsuits between Believers
rest: Does anyone among you, if he has a matter against someone else, dare to go to court before the unrighteous, and not before the saints?

firstLine: Avoid Sexual Immorality
rest: All things are permitted for me, but not all things are profitable. All things are permitted for me, but I will not be controlled by anything.

firstLine: Concerning Christian Marriage
rest: Now concerning the things about which you wrote: “It is good for a man not to touch a woman.”

firstLine: Concerning the Unmarried
rest: Now concerning virgins I do not have a command from the Lord, but I am giving an opinion as one shown mercy by the Lord to be trustworthy.

firstLine: Concerning Food Sacrificed to Idols
rest: Now concerning food sacrificed to idols, we know that “we all have knowledge.” Knowledge puffs up, but love builds up.

firstLine: yet to us there is one God, the Father,
Paul Gives Up His Rights as an Apostle
rest: Am I not free? Am I not an apostle? Have I not seen Jesus our Lord? Are you not my work in the Lord?

firstLine: A History Lesson from Israel
rest: For I do not want you to be ignorant, brothers, that our fathers were all under the cloud and all went through the sea,

firstLine: Warning Against Idolatry
rest: Therefore, my dear friends, flee from idolatry.

firstLine: Freedom in Christ
rest: All things are permitted, but not all things are profitable. All things are permitted, but not all things build up.

firstLine: Concerning Head Coverings in Worship
rest: Become imitators of me, just as I also am of Christ.

firstLine: Improper Conduct at the Lord’s Supper
rest: But in giving this instruction I do not praise you, because you come together not for the better but for the worse.

firstLine: Varieties of Spiritual Gifts
rest: Now concerning spiritual gifts, brothers, I do not want you to be ignorant.

firstLine: Unity in the Midst of Diversity
rest: For just as the body is one and has many members, but all the members of the body, although they are many, are one body, thus also Christ.

firstLine: Love, the More Excellent Way
rest: If I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, but do not have love, I have become a ringing brass gong or a clashing cymbal.

firstLine: Appropriate Use of Prophecy and Tongues
rest: Pursue love, and strive for spiritual gifts, but especially that you may prophesy.

firstLine: In the law it is written:
rest:
“By those who speak a foreign language
and by the lips of others
I will speak to this people,
and not even in this way will they obey me,”
says the Lord.

firstLine: Specific Instructions for Orderly Worship Services
rest: Therefore what should you do, brothers? Whenever you come together, each one of you has a psalm, has a teaching, has a revelation, has a tongue, has an interpretation. All things must be done for edification.

firstLine: Paul’s Gospel and the Resurrection of Christ
rest: Now I make known to you, brothers, the gospel which I proclaimed to you, which you have also received, in which you also stand,

firstLine: Concerning the Resurrection of the Dead
rest: Now if Christ is preached as raised up from the dead, how do some among you say that there is no resurrection of the dead?

firstLine: Questions Concerning the Resurrection Body
rest: But someone will say, “How are the dead raised? And with what sort of body do they come?”

firstLine: Concerning the Collection for the Saints
rest: Now concerning the collection for the saints: just as I gave directions about it to the churches of Galatia, so you do also.

firstLine: Travel Plans for Paul and Associates
rest: But I will come to you whenever I go through Macedonia (for I am going through Macedonia),

firstLine: Concluding Exhortations
rest: Be on the alert, stand firm in the faith, act courageously, be strong.

firstLine: Final Greetings and Benediction
rest: The churches of the province of Asia greet you. Aquila and Prisca greet you in the Lord many times, together with the church in their house.

firstLine: Greeting
rest: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, and Timothy our brother, to the church of God that is in Corinth, together with all the saints who are in all Achaia.

firstLine: Thanksgiving for God’s Compassion and Comfort
rest: Blessed is the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and God of all comfort,

firstLine: Paul’s Clear Conscience
rest: For our reason for boasting is this: the testimony of our conscience that we conducted ourselves in the world, and especially toward you, in holiness and purity of motive from God, not in merely human wisdom, but by the grace of God.

firstLine: Paul Delays His Visit to Corinth
rest: And with this confidence, I was wanting to come to you previously, in order that you may have a second proof of my goodwill,

firstLine: Forgive and Comfort the Offender
rest: But if anyone has caused sorrow, he has not caused me sorrow, but to some degree—in order not to say too much—to all of you.

firstLine: Triumphant Ministry in Christ
rest: Now when I arrived in Troas for the gospel of Christ and a door was opened for me by the Lord,

firstLine: New Covenant Ministry
rest: Are we beginning to commend ourselves again? Or do we, like some, need letters of recommendation to you or from you?

firstLine: Proclaiming Jesus Christ as Lord
rest: Because of this, since we have this ministry, just as we have been shown mercy, we do not lose heart,

firstLine: Treasure in Earthenware Jars
rest: But we have this treasure in earthenware jars, in order that the extraordinary degree of the power may be from God and not from us.

firstLine: Absent from the Body and at Home with the Lord
rest: For we know that if our earthly house, the tent, is destroyed, we have a building from God, a house not made by hands, eternal in the heavens.

firstLine: Controlled by the Love of Christ
rest: Therefore, because we know the fear of the Lord, we are attempting to persuade people, but we are revealed to God, and I hope to be revealed in your consciences.

firstLine: Afflictions of God’s Servants
rest: Now because we are fellow workers, we also urge you not to receive the grace of God in vain.

firstLine: For he says,
rest:
“At the acceptable time I heard you,
and in the day of salvation I helped you.”
Behold, now is the acceptable time; behold, now is the day of salvation!

firstLine: Do Not Become Unevenly Yoked with Unbelievers
rest: Do not become unevenly yoked with unbelievers, for what participation is there between righteousness and lawlessness? Or what fellowship does light have with darkness?

firstLine: Therefore “come out from their midst
rest:
and be separate,” says the Lord,
“and do not touch what is unclean,
and I will welcome you,

firstLine: and I will be a father to you,
rest:
and you will be sons and daughters to me,”
says the all-powerful Lord.

firstLine: Paul’s Joy at the Corinthians’ Repentance
rest: Therefore since we have these promises, dear friends, let us cleanse ourselves from all defilement of body and spirit, accomplishing holiness in the fear of God.

firstLine: Generosity in Giving
rest: Now we make known to you, brothers, the grace of God that has been given among the churches of Macedonia,

firstLine: Arrangements for Administering the Corinthians’ Gift
rest: But thanks be to God, who has put in the heart of Titus the same devotion on your behalf,

firstLine: God Loves a Cheerful Giver
rest: For it is unnecessary for me to write to you concerning the ministry to the saints,

firstLine: Just as it is written,
rest:
“He scattered widely, he gave to the poor;
his righteousness remains forever.”

firstLine: Paul’s Ministry Defended
rest: Now I, Paul, appeal to you myself by the humility and gentleness of Christ, who when I am present in person am humble among you, but when I am absent am bold toward you—

firstLine: Paul Defends His Apostleship
rest: I wish that you would put up with me in something a little foolish—but indeed you are putting up with me.

firstLine: Paul Boasts in His Sufferings
rest: Again I say, do not let anyone think I am foolish. But indeed, if you do, accept me even as foolish, in order that I also may boast a little.

firstLine: A Vision of Paradise
rest: It is necessary to boast; it is not profitable, but I will proceed to visions and revelations of the Lord.

firstLine: Paul’s Concern for the Christians at Corinth
rest: I have become a fool! You compelled me, for I ought to have been commended by you, for I am in no way inferior to the preeminent apostles, even if I am nothing.

firstLine: Final Warnings to the Church at Corinth
rest: This is the third time I am coming to you. By the testimony of two or three witnesses every word will be established.

firstLine: Final Greetings and Benediction
rest: Finally, brothers, rejoice, be restored, be encouraged, be in agreement, be at peace, and the God of love and peace will be with you.

firstLine: Greeting
rest: Paul, an apostle not from men nor by men but through Jesus Christ and God the Father who raised him from the dead,

firstLine: A Different Gospel
rest: I am astonished that you are turning away so quickly from the one who called you by the grace of Christ to a different gospel,

firstLine: Paul’s Defense of His Apostleship
rest: For I make known to you, brothers, the gospel that has been proclaimed by me, that it is not of human origin.

firstLine: Paul’s Ministry Recognized by the Jerusalem Apostles
rest: Then after fourteen years I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, taking along Titus also.

firstLine: Paul Confronts Peter at Antioch
rest: But when Cephas came to Antioch, I opposed him to his face, because he was condemned.

firstLine: Justified by Faith in Christ
rest: We are Jews by nature and not sinners from among the Gentiles,

firstLine: The Promise to Abraham and His Descendant
rest: Brothers, I am speaking according to a human perspective. Nevertheless, when the covenant of a man has been ratified, no one declares it invalid or adds additional provisions to it.

firstLine: The Addition of the Law
rest: Why then the law? It was added on account of transgressions, until the descendant should come to whom it had been promised, having been ordered through angels by the hand of a mediator.

firstLine: No Longer Slaves But Sons and Heirs
rest: Now I say, for as long a time as the heir is a child, he is no different from a slave, although he is master of everything,

firstLine: Do Not Be Enslaved Again
rest: But at that time when you did not know God, you were enslaved to the things which by nature are not gods.

firstLine: Paul’s Personal Appeal
rest: But you know that because of an illness of the flesh I proclaimed the gospel to you the first time.

firstLine: Hagar and Sarah Represent Two Covenants
rest: Tell me, you who are wanting to be under the law, do you not understand the law?

firstLine: For it is written,
rest:
“Rejoice, O barren woman, who does not give birth to children;
burst out and shout, you who do not have birth pains,
because many are the children of the desolate woman,
even more than those of the one who has a husband.”

firstLine: Live in Freedom and Love One Another
rest: For freedom Christ has set us free. Stand firm, therefore, and do not be subject again to a yoke of slavery.

firstLine: Live by the Spirit and Reject the Deeds of the Flesh
rest: But I say, live by the Spirit, and you will never carry out the desire of the flesh.

firstLine: Carry One Another’s Burdens
rest: Brothers, even if a person is caught in some trespass, you who are spiritual restore such a person in a spirit of humility, looking out for yourself, lest you also be tempted.

firstLine: Do Good to All People
rest: Now the one who is taught the word must share in all good things with the one who teaches.

firstLine: A Final Warning
rest: See with what large letters I am writing to you with my own hand.

firstLine: Conclusion and Benediction
rest: Finally, let no one cause me trouble, for I carry on my body the marks of Jesus.

firstLine: Greeting
rest: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, to the saints who are in Ephesus and faithful in Christ Jesus:

firstLine: Praise to God for Spiritual Blessings
rest: Blessed is the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places in Christ,

firstLine: Prayer for Spiritual Wisdom
rest: Because of this I also, hearing of your faith in the Lord Jesus and your love for all the saints,

firstLine: Made Alive in Christ
rest: And you, although you were dead in your trespasses and sins,

firstLine: Jewish and Gentile Believers United in Christ
rest: Therefore remember that formerly you, the Gentiles in the flesh, the so-called uncircumcision by the so-called circumcision in the flesh, made by hands,

firstLine: The Mystery of Christ Revealed
rest: On account of this I, Paul, the prisoner of Christ Jesus for the sake of you Gentiles

firstLine: Prayer for Spiritual Strength
rest: On account of this, I bend my knees before the Father,

firstLine: Christians Should Live in Unity
