rest: Therefore I, the prisoner in the Lord, exhort you to live in a manner worthy of the calling with which you were called:

firstLine: Gifted Leaders Bring the Church to Maturity
rest: Now to each one of us was given this grace, according to the measure of Christ’s gift.

firstLine: Therefore it says,
rest:
“Ascending on high he led captivity captive;
he gave gifts to men.”

firstLine: Appeal for New Behavior
rest: This therefore I say and testify in the Lord, that you no longer walk as the Gentiles walk: in the futility of their mind,

firstLine: Old Behavior, New Behavior, and Motivation
rest: Therefore, putting aside the lie, speak truth each one of you with his neighbor, because we are members of one another.

firstLine: Imitators of God
rest: Therefore become imitators of God, as beloved children,

firstLine: Walk Like Children of Light
rest: Therefore do not be sharers with them,

firstLine: Being Filled by the Spirit
rest: Because of this do not become foolish, but understand what the will of the Lord is.

firstLine: Husbands and Wives
rest: Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ also loved the church, and gave himself for her;

firstLine: Children and Parents
rest: Children, obey your parents in the Lord, for this is right.

firstLine: Slaves and Masters
rest: Slaves, obey your earthly masters with fear and trembling, in the sincerity of your heart, as to Christ,

firstLine: Spiritual Warfare
rest: Finally, become strong in the Lord and in the might of his strength.

firstLine: Conclusion and Benediction
rest: Now, so that you also may know my circumstances, what I am doing, Tychicus, my dear brother and faithful servant in the Lord, will make known to you all things,

firstLine: Greeting
rest: Paul and Timothy, slaves of Christ Jesus, to all the saints in Christ Jesus who are in Philippi, together with the overseers and deacons.

firstLine: Thanksgiving
rest: I give thanks to my God upon my every remembrance of you,

firstLine: Prayer for Spiritual Maturity
rest: And this I pray: that your love may abound still more and more in knowledge and all discernment,

firstLine: The Progress of the Gospel
rest: Now I want you to know, brothers, that my circumstances have happened instead for the progress of the gospel,

firstLine: Stand Firm for the Gospel
rest: Only lead your lives in a manner worthy of the gospel of Christ, so that whether I come and see you or am absent I hear your circumstances, that you are standing firm in one spirit, with one soul contending side by side for the faith of the gospel,

firstLine: Humility and Unity
rest: Therefore, if there is any encouragement in Christ, if any consolation of love, if any fellowship of the Spirit, if any affection and compassion,

firstLine: Christ’s Humiliation and Exaltation
rest: Think this in yourselves which was also in Christ Jesus,

firstLine: who, existing in the form of God,
rest: did not consider being equal with God something to be grasped,

firstLine: but emptied himself
rest:
by taking the form of a slave,
by becoming in the likeness of people.
And being found in appearance like a man,

firstLine: he humbled himself
rest:
by becoming obedient to the point of death,
that is, death on a cross.

firstLine: Therefore also God exalted him
rest: and graciously granted him the name above every name,

firstLine: so that at the name of Jesus
rest:
every knee should bow,
of those in heaven and of those on earth and of those under the earth,

firstLine: and every tongue confess
rest:
that Jesus Christ is Lord,
to the glory of God the Father.

firstLine: Holding Fast to the Word of Life
rest: Therefore my dear friends, just as you have always obeyed, not as in my presence only but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling.

firstLine: Timothy’s Proven Character
rest: But I hope in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy to you soon, so that I also may be encouraged when I know your circumstances.

firstLine: Epaphroditus’ Mission
rest: But I considered it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother and fellow worker and fellow soldier, but your messenger and servant of my need,

firstLine: Warning Against Evil Workers
rest: Finally, my brothers, rejoice in the Lord. To write the same things to you is not troublesome to me, but is a safeguard for you.

firstLine: Imitate Paul
rest: Therefore as many as are perfect, let us hold this opinion, and if you think anything differently, God will reveal this also to you.

firstLine: Appeal for Unity
rest: So then, my beloved and greatly desired brothers, my joy and crown, thus stand firm in the Lord, dear friends.

firstLine: Be Anxious for Nothing
rest: Rejoice in the Lord always; again I say, rejoice.

firstLine: Support for Paul’s Ministry
rest: But I rejoiced in the Lord greatly that now at last you have renewed your concern for me, for whom also you were thinking, but you had no opportunity to express it.

firstLine: Final Greetings and Benediction
rest: Greet every saint in Christ Jesus. The brothers with me greet you.

firstLine: Greeting
rest: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, and Timothy our brother,

firstLine: Thanksgiving for the Colossian Believers
rest: We give thanks always to God the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ when we pray for you,

firstLine: Prayer for Maturity Based on Christ’s Preeminence
rest: Because of this also we, from the day we heard about it, did not cease praying for you, and asking that you may be filled with the knowledge of his will in all wisdom and spiritual insight,

firstLine: Paul’s Suffering and Stewardship
rest: Now I rejoice in my sufferings on behalf of you, and I fill up in my flesh what is lacking of the afflictions of Christ, on behalf of his body which is the church,

firstLine: Christ, the Mystery of God
rest: For I want you to know how great a struggle I have on behalf of you, and those in Laodicea, and all those who have not seen my face in person,

firstLine: Made Alive in Christ
rest: Therefore as you have received Christ Jesus the Lord, live in him,

firstLine: Do Not Be Judged by Human Religious Rules
rest: Therefore do not let anyone judge you with reference to eating or drinking or participation in a feast or a new moon or a Sabbath,

firstLine: Seek the Things Above
rest: Therefore, if you have been raised together with Christ, seek the things above, where Christ is, seated at the right hand of God.

firstLine: Put Off the Old Behavior
rest: Therefore put to death what is earthly in you: sexual immorality, uncleanness, lustful passion, evil desire, and greediness, which is idolatry,

firstLine: Appeal for New Behavior
rest: Therefore, as the chosen of God, holy and dearly loved, put on affection, compassion, kindness, humility, gentleness, patience,

firstLine: Mutual Responsibilities in Christian Relationships
rest: Wives, be subject to your husbands, as is fitting in the Lord.

firstLine: Further Advice for the Christian Life
rest: Be devoted to prayer, keeping alert in it with thanksgiving,

firstLine: Exhortations Regarding Fellow Workers
rest: Tychicus, my dear brother and faithful servant and fellow slave in the Lord, will make known to you all my circumstances,

firstLine: Final Greeting and Benediction
rest: The greeting is by my hand, Paul’s. Remember my imprisonment. Grace be with you.

firstLine: Greeting
rest: Paul and Silvanus and Timothy, to the church of the Thessalonians in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. Grace to you and peace.

firstLine: Thanksgiving for the Thessalonian Believers
rest: We give thanks to God always concerning all of you, making mention constantly in our prayers,

firstLine: Paul’s Approach to Ministry in Thessalonica
rest: For you yourselves know, brothers, our reception with you, that it was not in vain,

firstLine: The Thessalonians’ Response to Paul’s Message
rest: And because of this we also give thanks to God constantly, that when you received God’s word that you heard from us, you accepted it not as the word of men, but as it truly is, the word of God, which also is at work in you who believe.

firstLine: Paul’s Desire to Revisit the Thessalonians
rest: But when we were made orphans by separation from you, brothers, for a short time (in face, not in heart), we were even more eager with great desire to see your face,

firstLine: Paul Sends Timothy to Thessalonica
rest: Therefore when we could bear it no longer, we determined to be left behind in Athens alone,

firstLine: Timothy’s Positive Report
rest: But now, because Timothy has come to us from you and has brought good news to us of your faith and love, and that you always think kindly of us, desiring to see us just as also we desire to see you,

firstLine: Appeal for Continuing Sanctification
rest: Finally therefore, brothers, we ask you and appeal to you in the Lord Jesus that, just as you have received from us how it is necessary for you to live and to please God, just as indeed you are living, that you progress even more.

firstLine: Affirmation of Continuing Love
rest: But concerning brotherly love, I do not have need to write to you, for you yourselves are taught by God to love one another,

firstLine: The Comfort of the Lord’s Return
rest: Now we do not want you to be ignorant, brothers, concerning those who have fallen asleep, so that you will not grieve as also the rest, who have no hope.

firstLine: The Sudden Arrival of the Day of the Lord
rest: Now concerning the times and the seasons, brothers, you have no need of anything to be written to you,

firstLine: Final Exhortations and Benediction
rest: Now we ask you, brothers, to respect those who labor among you and rule over you in the Lord and admonish you,

firstLine: Greeting
rest: Paul and Silvanus and Timothy, to the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

firstLine: Thanksgiving for the Thessalonian Believers
rest: We ought to give thanks to God always concerning you, brothers, just as it is fitting, because your faith is flourishing and the love of each one of you all toward one another is increasing

firstLine: The Man of Lawlessness Will Be Revealed
rest: Now we ask you, brothers, concerning the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and our assembling to him,

firstLine: Stand Firm and Hold Fast
rest: But we ought to give thanks to God always concerning you, brothers dearly loved by the Lord, because God has chosen you as first fruits for salvation by the sanctification of the Spirit and faith in the truth,

firstLine: Paul’s Prayer Request
rest: Finally, brothers, pray for us, that the word of the Lord may progress and be honored, just as also it was with you,

firstLine: Warning Against Lazy, Irresponsible Behavior
rest: But we command you, brothers, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you keep away from every brother who lives irresponsibly and not according to the tradition that they received from us.

firstLine: Final Greeting and Benediction
rest: Now may the Lord of peace himself grant you peace through everything in every way. May the Lord be with all of you.

firstLine: Greeting
rest: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus according to the command of God our Savior and of Christ Jesus our hope,

firstLine: Instructions for Timothy in Ephesus
rest: Just as I urged you when I traveled to Macedonia, remain in Ephesus, so that you may instruct certain people not to teach other doctrine,

firstLine: Paul’s Thankfulness for the Mercy Shown to Him
rest: I give thanks to the one who strengthens me, Christ Jesus our Lord, because he considered me faithful, placing me into ministry,

firstLine: Paul’s Charge to Timothy
rest: I am setting before you this instruction, Timothy my child, in accordance with the prophecies spoken long ago about you, in order that by them you may fight the good fight,

firstLine: Instructions to Pray for All People
rest: Therefore, I urge first of all that petitions, prayers, requests, and thanksgiving be made on behalf of all people,

firstLine: Instructions for Women
rest: Likewise also the women should adorn themselves in appropriate clothing, with modesty and self-control, not with braided hair and gold jewelry or pearls or expensive clothing,

firstLine: Qualifications for Overseers
rest: The saying is trustworthy: if anyone aspires to supervision, he desires a good work.

firstLine: Qualifications for Deacons
rest: Deacons likewise must be dignified, not insincere, not devoted to much wine, not fond of dishonest gain,

firstLine: The Mystery of Godliness Described
rest: I am writing these things to you, hoping to come to you in a short time.

firstLine: And most certainly, great is the mystery of godliness:
rest:
Who was revealed in the flesh,
was vindicated by the Spirit,
was seen by angels,
was proclaimed among the Gentiles,
was believed on in the world,
was taken up in glory.

firstLine: The Coming Apostasy
rest: Now the Spirit explicitly says that in the last times some will depart from the faith, paying attention to deceitful spirits and teachings of demons,

firstLine: The Good Servant of Christ
rest: By teaching these things to the brothers, you will be a good servant of Christ Jesus, trained in the words of the faith and of the good teaching that you have followed faithfully.

firstLine: Instructions About Widows
rest: Do not rebuke an older man, but appeal to him as a father, younger men as brothers,

firstLine: Honoring Worthy Elders and Dealing With Sinners
rest: The elders who lead well must be considered worthy of double honor, especially those who labor by speaking and teaching.

firstLine: Slaves and Masters
rest: All those who are under the yoke as slaves must regard their own masters as worthy of all honor, lest the name of God and the teaching be slandered.

firstLine: Renewed Charge to Timothy
rest: But you, O man of God, flee from these things, and pursue righteousness, godliness, faith, love, patient endurance, gentleness.

firstLine: Instructions to the Rich
rest: Command those who are rich in this present age not to be proud and not to put their hope in the uncertainty of riches, but in God, who provides us all things richly for enjoyment,

firstLine: Final Charge and Benediction
rest: O Timothy, guard what has been entrusted to you. Turn away from pointless empty talk and contradictions of what is falsely called knowledge,

firstLine: Greeting
rest: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, according to the promise of life which is in Christ Jesus,

firstLine: Timothy’s Spiritual Heritage
rest: I am thankful to God, whom I have served with a clear conscience as my ancestors did, when I remember you constantly in my prayers night and day,

firstLine: Exhortation to Share Paul’s Suffering
rest: Therefore, do not be ashamed of the testimony about our Lord, nor me his prisoner, but suffer along with me for the gospel, according to the power of God,

firstLine: Exhortation to Be Strong in Grace
rest: You, therefore, my child, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus,

firstLine: A Trustworthy Saying
rest: Remember Jesus Christ, raised from the dead, a descendant of David according to my gospel,

firstLine: The saying is trustworthy:
rest: For if we died with him, we will also live with him;

firstLine: if we endure, we will also reign with him;
rest: if we deny him, he also will deny us;

firstLine: A Worker Approved to God and Not Ashamed
rest: Remind people of these things, solemnly urging them before the Lord not to dispute about words. This is in no way beneficial and leads to the ruin of the hearers.

firstLine: Difficult Times Ahead in the Last Days
rest: But know this, that in the last days difficult times will come,

firstLine: The Value of the Scriptures
rest: But you have faithfully followed my teaching, way of life, purpose, faith, patience, love, endurance,

firstLine: Paul’s Charge to Timothy
rest: I solemnly charge you before God and Christ Jesus, who is going to judge the living and the dead, and by his appearing and his kingdom,

firstLine: Final Instructions to Timothy
rest: Make haste to come to me quickly.

firstLine: Final Greetings and Benediction
rest: Greet Prisca and Aquila and the household of Onesiphorus.

firstLine: Greeting
rest: Paul, a slave of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ for the faith of the chosen of God and the knowledge of the truth that is according to godliness,

firstLine: Instructions to Titus in Crete
rest: On account of this, I left you behind in Crete, in order that what remains may be set in order and you may appoint elders in every town, as I ordered you.

firstLine: Sound Instruction and Consistent Behavior
rest: But you, speak the things which are fitting for sound instruction.

firstLine: Conduct Toward All People
rest: Remind them to be subject to the rulers and to the authorities, to obey, to be prepared for every good work,

firstLine: Final Instructions to Titus
rest: The saying is trustworthy, and I want you to insist concerning these things, so that those who have believed in God may be careful to engage in good deeds. These things are good and beneficial for people.

firstLine: Greeting
rest: Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon, our dear friend and fellow worker,

firstLine: Thanksgiving and Prayer for Philemon
rest: I thank my God, always making mention of you in my prayers,

firstLine: Paul’s Appeal for Onesimus
rest: Therefore, although I have great confidence in Christ to order you to do what is proper,

firstLine: Paul’s Request to Philemon
rest: If therefore you consider me a partner, receive him as you would me.

firstLine: Final Greetings and Benediction
rest: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, greets you,

firstLine: God’s Full and Final Revelation in the Son
rest: Although God spoke long ago in many parts and in many ways to the fathers by the prophets,

firstLine: The Son Superior to the Angels
rest:
For to which of the angels did he ever say,
“You are my son,
today I have begotten you,”
and again,
“I will be his father,
and he will be my son”?

firstLine: And again, when he brings the firstborn into the world, he says,
rest: “And let all the angels of God worship him.”

firstLine: And concerning the angels he says,
rest:
“The one who makes his angels winds,
and his servants a flame of fire,”

firstLine: but concerning the Son,
rest:
“Your throne, O God, is forever and ever,
and the scepter of righteous is the scepter of your kingdom.

firstLine: You have loved righteousness and hated lawlessness;
rest:
because of this God, your God, has anointed you
with the olive oil of joy more than your companions.

firstLine: And,
rest:
“You, Lord, laid the foundation of the earth in the beginning,
and the heavens are the works of your hands;

firstLine: they will perish, but you continue,
rest: and they will all become old like a garment,

firstLine: and like a robe you will roll them up,
rest:
and like a garment they will be changed;
but you are the same, and your years will not run out.”

firstLine: But to which of the angels has he ever said,
rest:
“Sit down at my right hand,
until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet.”

firstLine: Warning Not to Neglect Salvation
rest: Because of this, it is all the more necessary that we pay attention to the things we have heard, lest we drift away.

firstLine: The Son’s Humiliation and Suffering
rest: For he did not subject to angels the world to come, about which we are speaking.

firstLine: But someone testified somewhere, saying,
rest:
“What is man, that you remember him,
or the son of man, that you care for him?

firstLine: You made him for a short time lower than the angels;
rest: you crowned him with glory and honor;

firstLine: saying,
rest:
“I will proclaim your name to my brothers;
in the midst of the assembly I will sing in praise of you.”

firstLine: And again,
rest:
“I will trust in him.”
And again,
“Behold, I and the children God has given me.”

firstLine: The Superiority of Jesus to Moses
rest: Therefore, holy brothers, sharers in a heavenly calling, consider Jesus, the apostle and high priest of our confession,

firstLine: A Serious Warning Against Unbelief
rest:
Therefore, just as the Holy Spirit says,
“Today, if you hear his voice,

firstLine: do not harden your hearts as in the rebellion,
rest: in the day of testing in the wilderness,

firstLine: where your fathers tested me by trial
rest: and saw my works

firstLine: As I swore in my anger,
rest: ‘They will never enter into my rest.’”

firstLine: while it is said,
rest:
“Today, if you hear his voice,
do not harden your hearts as in the rebellion.”

firstLine: The Rest that Remains for the People of God
rest: Therefore let us fear, while there remains a promise of entering into his rest, that none of you appear to fall short of it.

firstLine: For we who have believed enter into rest, just as he has said,
rest:
“As I swore in my anger,
‘They will never enter into my rest.’”
And yet these works have been accomplished from the foundation of the world.

firstLine: again he ordains a certain day, today, speaking by David after so long a time, just as had been said before,
rest:
“Today, if you hear his voice,
do not harden your hearts.”

firstLine: Jesus Our Great High Priest
rest: Therefore, because we have a great high priest who has gone through the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold fast to our confession.

firstLine: A High Priest Like Melchizedek
rest: For every high priest taken from among men is appointed on behalf of people in the things relating to God, in order that he can offer both gifts and sacrifices on behalf of sins,

firstLine: Thus also Christ did not glorify himself to become high priest, but the one who said to him,
rest: “You are my Son, today I have begotten you,”

firstLine: just as also in another place he says,
rest: “You are a priest forever according to the order of Melchizedek,”

firstLine: Advanced Teaching Hindered by Immaturity
rest: Concerning this we have much to say and it is difficult to explain, since you have become sluggish in hearing.

firstLine: A Serious Warning Against Falling Away
rest: Therefore, leaving behind the elementary message about Christ, let us move on to maturity, not laying again a foundation of repentance from dead works and faith in God,

firstLine: The Reliability of God’s Promise
rest: For when God made a promise to Abraham, since he had no one greater to swear by, he swore by himself,

firstLine: saying,
rest: “Surely I will greatly bless you, and I will greatly multiply you.”

firstLine: The Greatness of Melchizedek
rest: For this Melchizedek, king of Salem, priest of the most high God, who met Abraham as he was returning from the slaughter of the kings and blessed him,

firstLine: The Superiority of Jesus to Melchizedek
rest: Thus if perfection was through the Levitical priesthood, for on the basis of it the people received the law, what further need is there for another priest to arise according to the order of Melchizedek and not said to be according to the order of Aaron?

firstLine: For it is testified,
rest: “You are a priest forever according to the order of Melchizedek.”

firstLine: but he with an oath by the one who said to him,
rest:
“The Lord has sworn and will not change his mind,
‘You are a priest forever’”),

firstLine: The Mediator of a New and Better Covenant
rest: Now this is the main point in what has been said: we have a high priest such as this, who sat down at the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in heaven,

firstLine: For in finding fault with them he says,
rest:
“Behold, days are coming, says the Lord,
when I will complete a new covenant with the house of Israel
and with the house of Judah,

firstLine: not like the covenant which I made with their fathers
rest:
on the day I took hold of them by my hand
to lead them out of the land of Egypt,
because they did not continue in my covenant
and I disregarded them, says the Lord.

firstLine: For this is the covenant that I will decree with the house of Israel
rest:
after those days, says the Lord:
I am putting my laws in their minds
and I will write them on their hearts,
and I will be their God
and they will be my people.

firstLine: And they will not teach each one his fellow citizen
rest:
and each one his brother, saying, ‘Know the Lord,’
because they will all know me,
from the least of them to the greatest.

firstLine: For I will be merciful toward their wrongdoings,
rest: and I will not remember their sins any longer.”

firstLine: The Earthly Ministry of the Old Covenant
rest: Now the first covenant had regulations for worship and the earthly sanctuary.

firstLine: The Heavenly Ministry of the New Covenant
rest: But Christ has arrived as a high priest of the good things to come. Through the greater and more perfect tent not made by hands, that is, not of this creation,

firstLine: saying,
rest: “This is the blood of the covenant that God has commanded for you.”

firstLine: Christ’s One Sacrifice for Sin
rest: For the law, possessing a shadow of the good things that are about to come, not the form of things itself, is never able year by year by means of the same sacrifices which they offer without interruption to make perfect those who draw near.

firstLine: Therefore, when he came into the world, he said,
rest:
“Sacrifice and offering you did not want,
but a body you prepared for me;

firstLine: Then I said, ‘Behold, I have come—
rest:
in the roll of the book it is written about me—
to do your will, O God.’

firstLine: When he says above,
rest:
“Sacrifices and offerings and whole burnt offerings and offerings for sin
you did not want, nor did you delight in,”
which are offered according to the law,

firstLine: then he has said,
rest:
“Behold, I have come to do your will.”
He takes away the first in order to establish the second,

firstLine: “This is the covenant that I will decree for them
rest:
after those days, says the Lord:
I am putting my laws on their hearts,
and I will write them on their minds.”

firstLine: He also says,
rest: “Their sins and their lawless deeds I will never remember again.”

firstLine: Hold Fast the Confession of Our Hope
rest: Therefore, brothers, since we have confidence for the entrance into the sanctuary by the blood of Jesus,

firstLine: A Serious Warning Against Continuing Deliberate Sin
rest: For if we keep on sinning deliberately after receiving the knowledge of the truth, there no longer remains a sacrifice for sins,

firstLine: For we know the one who said,
rest:
“Vengeance is mine, I will repay,”
and again,
“The Lord will judge his people.”

firstLine: For yet
rest:
“a very, very little while,
and the one who is coming will come and will not delay.

firstLine: But my righteous one will live by faith,
rest: and if he shrinks back, my soul is not well pleased with him.”

firstLine: Examples of Faith in Action
rest: Now faith is the realization of what is hoped for, the proof of things not seen.

firstLine: The Example of Jesus’ Suffering
rest: Therefore, since we also have such a great cloud of witnesses surrounding us, putting aside every weight and the sin that so easily ensnares us, let us run with patient endurance the race that has been set before us,

firstLine: For the Lord disciplines the one whom he loves,
rest: and punishes every son whom he accepts.”

firstLine: A Serious Warning Against Refusing God
rest: Therefore strengthen your slackened hands and your weakened knees,

firstLine: whose voice shook the earth at that time, but now he has promised, saying,
rest: “Yet once more I will shake not only the earth but also heaven.”

firstLine: Concluding Ethical Instructions
rest: Brotherly love must continue.

firstLine: So then, we can say with confidence,
rest:
“The Lord is my helper, I will not be afraid.
What will man do to me?”

firstLine: Benediction
rest: Now may the God of peace, who brought up from the dead our Lord Jesus, the great shepherd of the sheep, by the blood of the eternal covenant,

firstLine: Conclusion
rest: Now I urge you, brothers, bear with my word of exhortation, for indeed I have written to you briefly.

firstLine: Greeting
rest: James, a slave of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes in the dispersion. Greetings!

firstLine: Trials, Testing, and Faith
rest: Consider it all joy, my brothers, whenever you encounter various trials,

firstLine: Doers of the Message, Not Just Hearers
rest: Understand this, my dear brothers: every person must be quick to hear, slow to speak, slow to anger,

firstLine: Partiality Forbidden
rest: My brothers, do not hold your faith in our glorious Lord Jesus Christ with partiality.

firstLine: Faith and Works
rest: What is the benefit, my brothers, if someone says that he has faith but does not have works? That faith is not able to save him, is it?

firstLine: Restraining the Tongue
rest: Not many should become teachers, my brothers, because you know that we will receive a greater judgment.

firstLine: The Wisdom That Comes Down from Above
rest: Who is wise and understanding among you? Let him show by his good behavior his works, with the humility of wisdom.

firstLine: Subject Yourselves to God
rest: From where are conflicts and from where are quarrels among you? Is it not from this, from your pleasures that wage war among your members?

firstLine: Arrogant Boasting About the Future
rest: Come now, you who say, “Today or tomorrow we will travel to such and such a city and spend a year there, and carry on business and make a profit,”

firstLine: Woes on the Rich Who Oppress Others
rest: Come now, you rich people, weep and cry aloud over the miseries that are coming upon you!

firstLine: Exhortation to Patience
rest: Therefore be patient, brothers, until the coming of the Lord. Behold, the farmer waits for the precious fruit of the soil, being patient concerning it until it receives the early and late rains.

firstLine: The Effective Prayer of Faith
rest: Is anyone among you suffering misfortune? He should pray. Is anyone cheerful? He should sing praise.

firstLine: Greeting
rest: Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, to the chosen who are residing temporarily in the dispersion in Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,

firstLine: A New Birth to a Living Hope
rest: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who according to his great mercy has caused us to be born again to a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,

firstLine: Be Holy in All Your Conduct
rest: Therefore, when you have prepared your minds for action by being self-controlled, put your hope completely in the grace that will be brought to you at the revelation of Jesus Christ.

firstLine: For
rest:
“all flesh is like grass,
and all its glory like the flower of the grass.
The grass withers and the flower falls off,

firstLine: Chosen as Living Stones
rest: Therefore, ridding yourselves of all malice and all deceit and hypocrisy and envy and all slander,

firstLine: For it stands in scripture,
rest:
“Behold, I am laying in Zion a stone, a chosen and precious cornerstone,
and the one who believes in him will never be put to shame.”

firstLine: Therefore the honor is for you who believe, but for those who refuse to believe,
rest:
“The stone that the builders rejected,
this one has become the cornerstone,”

firstLine: and
rest:
“A stone of stumbling and a rock of offense,”
who stumble because they disobey the word to which also they were consigned.

firstLine: Submission to Established Authority
rest: Subject yourselves to every human authority for the sake of the Lord, whether to a king as having supreme authority,

firstLine: Wives and Husbands
rest: In the same way, wives, be subject to your own husbands, so that even if some are disobedient to the word, they may be won over without a word by the conduct of their wives,

firstLine: Called to Inherit a Blessing
rest: And finally, all of you be harmonious, sympathetic, showing mutual affection, compassionate, humble,

firstLine: For
rest:
“The one who wants to love life
and see good days
must keep his tongue from evil
and his lips must not speak deceit.

firstLine: And he must turn away from evil and do good;
rest: he must seek peace and pursue it.

firstLine: For the eyes of the Lord are on the righteous,
rest:
and his ears are open to their prayer.
But the face of the Lord is against those who do evil.

firstLine: Suffer for Doing What is Good
rest: And who is the one who will harm you if you are a zealous adherent for what is good?

firstLine: For Christ also suffered once for sins,
rest:
the just for the unjust,
in order that he could bring you to God,
being put to death in the flesh,
but made alive in the spirit,

firstLine: The Time for Behaving Like the Gentiles is Past
rest: Therefore, because Christ suffered in the flesh, you also equip yourselves with the same way of thinking, because the one who has suffered in the flesh has ceased from sin,

firstLine: Serving to the Glory of God
rest: Now the end of all things draws near. Therefore be self-controlled and sober-minded for your prayers.

firstLine: Sharing the Sufferings of Christ
rest: Dear friends, do not be surprised at the fiery ordeal among you, when it takes place to test you, as if something strange were happening to you.

firstLine: Leadership and Humility
rest: Therefore I, your fellow elder and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, and also a sharer of the glory that is going to be revealed, exhort the elders among you:

firstLine: Conclusion and Final Greetings
rest: Through Silvanus, the faithful brother (as I consider him), I have written to you briefly to encourage you and to attest that this is the true grace of God. Stand firm in it.

firstLine: Greeting
rest: Simeon Peter, a slave and apostle of Jesus Christ, to those who have obtained a faith equal in value to ours by the righteousness of our God and Savior Jesus Christ.

firstLine: Make Your Calling and Election Secure
rest: For if these things are yours and are increasing, this does not make you useless or unproductive in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.

firstLine: The Reliable Prophetic Word of Testimony
rest: For we did not make known to you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ by following ingeniously concocted myths, but by being eyewitnesses of that one’s majesty.

firstLine: The Rise and Fall of the False Teachers
rest: But there were also false prophets among the people, as there will be false teachers among you also, who will bring in destructive heresies, even denying the Master who bought them, thus bringing on themselves swift destruction.

firstLine: The Coming Day of the Lord
rest: Dear friends, this is already the second letter I am writing to you, in both of which I am attempting to stir up your sincere mind by a reminder,

firstLine: Final Exhortations and Conclusion
rest: Therefore, dear friends, because you are waiting for these things, make every effort to be found at peace, spotless and unblemished in him.

firstLine: Prologue
rest: What was from the beginning, what we have heard, what we have seen with our eyes, what we have looked at and our hands have touched, concerning the word of life—

firstLine: God is Light, so Walk in the Light
rest: And this is the message which we have heard from him and announce to you, that God is light and there is no darkness in him at all.

firstLine: Keeping the New Commandment
rest: My little children, I am writing these things to you in order that you may not sin. And if anyone sins, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous one,

firstLine: Encouragement and Assurance
rest: I am writing to you, little children, because your sins have been forgiven you on account of his name.

firstLine: Do Not Love the World
rest: Do not love the world or the things in the world. If anyone loves the world, the love of the Father is not in him,

firstLine: Departure of the False Teachers
rest: Children, it is the last hour, and just as you have heard that antichrist is coming, even now many antichrists have arisen, by which we know that it is the last hour.

firstLine: God’s Children
rest: And now, little children, remain in him, so that whenever he is revealed we may have confidence and not be put to shame before him at his coming.

firstLine: God is Love, so Love One Another
rest: For this is the message that you have heard from the beginning: that we should love one another,

firstLine: How to Recognize the Spirit of God
rest: Dear friends, do not believe every spirit, but test the spirits to determine if they are from God, because many false prophets have gone out into the world.

firstLine: God’s Love Revealed
rest: Dear friends, let us love one another, because love is from God, and everyone who loves has been fathered by God and knows God.

firstLine: Our Assurance of Eternal Life
rest: These things I have written to you who believe in the name of the Son of God, in order that you may know that you have eternal life.

firstLine: Greeting
rest: The elder, to the elect lady and her children, whom I love in truth—and not I alone, but also all those who know the truth—

firstLine: Watch Out for False Teachers
rest: And now I ask you, lady (not as if I were writing a new commandment to you, but one that we have had from the beginning), that we should love one another.

firstLine: Conclusion and Final Greeting
rest: Although I have many things to write to you, I do not want to do so by means of paper and ink, but I hope to be with you and to speak face to face, so that your joy may be complete.

firstLine: Greeting
rest: The elder, to Gaius the beloved, whom I love in the truth.

firstLine: Instructions to Gaius
rest: Dear friend, you act faithfully in whatever you do for the brothers, even though they are strangers.

firstLine: Diotrephes Causes Trouble
rest: I wrote something to the church, but Diotrephes, who wants to be first among them, does not acknowledge us.

firstLine: Demetrius Commended
rest: Demetrius has been testified to by all, even by the truth itself. And we also testify to him, and you know that our testimony is true.

firstLine: Conclusion and Final Greeting
rest: I have many things to write to you, but I do not want to write to you by means of ink and pen.

firstLine: Greeting
rest: Jude, a slave of Jesus Christ and brother of James, to those who are called, loved in God the Father and kept for Jesus Christ.

firstLine: Contend for the Faith
rest: Dear friends, although I was making every effort to write to you concerning our common salvation, I considered it a necessity to write to you to encourage you to contend for the faith delivered once and for all to the saints.

firstLine: Condemnation of the Ungodly False Teachers
rest: Now I want to remind you, although you know everything once and for all, that Jesus, having saved the people out of the land of Egypt, the second time destroyed those who did not believe.

firstLine: Persevere in the Love of God
rest: But you, dear friends, remember the words proclaimed beforehand by the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ,

firstLine: Benediction
rest: Now to the one who is able to protect you from stumbling and make you to stand before his glory blameless with exultation,

firstLine: Prologue
rest: The revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave him to show to his slaves the things which must take place in a short time, and communicated it by sending it through his angel to his slave John,

firstLine: Greetings to the Churches
rest: John, to the seven churches in Asia: grace to you and peace from the one who is and the one who was and the one who is coming, and from the seven spirits who are before his throne,

firstLine: Behold, he is coming with the clouds,
rest:
and every eye will see him,
even every one who pierced him,
and all the tribes of the earth will mourn over him.
Yes, amen.

firstLine: John’s Vision of the Son of Man
rest: I, John, your brother and co-sharer in the affliction and kingdom and steadfastness in Jesus, was on the island called Patmos because of the word of God and the testimony about Jesus.

firstLine: The Letter to the Church in Ephesus
rest:
“To the angel of the church in Ephesus write:
“This is what the one who holds the seven stars in his right hand says, the one who walks in the midst of the seven gold lampstands:

firstLine: The Letter to the Church in Smyrna
rest:
“And to the angel of the church in Smyrna write:
“This is what the first and the last says, who was dead and came to life:

firstLine: The Letter to the Church in Pergamum
rest:
“And to the angel of the church in Pergamum write:
“This is what the one who has the sharp double-edged sword says:

firstLine: The Letter to the Church in Thyatira
rest:
“And to the angel of the church in Thyatira write:
“This is what the Son of God says, the one who has his eyes like a fiery flame and his feet like fine bronze:

firstLine: The Letter to the Church in Sardis
rest:
“And to the angel of the church in Sardis write:
“This is what the one who has the seven spirits of God and the seven stars says: ‘I know your works, that you have a name that you are alive, and you are dead.

firstLine: The Letter to the Church in Philadelphia
rest:
“And to the angel of the church in Philadelphia write:
“This is what the holy one, the true one, the one who has the key of David, the one who opens and no one can shut, and who shuts and no one can open, says:

firstLine: The Letter to the Church in Laodicea
rest:
“And to the angel of the church in Laodicea write:
“This is what the Amen, the faithful and true witness, the originator of God’s creation, says:

firstLine: The Heavenly Throne
rest: After these things I looked, and behold, an open door in heaven, and the former voice that I had heard like a trumpet speaking with me was saying, “Come up here and I will show you the things which must take place after these things.”

firstLine: “You are worthy, our Lord and God,
rest:
to receive glory and honor and power,
because you have created all things,
and because of your will they existed and were created.”

firstLine: The Scroll with Seven Seals and the Lamb
rest: And I saw in the right hand of the one who is seated on the throne a scroll, written inside and on the back, sealed up with seven seals.

firstLine: And they were singing a new song, saying,
rest:
“You are worthy to take the scroll
and to open its seals,
because you were slaughtered,
and bought people for God by your blood
from every tribe and language and people and nation,

firstLine: and made them a kingdom and priests to our God,
rest: and they will reign on the earth.”

firstLine: saying with a loud voice,
rest:
“Worthy is the Lamb who was slaughtered
to receive power and riches
and wisdom and strength
and honor and glory and praise!”

firstLine: The Opening of the First Six Seals
rest: And I watched when the Lamb opened one of the seven seals, and I heard one of the four living creatures saying like the sound of thunder, “Come!”

firstLine: The Sealing of the 144,000
rest: After this I saw four angels standing at the four corners of the earth, holding back the four winds of the earth, so that no wind could blow on the earth or on the sea or on any tree.

firstLine: from the tribe of Judah, twelve thousand sealed,
rest:
from the tribe of Reuben, twelve thousand,
from the tribe of Gad, twelve thousand,

firstLine: from the tribe of Asher, twelve thousand,
rest:
from the tribe of Naphtali, twelve thousand,
from the tribe of Manasseh, twelve thousand,

firstLine: from the tribe of Simeon, twelve thousand,
rest:
from the tribe of Levi, twelve thousand,
from the tribe of Issachar, twelve thousand,

firstLine: from the tribe of Zebulun, twelve thousand,
rest:
from the tribe of Joseph, twelve thousand,
from the tribe of Benjamin, twelve thousand were sealed.

firstLine: The Great Crowd before the Throne
rest: After these things I looked, and behold, a great crowd that no one was able to number, from every nation and tribe and people and language, standing before the throne and before the Lamb, dressed in white robes and with palm branches in their hands.

firstLine: And they were crying out with a loud voice, saying,
rest:
“Salvation to our God
who is seated on the throne,
and to the Lamb!”

firstLine: saying,
rest:
“Amen! Praise and glory,
and wisdom and thanksgiving,
and honor and power and strength
be to our God forever and ever. Amen!”

firstLine: Because of this, they are before the throne of God,
rest:
and they serve him day and night in his temple,
and the one who is seated on the throne will shelter them.

firstLine: They will not be hungry any longer or be thirsty any longer,
rest: nor will the sun ever beat down on them, nor any heat,

firstLine: because the Lamb who is in the midst of the throne will shepherd them
rest:
and will lead them to springs of living waters,
and God will wipe away every tear from their eyes.”

firstLine: The Opening of the Seventh Seal
rest: And when he opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven for about half an hour.

firstLine: The Blowing of the Trumpets
rest: And the seven angels who had the seven trumpets prepared themselves in order to blow them.

firstLine: Tormenting Locusts from the Abyss
rest: And the fifth angel blew the trumpet, and I saw a star that had fallen from heaven to the earth, and the key of the shaft of the abyss was given to him.

firstLine: A Third of Humanity Killed by Plagues
rest: And the sixth angel blew the trumpet, and I heard one voice from the horns of the golden altar that is before God

firstLine: The Angel and the Little Scroll
rest: And I saw another powerful angel descending from heaven, wrapped in a cloud, and a rainbow over his head, and his face was like the sun, and his feet were like pillars of fire,

firstLine: The Two Witnesses
rest: And a measuring rod similar in appearance to a staff was given to me, saying, “Get up and measure the temple of God and the altar and those who worship in it.

firstLine: The Blowing of the Seventh Trumpet
rest:
And the seventh angel blew the trumpet, and there was a loud voice in heaven saying,
“The kingdom of the world has become the kingdom of our Lord
and of his Christ,
and he will reign forever and ever.”

firstLine: saying,
rest:
“We give thanks to you, Lord God All-Powerful,
the one who is and the one who was,
because you have taken your great power
and have begun to reign.

firstLine: And the nations were angry,
rest:
and your wrath has come,
and the time for the dead to be judged,
and to give their reward to your slaves the prophets
and to the saints and to the ones who fear your name,
the small and the great,
and to destroy those who destroy the earth.”

firstLine: The Woman and Her Son Versus the Dragon
rest: And a great sign appeared in heaven: a woman clothed with the sun and with the moon under her feet, and on her head a crown of twelve stars,

firstLine: Satan Thrown Down from Heaven to Earth
rest: And there was war in heaven; Michael and his angels fought against the dragon, and the dragon and his angels fought back.

firstLine: And I heard a loud voice in heaven saying,
rest:
“Now the salvation and the power
and the kingdom of our God
and the authority of his Christ have come,
because the accuser of our brothers has been thrown down,
the one who accuses them before our God day and night.

firstLine: And they conquered him by the blood of the Lamb
rest:
and by the word of their testimony,
and they did not love their lives until death.

firstLine: Because of this, rejoice, you heavens,
rest:
and those who live in them!
Woe to the earth and to the sea,
because the devil has come down to you,
having great anger,
because he knows that he has little time!”

firstLine: The First Beast from the Sea
rest: And I saw coming up out of the sea a beast that had ten horns and seven heads, and on its horns ten royal headbands, and on its heads a blasphemous name.

firstLine: The Second Beast from the Earth
rest: And I saw another beast coming up from the earth, and he had two horns like a lamb, and he was speaking like a dragon.

firstLine: The Lamb and the 144,000 on Mount Zion
rest: And I looked, and behold, the Lamb standing on Mount Zion, and with him one hundred forty-four thousand who had his name and the name of his Father written on their foreheads.

firstLine: The Three Angels and Their Messages
rest: And I saw another angel flying directly overhead, having an eternal gospel to proclaim to those who reside on the earth, and to every nation and tribe and language and people,

firstLine: And I heard a voice from heaven saying, “Write:
rest:
‘Blessed are the dead who die in the Lord from now on!’”
“Yes,” says the Spirit, “in order that they may rest from their labors, for their deeds follow after them.”

firstLine: The Earth is Harvested
rest: And I looked, and behold, a white cloud, and on the cloud was seated one like a son of man, having on his head a golden crown, and in his hand a sharp sickle.

firstLine: Seven Angels with Seven Last Plagues
rest: And I saw another great and marvelous sign in heaven: seven angels having seven plagues that are the last ones, because with them the wrath of God is completed.

firstLine: And they were singing the song of Moses, the slave of God, and the song of the Lamb, saying:
rest:
“Great and marvelous are your works,
Lord God All-Powerful;
righteous and true are your ways,
King of the ages!

firstLine: Who would never fear, Lord,
rest:
and glorify your name?
For only you are holy,
because all the nations will come
and worship before you,
because your righteous deeds have been revealed.”

firstLine: The Seven Bowls of the Wrath of God
rest: And I heard a loud voice from the temple saying to the seven angels, “Go and pour out on the earth the seven bowls of the wrath of God.”

firstLine: And I heard the angel of the waters saying,
rest:
“You are righteous, the one who is and the one who was, the Holy One,
because you have judged these things,

firstLine: because they have poured out the blood of the saints and prophets,
rest:
and you have given them blood to drink;
they are deserving!”

firstLine: And I heard the altar saying,
rest:
“Yes, Lord God All-Powerful,
true and righteous are your judgments.”

firstLine: The Judgment of the Great Prostitute Babylon
rest: And one of the seven angels who had the seven bowls came and spoke with me, saying, “Come, I will show you the judgment of the great prostitute who is seated on many waters,

firstLine: Lament Over Babylon the Great
rest: After these things I saw another angel descending from heaven, who had great authority, and the earth was illuminated by his splendor.

firstLine: And he cried out with a powerful voice, saying,
rest:
“Fallen, fallen is Babylon the great,
and it has become a dwelling place of demons
and a haunt of every unclean spirit
and a haunt of every unclean bird
and a haunt of every unclean and detested animal.

firstLine: For all the nations have drunk
rest:
from the wine of the passion of her sexual immorality,
and the kings of the earth have committed sexual immorality with her,
and the merchants of the earth have become rich
from the power of her sensuality.”

firstLine: And I heard another voice from heaven saying,
rest:
“Come out from her, my people,
so that you will not participate in her sins,
and so that you will not receive her plagues,

firstLine: because her sins have reached up to heaven,
rest: and God has remembered her crimes.

firstLine: Pay back to her as she herself also paid out,
rest:
and pay back double according to her deeds;
in the cup that she mixed, mix double for her.

firstLine: As much as she glorified herself and lived in luxury,
rest:
give to her so much torment and mourning,
because in her heart she said,
‘I sit as a queen, and am not a widow,
and I will never see mourning!’

firstLine: Because of this her plagues will come in one day—
rest:
death and mourning and famine—
and she will be burned up with fire,
because the Lord God who passes judgment on her is powerful!”

firstLine: standing far off because of the fear of her torment, saying,
rest:
“Woe, woe, the great city,
Babylon the powerful city,
because in one hour your judgment has come!”

firstLine: “And the fruit your soul desires has departed from you,
rest:
and all the luxury and the splendor has perished from you,
and they will never find them any more.”

firstLine: saying,
rest:
“Woe, woe, the great city,
dressed in fine linen and purple cloth and scarlet cloth,
and adorned with gold and precious stones and pearls,

firstLine: And they threw dust on their heads and were crying out, weeping and mourning, saying,
rest:
“Woe, woe, the great city,
in which all those who had ships on the sea
became rich from her prosperity,
because in one hour she has been laid waste!”

firstLine: Rejoice over her, heaven
rest:
and the saints and the apostles and the prophets,
because God has pronounced your judgment on her!”

firstLine: And one powerful angel picked up a stone like a great millstone and threw it into the sea, saying,
rest:
“In this way Babylon the great city will be thrown down with violence,
and will never be found again!

firstLine: And the sound of harpists and musicians and flute players and trumpeters
rest:
will never be heard in you again!
And every craftsman of every trade
will never be found in you again!
And the sound of a mill
will never be heard in you again!

firstLine: And the light of a lamp
rest:
will never shine in you again!
And the sound of a bridegroom and bride
will never be heard in you again!
For your merchants were the most important people of the earth,
because with your sorcery they deceived all the nations.

firstLine: And in her was found the blood of prophets and saints
rest: and all those who had been slaughtered on the earth.

firstLine: Rejoicing in Heaven
rest:
After these things I heard something like the loud sound of a great crowd in heaven saying,
“Hallelujah!
Salvation and glory and power belong to our God,

firstLine: because his judgments are true and righteous,
rest:
because he has passed judgment on the great prostitute
who corrupted the earth with her sexual immorality,
and has avenged the blood of his slaves shed by her hand!”

firstLine: And a second time they said,
rest:
“Hallelujah!”
And her smoke goes up forever and ever.

firstLine: And a voice came out from the throne, saying,
rest:
“Praise our God
all his slaves,
and those who fear him,
the small and the great!”

firstLine: The Wedding Celebration of the Lamb
rest:
And I heard something like the sound of a great crowd and something like the sound of many waters and something like the sound of powerful thunder, saying,
“Hallelujah!
For the Lord God, the All-Powerful, reigns!

firstLine: Let us rejoice and be glad
rest:
and give him the glory,
because the wedding celebration of the Lamb has come,
and his bride has prepared herself.

firstLine: The Warrior on the White Horse
rest: And I saw heaven opened, and behold, a white horse, and the one seated on it was called “Faithful” and “True,” and with justice he judges and makes war.

firstLine: in order that you may eat the flesh of kings,
rest:
and the flesh of military tribunes,
and the flesh of the powerful,
and the flesh of horses and those seated on them,
and the flesh of all people,
both free and slave,
and small and great!”

firstLine: Satan Bound for a Thousand Years
rest: And I saw an angel descending from heaven, holding the key of the abyss and a great chain in his hand.

firstLine: Satan’s Release and Defeat
rest: And when the thousand years are completed, Satan will be released from his prison

firstLine: The Judgment at the Great White Throne
rest: And I saw a great white throne and the one who was seated on it, from whose presence earth and heaven fled, and a place was not found for them.

firstLine: The New Heaven, New Earth, and New Jerusalem
rest: And I saw a new heaven and a new earth, for the first heaven and the first earth had passed away, and the sea did not exist any longer.

firstLine: And I heard a loud voice from the throne saying,
rest:
“Behold, the dwelling of God is with humanity,
and he will take up residence with them,
and they will be his people
and God himself will be with them.

firstLine: And he will wipe away every tear from their eyes,
rest:
and death will not exist any longer,
and mourning or wailing or pain will not exist any longer.
The former things have passed away.”

firstLine: A Description of the New Jerusalem
rest: And one of the seven angels who had the seven bowls full of the seven last plagues came and spoke with me, saying, “Come, I will show you the bride, the wife of the Lamb.”

firstLine: Paradise Restored
rest: And he showed me the river of the water of life, clear as crystal, coming out from the throne of God and of the Lamb

firstLine: The Time of Fulfillment is Near
rest: And he said to me, “These words are faithful and true, and the Lord, the God of the spirits of the prophets, has sent his angel to show his slaves the things which must take place in a short time.”

firstLine: An Invitation to Respond
rest: And the Spirit and the bride say, “Come!” And the one who hears, let him say, “Come!” And the one who is thirsty, let him come. The one who wants, let him take the water of life freely.

firstLine: A Final Warning
rest: I testify to everyone who hears the words of the prophecy of this book: if anyone adds to them, God will add to him the plagues written in this book.

firstLine: The Beginning
rest: In the beginning, God created the heavens and the earth.

firstLine: Adam and Eve
rest:
Here is the story of the heavens and the earth when they were created.
The Lord God made the earth and the heavens.

firstLine: The man said,
rest:
“Her bones have come from my bones.
Her body has come from my body.
She will be named ‘woman,’
because she was taken out of a man.”

firstLine: Adam and Eve Fall Into Sin
rest: The serpent was more clever than any of the wild animals the Lord God had made. The serpent said to the woman, “Did God really say, ‘You must not eat the fruit of any tree that is in the garden’?”

firstLine: I will put hatred
rest:
between you and the woman.
Your children and her children will be enemies.
Her son will crush your head.
And you will crush his heel.”

firstLine: The Lord God said to the woman,
rest:
“I will greatly increase your pain when you give birth.
You will be in pain when you have children.
You will long for your husband.
And he will rule over you.”

firstLine: You will eat the plants of the field,
rest: even though the ground produces thorns and thistles.

firstLine: You will have to work hard and sweat a lot
rest:
to produce the food you eat.
You were made out of the ground.
And you will return to it.
You are dust.
So you will return to it.”

firstLine: Cain and Abel
rest: Adam made love to his wife Eve. She became pregnant and gave birth to Cain. She said, “With the Lord’s help I have had a baby boy.”

firstLine: Lamech said to his wives,
rest:
“Adah and Zillah, listen to me.
You wives of Lamech, hear my words.
I have killed a man because he wounded me.
I have killed a young man because he hurt me.

firstLine: The Family Line of Adam
rest:
Here is the written story of Adam’s family line.
When God created man, he made him in his own likeness.

firstLine: The Flood
rest: Men began to increase their numbers on the earth, and daughters were born to them.

firstLine: “As long as the earth lasts,
rest:
there will always be a time to plant
and a time to gather the crops.
As long as the earth lasts,
there will always be cold and heat.
There will always be summer and winter,
day and night.”

firstLine: God Makes a Covenant With Noah
rest: Then God gave his blessing to Noah and his sons. He said to them, “Have children and increase your numbers. Fill the earth.

firstLine: “Anyone who murders man
rest:
will be killed by man.
That is because I have made man
in my own likeness.

firstLine: The Sons of Noah
rest: The sons of Noah who came out of the ark were Shem, Ham and Japheth. Ham was the father of Canaan.

firstLine: He said,
rest:
“May a curse be put on Canaan.
He will be the lowest of slaves to his brothers.”

firstLine: Noah also said,
rest:
“May the Lord, the God of Shem, be blessed.
May Canaan be the slave of Shem.

firstLine: A List of Nations
rest: Here is the story of Shem, Ham and Japheth. They were Noah’s sons. After the flood, they too had sons.

firstLine: The Sons of Japheth
rest:
The sons of Japheth were
Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech and Tiras.

firstLine: The sons of Gomer were
rest: Ashkenaz, Riphath and Togarmah.

firstLine: The sons of Javan were
rest: Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittim and the Rodanites.

firstLine: The Sons of Ham
rest:
The sons of Ham were
Cush, Egypt, Put and Canaan.

firstLine: The sons of Cush were
rest:
Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah and Sabteca.
The sons of Raamah were
Sheba and Dedan.

firstLine: Egypt was the father of
rest: the Ludites, Anamites, Lehabites and Naphtuhites.

firstLine: Canaan was the father of
rest: Sidon. Sidon was his oldest son. Canaan was also the father of the Hittites,

firstLine: The Sons of Shem
rest: Sons were also born to Shem. Shem was Japheth’s younger brother. All of the sons of Eber came from Shem.

firstLine: The sons of Shem were
rest: Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud and Aram.

firstLine: The sons of Aram were
rest: Uz, Hul, Gether and Meshech.

firstLine: Joktan was the father of
rest: Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth and Jerah.

firstLine: The Tower of Babel
rest: The whole world had only one language. All people spoke it.

firstLine: The Family Line of Shem
rest:
Here is the story of Shem.
It was two years after the flood. When Shem was 100 years old, he became the father of Arphaxad.

firstLine: God Chooses Abram
rest: The Lord had said to Abram, “Leave your country and your people. Leave your father’s family. Go to the land I will show you.

firstLine: “I will make you into a great nation.
rest:
I will bless you.
I will make your name great.
You will be a blessing to others.

firstLine: Abram Goes to Egypt
rest: At that time there wasn’t enough food in the land. So Abram went down to Egypt to live there for a while.

firstLine: Abram and Lot Separate
rest: Abram went up from Egypt to the Negev Desert. He took his wife and everything he had. Lot went with him.

firstLine: Abram Saves Lot
rest: At that time Amraphel was the king of Babylonia. Arioch was the king of Ellasar. Kedorlaomer was the king of Elam. And Tidal was the king of Goiim.

firstLine: God Makes a Covenant With Abram
rest:
Some time later, Abram had a vision. The Lord said to him,
“Abram, do not be afraid.
I am like a shield to you.
I am your very great reward.”

firstLine: Hagar and Ishmael
rest: Abram’s wife Sarai had never had any children by him. But she had a female servant from Egypt named Hagar.

firstLine: The angel of the Lord also said to her,
rest:
“You are now pregnant.
You will have a son.
You will name him Ishmael.
That is because the Lord has heard about your suffering.

firstLine: The Covenant of Circumcision
rest: When Abram was 99 years old, the Lord appeared to him. He said, “I am the Mighty God. Walk with me and live without any blame.

firstLine: Three Men Visit Abraham
rest: The Lord appeared to Abraham near the large trees of Mamre. Abraham was sitting at the entrance to his tent. It was the hottest time of the day.

firstLine: “Where is your wife Sarah?” they asked him.
rest: “Over there, in the tent,” he said.

firstLine: Abraham Makes an Appeal for Sodom
rest: The men got up to leave. They looked down toward Sodom. Abraham walked along with them to see them on their way.

firstLine: The Lord Destroys Sodom and Gomorrah
rest:
The two angels arrived at Sodom in the evening. Lot was sitting near the gate of the city.
When Lot saw them, he got up to meet them. He bowed down with his face to the ground.

firstLine: Lot and His Daughters
rest: Lot and his two daughters left Zoar. They went to settle down in the mountains. Lot was afraid to stay in Zoar. So he and his daughters lived in a cave.

firstLine: Abraham and Abimelech
rest: Abraham moved away from there into the Negev Desert. He lived between Kadesh and Shur. For a while he stayed in Gerar.

firstLine: Isaac Is Born
rest: The Lord was gracious to Sarah, just as he had said he would be. He did for Sarah what he had promised to do.

firstLine: Abraham Sends Hagar and Ishmael Away
rest: Isaac grew. The time came for his mother to stop nursing him. On that day Abraham had a big dinner prepared.

firstLine: The Peace Treaty at Beersheba
rest: At that time Abimelech and Phicol spoke to Abraham. Phicol was the commander of Abimelech’s army. They said, “God is with you in everything you do.

firstLine: God Puts Abraham to the Test
rest:
Some time later God put Abraham to the test. He said to him, “Abraham!”
“Here I am,” Abraham replied.

firstLine: Nahor’s Sons
rest: Some time later Abraham was told, “Milcah has become a mother. She has had sons by your brother Nahor.

firstLine: Sarah Dies
rest: Sarah lived to be 127 years old.

firstLine: Abraham’s Servant Finds a Wife for Isaac
rest: By that time Abraham was very old. The Lord had blessed him in every way.

firstLine: “I asked her, ‘Whose daughter are you?’
rest:
“She said, ‘The daughter of Bethuel. He’s the son Milcah had by Nahor.’
“Then I put the ring in her nose. I put the bracelets on her arms.

firstLine: Abraham Dies
rest: Abraham married another woman. Her name was Keturah.

firstLine: The Sons of Ishmael
rest: Here is the story of Abraham’s son Ishmael. Hagar had Ishmael by Abraham. She was Sarah’s servant from Egypt.

firstLine: Jacob and Esau
rest:
Here is the story of Abraham’s son Isaac.
Abraham was the father of Isaac.

firstLine: The Lord said to her,
rest:
“Two nations are in your body.
Two tribes that are now inside you will be separated.
One nation will be stronger than the other.
The older son will serve the younger one.”

firstLine: Isaac and Abimelech
rest: There was very little food in the land. The same thing had been true earlier, in Abraham’s time. Isaac went to Abimelech in Gerar. Abimelech was the king of the Philistines.

firstLine: Isaac Gives Jacob His Blessing
rest:
Isaac had become old. His eyes were so weak he couldn’t see anymore. One day he called for his older son Esau. He said to him, “My son.”
“Here I am,” he answered.

firstLine: “Are you really my son Esau?” he asked.
rest: “I am,” Jacob replied.

firstLine: His father Isaac answered him,
rest:
“You will live far away from the richness of the earth.
You will live far away from the dew of heaven above.

firstLine: Jacob Runs Away to Laban
rest: Esau was angry with Jacob. He was angry because of the blessing his father had given to Jacob. He said to himself, “My father will soon die. The days of sorrow over him are near. Then I’ll kill my brother Jacob.”

firstLine: Jacob Has a Dream at Bethel
rest: Jacob left Beersheba and started out for Haran.

firstLine: Jacob Arrives in Paddan Aram
rest: Then Jacob continued on his journey. He came to the land where the eastern tribes lived.

firstLine: Jacob Becomes the Father of Many Children
rest: The Lord saw that Jacob didn’t love Leah as much as he loved Rachel. So he let Leah have children. But Rachel wasn’t able to have children.

firstLine: Jacob’s Flocks Increase Their Numbers
rest: After Rachel had Joseph, Jacob spoke to Laban. He said, “Send me on my way. I want to go back to my own home and country.

firstLine: “What should I give you?” Laban asked.
rest: “Don’t give me anything,” Jacob replied. “Just do one thing for me. Then I’ll go on taking care of your flocks and watching over them.

firstLine: Jacob Runs Away From Laban
rest: Jacob heard what Laban’s sons were saying. “Jacob has taken everything our father owned,” they said. “He has gained all of this wealth from what belonged to our father.”

firstLine: Laban Chases Jacob
rest: On the third day Laban was told that Jacob had run away.

firstLine: “The God of Abraham and Nahor is also the God of their father. May their God decide which of us is right.”
rest: So Jacob took an oath in the name of the God his father Isaac worshiped.

firstLine: Jacob Gets Ready to Meet Esau
rest: Jacob also went on his way. The angels of God met him.

firstLine: Jacob Struggles With God
rest: That night Jacob got up. He took his two wives, his two female servants and his 11 sons and sent them across the Jabbok River.

firstLine: Jacob Meets Esau
rest: Jacob looked up. And there was Esau, coming with his 400 men! So Jacob separated the children. He put them with Leah, Rachel and the two female servants.

firstLine: Simeon and Levi Kill the Men of Shechem
rest: Dinah was the daughter Leah had by Jacob. Dinah went out to visit the women of the land.

firstLine: Jacob Returns to Bethel
rest: Then God said to Jacob, “Go up to Bethel and settle there. Build an altar there to honor me. That’s where I appeared to you when you were running away from your brother Esau.”

firstLine: Rachel and Isaac Die
rest: They moved on from Bethel. Ephrath wasn’t very far away when Rachel began to have a baby. She was having a very hard time of it.

firstLine: Leah was the mother of
rest:
Reuben, Jacob’s oldest son.
Her other sons were
Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar and Zebulun.

firstLine: The sons of Rachel were
rest: Joseph and Benjamin.

firstLine: The sons of Rachel’s female servant Bilhah were
rest: Dan and Naphtali.

firstLine: The sons of Leah’s female servant Zilpah were
rest:
Gad and Asher.
Those were Jacob’s sons. They were born in Paddan Aram.

firstLine: The Family Line of Esau
rest: Here is the story of Esau. Esau was also called Edom.

firstLine: The sons of Eliphaz were
rest: Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam and Kenaz.

firstLine: The sons of Reuel were
rest: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah and Mizzah. They were grandsons of Esau’s wife Basemath.

firstLine: The sons of Esau’s son Reuel were
rest: Chiefs Nahath, Zerah, Shammah and Mizzah. They were the chiefs in Edom who were sons of Reuel. They were grandsons of Esau’s wife Basemath.

firstLine: The sons of Esau’s wife Oholibamah were
rest: Chiefs Jeush, Jalam and Korah. They were the chiefs who were sons of Esau’s wife Oholibamah. She was Anah’s daughter.

firstLine: The sons of Lotan were
rest: Hori and Homam. Timna was Lotan’s sister.

firstLine: The sons of Shobal were
rest: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho and Onam.

firstLine: The sons of Zibeon were
rest: Aiah and Anah. He was the Anah who discovered the hot springs of water in the desert. He found them while he was taking care of the donkeys that belonged to his father Zibeon.

firstLine: The children of Anah were
rest: Dishon and Oholibamah. Oholibamah was the daughter of Anah.

firstLine: The sons of Dishon were
rest: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran and Keran.

firstLine: The sons of Ezer were
rest: Bilhan, Zaavan and Akan.

firstLine: The sons of Dishan were
rest: Uz and Aran.

firstLine: The Horite chiefs were
rest: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah,

firstLine: The Rulers of Edom
rest: Before Israel had a king, there were kings who ruled in Edom.

firstLine: Joseph Has Two Dreams
rest: Jacob lived in the land of Canaan. It’s the land where his father had stayed.

firstLine: Joseph Is Sold by His Brothers
rest: Joseph’s brothers had gone to take care of their father’s flocks near Shechem.

firstLine: “They’ve moved on from here,” the man answered. “I heard them say, ‘Let’s go to Dothan.’”
rest: So Joseph went to look for his brothers. He found them near Dothan.

firstLine: “Let’s not spill any blood. Throw him into this empty well here in the desert. But don’t harm him yourselves.”
rest: Reuben said that to save Joseph from them. He was hoping he could take him back to his father.

firstLine: Judah and Tamar
rest: At that time, Judah left his brothers. He went down to stay with a man named Hirah. Hirah was from the town of Adullam.

firstLine: “I’ll send you a young goat from my flock,” he said.
rest: “Will you give me something that belongs to you?” she asked. “I’ll keep it until you send the goat.”

firstLine: Joseph and Potiphar’s Wife
rest: Joseph had been taken down to Egypt. An Egyptian named Potiphar had bought him from the Ishmaelite traders who had taken him there. Potiphar was one of Pharaoh’s officials. He was the captain of the palace guard.

firstLine: The Wine Taster and the Baker
rest: Some time later, the Egyptian king’s baker and wine taster did something their master didn’t like.

firstLine: “We both had dreams,” they answered. “But no one can tell us what they mean.”
rest: Then Joseph said to them, “Only God knows what dreams mean. Tell me your dreams.”

firstLine: Pharaoh Has Two Dreams
rest: When two full years had passed, Pharaoh had a dream. In his dream, he was standing by the Nile River.

firstLine: Joseph Is Put in Charge of Egypt
rest: So Pharaoh said to Joseph, “I’m putting you in charge of the whole land of Egypt.”

firstLine: Joseph’s Brothers Go Down to Egypt
rest: Jacob found out that there was grain in Egypt. So he said to his sons, “Why do you just keep looking at each other?”

firstLine: “My money has been given back,” he said to his brothers. “Here it is in my sack.”
rest: They had a sinking feeling in their hearts. They began to tremble. They turned to each other and said, “What has God done to us?”

firstLine: Joseph’s Brothers Go Down to Egypt Again
rest: There still wasn’t enough food anywhere in the land.

firstLine: A Silver Cup in a Sack
rest: Joseph told the manager of his house what to do. “Fill the men’s sacks with as much food as they can carry,” he said. “Put each man’s money in his sack.

firstLine: Joseph Tells His Brothers Who He Is
rest:
Joseph couldn’t control himself anymore in front of all of his attendants. He cried out, “Have everyone leave me!”
So there wasn’t anyone with Joseph when he told his brothers who he was.

firstLine: Jacob Goes Down to Egypt
rest: So Israel started out with everything that belonged to him. When he reached Beersheba, he offered sacrifices to the God of his father Isaac.

firstLine: The sons of Reuben were
rest: Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron and Carmi.

firstLine: The sons of Simeon were
rest: Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jakin, Zohar and Shaul. Shaul was the son of a woman from Canaan.

firstLine: The sons of Levi were
rest: Gershon, Kohath and Merari.

firstLine: The sons of Judah were
rest: Er, Onan, Shelah, Perez and Zerah. But Er and Onan had died in the land of Canaan. The sons of Perez were Hezron and Hamul.

firstLine: The sons of Issachar were
rest: Tola, Puah, Jashub and Shimron.

firstLine: The sons of Zebulun were
rest: Sered, Elon and Jahleel.

firstLine: The sons of Gad were
rest: Zephon, Haggi, Shuni, Ezbon, Eri, Arodi and Areli.

firstLine: The sons of Asher were
rest: Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi and Beriah. Their sister was Serah. The sons of Beriah were Heber and Malkiel.

firstLine: The sons of Jacob’s wife Rachel were
rest: Joseph and Benjamin.

firstLine: The sons of Benjamin were
rest: Bela, Beker, Ashbel, Gera, Naaman, Ehi, Rosh, Muppim, Huppim and Ard.

firstLine: The son of Dan was
rest: Hushim.

firstLine: The sons of Naphtali were
rest: Jahziel, Guni, Jezer and Shillem.

firstLine: Joseph Saves Many Lives
rest: But there wasn’t any food in the whole area. In fact, there wasn’t enough food anywhere. Both Egypt and Canaan lost their strength because there wasn’t enough food to go around.

firstLine: Ephraim and Manasseh
rest: Some time later Joseph was told, “Your father is sick.” So he took his two sons Manasseh and Ephraim along with him.

firstLine: “They are the sons God has given me here,” Joseph said to his father.
rest: Then Israel said, “Bring them to me. I want to give them my blessing.”

firstLine: Jacob Gives Blessings to His Sons
rest: Then Jacob sent for his sons. He said, “Gather around me so I can tell you what will happen to you in days to come.

firstLine: “Sons of Jacob, come together and listen.
rest: Listen to your father Israel.

firstLine: “Reuben, you are my oldest son.
rest:
You were my first child. You were the first sign of my strength.
You were first in honor. You were first in power.

firstLine: “Simeon and Levi are brothers.
rest: Their swords have killed a lot of people.

firstLine: May the Lord put a curse on them
rest:
because of their terrible anger.
I will scatter them in Jacob’s land.
I will spread them around in Israel.

firstLine: “Judah, your brothers will praise you.
rest:
Your enemies will be brought under your control.
Your father’s sons will bow down to you.

firstLine: “Zebulun will live by the seashore.
rest:
He will become a safe harbor for ships.
His border will go out toward Sidon.

firstLine: “Issachar is like a donkey
rest: lying down between two saddlebags.

firstLine: “Dan will do what is fair for his people.
rest: He will do it as one of the tribes of Israel.

firstLine: “Gad will be attacked by a group of robbers.
rest: But he’ll attack them as they run away.

firstLine: “Asher’s food will be rich and sweet.
rest: He will provide food that even a king would enjoy.

firstLine: “Naphtali is a female deer that is set free
rest: and gives birth to beautiful fawns.

firstLine: “Joseph is a vine that grows a lot of fruit.
rest:
It grows close by a spring.
Its branches climb over a wall.

firstLine: “Benjamin is a hungry wolf.
rest:
In the morning he eats what he has killed.
In the evening he shares what he has stolen.”

firstLine: Jacob Dies
rest: Then Jacob gave directions to his sons. He said, “I’m about to join the members of my family who have already died. Bury me with them in the cave in the field of Ephron the Hittite.

firstLine: Joseph Sets His Brothers Free From Their Fears
rest: Now that their father was dead, Joseph’s brothers were worried. They said, “Remember all of the bad things we did to Joseph? What if he decides to hold those things against us? What if he pays us back for them?”

firstLine: Joseph Dies
rest: Joseph stayed in Egypt, along with all of his father’s family. He lived 110 years.

firstLine: The People of Israel Are Slaves in Egypt
rest: Here are the names of Israel’s children who went to Egypt with Jacob. Each one went with his family.

firstLine: Moses Is Born
rest: A man and a woman from the tribe of Levi got married.

firstLine: Moses Escapes to Midian
rest: Moses grew up. One day, he went out to where his own people were. He watched them while they were hard at work. He saw an Egyptian hitting a Hebrew man. The man was one of Moses’ own people.

firstLine: The Lord Sends Moses to Save His People
rest: Moses was taking care of the flock of his father-in-law Jethro. Jethro was the priest of Midian. Moses led the flock to the western side of the desert. He came to Horeb. It was the mountain of God.

firstLine: Miraculous Signs for Moses to Do
rest: Moses answered, “What if the elders of Israel won’t believe me? What if they won’t listen to me? Suppose they say, ‘The Lord didn’t appear to you.’ Then what should I do?”

firstLine: Moses Returns to Egypt
rest:
Then Moses went back to his father-in-law Jethro. He said to him, “Let me go back to my own people in Egypt. I want to see if any of them are still alive.”
Jethro said, “Go. I hope everything goes well with you.”

firstLine: Pharaoh Makes the Israelites Work Even Harder
rest: Later on, Moses and Aaron went to Pharaoh. They said, “The Lord is the God of Israel. He says, ‘Let my people go. Then they will be able to hold a feast in my honor in the desert.’”

firstLine: The Lord Promises to Save the Israelites
rest: Moses returned to the Lord. He said to him, “Lord, why have you brought trouble on these people? Is this why you sent me?

firstLine: The Family Line of Moses and Aaron
