rest: The Lord had spoken to Moses and Aaron. He had talked with them about the Israelites and about Pharaoh, the king of Egypt. He had commanded Moses and Aaron to bring the people of Israel out of Egypt.

firstLine: Aaron Speaks for Moses
rest: The Lord had spoken to Moses in Egypt.

firstLine: Aaron’s Wooden Staff Becomes a Snake
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron.

firstLine: The Nile River Turns Into Blood
rest: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Pharaoh’s heart is very stubborn. He refuses to let the people go.

firstLine: The Plague of Frogs
rest: Seven days passed after the Lord struck the Nile River.

firstLine: “Tomorrow,” Pharaoh said.
rest: Moses replied, “It will happen just as you say. Then you will know that there is no one like the Lord our God.

firstLine: The Plague of Gnats
rest: Then the Lord spoke to Moses. He said, “Tell Aaron, ‘Reach your wooden staff out. Strike the dust on the ground with it.’ Then all over the land of Egypt the dust will turn into gnats.”

firstLine: The Plague of Flies
rest: Then the Lord spoke to Moses. He said, “Get up early in the morning. Talk to Pharaoh as he goes down to the river. Say to him, ‘The Lord says, “Let my people go. Then they will be able to worship me.

firstLine: The Plague on Livestock
rest: Then the Lord spoke to Moses. He said, “Go to Pharaoh. Tell him, ‘The Lord, the God of the Hebrews, says, “Let my people go. Then they will be able to worship me.

firstLine: The Plague of Boils
rest: Then the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron. He said, “Take handfuls of ashes from a furnace. Have Moses toss them into the air in front of Pharaoh.

firstLine: The Plague of Hail
rest: Then the Lord spoke to Moses. He said, “Get up early in the morning. Go to Pharaoh and say to him, ‘The Lord, the God of the Hebrews, says, “Let my people go. Then they will be able to worship me.

firstLine: The Plague of Locusts
rest: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Go to Pharaoh. I have made his heart stubborn. I have also made the hearts of his officials stubborn so I can do my miraculous signs among them.

firstLine: The Plague of Darkness
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said, “Reach out your hand toward the sky. Darkness will spread over Egypt. It will be so dark that people can feel it.”

firstLine: The Lord Announces the Tenth Plague
rest: The Lord had spoken to Moses. He had said, “I will bring one more plague on Pharaoh and on Egypt. After that, he will let you and your people go. When he does, he will drive you completely away.

firstLine: The First Passover Sacrifice
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron in Egypt.

firstLine: The People of Israel Leave Egypt
rest: During the night, Pharaoh sent for Moses and Aaron. He said to them, “Get out of here! You and the Israelites, leave my people! Go. Worship the Lord, just as you have asked.

firstLine: Rules for the Passover
rest:
The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron. He said, “Here are the rules for the Passover.
“No one from another country is allowed to eat the Passover meal.

firstLine: Setting Apart the Oldest Sons
rest: The Lord said to Moses,

firstLine: “In days to come, your son will ask you, ‘What does this mean?’
rest: “When he does, say to him, ‘The Lord used his mighty hand to bring us out of Egypt. That’s the land where we were slaves.

firstLine: Israel Goes Through the Red Sea
rest: Pharaoh let the people go. The shortest road from Goshen to Canaan went through the Philistine country. But God didn’t lead them that way. God said, “If they have to go into battle, they might change their minds. They might return to Egypt.”

firstLine: The Song of Moses and Miriam
rest:
Here is the song that Moses and the people of Israel sang to the Lord. They said,
“I will sing to the Lord.
He is greatly honored.
He has thrown Pharaoh’s horses and their riders
into the Red Sea.

firstLine: He has thrown Pharaoh’s chariots and army
rest:
into the Red Sea.
Pharaoh’s best officers
drowned in the sea.

firstLine: “Lord, your right hand
rest:
was majestic and powerful.
Lord, your right hand
destroyed your enemies.

firstLine: Because of your great majesty,
rest:
you threw down those who opposed you.
Your burning anger blazed out.
It burned them up like straw.

firstLine: The powerful blast from your nose
rest:
piled up the waters.
The rushing waters stood firm like a wall.
The deep waters stood up in the middle of the sea.

firstLine: “Your enemies bragged,
rest:
‘We will chase Israel. We will catch them.
We’ll divide up what we take from them.
We’ll eat them alive.
We’ll pull our swords out.
Our powerful hands will destroy them.’

firstLine: “Lord, who among the gods is like you?
rest:
Who is like you?
You are majestic and holy.
Your glory fills me with wonder.
You do wonderful miracles.

firstLine: “Because your love is faithful,
rest:
you will lead the people you have set free.
Because you are so strong,
you will guide them to the holy place where you live.

firstLine: “The Lord will rule
rest: for ever and ever.”

firstLine: Miriam sang to them,
rest:
“Sing to the Lord.
He is greatly honored.
He has thrown Pharaoh’s horses and their riders
into the Red Sea.”

firstLine: At the Waters of Marah and Elim
rest: Then Moses led Israel away from the Red Sea. They went into the Desert of Shur. For three days they traveled in the desert. They didn’t find any water there.

firstLine: The Lord Gives Israel Food Every Day
rest: The whole community of Israel started out from Elim. They came to the Desert of Sin. It was between Elim and Sinai. They arrived there on the 15th day of the second month after they had come out of Egypt.

firstLine: The Lord Gives Israel Water Out of the Rock
rest:
The whole community of Israel started out from the Desert of Sin. They traveled from place to place, just as the Lord commanded.
They camped at Rephidim. But there wasn’t any water for the people to drink.

firstLine: Joshua Wins the Battle Over the Amalekites
rest: The Amalekites came and attacked the Israelites at Rephidim.

firstLine: Jethro Visits Moses
rest: Moses’ father-in-law Jethro was the priest of Midian. He heard about everything God had done for Moses and for his people Israel. He heard how the Lord had brought Israel out of Egypt.

firstLine: Israel Comes to Mount Sinai
rest: Exactly three months after the people of Israel left Egypt, they came to the Desert of Sinai.

firstLine: God Gives His People the Ten Commandments
rest: Here are all of the words God spoke. He said,

firstLine: Worshiping the Lord
rest: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Here is what you must tell the people of Israel. Say to them, ‘You have seen for yourselves what I said to you from heaven.

firstLine: Set Your Hebrew Servants Free
rest: “Suppose you buy a Hebrew servant. He must serve you for six years. But in the seventh year, you must set him free. He does not have to pay anything.

firstLine: Laws About Harming Others
rest: “You can be sure that if anyone hits and kills someone else, he will be put to death.

firstLine: Laws About Keeping Property Safe
rest: “Suppose a man steals an ox or a sheep. And suppose he kills it or sells it. Then he must pay back five head of cattle for the ox. Or he must pay back four sheep or goats for the sheep.

firstLine: Laws About Social Problems
rest: “Suppose a man meets a virgin who is not engaged. And he talks her into having sex with him. Then he must pay her father the price for a bride. And he must get married to her.

firstLine: “Do not hold back your grain offerings or wine offerings.
rest: “You must give me the oldest of your sons.

firstLine: Laws About Mercy and Fairness
rest: “Do not spread reports that are false. Do not help an evil person by telling lies in court.

firstLine: Laws About Sabbaths
rest: “For six years plant your fields and gather your crops.

firstLine: Laws About Celebrating the Main Feasts
rest: “Three times a year you must celebrate a feast in my honor.

firstLine: “Celebrate the Feast of Weeks. Bring the first share of your crops from your field.
rest: “Celebrate the Feast of Booths. Hold it in the fall when you gather in your crops from the field.

firstLine: “Do not include anything that is made with yeast when you offer me the blood of a sacrifice.
rest: “Suppose the fat from sacrifices is left over from my feasts. Then do not keep it until morning.

firstLine: “Bring the best of the first share of your crops to my house. I am the Lord your God.
rest: “Do not cook a young goat in its mother’s milk.

firstLine: God’s Angel Will Prepare the Way
rest: “I am sending an angel ahead of you. He will guard you along the way. He will bring you to the place I have prepared.

firstLine: The Blood of the Covenant
rest: The Lord said to Moses, “You and Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and 70 of the elders of Israel must come up to me. Do not come close when you worship.

firstLine: Offerings for the Holy Tent
rest: The Lord said to Moses,

firstLine: “Here are the offerings you must receive from them.
rest: “gold, silver and bronze

firstLine: blue, purple and bright red yarn and fine linen
rest: goat hair

firstLine: ram skins that are dyed red
rest:
the hides of sea cows
acacia wood

firstLine: olive oil for the lights
rest: spices for the anointing oil and for the sweet-smelling incense

firstLine: The Ark of the Covenant
rest: “Have them make a chest out of acacia wood. Make it three feet nine inches long and two feet three inches wide and high.

firstLine: The Table for the Holy Bread
rest: “Make a table out of acacia wood. Make it three feet long, one foot six inches wide and two feet three inches high.

firstLine: The Gold Lampstand
rest: “Make a lampstand out of pure gold. Hammer out its base and stem. Its buds, blooms and cups must branch out from it.

firstLine: The Holy Tent
rest: “Make ten curtains out of finely twisted linen for the holy tent. Make them with blue, purple and bright red yarn. Have a skilled worker sew cherubim into the pattern.

firstLine: The Altar for Burnt Offerings
rest: “Build an altar out of acacia wood. It must be four feet six inches high and seven feet six inches square.

firstLine: The Courtyard
rest: “Make a courtyard for the holy tent. The south side must be 150 feet long. It must have curtains that are made out of finely twisted linen.

firstLine: Oil for the Lampstand
rest: “Command the people of Israel to bring you clear oil that is made from pressed olives. Use it to keep the lamps burning and giving light.

firstLine: Clothes for the Priests
rest: “Have your brother Aaron brought to you from among the people of Israel. His sons Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar must also be brought. They will serve me as priests.

firstLine: The Linen Apron
rest: “Make the linen apron out of fine gold wire, and out of blue, purple and bright red yarn, and out of finely twisted linen. Have a skilled worker make it.

firstLine: The Chest Cloth
rest: “Make a chest cloth that will be used for making decisions. Have a skilled worker make it. Make it like the linen apron. Use fine gold wire, and blue, purple and bright red yarn, and finely twisted linen.

firstLine: More Clothes for the Priests
rest: “Make the outer robe of the linen apron completely from blue cloth.

firstLine: Directions for Setting the Priests Apart
rest:
“Here is what you must do to set Aaron and his sons apart to serve me as priests.
“Get a young bull and two rams. They must not have any flaws.

firstLine: The Altar for Burning Incense
rest: “Make an altar for burning incense. Make it out of acacia wood.

firstLine: Money to Pay for the People’s Lives
rest: Then the Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: The Large Bowl for Washing
rest: Then the Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: Anointing Oil
rest: Then the Lord spoke to Moses.

firstLine: Incense
rest: Then the Lord spoke to Moses. He said, “Get some sweet-smelling spices. Get some gum resin, onycha and galbanum. Also get some pure frankincense. Make sure everything is in equal amounts.

firstLine: Bezalel and Oholiab
rest: Then the Lord spoke to Moses.

firstLine: “I have also appointed Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, to help him. Oholiab is from the tribe of Dan.
rest: “I have given ability to all of the skilled workers. They can make everything I have commanded you to make. Here is the complete list.

firstLine: “the Tent of Meeting
rest:
the ark where the tablets of the covenant are kept
the cover for the ark

firstLine: the table for the holy bread and its articles
rest:
the pure gold lampstand and everything that is used with it
the altar for burning incense

firstLine: the altar for burnt offerings and all of its tools
rest: the large bowl with its stand

firstLine: the sacred clothes for Aaron the priest
rest: the clothes for his sons when they serve as priests

firstLine: the anointing oil
rest:
the sweet-smelling incense for the Holy Room
“The skilled workers must make them just as I commanded you.”

firstLine: The Sabbath Day
rest: Then the Lord spoke to Moses.

firstLine: Israel Worships a Golden Calf
rest: The people saw that Moses took a long time to come down from the mountain. So they gathered around Aaron. They said to him, “Come. Make us a god that will lead us. This fellow Moses brought us up out of Egypt. But we don’t know what has happened to him.”

firstLine: Moses replied,
rest:
“It’s not the sound of winning.
It’s not the sound of losing.
It’s the sound of singing that I hear.”

firstLine: The Tent of Meeting
rest: Moses used to take a tent and set it up far outside the camp. He called it the “tent of meeting.” Anyone who wanted to ask the Lord a question would go to the tent of meeting that was outside the camp.

firstLine: The Lord Shows Moses His Glory
rest: Moses said to the Lord, “You have been telling me, ‘Lead these people.’ But you haven’t let me know whom you will send with me. You have said, ‘I know your name. I know all about you. And I am pleased with you.’

firstLine: The New Stone Tablets
rest: The Lord said to Moses, “Cut out two stone tablets that are just like the first ones. I will write on them the words that were on the first tablets, which you broke.

firstLine: “Celebrate the Feast of Weeks. Bring the first share of your wheat crop.
rest: “Celebrate the Feast of Booths. Hold it in the fall.

firstLine: “Bring the best of the first share of your crops to my house. I am the Lord your God.
rest: “Do not cook a young goat in its mother’s milk.”

firstLine: The Face of Moses Shines
rest: Moses came down from Mount Sinai. He had the two tablets of the covenant in his hands. His face was shining because he had spoken with the Lord. But he didn’t realize it.

firstLine: Rules for the Sabbath Day
rest: Moses gathered the whole community of Israel together. He said to them, “Here are the things the Lord has commanded you to do.

firstLine: Supplies for the Holy Tent
rest: Moses spoke to the whole community of Israel. He said, “Here is what the Lord has commanded.

firstLine: blue, purple and bright red yarn and fine linen
rest: goat hair

firstLine: ram skins that are dyed red
rest:
the hides of sea cows
acacia wood

firstLine: olive oil for the lights
rest: spices for the anointing oil and for the sweet-smelling incense

firstLine: the ark of the covenant
rest:
the poles and cover for the ark
the curtain that screens the ark

firstLine: the table for the holy bread
rest:
the poles and all of the articles for the table
the holy bread

firstLine: the lampstand for light and everything that is used with it
rest: the lamps and the olive oil that gives light

firstLine: the altar for burning incense
rest:
the poles for the altar
the anointing oil
the sweet-smelling incense
the curtain for the entrance to the holy tent

firstLine: the altar for burnt offerings with its bronze grate
rest:
its poles and all of its tools
the large bronze bowl with its stand

firstLine: the curtains of the courtyard with their posts and bases
rest: the curtain for the entrance to the courtyard

firstLine: the sacred clothes for Aaron the priest
rest: the clothes for his sons when they serve as priests”

firstLine: Bezalel and Oholiab
rest: Then Moses spoke to the people of Israel. He said, “The Lord has chosen Bezalel, the son of Uri. Uri is the son of Hur. Bezalel is from the tribe of Judah.

firstLine: The Holy Tent
rest: All of the skilled workers made the holy tent. They made ten curtains out of finely twisted linen. They made them with blue, purple and bright red yarn. A skilled worker sewed cherubim into the pattern.

firstLine: The Ark of the Covenant
rest: Bezalel made the ark of the covenant out of acacia wood. It was three feet nine inches long and two feet three inches wide and high.

firstLine: The Table for the Holy Bread
rest: The workers made the table out of acacia wood. It was three feet long, one foot six inches wide and two feet three inches high.

firstLine: The Gold Lampstand
rest: The workers made the lampstand out of pure gold. They hammered out its base and stem. Its buds, blooms and cups branched out from it.

firstLine: The Altar for Burning Incense
rest: The workers made an altar for burning incense. They made it out of acacia wood. It was one foot six inches square and three feet high. A horn stuck out from each of its upper four corners.

firstLine: The Altar for Burnt Offerings
rest: The workers made the altar for burnt offerings out of acacia wood. It was four feet six inches high and seven feet six inches square.

firstLine: The Large Bowl for Washing
rest: The workers made the large bronze bowl and its bronze stand. They made them out of the bronze mirrors that belonged to the women who served at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.

firstLine: The Courtyard
rest: Next, the workers made the courtyard. The south side was 150 feet long. It had curtains that were made out of finely twisted linen.

firstLine: The Amounts of the Metals Used
rest: Here are the amounts of the metals that were used for the holy tent, where the tablets of the covenant were kept. Moses commanded the Levites to record the amounts. The Levites did the work under the direction of Ithamar. Ithamar was the son of the priest Aaron.

firstLine: The Clothes for the Priests
rest: The workers made clothes from the blue, purple and bright red yarn. The clothes were worn by those who served in the holy tent. The workers also made sacred clothes for Aaron. They made them just as the Lord had commanded Moses.

firstLine: The Linen Apron
rest: The workers made the linen apron out of fine gold wire, and out of blue, purple and bright red yarn, and out of finely twisted linen.

firstLine: The Chest Cloth
rest: Skilled workers made the chest cloth. They made it like the linen apron. They used fine gold wire, and blue, purple and bright red yarn, and finely twisted linen.

firstLine: More Clothes for the Priests
rest: The workers made the outer robe of the linen apron completely from blue cloth. The cloth was made by a skillful person.

firstLine: The Holy Tent Is Completed
rest: So all of the work on the holy tent, the Tent of Meeting, was completed. The people of Israel did everything just as the Lord had commanded Moses.

firstLine: the covering of ram skins that were dyed red
rest:
the covering of the hides of sea cows
the curtain that screens the ark

firstLine: the ark where the tablets of the covenant are kept
rest: the poles and cover for the ark

firstLine: the table for the holy bread with all of its articles
rest: the holy bread

firstLine: the pure gold lampstand with its row of lamps and everything that is used with it
rest: the olive oil that gives light

firstLine: the gold altar for burning incense
rest:
the anointing oil
the sweet-smelling incense
the curtain for the entrance to the tent

firstLine: the bronze altar for burnt offerings with its bronze grate
rest:
its poles and all of its tools
the large bowl with its stand

firstLine: the curtains of the courtyard with their posts and bases
rest:
the curtain for the entrance to the courtyard
the ropes and tent stakes for the courtyard

firstLine: the sacred clothes for the priest Aaron
rest: the clothes for his sons when they serve as priests

firstLine: Moses Sets Up the Holy Tent
rest: Then the Lord said to Moses,

firstLine: The Glory of the Lord
rest: Then the cloud covered the Tent of Meeting. The glory of the Lord filled the holy tent.

firstLine: Rules for Burnt Offerings
rest: The Lord called out to Moses. He spoke to him from the Tent of Meeting. He said,

firstLine: Rules for Grain Offerings
rest: “‘Suppose someone brings a grain offering to the Lord. Then his offering must be made out of fine flour. He must pour olive oil on it. He must also put incense on it.

firstLine: Rules for Friendship Offerings
rest: “‘Suppose someone brings a friendship offering. If he offers an animal from the herd, it can be either male or female. It must not have any flaws. He must offer it in the sight of the Lord.

firstLine: Rules for Sin Offerings
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: Rules for Guilt Offerings
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: More Rules for Burnt Offerings
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: More Rules for Grain Offerings
rest: “‘Here are some more rules for grain offerings. The priests who are in Aaron’s family line must bring the grain offering to the Lord in front of the altar.

firstLine: More Rules for Sin Offerings
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: More Rules for Guilt Offerings
rest: “‘Here are some more rules for guilt offerings. The guilt offering is very holy.

firstLine: More Rules for Friendship Offerings
rest: “‘Here are some more rules for friendship offerings a person may bring to the Lord.

firstLine: Israel Must Not Eat Fat or Blood
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: The Share That Belongs to the Priests
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: Preparing the Priests to Serve the Lord
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: The Priests Offer Sacrifices
rest: On the eighth day Moses sent for Aaron, his sons and the elders of Israel.

firstLine: The Lord Kills Nadab and Abihu
rest: Nadab and Abihu were two of Aaron’s sons. They got their shallow cups for burning incense. They put fire in them. They added incense to it. They made an offering to the Lord by using fire that wasn’t allowed. They did it against his command.

firstLine: Food That Is “Clean” and Food That Is Not
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron. He said to them,

firstLine: “‘Some animals only chew the cud. Some only have hoofs that are separated in two. You must not eat those animals.
rest: “‘Camels chew the cud. But their hoofs are not separated in two. So they are not “clean” for you.

firstLine: “‘Here are the birds you must be sure to avoid. Do not eat them. Be sure to avoid them.
rest: “‘They include eagles, vultures and black vultures.

firstLine: Becoming “Clean” After Having a Baby
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: Rules About Skin Diseases
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron. He told them to say to the people,

firstLine: Rules About Mold
rest: “Suppose some clothes have mold on them. The clothes could be made out of wool or linen.

firstLine: Making People “Clean” From Skin Diseases
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He told him to say to the people,

firstLine: Making Things “Clean” From Mold
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron. He told them to say to the people,

firstLine: Rules About Liquid Body Wastes
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron. He said,

firstLine: The Day When Sin Is Paid For
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses after two of Aaron’s sons had died. They were the sons who died when they came near the Lord.

firstLine: Do Not Eat Meat That Has Blood in It
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: Do Not Commit Sexual Sins
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: Other Laws
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: “‘Do not steal.
rest:
“‘Do not tell lies.
“‘Do not cheat one another.

firstLine: “‘Do not cheat your neighbor. Do not rob him.
rest: “‘Do not hold back the pay of a hired worker until morning.

firstLine: “‘Do not go around spreading lies among your people.
rest: “‘Do not do anything that puts your neighbor’s life in danger. I am the Lord.

firstLine: “‘Obey my rules.
rest:
“‘Do not let different kinds of animals mate with each other.
“‘Do not mix two kinds of seeds and then plant them in your field.
“‘Do not wear clothes that are made out of two kinds of cloth.

firstLine: “‘Do not eat any meat that still has blood in it.
rest: “‘Do not practice any kind of evil magic at all.

firstLine: Israel Will Be Punished for Their Sins
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: Rules for Priests
rest: The Lord said to Moses, “Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron. Tell them, ‘A priest must not make himself “unclean” by going near the dead body of any of his people.

firstLine: Sacrifices the Lord Does Not Accept
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: The Sabbath Day
rest: “‘There are six days when you can work. But the seventh day is a Sabbath. You must rest on it. Come together on that sacred day. You must not do any work on it. No matter where you live, it is a Sabbath day in my honor.

firstLine: Passover and Unleavened Bread
rest: “‘Here are my appointed feasts. Tell the people that they must come together for these sacred feasts at their appointed times.

firstLine: The First Share of Israel’s Crops Belongs to the Lord
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: The Feast of Weeks
rest: “‘The day you brought the grain for the wave offering was the day after the Sabbath. Count off seven full weeks from that day.

firstLine: The Feast of Trumpets
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: The Day When Sin Is Paid For
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: The Feast of Booths
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: Olive Oil, Bread and Incense
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: A Person Who Speaks Evil Is Put to Death
rest: There was a man who had an Israelite mother. His father was born in Egypt. The man went out among the people of Israel. A fight broke out in the camp between him and an Israelite.

firstLine: The Sabbath Year
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses on Mount Sinai. He said,

firstLine: The Year of Jubilee
rest: “‘Count off seven sabbaths of years. Count off seven times seven years. The seven sabbaths of years add up to a total of 49 years.

firstLine: Rewards for Obeying the Lord
rest: “‘Do not make statues of gods for yourselves. Do not set up a likeness of a god or a sacred stone for yourselves. Do not place a carved stone in your land and bow down in front of it. I am the Lord your God.

firstLine: Punishment for Not Obeying the Lord
rest: “‘But suppose you will not listen to me. You will not carry out all of my commands.

firstLine: Keep Your Promises to the Lord
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: The Men of Israel Are Counted
rest:
The Lord spoke to Moses in the Tent of Meeting. It happened in the Desert of Sinai. The Lord spoke to him on the first day of the second month. It was the second year after the people of Israel came out of Egypt.
The Lord said,

firstLine: “Here are the names of the men who must help you.
rest: “From the tribe of Reuben will come Elizur, the son of Shedeur.

firstLine: The Tribes Camp Around the Tent of Meeting
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron. He said,

firstLine: The Levites
rest: Here is the story of the family of Aaron and Moses. It belongs to the time when the Lord talked with Moses on Mount Sinai.

firstLine: The sons of Levi were
rest: Gershon, Kohath and Merari.

firstLine: The major families from Gershon were
rest: Libni and Shimei.

firstLine: The major families from Kohath were
rest: Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.

firstLine: The major families from Merari were
rest:
Mahli and Mushi.
Those were the major families of the Levites.

firstLine: The Kohath Families
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron. He said,

firstLine: The Gershon Families
rest: The Lord said to Moses,

firstLine: The Merari Families
rest: “Count the Merari families. Count them family by family.

firstLine: Counting the Families of the Levites
rest: Moses, Aaron and the leaders of the community counted the men of Kohath. They counted them family by family.

firstLine: Making the Camp Pure
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: Sins Against Others Must Be Paid For
rest: The Lord said to Moses,

firstLine: The Test for a Wife Who Is Not Faithful
rest: Then the Lord spoke to Moses again. He said,

firstLine: Becoming a Nazirite
rest: The Lord said to Moses,

firstLine: How the Priests Bless the People
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: “‘“May the Lord bless you
rest: and take good care of you.

firstLine: May the Lord smile on you
rest: and be gracious to you.

firstLine: May the Lord look on you with favor
rest: and give you his peace.”’

firstLine: Israel’s Leaders Bring Offerings for the Holy Tent
rest: Moses finished setting up the holy tent. Then he anointed it with olive oil. He set it apart to the Lord. He did the same thing with everything that belonged to it. He also anointed the altar. And he set apart to the Lord the altar and all of its tools.

firstLine: Aaron Sets Up the Lamps
rest: The Lord said to Moses,

firstLine: Moses Sets the Levites Apart
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: Israel Celebrates the Passover Feast
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses in the Desert of Sinai. It was the first month of the second year after the people came out of Egypt. He said,

firstLine: The Cloud Covers the Holy Tent
rest: The holy tent was set up. It was the tent where the tablets of the covenant were kept. On the day it was set up, the cloud covered it. From evening until morning the cloud that was above the tent looked like fire.

firstLine: The Silver Trumpets
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: The People of Israel Leave the Sinai Desert
rest: It was the 20th day of the second month of the second year. On that day the cloud began to move. It went up from above the holy tent where the tablets of the covenant were kept.

firstLine: When the ark started out, Moses said,
rest:
“Lord, rise up!
Let your enemies be scattered.
Let them run away from you.”

firstLine: When the ark came to rest, Moses said,
rest:
“Lord, return.
Return to the many thousands of people in Israel.”

firstLine: The Lord Sends Fire Among the People
rest: The people weren’t happy about the hard times they were having. The Lord heard what they were saying. It made him burn with anger. Then the Lord sent fire on them. It blazed out among the people. It burned up some of the outer edges of the camp.

firstLine: The Lord Sends Meat for the People
rest: Some people who were with them began to long for other food. Again the people of Israel began to cry out. They said, “We wish we had meat to eat.

firstLine: Miriam and Aaron Speak Against Moses
rest: Miriam and Aaron began to say bad things about Moses. That’s because Moses had married a woman from Cush.

firstLine: Some Men Check Out the Land of Canaan
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: The Men Report on What They Found
rest: The men came back to Moses, Aaron and the whole community of Israel. The people were at Kadesh in the Desert of Paran. There the men reported to Moses and Aaron and all of the people. They showed them the fruit of the land.

firstLine: The People Refuse to Obey the Lord
rest: That night all of the people in the community raised their voices. They sobbed out loud.

firstLine: Other Offerings
rest: The Lord said to Moses,

firstLine: Offerings for Sins That Aren’t Committed on Purpose
rest: “‘Suppose you fail to keep any of the commands the Lord gave Moses. And suppose you do it without meaning to.

firstLine: A Man Breaks the Sabbath Day
rest: The people of Israel were in the desert. One Sabbath day, people saw a man gathering wood.

firstLine: Tassels on Clothes
rest: The Lord said to Moses,

firstLine: Korah, Dathan and Abiram
rest: Korah was the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath. Kohath was the son of Levi. Korah and certain men from the tribe of Reuben turned against Moses. The men from Reuben were Dathan, Abiram and On. Dathan and Abiram were the sons of Eliab. On was the son of Peleth.

firstLine: Aaron’s Wooden Staff Produces Buds
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: Duties of Priests and Levites
rest: The Lord spoke to Aaron. He said, “You, your sons and your father’s family are in charge of the sacred tent. You will be held accountable for sins that are committed against it. And you and your sons will be held accountable for sins that are committed against the office of priest.

firstLine: Offerings for Priests and Levites
rest: Then the Lord spoke to Aaron. He said, “I have put you in charge of the offerings that are brought to me. The people of Israel will give me holy offerings. I will give all of their offerings to you and your sons. They are the part that belongs to you. They are your regular share.

firstLine: The Special Water That Makes People “Clean”
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron. He said,

firstLine: The Lord Gives Israel Water Out of the Rock
rest: In the first month the whole community of Israel arrived at the Desert of Zin. They stayed at Kadesh. Miriam died there. Her body was also buried there.

firstLine: Edom Doesn’t Let Israel Pass Through Its Territory
rest:
Moses sent messengers from Kadesh to the king of Edom. The messengers said,
“The nation of Israel is your brother. They say, ‘You know about all of the hard times we’ve had.

firstLine: But the people of Edom answered,
rest: “You can’t pass through here. If you try to, we’ll march out against you. We’ll attack you with our swords.”

firstLine: The people of Israel replied,
rest: “We’ll go along the main road. We and our livestock won’t drink any of your water. If we do, we’ll pay for it. We only want to walk through your country. That’s all we ask.”

firstLine: Again the people of Edom answered,
rest:
“You can’t pass through here.”
Then the people of Edom came out against them. They came with a large and powerful army.

firstLine: Aaron Dies
rest: The whole community of Israel started out from Kadesh. They arrived at Mount Hor.

firstLine: Israel Destroys Arad
rest: The Canaanite king of the city of Arad lived in the Negev Desert. He heard that Israel was coming along the road to Atharim. So he attacked the people of Israel. He captured some of them.

firstLine: Moses Makes a Bronze Snake
rest: The people of Israel traveled from Mount Hor along the way to the Red Sea. They wanted to go around Edom. But they grew tired on the way.

firstLine: The People Continue On to Moab
rest: The people of Israel moved on. They camped at Oboth.

firstLine: Israel Wins the Battle Over Sihon and Og
rest: The people of Israel sent messengers to speak to Sihon. He was the king of the Amorites. The messengers said to him,

firstLine: That’s why the poets say,
rest:
“Come to Heshbon. Let it be built again.
Let Sihon’s city be made as good as new.

firstLine: “Fire went out from Heshbon.
rest:
A blaze went out from the city of Sihon.
It burned up Ar in Moab.
It burned up the citizens who lived on Arnon’s hills.

firstLine: “But we have taken them over.
rest:
Heshbon is destroyed all the way to Dibon.
We have destroyed them as far as Nophah.
Nophah goes all the way to Medeba.”

firstLine: Balak Sends For Balaam
rest: Then the people of Israel traveled to the flatlands of Moab. They camped along the Jordan River across from Jericho.

firstLine: Balaam’s Donkey
rest: Balaam got up in the morning. He put a saddle on his donkey. Then he went with the princes of Moab.

firstLine: Balaam’s First Message From God
rest: Balaam said to Balak, “Build me seven altars here. Prepare seven bulls and seven rams for me to sacrifice.”

firstLine: But how can I put a curse on
rest:
people God hasn’t cursed?
How can I speak against
people the Lord hasn’t spoken against?

firstLine: Balaam’s Second Message From God
rest: Then Balak said to Balaam, “Come with me to another place. You can see the people of Israel from there. You will see only some of them. You won’t see all of them. From there, put a curse on them for me.”

firstLine: “I don’t see any trouble coming on the people of Jacob.
rest:
I don’t see any suffering in Israel.
The Lord their God is with them.
The shout of the King is among them.

firstLine: Balaam’s Third Message From God
rest: Then Balak said to Balaam, “Come. Let me take you to another place. Perhaps God will be pleased to let you put a curse on them for me from there.”

firstLine: “People of Jacob, your tents are very beautiful.
rest: Israel, the places where you live are very beautiful.

firstLine: “They spread out like valleys.
rest:
They are like gardens beside a river.
They are like aloes the Lord has planted.
They are like cedar trees beside a stream.

firstLine: “God brought them out of Egypt.
rest:
They are as strong as a wild ox.
They eat up nations that are at war with them.
They break their bones in pieces.
They wound them with their arrows.

firstLine: Balaam’s Fourth Message From God
rest:
Then Balaam spoke the message he had received from God. He said,
“Here is the message God gave Balaam, the son of Beor.
It’s the message God gave to the one who sees clearly.

firstLine: “I see him, but I don’t see him now.
rest:
I view him, but he isn’t near.
A star will come from among the people of Jacob.
A king will rise up out of Israel.
He’ll crush the foreheads of the people of Moab.
He’ll crush the skulls of all of the sons of Sheth.

firstLine: Balaam’s Fifth Message From God
rest:
Then Balaam saw the people of Amalek. He spoke the message he had received from God. He said,
“Amalek was the first nation to attack Israel.
But they will finally be destroyed.”

firstLine: Balaam’s Sixth Message From God
rest:
Then he saw the Kenites. He spoke the message he had received from God. He said,
“The place where you live is safe.
Your nest is on a high cliff.

firstLine: Balaam’s Seventh Message From God
rest:
Then he spoke the message he had received from God. He said,
“Who can live when God does this?

firstLine: Moab Leads Israel Down the Wrong Path
rest: Israel was staying in Shittim. The men of Israel began to commit sexual sins with the women of Moab.

firstLine: The Men of Israel Are Counted a Second Time
rest: After the plague the Lord spoke to Moses and the priest Eleazar. Eleazar was the son of Aaron. The Lord said,

firstLine: “Count all of the men who are 20 years old or more. Do it just as the Lord commanded Moses.”
rest: Here are the men of Israel who came out of Egypt.

firstLine: Zelophehad’s Daughters
rest: The daughters of Zelophehad belonged to the family groups of Manasseh. Zelophehad was the son of Hepher. Hepher was the son of Gilead. Gilead was the son of Makir. Makir was the son of Manasseh. And Manasseh was the son of Joseph. The names of Zelophehad’s daughters were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah and Tirzah. They approached

firstLine: Joshua Becomes Israel’s New Leader
rest: Then the Lord spoke to Moses. He said, “Go up this mountain in the Abarim range. See the land I have given the people of Israel.

firstLine: Offerings That Israel Must Bring Each Day
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: Offerings That Israel Must Bring on the Sabbath Day
rest: “‘On the Sabbath day, bring an offering of two lambs. They must be a year old. They must not have any flaws. Offer them along with their drink offering. Offer them along with a grain offering of 16 cups of fine flour. Mix it with olive oil.

firstLine: Offerings That Israel Must Bring Every Month
rest: “‘On the first day of every month, bring to the Lord a burnt offering. Bring two young bulls and one ram. Also bring seven male lambs that are a year old. They must not have any flaws.

firstLine: The Passover Feast
rest: “‘The Lord’s Passover Feast must be held on the 14th day of the first month.

firstLine: The Feast of Weeks
rest: “‘On the day you gather the first share of your crops, bring to the Lord an offering of your first grain. Do it during the Feast of Weeks. Come together for a special service. Do not do any regular work.

firstLine: The Feast of Trumpets
rest: “‘On the first day of the seventh month, come together for a special service. Do not do any regular work. Blow the trumpets on that day.

firstLine: The Day When Sin Is Paid For
rest: “‘On the tenth day of the seventh month, come together for a special service. You must not eat anything on that day. You must not do any work on it.

firstLine: The Feast of Booths
rest: “‘On the 15th day of the seventh month, come together for a special service. Do not do any regular work. Celebrate the Feast of Booths in honor of the Lord for seven days.

firstLine: Oaths and Special Promises
rest: Moses spoke to the heads of the tribes of Israel. He said, “Here is what the Lord commands.

firstLine: “Her husband can let her keep any special promise she makes. Or he can refuse to let her keep it.
rest: “Suppose she takes an oath and agrees not to eat anything. Then her husband can let her keep her promise. Or he can refuse to let her keep it.

firstLine: The Lord Punishes the People of Midian
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: The People Divide Up What They Had Taken
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: The Tribes on the East Side of the Jordan River
rest: The tribes of Reuben and Gad had very large herds and flocks. They looked at the lands of Jazer and Gilead. They saw that those lands were just right for livestock.

firstLine: The Places Where Israel Stopped During Their Journey
rest: Here are the places where the people of Israel stopped during their journey. When they came out of Egypt, they marched in companies like an army. Moses and Aaron led them.

firstLine: Israel Arrives at the Borders of Canaan
rest: The Lord spoke to Moses. He said,

firstLine: Shemuel, the son of Ammihud,
rest: is from the tribe of Simeon.

firstLine: Elidad, the son of Kislon,
rest: is from the tribe of Benjamin.

firstLine: Bukki, the son of Jogli,
rest: is the leader from the tribe of Dan.

firstLine: Hanniel, the son of Ephod,
rest: is the leader from the tribe of Manasseh. Manasseh was the son of Joseph.

firstLine: Kemuel, the son of Shiphtan,
rest: is the leader from the tribe of Ephraim. Ephraim was the son of Joseph.

firstLine: Elizaphan, the son of Parnach,
rest: is the leader from the tribe of Zebulun.

firstLine: Paltiel, the son of Azzan,
rest: is the leader from the tribe of Issachar.

firstLine: Ahihud, the son of Shelomi,
rest: is the leader from the tribe of Asher.

firstLine: Pedahel, the son of Ammihud,
rest: is the leader from the tribe of Naphtali.”

firstLine: The Levites Receive Their Towns
rest: On the flatlands of Moab, the Lord spoke to Moses. It was by the Jordan River across from Jericho. The Lord said,

firstLine: Cities to Go to for Safety
rest: “Six of the towns you give the Levites will be cities to go to for safety. A person who has killed someone can run to one of them. Also give the Levites 42 other towns.

firstLine: The Property Zelophehad’s Daughters Will Receive
rest: The heads of the families of Gilead came to Moses. Gilead was the son of Makir. The family heads were from the tribe of Manasseh. So they were in the family line of Joseph. They spoke to Moses in front of the leaders of the families of Israel.

firstLine: The Lord Commands Israel to Leave Mount Horeb
rest: These are the words Moses spoke to all of the people of Israel. At that time, they were in the desert east of the Jordan River. It’s in the Arabah Valley across from Suph. They were between Paran and Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth and Dizahab.

firstLine: Some Officials Help Moses
rest: At that time I spoke to you. I said, “You are too heavy a load for me to carry alone.

firstLine: Twelve Men Check Out the Land of Canaan
rest: The Lord our God commanded us to start out from Mount Horeb. So we did. We went toward the hill country of the Amorites. We traveled all through the huge and terrible desert you saw. Finally, we reached Kadesh Barnea.

firstLine: Israel Refuses to Obey the Lord
rest: But you wouldn’t go up. You refused to obey the command of the Lord your God.

firstLine: Israel Wanders in the Desert
rest: We turned back and started out toward the desert. We went along the road that leads to the Red Sea. That’s how the Lord had directed me. For a long time we made our way around the hill country of Seir.

firstLine: Israel Wins the Battle Over Sihon
rest: The Lord said, “Start out and go across the valley of the Arnon River. I have handed Sihon over to you. He is the Amorite king of Heshbon. I have also given you his country. Begin to take it as your own. Go to war against him.

firstLine: Israel Wins the Battle Over Og
rest: Next, we turned and went up along the road toward Bashan. Og, the king of Bashan, marched out with his whole army. They fought against us at Edrei.

firstLine: Moses Divides Up the Land
rest: I divided up the land we took over at that time. I gave the tribes of Reuben and Gad the territory north of Aroer by the Arnon River valley. It includes half of the hill country of Gilead together with its towns.

firstLine: The Lord Will Not Allow Moses to Cross the Jordan River
rest: At that time I gave Joshua a command. I said, “Your own eyes have seen everything the Lord your God has done to Sihon and Og. He will do the same thing to all of the kingdoms in the land where you are going.

firstLine: Obey the Lord
rest: Israel, listen to the rules and laws I’m going to teach you. Follow them. Then you will live. You will go in and take over the land. The Lord was the God of your people long ago. He’s giving you the land.

firstLine: Don’t Make or Worship Statues of Gods
rest: The Lord spoke to you at Mount Horeb out of the fire. But you didn’t see any shape or form that day. So be very careful.

firstLine: The Lord Is God
rest: Ask now about the days of long ago. Learn what happened long before your time. Ask about what has happened since the time God created man on the earth. Ask from one end of the world to the other. Has anything as great as this ever happened? Has anything like it ever been heard of?

firstLine: Cities to Go to for Safety
rest: I set apart three cities east of the Jordan River.

firstLine: Moses Gives the Law to Israel
rest: Here is the law I gave the people of Israel.

firstLine: The Ten Commandments
rest:
I sent for all of the people of Israel. Here is what I said to them.
Israel, listen to me. Here are the rules and laws I’m announcing to you today. Learn them well. Be sure to follow them.

firstLine: Love the Lord Your God
rest: The Lord your God has directed me to teach you his commands, rules and laws. Obey them in the land you will take over when you go across the Jordan River.

firstLine: The Lord Will Drive Many Nations Out
rest: The Lord your God will bring you into the land. You are going to enter it and take it as your own. He’ll drive many nations out to make room for you. He’ll drive out the Hittites, Girgashites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites and Jebusites. Those seven nations are larger and stronger than you are.

firstLine: Remember What the Lord Has Done
rest: Make sure you follow every command I’m giving you today. Then you will live. You will increase your numbers. You will enter the land and take it as your own. It’s the land the Lord promised with an oath to your people long ago.

firstLine: Why the Lord Gave Canaan to Israel
rest:
Israel, listen to me. You are now about to go across the Jordan. You will take over the land of the nations that live there.
Those nations are greater and stronger than you are. Their large cities have walls that reach up to the sky.

firstLine: Israel Worshiped the Golden Calf
rest: Here is something you must remember. Never forget it. You made the Lord your God angry in the desert. You refused to obey him from the day you left Egypt until you arrived here.

firstLine: The New Stone Tablets
rest: At that time the Lord spoke to me. He said, “Carve out two stone tablets, just like the first ones. Then come up to me on the mountain. Also make a wooden chest.

firstLine: Have Respect for the Lord
rest: And now, Israel, what is the Lord your God asking you to do? Have respect for him. Live exactly as he wants you to live. Love him. Serve him with all your heart and with all your soul.

firstLine: Love and Obey the Lord
rest: Love the Lord your God. Do what he requires. Always obey his rules, laws and commands.

firstLine: Worship Only Where the Lord Wants You To
rest: Here are the rules and laws you must obey. Be careful to follow them in the land the Lord has given you to take as your own. He’s the God of your people who lived long ago. Obey these rules and laws as long as you live in the land.

firstLine: Don’t Worship Other Gods
rest: Suppose a prophet appears among you. Or someone comes who uses dreams to tell what’s going to happen. He tells you that a miraculous sign or wonder is going to take place.

firstLine: Food That Is “Clean” and Food That Is Not
rest: You are the children of the Lord your God. Don’t cut yourselves to honor the dead. Don’t shave the front of your heads to honor them.

firstLine: Give a Tenth of What You Produce
rest: Be sure to set apart a tenth of everything your fields produce each year.

firstLine: The Year for Forgiving People What They Owe
rest: At the end of every seven years you must forgive people what they owe you.

firstLine: Set Your Hebrew Servants Free
rest: Suppose Hebrew men or women sell themselves to you. If they do, they will serve you for six years. Then in the seventh year you must let them go free.

firstLine: Male Animals That Are Born First to Their Mothers
rest: Set apart to the Lord your God every male animal among your livestock that was born first to its mother. Don’t put that kind of ox to work. Don’t clip the wool from that kind of sheep.

firstLine: The Passover Feast
rest: Celebrate the Passover Feast of the Lord your God in the month of Abib. In that month he brought you out of Egypt at night.

firstLine: The Feast of Weeks
rest: Count off seven weeks from the time you begin to cut your grain in the field.

firstLine: The Feast of Booths
rest: Gather the grain from your threshing floors. Take the fresh wine from your winepresses. Then celebrate the Feast of Booths for seven days.

firstLine: Appoint Judges and Officials
rest: Appoint judges and officials for each of your tribes. Do it in every town the Lord your God is giving you. They must judge the people fairly.

firstLine: Don’t Worship Other Gods
rest: Don’t set up a wooden pole that is used to worship the goddess Asherah. Don’t set it up beside the altar you build to worship the Lord your God.

firstLine: Law Courts
rest: People will bring their cases to your courts. But some cases will be too hard for you to judge. They might be about murders, attacks or other crimes. Then take those hard cases to the place the Lord your God will choose.

firstLine: Appoint the King the Lord Chooses
rest: You will enter the land the Lord your God is giving you. You will take it as your own. You will settle down in it. When you do, you will say, “Let’s appoint a king over us, just like all of the nations around us.”

firstLine: Offerings for Priests and Levites
rest: The priests, who are Levites, won’t receive any part of the land of Israel. That also applies to the whole tribe of Levi. They will eat the offerings that are made to the Lord with fire. That will be their share.

firstLine: Practices the Lord Hates
rest: You will enter the land the Lord your God is giving you. When you do, don’t copy the practices of the nations that are there. The Lord hates those practices.

firstLine: The Prophet of the Lord
rest: You will take over the nations that are in the land the Lord is giving you. They listen to those who practice all kinds of evil magic. But you belong to the Lord your God. He says you must not do those things.

firstLine: Cities to Go to for Safety
rest: The Lord your God will destroy the nations whose land he is giving you. You will drive them out. And you will settle down in their towns and houses.

firstLine: Witnesses
rest: Suppose someone is charged with committing a crime of any kind. Then one witness won’t be enough to prove he is guilty. Every matter must be proved by the words of two or three witnesses.

firstLine: Going to War
rest: When you go to war against your enemies, you might see that they have horses and chariots. They might even have an army that is stronger than yours. But don’t be afraid of them. The Lord your God will be with you. After all, he brought you up out of Egypt.

firstLine: What to Do When You Don’t Know Who Killed Someone
rest: Suppose you find someone who has been killed. The body is lying in a field in the land the Lord your God is giving you to take as your own. But no one knows who the killer was.

firstLine: Getting Married to a Woman Who Is Your Prisoner
rest: Suppose you go to war against your enemies. And the Lord your God hands them over to you and you take them as prisoners.

firstLine: The Rights of the Oldest Son
rest: Suppose a man has two wives. He loves one but not the other. And both of them have sons by him. But the oldest son is the son of the wife the man doesn’t love.

firstLine: A Stubborn Son
rest: Suppose someone has a very stubborn son. He doesn’t obey his father and mother. And he won’t listen to them when they try to correct him.

firstLine: Several Other Laws
rest: Suppose a man is put to death for a crime that is worthy of death. And a pole is stuck through his body and set up where people can see it.

firstLine: Breaking Marriage Laws
rest: Suppose a man gets married to a woman and makes love to her. But then he doesn’t like her.

firstLine: Keep the Camp of the Soldiers Pure and Clean
rest: There will be times when you are at war with your enemies. And your soldiers will be in camp. Then keep away from anything that isn’t pure and clean.

firstLine: Several Other Laws
rest: If a slave comes to you for safety, don’t hand him over to his master.

firstLine: Give the Lord His Share
rest: You will enter the land the Lord your God is giving you as your own. You will take it over. You will settle down in it.

firstLine: Follow the Lord’s Commands
rest: This very day the Lord your God commands you to follow all of those rules and laws. Be careful to obey them with all your heart and with all your soul.

firstLine: The Altar on Mount Ebal
rest: The elders of Israel and I gave commands to the people. We said, “Obey all of the commands we’re giving you today.

firstLine: Curses for Not Obeying the Lord
rest: Then the priests, who are Levites, and I spoke to all of the people of Israel. We said, “Israel, be quiet! Listen! You have now become the people of the Lord your God.

firstLine: “May anyone who brings shame on his father or mother be under the Lord’s curse.”
rest: Then all of the people will say, “Amen!”

firstLine: “May anyone who moves his neighbor’s boundary stone be under the Lord’s curse.”
rest: Then all of the people will say, “Amen!”

firstLine: “May anyone who leads blind people down the wrong road be under the Lord’s curse.”
rest: Then all of the people will say, “Amen!”

firstLine: “May anyone who has sex with animals be under the Lord’s curse.”
rest: Then all of the people will say, “Amen!”

firstLine: “May any man who has sex with his mother-in-law be under the Lord’s curse.”
rest: Then all of the people will say, “Amen!”

firstLine: “May anyone who kills his neighbor secretly be under the Lord’s curse.”
rest: Then all of the people will say, “Amen!”

firstLine: “May anyone who accepts money to kill someone who isn’t guilty of doing anything wrong be under the Lord’s curse.”
rest: Then all of the people will say, “Amen!”

firstLine: “May anyone who doesn’t honor the words of this law by obeying them be under the Lord’s curse.”
rest: Then all of the people will say, “Amen!”

firstLine: Blessings for Obeying the Lord
rest: Make sure you obey the Lord your God completely. Be careful to follow all of his commands. I’m giving them to you today. If you do those things, the Lord will honor you more than all of the other nations on earth.

firstLine: More Curses for Not Obeying the Lord
rest: But suppose you don’t obey the Lord your God. And you aren’t careful to follow all of his commands and rules I’m giving you today. Then he will send curses on you. They’ll catch up with you. Here are those curses.

firstLine: Follow the Terms of the Covenant
rest: These are the terms of the covenant the Lord commanded me to make with the people of Israel in Moab. The terms were added to the covenant he had made with them at Mount Horeb.

firstLine: The Lord Will Bless His People
rest: I have told you about all of those blessings and curses. The Lord will bring them on you. Then you will think carefully about them everywhere the Lord your God scatters you among the nations.

firstLine: Choose Life
rest: What I’m commanding you today is not too hard for you. It isn’t beyond your reach.

firstLine: Joshua Becomes the New Leader
rest: Here are the words I spoke to all of the people of Israel.

firstLine: The Law Must Be Read
rest: I wrote down that law. I gave it to the priests, who are sons of Levi. They carried the ark of the covenant of the Lord. I also gave the law to all of the elders of Israel.

firstLine: Israel Will Refuse to Obey the Lord
rest: The Lord spoke to me. He said, “The day when you will die is near. Have Joshua go to the Tent of Meeting. Join him there. That is where I will appoint him as the new leader.” So Joshua and I went to the Tent of Meeting.

firstLine: The Song of Moses
rest: I spoke the words of this song from beginning to end. The whole community of Israel heard them. Here is what I said.

firstLine: “I will turn my face away from them,” he said.
rest:
“I will see what will happen to them in the end.
They are sinful people.
They are unfaithful children.

firstLine: “I will pile troubles on my people.
rest: I will shoot all of my arrows at them.

firstLine: “Look! I am the One!
rest:
There is no other God except me.
I put some people to death. I bring others to life.
I have wounded, and I will heal.
No one can save you from my powerful hand.

firstLine: And you can be just as sure
rest:
that I will sharpen my flashing sword.
My hand will hold it when I judge.
I will get even with my enemies.
I will pay back those who hate me.

firstLine: Moses Will Die on Mount Nebo
rest: On that same day the Lord spoke to me. He said,

firstLine: Moses Blesses the Tribes
rest: Here is the blessing that Moses, the man of God, gave to the people of Israel before he died.

firstLine: He said,
rest:
“The Lord came from Mount Sinai.
Like the rising sun, he shone on his people from Mount Seir.
He shone on them from Mount Paran.
He came with large numbers of angels.
He came from his mountain slopes in the south.

firstLine: The Lord was king over Israel
rest:
when the leaders of the people came together.
The tribes of Israel were also there.”

firstLine: “There is no one like the God of Israel.
rest:
He rides in the heavens to help you.
He rides on the clouds in his glory.

firstLine: Moses Dies
rest:
Moses climbed Mount Nebo. He went up from the flatlands of Moab to the highest slopes of Pisgah. It’s across from Jericho.
At Pisgah the Lord showed him the whole land from Gilead all the way to Dan.

firstLine: The Lord Gives Commands to Joshua
rest: Moses, the servant of the Lord, died. After that, the Lord spoke to Joshua, the son of Nun. Joshua was Moses’ helper. The Lord said to Joshua,

firstLine: Joshua Gives Commands to the People
rest: So Joshua gave orders to the officers of the people. He said,

firstLine: Rahab Helps the Spies
rest:
Joshua, the son of Nun, sent two spies from Shittim. He sent them in secret. He said to them, “Go. Look the land over. Most of all, check out Jericho.”
So they went to Jericho. They stayed at the house of a prostitute. Her name was Rahab.

firstLine: Israel Goes Across the Jordan River
rest: Early one morning Joshua and all of the people of Israel started out from Shittim. They went down to the Jordan River. They camped there before they went across it.

firstLine: Joshua Circumcises the Men of Israel
rest:
All of the Amorite and Canaanite kings heard how the Lord had dried up the Jordan River. They heard how he had dried it up for the people of Israel until they had gone across it. The Amorite kings lived west of the Jordan. The kings of Canaan lived along the Mediterranean Sea.
When all of those kings heard what the Lord had done, their hearts melted away in fear. They weren’t brave enough to face the people of Israel anymore.

firstLine: Israel Captures Jericho
rest: When Joshua was near Jericho, he looked up and saw a man standing in front of him. The man was holding a sword. He was ready for battle. Joshua went up to him. He asked, “Are you on our side? Or are you on the side of our enemies?”

firstLine: Achan Sins Against the Lord
rest:
But the people of Israel weren’t faithful to the Lord. They didn’t do what they were told to do with the things that had been set apart to him in a special way to be destroyed.
Achan had taken some of those things. So the Lord’s anger burned against Israel. Achan was the son of Carmi. Carmi was the son of Zimri. And Zimri was the son of Zerah. They were from the tribe of Judah.

firstLine: Israel Destroys Ai
rest: Then the Lord spoke to Joshua. He said, “Do not be afraid. Do not lose hope. Go up and attack Ai. Take the whole army with you. I have handed the king of Ai over to you. I have given you his people, his city and his land.

firstLine: Joshua Reads the Scroll of the Law to the People
rest: Joshua built an altar to honor the Lord, the God of Israel. He built it on Mount Ebal.

firstLine: The People of Gibeon Trick Israel
rest: All of the kings who ruled west of the Jordan River heard about the battles Israel had won. That included the kings who ruled in the central hill country and the western hills. It also included those who ruled along the entire coast of the Mediterranean Sea all the way to Lebanon. They were the kings of the Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites and Jebusites.

firstLine: “We’ll serve you,” they said to Joshua.
rest: But Joshua asked, “Who are you? Where do you come from?”

firstLine: The Sun Stands Still
rest:
Adoni-Zedek was the king of Jerusalem. He heard that Joshua had taken Ai. He found out that the city had been set apart to the Lord in a special way to be destroyed. He heard that Joshua had done to Ai and its king the same thing he had done to Jericho and its king.
Adoni-Zedek heard that the people of Gibeon had made a peace treaty with Israel. He also found out that they were living among the people of Israel.

firstLine: Joshua Kills the Five Amorite Kings
rest: The five Amorite kings had run away. They had hidden in the cave at Makkedah.

firstLine: The Campaign Against the Cities in the South
rest: Joshua moved on from Makkedah to Libnah. Israel’s whole army went with him. They attacked Libnah.

firstLine: The Campaign Against the Cities in the North
rest: Jabin was the king of Hazor. He heard about the battles Israel had won. So he sent a message to Jobab. Jobab was the king of Madon. Jabin sent the same message to the kings of Shimron and Acshaph.

firstLine: Israel Wins the Battle Over the Kings in the Land
rest: The people of Israel took over the territory east of the Jordan River. The land they took reached from the Arnon River valley to Mount Hermon. It included the whole east side of the Arabah Valley. Israel won the battle over the kings of that whole territory. Here are the lands Israel took from the kings they won the battle over.

firstLine: the king of Jericho
rest:
one
the king of Ai, which is near Bethel
one

firstLine: the king of Jerusalem
rest:
one
the king of Hebron
one

firstLine: the king of Jarmuth
rest:
one
the king of Lachish
one

firstLine: the king of Eglon
rest:
one
the king of Gezer
one

firstLine: the king of Debir
rest:
one
the king of Geder
one

firstLine: the king of Hormah
rest:
one
the king of Arad
one

firstLine: the king of Libnah
rest:
one
the king of Adullam
one

firstLine: the king of Makkedah
rest:
one
the king of Bethel
one

firstLine: the king of Tappuah
rest:
one
the king of Hepher
one

firstLine: the king of Aphek
rest:
one
the king of Lasharon
one

firstLine: the king of Madon
rest:
one
the king of Hazor
one

firstLine: the king of Shimron Meron
rest:
one
the king of Acshaph
one

firstLine: the king of Taanach
rest:
one
the king of Megiddo
one

firstLine: the king of Kedesh
rest:
one
the king of Jokneam in Carmel
one

firstLine: the king of Dor in Naphoth Dor
rest:
one
the king of Goyim in Gilgal
one

firstLine: the king of Tirzah
rest:
one
The total number of kings was 31.

firstLine: The Land That Remained to Be Taken Over
rest: Joshua was now very old. The Lord said to him, “You are very old. And there are still very large areas of land that have not been taken over yet.

firstLine: Moses Had Given the Eastern Tribes Their Land
rest: The other half of Manasseh’s tribe had already received the share of land Moses had given them. Their share was east of the Jordan River. The tribes of Reuben and Gad had already received their share too. Moses, the servant of the Lord, had given it to them.

firstLine: The Western Tribes Are Given Their Land
rest: The rest of the tribes of Israel received their shares of land in Canaan. The priest Eleazar and Joshua, the son of Nun, decided what each of the tribes should receive. The leaders of the tribes helped them make those decisions.

firstLine: Joshua Gives Hebron to Caleb
rest: The men of Judah approached Joshua at Gilgal. Caleb, the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, spoke to Joshua. He said, “You know what the Lord said to Moses, the man of God. He spoke to him at Kadesh Barnea about you and me.

firstLine: Land Is Given to Judah
rest: Land was given to the tribe of Judah, family group by family group. It reached down to the territory of Edom. It went as far south as the Desert of Zin.

firstLine: Land Is Given to Ephraim and Manasseh
rest: The land that was given to the two tribes in the family line of Joseph began at the Jordan River near Jericho. Their border started east of the springs of Jericho. It went up from there through the desert into the hill country of Bethel.

firstLine: The Rest of the Land Is Divided Up
rest: The whole community of Israel gathered together at Shiloh. They set up the Tent of Meeting there. The country was brought under their control.

firstLine: “But the Levites don’t get any share of your land. That’s because their share is to serve the Lord as priests.
rest: “The tribes of Gad and Reuben and half of the tribe of Manasseh have already received their shares. They are on the east side of the Jordan River. Moses, the servant of the Lord, gave their shares to them.”

firstLine: Land Is Given to Benjamin
rest: The first lot that was drawn out was for the tribe of Benjamin, family group by family group. The territory they were given was located between the tribes of the people of Judah and the people of Joseph. Here are the borders of Benjamin’s territory.

firstLine: Land Is Given to Simeon
rest: The second lot that was drawn out was for the tribe of Simeon, family group by family group. The share of land they were given was in the territory of Judah.

firstLine: Land Is Given to Zebulun
rest:
The third lot that was drawn out was for the tribe of Zebulun, family group by family group. Here are the borders of Zebulun’s territory.
The border of their share of land went as far as Sarid.

firstLine: Land Is Given to Issachar
rest: The fourth lot that was drawn out was for the tribe of Issachar, family group by family group.

firstLine: Land Is Given to Asher
rest: The fifth lot that was drawn out was for the tribe of Asher, family group by family group.

firstLine: Land Is Given to Naphtali
rest: The sixth lot that was drawn out was for Naphtali, family group by family group.

firstLine: Land Is Given to Dan
rest: The seventh lot that was drawn out was for the tribe of Dan, family group by family group.

firstLine: Land Is Given to Joshua
rest: The people of Israel finished dividing up the shares of land the tribes received. Then they gave a share to Joshua, the son of Nun.

firstLine: Cities to Go to for Safety
rest: Then the Lord spoke to Joshua. He said,

firstLine: Towns Are Given to the Levites
rest: The leaders of the Levite family groups approached the priest Eleazar and Joshua, the son of Nun. They also approached the leaders of the family groups of Israel’s other tribes.

firstLine: From the tribe of Issachar
rest: they received Kishion, Daberath,

firstLine: From the tribe of Asher
rest: they received Mishal, Abdon,

firstLine: From the tribe of Naphtali
rest: they received Kedesh in Galilee. Kedesh was a city where anyone who was charged with murder could go for safety. They also received Hammoth Dor and Kartan. The total number of those towns and their grasslands was three.

firstLine: From the tribe of Reuben
rest: they received Bezer, Jahaz,

firstLine: From the tribe of Gad
rest: they received Ramoth in Gilead. Ramoth was a city where anyone who was charged with murder could go for safety. They also received Mahanaim,

firstLine: The Eastern Tribes Return Home
rest: Joshua sent for the tribes of Reuben and Gad and half of the tribe of Manasseh.

firstLine: Joshua Says Good-by to the Leaders
rest: A long time had passed. The Lord had given Israel peace and rest from all of their enemies who were around them. By that time Joshua was very old.

firstLine: Joshua Tells Israel to Serve the Lord
rest: Joshua gathered all of Israel’s tribes together at Shechem. He sent for the elders, leaders, judges and officials of Israel. They came and stood there in the sight of God.

firstLine: Joshua Dies
rest: Joshua sent the people away. He sent all of them to their own shares of land.

firstLine: Israel Fights Against the Canaanites Who Are Still Left
rest: Joshua died. After that, the people of Israel spoke to the Lord. They asked him, “Who will go up first and fight for us against the people of Canaan?”

firstLine: The Angel of the Lord Warns Israel
rest: The angel of the Lord went up from Gilgal to Bokim. There he spoke to the people of Israel. “I brought you up out of Egypt,” he said. “I led you into this land. It is the land I promised with an oath to give to Abraham, Isaac and Jacob. I said, ‘I will never break the covenant I made with you.

firstLine: The People Turn Away From the Lord
rest: Joshua sent the people of Israel away. Then they went to take over the land. All of them went to their own shares of land.

firstLine: Othniel
rest: The people of Israel did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. They forgot the Lord their God. They served the gods that were named after Baal. They also served the goddesses that were named after Asherah.

firstLine: Ehud
rest: Once again the people of Israel did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. Because they did that, the Lord gave Eglon power over Israel. Eglon was the king of Moab.

firstLine: “Follow me,” Ehud ordered. “The Lord has handed your enemy Moab over to you.”
rest: So they followed him down. They took over the only places where people could go across the Jordan River to get to Moab. They didn’t let anyone go across.

firstLine: Shamgar
rest: After Ehud, Shamgar became the next leader. He was the son of Anath. He struck down 600 Philistines with a large, pointed stick that was used to drive oxen. He saved Israel too.

firstLine: Deborah
rest: After Ehud died, the people of Israel once again did what was evil in the sight of the Lord.

firstLine: The Song of Deborah
rest: On that day Deborah and Barak sang a song. Barak was the son of Abinoam. Here is what Deborah and Barak sang.

firstLine: “The princes in Israel lead the way.
rest:
The people follow them just because they want to.
Praise the Lord!

firstLine: “Kings, hear this! Rulers, listen!
rest:
I will sing to the Lord. I will sing.
I will make music to the Lord. He is the God of Israel.

firstLine: “Lord, you went out from Mount Seir.
rest:
You marched out from the land of Edom.
The earth shook. The heavens poured.
The clouds poured down their water.

firstLine: “The roads were deserted. So travelers used the winding paths.
rest:
That happened in the days of Shamgar, the son of Anath.
It happened in the days of Jael.

firstLine: “Some of you ride on white donkeys.
rest:
Some of you sit on your saddle blankets.
Some of you walk along the road.
Think about

firstLine: ‘Wake up, Deborah! Wake up!’ they said.
rest:
‘Wake up! Wake up! Begin to sing!
Barak, get up!
Son of Abinoam, capture your prisoners!’

firstLine: “Then the people who were left came down to the nobles.
rest:
The people of the Lord
came to me against the powerful enemy.

firstLine: “Kings came and fought.
rest:
The kings of Canaan fought
at Taanach by the streams of Megiddo.
But they didn’t carry any silver away.
They didn’t take anything at all.

firstLine: ‘Let Meroz be cursed,’ said the angel of the Lord.
rest:
‘Let bitter curses fall on its people.
They did not come to help the Lord.
They did not come to help him against our powerful enemies.’

firstLine: “May Jael be the most blessed woman of all.
rest:
May the wife of the Kenite Heber be blessed.
May she be the most blessed woman of all those who live in tents.

firstLine: “Sisera’s mother looked out through the window.
rest:
From behind the wooden screen she cried out.
‘Why is his chariot taking so long to get here?’ she said.
‘Why can’t I hear the noise of his chariots yet?’

firstLine: “Lord, may all of your enemies be destroyed.
rest:
But may those who love you be like the morning sun.
May they be like the sun when it shines the brightest.”
So the land was at peace for 40 years.

firstLine: Gideon
rest: Once again the people of Israel did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. So for seven years he handed them over to the people of Midian.

firstLine: Gideon Wins the Battle Over the Midianites
rest: Early in the morning Jerub-Baal and all of his men camped at the spring of Harod. Jerub-Baal was another name for Gideon. The camp of Midian was north of Gideon’s camp. It was in the valley near the hill of Moreh.

firstLine: Gideon Destroys Midian’s Whole Army
rest: The men of Ephraim spoke to Gideon. They asked, “Why have you treated us like this? Why didn’t you ask us to help you when you went out to fight against Midian?” They spoke very sharply against Gideon.

firstLine: Gideon Refuses to Be Israel’s Ruler
rest: The people of Israel spoke to Gideon. They said, “Rule over us. We want you, your son and your grandson to be our rulers. You have saved us from the power of Midian.”

firstLine: Gideon Dies
rest: Israel brought Midian under their control. Midian wasn’t able to attack Israel anymore. So the land was at peace for 40 years. The peace lasted as long as Gideon was living.

firstLine: Abimelech Becomes King of Shechem
rest: Abimelech was the son of Jerub-Baal. He went to his mother’s brothers in Shechem. He spoke to them and to all of the members of his mother’s family group. He said,

firstLine: Tola
rest: Tola rose up to save Israel. That happened after the time of Abimelech. Tola was from the tribe of Issachar. He was the son of Puah, who was the son of Dodo. Tola lived in Shamir. It’s in the hill country of Ephraim.

firstLine: Jair
rest: Jair became the leader after Tola. Jair was from the land of Gilead. He led Israel for 22 years.

firstLine: Jephthah
rest: Once again the people of Israel did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. They served the gods that were named after Baal. They served the goddesses that were named after Ashtoreth. They worshiped the gods of Aram and Sidon. They served the gods of Moab and Ammon. They also worshiped the gods of the Philistines. The people of Israel deserted the Lord. They didn’t serve him anymore.

firstLine: They said,
rest: “Here is what Jephthah says to you. Israel didn’t take the land of Moab. They didn’t take the land of Ammon.

firstLine: Jephthah Wins the Battle Over Ephraim
rest: The men of Ephraim called out their troops. The troops went across the Jordan River to Zaphon. When they arrived, they said to Jephthah, “You went to fight against the Ammonites. Why didn’t you ask us to go with you? We’re going to burn down your house over your head.”

firstLine: Ibzan, Elon and Abdon
rest: After Jephthah, Ibzan from Bethlehem led Israel.

firstLine: Samson Is Born
rest: Once again the people of Israel did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. So the Lord handed them over to the Philistines for 40 years.

firstLine: Samson Gets Married
rest: Samson went down to Timnah. There he saw a young Philistine woman.

firstLine: Samson replied,
rest:
“Out of the eater came something to eat.
Out of the strong came something sweet.”
For three days they couldn’t give him the answer.

firstLine: Samson Gets Even With the Philistines
rest: Later on, Samson went to visit his wife. He took a young goat with him. He went at the time the wheat was being gathered. He said, “I’m going to my wife’s room.” But her father wouldn’t let him go in.

firstLine: Then Samson said,
rest:
“By using a donkey’s jawbone
I’ve made them look like donkeys.
By using a donkey’s jawbone
I’ve struck down 1,000 men.”

firstLine: Samson and Delilah
rest: One day Samson went to Gaza. There he saw a prostitute. He went in to spend the night with her.

firstLine: Samson Dies
rest: The rulers of the Philistines gathered together. They were going to offer a great sacrifice to their god Dagon. They were going to celebrate. They said, “Our god has handed our enemy Samson over to us.”

firstLine: Micah Makes Some Statues of Gods
rest: A man named Micah lived in the hill country of Ephraim.

firstLine: The People of Dan Settle Down in Laish
rest:
In those days Israel didn’t have a king.
And in those days the tribe of Dan was looking for a place where they could settle down. They hadn’t been able to take over their own share of land among the tribes of Israel.

firstLine: A Levite and His Concubine
rest:
In those days Israel didn’t have a king.
There was a Levite who lived deep in the hill country of Ephraim. He got a concubine from Bethlehem in Judah.

firstLine: The Tribe of Benjamin Is Attacked by the Other Tribes
rest: Then all of the people of Israel came out. They came from the whole land between Dan and Beersheba. They also came from the land of Gilead. All of them gathered together in the sight of the Lord at Mizpah.

firstLine: The Men of Benjamin Receive Wives
rest: The men of Israel had taken an oath and made a promise at Mizpah. They had said, “Not one of us will give his daughter to be married to a man from Benjamin.”

firstLine: Ruth Goes to Bethlehem With Naomi
rest:
There was a time when Israel didn’t have kings to rule over them. But they had leaders to help them. This is a story about some things that happened during that time.
There wasn’t enough food in the land of Judah. So a man went to live in the country of Moab for a while. He was from Bethlehem in Judah. His wife and two sons went with him.

firstLine: Ruth Meets Boaz
rest: Naomi had a relative on her husband’s side of the family. Her husband’s name was Elimelech. The relative’s name was Boaz. He was a very important man.

firstLine: Ruth Goes to Boaz at the Threshing Floor
