rest: One day Ruth’s mother-in-law Naomi spoke to her. She said, “My daughter, shouldn’t I try to find a secure place for you? Shouldn’t you have peace and rest? Shouldn’t I find a home where things will go well with you?

firstLine: “Who are you?” he asked.
rest: “I’m Ruth,” she said. “You are my family protector. So take good care of me by making me your wife.”

firstLine: Boaz Gets Married to Ruth
rest: Boaz went up to the town gate and sat down there. The family protector he had talked about came by. Then Boaz said, “Come over here, my friend. Sit down.” So the man went over and sat down.

firstLine: The Family Line of David
rest: So Boaz got married to Ruth. She became his wife. Then he made love to her. The Lord blessed her so that she became pregnant. And she had a son.

firstLine: Samuel Is Born
rest: A certain man from Ramathaim in the hill country of Ephraim was named Elkanah. He was the son of Jeroham. Jeroham was the son of Elihu. Elihu was the son of Tohu. Tohu was the son of Zuph. Elkanah belonged to the family line of Zuph. Elkanah lived in the territory of Ephraim.

firstLine: Hannah Gives Samuel to the Lord
rest: Elkanah went up to Shiloh to offer the yearly sacrifice to the Lord. He also went there to keep a promise he had made. His whole family went with him.

firstLine: Hannah Gives Thanks to the Lord
rest:
Then Hannah prayed. She said,
“The Lord has filled my heart with joy.
He has made me strong.
I can laugh at my enemies.
I’m so glad he saved me.

firstLine: “There isn’t anyone holy like the Lord.
rest:
There isn’t anyone except him.
There isn’t any Rock like our God.

firstLine: “Don’t keep talking so proudly.
rest:
Don’t let your mouth say such proud things.
The Lord is a God who knows everything.
He judges everything people do.

firstLine: “The bows of great heroes are broken.
rest: But those who trip and fall are made strong.

firstLine: “The Lord causes people to die. He also gives people life.
rest: He brings people down to the grave. He also brings people up.

firstLine: Eli’s Evil Sons
rest: Eli’s sons were evil men. They didn’t know the Lord.

firstLine: A Man of God Prophesies Against Eli’s Family
rest: A man of God came to Eli. He told him, “The Lord says, ‘I made myself clearly known to your relatives who lived long ago. I did it when they were in Egypt under Pharaoh.

firstLine: The Lord Calls Out to Samuel
rest: The boy Samuel served the Lord under the direction of Eli. In those days the Lord didn’t give many messages to his people. He didn’t give them many visions.

firstLine: Eli Dies
rest: That same day a man from the tribe of Benjamin ran from the front lines of the battle. He went to Shiloh. His clothes were torn. He had dust on his head.

firstLine: The Ark Is Taken to Ashdod and Ekron
rest: The Philistines had captured the ark of God. They took it from Ebenezer to Ashdod.

firstLine: The Philistines Return the Ark to Israel
rest: The ark of the Lord had been in Philistine territory for seven months.

firstLine: Samuel Brings the Philistines Under Israel’s Control
rest: The ark remained at Kiriath Jearim for a long time. It was there for a full 20 years. All of the people of Israel were filled with sorrow. They looked to the Lord for help.

firstLine: Israel Asks Samuel for a King
rest: When Samuel became old, he appointed his sons to serve as judges for Israel.

firstLine: Samuel Anoints Saul to Be Israel’s Leader
rest: There was a man named Kish from the tribe of Benjamin. Kish was a very important person. He was the son of Abiel, the son of Zeror. Zeror was the son of Becorath, the son of Aphiah from the tribe of Benjamin.

firstLine: Saul Is Made King of Israel
rest: As Saul turned to leave Samuel, God changed Saul’s heart. All of those things happened that day.

firstLine: Saul Saves the City of Jabesh Gilead
rest: Nahash was the king of Ammon. He and his army went up to Jabesh Gilead. They surrounded it and got ready to attack it. All of the men of Jabesh spoke to Nahash. They said, “Make a peace treaty with us. Then we’ll be under your control.”

firstLine: The People Agree to Have Saul as King
rest: The people said to Samuel, “Who asked, ‘Is Saul going to rule over us?’ Bring those people to us. We’ll put them to death.”

firstLine: Samuel Tells Israel to Serve the Lord
rest: Samuel spoke to all of the people of Israel. He said, “I’ve done everything you asked me to do. I’ve placed a king over you.

firstLine: Saul Refuses to Obey the Lord’s Command
rest: Saul was 30 years old when he became king. He ruled over Israel for 42 years.

firstLine: “What have you done?” asked Samuel.
rest: Saul replied, “I saw that the men were scattering. I saw that the Philistines were gathering together at Micmash. You didn’t come when you said you would.

firstLine: Israel Doesn’t Have Swords or Spears
rest: Saul and his son Jonathan were staying in Gibeah in the land of Benjamin. What was left of the army was there with them. At the same time, the Philistines camped at Micmash.

firstLine: Jonathan Attacks the Philistines
rest: A group of Philistine soldiers had gone out to the pass at Micmash.

firstLine: Israel Chases the Philistines Away
rest: Then panic struck the whole Philistine army. It struck those who were in the camp and the field. It struck those who were at the edge of the camp. It also struck those who were in the groups that had been sent out to attack Israel. The ground shook. It was a panic that God had sent.

firstLine: Jonathan Eats Honey
rest: The men of Israel became very hungry that day. That’s because Saul had put the army under an oath. He had said, “None of you must eat any food before evening comes. You must not eat until I’ve paid my enemies back for what they did. If you do, may you be under a curse!” So none of the troops ate any food at all.

firstLine: Saul’s Family
rest: Saul’s sons were Jonathan, Ishvi and Malki-Shua. His older daughter was named Merab. His younger daughter was named Michal.

firstLine: The Lord Is Sorry He Has Made Saul King
rest: Samuel said to Saul, “The Lord sent me to anoint you as king over his people Israel. So listen now to a message from him.

firstLine: “I am very sorry I have made Saul king. He has turned away from me. He has not done what I directed him to do.”
rest: When Samuel heard that, he was troubled. He cried out to the Lord during that whole night.

firstLine: “Stop!” Samuel said to Saul. “Let me tell you what the Lord said to me last night.”
rest: “Tell me,” Saul replied.

firstLine: But Samuel replied,
rest:
“What pleases the Lord more?
Burnt offerings and sacrifices, or obeying him?
It is better to obey than to offer a sacrifice.
It is better to do what he says than to offer the fat of rams.

firstLine: But Samuel said,
rest:
“Your sword has killed the children of other women.
So the child of your mother will be killed.”
Samuel put Agag to death at Gilgal in the sight of the Lord.

firstLine: Samuel Anoints David to Be Israel’s King
rest: The Lord said to Samuel, “How long will you be filled with sorrow because of Saul? I have refused to have him as king over Israel. Fill your animal horn with olive oil and go on your way. I am sending you to Jesse in Bethlehem. I have chosen one of his sons to be king.”

firstLine: David Serves Saul
rest: The Spirit of the Lord had left Saul. And an evil spirit that was sent by the Lord terrified him.

firstLine: David Kills Goliath
rest: The Philistines gathered their army together for war. They came to Socoh in Judah. They set up camp at Ephes Dammim. It was between Socoh and Azekah.

firstLine: “Young man, whose son are you?” Saul asked him.
rest: David said, “I’m the son of Jesse from Bethlehem.”

firstLine: Saul Becomes Jealous of David
rest: David finished talking with Saul. After that, Jonathan and David became close friends. Jonathan loved David just as he loved himself.

firstLine: As they danced, they sang,
rest:
“Saul has killed thousands of men.
David has killed tens of thousands.”

firstLine: Michal Helps David Get Away
rest: Saul told his son Jonathan and all of the attendants to kill David. But Jonathan liked David very much.

firstLine: Jonathan Helps David Get Away
rest: David was in Naioth at Ramah. He ran away from there to where Jonathan was. He asked him, “What have I done? What crime have I committed? I haven’t done anything to harm your father. So why is he trying to kill me?”

firstLine: Ahimelech Helps David
rest: David went to the priest Ahimelech at Nob. Ahimelech trembled with fear when he met him. He asked David, “Why are you alone? Why isn’t anyone with you?”

firstLine: David Meets a Philistine King
rest: That day David ran away from Saul. He went to Achish, the king of Gath.

firstLine: David Goes to Adullam and Mizpah
rest: David left Gath and escaped to the cave of Adullam. His brothers and the other members of his family heard about it. So they went down to join him there.

firstLine: Saul Kills the Priests of Nob
rest: Saul heard that the place where David and his men were hiding had been discovered. Saul was sitting under a tamarisk tree on the hill at Gibeah. He was holding his spear. All of his officials were standing around him.

firstLine: David Saves the People of Keilah
rest: David was told, “The Philistines are fighting against the town of Keilah. They are stealing grain from the threshing floors.”

firstLine: Saul Chases David
rest: Saul was told that David had gone to Keilah. He said, “God has handed him over to me. David has trapped himself by entering a town that has gates and heavy metal bars.”

firstLine: David Spares Saul’s Life
rest: Saul returned from chasing the Philistines. Then he was told, “David is in the Desert of En Gedi.”

firstLine: David Gets Married to Abigail
rest:
Samuel died. The whole nation of Israel gathered together. They were filled with sorrow because he was dead. They buried his body at his home in Ramah.
Then David went down into the Desert of Maon.

firstLine: David Spares Saul’s Life Again
rest: Some people from Ziph went to Saul at Gibeah. They said, “David is hiding on the hill of Hakilah. It faces Jeshimon.”

firstLine: David Lives in Philistine Territory
rest: David thought, “Some day the powerful hand of Saul will destroy me. So the best thing I can do is escape. I’ll go to the land of the Philistines. Then Saul will stop looking for me everywhere in Israel. His hand won’t be able to reach me.”

firstLine: Saul Disobeys the Lord at Endor
rest:
While David was living in Ziklag, the Philistines gathered their army together. They planned to fight against Israel.
Achish said to David, “I want you to understand that you and your men must march out with me and my army.”

firstLine: “What does he look like?” Saul asked.
rest:
“An old man wearing a robe is coming up,” she said.
Then Saul knew it was Samuel. He bowed down. He lay down flat with his face toward the ground.

firstLine: Achish Sends David Back to Ziklag
rest: The Philistines gathered their whole army together at Aphek. Israel’s army camped by the spring of water at Jezreel.

firstLine: David Destroys the Amalekites
rest: On the third day David and his men arrived in Ziklag. The Amalekites had attacked the people of the Negev Desert. They had also attacked Ziklag and burned it.

firstLine: Saul Takes His Own Life
rest: The Philistines fought against Israel. The men of Israel ran away from them. But many Israelites were killed on Mount Gilboa.

firstLine: David Hears That Saul Has Died
rest: After Saul died, David returned to Ziklag. He had won the battle over the Amalekites. He stayed in Ziklag for two days.

firstLine: “Where have you come from?” David asked him.
rest: He answered, “I’ve escaped from Israel’s camp.”

firstLine: “What happened?” David asked. “Tell me.”
rest: He said, “Israel’s men ran away from the battle. Many of them were killed. Saul and his son Jonathan are dead.”

firstLine: “He asked me, ‘Who are you?’
rest: “‘An Amalekite,’ I answered.

firstLine: David’s Song of Sadness About Saul and Jonathan
rest: David sang a song of sadness about Saul and his son Jonathan.

firstLine: “Israel, your glorious leaders lie dead on your hills.
rest: Your mighty men have fallen.

firstLine: “Don’t announce it in Gath.
rest:
Don’t tell it in the streets of Ashkelon.
If you do, the daughters of the Philistines will be glad.
The daughters of men who haven’t been circumcised will be joyful.

firstLine: “Mountains of Gilboa,
rest:
may no dew or rain fall on you.
May your fields not produce any offerings of grain.
The shield of the mighty king lies polluted there.
The shield of Saul lies there. It isn’t rubbed with oil anymore.

firstLine: “In life Saul and Jonathan were loved and gracious.
rest:
In death they were not parted.
They were faster than eagles.
They were stronger than lions.

firstLine: “Daughters of Israel, sob over Saul.
rest:
He dressed you in the finest clothes.
He decorated your clothes with ornaments of gold.

firstLine: “Your mighty men have fallen in battle.
rest: Jonathan lies dead on your hills.

firstLine: “Israel’s mighty men have fallen.
rest: Their weapons of war are broken.”

firstLine: David Is Anointed to Be King Over Judah
rest:
After Saul and Jonathan died, David asked the Lord for advice. “Should I go up to one of the towns of Judah?” he asked.
The Lord said, “Go up.”
David asked, “Where should I go?”
“To Hebron,” the Lord answered.

firstLine: The Armies of David and Saul Fight Each Other
rest: Abner, the son of Ner, was commander of Saul’s army. He had brought Saul’s son Ish-Bosheth to Mahanaim.

firstLine: Abner Goes Over to David’s Side
rest: The fighting continued between David’s royal house and Saul’s royal house. Abner gained more and more power in the royal house of Saul.

firstLine: Joab Murders Abner
rest: Just then David’s men and Joab came back from attacking their enemies. They brought with them the large amount of goods they had taken. But Abner wasn’t with David in Hebron anymore. That’s because David had sent him away, and he had gone in peace.

firstLine: Ish-Bosheth Is Murdered
rest: Ish-Bosheth, the son of Saul, heard that Abner had died in Hebron. Then he wasn’t so brave anymore. And all of the people of Israel became alarmed.

firstLine: David Becomes King Over Israel
rest: All of the tribes of Israel came to see David at Hebron. They said, “We are your own flesh and blood.

firstLine: David Captures Jerusalem
rest:
The king and his men marched to Jerusalem. They went to attack the Jebusites who lived there.
The Jebusites said to David, “You won’t get in here. Even blind people and those who are disabled can keep you from coming in.” They thought, “David can’t get in here.”

firstLine: David Wins the Battle Over the Philistines
rest: The Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over Israel. So their whole army went to look for him. But David heard about it. He went down to his usual place of safety.

firstLine: David Brings the Ark to Jerusalem
rest: Again David brought together the best soldiers in Israel. The total number was 30,000.

firstLine: God Makes a Promise to David
rest: The king settled down in his palace. The Lord had given him peace and rest from all of his enemies who were around him.

firstLine: David Prays to the Lord
rest:
Then King David went into the holy tent. He sat down in front of the Lord. He said,
“Lord and King, who am I? My family isn’t important. So why have you brought me this far?

firstLine: David Wins Many Battles
rest: While David was king of Israel, he won many battles over the Philistines. He brought them under his control. He took Metheg Ammah away from them.

firstLine: David’s Officials
rest: David ruled over the whole nation of Israel. He did what was fair and right for all of his people.

firstLine: David Is Kind to Mephibosheth
rest: David asked, “Is anyone left from the royal house of Saul? If there is, I want to be kind to him because of Jonathan.”

firstLine: “Where is he?” the king asked.
rest: Ziba answered, “He’s in the town of Lo Debar. He’s staying at the house of Makir, the son of Ammiel.”

firstLine: David Goes to War Against the People of Ammon
rest: The king of Ammon died. His son Hanun became the next king after him.

firstLine: David and Bathsheba
rest: It was spring. It was the time when kings go off to war. So David sent Joab out with the king’s special troops and the whole army of Israel. They destroyed the Ammonites. They went to the city of Rabbah. They surrounded it and got ready to attack it. But David remained in Jerusalem.

firstLine: David’s Son Dies
rest: The Lord sent the prophet Nathan to David. When Nathan came to him, he said, “Two men lived in the same town. One was rich. The other was poor.

firstLine: David Captures the City of Rabbah
rest: During that time, Joab fought against Rabbah. It was the royal city of the Ammonites. It had high walls around it. Joab was about to capture it.

firstLine: Amnon Rapes Tamar
rest: Some time later, David’s son Amnon fell in love with Tamar. She was the beautiful sister of Absalom. He was another one of David’s sons.

firstLine: “No!” she said to him. “Don’t send me away. That would be worse than what you have already done to me.”
rest: But he refused to listen to her.

firstLine: Absalom Kills Amnon
rest: Two years later, Absalom invited all of the king’s sons to come to Baal Hazor. It was near the border of Ephraim. The workers who clipped the wool off Absalom’s sheep were there.

firstLine: Absalom Returns to Jerusalem
rest: Joab, the son of Zeruiah, knew that the king longed to see Absalom.

firstLine: Absalom Makes Secret Plans Against David
rest: Some time later, Absalom got a chariot and horses for himself. He also got 50 men to run in front of him.

firstLine: David Runs Away From Absalom
rest: A messenger came and spoke to David. He told him, “The hearts of the people are turned toward Absalom.”

firstLine: Ziba Lies to David
rest: David went just beyond the top of the Mount of Olives. Ziba was waiting there to meet him. He was Mephibosheth’s manager. He had several donkeys with saddles on them. They were carrying 200 loaves of bread and 100 raisin cakes. They were also carrying 100 fig cakes and a bottle of wine. The bottle was made out of animal skin.

firstLine: Shimei Calls Down Curses on David
rest: King David approached Bahurim. As he did, a man came out toward him. The man was from the same family group that Saul was from. His name was Shimei. He was the son of Gera. As he came out of the town, he called down curses on David.

firstLine: Hushai and Ahithophel Give Advice to Absalom
rest: During that time, Absalom and all of the men of Israel came to Jerusalem. Ahithophel was with him.

firstLine: Absalom Dies
rest: David brought together the men who were with him. He appointed commanders of thousands over some of them. He appointed commanders of hundreds over the others.

firstLine: David Sobs Over Absalom
rest: Ahimaaz said to Joab, “Let me run and take the news to the king. Let me tell him that the Lord has saved him from the power of his enemies.” Ahimaaz was the son of Zadok.

firstLine: Sheba Tells Israel Not to Follow David
rest:
An evil man who always stirred up trouble happened to be in Gilgal. His name was Sheba, the son of Bicri. Sheba was from the tribe of Benjamin. He blew his trumpet. Then he shouted,
“We don’t have any share in David’s kingdom!
Jesse’s son is not our king!
Men of Israel, every one of you go back home!”

firstLine: David Makes Things Right for the People of Gibeon
rest: For three years in a row there wasn’t enough food in the land. That was while David was king. So David asked the Lord why he wasn’t showing his favor to his people. The Lord said, “It is because Saul and his family committed murder. He put the people of Gibeon to death.”

firstLine: Israel Goes to War Against the Philistines
rest: Once again there was a battle between the Philistines and Israel. David went down with his men to fight against the Philistines. He became very tired.

firstLine: David Sings Praises to the Lord
rest: David sang the words of this song to the Lord. He sang them when the Lord saved him from the powerful hand of all of his enemies and of Saul.

firstLine: He said,
rest: “The Lord is my rock and my fort. He is the One who saves me.

firstLine: “The waves of death were all around me.
rest: A destroying flood swept over me.

firstLine: “The earth trembled and shook.
rest:
The pillars of the heavens rocked back and forth.
They trembled because the Lord was angry.

firstLine: From the brightness that was all around him
rest: flashes of lightning blazed out.

firstLine: “He reached down from heaven. He took hold of me.
rest: He lifted me out of deep waters.

firstLine: “The Lord has been good to me because I do what is right.
rest: He has rewarded me because I lead a pure life.

firstLine: “Lord, to those who are faithful you show that you are faithful.
rest: To those who are without blame you show that you are without blame.

firstLine: “God’s way is perfect.
rest:
The word of the Lord doesn’t have any flaws.
He is like a shield
to all who go to him for safety.

firstLine: You give me a wide path to walk in
rest: so that I don’t twist my ankles.

firstLine: “I chased my enemies and crushed them.
rest: I didn’t turn back until they were destroyed.

firstLine: “You saved me when my own people attacked me.
rest:
You have kept me as the ruler over nations.
People I didn’t know serve me now.

firstLine: “The Lord lives! Give praise to my Rock!
rest: Give honor to God, the Rock! He is my Savior!

firstLine: David’s Last Words
rest:
Here are David’s last words. He said,
“I am David, the son of Jesse. God has given me a message.
The Most High God has greatly honored me.
The God of Jacob anointed me as king.
I am Israel’s singer of songs.

firstLine: “The Spirit of the Lord spoke through me.
rest: I spoke his word with my tongue.

firstLine: Then he will be like the light of morning at sunrise
rest:
when there aren’t any clouds.
He will be like the bright sun after rain
that makes the grass grow on the earth.’

firstLine: “Isn’t my royal family right with God?
rest:
Hasn’t he made a covenant with me that will last forever?
Every part of it was well prepared and made secure.
Won’t he save me completely?
Won’t he give me everything I long for?

firstLine: Even if you touch them,
rest:
you must use an iron tool or a spear.
Thorns are burned up right where they are.”

firstLine: David’s Mighty Men
rest:
Here are the names of David’s mighty men.
Josheb-Basshebeth was chief of the Three. He was a Tahkemonite. He used his spear against 800 men. He killed all of them at one time.

firstLine: Shammah, the Harodite
rest: Elika, the Harodite

firstLine: Helez, the Paltite
rest: Ira, the son of Ikkesh, from Tekoa

firstLine: Abiezer from Anathoth
rest: Mebunnai, the Hushathite

firstLine: Zalmon, the Ahohite
rest: Maharai from Netophah

firstLine: Heled, the son of Baanah, from Netophah
rest: Ithai, the son of Ribai, from Gibeah in Benjamin

firstLine: Benaiah from Pirathon
rest: Hiddai from the valleys of Gaash

firstLine: Abi-Albon, the Arbathite
rest: Azmaveth, the Barhumite

firstLine: Eliahba, the Shaalbonite
rest:
the sons of Jashen
Jonathan,

firstLine: the son of Shammah, the Hararite
rest: Ahiam, the son of Sharar, the Hararite

firstLine: Eliphelet, the son of Ahasbai, the Maacathite
rest: Eliam, the son of Ahithophel, from Giloh

firstLine: Hezro from Carmel
rest: Paarai, the Arbite

firstLine: Igal, the son of Nathan, from Zobah
rest: the son of Hagri

firstLine: Zelek from Ammon
rest: Naharai from Beeroth, who carried the armor of Joab, the son of Zeruiah

firstLine: Ira, the Ithrite
rest: Gareb, the Ithrite

firstLine: Uriah, the Hittite
rest: The total number of men was 37.

firstLine: David Counts His Fighting Men
rest: The Lord’s anger burned against Israel. He stirred up David against them. He said, “Go! Count the men of Israel and Judah.”

firstLine: David Builds an Altar
rest: On that day Gad went to David. Gad said to him, “Go up to the threshing floor of Araunah, the Jebusite. Build an altar there to honor the Lord.”

firstLine: Adonijah Makes Himself King
rest: King David was now very old. He couldn’t keep warm even when blankets were spread over him.

firstLine: David Makes Solomon King
rest: King David said, “Tell Bathsheba to come in.” So she came and stood in front of the king.

firstLine: David Gives Orders to Solomon
rest: The time came near for David to die. So he gave orders to his son Solomon. He said,

firstLine: Solomon’s Kingdom Is Made Secure
rest:
Adonijah was the son of David’s wife Haggith. He went to Bathsheba. She was Solomon’s mother. She asked Adonijah, “Have you come in peace?”
He answered, “Yes. I’ve come in peace.”

firstLine: “I have one small favor to ask of you,” she said. “Don’t say no to me.”
rest: The king replied, “Mother, go ahead and ask. I won’t say no to you.”

firstLine: Solomon Asks God for Wisdom
rest: Solomon and Pharaoh, the king of Egypt, agreed to help each other. So Solomon got married to Pharaoh’s daughter. He brought her to the City of David. She stayed there until he finished building his palace, the Lord’s temple, and the wall that was around Jerusalem.

firstLine: Solomon Judges Wisely
rest: Two prostitutes came to the king. They stood in front of him.

firstLine: Solomon’s Officials and Governors
rest: So King Solomon ruled over the whole nation of Israel.

firstLine: Solomon’s Daily Supplies
rest: There were many people in Judah and Israel. In fact, they were as many as the grains of sand on the seashore. They ate, drank and were happy.

firstLine: ten head of cattle that had been fed by hand
rest:
20 head of cattle that had been fed on grasslands
100 sheep and goats
deer, antelopes and roebucks
the finest birds

firstLine: God Makes Solomon Very Wise
rest: God made Solomon very wise. His understanding couldn’t even be measured. It was like the sand on the seashore. People can’t measure that either.

firstLine: Solomon Asks Hiram to Help Build the Temple
rest: Hiram was the king of Tyre. He heard that Solomon had been anointed as king. He heard that Solomon had become the next king after his father David. Hiram had always been David’s friend. So Hiram sent his messengers to Solomon.

firstLine: Solomon Builds the Temple
rest: Solomon began to build the temple of the Lord. It was 480 years after the people of Israel had come out of Egypt. It was in the fourth year of Solomon’s rule over Israel. He started in the second month. That was the month of Ziv.

firstLine: Solomon Builds His Palace
rest: But it took Solomon 13 years to finish constructing his palace and the other buildings that were related to it.

firstLine: More Facts About the Temple
rest: King Solomon sent messengers to Tyre. He wanted them to bring Huram back with them.

firstLine: Solomon Brings the Ark to the Temple
rest: Then King Solomon sent for the elders of Israel. He told them to come to him in Jerusalem. They included all of the leaders of the tribes. They also included the chiefs of the families of Israel. Solomon wanted them to bring up the ark of the Lord’s covenant from Zion. Zion was the City of David.

firstLine: Then he said,
rest: “I praise the Lord. He is the God of Israel. With his own mouth he made a promise to my father David. With his own powerful hand he made it come true. He said,

firstLine: Solomon Prays to Set the Temple Apart to the Lord
rest: Then Solomon stood in front of the Lord’s altar. He stood in front of the whole community of Israel. He spread out his hands toward heaven.

firstLine: He said,
rest: “Lord, you are the God of Israel. There is no God like you in heaven above or on earth below. You keep the covenant you made with us. You show us your love. You do that when we follow you with all our hearts.

firstLine: Solomon Sets the Temple Apart to the Lord
rest: Then the king and the whole community of Israel offered sacrifices to the Lord.

firstLine: The Lord Appears to Solomon
rest: Solomon finished building the Lord’s temple and the royal palace. He had accomplished everything he had planned to do.

firstLine: The Lord said to him,
rest: “I have heard you pray to me. I have heard you ask me to show you my favor. You have built this temple. I have set it apart for myself. My Name will be there forever. My eyes and my heart will always be there.

firstLine: Other Things Solomon Did
rest: Solomon built the Lord’s temple and the royal palace. It took him 20 years to construct those two buildings.

firstLine: The Queen of Sheba Visits Solomon
rest: The queen of Sheba heard about how famous Solomon was. She also heard about how he served and worshiped the Lord. So she came to test him with hard questions.

firstLine: Solomon in All of His Glory
rest: Each year Solomon received 25 tons of gold.

firstLine: Solomon’s Wives Turn Him Away From the Lord
rest: King Solomon loved many women besides Pharaoh’s daughter. They were from other lands. They were Moabites, Ammonites, Edomites, Sidonians and Hittites.

firstLine: The Lord Brings Enemies Against Solomon
rest: Then the Lord brought an enemy against Solomon. The enemy’s name was Hadad. He was from Edom. In fact, he belonged to the royal family of Edom.

firstLine: “Why do you want to go back to your own country?” Pharaoh asked. “Don’t you have everything you need right here?”
rest: “Yes,” Hadad replied. “But I want you to let me go anyway!”

firstLine: Jeroboam Refuses to Follow Solomon
rest: Jeroboam refused to follow King Solomon. He was one of Solomon’s officials. He was from Zeredah in the territory of Ephraim. His father was Nebat. His mother was a widow named Zeruah.

firstLine: Solomon Dies
rest: The other events of Solomon’s rule are written down. Everything he did and the wisdom he showed are written down. They are written in the official records of Solomon.

firstLine: Israel Refuses to Follow Rehoboam
rest: Rehoboam went to Shechem. All of the people of Israel had gone there to make him king.

firstLine: Jeroboam Sets Up Golden Calves at Bethel and Dan
rest: Jeroboam built up the walls of Shechem. It was in the hill country of Ephraim. Jeroboam made Shechem his home. From there he went out and built up Peniel.

firstLine: A Man of God Goes to Bethel
rest: A man of God went from Judah to Bethel. He had received a message from the Lord. He arrived in Bethel just as Jeroboam was standing by the altar to offer a sacrifice.

firstLine: Ahijah Prophesies Against Jeroboam
rest: At that time Abijah became sick. He was the son of Jeroboam.

firstLine: Rehoboam, the King of Judah
rest: Rehoboam was king in Judah. He was the son of Solomon. Rehoboam was 41 years old when he became king. He ruled for 17 years in Jerusalem. It was the city the Lord had chosen out of all of the cities in the tribes of Israel. He wanted to put his Name there. Rehoboam’s mother was Naamah from Ammon.

firstLine: Abijah Becomes King of Judah
rest: Abijah became king of Judah. It was in the 18th year of Jeroboam’s rule over Israel. Jeroboam was the son of Nebat.

firstLine: Asa Becomes King of Judah
rest: Asa became king of Judah. It was in the 20th year that Jeroboam was king of Israel.

firstLine: Nadab Becomes King of Israel
rest: Nadab became king of Israel. It was in the second year that Asa was king of Judah. Nadab ruled over Israel for two years. He was the son of Jeroboam.

firstLine: Baasha Becomes King of Israel
rest: Baasha became king of Israel in Tirzah. It was in the third year that Asa was king of Judah. Baasha ruled for 24 years. He was the son of Ahijah.

firstLine: Elah Becomes King of Israel
rest: Elah became king of Israel. It was in the 26th year that Asa was king of Judah. Elah ruled in Tirzah for two years. He was the son of Baasha.

firstLine: Zimri Becomes King of Israel
rest: Zimri ruled in Tirzah for seven days. It was in the 27th year that Asa was king of Judah. The army of Israel had set up camp near Gibbethon. It was a Philistine town.

firstLine: Omri Becomes King of Israel
rest: The people of Israel divided up into two groups. Half of them wanted Tibni to be king. He was the son of Ginath. The other half wanted Omri.

firstLine: Ahab Becomes King of Israel
rest: Ahab became king of Israel. It was in the 38th year that Asa was king of Judah. Ahab ruled over Israel in Samaria for 22 years. He was the son of Omri.

firstLine: Elijah Is Fed by Ravens
rest: Elijah was from Tishbe in the land of Gilead. He said to Ahab, “I serve the Lord. He is the God of Israel. You can be sure that he lives. And you can be just as sure that there won’t be any dew or rain on the whole land. There won’t be any during the next few years. It won’t come until I say so.”

firstLine: Elijah Visits a Widow at Zarephath
rest: Some time later the brook dried up. It hadn’t rained in the land for quite a while.

firstLine: Elijah Gives Obadiah a Message for Ahab
rest: It was now three years since it had rained. A message came to Elijah from the Lord. He said, “Go. Speak to Ahab. Then I will send rain on the land.”

firstLine: The Lord Answers Elijah’s Prayer on Mount Carmel
rest: Obadiah went back to Ahab. He told Ahab that Elijah wanted to see him. So Ahab went to where Elijah was.

firstLine: “Do it again,” he said. So they did it again.
rest: “Do it a third time,” he ordered. And they did it the third time.

firstLine: “Go and look toward the sea,” he told his servant. So he went up and looked.
rest:
“I don’t see anything there,” he said.
Seven times Elijah said, “Go back.”

firstLine: Elijah Runs Away to Mount Horeb
rest: Ahab told Jezebel everything Elijah had done. He told her how Elijah had killed all of the prophets with his sword.

firstLine: The Lord Chooses Elisha
rest: Elijah left Mount Horeb. He saw Elisha, the son of Shaphat. Elisha was plowing in a field. He was driving the last of 12 pairs of oxen. Elijah went up to him. He threw his coat around him.

firstLine: Ben-Hadad Attacks Samaria
rest: Ben-Hadad brought his whole army together. He was king of Aram. He went up to Samaria. He took 32 kings and their horses and chariots with him. All of them surrounded Samaria and attacked it.

firstLine: Ahab Wins the Battle Over Ben-Hadad
rest: During that time a prophet came to Ahab, the king of Israel. He announced, “The Lord says, ‘Do you see this huge army? I will hand it over to you today. Then you will know that I am the Lord.’”

firstLine: “But who will do it?” Ahab asked.
rest:
The prophet answered, “The Lord says, ‘The young officers who are under the area commanders will do it.’”
“And who will start the battle?” he asked.
The prophet answered, “You will.”

firstLine: A Prophet Brings Charges Against Ahab
rest: There was a group that was called the company of the prophets. A message from the Lord came to one of their members. He said to his companion, “Strike me down with your weapon.” But the man wouldn’t do it.

firstLine: Ahab Takes Over Naboth’s Vineyard
rest: Some time later King Ahab wanted a certain vineyard. It belonged to Naboth from Jezreel. The vineyard was in Jezreel. It was close to the palace of Ahab, the king of Samaria.

firstLine: In those letters she wrote,
rest: “Announce a day when people are supposed to go without eating. Have Naboth sit in an important place among the people.

firstLine: Micaiah Prophesies Against Ahab
rest: For three years there wasn’t any war between Aram and Israel.

firstLine: “‘How?’ the Lord asked.
rest:
“The spirit said, ‘I’ll go out and put lies in the mouths of all of his prophets.’
“‘You will have success in getting Ahab to attack Ramoth Gilead,’ said the Lord. ‘Go and do it.’

firstLine: Ahab Is Killed at Ramoth Gilead
rest: So the king of Israel went up to Ramoth Gilead. Jehoshaphat, the king of Judah, went there too.

firstLine: Jehoshaphat’s Rule Comes to an End
rest: Jehoshaphat began to rule over Judah. It was in the fourth year that Ahab was king of Israel. Jehoshaphat was the son of Asa.

firstLine: Ahaziah Becomes King of Israel
rest: Ahaziah became king of Israel in Samaria. It was in the 17th year that Jehoshaphat was king of Judah. Ahaziah ruled over Israel for two years. He was the son of Ahab.

firstLine: The Lord Judges Ahaziah
rest: After Ahab died, Moab refused to remain under Israel’s control.

firstLine: Elijah Is Taken Up to Heaven
rest: Elijah and Elisha were on their way from Gilgal. The Lord was going to use a strong wind to take Elijah up to heaven.

firstLine: Elisha Makes Jericho’s Water Pure
rest: The men of Jericho spoke to Elisha. “Look,” they said. “This town has a good location. You can see that for yourself. But the spring of water here is bad. So the land doesn’t produce anything.”

firstLine: Some Young Fellows Make Fun of Elisha
rest: Elisha left Jericho and went up to Bethel. He was walking along the road. Some young fellows came out of the town. They made fun of him. “Go on up! You don’t even have any hair on your head!” they said. “Go on up! You don’t even have any hair on your head!”

firstLine: Moab’s King Refuses to Obey Israel’s King
rest: Joram became king of Israel in Samaria. It was in the 18th year that Jehoshaphat was king of Judah. Joram ruled for 12 years. He was the son of Ahab.

firstLine: “What road should we take to attack Moab?” Joram asked.
rest: “The one that goes through the Desert of Edom,” Jehoshaphat answered.

firstLine: Elisha Provides Olive Oil for a Widow
rest: The wife of a man from the company of the prophets cried out to Elisha. She said, “My husband is dead. You know how much respect he had for the Lord. But he owed money to someone. And now that person is coming to take my two boys away. They will become his slaves.”

firstLine: The Son of a Woman From Shunem Is Brought Back to Life
rest: One day Elisha went to the town of Shunem. A rich woman lived there. She begged him to stay and have a meal. So every time he came by, he stopped there to eat.

firstLine: “You will hold a son in your arms,” Elisha said. “It will be about this time next year.”
rest: “No, my master!” she objected. “You are a man of God. So don’t lie to me!”

firstLine: “Why do you want to go to him today?” he asked. “It isn’t the time for the New Moon Feast. It isn’t the Sabbath day.”
rest: “Don’t let that bother you,” she said.

firstLine: Deadly Food in a Pot
rest: Elisha returned to Gilgal. There wasn’t enough food to eat in that area. The company of the prophets was meeting with Elisha. So he said to his servant, “Put the large pot over the fire. Cook some stew for these men.”

firstLine: Elisha Feeds 100 People
rest: A man came from Baal Shalishah. He brought the man of God 20 loaves of barley bread. They had been baked from the first grain that had ripened. He also brought some heads of new grain. “Give this food to the people to eat,” Elisha said.

firstLine: “How can I put this in front of 100 men?” his servant asked.
rest: But Elisha answered, “Give it to the people to eat. Do it because the Lord says, ‘They will eat and have some left over.’”

firstLine: Naaman Is Healed of a Skin Disease
rest: Naaman was commander of the army of the king of Aram. He was a very important man in the eyes of his master. And he was highly respected. That’s because the Lord had helped him win the battle over Aram’s enemies. He was a brave soldier. But he had a skin disease.

firstLine: “I think you should go,” the king of Aram replied. “I’ll give you a letter to take to the king of Israel.”
rest: So Naaman left. He took 750 pounds of silver with him. He also took 150 pounds of gold. And he took ten sets of clothes.

firstLine: “Go in peace,” Elisha said.
rest: Naaman started out on his way.

firstLine: An Ax Blade Floats
rest: The company of the prophets spoke to Elisha. They said, “Look. The place where we meet with you is too small for us.

firstLine: Elisha Makes the Soldiers of Aram Blind
rest: The king of Aram was at war with Israel. He talked things over with his officers. Then he said, “I’m going to set up my camp in a certain place.”

firstLine: Aram’s Army Attacks Samaria
rest: Some time later, Ben-Hadad gathered his entire army together. Ben-Hadad was the king of Aram. His army marched up and surrounded Samaria. Then they attacked it.

firstLine: The Attack on Samaria Ends
rest: There were four men who had a skin disease. They were at the entrance of the gate of Samaria. They said to one another, “Why should we stay here until we die?

firstLine: The Woman from Shunem Gets Her Land Back
rest: Elisha had brought a woman’s son back to life. He had said to her, “Go away with your family. Stay for a while anywhere you can. The Lord has decided that there won’t be enough food in the land. That will be true for seven years.”

firstLine: Hazael Murders Ben-Hadad
rest: Elisha went to Damascus. Ben-Hadad was sick. He was king of Aram. The king was told, “The man of God has come all the way up here.”

firstLine: “Why are you sobbing?” asked Hazael.
rest: “Because I know how much harm you will do to the people of Israel,” he answered. “You will set fire to their cities that have high walls around them. You will kill their young men with your sword. You will smash their little children on the ground. You will rip open their pregnant women.”

firstLine: Jehoram Becomes King of Judah
rest: Jehoram began to rule as king over Judah. It was in the fifth year that Joram was king of Israel. Joram was the son of Ahab. Jehoram was the son of Jehoshaphat.

firstLine: Ahaziah Becomes King of Judah
rest: Ahaziah began to rule as king over Judah. It was in the 12th year that Joram was king of Israel. Joram was the son of Ahab. Ahaziah was the son of Jehoram.

firstLine: Jehu Is Anointed as King of Israel
rest: The prophet Elisha sent for a man from the company of the prophets. Elisha said to him, “Tuck your coat into your belt. Take this bottle of olive oil with you. Go to Ramoth Gilead.

firstLine: “That’s not true!” they said. “Tell us.”
rest: Jehu said, “Here is what he told me. He announced, ‘The Lord says, “I am anointing you as king over Israel.”’”

firstLine: Jehu Kills Joram and Ahaziah
rest: Jehu was the son of Jehoshaphat, the son of Nimshi. Jehu made plans against Joram. During that time Joram and Israel’s whole army had been guarding Ramoth Gilead. They had been guarding it against Hazael, the king of Aram.

firstLine: Jehu Kills Jezebel
rest: Jehu went to Jezreel. Jezebel heard about it. So she put makeup on her eyes and fixed her hair. She looked out of a window.

firstLine: Jehu Wipes Out Ahab’s Royal House
rest: Ahab’s royal family in the city of Samaria had a total of 70 sons. Jehu wrote some letters to the officials of the city. He also sent them to the elders there. And he sent them to those who took care of Ahab’s children. He said,

firstLine: Jehu Kills Those Who Serve Baal
rest: Then Jehu brought all of the people together. He said to them, “Ahab served the god Baal a little. I will serve him a lot.

firstLine: Athaliah and Joash
rest: Athaliah was Ahaziah’s mother. She saw that her son was dead. So she began to wipe out the whole royal house of Judah.

firstLine: Joash Repairs the Temple
rest: Joash became king of Judah. It was in the seventh year of Jehu’s rule. Joash ruled in Jerusalem for 40 years. His mother’s name was Zibiah. She was from Beersheba.

firstLine: Jehoahaz Becomes King of Israel
rest: Jehoahaz became king of Israel in Samaria. It was in the 23rd year of Joash, the king of Judah. Jehoahaz ruled for 17 years. Joash was the son of Ahaziah. Jehoahaz was the son of Jehu.

firstLine: Jehoash Becomes King of Israel
rest: Jehoash became king of Israel in Samaria. It was in the 37th year that Joash was king of Judah. Jehoash ruled for 16 years. He was the son of Jehoahaz.

firstLine: “Open the east window,” Elisha said. So he did. “Shoot!” Elisha said. So he shot.
rest: “That’s the Lord’s arrow!” Elisha announced. “It means you will win the battle over Aram! You will completely destroy the men of Aram at Aphek.”

firstLine: Amaziah Becomes King of Judah
rest: Amaziah began to rule as king over Judah. It was in the second year that Jehoash was king of Israel. He was the son of Jehoahaz. Amaziah was the son of Joash.

firstLine: Jeroboam II Becomes King of Israel
rest: Jeroboam became king of Israel in Samaria. It was in the 15th year that Amaziah was king of Judah. Jeroboam ruled for 41 years. Amaziah was the son of Joash. Jeroboam was the son of Jehoash.

firstLine: Uzziah Becomes King of Judah
rest: Uzziah began to rule as king over Judah. It was in the 27th year that Jeroboam was king of Israel. Uzziah was the son of Amaziah.

firstLine: Zechariah Becomes King of Israel
rest: Zechariah became king of Israel in Samaria. It was in the 38th year that Uzziah was king of Judah. Zechariah ruled for six months. He was the son of Jeroboam, the son of Jehoash.

firstLine: Shallum Becomes King of Israel
rest: Shallum became king of Israel. It was in the 39th year that Uzziah was king of Judah. Shallum ruled in Samaria for one month. He was the son of Jabesh.

firstLine: Menahem Becomes King of Israel
rest: Menahem became king of Israel. It was in the 39th year that Uzziah was king of Judah. Menahem ruled in Samaria for ten years. He was the son of Gadi.

firstLine: Pekahiah Becomes King of Israel
rest: Pekahiah became king of Israel in Samaria. It was in the 50th year that Uzziah was king of Judah. Pekahiah ruled for two years. He was the son of Menahem.

firstLine: Pekah Becomes King of Israel
rest: Pekah became king of Israel in Samaria. It was in the 52nd year that Uzziah was king of Judah. Pekah ruled for 20 years. He was the son of Remaliah.

firstLine: Jotham Becomes King of Judah
rest: Jotham began to rule as king over Judah. It was in the second year that Pekah was king of Israel. He was the son of Remaliah. Jotham was the son of Uzziah.

firstLine: Ahaz Becomes King of Judah
rest: Ahaz began to rule as king over Judah. It was in the 17th year of the rule of Pekah, the son of Remaliah. Ahaz was the son of Jotham.

firstLine: Hoshea Becomes the Last King of Israel
rest: Hoshea became king of Israel in Samaria. It was in the 12th year that Ahaz was king of Judah. Hoshea ruled for nine years. He was the son of Elah.

firstLine: Israel Is Forced to Go Away to Assyria
rest: All of that took place because the people of Israel had committed sins against the Lord their God. He had brought them up out of Egypt. He had brought them out from under the power of Pharaoh, the king of Egypt. But they worshiped other gods.

firstLine: Assyria Brings Other People to Samaria
rest: The king of Assyria brought people from Babylon. He also brought them from Cuthah, Avva, Hamath and Sepharvaim. He settled all of them in the towns of Samaria. They took the place of the people of Israel. They took over Samaria and lived in its towns.

firstLine: Hezekiah Becomes King of Judah
rest: Hezekiah began to rule as king over Judah. It was in the third year that Hoshea was king of Israel. He was the son of Elah. Hezekiah was the son of Ahaz.

firstLine: Sennacherib Warns Jerusalem
rest: The king of Assyria sent his highest commander from Lachish to King Hezekiah at Jerusalem. He also sent his chief officer and his field commander along with a large army. All of them came up to Jerusalem. They stopped at the channel that brings water from the Upper Pool. It was on the road to the Washerman’s Field.

firstLine: Isaiah Prophesies That Jerusalem Will Be Saved
rest: When King Hezekiah heard what the field commander had said, he tore his clothes. He put on black clothes. Then he went into the Lord’s temple.

firstLine: Hezekiah Prays to the Lord
rest: When Hezekiah received the letter from the messengers, he read it. Then he went up to the Lord’s temple. There he spread the letter out in front of the Lord.

firstLine: Isaiah Prophesies That Sennacherib Will Fall From Power
rest: Isaiah sent a message to Hezekiah. Isaiah was the son of Amoz. Isaiah said, “The Lord is the God of Israel. He says, ‘I have heard your prayer about Sennacherib, the king of Assyria.’

firstLine: “Here is the message the Lord has spoken against him. The Lord says,
rest:
“‘You will not win the battle over Zion.
Its people hate you and make fun of you.
The people of Jerusalem lift up their heads proudly
as you run away.

firstLine: Through your messengers
rest:
you have laughed at me again and again.
And you have said,
“I have many chariots.
With them I have climbed to the tops of the mountains.
I’ve climbed the highest mountains in Lebanon.
I’ve cut down its tallest cedar trees.
I’ve cut down the best of its pine trees.
I’ve reached its farthest parts.
I’ve reached its finest forests.

firstLine: “‘But I, the Lord, say, “Haven’t you heard what I have done?
rest:
Long ago I arranged for you to do all of that.
In days of old I planned it.
Now I have made it happen.
You have turned cities with high walls
into piles of stone.

firstLine: “‘“But I know where you live.
rest:
I know when you come and go.
I know how very angry you are with me.

firstLine: “Here is a message from me about the king of Assyria. It says,
rest:
“‘He will not enter this city.
He will not even shoot an arrow at it.
He will not come near it with a shield.
He will not build a ramp in order to climb over its walls.

firstLine: “‘I will guard this city and save it.
rest: I will do it for myself. And I will do it for my servant David.’”

firstLine: Hezekiah Becomes Sick
rest:
In those days Hezekiah became very sick. He knew he was about to die.
The prophet Isaiah, the son of Amoz, went to him. Isaiah told Hezekiah, “The Lord says, ‘Put everything in order. Make out your will. You are going to die soon. You will not get well again.’”

firstLine: Messengers Come From Babylon to Hezekiah
rest: At that time Merodach-Baladan, the king of Babylonia, sent Hezekiah letters and a gift. He had heard that Hezekiah had been sick. Merodach-Baladan was the son of Baladan.

firstLine: Manasseh Becomes King of Judah
rest: Manasseh was 12 years old when he became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for 55 years. His mother’s name was Hephzibah.

firstLine: Amon Becomes King of Judah
rest: Amon was 22 years old when he became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for two years. His mother’s name was Meshullemeth. She was the daughter of Haruz. She was from Jotbah.

firstLine: Hilkiah Finds the Scroll of the Law
rest: Josiah was eight years old when he became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for 31 years. His mother’s name was Jedidah. She was the daughter of Adaiah. She was from Bozkath.

firstLine: Josiah Promises to Follow the Covenant
rest: Then the king called together all of the elders of Judah and Jerusalem.

firstLine: “Leave it alone,” Josiah said. “Don’t let anyone touch his bones.”
rest: So they spared his bones. They also spared the bones of the prophet who had come from the northern kingdom of Israel.

firstLine: Jehoahaz Becomes King of Judah
rest: Jehoahaz was 23 years old when he became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for three months. His mother’s name was Hamutal. She was the daughter of Jeremiah. She was from Libnah.

firstLine: Jehoiakim Becomes King of Judah
rest: Jehoiakim was 25 years old when he became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for 11 years. His mother’s name was Zebidah. She was the daughter of Pedaiah. She was from Rumah.

firstLine: Jehoiachin Becomes King of Judah
rest: Jehoiachin was 18 years old when he became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for three months. His mother’s name was Nehushta. She was the daughter of Elnathan. She was from Jerusalem.

firstLine: Zedekiah Becomes King of Judah
rest: Zedekiah was 21 years old when he became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for 11 years. His mother’s name was Hamutal. She was the daughter of Jeremiah. She was from Libnah.

firstLine: Jehoiachin Is Set Free
rest: Evil-Merodach set Jehoiachin, the king of Judah, free from prison. It was in the 37th year after Jehoiachin had been taken away to Babylon. It was also the year Evil-Merodach became king of Babylonia. It was on the 27th day of the 12th month.

firstLine: A List of Names From Adam to Abraham
rest:
A List of Names From Adam to the Sons of Noah
Adam, Seth, Enosh,

firstLine: The sons of Noah were
rest: Shem, Ham and Japheth.

firstLine: The Sons of Japheth
rest:
The sons of Japheth were
Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech and Tiras.

firstLine: The sons of Gomer were
rest: Ashkenaz, Riphath and Togarmah.

firstLine: The sons of Javan were
rest: Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittim and the Rodanites.

firstLine: The Sons of Ham
rest:
The sons of Ham were
Cush, Egypt, Put and Canaan.

firstLine: The sons of Cush were
rest:
Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raamah and Sabteca.
The sons of Raamah were
Sheba and Dedan.

firstLine: Cush was the father of
rest: Nimrod. Nimrod grew up to be a mighty hero on the earth.

firstLine: Egypt was the father of
rest: the Ludites, Anamites, Lehabites and Naphtuhites.

firstLine: The Sons of Shem
rest:
The sons of Shem were
Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud and Aram.
The sons of Aram were
Uz, Hul, Gether and Meshech.

firstLine: Joktan was the father of
rest: Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth and Jerah.

firstLine: A List of Names From Shem to Abraham
rest: Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah,

firstLine: The Family Line of Abraham
rest:
The sons of Abraham were
Isaac and Ishmael.

firstLine: The Family Line of Hagar
rest:
Here are the members of the family line of Hagar.
Nebaioth was Ishmael’s oldest son. Then came Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,

firstLine: The Family Line of Keturah
rest:
Here are the sons that were born to Abraham’s concubine Keturah.
They were Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak and Shuah.
The sons of Jokshan were
Sheba and Dedan.

firstLine: The sons of Midian were
rest:
Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida and Eldaah.
All of them came from Keturah.

firstLine: The Family Line of Sarah
rest:
Abraham was the father of Isaac.
The sons of Isaac were
Esau and Israel.

firstLine: The Family Line of Esau
rest:
The sons of Esau were
Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam and Korah.

firstLine: The sons of Eliphaz were
rest:
Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam and Kenaz.
Timna had Amalek by Eliphaz.

firstLine: The sons of Reuel were
rest: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah and Mizzah.

firstLine: The People of Seir in Edom
rest:
The sons of Seir were
Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer and Dishan.

firstLine: The sons of Lotan were
rest: Hori and Homam. Timna was Lotan’s sister.

firstLine: The sons of Shobal were
rest:
Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho and Onam.
The sons of Zibeon were
Aiah and Anah.

firstLine: The son of Anah was
rest:
Dishon.
The sons of Dishon were
Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran and Keran.

firstLine: The sons of Ezer were
rest:
Bilhan, Zaavan and Akan.
The sons of Dishan were
Uz and Aran.

firstLine: The Rulers of Edom
rest:
Before Israel had a king, there were kings who ruled in Edom.
Bela was the son of Beor. Bela’s city was called Dinhabah.

firstLine: The Sons of Israel
rest:
Here are the names of the sons of Israel.
Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,

firstLine: The Family Line of Judah
rest:
The Family Line From Judah’s Sons to Hezron’s Sons
The sons of Judah were
Er, Onan and Shelah. A woman from Canaan had those three sons by him. She was the daughter of Shua. Er was Judah’s oldest son. He was evil in the Lord’s eyes. So the Lord put him to death.

firstLine: The sons of Perez were
rest: Hezron and Hamul.

firstLine: The sons of Zerah were
rest: Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol and Darda. The total number of Zerah’s sons was five.

firstLine: The son of Ethan was
rest: Azariah.

firstLine: Hezron was the father of
rest: Jerahmeel, Ram and Caleb.

firstLine: The Family Line of Ram
rest:
Ram was the father of
Amminadab. Amminadab was the father of Nahshon. Nahshon was the leader of the people of Judah.

firstLine: Jesse’s first son was
rest: Eliab. His second son was Abinadab. The third was Shimea.

firstLine: The Family Line of Caleb
rest: Caleb was the son of Hezron. Caleb’s wife Azubah had children by him. Jerioth also had children by him. Azubah’s sons were Jesher, Shobab and Ardon.

firstLine: The Family Line of Jerahmeel
rest: Here are the sons of Jerahmeel. He was the oldest son of Hezron. Ram was Jerahmeel’s oldest son. Then came Bunah, Oren, Ozem and Ahijah.

firstLine: The sons of Onam were
rest:
Shammai and Jada.
The sons of Shammai were
Nadab and Abishur.

firstLine: The sons of Nadab were
rest: Seled and Appaim. Seled died without having any children.

firstLine: The son of Appaim was
rest:
Ishi. Ishi was the father of Sheshan.
Sheshan was the father of Ahlai.

firstLine: The sons of Jada were
rest: Jether and Jonathan. Jada was Shammai’s brother. Jether died without having any children.

firstLine: The sons of Jonathan were
rest:
Peleth and Zaza.
They belonged to the family line of Jerahmeel.

firstLine: The Family Groups of Caleb
rest:
Caleb was the brother of Jerahmeel.
Caleb’s oldest son was Mesha. Mesha was the father of Ziph. Caleb had another son named Mareshah. Mareshah was the father of Hebron.

firstLine: The sons of Hebron were
rest: Korah, Tappuah, Rekem and Shema.

firstLine: The sons of Jahdai were
rest: Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah and Shaaph.

firstLine: The Sons of David
rest:
Here are the sons of David who were born to him in Hebron.
His first son was Amnon. Amnon’s mother was Ahinoam from Jezreel.
The second son was Daniel. His mother was Abigail from Carmel.

firstLine: The Kings of Judah
rest:
Solomon’s son was Rehoboam.
Abijah was the son of Rehoboam.
Asa was the son of Abijah.
Jehoshaphat was the son of Asa.

firstLine: The Royal Family Line After Jehoiachin
rest:
Here are the members of the family line of Jehoiachin. He was taken as a prisoner to Babylon.
His sons were Shealtiel,

firstLine: The sons of Pedaiah were
rest:
Zerubbabel and Shimei.
The sons of Zerubbabel were
Meshullam and Hananiah.
Shelomith was their sister.

firstLine: The family line of Hananiah included
rest: Pelatiah and Jeshaiah. It also included the sons of Rephaiah, Arnan, Obadiah and Shecaniah.

firstLine: The family line of Shecaniah included
rest:
Shemaiah and his sons.
They were Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah and Shaphat. The total number of men was six.

firstLine: The sons of Neariah were
rest: Elioenai, Hizkiah and Azrikam. The total number of sons was three.

firstLine: The sons of Elioenai were
rest: Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah and Anani. The total number of sons was seven.

firstLine: Other Family Groups of Judah
rest:
The family line of Judah included
Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur and Shobal.

firstLine: The sons of Etam were
rest: Jezreel, Ishma and Idbash. Their sister was named Hazzelelponi.

firstLine: The sons of Helah were
rest: Zereth, Zohar, Ethnan

firstLine: The sons of Kenaz were
rest:
Othniel and Seraiah.
The sons of Othniel were
Hathath and Meonothai.

firstLine: The sons of Caleb were
rest:
Iru, Elah and Naam. Caleb was the son of Jephunneh.
The son of Elah was
Kenaz.

firstLine: The sons of Jehallelel were
rest: Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria and Asarel.

firstLine: The sons of Ezrah were
rest: Jether, Mered, Epher and Jalon. One of Mered’s wives had Miriam, Shammai and Ishbah by him. Ishbah was the father of Eshtemoa.

firstLine: The sons of Shimon were
rest:
Amnon, Rinnah, Ben-Hanan and Tilon.
The family line of Ishi included
Zoheth and Ben-Zoheth.

firstLine: The Family Line of Simeon
rest:
The family line of Simeon included
Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah and Shaul.

firstLine: The Family Line of Reuben
rest: Here is a list of the sons of Reuben. First, here are a few things about him. Reuben was the oldest son of Israel. But he had sex with his father’s concubine. He made his father’s bed “unclean.” That’s why his rights as the oldest son were given to the sons of Joseph, the son of Israel. So Reuben isn’t listed in the family history as the one who had the rights of the oldest son.

firstLine: The family line of Joel includes
rest:
his son Shemaiah. Gog was the son of Shemaiah.
Shimei was the son of Gog.

firstLine: The Family Line of Gad
rest: The people of Gad lived next to the people of Reuben in Bashan. They spread out all the way to Salecah.

firstLine: The Family Line of Half of the Tribe of Manasseh
rest: The people in half of the tribe of Manasseh greatly increased their numbers. They settled in the land from Bashan to Baal Hermon. Baal Hermon is also called Senir. Another name for it is Mount Hermon.

firstLine: The Family Line of Levi
rest:
The sons of Levi were
Gershon, Kohath and Merari.

firstLine: The sons of Kohath were
rest: Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.

firstLine: Aaron, Moses and Miriam
rest:
were born in the family line of Amram.
The sons of Aaron were
Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.

firstLine: The sons of Levi were
rest: Gershon, Kohath and Merari.

firstLine: The names of the sons of Gershon were
rest: Libni and Shimei.

firstLine: The sons of Kohath were
rest: Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.

firstLine: The sons of Merari were
rest:
Mahli and Mushi.
Here are the members of the family groups of the Levites. They are listed under the names of their fathers.

firstLine: The sons of Samuel were
rest:
his first son Joel
and his second son Abijah.

firstLine: The Levites Who Were in Charge of the Music
rest: Here are the Levites David put in charge of the music in the house of the Lord. He did it after the ark was placed there.

firstLine: From the tribe of Issachar
rest: they received Kedesh, Daberath,

firstLine: From the tribe of Asher
rest: they received Mashal, Abdon,

firstLine: From the tribe of Naphtali
rest: they received Kedesh in Galilee. They also received Hammon and Kiriathaim. They were given all of those towns together with their grasslands.

firstLine: From the tribe of Gad
rest: they received Ramoth in Gilead. They also received Mahanaim,

firstLine: The Family Line of Issachar
rest:
The sons of Issachar were
Tola, Puah, Jashub and Shimron. The total number of sons was four.

firstLine: The sons of Tola were
rest: Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam and Samuel. They were the leaders of their families. The total number of fighting men who were listed in the history of the family line of Tola was 22,600. That was when David was king.

firstLine: The son of Uzzi was
rest:
Izrahiah.
The sons of Izrahiah were
Michael, Obadiah, Joel and Isshiah. All five of them were chiefs.

firstLine: The Family Line of Benjamin
rest:
The three sons of Benjamin were
Bela, Beker and Jediael.

firstLine: The sons of Bela were
rest: Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth and Iri. They were the leaders of their families. The total number of sons was five. Their family history listed 22,034 fighting men.

firstLine: The sons of Beker were
rest: Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth and Alemeth. All of them were the sons of Beker.

firstLine: The son of Jediael was
rest:
Bilhan.
The sons of Bilhan were
Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Kenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish and Ahishahar.

firstLine: The Family Line of Naphtali
rest:
The sons of Naphtali were
Jahziel, Guni, Jezer and Shillem. They belonged to the family line of Bilhah.

firstLine: The Family Line of Manasseh
rest:
Here is the family line of Manasseh.
He had a concubine who was from the land of Aram. She had Asriel and Makir by him. Makir was the father of Gilead.

firstLine: The son of Ulam was
rest:
Bedan.
Those were the members of the family line of Makir, the son of Manasseh. Gilead was the son of Makir.

firstLine: The sons of Shemida were
rest: Ahian, Shechem, Likhi and Aniam.

firstLine: The Family Line of Ephraim
rest:
Here are the members of the family line of Ephraim.
Shuthelah was Ephraim’s son.
Bered was Shuthelah’s son.
Tahath was Bered’s son.
Eleadah was Tahath’s son.
Tahath was Eleadah’s son.

firstLine: The Family Line of Asher
rest:
The sons of Asher were
Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi and Beriah. They had a sister named Serah.

firstLine: The sons of Beriah were
rest: Heber and Malkiel. Malkiel was the father of Birzaith.

firstLine: The sons of Japhlet were
rest: Pasach, Bimhal and Ashvath. They were Japhlet’s sons.

firstLine: The sons of Shomer were
rest: Ahi, Rohgah, Hubbah and Aram.

firstLine: The sons of Shomer’s brother Helem were
rest: Zophah, Imna, Shelesh and Amal.

firstLine: The sons of Zophah were
rest: Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,

firstLine: The sons of Jether were
rest: Jephunneh, Pispah and Ara.

firstLine: The sons of Ulla were
rest: Arah, Hanniel and Rizia.

firstLine: The Family History of Saul
rest:
Benjamin was the father of Bela. Bela was his first son.
Ashbel was his second son. Aharah was the third.

firstLine: The sons of Bela were
rest: Addar, Gera, Abihud,

firstLine: The sons of Elpaal were
rest: Eber, Misham and Shemed. Shemed built Ono and Lod and the villages that were around it.

firstLine: The son of Jonathan was
rest: Merib-Baal. Merib-Baal was the father of Micah.

firstLine: The sons of Micah were
rest: Pithon, Melech, Tarea and Ahaz.

firstLine: The Family History of Saul
rest:
Jeiel lived in the city of Gibeon. He was the father of Gibeon.
Jeiel had a wife named Maacah.

firstLine: The son of Jonathan was
rest: Merib-Baal. Merib-Baal was the father of Micah.

firstLine: The sons of Micah were
rest: Pithon, Melech, Tahrea and Ahaz.

firstLine: Saul Takes His Own Life
rest: The Philistines fought against Israel. The men of Israel ran away from them. But many Israelites were killed on Mount Gilboa.

firstLine: David Becomes King Over Israel
rest: The whole community of Israel came together to see David at Hebron. They said, “We are your own flesh and blood.

firstLine: David Captures Jerusalem
rest:
David and all of the men of Israel marched to Jerusalem. Jerusalem was also called Jebus.
The Jebusites who lived there

firstLine: David’s Mighty Men
rest: The chiefs of David’s mighty men and the whole community of Israel helped David greatly. They helped him become king over the entire land. That’s exactly what the Lord had promised him.

firstLine: Shammoth, the Harorite
rest: Helez, the Pelonite

firstLine: Ira, the son of Ikkesh, from Tekoa
rest: Abiezer from Anathoth

firstLine: Sibbecai, the Hushathite
rest: Ilai, the Ahohite

firstLine: Maharai from Netophah
rest: Heled, the son of Baanah, from Netophah

firstLine: Ithai, the son of Ribai, from Gibeah in Benjamin
rest: Benaiah from Pirathon

firstLine: Hurai from the valleys of Gaash
rest: Abiel, the Arbathite

firstLine: Azmaveth, the Baharumite
rest: Eliahba, the Shaalbonite

firstLine: the sons of Hashem, the Gizonite
rest: Jonathan, the son of Shagee, the Hararite

firstLine: Ahiam, the son of Sacar, the Hararite
rest: Eliphal, the son of Ur

firstLine: Hepher, the Mekerathite
rest: Ahijah, the Pelonite

firstLine: Hezro from Carmel
rest: Naarai, the son of Ezbai

firstLine: Joel, the brother of Nathan
rest: Mibhar, the son of Hagri

firstLine: Zelek from Ammon
rest: Naharai, from Beeroth, who carried the armor of Joab, the son of Zeruiah

firstLine: Ira, the Ithrite
rest: Gareb, the Ithrite

firstLine: Uriah, the Hittite
rest: Zabad, the son of Ahlai

firstLine: Hanan, the son of Maacah
rest: Joshaphat, the Mithnite

firstLine: Uzzia, the Ashterathite
rest: Shama and Jeiel, the sons of Hotham from Aroer

firstLine: Jediael, the son of Shimri
rest: his brother Joha, the Tizite

firstLine: Eliel, the Mahavite
rest:
Jeribai and Joshaviah, the sons of Elnaam
Ithmah from Moab

firstLine: Eliel
rest:
Obed
Jaasiel, the Mezobaite

firstLine: Fighting Men Join David
rest: Some fighting men came to David at Ziklag. They were among those who helped him in battle. David had been forced to hide from Saul, the son of Kish.

firstLine: Their chief Ahiezer and Joash, the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite
rest:
Jeziel and Pelet, the sons of Azmaveth
Beracah
Jehu from Anathoth

firstLine: Ishmaiah, the Gibeonite, who was a mighty man among the Thirty and a leader of the Thirty
rest:
Jeremiah
Jahaziel
Johanan
Jozabad from Gederah

firstLine: Eluzai
rest:
Jerimoth
Bealiah
Shemariah
Shephatiah, the Haruphite

firstLine: Other Fighting Men Join David at Hebron
rest: Large numbers of men came to David at Hebron. They were prepared for battle. They came to hand Saul’s kingdom over to him, just as the Lord had said. Here are the numbers of the men who came.

firstLine: David Wants to Bring the Ark Back
rest: David talked with each of his officers. He wanted to get their advice. Some of them were commanders of thousands of men. Others were commanders of hundreds.

firstLine: David’s Palace and Family
rest: Hiram was king of Tyre. He sent messengers to David. He sent cedar logs along with them. He also sent skilled workers to build a palace for David. They worked with stone and wood.

firstLine: David Wins the Battle Over the Philistines
rest: The Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over the entire nation of Israel. So their whole army went to look for him. But David heard about it. He went out to where they were.

firstLine: David Brings the Ark to Jerusalem
rest: David constructed buildings for himself in the City of David. Then he prepared a place for the ark of God. He set up a tent for it.

firstLine: From the families of Kohath
rest: came the leader Uriel and 120 relatives.

firstLine: From the families of Merari
rest: came the leader Asaiah and 220 relatives.

firstLine: From the families of Gershon
rest: came the leader Joel and 130 relatives.

firstLine: From the families of Elizaphan
rest: came the leader Shemaiah and 200 relatives.

firstLine: From the families of Hebron
rest: came the leader Eliel and 80 relatives.

firstLine: From the families of Uzziel
rest: came the leader Amminadab and 112 relatives.

firstLine: David’s Psalm of Thanks to the Lord
rest: That day was the first time David gave Asaph and his helpers this psalm of thanks to the Lord.

firstLine: Give praise to the Lord, the God of Israel,
rest:
for ever and ever.
Then all of the people said, “Amen!” They also said, “Praise the Lord.”

firstLine: God Makes a Promise to David
rest: David settled down in his palace. Then he spoke to the prophet Nathan. He said, “Here I am, living in a palace that has beautiful cedar walls. But the ark of the covenant of the Lord is under a tent.”

firstLine: David Prays to the Lord
rest:
Then King David went into the holy tent. He sat down in front of the Lord. He said,
“Lord God, who am I? My family isn’t important. So why have you brought me this far?

firstLine: David Wins Many Battles
rest: While David was king of Israel, he won many battles over the Philistines. He brought them under his control. He took Gath away from the Philistines. He also captured the villages that were around Gath.

firstLine: David’s Officials
rest: David ruled over the whole nation of Israel. He did what was fair and right for all of his people.

firstLine: David Goes to War Against the People of Ammon
rest: Nahash was king of Ammon. After he died, his son became the next king after him.

firstLine: Joab Captures the City of Rabbah
rest: In the spring, Joab led Israel’s army out. It was the time when kings go off to war. Joab destroyed the land of Ammon. He went to the city of Rabbah. He surrounded it and got ready to attack it. But David remained in Jerusalem. Later, Joab attacked Rabbah and completely destroyed it.

firstLine: Israel Goes to War Against the Philistines
rest: War broke out at Gezer against the Philistines. At that time Sibbecai killed Sippai. So the Philistines were brought under Israel’s control. Sibbecai was a Hushathite. Sippai was from the family line of Rapha.

firstLine: David Counts His Fighting Men
rest: Satan rose up against Israel. He stirred up David to count the men of Israel.

firstLine: David Builds an Altar
rest: Then the angel of the Lord ordered Gad to tell David to go up to the threshing floor of Araunah, the Jebusite. He wanted David to build an altar there to honor the Lord.

firstLine: David Makes Plans for Building the Temple
rest: David gave orders to bring together the outsiders who were living in Israel. He appointed some of them to cut stones. He wanted them to prepare blocks of stone for building the house of God.

firstLine: The Family Line of Levi
rest: David had become very old. So he made his son Solomon king over Israel.

firstLine: The Family of Gershon
rest: Ladan and Shimei belonged to the family of Gershon.

firstLine: The sons of Ladan were
rest: Jehiel, Zetham and Joel. Jehiel was the oldest son. The total number of sons was three.

firstLine: The sons of Shimei were
rest: Shelomoth, Haziel and Haran. The total number of sons was three. They were the leaders of the families of Ladan.

firstLine: The sons of Shimei were
rest: Jahath, Ziza, Jeush and Beriah. The total number of the sons of Shimei was four.

firstLine: The Family of Kohath
rest:
The sons of Kohath were
Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel. The total number of sons was four.

firstLine: The sons of Moses were
rest: Gershom and Eliezer.

firstLine: The Family of Merari
rest:
The sons of Merari were
Mahli and Mushi.
The sons of Mahli were
Eleazar and Kish.

firstLine: The sons of Mushi were
rest: Mahli, Eder and Jerimoth. The total number of sons was three.

firstLine: The Groups of Priests
rest:
Here are the groups of priests the sons of Aaron were separated into.
The sons of Aaron were Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.

firstLine: The Rest of the Levites
rest:
Here are the other members of the family line of Levi.
From the sons of Amram came Shubael.
From the sons of Shubael came Jehdeiah.

firstLine: The sons of Merari
rest: from Jaaziah were Beno, Shoham, Zaccur and Ibri.

firstLine: From Kish came
rest: Jerahmeel. Jerahmeel was the son of Kish.

firstLine: The Singers
rest: David and the commanders of the army set apart some of the sons of Asaph, Heman and Jeduthun. They set them apart to serve the Lord by prophesying while harps, lyres and cymbals were being played. Here is the list of the men who served in that way.

firstLine: From the sons of Asaph came
rest: Zaccur, Joseph, Nethaniah and Asarelah. The sons of Asaph were under the direction of Asaph. He prophesied under the king’s direction.

firstLine: From the sons of Jeduthun came
rest: Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Shimei, Hashabiah and Mattithiah. The total number was six. They were under the direction of their father Jeduthun. He prophesied while playing the harp. He used it to thank and praise the Lord.

firstLine: From the sons of Heman came
rest: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shubael, Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, Romamti-Ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir and Mahazioth.

firstLine: The 3rd was for Zaccur
rest: and his sons and relatives. The total number was 12.

firstLine: The 4th was for Izri
rest: and his sons and relatives. The total number was 12.

firstLine: The 5th was for Nethaniah
rest: and his sons and relatives. The total number was 12.

firstLine: The 6th was for Bukkiah
rest: and his sons and relatives. The total number was 12.

firstLine: The 7th was for Jesarelah
rest: and his sons and relatives. The total number was 12.

firstLine: The 8th was for Jeshaiah
rest: and his sons and relatives. The total number was 12.

firstLine: The 9th was for Mattaniah
rest: and his sons and relatives. The total number was 12.

firstLine: The 10th was for Shimei
rest: and his sons and relatives. The total number was 12.

firstLine: The 11th was for Azarel
rest: and his sons and relatives. The total number was 12.

firstLine: The 12th was for Hashabiah
rest: and his sons and relatives. The total number was 12.

firstLine: The 13th was for Shubael
rest: and his sons and relatives. The total number was 12.

firstLine: The 14th was for Mattithiah
rest: and his sons and relatives. The total number was 12.

firstLine: The 15th was for Jerimoth
rest: and his sons and relatives. The total number was 12.

firstLine: The 16th was for Hananiah
rest: and his sons and relatives. The total number was 12.

firstLine: The 17th was for Joshbekashah
rest: and his sons and relatives. The total number was 12.

firstLine: The 18th was for Hanani
rest: and his sons and relatives. The total number was 12.

firstLine: The 19th was for Mallothi
rest: and his sons and relatives. The total number was 12.

firstLine: The 20th was for Eliathah
rest: and his sons and relatives. The total number was 12.

firstLine: The 21st was for Hothir
rest: and his sons and relatives. The total number was 12.

firstLine: The 22nd was for Giddalti
rest: and his sons and relatives. The total number was 12.

firstLine: The 23rd was for Mahazioth
rest: and his sons and relatives. The total number was 12.

firstLine: The 24th was for Romamti-Ezer
rest: and his sons and relatives. The total number was 12.

firstLine: The Men Who Guarded the Gates
rest:
Here are the groups of men who guarded the gates.
From the family of Korah came Meshelemiah, the son of Kore. Kore was one of the sons of Asaph.

firstLine: Other Officials
rest: The Levite relatives of the men who guarded the gates were in charge of the treasures in the house of God. They were also in charge of other treasures that had been set apart for God.

firstLine: The Companies in the King’s Army
rest: Here is the list of the Israelites who served in the king’s army. They included leaders of families. They included commanders of thousands of men and commanders of hundreds. They also included other officers. All of them served the king in everything concerning the army companies that were on duty month by month all through the year. The total number of men in each company was 24,000.

firstLine: The Officers Over the Tribes
rest:
Here are the officers over the tribes of Israel.
Over the tribe of Reuben was Eliezer, the son of Zicri.
Over Simeon was Shephatiah, the son of Maacah.

firstLine: Other Officials of the King
rest:
Azmaveth was in charge of the royal storerooms. He was the son of Adiel.
Jonathan was in charge of the storerooms in the fields, towns, villages and lookout towers. He was the son of Uzziah.

firstLine: David Talks About His Plans for the Temple
rest: David asked all of the officials of Israel to come together at Jerusalem. He sent for the officers who were over the tribes. He sent for the commanders of the companies who served the king. He sent for the commanders of thousands of men and commanders of hundreds. He sent for the officials who were in charge of all of the royal property and livestock. They belonged to the king and his sons. He sent for the palace officials and the mighty men. He also sent for all of the brave fighting men.

firstLine: Gifts Are Brought for the Temple
rest: Then King David spoke to the whole community. He said, “God has chosen my son Solomon. But Solomon is young. He’s never done anything like this before. The task is huge. This grand and wonderful temple won’t be built for human beings. It will be built for the Lord God.

firstLine: David Praises the Lord
rest:
David praised the Lord in front of the whole community. He said,
“Lord, we give you praise.
You are the God of our father Israel.
We give you praise for ever and ever.

firstLine: Solomon Becomes the Next King
rest: The next day they offered sacrifices to the Lord. They brought burnt offerings to him. They sacrificed 1,000 bulls, 1,000 rams and 1,000 male lambs. They also brought the required drink offerings. And they offered many other sacrifices for the whole community of Israel.

firstLine: David Dies
rest: David was king over the whole nation of Israel. He was the son of Jesse.

firstLine: Solomon Asks God for Wisdom
rest: Solomon was the son of David. Solomon made his position secure over his kingdom. The Lord his God was with him. He made Solomon very great.

firstLine: Solomon Asks Hiram to Help Build the Temple
rest: Solomon gave orders to build a temple. That’s where the Lord would put his Name. Solomon also gave orders to build a royal palace for himself.
