firstLine: Hiram continued,
rest: “I praise the Lord. He is the God of Israel. He made heaven and earth. He has given King David a wise son. You have good sense. You understand what is right. You will build a temple for the Lord. You will also build a palace for yourself.

firstLine: Solomon Builds the Temple
rest: Then Solomon began to build the temple of the Lord. He built it on Mount Moriah in Jerusalem. That’s where the Lord had appeared to Solomon’s father David. He had appeared at the threshing floor of Araunah. Araunah was from Jebus. David had provided the threshing floor.

firstLine: More Facts About the Temple
rest: Solomon made a bronze altar that was 30 feet long, 30 feet wide and 15 feet high.

firstLine: Solomon Brings the Ark to the Temple
rest: Then Solomon sent for the elders of Israel. He told them to come to Jerusalem. They included all of the leaders of the tribes. They also included the chiefs of the families of Israel. Solomon wanted them to bring up the ark of the Lord’s covenant from Zion. Zion was the City of David.

firstLine: Then he said,
rest: “I praise the Lord. He is the God of Israel. With his mouth he made a promise to my father David. With his powerful hands he made it come true. He said,

firstLine: Solomon Prays to Set the Temple Apart to the Lord
rest: Then Solomon stood in front of the Lord’s altar. He stood in front of the whole community of Israel. He spread out his hands to pray.

firstLine: He said,
rest: “Lord, you are the God of Israel. There is no God like you in heaven or on earth. You keep the covenant you made with us. You show us your love. You do that when we follow you with all our hearts.

firstLine: “Lord God, rise up and come to your resting place.
rest:
Come in together with the ark.
It’s the sign of your power.
Lord God, may your priests put on salvation as if it were their clothes.
May your faithful people be glad because you are so good.

firstLine: Solomon Sets the Temple Apart to the Lord
rest: Solomon finished praying. Then fire came down from heaven. It burned up the burnt offering and the sacrifices. The glory of the Lord filled the temple.

firstLine: The Lord Appears to Solomon
rest: Solomon finished the Lord’s temple and the royal palace. He had done everything he had planned to do in the Lord’s temple and his own palace.

firstLine: Other Things Solomon Did
rest: Solomon built the Lord’s temple and his own palace. It took him 20 years to build them. After that,

firstLine: The Queen of Sheba Visits Solomon
rest: The queen of Sheba heard about how famous Solomon was. So she came to Jerusalem to test him with hard questions. She arrived with a very large group of attendants. Her camels were carrying spices, huge amounts of gold, and valuable jewels. She came to Solomon and asked him about everything she wanted to know.

firstLine: Solomon in All of His Glory
rest: Each year Solomon received 25 tons of gold.

firstLine: Solomon Dies
rest: The other events of Solomon’s rule from beginning to end are written down. They are written in the records of the prophet Nathan. They are written in the prophecy of Ahijah. He was from Shiloh. They are also written in the records of the visions of the prophet Iddo about Jeroboam. Jeroboam was the son of Nebat.

firstLine: Israel Refuses to Follow Rehoboam
rest: Rehoboam went to Shechem. All of the people of Israel had gone there to make him king.

firstLine: Rehoboam Builds Up Judah’s Towns
rest: Rehoboam lived in Jerusalem. He made Judah more secure by building up their towns.

firstLine: Rehoboam’s Family
rest: Rehoboam got married to Mahalath. She was the daughter of David’s son Jerimoth. Her mother was Abihail. Abihail was the daughter of Jesse’s son Eliab.

firstLine: Shishak Attacks Jerusalem
rest: Rehoboam had made his position as king secure. He had become very strong. Then he turned away from the law of the Lord. So did all of the people of Judah.

firstLine: Abijah Becomes King of Judah
rest: Abijah became king of Judah. It was in the 18th year of Jeroboam’s rule over Israel.

firstLine: Asa Becomes King of Judah
rest: Asa did what was good and right in the eyes of the Lord his God.

firstLine: Asa Makes Judah a Better Nation
rest: The Spirit of God came on Azariah. He was the son of Oded.

firstLine: The Last Years of Asa’s Rule
rest: Baasha was king of Israel. He marched out against Judah. It was in the 36th year of Asa’s rule over Judah. Baasha built up the walls of Ramah. He did it to keep people from leaving or entering the territory of Asa, the king of Judah.

firstLine: Jehoshaphat Becomes King of Judah
rest: Jehoshaphat was the son of Asa. Jehoshaphat became the next king after him. He made his kingdom strong in case Israel would attack him.

firstLine: Micaiah Prophesies Against Ahab
rest: Jehoshaphat had great wealth and honor. He joined forces with Ahab by getting married to Ahab’s daughter.

firstLine: “The spirit said, ‘I’ll go and put lies in the mouths of all of his prophets.’
rest: “‘You will have success in getting Ahab to attack Ramoth Gilead,’ said the Lord. ‘Go and do it.’

firstLine: Ahab Is Killed at Ramoth Gilead
rest: So the king of Israel went up to Ramoth Gilead. Jehoshaphat, the king of Judah, went there too.

firstLine: Jehoshaphat Appoints Judges
rest: Jehoshaphat lived in Jerusalem. He went out again among the people. He went from Beersheba to the hill country of Ephraim. He turned the people back to the Lord, the God of Israel.

firstLine: Jehoshaphat Wins the Battle Over Moab and Ammon
rest: After that, the Moabites, Ammonites and some Meunites went to war against Jehoshaphat.

firstLine: He said,
rest: “Lord, you are the God of our people. You are the God who is in heaven. You rule over all of the kingdoms of the nations. Your hands are strong and powerful. No one can fight against you and win.

firstLine: Jehoshaphat’s Rule Comes to an End
rest: So Jehoshaphat ruled over Judah. He was 35 years old when he became Judah’s king. He ruled in Jerusalem for 25 years. His mother’s name was Azubah. She was the daughter of Shilhi.

firstLine: Jehoram Becomes King of Judah
rest: Jehoram made his position secure over his father’s kingdom. Then he killed all of his brothers with his sword. He also killed some of the princes of Israel.

firstLine: Ahaziah Becomes King of Judah
rest: The people of Jerusalem made Ahaziah king in place of Jehoram. Ahaziah was Jehoram’s youngest son. Robbers had come with the Arabs into Jehoram’s camp. The robbers had killed all of his older sons. So Ahaziah, the king of Judah, began to rule. He was the son of Jehoram.

firstLine: Athaliah and Joash
rest: Athaliah was Ahaziah’s mother. She saw that her son was dead. So she began to wipe out the whole royal house of Judah.

firstLine: Joash Repairs the Temple
rest: Joash was seven years old when he became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for 40 years. His mother’s name was Zibiah. She was from Beersheba.

firstLine: The Evil Things Joash Did
rest: After Jehoiada died, the officials of Judah came to King Joash. They bowed down to him. He listened to them.

firstLine: Amaziah Becomes King of Judah
rest: Amaziah was 25 years old when he became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for 29 years. His mother’s name was Jehoaddin. She was from Jerusalem.

firstLine: Uzziah Becomes King of Judah
rest: All of the people of Judah made Uzziah king. He was 16 years old. They made him king in place of his father Amaziah.

firstLine: Jotham Becomes King of Judah
rest: Jotham was 25 years old when he became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for 16 years. His mother’s name was Jerusha. She was the daughter of Zadok.

firstLine: Ahaz Becomes King of Judah
rest:
Ahaz was 20 years old when he became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for 16 years.
He didn’t do what was right in the eyes of the Lord. He didn’t do what King David had done.

firstLine: Hezekiah Purifies the Temple
rest: Hezekiah was 25 years old when he became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for 29 years. His mother’s name was Abijah. She was the daughter of Zechariah.

firstLine: Shimri and Jeiel were from
rest:
the family line of Elizaphan.
Zechariah and Mattaniah were from
the family line of Asaph.

firstLine: Jehiel and Shimei were from
rest:
the family line of Heman.
Shemaiah and Uzziel were from
the family line of Jeduthun.

firstLine: Hezekiah Celebrates the Passover Feast
rest: Hezekiah sent a message to all of the people of Israel and Judah. He also wrote letters to the tribes of Ephraim and Manasseh. He invited everyone to come to the Lord’s temple in Jerusalem. He wanted them to celebrate the Passover Feast in honor of the Lord. He is the God of Israel.

firstLine: The People Bring Gifts to the Lord
rest: Hezekiah put the priests and Levites in groups based on their duties. The priests sacrificed burnt offerings and friendship offerings. The Levites served the Lord by giving thanks and singing praises at the gates of his house.

firstLine: Sennacherib’s Army Surrounds Jerusalem
rest: Hezekiah had been completely faithful to the Lord. But in spite of that, Sennacherib came and marched into Judah. He was the king of Assyria. He surrounded the cities that had high walls around them. He got ready to attack them. He thought he could win the battle over them. He thought he could take them for himself.

firstLine: Hezekiah’s Pride, Success and Death
rest: In those days Hezekiah became sick. He knew he was about to die. So he prayed to the Lord. And the Lord answered him. He gave him a miraculous sign.

firstLine: Manasseh Becomes King of Judah
rest: Manasseh was 12 years old when he became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for 55 years.

firstLine: Amon Becomes King of Judah
rest: Amon was 22 years old when he became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for two years.

firstLine: Josiah Makes Judah a Better Nation
rest: Josiah was eight years old when he became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for 31 years.

firstLine: Hilkiah Finds the Scroll of the Law
rest: The money that had been taken into the Lord’s temple was being brought out. At that time the priest Hilkiah found the Scroll of the Law of the Lord. It had been given through Moses.

firstLine: Josiah Celebrates the Passover Feast
rest: Josiah celebrated the Passover Feast in Jerusalem in honor of the Lord. The Passover lamb was killed on the 14th day of the first month.

firstLine: Josiah Dies
rest: Josiah had put the temple in order. After all of that, Neco went up to fight at Carchemish. He was king of Egypt. Carchemish was on the Euphrates River. Josiah marched out to meet Neco in battle.

firstLine: Jehoahaz Becomes King of Judah
rest: Jehoahaz was 23 years old when he became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for three months.

firstLine: Jehoiakim Becomes King of Judah
rest: Jehoiakim was 25 years old when he became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for 11 years. He did what was evil in the sight of the Lord his God.

firstLine: Jehoiachin Becomes King of Judah
rest: Jehoiachin was 18 years old when he became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for three months and ten days. He did what was evil in the sight of the Lord.

firstLine: Zedekiah Becomes King of Judah
rest: Zedekiah was 21 years old when he became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for 11 years.

firstLine: Nebuchadnezzar Destroys Jerusalem
rest: The Lord, the God of Israel, sent word to his people through his messengers. He sent it to them again and again. He took pity on his people. He also took pity on the temple where he lived.

firstLine: Cyrus, the king of Persia, says,
rest: “‘The Lord is the God of heaven. He has given me all of the kingdoms on earth. He has appointed me to build a temple for him at Jerusalem in Judah. Any one of his people among you can go up to Jerusalem. And may the Lord your God be with you.’”

firstLine: Cyrus Helps the Jews Build the Lord’s Temple
rest: It was the first year of the rule of Cyrus. He was king of Persia. The Lord stirred him up to send a message all through his kingdom. It happened so that what the Lord had spoken through Jeremiah would come true. The message was written down. It said,

firstLine: “Cyrus, the king of Persia, says,
rest: “‘The Lord is the God of heaven. He has given me all of the kingdoms on earth. He has appointed me to build a temple for him at Jerusalem in Judah.

firstLine: A List of People Who Returned to Judah
rest: Nebuchadnezzar had taken many Jews away from the land of Judah. He had forced them to go to Babylonia as prisoners. Now they returned to Jerusalem and Judah. All of them went back to their own towns. Nebuchadnezzar was king of Babylonia.

firstLine: Shephatiah, Hattil,
rest: Pokereth-Hazzebaim, Ami

firstLine: There were 652 of them from the family lines of
rest: Delaiah, Tobiah and Nekoda.

firstLine: The People Rebuild the Altar
rest: The people of Israel had settled down in their towns. In the seventh month all of them gathered together in Jerusalem.

firstLine: The People Begin to Rebuild the Temple
rest: The people gave money to those who worked with stone and those who worked with wood. They gave food and drink and olive oil to the people of Sidon and Tyre. Then those people brought cedar logs down from Lebanon to the Mediterranean Sea. They floated them down to Joppa. Cyrus, the king of Persia, authorized them to do it.

firstLine: Enemies Oppose the Rebuilding of the Temple
rest: The enemies of Judah and Benjamin heard about what the people who had returned from Babylonia were doing. They heard that they were building a temple to honor the Lord. He is the God of Israel.

firstLine: Later Enemies Also Oppose the Jews
rest: The enemies of the Jews brought charges against the people of Judah and Jerusalem. It happened when Xerxes began to rule over Persia.

firstLine: The king replied,
rest:
I am writing this letter to Rehum, the commanding officer. I am also writing it to Shimshai, the secretary. And I am writing it to your friends who are living in Samaria and in other places west of the Euphrates River.
I give you my greetings.

firstLine: Tattenai Sends a Letter to King Darius
rest: The prophets Haggai and Zechariah prophesied to the Jews in Judah and Jerusalem. They spoke to them in the name of the God of Israel. He had spoken to those prophets. Zechariah belonged to the family line of Iddo.

firstLine: The report they sent to the king said,
rest:
We are sending this letter to you, King Darius.
We give you our most friendly greetings.

firstLine: King Darius Sends a Reply to Tattenai
rest: King Darius gave an order. He had a search made in the official records that were stored among the treasures at Babylon.

firstLine: The Temple Is Completed and Set Apart to God
rest: The governor Tattenai carried out the order King Darius had sent. So did Shethar-Bozenai and their friends.

firstLine: The People Celebrate the Passover Feast
rest: Those who had returned from Babylonia celebrated the Passover Feast. It was on the 14th day of the first month.

firstLine: Ezra Comes to Jerusalem
rest: After all of those things had happened, Ezra came up to Jerusalem from Babylonia. It was during the rule of Artaxerxes. He was king of Persia. Ezra was the son of Seraiah. Seraiah was the son of Azariah. Azariah was the son of Hilkiah.

firstLine: King Artaxerxes Gives Ezra a Letter
rest: Ezra was a priest and teacher. He was an educated man. He knew the Lord’s commands and rules for Israel very well. Here is a copy of a letter King Artaxerxes had given to Ezra. It said,

firstLine: Ezra Praises the Lord
rest: People of Israel, give praise to the Lord. He is the God of our people who lived long ago. He has put it in the king’s heart to bring honor to the Lord’s temple in Jerusalem. The king has honored the Lord in his letter.

firstLine: The Family Leaders Who Returned to Jerusalem With Ezra
rest: Many family leaders came up to Jerusalem with me from Babylonia. So did others who were listed with them. It was during the time when Artaxerxes was king. Here is a list of those who came.

firstLine: Ezra Leads Many Jews Back to Jerusalem
rest: I gathered the people together at the waterway that flows toward Ahava. We camped there for three days. I looked for Levites among the people and priests. But I didn’t find any.

firstLine: Ezra Prays for the People
rest: After all of those things had been done, the leaders came to me. They said, “The people of Israel have committed sins. Even the priests and Levites have sinned. They haven’t kept themselves separate from the nations that are around them. The Lord hates the practices of those nations. He hates what the Canaanites, Hittites, Perizzites and Jebusites do. He also hates what the Ammonites, Moabites, Egyptians and Amorites do.

firstLine: I prayed,
rest: “You are my God. I’m filled with shame and dishonor. I can hardly look to you and pray. That’s because our sins are piled up above our heads. Our guilt reaches all the way to the heavens.

firstLine: The People Admit They Have Sinned
rest: Ezra was praying and admitting to God that his people had sinned. He was sobbing and throwing himself down in front of the house of God. Then a large crowd gathered around him. Men, women and children were there. They too sobbed bitterly.

firstLine: A List of Those Who Had Married Women From Other Lands
rest:
Among the family lines of the priests, here are the men who had married women from other lands.
Maaseiah, Eliezer, Jarib and Gedaliah
came from the family line of Jeshua and his brothers. Jeshua was the son of Jehozadak.

firstLine: Hanani and Zebadiah
rest: came from the family line of Immer.

firstLine: Maaseiah and Elijah
rest: came from the family line of Harim. So did Shemaiah, Jehiel and Uzziah.

firstLine: Elioenai, Maaseiah and Ishmael
rest: came from the family line of Pashhur. So did Nethanel, Jozabad and Elasah.

firstLine: Mattaniah, Zechariah and Jehiel
rest: came from the family line of Elam. So did Abdi, Jeremoth and Elijah.

firstLine: Elioenai, Eliashib and Mattaniah
rest: came from the family line of Zattu. So did Jeremoth, Zabad and Aziza.

firstLine: Jehohanan, Hananiah, Zabbai and Athlai
rest: came from the family line of Bebai.

firstLine: Meshullam, Malluch and Adaiah
rest: came from the family line of Bani. So did Jashub, Sheal and Jeremoth.

firstLine: Adna, Kelal, Benaiah and Maaseiah
rest: came from the family line of Pahath-Moab. So did Mattaniah, Bezalel, Binnui and Manasseh.

firstLine: Eliezer, Ishijah, Malkijah, Shemaiah and Shimeon
rest: came from the family line of Harim.

firstLine: Mattenai, Mattattah, Zabad and Eliphelet
rest: came from the family line of Hashum. So did Jeremai, Manasseh and Shimei.

firstLine: Maadai, Amram and Uel
rest: came from the family line of Bani.

firstLine: Jeiel, Mattithiah, Zabad and Zebina
rest: came from the family line of Nebo. So did Jaddai, Joel and Benaiah.

firstLine: Nehemiah Prays to the Lord
rest:
These are the words of Nehemiah. He was the son of Hacaliah.
I was in the safest place in Susa. I was there in the 20th year that Artaxerxes was king. It was in the month of Kislev.

firstLine: I said,
rest: “Lord, you are the God of heaven. You are a great and wonderful God. You keep the covenant you made with those who love you and obey your commands. You show them your love.

firstLine: Artaxerxes Sends Nehemiah to Jerusalem
rest: Wine was brought in for King Artaxerxes. It was the month of Nisan in the 20th year of his rule. I got the wine and gave it to him. I hadn’t been sad in front of him before. But now I was.

firstLine: Nehemiah Checks Out the Walls of Jerusalem
rest: I went to Jerusalem. I stayed there for three days.

firstLine: A List of the People Who Repaired the Wall
rest: The high priest Eliashib and the other priests went to work. They rebuilt the Sheep Gate. They set it apart to God. They put its doors in place. They continued to rebuild the wall up to the Tower of the Hundred. They set the tower apart to God. Then they continued to rebuild the wall all the way to the Tower of Hananel.

firstLine: Nehemiah’s Enemies Oppose Him
rest: Sanballat heard that we were rebuilding the wall. So he burned with anger. He became very upset. He made fun of the Jews.

firstLine: Nehemiah Helps Some Poor People
rest: Some men and their wives cried out against their Jewish brothers and sisters.

firstLine: “We’ll give it back,” they said. “And we won’t require anything more from them. We’ll do exactly as you say.”
rest: Then I sent for the priests. I made the nobles and officials take an oath to do what they had promised.

firstLine: Nehemiah’s Enemies Continue to Oppose Him
rest: Sanballat, Tobiah and Geshem, the Arab, heard about what I had done. So did the rest of our enemies. All of them heard I had rebuilt the wall. In fact, they heard there weren’t any gaps left in it. But up to that time I hadn’t put up the gates at the main entrances to the city.

firstLine: It said,
rest:
“A report is going around among the nations. Geshem says it’s true. We hear that you and the other Jews are planning to turn against the Persian rulers. And that’s why you are building the wall.
“It’s also reported that you are about to become their king.

firstLine: The City Wall Is Completed
rest: So the city wall was completed on the 25th day of the month of Elul. It was finished in 52 days.

firstLine: A List of People Who Returned to Judah
rest: Jerusalem was large. It had a lot of room. But only a few people lived there. The houses hadn’t been rebuilt yet.

firstLine: The Levites belonged to
rest: the family line of Jeshua through Kadmiel through the line of Hodaviah. The total number of men was 74.

firstLine: The singers belonged to
rest: the family line of Asaph. The total number of men was 148.

firstLine: The men who guarded the temple gates belonged to
rest: the family lines of Shallum, Ater, Talmon, Akkub, Hatita and Shobai. The total number of men was 138.

firstLine: Shephatiah, Hattil,
rest: Pokereth-Hazzebaim, Amon

firstLine: There were 642 of them from the family lines of
rest: Delaiah, Tobiah and Nekoda.

firstLine: The People of Israel Pray to the Lord
rest: It was the 24th day of the seventh month. The people of Israel gathered together again. They didn’t eat any food. They wore black clothes. They put dust on their heads.

firstLine: The People Agree to Obey God’s Law
rest: “So we are making a firm agreement. We’re writing it down. Our leaders are stamping it with their seals. And so are our Levites and priests.”

firstLine: Maaziah, Bilgai, Shemaiah
rest: They were the priests.

firstLine: People Are Chosen to Live in Jerusalem
rest: The leaders of the people settled down in Jerusalem. The rest of the people cast lots. They did it to choose one person out of every ten. That person was brought to live in the holy city of Jerusalem. The other nine had to stay in their own towns.

firstLine: The Priests and Levites Who Returned to Judah
rest:
Some priests and Levites returned to Judah with Zerubbabel and Jeshua. Zerubbabel was the son of Shealtiel. Here are the names of those priests and Levites.
Seraiah, Jeremiah, Ezra,

firstLine: Sallu, Amok, Hilkiah, Jedaiah
rest: All of them were the leaders of the priests and those who helped them. They lived in the days of Jeshua.

firstLine: The Wall of Jerusalem Is Set Apart to God
rest: The wall of Jerusalem was set apart to God. For that occasion, the Levites were gathered together from where they lived. They were brought to Jerusalem to celebrate that happy occasion. They celebrated the fact that the wall was being set apart to God. They did it by singing and giving their thanks to him. They celebrated by playing music on cymbals, harps and lyres.

firstLine: Nehemiah Warns the People
rest: On that same day the Scroll of Moses was read out loud. All of the people heard it. It was written there that no one from Ammon or Moab should ever be allowed to become a member of the community of God.

firstLine: Vashti Is Removed From Her Position as Queen
rest: King Xerxes ruled over the 127 territories in his kingdom. They reached from India all the way to Cush. Here is what happened during the time Xerxes ruled over the whole Persian kingdom.

firstLine: Esther Becomes Queen of Persia
rest: Later, the anger of King Xerxes calmed down. Then he remembered Vashti and what she had done. He also remembered the royal order he had sent out concerning her.

firstLine: Mordecai Uncovers a Plan to Kill the King
rest: The virgins were gathered together a second time. At that time Mordecai was sitting at the palace gate.

firstLine: Haman Plans to Destroy the Jews
rest: After those events, King Xerxes honored Haman. Haman was the son of Hammedatha. He was from the family line of Agag. The king gave Haman a higher position than he had before. He gave him a seat of honor. It was higher than the positions any of the other nobles had.

firstLine: Mordecai Talks Esther Into Helping the Jews
rest: Mordecai found out about everything that had been done. So he tore his clothes. He put on black clothes. He sat down in ashes. Then he went out into the city. He sobbed out loud. He cried bitter tears.

firstLine: Esther Invites the King and Haman to a Big Dinner
rest:
On the third day Esther put her royal robes on. She stood in the inner courtyard of the palace. It was in front of the king’s hall.
The king was sitting on his royal throne in the hall. He was facing the entrance.

firstLine: “Bring Haman at once,” the king said to his servants. “Then we’ll do what Esther asks.”
rest: So the king and Haman went to the big dinner Esther had prepared.

firstLine: Haman Brags About Being Invited to Esther’s Dinner
rest: That day Haman was happy. So he left the palace in a good mood. But then he saw Mordecai at the palace gate. He noticed that Mordecai didn’t stand up when he walked by. In fact, Mordecai didn’t have any respect for him at all. So he burned with anger against him.

firstLine: The King Honors Mordecai
rest: That night the king couldn’t sleep. So he ordered the official records of his rule to be brought in. He ordered someone to read them to him.

firstLine: “What great honor has Mordecai received for doing that?” the king asked.
rest: “Nothing has been done for him,” his attendants answered.

firstLine: Haman Is Put to Death
rest: So the king and Haman went to dine with Queen Esther.

firstLine: The King Allows the Jews to Fight for Their Lives
rest:
That same day King Xerxes gave Queen Esther everything Haman had owned. Haman had been the enemy of the Jews.
Esther had told the king that Mordecai was her cousin. So Mordecai came to see the king.

firstLine: The Jews Win the Battle Over Their Enemies
rest: The king’s order had to be carried out on the 13th day of the 12th month. That was the month of Adar. On that day the enemies of the Jews had hoped to win the battle over them. But now everything had changed. The Jews had gained the advantage over those who hated them.

firstLine: Purim Is Celebrated
rest: But the Jews in Susa had gathered together on the 13th and 14th. Then on the 15th they rested. They made it a day to celebrate with great joy. And they enjoyed good food.

firstLine: The Greatness of Mordecai
rest: King Xerxes required people all through his kingdom to bring him gifts. He required gifts from its farthest shores.

firstLine: The Story Begins
rest: There was a man who lived in the land of Uz. His name was Job. He was honest. He did what was right. He had respect for God and avoided evil.

firstLine: Job Is Put to the Test
rest: One day angels came to the Lord. Satan also came with them.

firstLine: He said,
rest:
“I was born naked.
And I’ll leave here naked.
You have given, and you have taken away.
May your name be praised.”

firstLine: Job Is Put to the Test Again
rest: On another day angels came to the Lord. Satan also came to him along with them.

firstLine: Job’s Three Friends Come to Comfort Him
rest: Job had three friends named Eliphaz the Temanite, Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite. They heard about all of the troubles that had come to Job. So they started out from their homes. They had agreed to meet together. They wanted to go and show their concern for Job. They wanted to comfort him.

firstLine: Job Wishes He Had Never Been Born
rest: After a while, Job opened his mouth to speak. He called down a curse on the day he had been born.

firstLine: “May the day I was born be wiped out.
rest: May the night be wiped away when people said, ‘A boy is born!’

firstLine: “Why didn’t I die when I was born?
rest: Why didn’t I die as I came out of my mother’s body?

firstLine: If all of that hadn’t happened,
rest:
I would be lying down in peace.
I’d be asleep and at rest in the grave.

firstLine: “Why is the light that leads to life given to those who suffer?
rest: Why is it given to those whose spirits are bitter?

firstLine: Why is life given to those who are actually happy and glad
rest: when they reach the grave?

firstLine: The First Speech of Eliphaz
rest: Then Eliphaz the Temanite replied,

firstLine: “Job, suppose someone tries to talk to you.
rest:
Will that make you uneasy?
I can’t keep from speaking up.

firstLine: “Here’s something to think about.
rest:
Have blameless people ever been wiped out?
Have honest people ever been completely destroyed?

firstLine: “A message came to me in secret.
rest: It was as quiet as a whisper.

firstLine: Eliphaz continued,
rest:
“Call out if you want to, Job.
But who will answer you?
Which one of the holy angels will you turn to?

firstLine: “If I were you, I’d make my appeal to God.
rest: I’d bring my case to be judged by him.

firstLine: “Blessed is the person God corrects.
rest: So don’t hate the Mighty One’s training.

firstLine: You will go down to the grave
rest:
while you are still very strong.
You will be like a crop that is gathered at the right time.

firstLine: “We have carefully studied all of those things.
rest:
And they are true.
So pay attention to them.
Apply them to yourself.”

firstLine: Job’s Reply
rest: Job replied,

firstLine: “I wish my great pain could be weighed!
rest: I wish all of my suffering could be weighed on scales!

firstLine: “I wish I could have what I’m asking for!
rest: I wish God would give me what I’m hoping for!

firstLine: “I’m so weak that I no longer have any hope.
rest: Things have gotten so bad that I can’t wait for help anymore.

firstLine: “A man’s friends should love him when his hope is gone.
rest:
They should be faithful to him
even if he stops showing respect for the Mighty One.

firstLine: “Teach me. Then I’ll be quiet.
rest: Show me what I’ve done wrong.

firstLine: “But now please look at me.
rest: Would I tell you a lie right here in front of you?

firstLine: Job continued,
rest:
“Doesn’t every man have to work hard on this earth?
Aren’t his days like the days of a hired worker?

firstLine: I’ve been like a slave
rest:
who longs for the evening shadows to come.
I’ve been like a hired worker
who can hardly wait to get paid.

firstLine: When I lie down I think,
rest:
‘How long will it be before I can get up?’
The night drags on.
I toss and turn until sunrise.

firstLine: “My days pass by faster than a weaver can work.
rest: They come to an end. I don’t have any hope.

firstLine: “So I won’t keep quiet.
rest:
When I’m suffering greatly, I’ll speak out.
When my spirit is bitter, I’ll tell you how unhappy I am.

firstLine: “What are human beings that you think so much of them?
rest: What are they that you pay so much attention to them?

firstLine: The First Speech of Bildad
rest: Then Bildad the Shuhite replied,

firstLine: “Job, how long will you talk like that?
rest: Your words don’t have any meaning.

firstLine: “Find out what your people who lived long ago taught.
rest: Discover what those who lived before them learned.

firstLine: While they are still growing and haven’t been cut,
rest: they dry up faster than grass does.

firstLine: He is like a plant in the sunshine
rest:
that receives plenty of water.
It spreads its new growth all over the garden.

firstLine: But when a plant is pulled up from its spot,
rest: that place says, ‘I never saw you.’

firstLine: “I’m sure God doesn’t turn his back on anyone who is honest.
rest: And he doesn’t help those who do what is evil.

firstLine: Job’s Reply
rest: Job replied,

firstLine: “I’m sure that what you have said is true.
rest: But how can human beings be right with God?

firstLine: “So how can I disagree with God?
rest: How can I possibly argue with him?

firstLine: Even if I hadn’t done anything wrong,
rest:
I couldn’t answer him.
I could only beg my Judge to have mercy on me.

firstLine: “Even though I’m honest,
rest:
I’m not concerned about myself.
I hate my own life.

firstLine: “God, my days race by like a runner.
rest: They fly away without seeing any joy.

firstLine: “God isn’t a man like me. I can’t answer him.
rest: We can’t take each other to court.

firstLine: “I’m sick of living.
rest:
So I’ll talk openly about my problems.
I’ll speak out because my spirit is bitter.

firstLine: “‘Your hands shaped me and made me.
rest: So are you going to destroy me now?

firstLine: “‘But here’s what you hid in your heart.
rest: Here’s what you had on your mind.

firstLine: “‘Why did you bring me out of my mother’s body?
rest: I wish I had died before anyone saw me.

firstLine: It’s the land of darkest night
rest:
and deep shadow and disorder.
There even the light is like darkness.’”

firstLine: The First Speech of Zophar
rest: Then Zophar the Naamathite replied,

firstLine: “Don’t all of your words require an answer?
rest: I’m sure that what you are saying can’t be right.

firstLine: “Do you know how deep the mysteries of God are?
rest: Can you discover the limits of the Mighty One’s knowledge?

firstLine: “Suppose God comes along and puts you in prison.
rest:
Suppose he takes you to court.
Then who can oppose him?

firstLine: “So commit yourself to God completely.
rest: Reach out your hands to him for help.

firstLine: Job’s Reply
rest: Job replied,

firstLine: “You people think you know everything, don’t you?
rest: You are sure that wisdom will die with you!

firstLine: “My friends laugh at me all the time,
rest:
even though I called out to God and he answered.
My friends laugh at me,
even though I’m honest and right.

firstLine: “But ask the animals what God does.
rest:
They will teach you.
Or ask the birds of the air.
They will tell you.

firstLine: Are there any of those creatures that don’t know
rest: what the powerful hand of the Lord has done?

firstLine: “Wisdom and power belong to God.
rest: Advice and understanding also belong to him.

firstLine: “My eyes have seen everything God has done.
rest: My ears have heard it and understood it.

firstLine: He would certainly correct you
rest: if you took his side in secret.

firstLine: “So be quiet and let me speak.
rest: Then I won’t care what happens to me.

firstLine: No matter how things turn out,
rest:
I’m sure I’ll still be saved.
After all, no ungodly person
would dare to come into his court.

firstLine: “God, I won’t hide from you.
rest: Here are the only two things I want.

firstLine: “People waste away like something that is rotten.
rest: They are like clothes that are eaten by moths.

firstLine: “God, why do you keep looking at someone like me?
rest: Are you planning to take me to court?

firstLine: “At least there is hope for a tree.
rest:
If it’s cut down, it will begin to grow again.
New branches will appear on it.

firstLine: “I wish you would hide me in a grave!
rest:
I wish you would cover me up until your anger passes by!
I wish you would set the time for me to spend in the grave
and then bring me back up!

firstLine: “A mountain wears away and crumbles.
rest: A rock is moved from its place.

firstLine: The Second Speech of Eliphaz
rest: Then Eliphaz the Temanite replied,

firstLine: “Job, if you were wise,
rest:
would you answer us with a lot of meaningless talk?
Would you fill your stomach with the hot east wind?

firstLine: “Are you the first man who was ever born?
rest: Were you created before the hills?

firstLine: “Can human beings really be pure?
rest: Can mere men really be right with God?

firstLine: “Listen to me. I’ll explain things to you.
rest: Let me tell you what I’ve seen.

firstLine: They boldly charge against him
rest: with their thick, strong shields.

firstLine: “Their faces are very fat.
rest: Their stomachs hang out.

firstLine: Don’t let them fool themselves
rest:
by trusting in what is worthless.
They won’t get anything out of it.

firstLine: They’ll be like vines
rest:
that are stripped of their unripe grapes.
They’ll be like olive trees
that drop their flowers.

firstLine: Instead of having children,
rest:
ungodly people create suffering.
All they produce is evil.
They are full of lies.”

firstLine: Job’s Reply
rest: Job replied,

firstLine: “I’ve heard many of those things before.
rest: You are terrible at comforting me!

firstLine: If you and I changed places,
rest:
I could say the same things you are saying.
I could make fine speeches against you.
I could shake my head at you.

firstLine: “If I speak, it doesn’t help me.
rest: And if I keep quiet, my pain doesn’t go away.

firstLine: “I’ve sewed black cloth over my skin.
rest: All I can do is sit here in the dust.

firstLine: “Earth, please don’t cover up my blood!
rest: May God always hear my cry for help!

firstLine: My go-between is my friend
rest: as I pour out my tears to God.

firstLine: He makes his appeal to God to help me
rest: as a man begs someone to help his friend.

firstLine: “Only a few years will pass by.
rest: Then I’ll go on a journey I won’t return from.

firstLine: “God, please pay the price to have me set free.
rest: Who else would put up money for me?

firstLine: “God has made everyone laugh at me.
rest: People spit in my face.

firstLine: Those who claim to be honest
rest:
are shocked when they see me.
Those who think they haven’t sinned
are stirred up against me.
They think I’m ungodly.

firstLine: “Come on, all of you! Try again!
rest: I can’t find a wise person among you.

firstLine: Suppose I say to the grave,
rest:
‘You are like a father to me.’
And suppose I say to its worms,
‘You are like a mother or sister to me.’

firstLine: The Second Speech of Bildad
rest: Then Bildad the Shuhite replied,

firstLine: “Job, when will you stop these speeches of yours?
rest: Be reasonable! Then we can talk.

firstLine: “The lamps of sinful people are blown out.
rest: Their flames will never burn again.

firstLine: Job’s Reply
rest: Job replied,

firstLine: “How long will you people make me suffer?
rest: How long will you crush me with your words?

firstLine: “I cry out, ‘Someone harmed me!’
rest:
But I don’t get any reply.
I call out for help.
But I’m not treated fairly.

firstLine: “God has caused my brothers to desert me.
rest: The people I used to know are now strangers to me.

firstLine: “Have pity on me, my friends! Please have pity!
rest: God has struck me down with his powerful hand.

firstLine: “I wish my words were written down!
rest: I wish they were written on a scroll!

firstLine: After my skin has been destroyed,
rest: in my body I’ll still see God.

firstLine: “You might say, ‘Let’s keep bothering Job.
rest: After all, he’s the cause of all of his suffering.’

firstLine: The Second Speech of Zophar
rest: Then Zophar the Naamathite replied,

firstLine: “My troubled thoughts force me to answer you.
rest: That’s because I’m very upset.

firstLine: “I’m sure you must know how things have always been.
rest:
They’ve been that way
ever since man was placed on this earth.

firstLine: But they will disappear forever,
rest:
like the waste from their own bodies.
Anyone who has seen them will say,
‘Where did they go?’

firstLine: “Anything that is evil tastes sweet to them.
rest: They keep it under their tongues for a while.

firstLine: What they worked for they must give back
rest:
before they can eat it.
They won’t enjoy what they have earned.

firstLine: “No matter how much they have,
rest:
they always long for more.
But their treasure can’t save them.

firstLine: While they are enjoying the good life,
rest:
trouble will catch up with them.
Terrible suffering will come on them.

firstLine: When they’ve filled their stomachs,
rest:
God will pour out his burning anger on them.
He’ll strike them down with blow after blow.

firstLine: Job’s Reply
rest: Job replied,

firstLine: “Listen carefully to what I’m saying.
rest: Let that be the comfort you people give me.

firstLine: “I’m not arguing with mere human beings.
rest: So why shouldn’t I be angry and uneasy?

firstLine: “How often are their lamps blown out?
rest:
How often does trouble come on them?
How often does God punish them when he’s angry?

firstLine: “Can anyone teach God anything?
rest: After all, he judges even the angels in heaven.

firstLine: “I know exactly what you people are thinking.
rest: I know you are planning to do bad things to me.

firstLine: You are saying to yourselves,
rest:
‘Where is the great man’s house now?
Where are the tents where his evil family lived?’

firstLine: They’ll tell you that sinful people
rest:
are spared from the day of trouble.
They’ll say that those people
are saved from the day when God will judge.

firstLine: The soil in the valley will be pleasant
rest:
to those who have died.
Many people will walk along behind their bodies.
Many others will walk in front of them.

firstLine: “So how can you comfort me with your speeches?
rest:
They don’t make any sense at all.
Your answers are nothing but lies!”

firstLine: The Third Speech of Eliphaz
rest: Then Eliphaz the Temanite replied,

firstLine: “Can any man be of benefit to God?
rest: Can even a wise man be of any help to him?

firstLine: “You say you have respect for him.
rest:
Is that why he corrects you?
Is that why he brings charges against you?

firstLine: You took clothes away from your relatives
rest:
just because they owed you some money.
You left them naked for no reason at all.

firstLine: “Isn’t God in the highest parts of heaven?
rest: See how high the highest stars are!

firstLine: Will you stay on the old path
rest: that sinful people have walked on?

firstLine: “Those who do what is right are joyful
rest:
when they see sinners destroyed.
Those who haven’t done anything wrong make fun of them.

firstLine: “Job, obey God and be at peace with him.
rest: Then he will help you succeed.

firstLine: If you return to the Mighty One,
rest:
you will have what you had before.
But first you must remove
everything that is evil far from your tent.

firstLine: Job’s Reply
rest: Job replied,

firstLine: “Even today my problems are more than I can handle.
rest: In spite of my groans, God’s hand is heavy on me.

firstLine: “But if I go to the east, God isn’t there.
rest: If I go to the west, I don’t find him.

firstLine: “But he’s the only God. Who can oppose him?
rest: He does anything he wants to do.

firstLine: “Why doesn’t the Mighty One set a time for judging sinful people?
rest: Why do those who know him have to keep waiting for that day?

firstLine: They take away the donkeys
rest:
that belong to children whose fathers have died.
They take a widow’s ox until she has paid what she owes.

firstLine: Children whose fathers have died
rest:
are torn away from their mothers.
A poor person’s baby is taken away to pay back what is owed.

firstLine: “Some people hate it when daylight comes.
rest: In the daytime they never walk outside.

firstLine: “But sinners are like bubbles on the surface of water.
rest:
Their share of the land is under God’s curse.
So no one goes to their vineyards.

firstLine: “Who can prove that what I’m saying is wrong?
rest: Who can prove that my words aren’t true?”

firstLine: The Third Speech of Bildad
rest: Then Bildad the Shuhite replied,

firstLine: “God is King. He should be feared.
rest: He establishes peace in the highest parts of heaven.

firstLine: Even the moon isn’t bright
rest: and the stars aren’t pure in God’s eyes.

firstLine: Job’s Reply
rest: Job replied,

firstLine: “Bildad, you haven’t helped people who aren’t strong!
rest: You haven’t saved people who are weak!

firstLine: “The spirits of the dead are suffering greatly.
rest:
So are those that are under the waters.
And so are all those that live in them.

firstLine: “God hasn’t treated me fairly.
rest:
The Mighty One has made my spirit bitter.
You can be sure that God lives.
And here’s something else you can be sure of.

firstLine: As long as I have life
rest: and God gives me breath,

firstLine: “May my enemies suffer like sinful people!
rest: May my attackers be punished like those who aren’t fair!

firstLine: God won’t listen to their cry
rest: when trouble comes on them.

firstLine: “I’ll teach all of you about God’s power.
rest: I won’t hide the things the Mighty One does.

firstLine: “Here’s what God does to sinful people.
rest: Here’s what those who are mean receive from the Mighty One.

firstLine: Sinners might store up silver like dust
rest: and clothes like piles of clay.

firstLine: “There are mines where silver is found.
rest: There are places where gold is purified.

firstLine: “And where can wisdom be found?
rest: Where does understanding live?

firstLine: “So where does wisdom come from?
rest: Where does understanding live?

firstLine: Death and the Grave say,
rest: ‘Only reports about it have reached our ears.’

firstLine: He said to human beings,
rest:
‘Have respect for me. That will prove you are wise.
Avoid evil. That will show you have understanding.’”

firstLine: “How I long for the good old days!
rest: That’s when God watched over me.

firstLine: “In those days I went to the city gate.
rest: I took my seat as a member of the council.

firstLine: “I thought, ‘I’ll die in my own house.
rest: The days of my life will be as many as the grains of sand.

firstLine: “People wanted to hear what I had to say.
rest: They waited silently for the advice I gave them.

firstLine: “But now those who are younger than I am make fun of me.
rest: I wouldn’t put even their parents with my sheep dogs!

firstLine: “Now their children laugh at me.
rest: They make fun of me with their songs.

firstLine: “Now my life is slipping away.
rest: Days of suffering grab hold of me.

firstLine: “God, I cry out to you. But you don’t answer me.
rest: I stand up. But all you do is look at me.

firstLine: “No one would crush people
rest: when they cry out for help in their trouble.

firstLine: “I made an agreement with my eyes.
rest: I promised not to look at another woman with sexual longing.

firstLine: “I haven’t told any lies.
rest: My feet haven’t hurried to cheat others.

firstLine: “Suppose my heart has been tempted by a woman.
rest: Or suppose I’ve prowled around my neighbor’s door.

firstLine: “Suppose I haven’t treated my male and female servants fairly
rest: when they’ve brought charges against me.

firstLine: “I haven’t said no to what poor people have wanted.
rest: I haven’t let widows lose their hope.

firstLine: Suppose I’ve seen people dying
rest:
because they didn’t have any clothes.
I’ve seen needy people
who had nothing to wear.

firstLine: And they didn’t give me their blessing
rest: when I warmed them with wool from my sheep.

firstLine: Suppose I’ve raised my hand
rest:
against children whose fathers have died.
And I did it because I knew
I had power in the courts.

firstLine: “Suppose I’ve put my trust in gold.
rest: I’ve said to pure gold, ‘You make me feel secure.’

firstLine: “I wasn’t happy when hard times came to my enemies.
rest: I didn’t enjoy seeing the trouble they had.

firstLine: I didn’t allow my mouth to sin
rest: by calling down curses on them.

firstLine: The workers in my house always said,
rest: ‘Job always gives plenty of food to everyone.’

firstLine: “I wish someone would listen to me!
rest:
I’m signing my name to everything I’ve said.
I hope the Mighty One will give me his answer.
I hope the one who brings charges against me will write them down.

firstLine: “Suppose my land cries out against me.
rest: And all of its soil is wet with tears.

firstLine: The Speech of Elihu
rest: So the three men stopped answering Job, because he thought he was right.

firstLine: Elihu the Buzite, the son of Barakel, said,
rest:
“I’m young, and you are old.
So I was afraid to tell you what I know.

firstLine: “So I’m saying you should listen to me.
rest: I’ll tell you what I know.

firstLine: “Job, those men are afraid.
rest:
They don’t have anything else to say.
They’ve run out of words.

firstLine: If I weren’t honest when I praised people,
rest: my Maker would soon take me from this life.

firstLine: “Job, listen now to my words.
rest: Pay attention to everything I say.

firstLine: “But I heard what you said.
rest: And here are the exact words I heard.

firstLine: “But I’m telling you that you aren’t right when you talk like that.
rest: After all, God is greater than a mere man.

firstLine: Why do you claim that God
rest: never answers any of our questions?

firstLine: “But suppose there is an angel who will speak up for him.
rest:
The angel is very special. He’s one out of a thousand.
He will tell that person what is right for him.

firstLine: Then the person comes to others and says,
rest:
‘I sinned. I made what was wrong appear to be right.
But I wasn’t punished as I should have been.

firstLine: “God does all of those things to people.
rest: In fact, he does them again and again.

firstLine: “Pay attention, Job! Listen to me!
rest: Be quiet so I can speak.

firstLine: “Hear what I’m saying, you wise men.
rest: Listen to me, you who have learned so much.

firstLine: “Job says, ‘I’m not guilty of doing anything wrong.
rest: But God doesn’t treat me fairly.

firstLine: Even though I’m right,
rest:
he thinks I’m a liar.
Even though I’m not guilty,
his arrows give me wounds that can’t be healed.’

firstLine: He asks, ‘What good is it
rest: to try to please God?’

firstLine: “So listen to me, you men who have understanding.
rest:
God would never do what is evil.
The Mighty One would never do what is wrong.

firstLine: If he really wanted to,
rest: he could hold back his spirit and breath.

firstLine: “Job, if you have understanding, listen to me.
rest: Pay attention to what I’m saying.

firstLine: “His eyes see how people live.
rest: He watches every step they take.

firstLine: There isn’t a dark place or deep shadow
rest: where those who do what is evil can hide.

firstLine: “Someone might say to God,
rest:
‘I’m guilty of sinning,
but I won’t do it anymore.

firstLine: “You men who have understanding have spoken.
rest: You wise men who hear me have said to me,

firstLine: ‘Job doesn’t know what he’s talking about.
rest: The things he has said don’t make any sense.’

firstLine: “Job, do you think it’s fair for you to say,
rest: ‘God will clear me of all charges’?

firstLine: “I’d like to reply to you
rest: and to your friends who are with you.

firstLine: “People cry out when they are beaten down.
rest: They beg to be set free from the power of those who are over them.

firstLine: “Put up with me a little longer.
rest: I’ll show you I can speak up for God even more.

firstLine: “God is mighty, but he doesn’t hate people.
rest: He’s mighty, and he knows exactly what he’s going to do.

firstLine: If they obey him and serve him,
rest:
they’ll enjoy a long and happy life.
Things will go well with them.

firstLine: But if they don’t listen to him,
rest:
they’ll be killed with swords.
They’ll die because they didn’t want to know anything about him.

firstLine: “Those whose hearts are ungodly are always angry.
rest:
Even when God puts them in chains,
they don’t cry out for help.

firstLine: “Job, he wants to take you out of the jaws of trouble.
rest:
He wants to bring you to a wide and safe place.
He’d like to seat you at a table that is loaded with the best food.

firstLine: But now you are loaded down
rest:
with the punishment sinners will receive.
You have been judged fairly.

firstLine: Don’t long for the night to come
rest: so you can drag people away from their homes.

firstLine: “God is honored because he is so powerful.
rest: He has no equal as a teacher.

firstLine: “He makes mist rise from the water.
rest: Then it falls as rain into the streams.

firstLine: “When I hear the thunder, my heart pounds.
rest: It beats faster inside me.

firstLine: He directs the clouds to circle
rest:
above the surface of the whole earth.
They do everything he commands them to do.

firstLine: “Job, listen to me.
rest: Stop and think about the wonderful things God does.

firstLine: Even your clothes are too hot for you
rest: when the land lies quiet under the south wind.

firstLine: “Job, tell us what we should say to God.
rest:
We can’t prepare our case
because our minds are dark.

firstLine: The First Speech of the Lord
rest: The Lord spoke to Job out of a storm. He said,

firstLine: “Who do you think you are to disagree with my plans?
rest: You do not know what you are talking about.

firstLine: “Where were you when I laid the earth’s foundation?
rest: Tell me, if you know.

firstLine: “Who created the ocean?
rest: Who caused it to be born?

firstLine: “Job, have you ever commanded the morning to come?
rest: Have you ever shown the sun where to rise?

firstLine: The daylight takes the earth by its edges
rest:
as if it were a blanket.
Then it shakes sinful people out of it.

firstLine: “Have you traveled to the springs at the bottom of the ocean?
rest: Have you walked in its deepest parts?

firstLine: “Where does light come from?
rest: And where does darkness live?

firstLine: “Have you entered the places where the snow is kept?
rest: Have you seen the storerooms for the hail?

firstLine: “Can you tie up the beautiful Pleiades?
rest: Can you untie the ropes that hold Orion together?

firstLine: “Can you give orders to the clouds?
rest: Can you make them pour rain down on you?

firstLine: “Do you hunt for food for mother lions?
rest: Do you satisfy the hunger of their cubs?

firstLine: Who provides food for ravens
rest:
when their babies cry out to me?
They wander around because they do not have anything to eat.

firstLine: “Job, do you know when mountain goats have their babies?
rest: Do you watch when female deer give birth?

firstLine: “Who let the wild donkeys go free?
rest: Who untied their ropes?

firstLine: “Job, will wild oxen agree to serve you?
rest: Will they stay by your feed box at night?

firstLine: “The wings of ostriches flap with joy.
rest: But they can’t compare with the wings and feathers of storks.

firstLine: But when they spread their feathers to run,
rest: they laugh at a horse and its rider.

firstLine: “Job, do you give horses their strength?
rest: Do you put flowing manes on their necks?

firstLine: “Job, are you wise enough to teach hawks where to fly?
rest: They spread their wings and fly toward the south.

firstLine: “I am the Mighty One.
rest:
Will the man who argues with me correct me?
Let him who brings charges against me answer me!”

firstLine: Job’s Reply
rest: Job replied to the Lord,

firstLine: “I’m not worthy. How can I reply to you?
rest: I’m putting my hand over my mouth. I’ll stop talking.

firstLine: The Second Speech of the Lord
rest: Then the Lord spoke to Job out of the storm. He said,

firstLine: “Get ready to stand up for yourself.
rest:
I will ask you some more questions.
Then I want you to answer me.

firstLine: “Would you dare to claim that I am not being fair?
rest: Would you judge me in order to make yourself seem right?

firstLine: Then I myself will admit to you
rest: that your own right hand can save you.

firstLine: “Look at the behemoth. It is a huge animal.
rest:
I made both of you.
It eats grass like an ox.

firstLine: “Job, can you pull the leviathan out of the sea with a fish hook?
rest: Can you tie down its tongue with a rope?

firstLine: “Now I will speak about the leviathan’s legs.
rest: I will talk about its strength and its graceful body.

firstLine: Its back has rows of shields
rest: that are close together.

firstLine: Each one is so close to the next one
rest: that not even air can pass between them.

firstLine: When the leviathan rises up,
rest:
even mighty people are terrified.
They run away when it moves around wildly.

firstLine: Job’s Reply
rest: Job replied to the Lord,

firstLine: “I know that you can do anything.
rest: No one can keep you from doing what you plan to do.

firstLine: “You said, ‘Listen now, and I will speak.
rest:
I will ask you some questions.
Then I want you to answer me.’

firstLine: The Story Ends
rest: After the Lord finished speaking to Job, he spoke to Eliphaz the Temanite. He said, “I am angry with you and your two friends. You have not said what is true about me, as my servant Job has.

firstLine: BOOK I
rest:
Psalms 1–41
Psalm 1
Blessed is the one who obeys the law of the Lord.
He doesn’t follow the advice of evil people.
He doesn’t make a habit of doing what sinners do.
He doesn’t join those who make fun of the Lord and his law.

firstLine: Psalm 2
rest:
Why do the nations plan evil together?
Why do they make useless plans?

firstLine: “Let us break free from their chains,” they say.
rest: “Let us throw off their ropes.”

firstLine: He says to them,
rest: “I have placed my king on my holy mountain of Zion.”

firstLine: Psalm 3
rest:
A psalm of David when he ran away from his son Absalom.
Lord, I have so many enemies!
So many people are rising up against me!

firstLine: Many are saying about me,
rest: “God will not save him.” Selah

firstLine: I won’t be afraid of the tens of thousands
rest: who are lined up against me on every side.

firstLine: Psalm 4
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David to be played on stringed instruments.
My faithful God,
answer me when I call out to you.
Give me rest from my trouble.
Show me your favor. Hear my prayer.

firstLine: Psalm 5
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David to be played on flutes.
Lord, listen to my words.
Pay attention when I sigh.

firstLine: My King and my God,
rest:
listen to me when I cry for help.
I pray to you.

firstLine: Because of your great love
rest:
I will come into your house.
With deep respect I will bow down
toward your holy temple.

firstLine: Psalm 6
rest:
For the director of music. For sheminith. A psalm of David to be played on stringed instruments.
Lord, don’t correct me when you are angry.
Don’t punish me when you are burning with anger.

firstLine: Psalm 7
rest:
A shiggaion of David. He sang it to the Lord about Cush, who was from the tribe of Benjamin.
Lord my God, I go to you for safety.
Help me. Save me from all those who are chasing me.

firstLine: If evil people don’t change their ways,
rest:
God will sharpen his sword.
He will get his bow ready to use.

firstLine: Anyone who is full of evil
rest: plans trouble and ends up telling lies.

firstLine: Anyone who digs a hole and shovels it out
rest: falls into the pit he has made.

firstLine: Psalm 8
rest:
For the director of music. For gittith. A psalm of David.
Lord, our Lord,
how majestic is your name in the whole earth!
You have made your glory
higher than the heavens.

firstLine: You have made sure that children
rest:
and infants praise you.
You have done it because of your enemies.
You have done it to put a stop to their talk.

firstLine: They rule over all flocks and herds
rest: and over the wild animals.

firstLine: They rule over the birds of the air
rest:
and over the fish in the ocean.
They rule over everything that swims in the oceans.

firstLine: Lord, our Lord,
rest: how majestic is your name in the whole earth!

firstLine: Psalm 9
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David to the tune of “The Death of the Son.”
Lord, I will praise you with all my heart.
I will tell about all of the miracles you have done.

firstLine: Then I can give praise to you
rest:
at the gates of the city of Zion.
There I will be full of joy
because you have saved me.

firstLine: Psalm 10
rest:
Lord, why are you so far away?
Why do you hide yourself in times of trouble?

firstLine: You stand up for those whose fathers have died
rest:
and for those who have been beaten down.
You do it so that no one made of dust
may terrify others anymore.

firstLine: Psalm 11
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David.
I run to the Lord for safety.
So how can you say to me,
“Fly away like a bird to your mountain.

firstLine: When law and order are being destroyed,
rest: what can godly people do?”

firstLine: He will pour out flaming coals and burning sulfur
rest:
on those who do what is wrong.
A hot and dry wind will destroy them.

firstLine: Psalm 12
rest:
For the director of music. For sheminith. A psalm of David.
Help, Lord! Those who do what is right are gone.
Those who are faithful have disappeared from the earth.

firstLine: Proud and sinful people walk around openly
rest: when the evil they do is praised by others.

firstLine: Psalm 13
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David.
Lord, how long must I wait? Will you forget me forever?
How long will you turn your face away from me?

firstLine: Psalm 14
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David.
Foolish people say in their hearts,
“There is no God.”
They do all kinds of horrible and evil things.
No one does anything good.

firstLine: The Lord looks down from heaven
rest:
on all people.
He wants to see if there are any who understand.
He wants to see if there are any who trust in God.

firstLine: Psalm 15
rest:
A psalm of David.
Lord, who can live in your sacred tent?
Who can stay on your holy hill?

firstLine: Anyone who lives without blame
rest:
and does what is right.
He speaks the truth from his heart.

firstLine: Psalm 16
rest:
A miktam of David.
God, keep me safe.
I go to you for safety.

firstLine: Those who run after other gods
rest:
will have nothing but trouble.
I will not pour out offerings of blood to those gods.
My lips will not speak their names.

firstLine: Psalm 17
rest:
A prayer of David.
Lord, hear me when I ask you to treat me fairly.
Listen to my cry for help.
Hear my prayer.
It doesn’t come from lips that tell lies.

firstLine: Psalm 18
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David, the servant of the Lord. He sang the words of this song to the Lord. He sang them when the Lord saved him from the powerful hand of all of his enemies and of Saul. He said,
I love you, Lord.
You give me strength.

firstLine: You give me a wide path to walk on
rest: so that I don’t twist my ankles.

firstLine: Psalm 19
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David.
The heavens tell about the glory of God.
The skies show that his hands created them.

firstLine: Lord, may the words of my mouth and the thoughts of my heart
rest:
be pleasing in your eyes.
You are my Rock and my Redeemer.

firstLine: Psalm 20
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David.
May the Lord answer you when you are in trouble.
May the God of Jacob keep you safe.

firstLine: Psalm 21
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David.
Lord, the king is filled with joy because you are strong.
How great is his joy because you help him win his battles!

firstLine: When you appear,
rest:
you will be like a flaming furnace to them.
The Lord will swallow them up in his anger.
His fire will burn them up.

firstLine: You will make them turn their backs and run away
rest: when you aim your arrows at them.

firstLine: Psalm 22
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David to the tune of “The Doe of the Morning.”
My God, my God, why have you deserted me?
Why do you seem to be so far away when I need you to save me?
Why do you seem to be so far away that you can’t hear my groans?

firstLine: Because of what you have done,
rest:
I will praise you in the whole community of those who worship you.
In front of those who respect you,
I will keep my promises.

firstLine: People from one end of the earth to the other
rest:
will remember and turn to the Lord.
The people of all the nations
will bow down before him.

firstLine: And they will tell people who have not yet been born
rest: that he has done what is right.

firstLine: Psalm 23
rest:
A psalm of David.
The Lord is my shepherd. He gives me everything I need.

firstLine: Even though I walk
rest:
through the darkest valley,
I will not be afraid.
You are with me.
Your shepherd’s rod and staff
comfort me.

firstLine: You prepare a feast for me
rest:
right in front of my enemies.
You pour oil on my head.
My cup runs over.

firstLine: I am sure that your goodness and love will follow me
rest:
all the days of my life.
And I will live in the house of the Lord
forever.

firstLine: Psalm 24
rest:
A psalm of David.
The earth belongs to the Lord. And so does everything in it.
The world belongs to him. And so do all those who live in it.

firstLine: Psalm 25
rest:
A psalm of David.
Lord, I worship you.

firstLine: Those who put their hope in you
rest:
will never be put to shame.
But those who can’t be trusted
will be put to shame. They have no excuse.

firstLine: All of the Lord’s ways are loving and faithful
rest: for those who obey what his covenant commands.

firstLine: God, set Israel free
rest: from all of their troubles!

firstLine: Psalm 26
rest:
A psalm of David.
Lord, when you hand down your sentence, let it be in my favor.
I have lived without blame.
I have trusted in the Lord.
I have never doubted him.

firstLine: Psalm 27
rest:
A psalm of David.
The Lord gives me light and saves me.
Why should I fear anyone?
The Lord is my place of safety.
Why should I be afraid?

firstLine: Even if an army attacks me,
rest:
my heart will not be afraid.
Even if war breaks out against me,
I will still trust in God.

firstLine: When I’m in trouble,
rest:
he will keep me safe in his house.
He will hide me in the safety of his holy tent.
He will put me on a rock that is very high.

firstLine: Then I will win the battle
rest:
over my enemies who are all around me.
At his holy tent I will offer my sacrifice with shouts of joy.
I will sing and make music to the Lord.

firstLine: My father and mother may desert me,
rest: but the Lord will accept me.

firstLine: Psalm 28
rest:
A psalm of David.
Lord, my Rock, I call out to you.
Pay attention to me.
If you remain silent, I will die.
I will be like those who have gone down into the grave.

firstLine: Hear my cry for your favor
rest:
when I call out to you for help.
Hear me when I lift up my hands in prayer
toward your Most Holy Room.

firstLine: Psalm 29
rest:
A psalm of David.
Praise the Lord, you mighty angels.
Praise the Lord for his glory and strength.

firstLine: The voice of the Lord strikes
rest: with flashes of lightning.

firstLine: Psalm 30
rest:
A psalm of David. A song for committing the completed temple to God.
Lord, I will give you honor.
You brought me out of deep trouble.
You didn’t give my enemies the joy of seeing me die.

firstLine: When I felt safe, I said,
rest: “I will always be secure.”

firstLine: Lord, when you showed me your favor,
rest:
you made my mountain stand firm.
But when you turned your face away from me,
I was terrified.

firstLine: Psalm 31
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David.
Lord, I have gone to you for safety.
Don’t let me ever be put to shame.
Save me, because you do what is right.

firstLine: My neighbors make fun of me
rest:
because I have so many enemies.
My friends are afraid of me.
Those who see me on the street run away from me.

firstLine: I was afraid and said,
rest:
“I’ve been cut off from you!”
But you heard my cry for your favor.
You heard me when I called out to you for help.

firstLine: Psalm 32
rest:
A maskil of David.
Blessed is the one whose lawless acts are forgiven.
His sins have been taken away.

firstLine: When I kept silent about my sin,
rest:
my body became weak
because I groaned all day long.

firstLine: Day and night
rest:
your heavy hand punished me.
I became weaker and weaker
as I do in the heat of summer. Selah

firstLine: Let everyone who is godly pray to you
rest:
while they can still look to you.
When troubles come like a flood,
they certainly won’t reach those who are godly.

firstLine: Psalm 33
rest:
You who are godly, sing with joy to the Lord.
It is right for honest people to praise him.

firstLine: From heaven the Lord looks down
rest: and sees everyone.

firstLine: From his throne he watches
rest: all those who live on the earth.

firstLine: Psalm 34
rest:
A psalm of David when he was in front of Abimelech and pretended to be out of his mind. Abimelech drove him away, and he left.
I will thank the Lord at all times.
My lips will always praise him.

firstLine: The angel of the Lord stands guard
rest:
around those who have respect for him.
And he saves them.

firstLine: Do you love life
rest: and want to see many good days?

firstLine: Psalm 35
rest:
A psalm of David.
Lord, stand up against those who stand up against me.
Fight against those who fight against me.

firstLine: Get your spear and javelin ready to fight
rest:
against those who are chasing me.
Say to me, “I will save you.”

firstLine: Let those who are trying to kill me
rest:
be brought down in dishonor.
Let those who plan to destroy me
be turned back in terror.

firstLine: Let them be like straw blowing in the wind,
rest: while the angel of the Lord drives them away.

firstLine: Let their path be dark and slippery,
rest: while the angel of the Lord chases them.

firstLine: My whole being will cry out,
rest:
“Who is like you, Lord?
You save poor people from those who are too strong for them.
You save poor and needy people from those who rob them.”

firstLine: So I went around crying
rest:
as if I were crying over my friend or relative.
I bowed my head in sadness
as if I were sobbing over my mother.

firstLine: Don’t let those who are my enemies without any reason
rest:
laugh at me and make fun of me.
Don’t let those who hate me without any reason
wink at me with an evil purpose.

firstLine: Let all those who laugh at me because I’m in trouble
rest:
be ashamed and bewildered.
Let all who think they are better than I am
put on shame and dishonor as if they were clothes.

firstLine: Let those who are happy when my name is cleared
rest:
shout with joy and gladness.
Let them always say, “May the Lord be honored.
He is pleased when everything goes well with the one who serves him.”

firstLine: Psalm 36
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David, the servant of the Lord.
Here are the words God has given me to say
about the evil ways of anyone who sins.
He doesn’t have any respect for God.

firstLine: He praises himself so much
rest: that he can’t see his sin or hate it.

firstLine: Psalm 37
rest:
A psalm of David.
Don’t be upset because of sinful people.
Don’t be jealous of those who do wrong.

firstLine: If the Lord is pleased with the way a man lives,
rest: he makes his steps secure.

firstLine: Psalm 38
rest:
A psalm of David. A prayer.
Lord, don’t correct me when you are angry.
Don’t punish me when you are burning with anger.

firstLine: Lord my Savior,
rest: come quickly to help me.

firstLine: Psalm 39
rest:
For the director of music. For Jeduthun. A psalm of David.
I said, “I will be careful about how I live.
I will not sin by what I say.
I will keep my mouth closed
when sinful people are near me.”

firstLine: “Lord, what can I look forward to now?
rest: You are the only hope I have.

firstLine: “Lord, hear my prayer.
rest:
Listen to my cry for help.
Pay attention to my sobbing.
I’m like a guest in your home.
I’m only a visitor, like all of my family who lived before me.

firstLine: Psalm 40
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David.
I was patient while I waited for the Lord.
He turned to me and heard my cry for help.

firstLine: Blessed is the man
rest:
who trusts in the Lord.
He doesn’t look to proud people for help.
He doesn’t turn away to worship statues of gods.

firstLine: Lord my God,
rest:
no one can compare with you.
You have done many miracles.
And you plan to do many more for us.
There are too many of them
for me to talk about.

firstLine: I have told the whole community of those who worship you
rest:
that what you do is right.
Lord, you know
that I haven’t kept quiet.

firstLine: But let all those who look to you
rest:
be joyful and glad because of what you have done.
Let those who love you because you save them always say,
“May the Lord be honored!”

firstLine: Psalm 41
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David.
Blessed is the one who cares about weak people.
When he is in trouble, the Lord saves him.

firstLine: When anyone comes to see me,
rest:
he says things he doesn’t mean.
At the same time, he thinks up lies to tell against me.
Then he goes out and spreads those lies around.

firstLine: Then I will know that you are pleased with me,
rest: because my enemies haven’t won the battle over me.

firstLine: Give praise to the Lord, the God of Israel,
rest:
for ever and ever.
Amen and Amen.

firstLine: BOOK II
rest:
Psalms 42–72
Psalm 42
For the director of music. A maskil of the Sons of Korah.
A deer longs for streams of water.
God, I long for you in the same way.

firstLine: My tears have been my food
rest:
day and night.
All day long people say to me,
“Where is your God?”

firstLine: When I remember what has happened,
rest:
I tell God all of my troubles.
I remember how I used to walk along with the crowd of worshipers.
I led them to the house of God.
We shouted with joy and gave thanks
as we went to the holy feast.

firstLine: I say to God my Rock,
rest:
“Why have you forgotten me?
Why must I go around in sorrow?
Why am I beaten down by my enemies?”

firstLine: My body suffers deadly pain
rest:
as my enemies make fun of me.
All day long they say to me,
“Where is your God?”

firstLine: Psalm 43
rest:
God, when you hand down your decision, let it be in my favor.
Stand up for me against an ungodly nation.
Save me from those lying and sinful people.

firstLine: Psalm 44
rest:
For the director of music. A maskil of the Sons of Korah.
God, we have heard what you did.
Those who came before us have told us
what you did in their days,
in days long ago.

firstLine: All of this happened to us,
rest:
even though we had not forgotten you.
We had been true to the covenant you made with us.

firstLine: Psalm 45
rest:
For the director of music. A maskil of the Sons of Korah. A wedding song to the tune of “Lilies.”
My heart is full of beautiful words
as I say my poem for the king.
My tongue is like the pen of a skillful writer.

firstLine: In your majesty ride out with power
rest:
in honor of what is true and right.
Do it in honor of all those who are not proud.
Let your right hand do wonderful things.

firstLine: Psalm 46
rest:
For the director of music. A song of the Sons of Korah. For alamoth.
God is our place of safety. He gives us strength.
He is always there to help us in times of trouble.

firstLine: Psalm 47
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of the Sons of Korah.
Clap your hands, all you nations.
Shout to God with cries of joy.

firstLine: Psalm 48
rest:
A song. A psalm of the Sons of Korah.
The Lord is great. He is really worthy of praise.
Praise him in the city of our God, his holy mountain.

firstLine: Lord, you destroyed them like ships of Tarshish
rest: that were torn apart by an east wind.

firstLine: God, inside your temple
rest: we think about your faithful love.

firstLine: Psalm 49
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of the Sons of Korah.
Hear this, all you nations.
Listen, all you who live in this world.

firstLine: No one can pay enough to live forever
rest: and not rot in the grave.

firstLine: People who have riches but don’t understand
rest: are like the animals. They die.

firstLine: Psalm 50
rest:
A psalm of Asaph.
The Mighty One, God, the Lord, speaks.
He calls out to the earth
from the sunrise in the east
to the sunset in the west.

firstLine: From Zion, perfect and beautiful,
rest: God’s glory shines out.

firstLine: “You who forget God, think about this.
rest:
If you don’t, I will tear you to pieces.
No one will be able to save you.

firstLine: Psalm 51
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David when the prophet Nathan came to him after David had committed adultery with Bathsheba.
God, show me your favor
in keeping with your faithful love.
Because your love is so tender and kind,
wipe out my lawless acts.

firstLine: Psalm 52
rest:
For the director of music. A maskil of David when Doeg, who was from Edom, had gone to Saul. Doeg had told Saul, “David has gone to the house of Ahimelech.”
You think you are such a big, strong man!
Why do you brag about the evil things you’ve done?
You are a dishonor to God all the time.

firstLine: “Just look at this fellow!
rest:
He didn’t depend on God for his safety.
He put his trust in all his wealth.
He grew strong by destroying others!”

firstLine: Psalm 53
rest:
For the director of music. For mahalath. A maskil of David.
Foolish people say in their hearts,
“There is no God.”
They do all kinds of horrible and evil things.
No one does anything good.

firstLine: God looks down from heaven
rest:
on all people.
He wants to see if there are any who understand.
He wants to see if there are any who trust in God.

firstLine: Psalm 54
rest:
For the director of music. To be played on stringed instruments. A maskil of David when the men from Ziph had gone to Saul. They had said, “Isn’t David hiding among us?”
God, save me by your power.
Set me free by your might.

firstLine: I will sacrifice an offering to you
rest:
just because I choose to.
Lord, I will praise your name
because it is good.

firstLine: Psalm 55
rest:
For the director of music. A maskil of David to be played on stringed instruments.
God, listen to my prayer.
Pay attention to my cry for help.

firstLine: If an enemy were making fun of me,
rest:
I could stand it.
If he were looking down on me,
I could hide from him.

firstLine: We used to enjoy good friendship
rest: as we walked with the crowds at the house of God.

firstLine: Evening, morning and noon
rest:
I groan and cry out.
And he hears my voice.

firstLine: Even though many enemies are fighting against me,
rest: he brings me safely back from the battle.

firstLine: God, you will bring sinners
rest:
down to the grave.
Murderers and liars
won’t live out even half of their lives.
But I trust in you.

firstLine: Psalm 56
rest:
For the director of music. A miktam of David after the Philistines had captured him in Gath. To the tune of “A Dove on Distant Oak Trees.”
God, show me your favor. Men are chasing me.
All day long they keep attacking me.

firstLine: When I’m afraid,
rest: I will trust in you.

firstLine: My enemies will turn back
rest:
when I call out to you for help.
Then I will know that God is on my side.

firstLine: Psalm 57
rest:
For the director of music. A miktam of David when he had run away from Saul into the cave. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.”
Show me your favor, God. Show me your favor.
I go to you for safety.
I will find safety in the shadow of your wings.
There I will stay until the danger is gone.

firstLine: Psalm 58
rest:
For the director of music. A miktam of David to the tune of “Do Not Destroy.”
Are you rulers really fair when you speak?
Do you judge people honestly?

firstLine: It won’t listen to any tune of a snake charmer,
rest: even if the charmer really plays well.

firstLine: Then people will say,
rest:
“The godly will get their reward.
There really is a God who judges the earth.”

firstLine: Psalm 59
rest:
For the director of music. A miktam of David when Saul had sent men to watch David’s house in order to kill him. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.”
God, save me from my enemies.
Keep me safe from those who rise up against me.

firstLine: My enemies are like a pack of barking dogs
rest:
that come back to the city in the evening.
They prowl around the city.

firstLine: My enemies are like a pack of barking dogs
rest:
that come back into the city in the evening.
They prowl around the city.

firstLine: Psalm 60
rest:
