For the director of music. For teaching. A miktam of David when he fought against Aram Naharaim and Aram Zobah. That was when Joab returned and struck down 12,000 people from Edom in the Valley of Salt. To the tune of “The Lily of the Covenant.”
God, you have turned away from us. You have attacked us.
You have been angry. Now turn back to us!

firstLine: Psalm 61
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David to be played on stringed instruments.
God, hear my cry for help.
Listen to my prayer.

firstLine: Psalm 62
rest:
For the director of music. For Jeduthun. A psalm of David.
I find my rest in God alone.
He is the One who saves me.

firstLine: You only want to pull me down
rest:
from my place of honor.
You take delight in telling lies.
You bless me with what you say.
But in your hearts you call down curses on me. Selah

firstLine: Psalm 63
rest:
A psalm of David when he was in the Desert of Judah.
God, you are my God.
I greatly long for you.
With all my heart I thirst for you
in this dry desert
where there isn’t any water.

firstLine: Because you have helped me,
rest: I sing in the shadow of your wings.

firstLine: Psalm 64
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David.
God, hear me as I tell you my problem.
Don’t let my enemies kill me.

firstLine: Psalm 65
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David. A song.
God, we look forward to praising you in Zion.
We will keep our promises to you.

firstLine: All people will come to you,
rest: because you hear and answer prayer.

firstLine: When our sins became too much for us,
rest: you forgave our lawless acts.

firstLine: Blessed are those you choose
rest:
and bring near to worship you.
You bring us into the courtyards of your holy temple.
There in your house we are filled with all kinds of good things.

firstLine: Psalm 66
rest:
For the director of music. A song. A psalm.
Shout to God with joy, everyone on earth!

firstLine: If I had enjoyed having sin in my heart,
rest: the Lord would not have listened.

firstLine: Psalm 67
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm. A song to be played on stringed instruments.
God, show us your favor. Bless us.
May you smile on us with your favor. Selah

firstLine: Psalm 68
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David. A song.
May God rise up and scatter his enemies.
May they turn and run away from him.

firstLine: As wind blows smoke away,
rest:
so may God blow them away.
As fire melts wax,
so may he destroy sinful people.

firstLine: But may those who do what is right be glad
rest:
and filled with joy when they are with him.
May they be happy and joyful.

firstLine: The ground shook
rest:
when you, the God of Sinai, appeared.
The heavens poured down rain
when you, the God of Israel, appeared.

firstLine: Even while the soldiers sleep near the campfires,
rest:
God wins the battle for them.
He gives the enemy’s silver and gold
to Israel, his dove.”

firstLine: When he went up to his place on high,
rest:
he led a line of prisoners.
He received gifts from people,
even from those who refused to obey him.
The Lord God went up to live on Mount Zion.

firstLine: Do it from your temple at Jerusalem,
rest: where kings will bring you gifts.

firstLine: Psalm 69
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David to the tune of “Lilies.”
God, save me.
My troubles are like a flood.
I’m up to my neck in them.

firstLine: Those who hate me without any reason
rest:
are more than the hairs on my head.
Many people who don’t have any reason to be my enemies
are trying to destroy me.
They force me to give back
what I didn’t steal.

firstLine: When I sob and go without eating,
rest: they laugh at me.

firstLine: When I put on black clothes to show how sad I am,
rest: people make jokes about me.

firstLine: Psalm 70
rest:
For the director of music. A prayer of David.
God, hurry and save me.
Lord, come quickly and help me.

firstLine: But let all those who look to you
rest:
be joyful and glad because of what you have done.
Let those who love you because you save them always say,
“May God be honored!”

firstLine: Psalm 71
rest:
Lord, I have gone to you for safety.
Let me never be put to shame.

firstLine: Be my rock of safety
rest:
that I can always go to.
Give the command to save me.
You are my rock and my fort.

firstLine: God, don’t leave me
rest:
even when I’m old and have gray hair.
Let me live to tell my children about your power.
Let me tell all of them about your mighty acts.

firstLine: My God, I will use the harp to praise you
rest:
because you are always faithful.
Holy One of Israel,
I will use the lyre to sing praise to you.

firstLine: My lips will shout with joy
rest:
when I sing praise to you.
You have saved me.

firstLine: All day long my tongue will say
rest:
that you have done what is right.
Those who wanted to harm me have been put to shame.
They have not been honored.

firstLine: Psalm 72
rest:
A psalm of Solomon.
God, give the king the ability to judge fairly.
He is your royal son. Help him to do what is right.

firstLine: The mountains and the hills will produce rich crops,
rest: because the people will do what is right.

firstLine: He will rule as long as the sun shines
rest:
and the moon gives its light.
He will rule for all time to come.

firstLine: The kings of Tarshish and of places far away
rest:
will bring him gifts.
The kings of Sheba and Seba
will give him presents.

firstLine: BOOK III
rest:
Psalms 73–89
Psalm 73
A psalm of Asaph.
God is truly good to Israel.
He is good to those who have pure hearts.

firstLine: At one time my heart was sad
rest: and my spirit was bitter.

firstLine: Psalm 74
rest:
A maskil of Asaph.
God, why have you turned your back on us for so long?
Why does your anger burn against us? We are your very own sheep.

firstLine: In the place where you used to meet with us,
rest:
your enemies have shouted, “We’ve won the battle!”
They have set up their flags to show they have beaten us.

firstLine: They smashed all of the beautiful wooden walls
rest: with their axes and hatchets.

firstLine: Psalm 75
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of Asaph. A song to the tune of “Do Not Destroy.”
God, we give thanks to you.
We give thanks because your Name is near.
People talk about the wonderful things you have done.

firstLine: When the earth and all of its people tremble,
rest: I keep everything from falling to pieces. Selah

firstLine: No one from east or west or north or south
rest: can act as judge.

firstLine: Psalm 76
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of Asaph. A song to be played on stringed instruments.
In the land of Judah, God is known.
His name is great in Israel.

firstLine: God of Jacob, at your command
rest: both horse and chariot lie still.

firstLine: Psalm 77
rest:
For the director of music. For Jeduthun. A psalm of Asaph.
I cried out to God for help.
I cried out to God to hear me.

firstLine: “Will the Lord turn away from us forever?
rest: Won’t he ever show us his kindness again?

firstLine: Psalm 78
rest:
A maskil of Asaph.
My people, listen to my teaching.
Pay attention to what I say.

firstLine: Like their people who lived before them,
rest:
they turned away from him and were not faithful.
They were like a bow that doesn’t shoot straight.
They couldn’t be trusted.

firstLine: He brought him from tending sheep
rest:
to be the shepherd of his people Jacob.
He made him the shepherd of Israel, his special people.

firstLine: Psalm 79
rest:
A psalm of Asaph.
God, an army from the nations has attacked your land.
They have polluted your holy temple.
They have completely destroyed Jerusalem.

firstLine: They have given the dead bodies of your people
rest:
as food to the birds of the air.
They have given the bodies of your faithful people
to the animals of the earth.

firstLine: They have poured out the blood of your people like water
rest:
all around Jerusalem.
No one is left to bury the dead.

firstLine: Pour out your burning anger on the nations
rest:
that don’t pay any attention to you.
Pour it out on the kingdoms
that don’t worship you.

firstLine: Why should the nations say,
rest:
“Where is their God?”
Show the nations that you punish those who kill your people.
We want to see it happen.

firstLine: Psalm 80
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of Asaph to the tune of “The Lilies of the Covenant.”
Shepherd of Israel, hear us.
You lead the people of Joseph like a flock.
You sit on your throne between the cherubim.
Show your glory

firstLine: Lord God who rules over all,
rest:
how long will your anger burn
against the prayers of your people?

firstLine: Psalm 81
rest:
For the director of music. For gittith. A psalm of Asaph.
Sing joyfully to God! He gives us strength.
Give a loud shout to the God of Jacob!

firstLine: He gave it as a covenant law for the people of Joseph
rest:
when God went out to punish Egypt.
There we heard a language we didn’t understand.

firstLine: “My people, listen and I will warn you.
rest: Israel, I wish you would listen to me!

firstLine: “But my people wouldn’t listen to me.
rest: Israel wouldn’t obey me.

firstLine: “I wish my people would listen to me!
rest: I wish Israel would live as I want them to live!

firstLine: Psalm 82
rest:
A psalm of Asaph.
God takes his place at the head of a large gathering of rulers and judges.
He announces his decisions among them.

firstLine: “You rulers and judges don’t know anything.
rest:
You don’t understand anything.
You are in the dark about what is right.
Law and order have been destroyed all over the world.

firstLine: “I said, ‘Rulers and judges, you are “gods.”
rest: You are all children of the Most High God.’

firstLine: Psalm 83
rest:
A song. A psalm of Asaph.
God, don’t keep silent.
God, don’t keep quiet. Don’t be still.

firstLine: “Come,” they say. “Let’s destroy that whole nation.
rest: Then the name of Israel won’t be remembered anymore.”

firstLine: Their forces include the people of Edom,
rest: Ishmael, Moab and Hagar.

firstLine: They also include the people of Byblos, Ammon, Amalek,
rest: Philistia and Tyre.

firstLine: Even Assyria has joined them
rest: to give strength to the people of Moab and Ammon. Selah

firstLine: They said, “Let’s take over
rest: the grasslands that belong to God.”

firstLine: Lord, put them to shame
rest: so that people will worship you.

firstLine: Psalm 84
rest:
For the director of music. For gittith. A psalm of the Sons of Korah.
Lord who rules over all,
how lovely is the place where you live!

firstLine: Lord who rules over all,
rest:
even the sparrow has found a home near your altar.
My King and my God,
the swallow also has a nest there,
where she may have her young.

firstLine: As they pass through the dry Valley of Baca,
rest:
they make it a place where water flows.
The rain in the fall covers it with pools.

firstLine: Those people get stronger as they go along,
rest: until each of them appears in Zion, where God lives.

firstLine: A single day in your courtyards is better
rest:
than a thousand anywhere else.
I would rather guard the door of the house of my God
than live in the tents of sinful people.

firstLine: Lord who rules over all,
rest: blessed is everyone who trusts in you.

firstLine: Psalm 85
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of the Sons of Korah.
Lord, you showed favor to your land.
You blessed the people of Jacob with great success again.

firstLine: Psalm 86
rest:
A prayer of David.
Lord, hear me and answer me.
I am poor and needy.

firstLine: Lord, all of the nations you have made
rest:
will come and worship you.
They will bring glory to you.

firstLine: Psalm 87
rest:
A psalm of the Sons of Korah. A song.
The Lord has built his city
on the holy mountain.

firstLine: He loves the city of Zion
rest:
more than all of the other places
where the people of Jacob live.

firstLine: City of God,
rest: the Lord says glorious things about you. Selah

firstLine: He says, “I will include Egypt and Babylon
rest:
in a list of those who recognize me as king.
I will also include Philistia and Tyre, along with Cush.
I will say about them, ‘They were born in Zion.’”

firstLine: Certainly it will be said about Zion,
rest:
“This nation and that nation were born in her.
The Most High God himself will make her secure.”

firstLine: As they make music they will sing,
rest: “Zion, all of our blessings come from you.”

firstLine: Psalm 88
rest:
For the director of music. For mahalath leannoth. A song. A psalm of the Sons of Korah. A maskil of Heman the Ezrahite.
Lord, you are the God who saves me.
Day and night I cry out to you.

firstLine: I have so many troubles
rest: I’m about to die.

firstLine: It seems as if you have put me deep down in the grave,
rest: that deep and dark place.

firstLine: Psalm 89
rest:
A maskil of Ethan the Ezrahite.
Lord, I will sing about your great love forever.
For all time to come, I will tell how faithful you are.

firstLine: ‘I will make your family line continue forever.
rest: I will make your kingdom secure for all time to come.’” Selah

firstLine: “What if his sons turn away from my laws
rest: and do not follow them?

firstLine: What if they disobey my orders
rest: and fail to keep my commands?

firstLine: It will last forever like the moon,
rest: that faithful witness in the sky.” Selah

firstLine: BOOK IV
rest:
Psalms 90–106
Psalm 90
A prayer of Moses, the man of God.
Lord, from the very beginning
you have been like a home to us.

firstLine: Before you created the world and the mountains were made,
rest: from the beginning to the end you are God.

firstLine: To you a thousand years
rest:
are like a day that has just gone by.
They are like a few hours of the night.

firstLine: In the morning it springs up new,
rest: but by evening it’s all dried up.

firstLine: Psalm 91
rest:
The person who rests in the shadow of the Most High God
will be kept safe by the Mighty One.

firstLine: I will say about the Lord,
rest:
“He is my place of safety.
He is like a fort to me.
He is my God. I trust in him.”

firstLine: He will certainly save you from hidden traps
rest: and from deadly sickness.

firstLine: You will see with your own eyes
rest: how God punishes sinful people.

firstLine: The Lord will command his angels
rest: to take good care of you.

firstLine: Psalm 92
rest:
A psalm. A song for the Sabbath day.
Lord, it is good to praise you.
Most High God, it is good to make music to honor you.

firstLine: Psalm 93
rest:
The Lord rules.
He puts on majesty as if it were clothes.
The Lord puts on majesty and strength.
The world is firmly set in place.
It can’t be moved.

firstLine: Psalm 94
rest:
Lord, you are the God who punishes.
Since you are the one who punishes, come and show your anger.

firstLine: You give him rest from times of trouble,
rest: until a pit is dug to trap sinners.

firstLine: Psalm 95
rest:
Come, let us sing with joy to the Lord.
Let us give a loud shout to the Rock who saves us.

firstLine: Psalm 96
rest:
Sing a new song to the Lord.
All you people of the earth, sing to the Lord.

firstLine: They will sing to the Lord,
rest:
because he is coming to judge the earth.
He will judge the people of the world
in keeping with what is right and true.

firstLine: Psalm 97
rest:
The Lord rules. Let the earth be glad.
Let countries that are far away be full of joy.

firstLine: Psalm 98
rest:
A psalm.
Sing a new song to the Lord.
He has done wonderful things.
By the power of his right hand and his holy arm
he has saved his people.

firstLine: He has shown his faithful love
rest:
to the people of Israel.
People from one end of the earth to the other
have seen that our God has saved us.

firstLine: Let them sing to the Lord,
rest:
because he is coming to judge the earth.
He will judge the nations of the world
in keeping with what is right and fair.

firstLine: Psalm 99
rest:
The Lord rules.
Let the nations tremble.
He sits on his throne between the cherubim.
Let the earth shake.

firstLine: Psalm 100
rest:
A psalm for giving thanks.
Shout to the Lord with joy, everyone on earth.

firstLine: Psalm 101
rest:
A psalm of David.
I will sing about your love and fairness.
Lord, I will sing praise to you.

firstLine: I will be careful to lead a life
rest:
that is without blame.
When will you come and help me?
I will lead a life
that is without blame in my house.

firstLine: I will get rid of anyone
rest:
who tells lies about his neighbor in secret.
I won’t put up with anyone
whose eyes and heart are proud.

firstLine: No one who lies and cheats
rest:
will live in my house.
No one who tells lies
will serve me.

firstLine: Every morning I will get rid of
rest:
all the sinful people in the land.
I will remove from the city of the Lord
everyone who does what is evil.

firstLine: Psalm 102
rest:
A prayer of a suffering man when he is weak and pours out his problems to the Lord.
Lord, hear my prayer.
Listen to my cry for help.

firstLine: Don’t turn your face away from me
rest:
when I’m in trouble.
Pay attention to me.
When I call out for help, answer me quickly.

firstLine: Nations and kingdoms
rest: will gather there to worship the Lord.

firstLine: Psalm 103
rest:
A psalm of David.
I will praise the Lord.
Deep down inside me, I will praise him.
I will praise him, because his name is holy.

firstLine: The Lord does what is right and fair
rest: for all who are beaten down.

firstLine: His love for those who have respect for him
rest: is as high as the heavens are above the earth.

firstLine: He has removed our lawless acts from us
rest: as far as the east is from the west.

firstLine: But the Lord’s love
rest:
for those who have respect for him
lasts for ever and ever.
Their children’s children will know
that he always does what is right.

firstLine: Let everything the Lord has made praise him
rest:
everywhere in his kingdom.
I will praise the Lord.

firstLine: Psalm 104
rest:
I will praise the Lord.
Lord my God, you are very great.
You are dressed in glory and majesty.

firstLine: You make grass grow for the cattle
rest:
and plants for people to take care of.
That’s how they get food from the earth.

firstLine: All of those creatures depend on you
rest: to give them their food when they need it.

firstLine: When you give it to them,
rest:
they eat it.
When you open your hand,
they are satisfied with good things.

firstLine: When you turn your face away from them,
rest:
they are terrified.
When you take away their breath,
they die and turn back into dust.

firstLine: When you send your Spirit,
rest:
you create them.
You give new life to the earth.

firstLine: Psalm 105
rest:
Give thanks to the Lord. Worship him.
Tell the nations what he has done.

firstLine: The Lord gave his people so many children
rest: that there were too many of them for their enemies.

firstLine: He remembered the holy promise
rest: he had made to his servant Abraham.

firstLine: His chosen people shouted for joy
rest: as he brought them out of Egypt.

firstLine: He did it so they might obey his rules
rest:
and follow his laws.
Praise the Lord.

firstLine: Psalm 106
rest:
Praise the Lord.
Give thanks to the Lord, because he is good.
His faithful love continues forever.

firstLine: When our people were in Egypt,
rest:
they forgot about the Lord’s miracles.
They didn’t remember his many kind acts.
At the Red Sea they refused to obey him.

firstLine: Then his people believed his promises
rest: and sang praise to him.

firstLine: They traded their glorious God
rest: for a statue of a bull that eats grass.

firstLine: So he lifted up his hand and promised with an oath
rest: that he would make them die in the desert.

firstLine: They didn’t destroy the nations in Canaan
rest: as the Lord had commanded them.

firstLine: Instead, they mixed with those nations
rest: and adopted their ways.

firstLine: They sacrificed their sons and daughters
rest: as offerings to demons.

firstLine: They beat them down
rest: and kept them under their power.

firstLine: He made all those who held them as prisoners
rest: show concern for them.

firstLine: Give praise to the Lord, the God of Israel,
rest:
for ever and ever.
Let all of the people say, “Amen!”
Praise the Lord.

firstLine: BOOK V
rest:
Psalms 107–150
Psalm 107
Give thanks to the Lord, because he is good.
His faithful love continues forever.

firstLine: He led them straight
rest: to a city where they could settle down.

firstLine: They planted fields and vineyards
rest: that produced large crops.

firstLine: The One who looks down on proud nobles
rest: made them wander in a desert where no one lives.

firstLine: Psalm 108
rest:
A song. A psalm of David.
God, my heart feels secure.
I will sing and make music to you with all my heart.

firstLine: Psalm 109
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David.
God, I praise you.
Don’t remain silent.

firstLine: They bring charges against me,
rest:
even though I love them
and pray for them.

firstLine: May no one be kind to them
rest: or take pity on the children they leave behind.

firstLine: May that be the Lord’s way of paying back
rest:
those who bring charges against me.
May it happen to those who say
evil things about me.

firstLine: But Lord and King,
rest:
be true to your name. Treat me well.
Because your love is so good, save me.

firstLine: Psalm 110
rest:
A psalm of David.
The Lord says to my Lord,
“Sit at my right hand
until I put your enemies
under your control.”

firstLine: Your troops will be willing to fight for you
rest:
on the day of battle.
You will be wrapped in holy majesty.
Just as the dew falls fresh early in the morning,
you will always be young and strong.

firstLine: Psalm 111
rest:
Praise the Lord.
I will praise the Lord with all my heart.
I will praise him where honest people gather for worship.

firstLine: If you really want to become wise,
rest:
you must begin by having respect for the Lord.
All those who follow his rules have good understanding.
People should praise him forever.

firstLine: Psalm 112
rest:
Praise the Lord.
Blessed is the one who has respect for the Lord.
He finds great delight when he obeys God’s commands.

firstLine: Psalm 113
rest:
Praise the Lord.
Praise him, you who serve the Lord.
Praise the name of the Lord.

firstLine: Let us praise the name of the Lord,
rest: both now and forever.

firstLine: From the sunrise in the east to the sunset in the west,
rest: may the name of the Lord be praised.

firstLine: He bends down to look
rest: at the heavens and the earth.

firstLine: Psalm 114
rest:
The people of Israel came out of Egypt.
The people of Jacob left a land where a different language was spoken.

firstLine: Psalm 115
rest:
Lord, may glory be given to you, not to us.
You are loving and faithful.

firstLine: Why do the nations ask,
rest: “Where is their God?”

firstLine: But we who are alive praise the Lord,
rest:
both now and forever.
Praise the Lord.

firstLine: Psalm 116
rest:
I love the Lord, because he heard my voice.
He heard my cry for his favor.

firstLine: Because he paid attention to me,
rest: I will call out to him as long as I live.

firstLine: So now I can enjoy life here with you
rest: while I’m still living.

firstLine: I believed in you even when I said to myself,
rest: “I’m in great pain.”

firstLine: When I was terrified, I said to myself,
rest: “No one tells the truth.”

firstLine: I will bring an offering of wine to the Lord
rest:
and thank him for saving me.
I will worship him.

firstLine: In front of all of the Lord’s people,
rest: I will do what I promised him.

firstLine: The Lord pays special attention
rest: when his faithful people die.

firstLine: In front of all of the Lord’s people,
rest: I will do what I promised him.

firstLine: Psalm 117
rest:
All you nations, praise the Lord.
All you people on earth, praise him.

firstLine: Psalm 118
rest:
Give thanks to the Lord, because he is good.
His faithful love continues forever.

firstLine: Let the people of Israel say,
rest: “His faithful love continues forever.”

firstLine: Let the priests of Aaron say,
rest: “His faithful love continues forever.”

firstLine: Let those who have respect for the Lord say,
rest: “His faithful love continues forever.”

firstLine: It is better to go to the Lord for safety
rest: than to trust in mere men.

firstLine: It is better to go to the Lord for safety
rest: than to trust in human leaders.

firstLine: The stone the builders didn’t accept
rest: has become the most important stone of all.

firstLine: Psalm 119
rest:
א Aleph
Blessed are those who live without blame.
They live in keeping with the law of the Lord.

firstLine: You have given me rules
rest: that I must obey completely.

firstLine: I hope I will always stand firm
rest: in following your orders.

firstLine: Then I won’t be put to shame
rest: when I think about all of your commands.

firstLine: I will praise you with an honest heart
rest: as I learn about how fair your decisions are.

firstLine: ב Beth
rest:
How can a young person keep his life pure?
By living in keeping with your word.

firstLine: I have hidden your word in my heart
rest: so that I won’t sin against you.

firstLine: With my lips I talk about
rest: all of the decisions you have made.

firstLine: Following your covenant laws gives me joy
rest: just as great riches give joy to others.

firstLine: ג Gimel
rest:
Be good to me, and I will live.
I will obey your word.

firstLine: Open my eyes so that I can see
rest: the wonderful truths in your law.

firstLine: My heart is filled with longing
rest: for your laws at all times.

firstLine: Even if rulers sit together and tell lies about me,
rest: I will spend time thinking about your orders.

firstLine: ד Daleth
rest:
I lie in the dust. I’m about to die.
Keep me alive as you have promised.

firstLine: I am quick to follow your commands,
rest: because you have set my heart free.

firstLine: ה He
rest:
Lord, teach me to follow your orders.
Then I will obey them to the very end.

firstLine: Teach me to live as you command,
rest: because that makes me very happy.

firstLine: Make me want to follow your covenant laws
rest: instead of wanting to gain things only for myself.

firstLine: ו Waw
rest:
Lord, show me your faithful love.
Save me as you have promised.

firstLine: Then I will answer those who make fun of me,
rest: because I trust in your word.

firstLine: I will always obey your law,
rest: for ever and ever.

firstLine: I will lead a full and happy life,
rest: because I’ve tried to obey your rules.

firstLine: I take delight in obeying your commands
rest: because I love them.

firstLine: ז Zayin
rest:
Remember what you have said to me.
You have given me hope.

firstLine: Even when I suffer, I am comforted
rest: because you promised to keep me alive.

firstLine: I am very angry
rest: because evil people have turned away from your law.

firstLine: No matter where I live,
rest: I sing about your orders.

firstLine: I have really done my best
rest: to obey your rules.

firstLine: ח Heth
rest:
Lord, you are everything I need.
I have promised to obey your words.

firstLine: At midnight I get up to give you thanks
rest: because your decisions are very fair.

firstLine: ט Teth
rest:
Lord, be good to me
as you have promised.

firstLine: Increase my knowledge and give me good sense,
rest: because I believe in your commands.

firstLine: The law you gave is worth more to me
rest: than thousands of pieces of silver and gold.

firstLine: י Yodh
rest:
You made me and formed me with your own hands.
Give me understanding so that I can learn your commands.

firstLine: May your faithful love comfort me
rest: as you have promised me.

firstLine: כ Kaph
rest:
I deeply long for you to save me.
I have put my hope in your word.

firstLine: ל Lamedh
rest:
Lord, your word lasts forever.
It stands firm in the heavens.

firstLine: Your laws continue to this very day,
rest: because all things serve you.

firstLine: If I had not taken delight in your law,
rest: I would have died because of my suffering.

firstLine: מ Mem
rest:
Lord, I really love your law!
All day long I spend time thinking about it.

firstLine: Your commands make me wiser than my enemies,
rest: because your commands are always in my heart.

firstLine: I know more than all of my teachers do,
rest: because I spend time thinking about your covenant laws.

firstLine: I understand more than the elders do,
rest: because I obey your rules.

firstLine: I’ve kept my feet from every path that sinners take
rest: so that I might obey your word.

firstLine: I haven’t turned away from your laws,
rest: because you yourself have taught me.

firstLine: נ Nun
rest:
Your word is like a lamp that shows me the way.
It is like a light that guides me.

firstLine: I have decided to obey your orders
rest: to the very end.

firstLine: ס Samekh
rest:
I hate people who can’t make up their minds.
But I love your law.

firstLine: ע Ayin
rest:
I have done what is right and fair.
So don’t leave me to those who beat me down.

firstLine: פ Pe
rest:
Your covenant laws are wonderful.
So I obey them.

firstLine: I open my mouth and pant like a dog,
rest: because I long to know your commands.

firstLine: Streams of tears flow from my eyes,
rest: because people don’t obey your law.

firstLine: צ Tsadhe
rest:
Lord, you do what is fair.
And your laws are right.

firstLine: My anger is wearing me out,
rest: because my enemies don’t pay any attention to your words.

firstLine: ק Qoph
rest:
Lord, I call out to you with all my heart.
Answer me, and I will obey your orders.

firstLine: Long ago I learned from your covenant laws
rest: that you made them to last forever.

firstLine: ר Resh
rest:
Look at how I’m suffering!
Save me, because I haven’t forgotten to obey your law.

firstLine: ש Sin and Shin
rest:
Rulers attack me without any reason.
But my heart trembles because of your word.

firstLine: Seven times a day I praise you
rest: for your laws, because they are right.

firstLine: I obey your covenant laws,
rest: because I love them greatly.

firstLine: I obey your rules and your covenant laws,
rest: because you know all about how I live.

firstLine: ת Taw
rest:
Lord, may you hear my cry.
Give me understanding, just as you said you would.

firstLine: May my lips pour out praise to you,
rest: because you teach me your orders.

firstLine: May my tongue sing about your word,
rest: because all of your commands are right.

firstLine: May your hand be ready to help me,
rest: because I have chosen to obey your rules.

firstLine: Psalm 120
rest:
A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the Lord.
I call out to the Lord when I’m in trouble,
and he answers me.

firstLine: I have lived too long
rest: among those who hate peace.

firstLine: Psalm 121
rest:
A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the Lord.
I look up to the hills.
Where does my help come from?

firstLine: In fact, he who watches over Israel
rest: won’t get tired or go to sleep.

firstLine: The Lord will watch over your life no matter where you go,
rest: both now and forever.

firstLine: Psalm 122
rest:
A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the Lord. A psalm of David.
I was very glad when they said to me,
“Let us go up to the house of the Lord.”

firstLine: Jerusalem, our feet are standing
rest: inside your gates.

firstLine: Jerusalem is built like a city
rest: where everything is close together.

firstLine: Psalm 123
rest:
A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the Lord.
I look up and pray to you.
Your throne is in heaven.

firstLine: Psalm 124
rest:
A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the Lord. A psalm of David.
Here is what Israel should say.
Suppose the Lord had not been on our side.

firstLine: Suppose the Lord had not been on our side
rest: when our enemies attacked us.

firstLine: Suppose he had not been on our side
rest:
when their anger blazed out against us.
Then they would have swallowed us alive.

firstLine: They would have washed us away
rest: like a swollen stream.

firstLine: We have escaped like a bird
rest:
from a hunter’s trap.
The trap has been broken,
and we have escaped.

firstLine: Psalm 125
rest:
A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the Lord.
Those who trust in the Lord are like Mount Zion.
They will always be secure. They will last forever.

firstLine: Like the mountains around Jerusalem,
rest:
the Lord is all around his people
both now and forever.

firstLine: Evil people will not always rule
rest:
the land the Lord gave to those who do right.
If they did, those who do right
might do what is evil.

firstLine: Psalm 126
rest:
A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the Lord.
Our enemies took us away from Zion.
But when the Lord brought us home,
it seemed like a dream to us.

firstLine: Lord, bless us with great success again,
rest: as rain makes streams flow in the Negev Desert.

firstLine: Those who cry as they plant their crops
rest: will sing with joy when they gather them in.

firstLine: Those who go out sobbing
rest:
as they carry seeds to plant
will come back singing with joy.
They will bring the new crop back with them.

firstLine: Psalm 127
rest:
A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the Lord. A psalm of Solomon.
If the Lord doesn’t build a house,
the work of its builders is useless.
If the Lord doesn’t watch over a city,
it’s useless for those on guard duty to stand watch over it.

firstLine: It’s useless for you to work from early morning
rest:
until late at night
just to get food to eat.
God provides for those he loves even while they sleep.

firstLine: Children who are born to people when they are young
rest: are like arrows in the hands of a soldier.

firstLine: Blessed are those
rest:
who have many children.
They won’t be put to shame
when they go up against their enemies in court.

firstLine: Psalm 128
rest:
A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the Lord.
Blessed are all those who have respect for the Lord.
They live as he wants them to live.

firstLine: As a vine bears a lot of fruit,
rest:
so your wife will have many children by you.
They will sit around your table
like young olive trees.

firstLine: Only a man who has respect for the Lord
rest: will be blessed like that.

firstLine: Psalm 129
rest:
A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the Lord.
Here is what Israel should say.
Many times my enemies have beaten me down ever since I was a young nation.

firstLine: Many times my enemies have beaten me down ever since I was a young nation,
rest: but they haven’t won the battle.

firstLine: May all those who hate Zion
rest: be driven back in shame.

firstLine: May no one who passes by say to those who hate Zion,
rest:
“May the blessing of the Lord be on you.
We bless you in the name of the Lord.”

firstLine: Psalm 130
rest:
A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the Lord.
Lord, I cry out to you
because I’m suffering so deeply.

firstLine: Israel, put your hope in the Lord,
rest:
because the Lord’s love never fails.
He sets his people completely free.

firstLine: He himself will set Israel
rest: free from all of their sins.

firstLine: Psalm 131
rest:
A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the Lord. A psalm of David.
Lord, my heart isn’t proud.
My eyes aren’t proud either.
I don’t concern myself with important matters.
I don’t concern myself with things that are too wonderful for me.

firstLine: I have made myself calm and content
rest:
like a young child in its mother’s arms.
Deep down inside me, I am as content as a young child.

firstLine: Israel, put your hope in the Lord
rest: both now and forever.

firstLine: Psalm 132
rest:
A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the Lord.
Lord, remember David
and all of the hard times he went through.

firstLine: He said, “I won’t enter my house
rest: or go to bed.

firstLine: “Let us go to the Lord’s house.
rest: Let us worship at his feet.

firstLine: In honor of your servant David,
rest: don’t turn your back on your anointed king.

firstLine: If your sons keep my covenant
rest:
and the laws I teach them,
then their sons will sit
on your throne for ever and ever.”

firstLine: “Here in Jerusalem I will raise up a mighty king from the family of David.
rest:
I will set up the lamp of David’s kingdom for my anointed king.
Its flame will burn brightly forever.

firstLine: Psalm 133
rest:
A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the Lord. A psalm of David.
How good and pleasant it is
when God’s people live together in peace!

firstLine: It’s like the special olive oil
rest:
that was poured on Aaron’s head.
It ran down on his beard
and on the collar of his robe.

firstLine: It’s as if the dew of Mount Hermon
rest:
were falling on Mount Zion.
There the Lord gives his blessing.
He gives life that never ends.

firstLine: Psalm 134
rest:
A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the Lord.
All of you who serve the Lord, praise the Lord.
All of you who serve at night in the house of the Lord, praise him.

firstLine: Lift up your hands in the temple
rest: and praise the Lord.

firstLine: Psalm 135
rest:
Praise the Lord.
Praise the name of the Lord.
You who serve the Lord, praise him.

firstLine: The Lord does anything he wants to do
rest:
in the heavens and on the earth.
He does it even in the deepest parts of the oceans.

firstLine: He killed Sihon, the king of the Amorites,
rest:
and Og, the king of Bashan.
He killed all of the kings of Canaan.

firstLine: He gave their land as a gift
rest: to his people Israel.

firstLine: Psalm 136
rest:
Give thanks to the Lord, because he is good.
His faithful love continues forever.

firstLine: Psalm 137
rest:
We were sitting by the rivers of Babylon.
We cried when we remembered what had happened to Zion.

firstLine: On the nearby poplar trees
rest: we hung up our harps.

firstLine: How can we sing the songs of the Lord
rest: while we are in another land?

firstLine: Jerusalem, if I forget you,
rest: may my right hand never be able to play the harp again.

firstLine: If I don’t remember you,
rest:
may my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth so I can’t sing.
May it happen if I don’t consider Jerusalem
to be my greatest joy.

firstLine: Lord, remember what the people of Edom did
rest:
on the day Jerusalem fell.
“Tear it down!” they cried.
“Tear it down to the ground!”

firstLine: Happy are those who grab your babies
rest: and smash them against the rocks.

firstLine: Psalm 138
rest:
A psalm of David.
Lord, I will praise you with all my heart.
In front of those who think they are gods
I will sing praise to you.

firstLine: Lord, may all of the kings on earth praise you
rest: when they hear about what you have promised.

firstLine: Lord, may they sing about what you have done,
rest: because your glory is great.

firstLine: Trouble is all around me,
rest:
but you keep me alive.
You reach out your hand to put a stop to the anger of my enemies.
With your powerful right hand you save me.

firstLine: Psalm 139
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David.
Lord, you have seen what is in my heart.
You know all about me.

firstLine: Lord, even before I speak a word,
rest: you know all about it.

firstLine: Suppose I were to rise with the sun in the east
rest: and then cross over to the west where it sinks into the ocean.

firstLine: None of my bones was hidden from you
rest:
when you made me inside my mother’s body.
That place was as dark as the deepest parts of the earth.
When you were putting me together there,

firstLine: If I could count them,
rest:
they would be more than the grains of sand.
If I were to fall asleep counting and then wake up,
you would still be there with me.

firstLine: Psalm 140
rest:
For the director of music. A psalm of David.
Lord, save me from sinful men.
Keep me safe from those who want to hurt me.

firstLine: Those who are all around me have caused me trouble
rest:
by what their lips have said.
Let that trouble fall on their own heads.

firstLine: Psalm 141
rest:
A psalm of David.
Lord, I call out to you. Come quickly to help me.
Listen to me when I call out to you.

firstLine: When their rulers are thrown down from the rocky cliffs,
rest: those evil people will realize that my words were true.

firstLine: They will say, “As clumps of dirt are left from plowing up the ground,
rest: so our bones will be scattered near an open grave.”

firstLine: Psalm 142
rest:
A prayer of David when he was in the cave. A maskil.
I call out to the Lord.
I pray to him for his favor.

firstLine: When I grow weak,
rest:
you know what I’m going through.
In the path where I walk,
people have hidden a trap to catch me.

firstLine: Look around me, and you will see
rest:
that no one is concerned about me.
I have no place of safety.
No one cares whether I live or die.

firstLine: Psalm 143
rest:
A psalm of David.
Lord, hear my prayer.
Listen to my cry for your favor.
You are faithful and right.
Come and help me.

firstLine: Don’t take me to court and judge me,
rest: because in your eyes no living person does what is right.

firstLine: In the morning let me hear about your faithful love,
rest:
because I’ve put my trust in you.
Show me the way I should live,
because I pray to you.

firstLine: Lord, save me from my enemies,
rest: because I go to you for safety.

firstLine: Teach me to do what you want,
rest:
because you are my God.
May your good Spirit
lead me on a level path.

firstLine: Psalm 144
rest:
A psalm of David.
Give praise to the Lord. He is my rock.
He trains my hands for war.
He trains my fingers for battle.

firstLine: While our sons are young,
rest:
they will be like healthy plants.
Our daughters will be like pillars
that have been made to decorate a palace.

firstLine: Our storerooms will be filled
rest:
with every kind of food.
The sheep in our fields will increase by thousands.
They will increase by tens of thousands.

firstLine: Psalm 145
rest:
A psalm of praise. A psalm of David.
I will honor you, my God the King.
I will praise your name for ever and ever.

firstLine: You open your hand
rest: and satisfy the needs of every living creature.

firstLine: Psalm 146
rest:
Praise the Lord.
I will praise the Lord.

firstLine: Psalm 147
rest:
Praise the Lord.
How good it is to sing praises to our God!
How pleasant and right it is to praise him!

firstLine: Psalm 148
rest:
Praise the Lord.
Praise the Lord from the heavens.
Praise him in the heavens above.

firstLine: Let all of them praise the name of the Lord,
rest: because he gave a command and they were created.

firstLine: Praise the Lord from the earth,
rest: you great sea creatures and all of the deepest parts of the ocean.

firstLine: Psalm 149
rest:
Praise the Lord.
Sing a new song to the Lord.
Sing praise to him in the community of his faithful people.

firstLine: Psalm 150
rest:
Praise the Lord.
Praise God in his holy temple.
Praise him in his mighty heavens.

firstLine: Purpose
rest: These are the proverbs of Solomon. He was the son of David and the king of Israel.

firstLine: Main Point
rest:
If you really want to gain knowledge, you must begin by having respect for the Lord.
But foolish people hate wisdom and training.

firstLine: Think and Live Wisely
rest:
A Warning Against a Life of Crime
My son, listen to your father’s advice.
Don’t turn away from your mother’s teaching.

firstLine: My son, if sinners tempt you,
rest: don’t give in to them.

firstLine: How useless it is to spread a net
rest: while all the birds are watching!

firstLine: That’s what happens to everyone
rest:
who goes after money in the wrong way.
That kind of money takes away
the lives of those who get it.

firstLine: A Warning Against Turning Away From Wisdom
rest:
Wisdom calls out in the street.
She raises her voice in public places.

firstLine: “How long will you childish people love your childish ways?
rest:
How long will you rude people enjoy making fun of God and others?
How long will you foolish people hate knowledge?

firstLine: “Then you will call to me. But I won’t answer.
rest: You will look for me. But you won’t find me.

firstLine: “Childish people go down the wrong path. They will die.
rest: Foolish people are satisfied with the way they live. They will be destroyed.

firstLine: Good Things Come From Wisdom
rest:
My son, accept my words.
Store up my commands inside you.

firstLine: Men like that leave the straight paths
rest: to walk in dark ways.

firstLine: No one who goes to her comes back
rest: or reaches the paths of life.

firstLine: More Good Things Come From Wisdom
rest:
My son, do not forget my teaching.
Keep my commands in your heart.

firstLine: Then you will find favor and a good name
rest: in the eyes of God and people.

firstLine: By his knowledge the seas were separated,
rest: and the clouds dropped their dew.

firstLine: Wisdom Is Best
rest:
My children, listen to a father’s teaching.
Pay attention and gain understanding.

firstLine: A Warning Against Committing Adultery
rest:
My son, pay attention to my wisdom.
Listen carefully to my wise sayings.

firstLine: Warnings Against Foolish Acts
rest:
My son, don’t put up money for what your neighbor owes.
Don’t agree to pay up for someone else.

firstLine: A worthless and evil man
rest: goes around saying twisted things with his mouth.

firstLine: The Lord hates proud eyes,
rest:
a lying tongue,
and hands that kill those who aren’t guilty.

firstLine: He also hates hearts that make evil plans,
rest: feet that are quick to do evil,

firstLine: any witness who pours out lies,
rest: and anyone who stirs up family fights.

firstLine: A Warning Against Committing Adultery
rest:
My son, keep your father’s commands.
Don’t turn away from your mother’s teaching.

firstLine: You can’t shovel fire into your lap
rest: without burning your clothes.

firstLine: You can’t walk on hot coals
rest: without burning your feet.

firstLine: People don’t hate a thief who steals
rest: to fill his empty stomach.

firstLine: A Warning Against a Woman Who Commits Adultery
rest:
My son, obey my words.
Store up my commands inside you.

firstLine: Among those who were childish
rest: I saw a young man who had no sense.

firstLine: Sometimes in the streets, sometimes at other places,
rest: at every corner she would wait.

firstLine: I have covered my bed
rest: with colored sheets from Egypt.

firstLine: Wisdom Is Worth More Than Anything
rest:
Doesn’t wisdom call out?
Doesn’t understanding raise her voice?

firstLine: On the high roads along the way,
rest: she takes her place where the paths meet.

firstLine: Beside the gates leading into the city,
rest: she cries out at the entrances.

firstLine: “I, wisdom, live together with understanding.
rest: I have knowledge and good sense.

firstLine: “The Lord created me as the first of his works,
rest: before his acts of long ago.

firstLine: It was when he set limits for the sea
rest:
so that the waters had to obey his command.
When he marked out the foundations of the earth, I was there.

firstLine: “My children, listen to me.
rest: Blessed are those who keep my ways.

firstLine: Wisdom and Foolishness Call Out
rest:
Wisdom has built her house.
She has made its seven pillars.

firstLine: “Come and eat my food.
rest: Drink the wine I have mixed.

firstLine: “When you correct someone who makes fun of others, you might be laughed at.
rest: When you warn a sinner, you might get hurt.

firstLine: “If you really want to become wise, you must begin by having respect for the Lord.
rest: To know the Holy One is to gain understanding.

firstLine: Anyone who pays attention to his training
rest:
is on his way to life.
But anyone who refuses to be corrected
leads others down the wrong path.

firstLine: A beautiful woman who has no sense
rest: is like a gold ring in a pig’s nose.

firstLine: Being nobody and having a servant
rest: is better than pretending to be somebody and having no food.

firstLine: Those who aren’t faithful will be paid back
rest:
for what they’ve done.
And good men will receive rewards
for how they’ve lived.

firstLine: It is better to have respect for the Lord and have little
rest: than to be rich and have trouble.

firstLine: A meal of vegetables where there is love
rest: is better than the finest meat where there is hatred.

firstLine: When the way you live pleases the Lord,
rest: he makes even your enemies live at peace with you.

firstLine: It is better to have a little and do right
rest: than to have a lot and be unfair.

firstLine: It is better to eat a dry crust of bread in peace and quiet
rest: than to eat a big dinner in a house that is full of fighting.

firstLine: A person who understands what is right learns more from just a warning
rest: than a foolish person learns from 100 strokes with a whip.

firstLine: It is better to meet a bear whose cubs have been stolen
rest: than to meet a foolish person who is acting foolishly.

firstLine: Evil will never leave the house
rest: of anyone who pays back evil for good.

firstLine: A foolish child makes his father sad
rest: and his mother sorry.

firstLine: Anyone who doesn’t want to work
rest: is like someone who destroys.

firstLine: To answer before listening
rest: is foolish and shameful.

firstLine: It is better to be poor and to live without blame
rest: than to be foolish and to twist words around.

firstLine: If you whip a person who makes fun of others,
rest:
childish people will learn to be wise.
If you warn someone who already understands what is right,
he will gain even more knowledge.

firstLine: A child who robs his father and drives out his mother
rest: brings shame and dishonor.

firstLine: My son, if you stop listening to what I teach you,
rest: you will wander away from the words of knowledge.

firstLine: “It’s no good. It’s no good!” says a buyer.
rest: Then off he goes and brags about what he bought.

firstLine: If anyone calls down curses on his father or mother,
rest: his lamp will be blown out in total darkness.

firstLine: Property you gain quickly at the beginning
rest: will not be blessed in the end.

firstLine: A man is trapped if he makes a hasty promise to God
rest: and only later thinks about what he said.

firstLine: A fortune made by people who tell lies
rest: amounts to nothing and leads to death.

firstLine: It is better to live on a corner of a roof
rest: than to share a house with a nagging wife.

firstLine: If you refuse to listen to the cries of poor people,
rest: you too will cry out and not be answered.

firstLine: A man who leaves the path of understanding
rest: ends up with those who are dead.

firstLine: It is better to live in a desert
rest: than to live with a nagging, angry wife.

firstLine: Anyone who wants to be godly and loving
rest: finds life, success and honor.

firstLine: Anyone who is careful about what he says
rest: keeps himself out of trouble.

firstLine: No wisdom, wise saying or plan
rest: can succeed against the Lord.

firstLine: Sayings of Those Who Are Wise
rest:
Pay attention and listen to the sayings of those who are wise.
Apply your heart to the sayings I teach.

firstLine: When you sit down to eat with a ruler,
rest: look carefully at what’s in front of you.

firstLine: Put a knife to your throat
rest: if you like to eat too much.

firstLine: He is the kind of person
rest:
who is always thinking about how much it costs.
“Eat and drink,” he says to you.
But he doesn’t mean it.

firstLine: Deep down inside, I will be happy
rest: when you say what is right.

firstLine: “They hit me,” you will say. “But I’m not hurt!
rest:
They beat me. But I don’t feel it!
When will I wake up
so I can find another drink?”
19.

firstLine: Through knowledge its rooms are filled
rest: with priceless and beautiful things.

firstLine: More Sayings of Those Who Are Wise
rest:
Here are more sayings of those who are wise.
Taking sides in court is not good.

firstLine: An honest answer
rest: is like a kiss on the lips.

firstLine: More Proverbs of Solomon
rest: These are more proverbs of Solomon. They were copied down by the men of Hezekiah, the king of Judah.

firstLine: If you talk about a matter with your neighbor,
rest: don’t tell others what was said.

firstLine: The right word at the right time
rest: is like golden apples in silver jewelry.

firstLine: A wise person’s warning to a listening ear
rest: is like a gold earring or jewelry made of fine gold.

firstLine: A messenger trusted by those who send him
rest:
is like cool snow at harvest time.
He renews the spirit of his masters.

firstLine: A man who brags about gifts he doesn’t give
rest: is like wind and clouds that don’t produce rain.

firstLine: A man who gives false witness against his neighbor
rest: is like a club, a sword or a sharp arrow.

firstLine: Trusting someone who is not faithful when trouble comes
rest: is like a bad tooth or a disabled foot.

firstLine: It is better to live on a corner of a roof
rest: than to share a house with a nagging wife.

firstLine: Hearing good news from a land far away
rest: is like drinking cold water when you are tired.

firstLine: A man who can’t control himself
rest: is like a city whose walls are broken down.

firstLine: Sending a message in the hand of a foolish person
rest: is like cutting off your feet or drinking something harmful.

firstLine: A proverb in the mouth of a foolish person
rest: is like disabled legs that are useless.

firstLine: Giving honor to a foolish person
rest: is like tying a stone in a slingshot.

firstLine: A proverb in the mouth of a foolish person
rest: is like a thorn in the hand of someone who is drunk.

firstLine: Anyone who hires a foolish person or someone who is passing by
rest: is like a person who shoots arrows at just anybody.

firstLine: A foolish person who does the same foolish things again
rest: is like a dog that returns to where it has thrown up.

firstLine: A person who doesn’t want to work turns over in bed
rest: just like a door that swings back and forth.

firstLine: A person who doesn’t want to work is wiser in his own eyes
rest: than seven people who give careful answers.

firstLine: Suppose a crazy person shoots
rest: flaming arrows that can kill.

firstLine: A man who lies to his neighbor
rest: and says, “I was only joking!” is just like that person.

firstLine: Warm words that come from an evil heart
rest: are like shiny paint on a clay pot.

firstLine: Being warned openly is better
rest: than being loved in secret.

firstLine: A man who wanders away from his home
rest: is like a bird that wanders from its nest.

firstLine: A nagging wife is like
rest: dripping that never stops on a rainy day.

firstLine: As iron sharpens iron,
rest: so one person sharpens another.

firstLine: A ruler who beats poor people down
rest: is like a pounding rain that leaves no crops.

firstLine: It is better to be poor and live without blame
rest: than to be rich and follow a crooked path.

firstLine: A person who increases his wealth by charging high interest
rest: piles it up for someone who will be kind to poor people.

firstLine: If you don’t pay attention to the law,
rest: even your prayers are hated.

firstLine: Those who lead honest people down an evil path
rest:
will fall into their own trap.
But those who are without blame
will receive good things.

firstLine: An evil person who rules over helpless people
rest: is like a roaring lion or an angry bear.

firstLine: A man who is troubled because he is guilty of murder
rest:
will be on the run until the day he dies.
No one should give him any help.

firstLine: Anyone who steals from his parents and says, “It’s not wrong,”
rest: is just like a man who destroys.

firstLine: Those who give to poor people
rest:
will have everything they need.
But those who close their eyes to the poor
will be under many curses.

firstLine: A man who still won’t obey after being warned many times
rest: will suddenly be destroyed. Nothing can save him.

firstLine: A man who only pretends to praise his neighbor
rest: is spreading a net to catch him by the feet.

firstLine: If rulers listen to lies,
rest: all their officials become evil.

firstLine: If a king judges poor people fairly,
rest: his throne will always be secure.

firstLine: If you spoil your servant while he is young,
rest: he will bring you sorrow later on.

firstLine: The Sayings of Agur
rest:
These sayings are the words of Agur, son of Jakeh. He spoke them as if they came from God.
He spoke them to Ithiel
and to Ucal.

firstLine: “Every word of God is perfect.
rest:
He is like a shield to those who trust in him.
He keeps them safe.

firstLine: “Lord, I ask you for two things.
rest: Don’t refuse me before I die.

firstLine: “Don’t tell lies about a servant when you talk to his master.
rest: If you do, he will call down curses on you. And you will pay for it.

firstLine: “Some people call down curses on their fathers.
rest: Others don’t bless their mothers.

firstLine: “A bloodsucking worm has two daughters.
rest:
They cry out, ‘Give! Give!’
“Three things are never satisfied.
Four things never say, ‘Enough!’

firstLine: “Some make fun of their fathers.
rest:
Others laugh about obeying their mothers.
The ravens of the valley will peck their eyes out.
Then the vultures will eat them.

firstLine: “Three things are too amazing for me.
rest: There are four things I don’t understand.

firstLine: “This is the way of a woman who commits adultery.
rest:
She eats. She wipes her mouth.
Then she says, ‘I haven’t done anything wrong.’

firstLine: “Under three things the earth shakes.
rest: Under four things it can’t stand up.

firstLine: “Four things on earth are small.
rest: But they are very wise.

firstLine: “Three things walk as if they were kings.
rest: Four things move as kings do.

firstLine: “Have you been foolish?
rest:
Have you thought you were better than others?
Have you planned evil?
If you have, put your hand over your mouth and stop talking!

firstLine: The Sayings of King Lemuel
rest: These are the sayings of King Lemuel. His mother taught them to him. She spoke them as if they came from God.

firstLine: “Lemuel, it isn’t good for kings to drink wine.
rest: It isn’t good for rulers to long for beer.

firstLine: “Speak up for those who can’t speak for themselves.
rest: Speak up for the rights of all those who are poor.

firstLine: The Noble Wife
rest:
Who can find a noble wife?
She is worth far more than rubies.

firstLine: She brings him good, not harm,
rest: all the days of her life.

firstLine: Nothing Has Any Meaning
rest: These are the words of the Teacher. He was the son of David. He was also king in Jerusalem.

firstLine: “Meaningless! Everything is meaningless!”
rest:
says the Teacher.
“Everything is completely meaningless!
Nothing has any meaning.”

firstLine: There isn’t anything about which someone can say,
rest:
“Look! Here’s something new.”
It was already here long ago.
It was here before we were.

firstLine: Wisdom Doesn’t Have Any Meaning
rest: I, the Teacher, was king over Israel in Jerusalem.

firstLine: Pleasure Doesn’t Have Any Meaning
rest: I said to myself, “Come on. I’ll put pleasure to the test. I want to find out what is good.” But that also proved to be meaningless.

firstLine: Wisdom and Foolish Pleasure Don’t Have Any Meaning
rest:
I decided to think about wisdom.
I also thought about foolish pleasure.
What more can a new king do?
Can he do anything more than others have already done?

firstLine: I saw that wisdom is better than foolishness,
rest: just as light is better than darkness.

firstLine: Then I thought,
rest:
“What happens to a foolish person will catch up with me too.
So what do I gain by being wise?”
I said to myself,
“That doesn’t have any meaning either.”

firstLine: Work Doesn’t Have Any Meaning
rest: So I hated life. That’s because the work that is done on this earth made me sad. None of it has any meaning. It’s like chasing the wind.

firstLine: There Is a Time for Everything
rest:
There is a time for everything.
There’s a time for everything that is done on earth.

firstLine: I said to myself,
rest:
“God will judge
godly and sinful people alike.
He has a time for every act.
He has a time for everything that is done.”

firstLine: Suffering, Hard Work and Friendship
rest:
I looked and saw how much people were suffering on this earth.
I saw the tears of those who are suffering.
They don’t have anyone to comfort them.
Power is on the side of those who beat them down.
Those who are suffering don’t have anyone to comfort them.

firstLine: Then I announced that those
rest:
who have already died
are happier than those
who are still alive.

firstLine: But someone who hasn’t been born yet
rest:
is better off than the dead or the living.
That’s because he hasn’t seen the evil things
that are done on earth.

firstLine: One handful with peace and quiet
rest:
is better than two handfuls with hard work.
Working too hard is like chasing the wind.

firstLine: Getting Ahead Doesn’t Have Any Meaning
rest: A poor but wise young man is better off than an old but foolish king. That king doesn’t pay attention to a warning anymore.

firstLine: Have Respect for God
rest: Be careful what you say when you go to God’s house. Go there to listen. Don’t be like foolish people when you offer your sacrifice. They do what is wrong and don’t even know it.

firstLine: Riches Don’t Have Any Meaning
rest: Suppose you see poor people being mistreated somewhere. And what is being done to them isn’t right or fair. Don’t be surprised by that. One official is watched by a higher one. Others who are even higher are watching both of them.

firstLine: As more and more goods are made,
rest:
more and more people use them up.
So how can those goods benefit their owner?
All he can do is look at them with longing.

firstLine: It’s also when wealth is lost
rest:
because of an unwise business deal.
Then there won’t be anything left
for the owner’s son.

firstLine: What advantage does a wise man have
rest:
over someone who is foolish?
What does a poor man gain
by knowing how to act toward others?

firstLine: Being satisfied with what you have
rest:
is better than always wanting more.
That doesn’t have any meaning either.
It’s like chasing the wind.

firstLine: The more words people use,
rest:
the less meaning there is.
And that doesn’t help anyone.

firstLine: Good Advice About How to Live
rest:
A good name is better than fine perfume.
People can learn more from sobbing when someone dies
than from being happy when someone is born.

firstLine: So it’s better to go where people are sobbing
rest:
than to go where people are having a good time.
Everyone will die someday.
Those who are still living
should really think about that.

firstLine: A foolish person’s laughter
rest:
is like the crackling of thorns burning under a pot.
That doesn’t have any meaning either.

firstLine: Wisdom provides safety,
rest:
just as money provides safety.
But here’s the advantage of wisdom.
It guards the lives of those who have it.

firstLine: Wisdom makes one wise man more powerful
rest: than ten rulers in a city.

firstLine: There isn’t anyone on earth
rest: who does only what is right and never sins.

firstLine: No matter what else wisdom may be,
rest:
it’s far away and very deep.
Who can find it?

firstLine: A woman who hunts a man down
rest:
is more painful than death.
Her heart is like a trap.
Her hands are like chains.
A man who pleases God will try to get away from her.
But she will trap a sinner.

firstLine: “Look,” says the Teacher. “Here’s what I’ve discovered.
rest:
“I added one thing to another to find out
everything I could about wisdom.

firstLine: I searched and searched
rest:
but found very little.
I did find one honest man among a thousand.
But I didn’t find one honest woman among a thousand.

firstLine: Obey the King
rest: I’m telling you to obey the king’s command. You took an oath to serve him. You made a promise to God.

firstLine: Everyone Dies
rest:
I thought about all of those things. I realized that those who are wise and do what is right are under God’s control. What they do is also under his control.
But a man doesn’t know whether God will show favor to him.

firstLine: Being Wise Is Better Than Being Foolish
rest: Here’s something else I saw on this earth. I saw an example of wisdom that touched me deeply.

firstLine: People should listen to the quiet words
rest:
of those who are wise.
That’s better than paying attention to the shouts
of a ruler of foolish people.

firstLine: Be Bold
rest:
Put your money into trade across the ocean.
After a while you will earn something from it.

firstLine: Clouds that are full of water
rest:
pour rain down on the earth.
A tree might fall to the south or the north.
It will stay in the place where it falls.

firstLine: Remember the One Who Created You
rest:
Light is sweet.
People enjoy being out in the sun.

firstLine: No matter how many years a man might live,
rest:
let him enjoy all of them.
But let him remember the dark days.
There will be many of them.
Nothing that’s going to happen will have any meaning.

firstLine: “Meaningless! Everything is meaningless!”
rest:
says the Teacher.
“Nothing has any meaning.”

firstLine: Have Respect for God
rest: The Teacher was wise. He gave knowledge to people. He put many proverbs to the test. He thought about them carefully. Then he wrote them down in order.

firstLine: “I long for your lips to kiss me!
rest: Your love makes me happier than wine does.

firstLine: “Women of Jerusalem,
rest:
my skin is dark but lovely.
It is dark like the tents in Kedar.
It’s like the curtains of Solomon’s tent.

firstLine: “King Solomon, I love you.
rest:
So tell me where you take care of your flock.
Tell me where you rest your sheep at noon.
Why should I have to act like a prostitute
near the flocks of your friends?”
The other women say,

firstLine: “You are the most beautiful woman of all.
rest:
Don’t you know where to find the king?
Follow the tracks the sheep make.
Take care of your young goats
near the tents of the shepherds.”
King Solomon says to the Shulammite woman,

firstLine: “You are my love.
rest: You are like a mare that pulls one of Pharaoh’s chariots.

firstLine: “We will make gold earrings for you.
rest:
We’ll decorate them with silver.”
The woman says,

firstLine: “The king was at his table.
rest: My perfume gave off a sweet smell.

firstLine: The one who loves me is like a small bag of myrrh
rest: resting between my breasts.

firstLine: He is like henna flowers
rest:
from the vineyards of En Gedi.”
The king says,

firstLine: “You are so beautiful, my love!
rest:
So beautiful!
Your eyes are like doves.”
The woman says,

firstLine: “You are so handsome, my love!
rest:
So charming!
The green field is our bed.

firstLine: “I am like a rose on the coast of Sharon.
rest:
I’m like a lily in the valleys.”
The king says,

firstLine: “My love, among the young women
rest:
you are like a lily among thorns.”
The woman says,

firstLine: “My love, among the young men
rest:
you are like an apple tree among the trees of the forest.
I’m happy to sit in your shade.
Your fruit tastes so sweet to me.

firstLine: “Listen! I hear my love!
rest:
Look! Here he comes!
He’s leaping across the mountains.
He’s coming over the hills.

firstLine: “You are like a dove in an opening in the rocks.
rest:
You are like a dove in a hiding place on a mountainside.
Show me your face.
Let me hear your voice.
Your voice is so sweet.
Your face is so lovely.

firstLine: “My love belongs to me, and I belong to him.
rest: Like an antelope, he eats among the lilies.

firstLine: Until the day begins
rest:
and the shadows fade away,
turn to me, my love.
Be like an antelope
or like a young deer
on the rocky hills.

firstLine: “All night long on my bed
rest:
I searched for the one my heart loves.
I looked for him but didn’t find him.

firstLine: Those on guard duty found me
rest:
as they were walking around in the city.
‘Have you seen the one my heart loves?’ I asked.

firstLine: As soon as I had passed by them
rest:
I found the one my heart loves.
I threw my arms around him. I didn’t let him go
until I had brought him to my mother’s house.
I took him to my mother’s room.

firstLine: “Who is this man coming up from the desert
rest:
like a column of smoke?
He smells like myrrh and incense
made from all of the spices of the trader.

firstLine: The king says to the Shulammite woman,
rest:
“You are so beautiful, my love!
So beautiful!
Your eyes behind your veil are like doves.
Your hair flows like a flock of black goats
coming down from Mount Gilead.

firstLine: “Come with me from Lebanon, my bride.
rest:
Come with me from Lebanon.
Come down from the top of Mount Amana.
Come down from the top of Senir.
Come to me from the peak of Mount Hermon.
Leave the dens where the lions live.
Leave the places in the mountains where the leopards stay.

firstLine: My bride, you have stolen my heart
rest:
with one glance of your eyes.
My sister, you have stolen my heart
with one jewel in your necklace.

firstLine: You are like trees whose branches are loaded
rest: with pomegranates, fine fruits, henna and nard,

firstLine: “Wake up, north wind!
rest:
Come, south wind!
Blow on my garden.
Then its sweet smell will spread everywhere.
Let my love come into his garden.
Let him taste its fine fruits.”

firstLine: The king says,
rest:
“My bride, I have come into my garden.
My sister, I’ve gathered my myrrh and my spice.
I’ve eaten my honeycomb and my honey.
I’ve drunk my wine and my milk.”
The other women say to the Shulammite woman and to Solomon,
“Friends, eat and drink.
Lovers, drink all you want.”
The woman says,

firstLine: “I slept, but my heart was awake.
rest:
Listen! The one who loves me is knocking.
He says, ‘My sister, I love you.
Open up so I can come in.
You are my dove.
You are perfect in every way.
My head is soaked with dew.
The night air has made my hair wet.’

firstLine: “But I’ve taken my robe off.
rest:
Must I put it on again?
I’ve washed my feet.
Must I get them dirty again?

firstLine: Those on guard duty found me
rest:
as they were walking around in the city.
They beat me. They hurt me.
Those on guard duty at the walls
took my coat away from me.

firstLine: “You are the most beautiful woman of all.
rest:
How is the one you love better than others?
How is he better than anyone else?
Why do you ask us to make you a promise?”
The woman says,

firstLine: “The one who loves me is tanned and handsome.
rest: He’s the finest man among 10,000.

firstLine: His eyes are like doves
rest:
by streams of water.
They look as if they’ve been washed in milk.
They are set like jewels in his head.

firstLine: His cheeks are like beds of spice
rest:
that give off perfume.
His lips are like lilies
that drip with myrrh.

firstLine: His arms are like gold
rest:
that are set with chrysolite.
His body is like polished ivory
that is decorated with sapphires.

firstLine: His legs are like pillars of marble
rest:
that are set on bases of pure gold.
He looks like the finest cedar tree
in the mountains of Lebanon.

firstLine: The other women say,
rest:
“You are the most beautiful woman of all.
Where has the one who loves you gone?
Which way did he turn?
We’ll help you look for him.”
The woman says,

firstLine: “My love has gone down to his garden.
rest:
He’s gone to the beds of spices.
He’s eating in the gardens.
He’s gathering lilies.

firstLine: “My love, you are as beautiful as the city of Tirzah.
rest:
You are as lovely as Jerusalem.
You are as majestic as troops carrying their banners.

firstLine: Your teeth are as clean as a flock of sheep
rest:
coming up from being washed.
Each of your teeth has its twin.
Not one of them is alone.

firstLine: Your cheeks behind your veil
rest: are like the halves of a pomegranate.

firstLine: “Who is this woman?
rest:
She is like the sunrise in all of its glory.
She is as beautiful as the moon.
She is as bright as the sun.
She is as majestic as troops carrying their banners.”
The king says,

firstLine: “I went down to a grove of nut trees.
rest:
I wanted to look at the new plants growing in the valley.
I wanted to find out whether the vines had budded.
I wanted to see if the pomegranate trees had bloomed.

firstLine: Before I realized it,
rest:
I was among the royal chariots of my people.”
The other women say,

firstLine: “Come back to us.
rest:
Come back, Shulammite woman.
Come back to us.
Come back. Then we can look at you.”
The woman says,
“Why do you want to look at me
as you would watch a dancer at Mahanaim?”

firstLine: The king says to the Shulammite woman,
rest:
“You are like a prince’s daughter.
Your feet in sandals are so beautiful.
Your graceful legs are like jewels.
The hands of a skilled worker must have shaped them.

firstLine: Your navel is like a round bowl
rest:
that always has mixed wine in it.
Your waist is like a mound of wheat
that is surrounded by lilies.

firstLine: “I belong to you, my love.
rest: And you long for me.

firstLine: “I wish you were like a brother to me.
rest:
I wish my mother’s breasts had nursed you.
Then if I found you outside,
I could kiss you.
No one would look down on me.

firstLine: “Who is this woman coming up from the desert?
rest:
She’s leaning on the one who loves her.”
The woman says to the king,
“Under the apple tree I woke you up.
That’s where your mother became pregnant with you.
She went into labor, and you were born there.

firstLine: “We have a little sister.
rest:
Her breasts are still small.
What should we do for our sister
when she gets engaged?

firstLine: If she were a wall,
rest:
we’d build silver towers on her.
If she were a door,
we’d cover her with cedar boards.”
The woman says to the king,

firstLine: “I am a wall.
rest:
My breasts are like well-built towers.
So in your eyes I’ve become
like someone who makes you happy.

firstLine: “My love, you live in the gardens.
rest:
My friends listen for your voice.
But let me hear it now.”
The woman says,

firstLine: “Come away with me, my love.
rest:
Be like an antelope
or like a young deer
on mountains that are full of spices.”

firstLine: Israel Refuses to Obey the Lord
rest:
Listen to me, heavens! Pay attention to me, earth!
The Lord has said,
“I raised children. I brought them up.
But they have refused to obey me.

firstLine: There isn’t a healthy spot on your body
rest:
from the bottom of your feet to the top of your head.
There are only wounds, cuts
and open sores.
They haven’t been cleaned up or bandaged
or treated with olive oil.

firstLine: The city of Zion is left like a hut
rest:
where someone stands guard in a vineyard.
It is left like an empty cabin in a melon field.
It’s like a city that is being attacked.

firstLine: The Lord who rules over all
rest:
has let some people live through that time of trouble.
If he hadn’t, we would have become like Sodom.
We would have been like Gomorrah.

firstLine: Rulers of Sodom,
rest:
hear the Lord’s message.
People of Gomorrah,
listen to the law of our God.

firstLine: “Do you think I need any more of your sacrifices?”
rest:
asks the Lord.
“I have more than enough of your burnt offerings.
I have more than enough of rams
and the fat of your fattest animals.
I do not find any pleasure
in the blood of your bulls, lambs and goats.

firstLine: Who asked you to bring all of those animals
rest:
when you come to worship me?
Who asked you and your animals
to walk all over my courtyards?

firstLine: I hate your New Moon Feasts
rest:
and your other appointed feasts.
They have become a heavy load to me.
I am tired of carrying it.

firstLine: “Come. Let us talk some more about this matter,”
rest:
says the Lord.
“Even though your sins are bright red,
they will be as white as snow.
Even though they are deep red,
they will be white like wool.

firstLine: See how the faithful city of Jerusalem
rest:
has become like a prostitute!
Once it was full of people who treated others fairly.
Those who did what was right used to live in it.
But now murderers live there!

firstLine: People From Many Nations Will Worship at Mount Zion
rest: Here is a vision that Isaiah, the son of Amoz, had about Judah and Jerusalem.

firstLine: In the last days
rest:
the mountain where the Lord’s temple is located will be famous.
It will be the most important mountain of all.
It will stand out above the hills.
All of the nations will go to it.

firstLine: The Day of the Lord Is Coming
rest:
Lord, you have deserted the people of Jacob.
They are your people.
The land is full of false beliefs from the east.
The people practice evil magic, just as the Philistines do.
They make ungodly people their friends.

firstLine: He has set it apart for every high tower
rest: and every strong wall.

firstLine: He has set it apart for every trading ship
rest: and every beautiful boat.

firstLine: The Lord Will Judge Jerusalem and Judah
rest:
Here is what
the Lord who rules over all is about to do.
The Lord will take away from Jerusalem and Judah
supplies and help alike.
He will take away all of the supplies of food and water.

firstLine: A man will grab hold of one of his brothers
rest:
at his father’s home. He will say,
“You have a coat. So you be our leader.
Take charge of all of these broken-down buildings!”

firstLine: But at that time the brother will cry out,
rest:
“I can’t help you.
I don’t have any food or clothing in my house.
Don’t make me the leader of these people.”

firstLine: The Lord continues,
rest:
“The women in Zion are very proud.
They walk along with their noses in the air.
They tease men with their eyes.
They walk with quick, short steps.
Little chains jingle on their ankles.

firstLine: Instead of smelling sweet,
rest:
the women will smell bad.
Instead of wearing belts,
they will wear ropes.
Instead of having beautiful hair,
they won’t have any hair at all.
Instead of wearing fine clothes,
they’ll wear black clothes to show how sad they are.
Instead of being beautiful,
they’ll have the brands of slaves on their bodies.

firstLine: At that time seven women
rest:
will grab hold of one man.
They’ll say to him, “We will eat our own food.
We’ll provide our own clothes.
Just let us become your wives.
Take away our shame!”

firstLine: The Branch of the Lord
rest: At that time Israel’s king will be beautiful and glorious. He will be called The Branch of the Lord. The fruit of the land will be the pride and glory of those who are still left alive in Israel.

firstLine: The Song of the Vineyard
rest:
I will sing a song for the Lord.
He is the one I love.
It’s a song about his vineyard Israel.
The one I love had a vineyard.
It was on a hillside that had rich soil.

firstLine: So the Lord said, “People of Jerusalem and Judah,
rest: you be the judge between me and my vineyard.

firstLine: Now I will tell you
rest:
what I am going to do to my vineyard.
I will take away its fence.
And it will be destroyed.
I will break down its wall.
And people will walk all over it.

firstLine: The vineyard of the Lord who rules over all
rest:
is the nation of Israel.
The people of Judah
are the garden he takes delight in.
He kept looking for them to do what is fair.
But all he saw was blood being spilled.
He kept looking for them to do what is right.
But all he heard were cries of suffering.

firstLine: The Lord Judges His Vineyard
rest:
How terrible it will be for you who get too many houses!
How terrible for you who get too many fields!
Finally there won’t be any space left in the land.
Then you will live all alone.

firstLine: How terrible it will be for those who get up early in the morning
rest:
to start drinking!
How terrible for those who stay up late at night
until they are drunk with wine!

firstLine: But the Lord who rules over all will be honored
rest:
because he judges fairly.
The holy God will show that he is holy
by doing what is right.

firstLine: How terrible it will be for those who continue to sin
rest:
and lie about it!
How terrible for those who keep on doing what is evil
as if they were tied to it!

firstLine: How terrible for those who say,
rest:
“Let God hurry up and do what he says he will.
We want to see it happen.
Let the Holy One of Israel carry out his plan soon.
We want to know what it is.”

firstLine: How terrible it will be for those who say
rest:
