that what is evil is good!
How terrible for those who say
that what is good is evil!
How terrible for those who say
that darkness is light
and light is darkness!
How terrible for those who say
that what is bitter is sweet
and what is sweet is bitter!

firstLine: How terrible it will be for those
rest:
who are heroes at drinking wine!
How terrible for those
who are heroes at mixing drinks!

firstLine: How terrible for those
rest:
who take money to set guilty people free!
How terrible for those
who don’t treat good people fairly!

firstLine: The Lord Appoints Isaiah to Speak for Him
rest: In the year that King Uzziah died, I saw the Lord. He was seated on his throne. His long robe filled the temple. He was highly honored.

firstLine: Even if a tenth of the people remain there,
rest:
the land will be completely destroyed again.
But when oak trees and terebinth trees
are cut down, stumps are left.
And my holy people will be like stumps
that begin to grow again.”

firstLine: The Miraculous Sign of Immanuel
rest: Ahaz was king of Judah. Rezin was king of Aram. And Pekah was king of Israel. Rezin and Pekah marched up to fight against Jerusalem. But they couldn’t overpower it. Ahaz was the son of Jotham and the grandson of Uzziah. Pekah was the son of Remaliah.

firstLine: “‘But I am the Lord and King. I say,
rest:
“‘“That will not happen.
It will not take place.

firstLine: The Lord Uses Assyria to Judge Judah
rest: The Lord said to me, “Get a large scroll. Write ‘Maher-Shalal-Hash-Baz’ on it with a pen.

firstLine: “I am like the gently flowing stream of Siloam.
rest:
But the people of Judah have turned their backs on me.
They are filled with joy because of the fall of Rezin
and the son of Remaliah.

firstLine: So I am about to bring against these people
rest:
the king of Assyria and his whole army.
The Assyrians will be like the mighty Euphrates River
when it is flooding.
They will run over everything in their path.

firstLine: Have Respect for God
rest: The Lord put his powerful hand on me and spoke to me. He warned me not to live the way these people live. He said,

firstLine: “People of Judah, do not agree with those who say
rest:
Isaiah is guilty of treason.
Do not fear what they fear.
Do not be afraid.

firstLine: A Son Will Be Given to Us
rest: But there won’t be any more sadness for those who were suffering. In the past the Lord brought shame on the land of Zebulun. He also brought shame on the land of Naphtali. But in days to come he will honor Galilee, where people from other nations live. He will honor the land along the Mediterranean Sea. And he will honor the territory east of the Jordan River.

firstLine: The people who are now living in darkness
rest:
will see a great light.
They are now living in a very dark land.
But a light will shine on them.

firstLine: The Lord Is Angry With Israel
rest:
The Lord has sent a message against Jacob’s people.
He will punish Israel.

firstLine: “The brick buildings have fallen down.
rest:
But we will rebuild them with blocks of stone.
The fig trees have been chopped down.
But we’ll plant cedar trees in place of them.”

firstLine: Arameans from the east
rest:
have opened their mouths and swallowed Israel up.
So have Philistines from the west.
Even then, the Lord is still angry.
His hand is still raised against them.

firstLine: But his people have not returned
rest:
to the One who struck them down.
They haven’t turned for help
to the Lord who rules over all.

firstLine: How terrible it will be for you
rest:
who make laws that aren’t fair!
How terrible for you
who write laws that make life hard for others!

firstLine: The Lord Will Judge Assyria
rest:
The Lord says, “How terrible it will be for the people of Assyria!
They are the war club that carries out my anger.

firstLine: My powerful hand grabbed hold of kingdoms
rest:
whose people worship statues of gods.
They had more gods than Jerusalem and Samaria did.

firstLine: “The king of Assyria says,
rest:
“‘I have used my powerful hand
to take over all of those nations.
I am very wise.
I have great understanding.
I have wiped out the borders between nations.
I’ve taken their treasures.
Like a great hero I’ve brought their kings under my control.

firstLine: Does an ax claim to be more important
rest:
than the one who swings it?
Does a saw brag that it is better
than the one who uses it?
That would be like a stick
swinging someone who picks it up!
It would be like a war club
waving the one who carries it!

firstLine: He will completely destroy the beauty
rest:
of their forests and rich farm lands.
The Assyrian army will be like a sick man
who becomes weaker and weaker.

firstLine: Israel Will Return to the Lord
rest:
In days to come, some people will still be left alive in Israel.
They will be from Jacob’s family line.
But they won’t depend any longer on
the nation that struck them down.
Instead, they will truly depend on the Lord.
He is the Holy One of Israel.

firstLine: The people of Jacob who are still alive
rest: will return to the Mighty God.

firstLine: People of Zion, in days to come he will lift
rest:
the heavy load of the Assyrians from your shoulders.
He will remove their yokes from your necks.
They will be broken
because you have become so strong.

firstLine: A Branch Will Come From Jesse’s Family Line
rest:
Jesse’s family is like a tree that has been cut down.
A new little tree will grow from its stump.
From its roots a Branch will grow and produce fruit.

firstLine: The Branch will take delight
rest:
in respecting the Lord.
He will not judge things only by the way they look.
He won’t make decisions based simply on what people say.

firstLine: He will always do what is right
rest:
when he judges those who are in need.
He’ll be completely fair
when he makes decisions about poor people.
When he commands that people be punished,
it will happen.
When he orders that evil people be put to death,
it will take place.

firstLine: None of those animals will harm or destroy anything or anyone
rest:
on my holy mountain of Zion.
The oceans are full of water.
In the same way, the earth will be filled
with the knowledge of the Lord.

firstLine: The Lord will dry up
rest:
the Red Sea in Egypt.
With his powerful hand he’ll send a burning wind
to sweep over the Euphrates River.
He will break it up into many streams.
Then people will be able to go across it wearing sandals.

firstLine: There was a road the people of Israel used
rest:
when they came up from Egypt.
In the same way, there will be a wide road coming out of Assyria.
It will be used by the Lord’s people who are left alive there.

firstLine: Two Songs of Praise
rest:
In days to come, the people of Israel will sing,
“Lord, we will praise you.
You were angry with us.
But now your anger has turned away from us.
And you have brought us comfort.

firstLine: In days to come, the people of Israel will sing,
rest:
“Give thanks to the Lord. Worship him.
Tell the nations what he has done.
Announce how honored he is.

firstLine: A Message About Babylonia
rest: Here is the vision about Babylonia that Isaiah, the son of Amoz, saw.

firstLine: All of the stars in the sky
rest:
will stop giving their light.
The sun will be darkened as soon as it rises.
The moon will not shine.

firstLine: Outsiders who live in Babylonia will scatter
rest:
like antelope that are chased by a hunter.
They are like sheep that don’t have a shepherd.
All of them will return to their own people.
They will run back to their own countries.

firstLine: Their babies will be smashed to pieces
rest:
right in front of their eyes.
Their houses will be robbed.
Their wives will be raped.

firstLine: Instead, they will use their bows and arrows
rest:
to strike the young men down.
They won’t even show any mercy to babies.
They won’t take pity on children.

firstLine: Nations will help Israel
rest:
return to their own land.
People from other nations will belong to Israel.
They will serve them as male and female servants in the Lord’s land.
The Israelites will make prisoners of those who had held them as prisoners.
They will rule over those who had crushed them.

firstLine: “King of Babylonia, many people in the grave are really excited
rest:
about meeting you when you go down there.
The spirits of the dead get up to welcome you.
At one time all of them were leaders in the world.
They were kings over the nations.
They get up from their thrones.

firstLine: “King of Babylonia, you thought you were the bright morning star.
rest:
But now you have fallen from heaven!
You once brought nations down.
But now you have been thrown down to the earth!

firstLine: You said in your heart,
rest:
‘I will go up to heaven.
I’ll raise my throne
above the stars of God.
I’ll sit as king on the mountain where the gods meet.
I’ll set up my throne on the highest slopes of the sacred mountain.

firstLine: “Those who see you stare at you.
rest:
They think about what has happened to you.
They say to themselves,
‘Is this the man who shook the earth?
Is he the one who made kingdoms tremble with fear?

firstLine: “All of the kings of the nations are buried with honor.
rest: Each of them lies in his own tomb.

firstLine: “I will rise up against them,”
rest:
announces the Lord who rules over all.
“I will destroy Babylon.
It will not be remembered anymore.
No one will be left alive there.
I will destroy its people and their children after them,”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: “I will turn it into a place where nothing but owls can live.
rest:
I will turn it into a swamp.
I will sweep through it like a broom and destroy everything,”
announces the Lord who rules over all.

firstLine: A Message About Assyria
rest:
The Lord who rules over all has taken an oath. He has said,
“You can be sure that what I have planned will happen.
What I have decided will take place.

firstLine: A Message About the Philistines
rest: A message came to me from the Lord in the year King Ahaz died. The Lord said,

firstLine: “The rod of Assyria has struck all of you Philistines.
rest:
But do not be glad that it is broken.
That rod is like a snake that will produce an even more poisonous snake.
It will produce a darting, poisonous serpent.

firstLine: “Cities of Philistia, cry out for help! Scream in pain!
rest:
All of you Philistines, melt away in fear!
An army is coming from the north in a cloud of dust.
No one in its ranks is falling behind.

firstLine: What answer should be given
rest:
to the messengers from that nation?
Tell them, ‘The Lord has made Zion secure.
His suffering people will find safety there.’”

firstLine: A Message About Moab
rest:
Here is a message the Lord gave me about Moab.
The city of Ar in Moab is destroyed.
It happened in a single night.
Kir in Moab is also destroyed.
It happened in a single night.

firstLine: The people are trying to escape
rest:
through the Valley of the Poplar Trees.
They are carrying with them the wealth
they have collected and stored up.

firstLine: People of Moab, send lambs as a gift
rest:
to the ruler of Judah.
Send them from Sela.
Send them across the desert.
Send them to Mount Zion in the city of Jerusalem.

firstLine: The women of Moab are at the places
rest:
where people go across the Arnon River.
They are like birds that flap their wings
when they are pushed from their nest.

firstLine: The Moabites say to the rulers of Judah,
rest:
“Give us advice. Make a decision.
Cover us with your shadow.
Make it like night even at noon.
Hide those of us who are running away.
Don’t turn them over to their enemies.

firstLine: Messages About Damascus and Israel
rest:
Here is a message the Lord gave me about Damascus. He said,
“Damascus will not be a city anymore.
Instead, all of its buildings will be knocked down.

firstLine: “In days to come, the glory of Jacob’s people will fade.
rest: Their strength will get weaker and weaker.

firstLine: It will be as when a worker cuts and gathers grain
rest:
in the Valley of Rephaim.
He gathers up stalks with his arms.
Only a few heads of grain are left.

firstLine: They won’t trust in the altars
rest:
they made with their own hands.
They won’t pay any attention to the poles they used
to worship the goddess Asherah.
And they won’t depend on the incense altars
they made with their own fingers.

firstLine: A Message About Cush
rest:
How terrible it will be for the land
whose armies are like large numbers of flying insects!
That land is along the rivers of Cush.

firstLine: The Lord says to me,
rest:
“I will look down from heaven, where I live.
I will be as quiet as summer heat in the sunshine.
I will be as quiet as a cloud of dew in the heat of harvest.”

firstLine: A Message About Egypt
rest:
Here is a message the Lord gave me about Egypt.
The Lord is coming to Egypt.
He’s riding on a cloud that moves very fast.
The statues of the gods in Egypt tremble with fear because of him.
The hearts of the people there melt away inside them.

firstLine: I will hand the Egyptians over
rest:
to a mean and unkind master.
A powerful king will rule over them,” announces the Lord.
He is the Lord who rules over all.

firstLine: The Lord has given them
rest:
a spirit that makes them feel dizzy.
They make Egypt unsteady in everything it does.
Egypt is like a person who drinks too much.
He throws up and then walks around in the mess he’s made.

firstLine: A Message About Egypt and Cush
rest: Sargon sent his highest commander to the city of Ashdod. He attacked it and captured it. Sargon was king of Assyria.

firstLine: A Message About Babylonia
rest:
Here is a message the Lord gave me about Babylonia. It is known as the Desert by the Two Rivers.
An attack is coming through the desert.
It is coming from a land of terror.
It’s sweeping along like a windstorm blowing across the Negev Desert.

firstLine: The Lord said to me,
rest:
“Go. Put a guard on duty on Jerusalem’s walls.
Have him report what he sees.

firstLine: Tell him to watch for chariots
rest:
that are pulled by teams of horses.
Tell him to watch for men riding on donkeys or camels.
Make sure he stays awake.
Make sure he stays wide awake.”

firstLine: “My master!” the guard shouts back.
rest:
“Day after day I stand here on the lookout tower.
Every night I stay here on duty.

firstLine: My people, you have been crushed
rest:
like grain on a threshing floor.
But now I’m telling you the good news I’ve heard.
It comes from the Lord who rules over all.
He is the God of Israel.

firstLine: A Message About Edom
rest:
Here is a message the Lord gave me about Edom.
Someone is calling out to me from the land of Seir. He says,
“Guard, when will the night be over?
Guard, how soon will it end?”

firstLine: The guard answers,
rest:
“Morning is coming. But the night will return.
If you want to ask again,
come back and ask.”

firstLine: A Message About Arabia
rest:
Here is a message the Lord gave me about Arabia.
He told me to give orders to traders from Dedan.
They were camping in the bushes of Arabia.

firstLine: A Message About Jerusalem
rest:
Here is a message the Lord gave me about the Valley of Vision.
People of Jerusalem, what’s the matter with you?
Why have all of you gone up on the roofs of your houses?

firstLine: You saw that the City of David
rest:
had many holes in its walls.
They needed to be repaired.
You stored up water
in the Lower Pool.

firstLine: The Lord who rules over all
rest:
called out to you at that time.
The Lord told you to sob and cry.
He told you to tear your hair out.
And he told you to put black clothes on.

firstLine: ‘What are you doing here outside the city?
rest:
Who allowed you to cut out a tomb for yourself here?
Who said you could carve out your grave on the hillside?
Who allowed you to cut out your resting place in the rock?

firstLine: “‘Watch out, you mighty man!
rest:
The Lord is about to grab hold of you.
He is about to throw you away.

firstLine: A Message About Tyre
rest:
Here is a message the Lord gave me about Tyre.
Men in the ships of Tarshish, cry out!
The city of Tyre is destroyed.
Its houses and harbor are gone.
That’s the message you have received
from the island of Cyprus.

firstLine: Grain from Egypt
rest:
came across the mighty waters.
The harvest of the Nile River brought wealth to Tyre.
It became the market place of the nations.

firstLine: People of Tarshish, spread out over your land
rest:
like the waters of the Nile.
There isn’t anything to hold you back anymore.

firstLine: “Forgotten prostitute, pick up a harp.
rest:
Walk through the city.
Play the harp well. Sing many songs.
Then you will be remembered.”

firstLine: The Lord Will Destroy the Earth
rest:
The Lord is going to completely destroy everything on earth.
He will twist its surface.
He’ll scatter those who live on it.

firstLine: People of the earth,
rest: terror, a pit and a trap are waiting for you.

firstLine: Anyone who runs away from the terror
rest:
will fall into the pit.
Anyone who climbs out of the pit
will be caught in the trap.
The Lord will open the windows of the skies.
He will flood the land.
The foundations of the earth will shake.

firstLine: At that time the Lord will punish
rest:
the spiritual forces of evil in the heavens above.
He will also punish the kings on the earth below.

firstLine: They will be brought together
rest:
like prisoners in chains.
They’ll be locked up in prison.
After many days the Lord will punish them.

firstLine: The Lord who rules over all will rule
rest:
on Mount Zion in Jerusalem.
The elders of the city will be there.
They will see his glory.
His rule will be so glorious that the sun and moon
will be too ashamed to shine.

firstLine: A Song of Praise
rest:
Lord, you are my God.
I will honor you.
I will praise your name.
You have been perfectly faithful.
You have done wonderful things.
You had planned them long ago.

firstLine: On Mount Zion the Lord who rules over all will prepare
rest:
a feast for all of the nations.
The best and richest foods
and the finest aged wines will be served.

firstLine: On that mountain the Lord will destroy
rest:
the veil of sadness that covers all of the nations.
He will destroy the gloom that is spread over everyone.

firstLine: At that time they will say,
rest:
“He is our God.
We trusted in him, and he saved us.
He is the Lord. We trusted in him.
Let us be filled with joy because he saved us.”

firstLine: Another Song of Praise
rest:
At that time a song will be sung in the land of Judah. It will say,
“We have a strong city.
God’s saving power surrounds it
like walls and towers.

firstLine: Open its gates
rest:
so that those who do what is right can enter.
They are the people who remain faithful to God.

firstLine: Lord, you will give perfect peace
rest:
to anyone who commits himself to be faithful to you.
That’s because he trusts in you.

firstLine: “Trust in the Lord forever.
rest:
The Lord is the Rock.
The Lord will keep us safe forever.

firstLine: Israel Will Be Saved
rest:
At that time
the Lord will punish Leviathan with his sword.
His great, powerful and deadly sword will punish
the serpent that glides through the sea.
He will kill that twisting sea monster.

firstLine: “I am the Lord. I watch over my vineyard.
rest:
I water it all the time.
I guard it day and night.
I do it so no one can harm it.

firstLine: The Lord Will Judge Israel
rest:
How terrible it will be for the city of Samaria!
It sits on a hill like a crown of flowers.
The leaders of Ephraim are drunk.
They take pride in their city.
It sits above a valley that has rich soil.
How terrible it will be for the glorious beauty of that fading flower!

firstLine: At that time the Lord who rules over all
rest:
will be like a glorious crown.
He will be like a beautiful wreath
for those of his people who will be left alive.

firstLine: He will help those
rest:
who are fair when they judge.
He will give strength to those
who turn back their enemies at the city gate.

firstLine: He said to his people,
rest:
“I am offering you a resting place.
Let those who are tired rest.”
He continued, “I am offering you a place of peace and quiet.”
But they wouldn’t listen.

firstLine: Listen to the Lord’s message,
rest:
you who make fun of the truth.
Listen, you who rule over these people in Jerusalem.

firstLine: The Lord Will Judge Jerusalem
rest:
Jerusalem, how terrible it will be for you!
Ariel, you are the city where David settled.
The years will come and go.
Keep on celebrating your regular feasts.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“These people worship me only with their words.
They honor me by what they say.
But their hearts are far away from me.
Their worship doesn’t mean anything to me.
They teach nothing but human rules.

firstLine: So once more I will shock these people
rest:
with many wonderful acts.
I will destroy the wisdom of those who think they are so wise.
I will do away with the cleverness of those who think they are so smart.”

firstLine: How terrible it will be for people who do everything they can
rest:
to hide their plans from the Lord!
They do their work in darkness.
They think, “Who sees us? Who will know?”

firstLine: I will give understanding to you
rest:
who find yourselves going down the wrong path.
You who are always speaking against others
will accept what I teach you.”

firstLine: The Lord Will Judge His Stubborn People
rest:
“How terrible it will be for these stubborn children of mine!”
announces the Lord.
“How terrible for those who carry out plans that did not come from me!
Their agreement with Egypt did not come from my Spirit.
So they pile up one sin on top of another.

firstLine: They go down to Egypt
rest:
without asking me for advice.
They look to Pharaoh to help them.
They ask Egypt to keep them safe.

firstLine: But the people of Judah will be put to shame
rest:
because they are trusting in a nation that is useless to them.
Egypt will not bring them any help or advantage.
Instead, it will bring them shame and dishonor.”

firstLine: They say to the seers,
rest:
‘Don’t see any more visions!’
They say to the prophets,
‘Don’t give us any more visions of what is right!
Tell us pleasant things.
Prophesy things we want to hear even if they aren’t true.

firstLine: When one of them dares you to fight,
rest:
a thousand of you will run away.
When five of them dare you,
all of you will run away.
So few of you will be left that you will be
like a flagpole on top of a mountain.
You will be like only one banner on a hill.”

firstLine: The Lord will come from far away
rest:
in all of his power and glory.
He will show his burning anger.
Thick clouds of smoke will be all around him.
His mouth will speak angry words.
The words from his tongue will be like a destroying fire.

firstLine: His breath will be like a rushing flood
rest:
that rises up to the neck.
He’ll separate out the nations he is going to destroy.
He’ll place a bit in their jaws.
It will lead them down the road to death.

firstLine: You will sing
rest:
as you do on the night you celebrate a holy feast.
Your hearts will be filled with joy.
You will be as joyful as people playing their flutes
as they go up to the mountain of the Lord.
He is the Rock of Israel.

firstLine: He will strike them
rest:
with his rod to punish them.
Each time he does, his people will celebrate
with the music of harps and tambourines.
He will use his powerful arm
to strike the Assyrians down in battle.

firstLine: The Lord Will Judge Those Who Depend on Egypt
rest:
How terrible it will be for those who go down to Egypt for help!
How terrible for those who depend on horses!
They trust in how many chariots they have.
They trust in how strong their horsemen are.
But they don’t look to the Holy One of Israel.
They don’t ask the Lord for his help.

firstLine: The Lord says to me,
rest:
“A powerful lion stands over its food and growls.
A lot of shepherds can be brought together to drive it away.
But the lion is not frightened by their shouts.
It is not upset by the noise they make.
In the same way, I will come down from heaven.
I will fight on Mount Zion and on its hills.
Nothing will drive me away.
I am the Lord who rules over all.

firstLine: Their hiding places will be destroyed
rest:
when terror strikes them.
When their commanders see their enemy’s battle flags,
they will be filled with panic,”
announces the Lord.
His fire blazes out from Mount Zion.
His furnace burns in Jerusalem.

firstLine: The King Who Will Do What Is Right
rest:
A king will come who will do what is right.
His officials will govern fairly.

firstLine: The Sinful Women in Jerusalem
rest:
You women who are so contented,
pay attention to me.
You who feel so secure,
listen to what I have to say.

firstLine: That will continue until the Holy Spirit
rest:
is poured out on us from heaven.
Then the desert will be turned into rich farm lands.
The rich farm lands will seem like a forest.

firstLine: In the desert and the rich farm lands
rest:
people will do what is right.
And they will treat one another fairly.

firstLine: The Lord Will Judge Assyria
rest:
How terrible it will be for you, you who destroy others!
Assyria, you haven’t been destroyed yet.
How terrible for you, you who turn against others!
Others haven’t turned against you yet.
When you stop destroying,
you will be destroyed.
When you stop turning against others,
others will turn against you.

firstLine: “Now I will take action,” says the Lord.
rest:
“Now I will be honored.
Now I will be respected.

firstLine: “You nations far away, listen to what I have done!
rest: My people who are near, recognize how powerful I am!

firstLine: The Lord Will Judge the Nations
rest:
Nations, come near and listen to me!
Pay attention to what I’m about to say.
Let the earth and everything in it listen.
Let the world and everything that comes out of it pay attention.

firstLine: The people and their leaders will be killed
rest:
like wild oxen and young bulls.
Their land will be wet with their blood.
The dust will be covered with their fat.

firstLine: Edom’s nobles won’t have anything left there
rest:
that can be called a kingdom.
All of its princes will vanish.

firstLine: The Lord Will Set His People Free
rest:
The desert and the dry ground will be glad.
The dry places will be full of joy.
Flowers will grow there.
Like the first crocus in the spring,

firstLine: Say to those whose hearts are afraid,
rest:
“Be strong. Do not fear.
Your God will come.
He will pay your enemies back.
He will come to save you.”

firstLine: Sennacherib Warns Jerusalem
rest: Sennacherib attacked and captured all of the cities of Judah that had high walls around them. It was in the 14th year of the rule of Hezekiah. Sennacherib was king of Assyria.

firstLine: Isaiah Prophesies That Jerusalem Will Be Saved
rest: When King Hezekiah heard what the field commander had said, he tore his clothes. He put on black clothes. Then he went into the Lord’s temple.

firstLine: Hezekiah Prays to the Lord
rest: When Hezekiah received the letter from the messengers, he read it. Then he went up to the Lord’s temple. There he spread the letter out in front of the Lord.

firstLine: Sennacherib Falls From Power
rest: I sent a message to Hezekiah. I said, “The Lord is the God of Israel. He says, ‘You have prayed to me about Sennacherib, the king of Assyria.

firstLine: Through your messengers
rest:
you have laughed at me again and again.
And you have said,
‘I have many chariots.
With them I have climbed to the tops of the mountains.
I’ve climbed the highest mountains in Lebanon.
I’ve cut down its tallest cedar trees.
I’ve cut down the best of its pine trees.
I’ve reached its farthest mountains.
I’ve reached its finest forests.

firstLine: “‘“But I, the Lord, say, ‘Haven’t you heard what I have done?
rest:
Long ago I arranged for you to do all of that.
In days of old I planned it.
Now I have made it happen.
You have turned cities with high walls
into piles of stone.

firstLine: “‘“‘But I know where you live.
rest:
I know when you come and go.
I know how very angry you are with me.

firstLine: “Here is a message from me about the king of Assyria. It says,
rest:
“‘He will not enter this city.
He will not even shoot an arrow at it.
He will not come near it with a shield.
He will not build a ramp in order to climb over its walls.

firstLine: “I will guard this city and save it.
rest:
I will do it for myself.
And I will do it for my servant David.”

firstLine: Hezekiah Praises the Lord for Healing Him
rest: In those days Hezekiah became very sick. He knew he was about to die. I went to see him. I told him, “The Lord says, ‘Put everything in order. Make out your will. You are going to die soon. You will not get well again.’”

firstLine: I said, “Lord, I’ll never see you again
rest:
while I’m still alive.
I’ll never see people anymore.
I’ll never again be with those who live in this world.

firstLine: “But what can I say?
rest:
You have promised to heal me.
And you yourself have done it.
Once I was proud and bitter.
But now I will live the rest of my life free of pride.

firstLine: I’m sure it was for my benefit
rest:
that I suffered such great pain.
You love me. You kept me
from going down into the pit of death.
You have put all of my sins
behind your back.

firstLine: “You will save me.
rest:
So we will sing and play music on stringed instruments.
We will sing all the days of our lives
in your temple.”

firstLine: Messengers Come From Babylon to Hezekiah
rest: At that time Merodach-Baladan, the king of Babylonia, sent Hezekiah letters and a gift. He had heard that Hezekiah had been sick but had gotten well again. Merodach-Baladan was the son of Baladan.

firstLine: God Comforts His People
rest:
“Comfort my people,” says your God.
“Comfort them.

firstLine: A messenger is calling out,
rest:
“In the desert prepare
the way for the Lord.
Make a straight road through it
for our God.

firstLine: But someone who is too poor to bring that kind of offering
rest:
will choose some wood that won’t rot.
Then he looks for a skilled worker.
He pays the worker to make a statue of a god that won’t fall over.

firstLine: “So who will you compare me to?
rest: Who is equal to me?” says the Holy One.

firstLine: Family of Jacob, why do you say,
rest:
“The Lord doesn’t notice our condition”?
People of Israel, why do you say,
“Our God doesn’t pay any attention to our rightful claims”?

firstLine: But those who trust in the Lord
rest:
will receive new strength.
They will fly as high as eagles.
They will run and not get tired.
They will walk and not grow weak.

firstLine: The Lord Helps Israel
rest:
The Lord says, “People who live on the islands,
come and stand quietly in front of me.
Let the nations gain new strength
in order to state their case.
Let them come forward and speak.
Let us go to court and find out who is right.

firstLine: “Who has stirred up a king from the east?
rest:
Who has helped him win his battles?
I hand nations over to him.
I bring kings under his control.
He turns them into dust with his sword.
With his bow he turns them into straw blowing in the wind.

firstLine: “All those who are angry with you will be put to shame.
rest:
And they will be dishonored.
Those who oppose you will be destroyed.
And they will vanish.

firstLine: “Those who are poor and needy search for water.
rest:
But there isn’t any.
Their tongues are dry because they are thirsty.
But I will help them. I am the Lord.
I will not desert them.
I am Israel’s God.

firstLine: Then people will see and know
rest:
that my powerful hand has done it.
They will consider and understand
that I have created it.
I am the Holy One of Israel.”

firstLine: The Lord says to the nations and their gods,
rest:
“State your case.”
Jacob’s King says to them,
“Prove your case to me.

firstLine: “I have stirred up a king
rest:
who will come from the north.
He lives in the east.
He will bring honor to me.
He walks all over rulers as if they were mud.
He steps on them just as a potter stomps on clay.

firstLine: Which one of you gods said those things
rest:
would happen before they did?
Who told us about them
so we could know them?
Who told us ahead of time?
Who told us so we could say,
‘You are right’?
None of you told us about them.
None of you told us ahead of time.
In fact, no one heard you say anything at all.

firstLine: I look, but there is no one
rest:
among the gods that can give me advice.
None of them can answer
when I ask them the simplest question.

firstLine: The Lord’s Chosen Servant
rest:
“Here is my servant. I take good care of him.
I have chosen him. I am very pleased with him.
I will put my Spirit on him.
He will make everything right among the nations.

firstLine: “I, the Lord, have chosen you to do what is right.
rest:
I will take hold of your hand.
I will keep you safe.
You will put my covenant with the people of Israel into effect.
And you will be a light for the other nations.

firstLine: “I am the Lord. That is my name!
rest:
I will not let any other god share my glory.
I will not let statues of gods share my praise.

firstLine: A Song of Praise to the Lord
rest:
Sing a new song to the Lord.
Sing praise to him from one end of the earth to the other.
Sing, you who sail out on the ocean.
Sing, all of you creatures in it.
Sing, you islands.
Sing, all of you who live there.

firstLine: Israel Can’t See or Hear
rest:
“Israel, listen to me! You can hear,
but you do not understand.
Look to me! You can see,
but you do not know what you are seeing.

firstLine: The Lord wanted his people to see
rest:
how great and glorious his law is.
He wanted to show them
that he always does what is right.

firstLine: The Lord Saves Israel
rest:
Family of Jacob, the Lord created you.
People of Israel, he formed you.
He says, “Do not be afraid.
I will set you free.
I will send for you by name.
You belong to me.

firstLine: “People of Israel, you are my witnesses,” announces the Lord.
rest:
“I have chosen you to be my servants.
I wanted you to know me and believe in me.
I wanted you to understand that I am the one and only God.
Before me, there was no other god at all.
And there will not be any god after me.

firstLine: “And that is not all! I have always been God,
rest:
and I always will be.
No one can save people from my powerful hand.
When I do something, who can undo it?”

firstLine: The Lord Forgives Israel but Also Punishes Them
rest:
The Lord sets his people free.
He is the Holy One of Israel. He says,
“People of Israel, I will send an army to Babylon to save you.
I will cause all of the Babylonians to run away.
They will try to escape in the ships they were so proud of.

firstLine: Long ago the Lord opened
rest:
a way for his people to go through the Red Sea.
He made a path through the mighty waters.

firstLine: “Forget the things that happened in the past.
rest: Do not keep on thinking about them.

firstLine: “Family of Jacob, you have not prayed to me as you should.
rest: People of Israel, you have not even begun to get tired while doing it.

firstLine: “I am the one who wipes out your lawless acts.
rest:
I do it because of who I am.
I will not remember your sins anymore.

firstLine: The Lord Chooses Israel
rest:
“Family of Jacob, listen to me. You are my servants.
People of Israel, I have chosen you.

firstLine: Worship the Lord, Not Other Gods
rest:
“I am Israel’s King. I set them free.
I am the Lord who rules over all.
So listen to what I am saying.
I am the First and the Last.
I am the one and only God.

firstLine: People Will Live in Jerusalem Again
rest:
The Lord says,
“People of Israel, I set you free.
I formed you when you were born as a nation.
“I am the Lord. I have made everything.
I alone spread out the heavens.
I formed the earth by myself.

firstLine: “Some prophets are not really prophets at all.
rest:
I show that their miraculous signs are fake.
I make those who practice evil magic look foolish.
I destroy the learning of those who think they are wise.
Their knowledge does not make any sense at all.

firstLine: I say to the deep waters,
rest: ‘Dry up. Let your streams become dry.’

firstLine: I say about Cyrus,
rest:
‘He is my shepherd.
He will accomplish everything I want him to.
He will say about Jerusalem,
“Let it be rebuilt.”
And he will say about the temple,
“Let its foundations be laid.”’

firstLine: “Cyrus is my anointed king.
rest:
I take hold of his right hand.
I give him the power
to bring nations under his control.
I help him strip kings of their power
to go to war against him.
I break city gates open so he can go through them.
I say to him,

firstLine: ‘I will march out ahead of you.
rest:
I will make the mountains level.
I will break down bronze gates.
I will cut through their heavy iron bars.

firstLine: “‘Rain down godliness, you heavens above.
rest:
Let the clouds shower it down.
Let the earth open wide to receive it.
Let freedom spring to life.
Let godliness grow along with it.
I have created all of those things.
I am the Lord.’”

firstLine: How terrible it will be for anyone who says to his father,
rest:
“Why did you give me life?”
How terrible for anyone who says to his mother,
“Why have you brought me into the world?”

firstLine: The Lord says to the people of Jerusalem,
rest:
“You will get everything Egypt produces.
You will receive everything the people of Cush
and the tall Sabeans get in trade.
All of it will belong to you.
And all of those people will walk behind you as slaves.
They will be put in chains and come over to you.
They will bow down to you.
They will admit,
‘God is with you.
There is no other God.’”

firstLine: “Come together, you people of the nations
rest:
who escaped from Babylonia.
Gather together and come into court.
Only people who do not know anything
would carry around gods that are made out of wood.
They pray to gods that can’t save them.

firstLine: “All of you who live anywhere on earth,
rest:
turn to me and be saved.
I am God. There is no other God.

firstLine: There Is No Other God
rest:
The gods Bel and Nebo are brought down in shame.
The statues of them are being carried away on the backs of animals.
They used to be carried around by the people who worshiped them.
But now they’ve become a heavy load for tired animals.

firstLine: “Who will you compare me to?
rest:
Who is equal to me?
What am I like?
Who can you compare me to?

firstLine: “Remember what happened in the past.
rest:
Think about what took place long ago.
I am God. There is no other God.
I am God. There is no one like me.

firstLine: Babylon Will Fall
rest:
“City of Babylon,
go down and sit in the dust.
Leave your throne and sit on the ground.
City of the Babylonians,
your life will not be comfortable
and easy anymore.

firstLine: The Lord says, “City of the Babylonians,
rest:
go into a dark prison and sit there quietly.
You will not be called
the queen of kingdoms anymore.

firstLine: “So listen, you who love pleasure.
rest:
You think you are safe and secure.
You say to yourself,
‘I am like a god.
No one is greater than I am.
I’ll never be a widow.
And my children will never be taken away from me.’

firstLine: “So keep on casting your magic spells.
rest:
Keep on practicing your evil magic.
You have been doing those things ever since you were a child.
Perhaps they will help you.
Maybe they will scare your enemies away.

firstLine: All of the advice you have received
rest:
has only worn you out!
Let those who study the heavens come forward.
They claim to know what is going to happen
by watching the stars every month.
So let them save you from the trouble
that is coming on you.

firstLine: Israel Is Stubborn
rest:
People of Jacob, listen to me.
You are called by the name of Israel.
You come from the family line of Judah.
You take oaths in the name of the Lord.
You pray to Israel’s God.
But you aren’t honest.
You don’t mean what you say.

firstLine: “Long ago I told you ahead of time what would happen.
rest:
I announced it and made it known.
Then all of a sudden I acted.
And those things took place.

firstLine: Israel Is Set Free
rest:
“Family of Jacob, listen to me.
People of Israel, pay attention.
I have chosen you.
I am the First and the Last.
I am the Lord.

firstLine: “People of Israel, come together and listen to me.
rest:
What other god has said ahead of time that certain things would happen?
I have chosen Cyrus.
He will carry out my plans against Babylon.
He will use his powerful arm against the Babylonians.

firstLine: “Come close and listen to me.
rest:
“From the first time I said Cyrus was coming,
I did not do it in secret.
When he comes, I will be there.”
The Lord and King has filled me with his Spirit.
People of Israel, he has sent me to you.

firstLine: The Servant of the Lord
rest:
People who live on the islands, listen to me.
Pay attention, you nations far away.
Before I was born the Lord chose me to serve him.
He appointed me by name.

firstLine: But I said, “In spite of my hard work,
rest:
I feel as if I haven’t accomplished anything.
I’ve used up all of my strength.
It seems as if everything I’ve done is worthless.
But the Lord will give me what I should receive.
My God will reward me.”

firstLine: The Lord says to me,
rest:
“It is not enough for you as my servant
to bring the tribes of Jacob back to their land.
It is not enough for you to bring back
the people of Israel I have kept alive.
I will also make you a light for other nations.
Then you will make it possible for the whole world to be saved.”

firstLine: Israel Is Brought Back to Their Land
rest:
The Lord says to his servant,
“When it is time to show you my favor, I will answer your prayers.
When it is time to save you, I will help you.
I will keep you safe.
You will put my covenant with the people of Israel into effect.
Then their land will be made like new again.
Each tribe will be sent back to its territory that was left empty.

firstLine: The Lord answers, “Can a mother forget the baby
rest:
who is nursing at her breast?
Can she stop showing her tender love
to the child who was born to her?
She might forget her child.
But I will not forget you.

firstLine: “Zion, you were destroyed. Your land was left empty.
rest:
It was turned into a dry and empty desert.
But now you will be too small to hold all of your people.
And those who destroyed you will be far away.

firstLine: The children who were born during your time of sorrow
rest:
will speak to you. They will say,
‘This city is too small for us.
Give us more space to live in.’

firstLine: Then you will say to yourself,
rest:
‘Whose children are these?
I lost my children.
And I couldn’t have any more.
My children were taken far away from me.
And no one wanted them.
Who brought these children up?
I was left all alone.
So where have these children come from?’”

firstLine: The Lord and King continues,
rest:
“I will call out to the nations.
I will give a signal to them.
They will bring back your sons in their arms.
They will carry your daughters on their shoulders.

firstLine: “Yes, they can,” the Lord answers.
rest:
“Prisoners will be taken away from soldiers.
Stolen goods will be taken back from the powerful Babylonians.
Zion, I will fight against those who fight against you.
And I will save your people.

firstLine: The Lord’s Servant Obeys Him
rest:
The Lord says to the people in Jerusalem,
“Do you think I divorced your people before you?
Is that why I sent them away?
If it is, show me the letter of divorce.
I did not sell you into slavery to pay someone I owe.
You were sold because you sinned against me.
Your people were sent away because of their lawless acts.

firstLine: But all of you sinners who light fires
rest:
should go ahead and walk in their light.
You who carry flaming torches
should walk in their light.
Here’s what I’m going to do to you.
I’ll make you lie down in great pain.

firstLine: Zion Will Be Saved
rest:
The Lord says, “Listen to me, you who want to do what is right.
Pay attention, you who look to me.
Consider the rock you were cut out of.
Think about the rock pit you were dug from.

firstLine: “Listen to me, my people.
rest:
Pay attention, my nation.
My law will go out to the nations.
I make everything right.
That will be a guiding light for them.

firstLine: “Listen to me, you who know what is right.
rest:
Pay attention, you who have my law in your hearts.
Do not be afraid when mere people make fun of you.
Do not be terrified when they laugh at you.

firstLine: The Lord says to his people,
rest:
“I comfort you because of who I am.
Why are you afraid of mere men?
They are only human beings.
They are like grass that dries up.

firstLine: The Cup of the Lord’s Burning Anger
rest:
Wake up, Jerusalem!
Wake up! Get up!
The Lord has handed you the cup of his burning anger.
And you have drunk from it.
That cup makes men unsteady on their feet.
And you have drunk from it to the very last drop.

firstLine: None of the children who were born to you
rest:
are left to guide you.
None of the children you brought up
are left to lead you by the hand.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“When you were sold as slaves, no one paid anything for you.
Now no one will pay any money to set you free.”

firstLine: The Lord and King continues,
rest:
“Long ago my people went down to Egypt.
They lived there for a while.
Later, Assyria crushed them without any reason.

firstLine: “Now look at what has happened to them,” announces the Lord.
rest:
“Once again my people have been taken away.
And no one paid anything for them.
Those who rule over them brag about it,”
announces the Lord.
“All day long without stopping,
people speak evil things against my name.

firstLine: What a beautiful sight it is
rest:
to see messengers coming with good news!
How beautiful to see them coming down from the mountains
with a message about peace!
How wonderful it is when they bring the good news
that we are saved!
How wonderful when they say to Zion,
“Your God rules!”

firstLine: Burst into songs of joy together,
rest:
you broken-down buildings in Jerusalem.
The Lord has comforted his people.
He has set Jerusalem free.

firstLine: The Suffering and Glory of the Lord’s Servant
rest:
The Lord says, “My servant will act wisely and accomplish his task.
He will be highly honored. He will be greatly respected.

firstLine: The Lord says, “It was my plan to crush him
rest:
and cause him to suffer.
I made his life a guilt offering to pay for sin.
But he will see all of his children after him.
In fact, he will continue to live.
My plan will be brought about through him.

firstLine: Jerusalem Will Be Glorious
rest:
“Jerusalem, sing!
You are now like a woman who never had a child.
Burst into song! Shout with joy!
You who have never had labor pains,
you are now all alone.
But you will have more children than a woman who still has a husband,”
says the Lord.

firstLine: “Make a large area for your tent.
rest:
Spread out its curtains.
Go ahead and make your tent wider.
Make its ropes longer.
Drive the stakes down deeper.

firstLine: “Do not be afraid. You will not be put to shame anymore.
rest:
Do not be afraid of being dishonored.
People will no longer make fun of you.
You will forget the time when you suffered as slaves in Egypt.
You will no longer remember the shame
of being a widow in Babylonia.

firstLine: “For a brief moment I left you.
rest: But because I love you so much, I will bring you back.

firstLine: “During Noah’s time I took an oath and made a promise.
rest:
I said I would never cover the earth with water again.
In the same way, I have promised not to be angry with you.
I will never punish you again.

firstLine: “Suffering city, you have been beaten by storms.
rest:
You have not been comforted.
I will rebuild you with turquoise stones.
I will rebuild your foundations with sapphires.

firstLine: When you do what is right,
rest:
you will be made secure.
Your leaders will not be mean to you.
You will not have anything to be afraid of.
You will not be terrified anymore.
Terror will not come near you.

firstLine: “I created blacksmiths.
rest:
They fan the coals into flames of fire.
They make weapons that are fit for their work.
I also created those who destroy others.

firstLine: The Lord Invites His People to Come to Him
rest:
“Come, all of you who are thirsty.
Come and drink the water I offer to you.
You who do not have any money, come.
Buy and eat the grain I give you.
Come and buy wine and milk.
You will not have to pay anything for it.

firstLine: “My thoughts are not like your thoughts.
rest:
And your ways are not like my ways,”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: “The heavens are higher than the earth.
rest:
And my ways are higher than your ways.
My thoughts are higher than your thoughts.

firstLine: The rain and the snow
rest:
come down from the sky.
They do not return to it
without watering the earth.
They make plants come up and grow.
The plants produce seeds for farmers.
They also produce food for people to eat.

firstLine: “My people, you will leave Babylonia with joy.
rest:
You will be led out of it in peace.
The mountains and hills
will burst into song as you go.
And all of the trees in the fields
will clap their hands.

firstLine: The Lord Will Save Those Who Come to Him
rest:
The Lord says,
“Do what is fair and right.
I will soon come and save you.
Soon everyone will know that what I do is right.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“Suppose some eunuchs keep my Sabbath days.
They choose to do what pleases me.
And they are faithful in keeping my covenant.

firstLine: “Suppose outsiders want to follow me
rest:
and serve me.
They want to love me
and worship me.
They keep the Sabbath day and do not misuse it.
And they are faithful in keeping my covenant.

firstLine: The Lord and King will gather
rest:
those who were taken away from their homes in Israel.
He announces, “I will gather them to myself.
And I will gather others to join them.”

firstLine: The Lord Judges Israel’s Evil Leaders
rest:
Come, all of you enemy nations! Come like wild animals.
Come and destroy like animals in the forest.

firstLine: “Come!” they shout. “Let’s get some wine!
rest:
Let’s drink all the beer we can!
Tomorrow we’ll do the same thing.
And that will be even better than today.”

firstLine: Those who lead honest lives
rest: will enjoy peace and rest when they die.

firstLine: The Lord says, “Come here,
rest:
you children of women who practice evil magic!
You are children of prostitutes and those who commit adultery.

firstLine: “Who are you so afraid of
rest:
that you have not been true to me?
You have not remembered me.
You do not even care about me.
I have not punished you for a long time.
That is why you are not afraid of me.

firstLine: The Lord Comforts Those Who Aren’t Proud
rest:
A messenger says,
“Build up the road! Build it up! Get it ready!
Remove anything that would keep my people from coming back.”

firstLine: What True Worship Is All About
rest:
The Lord told me,
“Shout out loud. Do not hold back.
Raise your voice like a trumpet.
Tell my people that they have refused to obey me.
Tell the family of Jacob how much they have sinned.

firstLine: ‘We have gone without food,’ they say.
rest:
‘Why haven’t you noticed it?
We have made ourselves suffer.
Why haven’t you paid any attention to us?’
“On the day when you fast, you do as you please.
You take advantage of all of your workers.

firstLine: “Here is the way I want you to fast.
rest:
“Set free those who are held by chains without any reason.
Untie the ropes that hold people as slaves.
Set free those who are crushed.
Break every evil chain.

firstLine: “Do not work on the Sabbath day.
rest:
Do not do just anything you want to on my holy day.
Make the Sabbath a day you can enjoy.
Honor my holy day.
Do not work on it.
Do not do just anything you want to.
Do not talk about things that are worthless.

firstLine: The Lord Sets His People Free
rest:
People of Israel, the Lord’s arm is not too weak to save you.
His ears aren’t too deaf to hear your cry for help.

firstLine: “I set my people free. I will come to Mount Zion.
rest:
I will come to those in Jacob’s family who turn away from their sins,”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: Zion Will Be Glorious
rest:
“People of Jerusalem, get up.
Shine, because your light has come.
My glory will shine on you.

firstLine: “Look up. Look all around you.
rest:
All of your people are getting together to come back to you.
Your sons will come from far away.
Your daughters will be carried like little children.

firstLine: “Whose ships are these that sail along like clouds?
rest: They fly like doves to their nests.

firstLine: “People from other lands will rebuild your walls.
rest:
Their kings will serve you.
When I was angry with you, I struck you.
But now I will show you my tender love.

firstLine: “Lebanon’s glorious trees will be brought to you.
rest:
Its pines, firs and cypress trees will be brought.
They will be used to make my temple beautiful.
And I will bring glory to the place where my throne is.

firstLine: “You have been deserted and hated.
rest:
No one even travels through you.
But I will make you into something to be proud of forever.
You will be a place of joy for all time to come.

firstLine: The Lord’s Servant Accomplishes His Work
rest:
The Spirit of the Lord and King is on me.
The Lord has anointed me
to tell the good news to poor people.
He has sent me to comfort
those whose hearts have been broken.
He has sent me to announce freedom
for those who have been captured.
He wants me to set prisoners free
from their dark prisons.

firstLine: He has sent me to announce the year
rest:
when he will set his people free.
He wants me to announce the day
when he will pay his enemies back.
Our God has sent me to comfort all those who are sad.

firstLine: Instead of being put to shame
rest:
my people will receive a double share of wealth.
Instead of being dishonored
they will be glad to be in their land.
They will receive a double share of riches there.
And they’ll be filled with joy that will last forever.

firstLine: The people of Jerusalem will say,
rest:
“We take great delight in the Lord.
We are joyful because we belong to our God.
He has dressed us with salvation as if it were our clothes.
He has put robes of godliness on us.
We are like a groom who is dressed up for his wedding.
We are like a bride who decorates herself with her jewels.

firstLine: The Lord Gives Zion a New Name
rest:
The Lord says, “For the good of Zion I will not keep silent.
For Jerusalem’s benefit I will not remain quiet.
I will not keep silent until its people’s godliness
shines like the sunrise.
I will not remain quiet until they are saved
and shine like a blazing torch.

firstLine: Jerusalem, the nations will see
rest:
that I have made everything right for you.
All of their kings will see your glory.
You will be called by a new name.
I myself will give it to you.

firstLine: As a young man gets married to a young woman,
rest:
your people will marry you.
As a groom is happy with his bride,
I will be full of joy over you.”

firstLine: And don’t give him any rest
rest:
until he makes Jerusalem secure.
Don’t give him any peace
until people all over the earth praise that city.

firstLine: The Lord has announced a message
rest:
from one end of the earth to the other.
He has said, “Tell the people of Zion,
‘Look! Your Savior is coming!
He is bringing his people back as his reward.
He has won the battle over their enemies.’”

firstLine: God Will Save His People and Punish Their Enemies
rest:
Who is this man coming from the city of Bozrah in Edom?
His clothes are stained bright red.
Who is he? He is dressed up in all of his glory.
He is marching toward us with great strength.
The Lord answers, “It is I.
I have won the battle.
I am mighty.
I have saved my people.”

firstLine: The Lord answers, “I have been stomping on the nations
rest:
as if they were grapes.
No one was there to help me.
I walked all over the nations because I was angry.
That is why I stomped on them.
Their blood splashed all over my clothes.
So my clothes were stained bright red.

firstLine: Isaiah Prays to the Lord
rest:
I will talk about the kind things the Lord has done.
I’ll praise him for everything he’s done for us.
He has done many good things
for the nation of Israel.
That’s because he loves us and is very kind to us.

firstLine: He used his glorious and powerful arm
rest:
to help Moses.
He parted the waters of the sea in front of them.
That mighty act made him famous forever.

firstLine: Like cattle that are taken down to the flatlands,
rest:
they were given rest by the Spirit of the Lord.”
That’s how he guided his people.
So he made a glorious name for himself.

firstLine: I wish you would open up your heavens
rest:
and come down to us!
I wish the mountains would tremble
when you show your power!

firstLine: The Lord Answers Isaiah’s Prayer
rest:
The Lord says, “I made myself known to those who were not asking for me.
I was found by those who were not trying to find me.
I spoke to a nation that did not pray to me.
‘Here I am,’ I said. ‘Here I am.’

firstLine: All day long I have held out my hands
rest:
to welcome a stubborn nation.
They lead sinful lives.
They go where their evil thoughts take them.

firstLine: “I will judge them. I have even written it down.
rest:
I will not keep silent.
Instead, I will pay them back for all of their sins.

firstLine: I will punish them for their sins
rest:
and the sins of their people before them,”
says the Lord.
“They burned sacrifices on the mountains.
They disobeyed me by worshiping other gods on the hills.
So I will really punish them
for all of the sins they have committed.”

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“Sometimes juice is still left in grapes that have been crushed.
So people say, ‘Don’t destroy them.
Some good juice is still left in them.’
That is what I will do for the good of those who serve me.
I will not destroy all of my people.

firstLine: I will give children
rest:
to the families of Jacob and Judah.
They will possess my entire land.
My chosen people will be given all of it.
Those who serve me will live there.

firstLine: “But some of you have deserted me.
rest:
You no longer worship on my holy mountain of Zion.
You spread a table for the god that is called Good Fortune.
You offer bowls of mixed wine to the god named Fate.

firstLine: So the Lord and King says,
rest:
“Those who serve me will have food to eat.
But you will be hungry.
My servants will have plenty to drink.
But you will be thirsty.
Those who serve me will be full of joy.
But you will be put to shame.

firstLine: My servants will sing
rest:
with joy in their hearts.
But you will cry out
because of the great pain in your hearts.
You will cry because your spirits are sad.

firstLine: My chosen ones will use your names
rest:
when they call down curses on others.
I am your Lord and King.
I will put you to death.
But I will give new names to those who serve me.

firstLine: The Lord Will Create New Heavens and a New Earth
rest:
“I will create new heavens and a new earth.
The things that have happened before will not be remembered.
They will not even enter your minds.

firstLine: So be glad and full of joy forever
rest:
because of what I will create.
I will cause others to take delight in Jerusalem.
They will be filled with joy
when they see its people.

firstLine: “Babies in Jerusalem will no longer
rest:
live only a few days.
Old people will not fail
to live for a very long time.
Those who live to the age of 100
will be thought of as still being young when they die.
Those who die before they are 100
will be considered as having been under God’s curse.

firstLine: They will no longer build houses
rest:
only to have others live in them.
They will no longer plant crops
only to have others eat them.
My people will live to be as old as trees.
My chosen ones will enjoy for a long time
the things they have worked for.

firstLine: The Lord Judges Some People and Blesses Others
rest:
The Lord says,
“Heaven is my throne.
The earth is under my control.
So how could you ever build a house for me?
Where would my resting place be?

firstLine: “Zion is like a woman who has a baby
rest:
before she goes into labor.
She has a son
even before her labor pains begin.

firstLine: Zion, would I bring you to the moment of birth
rest:
and not let it happen?” says the Lord.
“Would I close up a mother’s body
when it is time for her baby to be born?” says your God.

firstLine: “Be glad along with Jerusalem, all you who love her.
rest:
Be filled with joy because of her.
Take great delight in her,
all you who sob over her.

firstLine: The Lord continues,
rest:
“I will cause peace to flow over her like a river.
I will make the wealth of nations sweep over her like a flooding stream.
You will nurse and be carried in her arms.
You will play on her lap.

firstLine: As a mother comforts her child,
rest:
I will comfort you.
You will find comfort in Jerusalem.”

firstLine: The Lord Chooses Jeremiah
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: “Before I formed you in your mother’s body I chose you.
rest:
Before you were born I set you apart to serve me.
I appointed you to be a prophet to the nations.”

firstLine: Israel Deserts the Lord
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: “Go. Announce my message to the people in Jerusalem. I want everyone to hear it. Tell them,
rest:
“‘I remember how faithful you were to me when you were young.
You loved me as if you were my bride.
You followed me through the desert.
Nothing had been planted there.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“What did your people find wrong with me?
Why did they wander so far away from me?
They worshiped worthless statues of gods.
Then they themselves became worthless.

firstLine: The priests did not ask,
rest:
‘Where is the Lord?’
Those who taught my law did not know me.
The leaders refused to obey me.
The prophets prophesied in the name of Baal.
They worshiped worthless statues of gods.

firstLine: “So I am bringing charges against you again,”
rest:
announces the Lord.
“And I will bring charges against your children’s children.

firstLine: “My people have sinned twice.
rest:
They have deserted me,
even though I am the spring of water that gives life.
And they have dug their own wells.
But those wells are broken.
They can’t hold any water.

firstLine: The men of Memphis and Tahpanhes
rest: have shaved your heads to dishonor you.

firstLine: Why do you go to Egypt
rest:
to drink water from the Shihor River?
Why do you go to Assyria
to drink from the Euphrates River?

firstLine: “Long ago you broke off the yoke I put on you.
rest:
You tore off the ropes I tied you up with.
You said, ‘I won’t serve you!’
In fact, on every high hill
you lay down like a prostitute.
You worshiped other gods under every green tree.

firstLine: “You say, ‘I am “clean.”
rest:
I haven’t followed the gods that are named after Baal.’
How can you say that?
Remember how you acted in the valley.
Consider what you have done.
You are like a female camel running quickly here and there.

firstLine: Do not run after other gods
rest:
until your sandals are worn out and your throat is dry.
But you said, ‘It’s no use!
I love those gods.
I must go after them.’

firstLine: “A thief is dishonored when he is caught.
rest:
And you people of Israel are filled with shame.
Your kings and officials are dishonored.
So are your priests and your prophets.

firstLine: “Why do you bring charges against me?
rest:
All of you have refused to obey me,”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: “I punished your people. But it did not do them any good.
rest:
They did not pay attention when they were corrected.
You have killed your prophets with swords.
You have swallowed them up like a hungry lion.

firstLine: “You who are now living, consider my message. I am saying,
rest:
“Have I been like a desert to Israel?
Have I been like a land of deep darkness?
Why do my people say, ‘We are free to wander.
We won’t come to you anymore’?

firstLine: Why do you keep on
rest:
changing your ways so much?
Assyria did not help you.
And Egypt will not help you either.

firstLine: So you will also leave Egypt
rest:
with your hands tied together above your heads.
I have turned my back on those you trust.
They will not help you.

firstLine: “Suppose a man divorces his wife.
rest:
What if she then gets married to another man?
Should her first husband return to her again?
If he does, won’t the land become completely ‘unclean’?
People of Israel, you have lived like a prostitute.
You have loved many other gods.
So do you think you can return to me now?”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: “Look up at the bare hilltops.
rest:
Is there any place where you have not committed adultery with other gods?
By the side of the road you sat waiting for lovers.
You sat there like someone who wanders in the desert.
You have polluted the land.
You are like a sinful prostitute.

firstLine: Israel Is Not Faithful to the Lord
rest: During the time Josiah was king, the Lord spoke to me. He said, “Have you seen what the people of Israel have done? They have not been faithful to me. They have committed adultery with other gods. They worshiped them on every high hill and under every green tree.

firstLine: “Go. Announce this message to the people in the north. Tell them,
rest:
“‘Israel, you have not been faithful,’ announces the Lord.
‘Return to me. Then I will look on you with favor again.
My love is faithful,’ announces the Lord.
‘I will not be angry with you forever.

firstLine: “I myself said,
rest:
“‘I would gladly treat you like my children.
I would give you a pleasant land.
It is the most beautiful land any nation could have.’
I thought you would call me ‘Father.’
I hoped you would always follow me.

firstLine: “You have not been faithful,”
rest:
says the Lord.
“Return to me. I will heal you.
Then you will not turn away from me anymore.”
“Yes,” the people say. “We will come to you.
You are the Lord our God.

firstLine: The gods we worship on the hills
rest:
and mountains are useless.
You are the Lord our God.
You are the only one who can save us.

firstLine: From our earliest years shameful gods have eaten up
rest:
everything our people worked for.
They have eaten up our flocks and herds.
They’ve destroyed our sons and daughters.

firstLine: “If you will return, Israel,
rest:
return to me,”
announces the Lord.
“Put the statues of your gods out of my sight.
I hate them.
Stop going down the wrong path.

firstLine: Trouble Will Come From the North
rest:
“Announce my message in Judah.
Tell it in Jerusalem.
Say, ‘Blow trumpets all through the land!’
Give a loud shout and say,
‘Gather together!
Let’s run to cities that have high walls around them!’

firstLine: “A dark day is coming,” announces the Lord.
rest:
“The king and his officials will lose hope.
The priests will be shocked.
And the prophets will be terrified.”

firstLine: “Tell the nations.
rest:
Warn Jerusalem.
Say, ‘An army will attack you.
It is coming from a land far away.
It will shout a war cry
against the cities of Judah.

firstLine: “The army will attack you
rest:
because of your conduct and actions.
That is how you will be punished.
It will be so bitter!
It will cut deep down into your hearts!”

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“The whole land will be destroyed.
But I will not destroy it completely.

firstLine: No One Is Honest
rest:
The Lord says, “Go up and down the streets of Jerusalem.
Look around.
Think about what you see.
Search through the market places.
See if you can find one honest person who tries to be truthful.
If you can, I will forgive this city.

firstLine: I thought, “The people of
rest:
Jerusalem are foolish.
They don’t know how the Lord wants them to live.
They don’t know what their God requires of them.

firstLine: “Armies of Babylonia, go through their vineyards and destroy them.
rest:
But do not destroy them completely.
Strip off their branches.
Those people do not belong to me.

firstLine: The people of Israel and Judah
rest:
have not been faithful to me at all,”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: “People of Israel, listen to me,”
rest:
announces the Lord.
“I am bringing against you
a nation from far away.
It is an old nation. And it will last for a long time.
Its people speak a language you do not know.
You can’t understand what they are saying.

firstLine: “‘Jeremiah,’ the people will ask, ‘Why has the Lord our God done all of this to us?’
rest: “Then you will tell them, ‘You have deserted the Lord. You have served other gods in your own land. So now you will serve another nation in a land that is not your own.’

firstLine: “Here is what I want you to announce
rest:
to the people of Jacob.
Tell it in Judah.
Tell them I say,

firstLine: ‘Listen to this, you foolish people,
rest:
who do not have any sense.
You have eyes, but you do not see.
You have ears, but you do not hear.

firstLine: You do not say to yourselves,
rest:
“Let us have respect for the Lord our God.
He sends rain in the fall and the spring.
He promises us that the harvest will come
at the same time each year.”

firstLine: But the things you have done wrong
rest:
have robbed you of those gifts.
Your sins have kept those good things
far away from you.’

firstLine: “Jeremiah, some of my people are evil.
rest:
They hide and wait just as people hide to catch birds.
They set traps for men.

firstLine: “Something horrible and shocking
rest: has happened in the land.

firstLine: Babylonia Will Attack Jerusalem
rest:
The Lord says, “People of Benjamin, run for safety!
Run away from Jerusalem!
Blow trumpets in Tekoa!
Warn everyone in Beth Hakkerem!
Horrible trouble is coming from the north.
The Babylonians will destroy everything with awful power.

firstLine: I will destroy the city of Zion,
rest: even though it is very beautiful.

firstLine: I will reach out my hand
rest:
against those who live in the land,”
announces the Lord.
“Then their houses will be turned over to others.
So will their fields and their wives.

firstLine: Everyone wants to get richer and richer,
rest:
from the least important of them to the most important.
Prophets and priests alike
try to fool everyone they can.

firstLine: They bandage the wounds of my people
rest:
as if they were not very deep.
‘Peace, peace,’ they say.
But there isn’t any peace.

firstLine: The Lord tells the people of Judah,
rest:
“Stand where the roads cross, and look around.
Ask where the old paths are.
Ask for the good path, and walk on it.
Then your hearts will find rest in me.
But you said, ‘We won’t walk on it.’

firstLine: So the Lord says,
rest:
“I will bring an army against the people of Judah.
Parents and children alike will trip and fall.
Neighbors and friends will die.”

firstLine: The Lord says to Jerusalem,
rest:
“Look! An army is coming
from the land of the north.
I am stirring up a great nation.
Its army is coming from a land that is very far away.

firstLine: The fire is made very hot
rest:
so the lead will burn away.
But it is impossible to make those people pure.
Those who are evil are not removed.

firstLine: Worshiping Other Gods Is Worthless
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: “Stand at the gate of my house. Announce my message to the people there. Say,
rest: “‘Listen to the Lord’s message, all of you people of Judah. You always come through these gates to worship the Lord.

firstLine: The Valley of Death
rest: “The people of Judah have done what is evil in my eyes,” announces the Lord. “They have set up statues of their gods. They have worshiped them in the house where my Name is. They have made my house ‘unclean.’ I hate those statues.

firstLine: The Lord Punishes His Sinful People
rest:
“Jeremiah, tell them, ‘The Lord says,
“‘“When people fall down, don’t they get up again?
When someone turns away, doesn’t he come back?

firstLine: “‘“How can you people say, ‘We are wise.
rest:
We have the law of the Lord’?
Actually, the teachers of the law have told lies about it.
Their pens have not written what is true.

firstLine: They bandage the wounds of my people
rest:
as if they were not very deep.
‘Peace, peace,’ they say.
But there isn’t any peace.

firstLine: “‘“I will take away their harvest,”
rest:
announces the Lord.
“There will not be any grapes on the vines.
The trees will not bear any figs.
The leaves on the trees will dry up.
What I have given them
will be taken away from them.”’”

firstLine: When our enemy’s horses snort,
rest:
the noise is heard all the way from Dan.
When their stallions neigh,
the whole land trembles with fear.
They have come to destroy
the land and everything in it.
The city and everyone who lives there will be destroyed.

firstLine: “People of Judah, I will send poisonous snakes among you.
rest:
No one will be able to charm them.
And they will bite you,”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: Listen to the cries of my people
rest:
from a land far away.
They cry out, “Isn’t the Lord in Zion?
Isn’t its King there anymore?”
The Lord says, “Why have they made me so angry
by worshiping their wooden gods?
Why have they made me angry
with their worthless statues
of gods from other lands?”

firstLine: I wish I had somewhere to go in the desert
rest:
where a traveler could stay!
Then I could leave my people.
I could get away from them.
All of them commit adultery by worshiping other gods.
They aren’t faithful to the Lord.

firstLine: “They get ready to use
rest:
their tongues like bows,”
announces the Lord.
“Their mouths shoot out lies like arrows.
They tell lies to gain power in the land.
They go from one sin to another.
They do not pay any attention to me.

firstLine: So the Lord who rules over all says,
rest:
“I will put them through the fire to test them.
What else can I do?
My people are so sinful!

firstLine: Let them come quickly
rest:
and sob over us.
Let them cry until tears flow from our eyes.
Let them sob until water pours out of our eyes.

firstLine: Say, “The Lord announces,
rest:
“‘The dead bodies of men will be like trash
lying in the open fields.
They will lie there like grain
that is cut down at harvest time.
No one will gather them up.’”

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“Do not let a wise man brag about how wise he is.
Do not let a strong man boast about how strong he is.
Do not let a rich person brag about how rich he is.

firstLine: The Lord Is the Only True God
rest: People of Israel, listen to what the Lord is telling you.

firstLine: He says,
rest:
“Do not follow the practices of other nations.
Do not be terrified by warnings in the sky.
Do not be afraid, even though the nations are terrified by them.

firstLine: King of the nations,
rest:
everyone should have respect for you.
That’s what people should give you.
Among all of the wise people in the nations
there is no one like you.
No one can compare with you in all of their kingdoms.

firstLine: The Land Will Be Destroyed
rest:
People of Jerusalem, your enemies have surrounded you.
They are attacking you.
So gather up what belongs to you.
Then leave the land.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“I am about to throw out of this land
everyone who lives in it.
I will bring trouble on them.
They will be captured.”

firstLine: The leaders of my people are like shepherds
rest:
who don’t have any sense.
They don’t ask the Lord for advice.
That’s why they don’t succeed.
And that’s why their whole flock
is scattered like sheep.

firstLine: Jeremiah Prays to the Lord
rest:
Lord, I know that a man doesn’t control his own life.
He doesn’t direct his own steps.

firstLine: The Lord’s People Have Broken His Covenant
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: “I love the people of Judah.
rest:
But they are working out their evil plans along with many others.
So what are they doing in my temple?
Can meat that is offered to me keep me from punishing you?
When you do evil things, you get a lot of pleasure from them.”

firstLine: Jeremiah’s Enemies Make Evil Plans Against Him
rest: The Lord told me about the evil plans of my enemies. That’s how I knew about them. He showed me what they were doing.

firstLine: Jeremiah Argues With the Lord
rest:
Lord, when I bring a matter to you,
you always do what is right.
But now I would like to speak with you
about whether you are being fair.
Why are sinful people successful?
Why do those who can’t be trusted have an easy life?

firstLine: The Lord Replies to Jeremiah
rest:
The Lord says, “Suppose you have run in a race with other men.
And suppose they have worn you out.
Then how would you be able to race against horses?
Suppose you feel safe only in open country.
Then how would you get along in the bushes near the Jordan River?

firstLine: “I will turn my back on my people.
rest:
I will desert my land.
I love the people of Judah.
In spite of that, I will hand them over to their enemies.

firstLine: My land has become to me
rest:
like a lion in the forest.
It roars at me.
So I hate it.

firstLine: A Linen Belt
rest: The Lord said to me, “Go and buy a linen belt. Put it around your waist. But do not let it get wet.”

firstLine: Wineskins
rest:
“Tell them, ‘The Lord is the God of Israel. He says, “Every wineskin should be filled with wine.”’
“The people might say to you, ‘Don’t we know that every wineskin should be filled with wine?’

firstLine: Judah Will Be Taken Away From Their Land
rest:
People of Judah, listen to me.
Pay attention. Don’t be proud.
The Lord has spoken.

firstLine: If you don’t listen,
rest:
I will sob in secret.
Because you are so proud,
I will sob bitterly.
Tears will flow from my eyes.
The Lord’s flock will be taken away as prisoners.

firstLine: Suppose you ask yourself,
rest:
“Why has this happened to me?”
It’s because you have committed so many sins.
That’s the reason your skirt has been torn off.
That’s why your body has been treated so badly.

firstLine: The Lord says, “I will scatter you like straw
rest: that the desert wind blows away.

firstLine: War and Hunger
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He told me there wouldn’t be any rain in the land. He said,

firstLine: “Judah is filled with sadness.
rest:
Its cities are wasting away.
The people sob over the land.
Crying is heard in Jerusalem.

firstLine: Even the does in the fields
rest:
desert their newborn fawns.
There isn’t any grass to eat.

firstLine: “Jeremiah, give them this message. Tell them,
rest:
“‘Let tears flow from my eyes.
Let them pour out night and day.
Never let them stop.
The people of my own nation
have suffered a terrible wound.
They have been crushed.

firstLine: “Suppose they ask you, ‘Where should we go?’
rest:
“Then tell them, ‘The Lord says,
“‘“Those I have appointed to die will die.
Those I have appointed to be killed with swords
will be killed with swords.
Those I have appointed to die of hunger
will die of hunger.
Those I have appointed to be taken away as prisoners
will be taken away.”’

firstLine: “Jerusalem, who will have pity on you?
rest:
Who will sob over you?
Who will stop to ask how you are doing?

firstLine: The Lord said,
rest:
“Jeremiah, I will keep you safe for a good purpose.
I will make your enemies ask you to pray for them.
They will make their appeal to you
when they are in great trouble.

firstLine: “People of Judah, the armies of Babylonia
rest:
will come from the north.
They are as strong as iron and bronze.
Can anyone break their power?

firstLine: So the Lord says,
rest:
“Turn away from your sins. Then I will heal you.
And then you will be able to serve me.
Speak words that are worthy, not worthless.
Then you will be speaking for me.
Let these people turn to you.
But you must not turn to them.

firstLine: “I will save you from the hands of evil people.
rest: I will set you free from those who treat you badly.”

firstLine: Times of Trouble Are Coming
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: “Judah’s sin is carved with an iron tool.
rest:
It is written with a sharp stone.
It is carved on the tablets of their hearts.
It is written on the horns that stick out
from the corners of their altars.

firstLine: Even their children offer sacrifices
rest:
to other gods on those altars.
They use the poles that were made
to worship the goddess Asherah.
They worship strange gods beside the green trees
