and on the high hills.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“Those who trust in man are under my curse.
They depend on human strength.
Their hearts turn away from me.

firstLine: “But I will bless any man who trusts in me.
rest: I will show my favor to the one who depends on me.

firstLine: They keep saying to me,
rest:
“What has happened to the message the Lord gave you?
Let it come true right now!”

firstLine: Keep the Sabbath Day Holy
rest: The Lord said to me, “Go. Stand at the city gate where the people gather together. That is where the kings of Judah go in and out. Also go to all of the other gates of Jerusalem.

firstLine: The Lord Sends Jeremiah to the Potter’s House
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: So the Lord says,
rest:
“Ask the nations a question. Say to them,
‘Who has ever heard anything like this?
The people of Israel have done
a very horrible thing.

firstLine: Does the snow ever disappear
rest:
from Lebanon’s rocky slopes?
Do its cool waters ever stop
flowing from places far away?

firstLine: But Lord, you know
rest:
all about their plans to kill me.
Don’t forgive their crimes.
Don’t erase their sins from your sight.
Destroy my enemies.
Punish them when the time to show your anger comes.

firstLine: Jeremiah and Pashhur
rest: The priest Pashhur was chief officer in the Lord’s temple. He was the son of Immer. Pashhur heard me prophesying that Jerusalem would be destroyed.

firstLine: Jeremiah Argues With the Lord
rest:
Lord, you tricked me, and I was tricked.
You overpowered me and won.
People make fun of me all day long.
Everyone laughs at me.

firstLine: I hear many people whispering,
rest:
“There is terror on every side!
Report Jeremiah! Let’s report him to the authorities!”
All of my friends
are waiting for me to slip.
They are saying, “Perhaps he will be tricked
into making a mistake.
Then we’ll win out over him.
We’ll get even with him.”

firstLine: May that man be like the towns
rest:
the Lord destroyed without pity.
May that man hear loud sobs in the morning.
May he hear a battle cry at noon.

firstLine: The Lord Refuses Zedekiah’s Appeal
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. It came when King Zedekiah sent Pashhur to me. Pashhur was the son of Malkijah. Zedekiah sent the priest Zephaniah along with him. Zephaniah was the son of Maaseiah. They said to me,

firstLine: The Lord says to you who belong to David’s royal house,
rest:
“‘“Every morning do what is right and fair.
Save those who have been robbed.
Set them free from the people who have treated them badly.
If you do not, my anger will blaze out against you.
It will burn like fire because of the evil things you have done.
No one will be able to put it out.

firstLine: Jerusalem, I am against you,”
rest:
announces the Lord.
“You live above this valley.
You are on a high, rocky flatland.
And you say, ‘Who can come against us?
Who can enter our place of safety?’

firstLine: But I will punish you in keeping with what you have done,”
rest:
announces the Lord.
“I will start a fire in your forests.
It will burn up everything around you.”’”

firstLine: The Lord Judges Evil Kings
rest: The Lord said to me, “Jeremiah, go down to the palace of the king of Judah. Announce my message there. Tell him,

firstLine: “Jehoiakim, does having more and more cedar boards
rest:
make you a king?
Your father Josiah had enough to eat and drink.
He did what was right and fair.
So everything went well with him.

firstLine: “Jehoiakim, the only thing on your mind
rest:
is to get rich by cheating others.
You would even kill people who are not guilty
of doing anything wrong.
You would mistreat them.
You would take everything they own.”

firstLine: Land, land, land,
rest: listen to the Lord’s message!

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“Let the record say that this man did not have any children.
Let it report that he did not have any success in life.
None of his children will have success either.
None of them will sit on David’s throne.
None of them will ever rule over Judah.

firstLine: The True and Rightful Branch
rest: “How terrible it will be for the shepherds who lead my people down the wrong path!” announces the Lord. “They are destroying and scattering the sheep that belong to my flock.”

firstLine: “A new day is coming,” announces the Lord.
rest:
“At that time I will raise up from David’s royal line
a true and rightful Branch.
He will be a King who will rule wisely.
He will do what is fair and right in the land.

firstLine: Prophets Who Tell Lies
rest:
Here is my message about the prophets.
My heart is broken inside me.
All of my bones tremble with fear.
I am like a man who is drunk.
I am like someone who has had too much wine.
That’s what the Lord’s holy words
have done to me.

firstLine: The land is full of people
rest:
who aren’t faithful to the Lord.
Now the land is under his curse.
And that’s why it is thirsty for water.
That’s why the grasslands in the desert are dry.
The prophets are leading sinful lives.
They don’t use their power in the right way.

firstLine: “Prophets and priests alike are ungodly,”
rest:
announces the Lord.
“Even in my temple I find them sinning.

firstLine: “Among the prophets of Samaria
rest:
I saw something I can’t stand.
They were prophesying in the name of Baal.
They were leading my people Israel down the wrong path.

firstLine: The Lord who rules over all says to the people of Judah,
rest:
“Do not listen to what the prophets are saying to you.
They fill you with false hopes.
They talk about visions that come from their own minds.
What they say does not come from my mouth.

firstLine: A storm will burst out
rest:
because of my burning anger.
A windstorm will sweep down
on the heads of sinful people.

firstLine: “Am I only a God who is nearby?”
rest:
announces the Lord.
“Am I not a God who is also far away?

firstLine: Can anyone hide in secret places
rest:
so that I can’t see him?”
announces the Lord.
“Don’t I fill heaven and earth?”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: Prophets Who Give Messages That Are Not From the Lord
rest:
“Jeremiah, those people might ask you a question. Or a prophet or priest might do it. They might ask, ‘What message have you received from the Lord?’
“Then tell them, ‘You ask, “What message?” Here it is. “I will desert you,” announces the Lord.’

firstLine: Judah Is Like Two Baskets of Figs
rest:
King Jehoiachin was forced to leave Jerusalem. He was the son of Jehoiakim. Jehoiachin was taken to Babylon by Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylonia. The officials and all of the skilled workers were forced to leave with him.
After they left, the Lord showed me two baskets of figs. They were in front of his temple.

firstLine: Seventy Years in Babylonia
rest: A message about all of the people of Judah came to me from the Lord. It came in the fourth year that Jehoiakim was king of Judah. It was the first year that Nebuchadnezzar was king of Babylonia. Jehoiakim was the son of Josiah.

firstLine: The Lord Judges the Nations
rest: The Lord is the God of Israel. He said to me, “Take this cup from my hand. It is filled with the wine of my burning anger. Make all of the nations to which I send you drink it.

firstLine: all of the people from other lands who lived there
rest:
all of the kings of Uz
the Philistine kings of Ashkelon, Gaza and Ekron
the Philistines who were still living in Ashdod

firstLine: all of the kings of Tyre and Sidon
rest: the kings of the islands and other lands along the Mediterranean Sea

firstLine: Dedan, Teman, Buz
rest: all of the other places far away in the east

firstLine: all of the kings of Arabia
rest: all of the other kings of people who live in the desert

firstLine: all of the kings in the north, near and far
rest: So he sent me to all of the kingdoms on the face of the earth, one after the other. After all of them drink from the cup of the Lord’s anger, the king of Babylonia will drink from it too.

firstLine: “Jeremiah, prophesy against them. Tell them,
rest:
“‘The Lord will roar from heaven like a lion.
His voice will sound like thunder
from his holy temple there.
He will roar loudly against his land.
He will shout like those who stomp on grapes in winepresses.
He will shout against everyone who lives on earth.

firstLine: The noise of battle will be heard
rest:
from one end of the earth to the other.
That’s because the Lord will bring charges against the nations.
He will judge every human being.
He will kill sinful people with his sword,’”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: The Lord who rules over all says,
rest:
“Look! Horrible trouble is spreading
from one nation to another.
A mighty storm is rising.
It is coming from a place
that is very far away.”

firstLine: Their peaceful meadows will be completely destroyed
rest: because of the Lord’s burning anger.

firstLine: Jeremiah’s Enemies Try to Have Him Killed
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. It was shortly after Jehoiakim became king of Judah. He was the son of Josiah.

firstLine: Judah Will Serve Nebuchadnezzar
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. It was shortly after Zedekiah became king of Judah. He was the son of Josiah.

firstLine: Hananiah Opposes Jeremiah
rest: The prophet Hananiah spoke to me in the Lord’s house. It was shortly after Zedekiah became king of Judah. It was in the fifth month of his fourth year. Hananiah was from Gibeon. He was the son of Azzur. In front of the priests and all of the people Hananiah said to me,

firstLine: Jeremiah’s Letter to the Jews in Babylonia
rest: I, the prophet Jeremiah, sent a letter from Jerusalem to Babylonia. It was for the Jewish elders who were still alive there. It was also for the priests and prophets in Babylonia. And it was for all of the other people Nebuchadnezzar had taken from Jerusalem to Babylon.

firstLine: Shemaiah Opposes Jeremiah
rest: Tell Shemaiah, the Nehelamite,

firstLine: Israel Will Return to the Lord
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: “I am the Lord. I say,
rest:
“‘Cries of fear are heard.
There is terror. There isn’t any peace.

firstLine: “‘At that time I will break the yoke off their necks,’
rest:
announces the Lord who rules over all.
‘I will tear off the ropes that hold them.
People from other lands will not make them slaves anymore.

firstLine: “‘People of Jacob, do not be afraid.
rest:
You are my servant.
Israel, do not be terrified,’”
announces the Lord.
“‘You can be sure that I will save you.
I will bring you out of a place far away.
I will bring your children back
from the land where they were taken.
Your people will have peace and security again.
And no one will make them afraid.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“Your wound can’t be cured.
Your pain can’t be healed.

firstLine: “But everyone who destroys you will be destroyed.
rest:
All of your enemies will be forced
to leave their countries.
Those who steal from you will be stolen from.
I will take the belongings
of those who take things from you.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“I will bless Jacob’s people with great success again.
I will show tender love to Israel.
Jerusalem will be rebuilt where it was destroyed.
The palace will stand in its proper place.

firstLine: “So you will be my people.
rest: And I will be your God.”

firstLine: A storm will burst out
rest:
because of the Lord’s burning anger.
A strong wind will sweep down
on the heads of evil people.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“Some of my people will live through
everything their enemies do to them.
They will find help in the desert.
I will come to give peace and rest to Israel.”

firstLine: Once again you will plant vineyards
rest:
on the hills of Samaria.
Farmers will plant them.
They will enjoy their fruit.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“Sing with joy because the people of Jacob are blessed.
Shout because the Lord has made them the greatest nation.
Make your praises heard.
Say, ‘Lord, save your people.
Save the people who are left alive in Israel.’

firstLine: “Listen to my message, you nations.
rest:
Announce it on shores far away.
Say, ‘He who scattered Israel will gather them.
He will watch over his flock like a shepherd.’

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“A voice is heard in Ramah.
It is the sound of crying and deep sadness.
Rachel is crying over her children.
She refuses to be comforted,
because they are gone.”

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“Do not sob anymore.
Do not let tears fall from your eyes.
I will reward you for your work,”
announces the Lord.
“Your children will return from the land of the enemy.

firstLine: So I am giving you hope for the years to come,”
rest:
announces the Lord.
“Your children will return to their own land.

firstLine: “I have heard the groans of Ephraim’s people. They say,
rest:
‘You corrected us like a calf you were training.
And we have been trained.
Bring us back to you, and we will come back.
You are the Lord our God.

firstLine: After we wandered away from you,
rest:
we turned away from our sins.
After we learned our lesson,
we beat our chests in sorrow.
We were full of shame.
What we did when we were young brought dishonor on us.’

firstLine: How long will you wander,
rest:
you people who are not faithful to me?
I will create a new thing on earth.
A woman will guard a man.”

firstLine: “In those days people will no longer say,
rest:
‘The fathers have eaten sour grapes.
But the children have a bitter taste in their mouths.’

firstLine: “A new day is coming,” announces the Lord.
rest:
“I will make a new covenant
with the people of Israel.
I will also make it with the people of Judah.

firstLine: It will not be like the covenant
rest:
I made with their people long ago.
That was when I took them by the hand.
I led them out of Egypt.
But they broke my covenant.
They did it even though I was like a husband to them,”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: “This is the covenant I will make with Israel
rest:
after that time,” announces the Lord.
“I will put my law in their minds.
I will write it on their hearts.
I will be their God.
And they will be my people.

firstLine: “Suppose my orders for creation disappear from my sight,”
rest:
announces the Lord.
“Only then will the people of Israel stop being
a nation in my sight.”

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“Suppose the sky above could be measured.
Suppose the foundations of the earth below could be completely discovered.
Only then would I turn the people of Israel away.
Even though they have committed many sins,
I will still accept them,”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: Jeremiah Buys a Field
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. It came in the 10th year that Zedekiah was king of Judah. It was in the 18th year of the rule of Nebuchadnezzar.

firstLine: The Lord Keeps His Promises
rest: I was still being held as a prisoner. I was kept in the courtyard of the guard. Then another message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: “In those days and at that time
rest:
I will make a true and rightful Branch grow from David’s royal line.
He will do what is fair and right in the land.

firstLine: Zedekiah Is Warned
rest:
Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylonia, and all of his armies were fighting against Jerusalem. They were also fighting against all of the towns that were around it. All of the kingdoms and nations Nebuchadnezzar ruled over were helping him.
At that time a message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: The People Set Their Slaves Free
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. King Zedekiah had made a covenant with all of the people in Jerusalem. He had told them to set their Hebrew slaves free.

firstLine: The Family of Recab
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. It came during the time Jehoiakim was king over Judah. He was the son of Josiah. The message said,

firstLine: Jehoiakim Burns Up Jeremiah’s Scroll
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. It came in the fourth year that Jehoiakim was king of Judah. He was the son of Josiah. The message said,

firstLine: Jeremiah Is Put in Prison
rest: Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylonia, appointed Zedekiah to be king of Judah. He was the son of Josiah. Zedekiah ruled in place of Jehoiachin, the son of Jehoiakim.

firstLine: Jeremiah Is Thrown Into an Empty Well
rest: Shephatiah, Gedaliah, Jehucal and Pashhur heard what I was telling all of the people. Shephatiah was the son of Mattan. Gedaliah was the son of Pashhur. Jehucal was the son of Shelemiah. And Pashhur was the son of Malkijah. Those four men heard me say,

firstLine: Zedekiah Questions Jeremiah Again
rest: Then King Zedekiah sent for me. He had me brought to the third entrance to the Lord’s temple. “I want to ask you something,” the king said to me. “Don’t hide anything from me.”

firstLine: Jeremiah Is Set Free From His Chains
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. It came after Nebuzaradan, the commander of the royal guard, had set me free at Ramah. I was being held by chains when he found me. I was among all of the prisoners from Jerusalem and Judah. We were being taken to Babylon.

firstLine: Gedaliah Is Murdered
rest: Some of Judah’s army officers and their men were still in the open country. They heard that the king of Babylonia had appointed Gedaliah, the son of Ahikam, as governor over Judah. He had put him in charge of the men, women and children who were still there. They were the poorest people in the land. They hadn’t been taken to Babylon.

firstLine: Some Jews Take Jeremiah to Egypt
rest: Then Johanan, the son of Kareah, led away all of the people from Mizpah who were still alive. All of the other army officers who were with Johanan helped him do it. He had taken them away from Ishmael, the son of Nethaniah. That happened after Ishmael had murdered Gedaliah, the son of Ahikam. The people Johanan had taken away included the soldiers, women, children and court officials he had brought from Gibeon.

firstLine: Don’t Worship Other Gods
rest: A message came to me from the Lord about all of the Jews who were living in Lower Egypt. They were living in Migdol, Tahpanhes and Memphis. It was also about all of the Jews who were living in Upper Egypt.

firstLine: The Lord Speaks to Baruch
rest: I, the prophet Jeremiah, talked to Baruch, the son of Neriah. It was in the fourth year that Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah, was king of Judah. But it was after Baruch had written down on a scroll the words I was telling him to write. I said,

firstLine: The Lord’s Message About the Nations
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. It was about the nations.

firstLine: A Message About Egypt
rest:
Here is what the Lord says about Egypt.
Here is his message against the army of Pharaoh Neco. He was king of Egypt. Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylonia, won the battle over his army. That happened at Carchemish on the Euphrates River. It was in the fourth year that Jehoiakim was king of Judah. He was the son of Josiah.
The message says,

firstLine: “Egyptians, prepare your shields!
rest:
Prepare large and small shields alike!
March out for battle!

firstLine: “Those who run fast can’t get away.
rest:
Those who are strong can’t escape.
In the north by the Euphrates River
they trip and fall.

firstLine: “Who is this that rises like the Nile River?
rest: Who rises like rivers of rushing waters?

firstLine: “People of Egypt,
rest:
go up to Gilead and get some healing lotion.
But no matter what you try, you will not be healed.
There isn’t any healing for you.

firstLine: “Egyptians, here is what I want you to announce in your land.
rest:
Announce it in Migdol.
Also announce it in Memphis and Tahpanhes.
Say, ‘Take up your battle positions! Get ready!
The sword eats up those who are around you.’

firstLine: The Egyptian soldiers will cry out,
rest:
‘Pharaoh is our king. But he’s only a loud noise.
He has missed his chance to win the battle.’

firstLine: “I am the King.
rest:
My name is The Lord Who Rules Over All.
Someone will come who is like Mount Tabor among the mountains.
He is like Mount Carmel by the Mediterranean Sea.
And that is just as sure as I am alive,”
announces the King.

firstLine: “So pack your belongings, you who live in Egypt.
rest:
You will be taken away from your land.
Memphis will be completely destroyed.
Its buildings will be broken down.
No one will live there.

firstLine: “Egypt is like a beautiful young cow.
rest:
But Nebuchadnezzar is coming against her from the north.
He will bite her like a fly.

firstLine: “People of Jacob, do not be afraid.
rest:
You are my servant.
Israel, do not be terrified.
I will bring you safely out of a place far away.
I will bring your children back
from the land where they were taken.
Your people will have peace and security again.
And no one will make them afraid.

firstLine: A Message About the Philistines
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. It was about the Philistines before Pharaoh attacked Gaza.

firstLine: The Lord said,
rest:
“The armies of Babylonia are like waters rising in the north.
They will become a great flood.
They will flow over the land and everything in it.
They will flow over the towns and those who live in them.
The people will cry out.
All those who live in the land will sob.

firstLine: The day has come
rest:
to destroy all of the Philistines.
The time has come to cut off all those
who could help Tyre and Sidon.
I am about to destroy the Philistines.
I will not leave anyone alive
who came from the coasts of Crete.

firstLine: The people of Gaza will be so sad
rest:
they will shave their heads.
And Ashkelon’s people will be silent.
You who remain on the flatlands,
how long will you cut yourselves?

firstLine: “‘Sword of the Lord!’ you cry out.
rest:
‘How long will it be until you rest?
Return to the place you came from.
Stop killing us! Be still!’

firstLine: But how can my sword rest
rest:
when I have given it a command?
I have ordered it
to attack Ashkelon and the Philistine coast.”

firstLine: A Message About Moab
rest:
Here is what the Lord says about Moab.
The Lord who rules over all is the God of Israel. He says,
“How terrible it will be for Nebo!
It will be destroyed.
Kiriathaim will be captured.
It will be put to shame.
Its fort will be broken down.
It will be put to shame.

firstLine: The one who is going to destroy you
rest:
will come against every town.
Not even one of them will escape.
The valley and the high flatlands
will be destroyed.
I, the Lord, have spoken.

firstLine: “May a person who is lazy when he does my work
rest:
be under my curse!
May anyone who keeps his sword from killing
be under my curse!

firstLine: “Moab has been at peace and rest from its earliest days.
rest:
It is like wine that has not been shaken up.
It has not been poured from one jar to another.
Moab’s people have not been taken away from their land.
They are like wine that tastes as it always did.
Its smell has not changed at all.

firstLine: But other days are coming,”
rest:
announces the Lord.
“At that time I will send people who pour wine from jars.
They will pour Moab out like wine.
They will empty its jars.
They will smash its jugs.

firstLine: “How can you say, ‘We are soldiers.
rest: We are men who are brave in battle’?

firstLine: “The fall of Moab is near.
rest: Its time of trouble will come quickly.

firstLine: “Come down from your glorious city, you who live in Dibon.
rest:
Come and sit on the thirsty ground.
The one who destroys your country
will come up and attack you.
Your enemies will destroy your cities
that have high walls around them.

firstLine: Stand by the road and watch,
rest:
you who live in Aroer.
Ask the men who are running away.
Ask the women who are escaping.
Ask them, ‘What has happened?’

firstLine: “Moab’s people think they are better than I am.
rest:
So let their enemies make them drunk.
Let the people get sick and throw up.
Let them roll around in the mess they have made.
Let people laugh at them.

firstLine: Leave your towns,
rest:
you who live in Moab.
Go and live among the rocks.
Be like a dove that makes its nest
at the mouth of a cave.

firstLine: “We have heard all about Moab’s pride.
rest:
We have heard how very proud they are.
They think they are so much better than others.
Their pride reaches deep down inside their hearts.

firstLine: I sob over you as Jazer sobs,
rest:
you vines of Sibmah.
Your branches used to spread out.
They went all the way down to the Dead Sea.
They reached as far as the sea of Jazer.
The one who destroys your country
has taken away your grapes and ripe fruit.

firstLine: “The sound of their cry rises from Heshbon.
rest:
It rises as far as Elealeh and Jahaz.
It rises from Zoar.
It goes all the way to Horonaim and Eglath Shelishiyah.
Even the waters at Nimrim are dried up.

firstLine: “Like a flute my heart sings a song of sadness for Moab.
rest:
It sings like a flute for the men of Kir Hareseth.
The wealth they had gotten is gone.

firstLine: “How broken Moab is! How the people sob!
rest:
They turn away from others
because they are so ashamed.
All those who are around them laugh at them.
They are shocked at them.”

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“Look! Nebuchadnezzar is like an eagle diving down.
He is spreading his wings over Moab.

firstLine: You people of Moab,”
rest:
announces the Lord,
“terror, a pit and a trap are waiting for you.

firstLine: Anyone who runs away from the terror
rest:
will fall into the pit.
Anyone who climbs out of the pit
will be caught in the trap.
The time is coming
when I will punish Moab,”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: “In the shadow of Heshbon
rest:
those who are trying to escape stand helpless.
A fire has blazed out from Heshbon.
Flames have come out from Sihon’s city.
It burns the foreheads of Moab’s people.
It burns the skulls of those who brag loudly.

firstLine: “But in days to come
rest:
I will bless Moab with great success again,”
announces the Lord.
That’s the report about how the Lord said he would judge Moab.

firstLine: A Message About Ammon
rest:
Here is what the Lord says about the people of Ammon.
He says,
“Doesn’t Israel have any sons?
Doesn’t Israel have anyone
to take over the family property?
Then why has the god Molech taken over Gad?
Why do those who worship him live in its towns?

firstLine: But a new day is coming,”
rest:
announces the Lord.
“At that time I will sound the battle cry.
I will sound it against Rabbah in the land of Ammon.
It will become a pile of broken-down buildings.
The villages that are around it will be set on fire.
Then Israel will drive out
those who drove her out,”
says the Lord.

firstLine: “Heshbon, sob over Ai! It is destroyed!
rest:
Cry out, you who live in Rabbah!
Put on black clothes and sob.
Run here and there inside the walls.
Your god Molech will be carried away.
So will its priests and officials.

firstLine: “But after that, I will bless the people of Ammon
rest:
with great success again,”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: A Message About Edom
rest:
Here is what the Lord says about Edom.
The Lord who rules over all says,
“Isn’t there wisdom in the town of Teman anymore?
Can’t those who are wise give advice?
Has their wisdom disappeared completely?

firstLine: “People of Edom,
rest:
all those who pass by you will be shocked.
They will make fun of you
because of all of your wounds.

firstLine: “I will be like a lion coming up
rest:
from the bushes by the Jordan River.
I will hunt in rich grasslands.
I will chase you from your land in an instant.
What nation will I choose to do it?
Which one will I appoint?
Is anyone like me?
Who would dare to argue with me?
What leader can stand against me?”

firstLine: So listen to what the Lord has planned
rest:
against the people of Edom.
Hear what he has planned against those who live in Teman.
Edom’s young people will be dragged away.
The Lord will completely destroy
their grasslands because of them.

firstLine: A Message About Damascus
rest:
Here is what the Lord says about Damascus. He says,
“The people of Hamath and Arpad are terrified.
They have heard bad news.
They have lost all hope.
They are troubled like the rolling sea.

firstLine: “I will set the walls of Damascus on fire.
rest: It will burn up the strong towers of King Ben-Hadad.”

firstLine: A Message About Kedar and Hazor
rest:
Here is what the Lord says about the land of Kedar and the kingdoms of Hazor. Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylonia, was planning to attack them.
The Lord says to the armies of Babylonia,
“Prepare for battle. Attack Kedar.
Destroy the people of the east.

firstLine: “Run away quickly!
rest:
You who live in Hazor, stay in deep caves,”
announces the Lord.
“Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylonia,
has made plans against you.
He has decided to attack you.

firstLine: “Armies of Babylonia, prepare for battle.
rest:
Attack a nation that feels secure.
Its people do not have any worries,”
announces the Lord.
“That nation does not have gates or heavy metal bars.
Its people live all alone.

firstLine: “Hazor will become a home for wild dogs.
rest:
It will be a dry and empty desert forever.
No one will live in that land.
No one will stay there even for a short time.”

firstLine: A Message About Elam
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. It was about Elam. It came shortly after Zedekiah became king of Judah.

firstLine: The Lord who rules over all said,
rest:
“Elam’s bow is the secret of its strength.
But I will break it.

firstLine: “But in days to come I will bless Elam
rest:
with great success again,”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: A Message About Babylonia
rest: Here is the message the Lord spoke through me about the city of Babylon and the land of Babylonia. He said,

firstLine: “Announce this message among the nations.
rest:
Lift up a banner.
Let the nations hear the message.
Do not keep anything back.
Say, ‘Babylon will be captured.
The god Bel will be put to shame.
Marduk will be filled with terror.
Babylon’s gods will be put to shame.
The gods its people made will be filled with terror.’

firstLine: “A new day is coming,”
rest:
announces the Lord.
“At that time the people of Israel and Judah will gather together.
They will come in tears to me.
I am the Lord their God.

firstLine: “My people have been like lost sheep.
rest:
Their shepherds have led them down the wrong path.
They have caused them to wander in the mountains.
They have wandered over mountains and hills.
They have forgotten that I am their true resting place.

firstLine: “People of Judah, run away from Babylon.
rest:
Leave the land of Babylonia.
Be like the goats that lead the flock.

firstLine: I will stir up great nations
rest:
that will join forces against Babylon.
I will bring them from the land of the north.
They will take up their battle positions against Babylon.
They will come from the north and capture it.
Their arrows will be like skilled soldiers.
They will not miss their mark.

firstLine: “People of Babylonia, you have stolen what belongs to me.
rest:
That has made you glad and full of joy.
You dance around like a young cow on a threshing floor.
You neigh like stallions.

firstLine: “All you who draw the bow,
rest:
take up your battle positions around Babylon.
Shoot at it! Do not spare any arrows!
Its people have sinned against me.

firstLine: “Israel is like a scattered flock
rest:
that lions have chased away.
The first lion that ate them up
was the king of Assyria.
The last one that broke their bones
was Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylonia.”

firstLine: A new day is coming,”
rest:
announces the Lord.
“At that time people will search for Israel’s guilt.
But they will not find any.
They will search for Judah’s sins.
But they will not find any.
That is because I will forgive the people I have spared.

firstLine: “Enemies of Babylonia, attack their land of Merathaim.
rest:
Make war against those who live in Pekod.
Chase them and kill them. Destroy them completely,”
announces the Lord.
“Do everything I have commanded you to do.

firstLine: “Send for men who are armed with bows and arrows.
rest:
Send them against Babylon.
Set up camp all around it.
Do not let anyone escape.
Pay it back for what its people have done.
Do to them what they have done to others.
They have dared to disobey me.
I am the Holy One of Israel.

firstLine: “Proud Babylonians, I am against you,”
rest:
announces the Lord.
The Lord who rules over all says,
“Your day to be judged has come.
It is time for you to be punished.

firstLine: The Lord who rules over all says,
rest:
“The people of Israel are being treated badly.
So are the people of Judah.
Those who have captured them are holding them.
They refuse to let them go.

firstLine: “A sword is coming against the Babylonians!”
rest:
announces the Lord.
“It is coming against those who live in Babylonia.
It is coming against their officials and wise men.

firstLine: “Desert creatures and hyenas will live in Babylon.
rest:
And so will owls.
People will never live there again.
It will not be lived in for all time to come.

firstLine: “Look! An army is coming from the north.
rest:
I am stirring up a great nation and many kings.
They are coming from a land that is very far away.

firstLine: When the earth hears that Babylonia has been captured,
rest:
it will shake.
The people’s cries will be heard among the nations.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“I will stir up the spirits of destroyers.
They will march out against Babylonia and its people.

firstLine: I will send other nations against it
rest:
to separate the straw from the grain.
I will send them to destroy Babylonia completely.
They will oppose it on every side.
At that time it will be destroyed.

firstLine: “People of Judah, run away from Babylonia!
rest:
Run for your lives!
Do not be destroyed because of the sins of its people.
It is time for me to pay them back.
I will punish them for what they have done.

firstLine: “The nations say, ‘We would have healed Babylon.
rest:
But it can’t be healed.
So let’s leave it. Let’s each go to our own land.
Babylon’s sins reach all the way to the skies.
They rise up as high as the clouds.’

firstLine: “The people of Judah say,
rest:
‘The Lord has made things right for us again.
So come. Let’s tell in Zion
what the Lord our God has done.’

firstLine: “I have stirred up you kings of the Medes.
rest:
So sharpen your arrows!
Get your shields!
I plan to destroy Babylon.
I will pay the Babylonians back.
They have destroyed my temple.

firstLine: You who live by the rivers of Babylon,
rest:
your end has come.
You who are rich in treasures,
it is time for you to be destroyed.

firstLine: “I used my power to make the earth.
rest:
I used my wisdom to set the world in place.
I used my understanding to spread the heavens out.

firstLine: “No one has any sense.
rest:
No one knows anything.
Everyone who works with gold is put to shame
by his wooden gods.
His metal gods are fakes.
They can’t even breathe.

firstLine: “Babylonia, you are my war club.
rest:
You are my weapon for battle.
I use you to destroy nations.
I use you to wipe out kingdoms.

firstLine: “Babylonia, I am against you.
rest:
Your kingdom is like a destroying mountain.
You have destroyed the whole earth,”
announces the Lord.
“I will reach out my hand against you.
I will roll you off the cliffs.
I will make you like a mountain that has been burned up.

firstLine: No rock will be taken from you to be used
rest:
as the most important stone for a building.
No stones will be taken from you
to be used for a foundation.
Your land will be empty forever,”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: “Nations, lift up a banner in the land of Babylonia!
rest:
Blow a trumpet among yourselves!
Prepare yourselves for battle against Babylonia.
Send the kingdoms
of Ararat, Minni and Ashkenaz against it.
Appoint a commander against it.
Send many horses against it.
Let them be as many as a huge number of locusts.

firstLine: One messenger after another
rest:
comes to the king of Babylonia.
All of them announce that
his entire city is captured.

firstLine: The people of Jerusalem say,
rest:
“Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylonia, has destroyed us.
He has thrown us into a panic.
He has emptied us out like a jar.
Like a snake he has swallowed us up.
He has filled his stomach with our rich food.
Then he has spit us out of his mouth.”

firstLine: The people continue, “May the people of Babylon
rest:
pay for the harmful things they have done to us.
May those who live in Babylonia
pay for spilling the blood of our people.”
That’s what the people who live in Zion say.

firstLine: So the Lord says,
rest:
“I will stand up for you.
I will pay the Babylonians back for what they did to you.
I will dry up their water supply.
I will make their springs run dry.

firstLine: “I will lead them down like lambs to be put to death.
rest: They will be like rams and goats that have been killed.

firstLine: “Babylon will be captured!
rest:
The whole earth was very proud of it.
But it will be taken over by others!
The nations will be shocked when it falls.

firstLine: “Come out of there, my people!
rest:
Run for your lives!
Run away from my burning anger.

firstLine: You will hear about terrible things
rest:
that are happening in Babylonia.
But do not lose hope. Do not be afraid.
You will hear one thing this year.
And you will hear something else next year.
You will hear about awful things in the land.
You will hear about one ruler fighting against another.

firstLine: “Babylon’s people have killed my people Israel.
rest:
They have also killed people all over the earth.
So now Babylon itself must fall.

firstLine: You who have not been killed in the war against Babylon,
rest:
leave! Do not wait!
In a land far away remember me.
And think about Jerusalem.”

firstLine: “But a new day is coming,” announces the Lord.
rest:
“At that time I will punish the gods of Babylon.
And all through its land
wounded people will groan.

firstLine: “The noise of people screaming comes from Babylon.
rest:
A terrible sound comes from its land.
It is the sound of a mighty city being destroyed.

firstLine: The Lord who rules over all says,
rest:
“Babylon’s thick walls will fall down flat.
Its high gates will be set on fire.
The nations wear themselves out for no reason at all.
Their hard work will only be burned up in the flames.”

firstLine: Nebuchadnezzar Destroys Jerusalem
rest: Zedekiah was 21 years old when he became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for 11 years. His mother’s name was Hamutal. She was the daughter of Jeremiah. She was from Libnah.

firstLine: In his 18th year,
rest: he took 832 people from Jerusalem.

firstLine: In Nebuchadnezzar’s 23rd year,
rest:
Nebuzaradan, the commander of the royal guard, took 745 Jews to Babylon.
The total number of people who were taken to Babylon was 4,600.

firstLine: Jehoiachin Is Set Free
rest: Evil-Merodach set Jehoiachin, the king of Judah, free from prison. It was in the 37th year after Jehoiachin had been taken away to Babylon. It was also the year Evil-Merodach became king of Babylonia. It was on the 25th day of the 12th month.

firstLine: After Judah’s people had suffered greatly,
rest:
they were taken away as prisoners.
Now they live among the nations.
They can’t find any place to rest.
All those who were chasing them have caught up with them.
And they can’t get away.

firstLine: Jerusalem’s enemies took away
rest:
all of its treasures.
Its people saw strangers
enter its temple.
The Lord had commanded them
not to do that.

firstLine: All of Jerusalem’s people groan
rest:
as they search for bread.
They trade their treasures for food
just to stay alive.
They say, “Lord, look at us.
Think about our condition.
Everyone looks down on us.”

firstLine: They also say, “All of you who are passing by,
rest:
don’t you care about what has happened to us?
Just look at our condition.
Has anyone suffered the way we have?
The Lord has brought all of this on us.
He has made us suffer.
His anger has burned against us.

firstLine: “He sent fire down from heaven.
rest:
It went deep down into our very bones.
He spread a net to catch us by the feet.
He stopped us right where we were.
He made our city empty.
We are sick all the time.

firstLine: “We must carry the heavy load of our sins.
rest:
He tied it on us with his hands.
Our sins are heavy on our necks.
The Lord has taken away our strength.
He has handed us over to our enemies.
We can’t win the battle over them.

firstLine: “The Lord has refused to accept
rest:
any of our soldiers.
He has sent for an army
to crush our young men.
We are like grapes in the Lord’s winepress.
He has stomped on us,
even though we are his very own people.

firstLine: “That’s why we are sobbing.
rest:
Tears are flowing from our eyes.
No one is near to comfort us.
No one can heal our spirits.
Our children don’t have anything.
Our enemies are much too strong for us.”

firstLine: “We called out to those who were going to help us.
rest:
But they turned against us.
Our priests and elders
died in the city.
They were searching for food
just to stay alive.

firstLine: “Lord, see how upset we are!
rest:
We are suffering deep down inside.
Our hearts are troubled.
Again and again we have refused to obey you.
Outside the city, people are being killed with swords.
Inside, there is nothing but death.

firstLine: “People have heard us groan.
rest:
But no one is here to comfort us.
Our enemies have heard about all of our troubles.
What you have done makes them happy.
So please judge them, just as you said you would.
Let them become like us.

firstLine: “Please pay attention to all of their sinful ways.
rest:
Punish them as you have punished us.
You judged us because we had committed so many sins.
We groan all the time.
And our hearts are weak.”

firstLine: See how the Lord covered the city of Zion
rest:
with the cloud of his anger!
He threw Israel’s glory down
from heaven to earth.
When he was angry, he turned his back
on his own city.

firstLine: Without pity the Lord swallowed up
rest:
all of the homes of Jacob’s people.
When he was angry, he tore down
the forts of the people of Judah.
He brought their kingdom and its princes
down to the ground in dishonor.

firstLine: When he burned with anger,
rest:
he took away Israel’s power.
He pulled back his powerful right hand
as the enemy approached.
His burning anger blazed out in Jacob’s land.
It burned up everything that was near it.

firstLine: The Lord decided to tear down
rest:
the walls around the city of Zion.
He measured out what he wanted to destroy.
Then he destroyed it with his powerful hand.
He made even its towers and walls sing songs of sadness.
All of them fell down.

firstLine: The elders of the city of Zion
rest:
sit silently on the ground.
They have sprinkled dust on their heads.
They’ve put on black clothes to show how sad they are.
The young women of Jerusalem
have bowed their heads toward the ground.

firstLine: They say to their mothers,
rest:
“Where can we find something to eat and drink?”
They faint like wounded soldiers
in the streets of the city.
Their lives are slipping away
in their mothers’ arms.

firstLine: All those who pass by
rest:
clap their hands and make fun of you.
They laugh at you and shake their heads
at the city of Jerusalem.
They say, “Could that be the city
that was called perfect and beautiful?
Is that the city that brought joy to everyone on earth?”

firstLine: All of your enemies open their mouths
rest:
wide against you.
They laugh at you and grind their teeth.
They say, “We have swallowed Jerusalem’s people up.
This is the day we’ve waited for.
And we’ve lived to see it.”

firstLine: People in the city of Zion,
rest:
cry out from your heart to the Lord.
Let your tears flow like a river
day and night.
Don’t stop at all.
Don’t give your eyes any rest.

firstLine: “Young people and old people alike
rest:
lie dead in the dust of my streets.
My young women and young men
have been killed with swords.
You killed them when you were angry.
You put them to death without pity.

firstLine: “You sent for terrors to come against me on every side.
rest:
It was as if you were inviting people to enjoy a feast day.
Because you were angry, no one escaped.
No one was left alive.
I took good care of my children and brought them up.
But my enemies have destroyed them.”

firstLine: He has made me live in darkness
rest: like those who are dead and gone.

firstLine: The arrows from his bag
rest: have gone through my heart.

firstLine: It is good when people wait quietly
rest: for the Lord to save them.

firstLine: It is good for a man to carry a heavy load of suffering
rest: while he is young.

firstLine: The Lord doesn’t turn his back
rest: on people forever.

firstLine: He doesn’t want to bring pain
rest: or suffering to people.

firstLine: Every time people crush prisoners under their feet,
rest: the Lord knows all about it.

firstLine: When people refuse to give a man his rights,
rest: the Most High God knows it.

firstLine: When people don’t treat a man fairly,
rest: the Lord knows it.

firstLine: Troubles and good things alike come to people
rest: because the Most High God has commanded them to come.

firstLine: A man who is still alive shouldn’t blame God
rest: when God punishes him for his sins.

firstLine: “You have covered yourself with the cloud of your anger.
rest:
You have chased us.
You have killed our people without pity.

firstLine: You have made us become like trash and garbage
rest: among the nations.

firstLine: “All of our enemies have opened their mouths wide
rest: to swallow us up.

firstLine: Those who were my enemies for no reason at all
rest: hunted me down as if I were a bird.

firstLine: They tried to end my life
rest:
by throwing me into a deep pit.
They threw stones down at me.

firstLine: I prayed, “Please don’t close your ears
rest:
to my cry for help.”
And you heard my appeal.

firstLine: Lord, you have seen the wrong things
rest:
people have done to me.
Stand up for me again!

firstLine: You have seen how my enemies
rest:
have tried to get even with me.
You know all about their plans against me.

firstLine: You have heard my enemies
rest:
whispering among themselves.
They speak against me all day long.

firstLine: The priceless children of Zion
rest:
were worth their weight in gold.
But now they are thought of as clay pots
made by the hands of a potter.

firstLine: Even wild dogs
rest:
nurse their young pups.
But my people are as mean
as ostriches in the desert.

firstLine: When our babies get thirsty,
rest:
their tongues stick to the roofs of their mouths.
When our children beg for bread,
no one gives them any.

firstLine: Those who once ate fine food
rest:
are dying in the streets.
Those who wore fancy clothes
are now lying on piles of trash.

firstLine: My people have been punished
rest:
more than Sodom was.
It was destroyed in a moment.
No one offered it a helping hand.

firstLine: Those who have been killed with swords are better off
rest:
than those who have to die of hunger.
Those who are hungry waste away to nothing.
They don’t have any food from the fields.

firstLine: With their own hands, loving mothers
rest:
have had to cook even their own children.
They ate their children
when my people were destroyed.

firstLine: Now those prophets and priests
rest:
have to feel their way along the streets
like people who are blind.
The blood of those they killed has made them “unclean.”
So no one dares even to touch their clothes.

firstLine: “Go away! You are ‘unclean’!”
rest:
people cry out to them.
“Go away! Get out of here!
Don’t touch us!”
So they run away and wander around.
Then people among the nations say,
“They can’t stay here anymore.”

firstLine: Those who were hunting us down were faster
rest:
than eagles in the sky.
They chased us over the mountains.
They hid and waited for us in the desert.

firstLine: People of Zion, the time for you to be punished
rest:
will come to an end.
The Lord won’t keep you away from your land any longer.
But he will punish your sin, people of Edom.
He will show you the evil things you have done.

firstLine: We put ourselves under the control of Egypt and Assyria
rest: just to get enough bread.

firstLine: The Lord Gives Ezekiel Visions of His Glory
rest: I was 30 years old. I was with my people who had been taken away from their country. We were by the Kebar River in the land of Babylonia. On the fifth day of the fourth month, the heavens were opened. I saw visions of God.

firstLine: The Lord Chooses Ezekiel
rest: He said to me, “Son of man, stand up on your feet. I will speak to you.”

firstLine: The Lord Warns Israel
rest: After seven days, a message came to me from the Lord.

firstLine: An Attack on Jerusalem Is Pictured
rest: “Son of man, get a clay tablet. Put it in front of you. Draw the city of Jerusalem on it.

firstLine: Ezekiel Prophesies Against the Mountains of Israel
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: The End Has Come
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: The People Worship Other Gods in the Temple
rest: It was the sixth year since King Jehoiachin had been brought to Babylon as a prisoner. On the fifth day of the sixth month, I was sitting in my house. The elders of Judah were sitting there with me. The Lord and King put his powerful hand on me there.

firstLine: The Lord Judges Those Who Worship Other Gods
rest: Then I heard the Lord call out in a loud voice. He said, “Bring those who guard the city here. Make sure each of them has a weapon.”

firstLine: The Glory of the Lord Moves Out of the Temple
rest: I looked up and saw something that appeared to be a throne made out of sapphire. It was above the huge space that was spread out over the heads of the cherubim.

firstLine: The Lord Punishes Israel’s Leaders
rest: Then the Spirit of the Lord lifted me up. He brought me to the east gate of the Lord’s house. There were 25 men at the entrance of the gate. I saw Jaazaniah and Pelatiah among them. They were leaders of the people. Jaazaniah is the son of Azzur. Pelatiah is the son of Benaiah.

firstLine: The Lord Will Bring His People Back Home
rest: “So tell them, ‘The Lord and King says, “I sent some of my people far away among the nations. I scattered them among the countries. But for a little while I have been their temple in the countries where they have gone.”’

firstLine: Many People Will Be Taken to Babylonia
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: The Lord Punishes Those Who Pretend to Be True Prophets
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: The Lord Judges Those Who Worship Other Gods
rest: Some of the elders of Israel came to see me. They sat down with me.

firstLine: The Lord Punishes All Sinners
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: Jerusalem Is Like a Useless Vine
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: A Story That Pictures Unfaithful Jerusalem
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: Two Eagles and a Vine
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: People Will Die Because of Their Own Sins
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: “You people have a proverb about the land of Israel. What do you mean by it? It says,
rest:
“‘The parents eat sour grapes.
But the children have a bitter taste in their mouths.’

firstLine: “Suppose a godly man
rest: does what is fair and right.

firstLine: “Suppose he does not eat at the mountain temples.
rest:
And he does not worship the statues of Israel’s gods.
He does not have sex with another man’s wife.

firstLine: “So I will judge you people. I will judge each of you in keeping with what you have done,” announces the Lord and King.
rest: “Turn away from your sins! Turn away from all of the evil things you have done. Then sin will not bring you down.

firstLine: A Song of Sadness About Israel’s Princes
rest: “Sing a song of sadness about Israel’s princes.

firstLine: Say to Israel,
rest:
“‘You were like a mother lion to your princes.
She lay down among the young lions.
She brought up her cubs.

firstLine: “‘The mother lion looked and waited.
rest:
But all of her hope was gone.
So she got another one of her cubs.
She made him into a strong lion.

firstLine: “‘Israel, you were like a vine in a vineyard.
rest:
It was planted near water.
It had a lot of fruit and many branches.
There was plenty of water.

firstLine: Israel Refuses to Obey the Lord
rest: It was the seventh year since King Jehoiachin had been brought to Babylon as a prisoner. On the tenth day of the fifth month, some of the elders of Israel came to ask the Lord for advice. They sat down with me.

firstLine: The Lord Judges Israel and Blesses Them
rest: The Lord said to me, “Speak to the people of Israel. Tell them, ‘The Lord and King says, “Are you going to pollute yourselves the way your people did? Do you long to see the statues of their evil gods?

firstLine: Ezekiel Prophesies Against the South
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: God Uses Babylonia to Judge Israel
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: “Son of man, prophesy. Say, ‘The Lord says,
rest:
“‘“A sword! A sword!
A sharp and shiny sword is coming from Babylonia!

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“I have told Nebuchadnezzar to shine his sword.
It is in his hand.
It has been sharpened and shined.
It is ready for the killer’s hand.

firstLine: “Son of man, prophesy.
rest:
Clap your hands.
Let the sword strike twice.
Let it strike even three times.
It is a sword to kill people.
It is a sword to kill many people.
It is closing in on them from every side.

firstLine: Jerusalem Sins Against the Lord
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: Samaria and Jerusalem Are Like Two Impure Sisters
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: The Lord and King says to Oholibah,
rest:
“You will drink from your sister’s cup.
It is large and deep.
It is filled with the wine of my anger.
So others will laugh at you.
They will make fun of you.

firstLine: Jerusalem Is Like a Cooking Pot
rest: It was the ninth year since King Jehoiachin had been brought to Babylon as a prisoner. On the tenth day of the tenth month, a message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: “Your people refuse to obey me. So tell them a story. Say to them, ‘The Lord and King told me,
rest:
“‘“Put a cooking pot on the fire.
Pour water into it.

firstLine: The Lord and King says,
rest:
“How terrible it will be for this city!
It has so many murderers in it.
How terrible for the pot that is coated with scum!
The scum on it will not go away.
Take the meat and bones out of the pot piece by piece.
Do not cast lots for them.

firstLine: “The blood Jerusalem’s people spilled is inside its walls.
rest:
They poured it out on a bare rock.
They did not pour it on the ground.
If they had, dust would have covered it up.

firstLine: So the Lord and King said to me,
rest:
“How terrible it will be for this city!
It has so many murderers in it.
I too will pile the wood high.

firstLine: Ezekiel’s Wife Dies
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: A Message About Ammon
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: A Message About Moab
rest: The Lord and King says, “Moab and Edom said, ‘Look! The people of Judah have become like all of the other nations.’

firstLine: A Message About Edom
rest: The Lord and King says, “Edom got even with the people of Judah. That made them very guilty.”

firstLine: A Message About the Philistines
rest: The Lord and King says, “The Philistines hated Judah deep down inside them. So they tried to get even with them. They had been Judah’s enemies for many years. So they tried to destroy them.”

firstLine: A Message About Tyre
rest: It was the first day of a month near the end of the 11th year since King Jehoiachin had been brought to Babylon as a prisoner. A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: “Then they will sing a song of sadness about you. They will say to you,
rest:
“‘Famous city, you have been completely destroyed!
You were filled with sea traders.
You and your citizens
were a mighty power on the seas.
You terrified everyone
who lived in you.

firstLine: The lands along the coast trembled with fear
rest:
when you fell.
The islands in the sea
were terrified when you were destroyed.’”

firstLine: A Song of Sadness About Tyre
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: They cut all of your lumber
rest:
from pine trees on Mount Hermon.
They used a cedar tree from Lebanon
to make a mast for you.

firstLine: They made your oars
rest:
out of oak trees from Bashan.
They made your deck out of cypress wood
from the coasts of Cyprus.
They decorated it with ivory.

firstLine: “‘“City of Tyre, men from Persia, Lydia and Put
rest:
served as soldiers in your army.
They hung their shields and helmets on your walls.
That brought glory to you.

firstLine: Men from Arvad and Cilicia
rest:
guarded your walls on every side.
Men from Gammad
were in your towers.
They hung their shields around your walls.
They made you perfect and beautiful.

firstLine: “‘“The ships of Tarshish
rest:
carry your products.
You are like a ship filled with a heavy load
in the middle of the sea.

firstLine: The sailors who man your oars take you
rest:
out to the high seas.
But the east wind will break you in pieces
in the middle of the sea.

firstLine: The lands along the coast will shake
rest: when your officers cry out.

firstLine: All those who man the oars
rest:
will desert their ships.
The sailors and all of the officers
will stand on the shore.

firstLine: As they sob and cry over you,
rest:
they will sing a song of sadness about you.
They will say, ‘Who was ever like Tyre?
It was destroyed in the sea.’

firstLine: All those who live in the lands along the coast
rest:
are shocked because of what has happened to you.
Their kings tremble with fear.
Their faces are twisted in horror.

firstLine: A Message About the King of Tyre
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: “Son of man, speak to Ethbaal. He is the ruler of Tyre. Tell him, ‘The Lord and King says,
rest:
“‘“In your proud heart
you say, ‘I am a god.
I sit on the throne of a god
in the Mediterranean Sea.’
But you are only a man. You are not a god.
In spite of that, you think you are as wise as a god.

firstLine: You have used your great skill in trading
rest:
to increase your wealth.
You are very rich.
So your heart has become proud.”’”

firstLine: The Lord and King says,
rest:
“You think you are wise.
In fact, you claim to be as wise as a god.

firstLine: “Son of man, sing a song of sadness about the king of Tyre. Tell him, ‘The Lord and King says,
rest:
“‘“You were the model of perfection.
You were full of wisdom.
You were perfect and beautiful.

firstLine: Your conduct was without blame
rest:
from the day you were created.
But soon you began to sin.

firstLine: You thought you were so handsome
rest:
that it made your heart proud.
You thought you were so glorious
that it spoiled your wisdom.
So I threw you down to the earth.
I made an example out of you in front of kings.

firstLine: Your many sins and dishonest trade
rest:
polluted your temple.
So I made you go up in flames.
I turned you into nothing but ashes on the ground.
I let everyone see it.

firstLine: All of the nations that knew you
rest:
are shocked because of what happened to you.
You have come to a horrible end.
And you will be gone forever.”’”

firstLine: A Message About Sidon
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: Say, ‘The Lord and King says,
rest:
“‘“Sidon, I am against your people.
I will gain glory for myself inside your city walls.
I will punish your people.
I will show that I am holy among them.
Then they will know that I am the Lord.

firstLine: A Message About Egypt
rest: It was the tenth year since King Jehoiachin had been brought to Babylon as a prisoner. On the 12th day of the tenth month, a message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: Tell him, ‘The Lord and King says,
rest:
“‘“Pharaoh Hophra, I am against you.
King of Egypt, you are like a huge monster
lying among your streams.
You say, ‘The Nile River belongs to me.
I made it for myself.’

firstLine: A Song of Sadness About Egypt
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: “Son of man, prophesy. Say, ‘The Lord and King says,
rest:
“‘“Cry out,
‘A terrible day is coming!’

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“Those who were going to help Egypt will die.
The strength Egypt was so proud of will fail.
Its people will be killed with swords
from Migdol all the way to Aswan,”
announces the Lord and King.

firstLine: “Egypt will be more empty than any other land.
rest: Its cities will be completely destroyed.

firstLine: The Lord and King says,
rest:
“I will put an end to the huge armies of Egypt.
I will use Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylonia, to do it.

firstLine: The Lord and King says,
rest:
“I will destroy the statues of Egypt’s gods.
I will put an end to the gods
the people in Memphis worship.
Egypt will not have princes anymore.
I will spread fear all through the land.

firstLine: The young men of Heliopolis and Bubastis
rest:
will be killed with swords.
Their people will be taken away as prisoners.

firstLine: A Cedar Tree in Lebanon
rest: It was the 11th year since King Jehoiachin had been brought to Babylon as a prisoner. On the first day of the third month, a message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: “Son of man, speak to Pharaoh Hophra, the king of Egypt. Also speak to his huge army. Tell him,
rest: “‘Who can be compared with your majesty?

firstLine: So it grew higher
rest:
than any other tree in the fields.
It grew more limbs.
Its branches grew long.
They spread because they had plenty of water.

firstLine: All of the birds of the air
rest:
made their nests in its limbs.
All of the wild animals
had their babies under its branches.
All of the great nations
lived in its shade.

firstLine: Its spreading branches
rest:
made it majestic and beautiful.
Its roots went down deep
to where there was plenty of water.

firstLine: The cedar trees in my garden
rest:
were no match for it.
The pine trees
could not equal its limbs.
The plane trees
could not compare with its branches.
No tree in my garden
could match its beauty.

firstLine: A Song of Sadness About Pharaoh
rest: It was the 12th year since King Jehoiachin had been brought to Babylon as a prisoner. On the first day of the 12th month, a message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: “Son of man, sing a song of sadness about Pharaoh Hophra, the king of Egypt. Tell him,
rest:
“‘You are like a lion among the nations.
You are like a monster in the sea.
You move around wildly in your rivers.
You churn the water with your feet.
You make the streams muddy.’”

firstLine: The Lord and King says,
rest:
“I will use a large crowd of people
to throw my net over you.
They will pull you up in it.

firstLine: When I wipe you out,
rest:
I will put a cover over the heavens.
I will darken the stars.
I will cover the sun with a cloud.
The moon will stop shining.

firstLine: I will darken all of the bright lights
rest:
in the sky above you.
I will bring darkness over your land,”
announces the Lord and King.

firstLine: “The hearts of many people will be troubled.
rest:
That is because I will destroy you among the nations.
You had never known anything about those lands before.

firstLine: Many nations will be shocked
rest:
when they see what has happened to you.
Their kings will tremble with fear
when they find out about it.
I will get ready to use Nebuchadnezzar
as my sword against them.
On the day you fall from power,
each of the kings will tremble with fear.
Each will be afraid he is the next to die.”

firstLine: The Lord and King says,
rest:
“I will send against you
the sword of the king of Babylonia.

firstLine: I will destroy all of its cattle
rest:
from the places where they have plenty of water.
Human feet will never stir the water up again.
The hoofs of cattle will not make it muddy anymore.

firstLine: “I will turn Egypt into an empty land.
rest:
I will strip away everything in it.
I will strike down everyone who lives there.
Then they will know that I am the Lord.

firstLine: The Lord Warns Israel
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: The Lord Explains Why Jerusalem Fell
rest: It was the 12th year since we had been brought to Babylonia as prisoners. On the fifth day of the tenth month, a man who had escaped from Jerusalem came to bring me a report. He said, “The city has fallen!”

firstLine: The Lord Is the Shepherd of His People
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: A Message About Edom
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: A Message About Israel
rest: “Son of man, prophesy to the mountains of Israel. Tell them, ‘Mountains of Israel, listen to the Lord’s message.

firstLine: Israel’s Dry Bones Will Come to Life Again
rest: The Lord put his strong hand on me. His Spirit brought me away from my home. He put me down in the middle of a valley. It was full of bones.

firstLine: Israel Will Be One Nation Under One King
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: A Message About Gog
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. He said,

firstLine: The New Temple Area
rest: It was the 14th year after Jerusalem had been captured. It was the tenth day of a month near the beginning of the 25th year since we had been brought to Babylonia as prisoners. On that very day the Lord put his strong hand on me. He took me back to my land.

firstLine: The East Gate to the Outer Courtyard
rest: I saw a wall that completely surrounded the temple area. The measuring rod in the man’s hand was ten and a half feet long. He measured the wall with it. The wall was as thick and as high as one measuring rod.

firstLine: The Outer Courtyard
rest: Then the man brought me into the outer courtyard. There I saw some rooms and a sidewalk. They had been built all around the courtyard. Along the sidewalk were 30 rooms.

firstLine: The North Gate
rest: Then the man measured the gate that faced north. He wanted to show me how long and wide it was. The gate led into the outer courtyard.

firstLine: The South Gate
rest: Then the man led me to the south side of the courtyard. There I saw a gate that faced south. He measured its doorposts and porch. They measured the same as the others.

firstLine: The Gates to the Inner Courtyard
rest: Then the man brought me into the inner courtyard. We went through the south gate. He measured it. It was the same size as the others.

firstLine: The Rooms for Preparing Sacrifices
rest: A room with a doorway was by the porch of each inner gateway. The burnt offerings were washed there.

firstLine: The Rooms for the Priests
rest: Near the inner gates were two rooms. They were in the inner courtyard. One room was next to the north gate. It faced south. The other one was next to the south gate. It faced north.

firstLine: The Temple
rest: The man brought me to the porch of the temple. He measured the doorposts of the porch. Each of them was almost nine feet wide. The entrance was 24 and a half feet wide. Each of the side walls was a little over five feet wide.

firstLine: The Rooms for the Priests
rest: Then the man led me north into the outer courtyard of the temple. He brought me to the rooms that were across from the inner courtyard. They were across from the outer wall of the temple on the north side.

firstLine: The Glory of the Lord Returns to the Temple
rest: Then the man brought me to the east gate.

firstLine: The Altar
rest: The man said, “Here is the size of the altar. The standard measurement I am using is 21 inches. The base of the altar is 21 inches high. The base has a ledge that is 21 inches wide. It also has a rim that is nine inches wide around the edge. Here is how high the altar is.

firstLine: The Prince, the Levites and the Priests
rest: Then the man brought me back to the outer gate of the temple. It was the one that faced east. It was shut.

firstLine: Dividing Up the Land
rest: “People of Israel, you will divide up the land you will receive. When you do, give me my share of it. It will be a sacred area. It will be eight and a fourth miles long and six and a half miles wide. The entire area will be holy.

firstLine: Offerings and Holy Days
rest: “You must offer a special gift. It must be 13 and a third cups out of every six bushels of grain.

firstLine: A River Will Flow From the Temple
rest: The man brought me back to the entrance to the temple. I saw water flowing east from under a temple gateway. The temple faced east. The water was coming down from under the south side of the temple. It was flowing south of the altar.

firstLine: The Borders of the Land
rest: The Lord and King says, “People of Israel, here are the borders you will have after you divide up the land. Each of the 12 tribes will receive a share. But the family of Joseph will have two shares.

firstLine: “Here are the borders of the land.
rest: “On the north side the border will start at the Mediterranean Sea. It will go by the Hethlon road past Lebo Hamath. Then it will continue on to Zedad,

firstLine: The Land Will Be Divided Up
rest: “Here are the tribes. They are listed by their names. Dan will receive one share of land. It will be at the northern border of Israel. The border will follow the Hethlon road to Lebo Hamath. Hazar Enan will be part of the border. So will the northern border of Damascus next to Hamath. Dan’s northern border will run from east to west.

firstLine: The Gates of the City
rest: “Here is a list of the gates of the city. Start with its north side. It will be a mile and a half long.

firstLine: “The city will be six miles around.
rest:
“From that time on, its name will be
the Lord is there.”

firstLine: Daniel Is Trained in Babylon
rest: It was the third year that Jehoiakim was king of Judah. Nebuchadnezzar came to Jerusalem. His armies surrounded the city and attacked it. Nebuchadnezzar was king of Babylonia.

firstLine: Nebuchadnezzar Dreams About a Large Statue
rest: In the second year of Nebuchadnezzar’s rule, he had a dream. His mind was troubled. He couldn’t sleep.

firstLine: He said,
rest:
“May God be praised for ever and ever!
He is wise and powerful.

firstLine: Daniel Tells the King What His Dream Means
rest: Then Daniel went to Arioch. The king had appointed him to put the wise men of Babylon to death. Daniel said to him, “Don’t kill the wise men of Babylon. Take me to the king. I’ll tell him what his dream means.”

firstLine: Daniel’s Friends Are Thrown Into a Blazing Furnace
rest: King Nebuchadnezzar made a statue that was covered with gold. It was 90 feet tall and 9 feet wide. He set it up on the flatlands of Dura near the city of Babylon.

firstLine: Nebuchadnezzar Dreams About a Tree
rest:
I, King Nebuchadnezzar, am writing this letter.
I am sending it to you people from every nation and language in the whole world.
May you have great success!

firstLine: Daniel Explains Nebuchadnezzar’s Dream
rest:
Daniel, who was also called Belteshazzar, was very bewildered for a while. His thoughts terrified him. So the king said, “Belteshazzar, don’t let the dream or its meaning make you afraid.”
Belteshazzar answered, “My master, I wish the dream were about your enemies! I wish its meaning had to do with them!

firstLine: Nebuchadnezzar’s Dream Comes True
rest: All of that happened to me.

firstLine: He considers all of the nations on earth
rest:
to be nothing.
He does as he pleases
with the powers of heaven.
He does what he wants
with the nations of the earth.
No one can hold his hand back.
No one can say to him,
“What have you done?”

firstLine: A Hand Writes on the Palace Wall
rest: King Belshazzar gave a big dinner. He invited a thousand of his nobles to it. He drank wine with them.

firstLine: “Here is what was written.
rest: mene, mene, tekel, parsin

firstLine: “And here is what those words mean.
rest: Mene means that God has limited the time of your rule. He has brought it to an end.

firstLine: Daniel Is Thrown Into a Den of Lions
rest: It pleased Darius to appoint 120 royal rulers over his entire kingdom.

firstLine: “I order people in every part of my kingdom to respect and honor Daniel’s God.
rest:
“He is the living God.
He will live forever.
His kingdom will not be destroyed.
His rule will never end.

firstLine: Daniel Has a Vision About Four Animals
rest: It was the first year that Belshazzar was king of Babylon. Daniel had a dream. He was lying on his bed. In his dream, visions passed through his mind. He wrote down what he saw.

firstLine: “As I watched,
rest:
“thrones were set in place.
The Eternal God took his seat.
His clothes were as white as snow.
The hair on his head was white like wool.
His throne was blazing with fire.
And flames were all around its wheels.

firstLine: An Angel Tells Daniel What His Dream Means
rest: “My spirit was troubled. The visions that passed through my mind upset me.

firstLine: Daniel Has a Vision About a Ram and a Goat
rest: It was the third year of King Belshazzar’s rule. After the vision that had already appeared to me, I had another one.

firstLine: Gabriel Tells Daniel What His Vision Means
rest: I was watching the vision. And I was trying to understand it. Then I saw someone who looked like a man.

firstLine: Daniel Prays to the Lord
rest: It was the first year that Darius was king of Babylonia. He was from Media and was the son of Xerxes.

firstLine: Gabriel Tells Daniel About Seventy “Weeks”
rest: I was speaking and praying. I was admitting that I and my people Israel had sinned. I was making my appeal to the Lord my God concerning his holy mountain of Zion.

firstLine: Daniel Has a Vision About What Will Happen to Israel
rest: It was the third year that Cyrus, the king of Persia, ruled over Babylonia. At that time I was living in Babylon. There the people called me Belteshazzar. A message came to me from God. It was true. It was about a great war. I had a vision that showed me what it meant.

firstLine: “Do not be afraid,” he said. “You are highly respected. May peace be with you! Be strong now. Be strong.”
rest: When he spoke to me, I became stronger. I said, “Speak, my master. You have given me strength.”

firstLine: The Kings of Egypt and Syria
rest: “Now then, what I’m about to tell you is true. Three more kings will appear in Persia. Then a fourth one will rule. He will be much richer than all of the others. He will use his wealth to gain power. And he will stir up everyone against the kingdom of Greece.

firstLine: A King Will Honor Himself
rest: “A certain king will do as he pleases. He will honor himself. He will put himself above every god. He will say things that have never been heard before against the greatest God of all. He will have success until God is not angry anymore. What God has decided to do must take place.

firstLine: The Time of the End
rest: “At that time Michael will appear. He is the great leader of the angels who guards your people. There will be a time of terrible suffering. Things will be worse than at any time since nations began. But at that time of suffering your people will be saved. Their names are written in the Book of Life.

firstLine: Hosea’s Wife and Children
rest: The Lord began to speak through me. He said to me, “Go. Get married to a woman who will commit adultery. Take as your own the children who will be born as a result of her adultery. Marry her because the people of the land are guilty of the worst kind of adultery. They have not been faithful to me.”

firstLine: Israel Is Punished and Brought Back to the Lord
rest:
I said to my children,
“Talk things over with your mother.
Talk to her.
She isn’t acting like a wife to me anymore.
She no longer treats me as her husband.
Tell her to stop looking and acting like a prostitute.
Tell her not to let her lovers
lie on her breasts anymore.

firstLine: She wouldn’t admit that I was the one
rest:
who gave her everything she had.
I provided her with grain, olive oil and fresh wine.
I gave her plenty of silver and gold.
But she used it to make statues of Baal.

firstLine: The Lord announces,
rest:
“Israel burned incense to the gods
that were named after Baal.
I will punish her
for all of the times she did that.
She decorated herself with rings and jewelry.
Then she went after her lovers.
But she forgot all about me.

firstLine: “So now I am going to draw her back to me.
rest:
I will lead her into the desert.
There I will speak tenderly to her.

firstLine: “A new day is coming,” announces the Lord.
rest:
“Israel will call me My Husband.
She will no longer call me My Master.

firstLine: She will no longer speak about the gods
rest:
that are named after Baal.
She will not pray to them for help anymore.

firstLine: At that time I will make a covenant
rest:
for the good of my people.
I will make it with the wild animals
and the birds of the air.
It will also be made with the creatures
that move on the ground.
I will remove bows and swords
and other weapons of war from the land.
Then my people can lie down in safety.

firstLine: “So at that time I will answer her,”
rest:
announces the Lord.
“I will command the skies
to send rain on the earth.

firstLine: Hosea Brings His Wife Back to Himself
rest: The Lord said to me, “Go. Show your love to your wife again. She is loved by another man. And she has committed adultery. But I want you to love her just as I love the people of Israel. They turn to other gods. And they love to offer raisin cakes to Baal and eat them. In spite of that, I love my people.”

firstLine: The Lord Brings Charges Against Israel
rest:
People of Israel, listen to the Lord’s message.
He is bringing charges
against you who live in Israel.
He says, “There is no faithfulness
or love in the land.
No one recognizes me as God.

firstLine: “But you priests should not blame the people.
rest:
You should not find fault with one another.
After all, your people
could also bring charges against you.

firstLine: My people are destroyed
rest:
because they do not know me.
“You priests have refused to obey me.
So I will refuse to accept you as my priests.
You have not paid any attention to my law.
So I will not let your children be my priests.

firstLine: The more priests there are,
rest:
the more they sin against me.
They have traded their glorious God for that shameful god Baal.

firstLine: “My people will eat.
rest:
But they will not have enough.
They will have sex with prostitutes.
But they will not have any children.
That is because they have deserted me.

firstLine: “I will not punish your daughters
rest:
when they become prostitutes.
I will not judge your daughters-in-law
when they commit adultery.
After all, the men themselves have sex with sinful women.
They offer sacrifices where temple prostitutes earn their living.
People who can’t understand will be destroyed!

firstLine: “Israel, you are not faithful to me.
rest:
But I do not want Judah to become guilty too.
“My people, do not go to Gilgal to offer sacrifices.
Do not go up to Bethel to worship other gods.
Do not take an oath and say,
‘You can be sure that the Lord is alive.’

firstLine: They continue to be unfaithful to me
rest:
even when their drinks are gone.
And their rulers love to do shameful things.

firstLine: The Lord Judges Israel
rest:
“Listen to me, you priests!
Pay attention, people of Israel!
Listen, you members of the royal family!
Here is my decision against you.
You have been like a trap at Mizpah.
You have been like a net spread out on Mount Tabor.

firstLine: “You can’t return to me
rest:
because you have done so many evil things.
In your hearts you long to act like prostitutes.
You do not recognize me as the Lord.

firstLine: “My people, blow trumpets in Gibeah!
rest:
Blow horns in Ramah!
Shout the battle cry in Bethel!
Say to Benjamin, ‘The Assyrian army is coming!’

firstLine: People of Ephraim, you will be completely destroyed
rest:
when it is time for me to punish you.
