You can be sure it will happen.
I am announcing it among your tribes.

firstLine: “Ephraim, you saw how sick you were.
rest:
Judah, you saw that you were wounded.
Ephraim, you turned to Assyria for help.
You sent gifts to the great King Tiglath-Pileser.
But he is not able to make you well.
He can’t heal your wounds.

firstLine: Israel Refuses to Turn Away From Their Sins
rest:
The people say, “Come.
Let us return to the Lord.
He has torn us to pieces.
But he will heal us.
He has wounded us.
But he’ll bandage our wounds.

firstLine: Just as Adam disobeyed me,
rest:
you have broken the covenant I made with you.
You were not faithful to me in the land I gave you.

firstLine: People of Israel, I have seen
rest:
a horrible thing in your land.
People of Ephraim, you have joined yourselves to other gods.
You have made yourselves ‘unclean.’

firstLine: “People of Judah, I have appointed a time
rest:
for you to be destroyed.
“My people, I would like to bless you
with great success again.”

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“I would like to heal Israel.
But when I try to, Ephraim’s sins
are brought out into the open.
The crimes of Samaria
are made known to everyone.
The people tell lies.
They break into houses and steal.
They rob others in the streets.

firstLine: But they do not realize
rest:
that I remember all of the evil things they do.
Their sins pile up and cover them.
I am always aware of those sins.

firstLine: “Their evil conduct even makes the king glad.
rest: Their lies make the princes happy.

firstLine: On special days to honor our king,
rest:
the princes get drunk with wine.
And the king enjoys the party.
He joins hands with those
who pretend to be faithful to him.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“The people of Ephraim are like a dove.
They are easily tricked.
They do not have any sense at all.
First they call out to Egypt for help.
Then they turn to Assyria.

firstLine: When they send for help,
rest:
I will throw my net over them.
I will capture them like birds of the air.
I will punish them,
just as I warned them I would.

firstLine: Israel Will Harvest a Windstorm
rest:
The Lord said to me,
“Put a trumpet to your lips!
Give a warning to my people!
Assyria is like an eagle.
It is ready to attack my land.
My people have broken the covenant I made with them.
They have refused to obey my law.

firstLine: Israel shouts to me,
rest: ‘We recognize you as our God!’

firstLine: The Lord says, “People of Samaria,
rest:
throw out your god that looks like a calf!
My anger burns against you.
How long will it be until you are able
to remain faithful to me?

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“Worshiping other gods is like worshiping the wind.
It is like planting worthless seeds.
Assyria is like a windstorm.
That is all my people will harvest.
There are no heads of grain
on the stems that will come up.
So they will not produce any flour.
Even if they did produce grain,
the Assyrians would eat all of it up.

firstLine: They have sold themselves to the nations
rest:
to get their help.
But now I will gather them together.
They will get weaker and weaker.
The mighty kings of Assyria will crush them.

firstLine: “Ephraim built many altars where they sacrificed
rest:
sin offerings to other gods.
So their altars have become
places where they commit sin.

firstLine: Israel Will Be Punished
rest:
Israel, don’t be joyful.
Don’t be glad as the other nations are.
You haven’t been faithful to your God.
You love to get paid for being a prostitute.
Your pay is the grain at every threshing floor.

firstLine: You have sunk very deep into sin,
rest:
just as our people did at Gibeah long ago.
God will remember the evil things you have done.
He will punish you for your sins.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“When I first found Israel,
it was like finding grapes in the desert.
When I saw your people long ago,
it was like seeing the early fruit on a fig tree.
But then they went to Baal Peor.
There they gave themselves to that shameful god Baal.
They became as evil as the god they loved.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“My people did many evil things in Gilgal.
That is why I hated them there.
They committed many sins.
So I will drive them out of my land.
I will not love them anymore.
All of their leaders refuse to obey me.

firstLine: The high places where Israel worshiped other gods
rest:
will be destroyed.
That’s where they sinned against the Lord.
Thorns and weeds will grow up there.
They will cover the altars.
Then the people will say to the mountains, “Cover us!”
They’ll say to the hills, “Fall on us!”

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“Israel, you have done evil things
ever since your people sinned at Gibeah long ago.
And you are still doing what is evil.
War caught up
with those who sinned at Gibeah.

firstLine: Your hearts are as hard as a field
rest:
that has not been plowed.
If you change your ways,
you will produce good crops.
So plant the seeds of doing what is right.
Then you will harvest the fruit of your faithful love.
It is time to turn to me.
When you do, I will come
and shower my blessings on you.

firstLine: The Lord Loves Israel
rest:
The Lord continues,
“When Israel was a young nation, I loved them.
I chose to bring my son out of Egypt.

firstLine: But the more I called out to Israel,
rest:
the further they went away from me.
They brought sacrifices to the statues of the gods
that were named after Baal.
And they burned incense to them.

firstLine: “But they refuse to turn away from their sins.
rest:
So they will return to Egypt.
And Assyria will rule over them.

firstLine: My people have made up their minds
rest:
to turn away from me.
Even if they call out to me,
I will certainly not honor them.
I am the Most High God.”

firstLine: The Lord continues,
rest:
“People of Ephraim, how can I give you up?
Israel, how can I hand you over to your enemies?
Can I destroy you as I did the town of Admah?
Can I treat you like Zeboiim?
My heart is stirred inside me.
It is filled with pity for you.

firstLine: Israel Has Sinned
rest:
The people of Ephraim tell nothing but lies.
Israel has not been honest with me.
And Judah continues to wander away from God.
They have deserted the faithful Holy One.

firstLine: Even before Jacob was born,
rest:
he was holding on to his brother’s heel.
When he became a man,
he struggled with God.

firstLine: People of Ephraim, you brag,
rest:
“We are very rich.
We’ve become wealthy.
And no one can prove we sinned
to gain all of this wealth.”

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“I am the Lord your God.
I brought you out of Egypt.
But I will make you live in tents again.
That is what you did when you celebrated
the Feast of Booths in the desert.

firstLine: The Lord Is Angry With Israel
rest:
When the tribe of Ephraim spoke,
the other tribes trembled with fear.
Ephraim was honored in Israel.
But its people sinned by worshiping Baal.
So they were as good as dead.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“People of Israel, I am the Lord your God.
I brought you out of Egypt.
You must not recognize any God but me.
You must not have any Savior except me.

firstLine: I will attack you like a bear
rest:
that is robbed of her cubs.
I will rip you wide open.
Like a lion I will eat you up.
Like a wild animal I will tear you apart.

firstLine: “Israel, you will be destroyed.
rest: I helped you. But you turned against me.

firstLine: “I will set you free from the power of the grave.
rest:
I will save you from death.
Death, where are your plagues?
Grave, where is your power to destroy?
“Ephraim, I will no longer pity you.

firstLine: Even though you are doing well among the other tribes,
rest:
trouble will come to you.
I will send a hot and dry wind from the east.
It will blow in from the desert.
Your springs will not have any water.
Your wells will dry up.
All of your treasures
will be taken out of your storerooms.

firstLine: The Lord Blesses Those Who Turn Away From Sin
rest:
Israel, return to the Lord your God.
Your sins have destroyed you!

firstLine: Then the Lord will answer,
rest:
“My people always wander away from me.
But I will put an end to that.
My anger has turned away from them.
Now I will love them freely.

firstLine: Once again my people will live
rest:
in the safety of my shade.
They will grow like grain.
They will bloom like vines.
And they will be as famous
as wine from Lebanon.

firstLine: If you are wise, you will realize
rest:
that what I’ve said is true.
If you have understanding,
you will know what it means.
The ways of the Lord are right.
People who are right with God live the way he wants them to.
But those who refuse to obey him trip and fall.

firstLine: Locusts Attack the Land
rest:
Elders, listen to me.
Pay attention, all you who live in the land.
Has anything like this ever happened in your whole life?
Did it ever happen to your people
who lived long ago?

firstLine: The giant locusts have eaten
rest:
what the common locusts have left.
The young locusts have eaten
what the giant locusts have left.
And other locusts have eaten
what the young locusts have left.

firstLine: The locusts are like an army
rest:
that has marched into our land.
There are so many of them
they can’t even be counted.
Their teeth are as sharp as a lion’s teeth.
They are like the fangs of a female lion.

firstLine: My people, sob like a virgin
rest:
who is dressed in black clothes.
She is sad because she has lost
the young man she was going to marry.

firstLine: No one brings grain offerings and drink offerings
rest:
to the Lord’s house anymore.
So the priests who serve the Lord
are filled with sorrow.

firstLine: Turn Away From Sin
rest:
Priests, put on black clothes and sob.
Cry, you who serve at the altar.
Come, you who serve my God in the temple.
Spend the night dressed in black clothes.
Sob because no one brings grain offerings and drink offerings
to the house of your God anymore.

firstLine: Our food has been taken away
rest:
right in front of our eyes.
There isn’t any joy or gladness
in the house of our God.

firstLine: The Lord Sends an Army of Locusts
rest:
Priests, blow the trumpets in Zion.
Give a warning on my holy mountain.
Let everyone who lives in the land tremble with fear.
The day of the Lord is coming.
It is very near.

firstLine: The Lord thunders with his mighty voice
rest:
as he leads his army.
He has so many forces they can’t even be counted.
Those who obey his commands are great in number.
The day of the Lord is great and terrifying.
Who can live through it?

firstLine: Let Your Hearts Be Broken
rest:
The Lord announces to his people,
“Return to me with all your heart.
There is still time.
Do not eat any food.
Sob and cry.”

firstLine: The Lord Answers the Prayer of His People
rest:
Then the Lord will show concern for his land.
He will take pity on his people.

firstLine: He will reply,
rest:
“I will send you grain, olive oil and fresh wine.
It will be enough to satisfy you completely.
I will never allow other nations
to make fun of you again.

firstLine: “I will drive far away from you
rest:
the army that comes from the north.
I will send some of its forces
into a dry and empty land.
Those in front will be pushed into the Dead Sea.
The ones in back will be driven into the Mediterranean Sea.
Their dead bodies will give off a bad smell.”
The Lord has done great things.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“I sent a great army of locusts to attack you.
They included common locusts, giant locusts,
young locusts and other locusts.
I will make up for the years
they ate your crops.

firstLine: The Day of the Lord Is Coming
rest:
“After that, I will pour out my Spirit on all people.
Your sons and daughters will prophesy.
Your old men will have dreams.
Your young men will have visions.

firstLine: In those days I will pour out my Spirit
rest: on those who serve me, men and women alike.

firstLine: The Lord Judges the Nations
rest:
“At that time I will bless Judah and Jerusalem
with great success again.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“Stir up the nations into action!
Let them march into the valley
where I will judge them.
I will take my seat in court.
I will judge all of the surrounding nations.

firstLine: Huge numbers of soldiers are gathered in the valley
rest:
where the Lord will hand down his sentence.
The day of the Lord is near in that valley.

firstLine: The Lord Blesses His People
rest:
The Lord says,
“You will know that I am the Lord your God.
I live in Zion.
It is my holy mountain.
Jerusalem will be my holy city.
People from other lands
will never attack it again.

firstLine: “At that time fresh wine will drip from the mountains.
rest:
Milk will flow down from the hills.
Water will run through all of Judah’s valleys.
A fountain will flow out of my temple.
It will water the places where acacia trees grow.

firstLine: I said,
rest:
“The Lord roars like a lion from Jerusalem.
His voice sounds like thunder from Zion.
The grasslands of the shepherds turn brown.
The top of Mount Carmel dries up.”

firstLine: The Lord Punishes Israel’s Neighbors
rest:
The Lord says,
“The people of Damascus have sinned again and again.
So I will punish them.
They used threshing sleds with iron teeth
to crush Gilead’s people.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“The people of Gaza have sinned again and again.
So I will punish them.
They captured whole communities.
They sold them to Edom.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“The people of Tyre have sinned again and again.
So I will punish them.
They captured whole communities.
They sold them to Edom.
They did not honor the treaty
of friendship they had made.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“The people of Edom have sinned again and again.
So I will punish them.
They chased Israel with swords
that were ready to strike them down.
They did not show them any pity.
They were angry all the time.
Their anger blazed out.
It could not be stopped.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“The people of Ammon have sinned again and again.
So I will punish them.
They ripped open the pregnant women in Gilead.
They wanted to add land to their territory.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“The people of Moab have sinned again and again.
So I will punish them.
They burned the bones
of Edom’s king to ashes.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“The people of Judah have sinned again and again.
So I will punish them.
They have refused to obey my law.
They have not kept my rules.
Other gods have led them down the wrong path.
Their people before them
worshiped those gods.

firstLine: The Lord Punishes Israel
rest:
The Lord says,
“The people of Israel have sinned again and again.
So I will punish them.
They sell into slavery those who do what is right.
They trade needy people
for a mere pair of sandals.

firstLine: They grind the heads of the poor
rest:
into the dust of the ground.
They refuse to be fair to those who are crushed.
A father and his son have sex with the same girl.
They treat my name as if it were not holy.

firstLine: They lie down beside every altar
rest:
on clothes they had taken
until the owner paid back what was owed.
In the house of their God
they drink wine that was taken as fines.

firstLine: “I destroyed the Amorites to make room
rest:
for my people in the land.
The Amorites were as tall as cedar trees.
They were as strong as oak trees.
But I cut off their fruit above the ground
and their roots below it.

firstLine: “People of Israel, I brought you up out of Egypt.
rest:
I led you in the desert for 40 years.
I gave you the land of the Amorites.

firstLine: “But you made the Nazirites drink wine.
rest: You commanded the prophets not to prophesy.

firstLine: “A cart that is loaded with grain
rest:
crushes anything it runs over.
In the same way, I will crush you.

firstLine: Even your bravest soldiers
rest:
will run away naked on that day,”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: The Lord Judges His Chosen People
rest: People of Israel, listen to the Lord’s message. It is against you. It is against the whole family he brought up out of Egypt. He says,

firstLine: “Out of all of the families on earth
rest:
I have chosen only you.
So I will punish you
because you have committed so many sins.”

firstLine: Do two people walk together
rest: unless they’ve agreed to do so?

firstLine: Does a lion roar in the bushes
rest:
when it doesn’t have any food?
Does it growl in its den
when it hasn’t caught anything?

firstLine: Does a bird fall into a trap on the ground
rest:
where no one has set a trap for it?
Does a net spring up from the earth
when there isn’t anything for it to catch?

firstLine: When someone blows a trumpet in a city,
rest:
don’t the people tremble with fear?
When trouble comes to a city,
hasn’t the Lord caused it?

firstLine: The Lord and King never does anything
rest: without telling his servants the prophets about it.

firstLine: “They do not know how to do what is right,”
rest:
announces the Lord.
“They pile up stolen goods in their forts.”

firstLine: So the Lord and King says,
rest:
“Enemies will take over your land.
They will pull down your places of safety.
They will rob your forts.”

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“Suppose a shepherd saves only two leg bones
from a lion’s mouth.
Or he might save only a piece of an ear.
That is how the Israelites will be saved.
They sit in Samaria
on the edge of their beds.
They lie down in Damascus
on their couches.”

firstLine: “I will punish Israel for their sins.
rest:
When I do, I will destroy their altars at Bethel.
The horns that stick out from the upper corners
of their main altar will be cut off.
They will fall to the ground.

firstLine: Israel Has Not Returned to the Lord
rest:
Listen to the Lord’s message,
you women who live on the hill of Samaria.
You treat poor people badly.
You crush those who are in need.
You say to your husbands,
“Bring us some drinks!”
But you are already as fat
as the cows in Bashan.

firstLine: The Lord and King has taken an oath
rest:
in his own holy name.
He says, “You can be sure
that the time will come
when your enemies will put hooks in your faces.
They will lead every one of you away with fishhooks.

firstLine: Each of you will go straight out
rest:
through a gap in the wall.
You will be thrown out of the city
on the hill where you crush others,”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: “People of Samaria, go to Bethel and sin!
rest:
Go to Gilgal! Sin there even more!
Bring your sacrifices every morning.
Every third year, bring a tenth
of everything you produce.

firstLine: “I made sure your stomachs were empty in every city.
rest:
You did not have enough bread in any of your towns.
In spite of that, you still have not returned to me,”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: “I also held rain back from you.
rest:
The time to harvest crops
was still three months away.
I sent rain on one town.
But I held it back from another.
One field had rain.
Another did not. So it dried up.

firstLine: “Many times I struck your gardens and vineyards.
rest:
I sent hot winds to dry them up completely.
Locusts ate up your fig and olive trees.
In spite of that, you still have not returned to me,”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: “I sent plagues on you,
rest:
just as I did on Egypt.
I killed your young men with swords.
I also let the horses you had captured be killed.
I filled your noses with the bad smell of your camps.
In spite of that, you still have not returned to me,”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: “I destroyed some of you,
rest:
just as I did Sodom and Gomorrah.
You were like a burning stick that was pulled out of the fire.
In spite of that, you still have not returned to me,”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: “People of Israel, I will punish you.
rest:
Because I will do that to you,
prepare to meet your God!”

firstLine: Look to the Lord and Live
rest: People of Israel, listen to the Lord’s message. Hear my song of sadness about you. I say,

firstLine: “The people of Israel have fallen.
rest:
They will never get up again.
They are deserted in their own land.
No one can lift them up.”

firstLine: The Lord and King says,
rest:
“A thousand soldiers will march out from a city in Israel.
But only a hundred will return.
A hundred soldiers will march out from a town.
But only ten will come back.”

firstLine: The Day of the Lord Is Coming
rest:
How terrible it will be for you
who long for the day of the Lord!
Why do you want it to come?
That day will be dark, not light.

firstLine: It will be like a man running away from a lion
rest:
only to meet a bear.
He enters his house and rests his hand on a wall
only to be bitten by a snake.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“I hate your holy feasts.
I can’t stand them.
I hate it when you gather together.

firstLine: “People of Israel, did you bring me sacrifices and offerings
rest: for 40 years in the desert?

firstLine: So I will send you away
rest:
as prisoners beyond Damascus,”
says the Lord.
His name is God Who Rules Over All.

firstLine: The Lord Judges Israel’s Pride
rest:
How terrible it will be for you men
who are so contented on Mount Zion!
How terrible for you who feel secure
on the hill of Samaria!
You are famous men from the greatest nation.
The people of Israel come to you
for help and advice.

firstLine: You are trying to avoid the time
rest:
when trouble will come.
But you are only bringing closer
the Assyrian rule of terror.

firstLine: You lie down on beds
rest:
that are decorated with ivory.
You rest on your couches.
You eat the best lambs
and the fattest calves.

firstLine: So you will be among the first
rest:
to be taken away as prisoners.
You won’t be able to enjoy good food.
You won’t lie around on couches anymore.

firstLine: The Lord Gives Amos Three Visions
rest: The Lord and King gave me a vision. He was bringing large numbers of locusts on the land. The king’s share of the first crop had already been harvested. Now the second crop was coming up.

firstLine: “The high places where Isaac’s people worship other gods will be destroyed.
rest:
The other places of worship in Israel will also be torn down.
I will use my sword
to attack Jeroboam’s royal family.”

firstLine: Amaziah Tells Amos to Stop Prophesying
rest: Amaziah was priest of Bethel. He sent a message to Jeroboam, the king of Israel. He said, “Amos is making evil plans against you right here in Israel. The people in the land can’t stand to listen to what he’s saying.

firstLine: Amos is telling them,
rest:
“‘Jeroboam will be killed with a sword.
The people of Israel will be taken away as prisoners.
They will be carried off from their own land.’”

firstLine: “But the Lord says,
rest:
“‘Your wife will become a prostitute
in the city of Bethel.
Your sons and daughters will be killed with swords.
Your land will be measured and divided up.
And you yourself will die in another country.
The people of Israel will be taken away as prisoners.
They will be carried off from their own land.’”

firstLine: The Lord Gives Amos Another Vision
rest: The Lord and King gave me a vision. He showed me a basket of ripe fruit.

firstLine: “What do you see, Amos?” he asked.
rest:
“A basket of ripe fruit,” I replied.
Then the Lord said to me, “The time is ripe for my people Israel. I will no longer spare them.

firstLine: You say,
rest:
“When will the New Moon Feast be over?
Then we can sell our grain.
When will the Sabbath day come to an end?
Then people can buy our wheat.”
But you don’t measure out the right amount.
You raise your prices.
You cheat others by using dishonest scales.

firstLine: “The land will tremble because of what will happen.
rest:
Everyone who lives in it will sob.
So the whole land will rise like the Nile River.
It will be stirred up.
Then it will settle back down again
like that river in Egypt.”

firstLine: The Lord and King announces,
rest:
“At that time I will make the sun go down at noon.
The earth will become dark in the middle of the day.

firstLine: The Lord and King announces,
rest:
“The days are coming
when I will send hunger through the land.
But people will not be hungry for food.
They will not be thirsty for water.
Instead, they will be hungry
to hear a message from me.

firstLine: “At that time
rest:
“the lovely young women and strong young men
will faint because they are so thirsty.

firstLine: Some people take oaths in the name
rest:
of Samaria’s shameful god.
Others say, ‘People of Dan, you can be sure
that your god is alive.’
Still others say, ‘You can be sure
that Beersheba’s god is alive.’
But all of those people will fall dead.
They will never get up again.”

firstLine: The Lord Gives Amos a Final Vision
rest:
I saw the Lord standing next to the altar in the temple. He said to me,
“Strike the tops of the temple pillars.
Then the heavy stones at the base of the entrance will shake.
Bring everything down on the heads of everyone there.
I will kill with my swords
those who are left alive.
Not one of them will escape.
None will get away.

firstLine: Their enemies might take them away
rest:
as prisoners to another country.
But I will command their enemies
to kill them with their swords.
I will turn my eyes toward them to harm them.
I will not help them.”

firstLine: “You Israelites are just like
rest:
the people of Cush to me,”
announces the Lord.
“I brought Israel up from Egypt.
I also brought the Philistines from Crete
and the Arameans from Kir.

firstLine: “I am the Lord and King.
rest:
My eyes are watching the sinful kingdom of Israel.
I will wipe it off the face of the earth.
But I will not totally destroy the people of Jacob,”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: “I will give an order.
rest:
I will shake the people of Israel
among all of the nations.
They will be like grain that is shaken through a screen.
Not a pebble will fall to the ground.

firstLine: All of the sinners among my people
rest:
will be killed with swords.
They say, ‘Nothing bad will ever happen to us.’

firstLine: Israel Will Be Made Like New Again
rest:
“The time will come when I will rebuild
David’s fallen tent.
I will repair its broken places.
I will rebuild what was destroyed.
I will make it what it used to be.

firstLine: Then my people will take control of those
rest:
who are left alive in Edom.
They will also possess all of the nations
that belong to me,”
announces the Lord.
He will do all of those things.

firstLine: “A new day is coming,” announces the Lord.
rest:
“At that time those who plow the land
will catch up with those who harvest the crops.
Those who stomp on grapes
will catch up with those who plant the vines.
Fresh wine will drip from the mountains.
It will flow down from all of the hills.

firstLine: The Lord says to Edom,
rest:
“I will make you weak among the nations.
They will look down on you.

firstLine: “Edom, suppose robbers came to you at night.
rest:
They would steal only as much as they wanted.
Suppose grape pickers came to harvest your vines.
They would still leave a few grapes.
But you are facing horrible trouble!

firstLine: All those who are helping you
rest:
will force you to leave your country.
Your friends will trick you and overpower you.
Those who eat bread with you
will set a trap for you.
But you will not see it.”

firstLine: The Lord announces, “At that time
rest:
I will destroy the wise men of Edom.
I will wipe out the men of understanding
in the mountains of Esau.

firstLine: You did harmful things to your brothers,
rest:
the people of Jacob.
So you will be covered with shame.
You will be destroyed forever.

firstLine: You should not have marched
rest:
through the gates of my people’s city
when they were having so much trouble.
You should not have looked down on them.
You should not have stolen their wealth.

firstLine: “The day of the Lord is near
rest:
for all of the nations.
Others will do to you
what you have done to them.
You will be paid back
for what you have done.

firstLine: You Edomites polluted my holy mountain of Zion
rest:
by drinking and celebrating there.
So all of the nations will drink
from the cup of my anger.
And they will keep on drinking from it.
They will vanish.
It will be as if they had never existed.

firstLine: Israelites from the Negev Desert
rest:
will take over Esau’s mountains.
Israelites from the western hills
will possess Philistia.
They’ll take over the territories
of Ephraim and Samaria.
Israelites from the tribe of Benjamin
will possess the land of Gilead.

firstLine: Leaders from Mount Zion will go
rest:
and rule over the mountains of Esau.
And the kingdom will belong to the Lord.

firstLine: Jonah Runs Away From the Lord
rest: A message from the Lord came to Jonah. He was the son of Amittai. The Lord said,

firstLine: Jonah Prays to the Lord
rest: From inside the fish Jonah prayed to the Lord his God.

firstLine: He said,
rest:
“When I was in trouble, I called out to you.
And you answered me.
When I had almost drowned,
I called out for help.
And you listened to my cry.

firstLine: “When my life was nearly over,
rest:
I remembered you, Lord.
My prayer rose up to you.
It reached you in your holy temple in heaven.

firstLine: “Some people worship the worthless statues of their gods.
rest:
They turn away from the grace
you want to give them.

firstLine: Jonah Goes to Nineveh
rest: A message came to Jonah from the Lord a second time. He said,

firstLine: The Lord Shows Concern for Nineveh
rest: But Jonah was very upset. He became angry.

firstLine: The Lord Will Judge Samaria and Jerusalem
rest:
The Lord is about to come down
from his home in heaven.
He rules over the highest places on earth.

firstLine: The mountains will melt under him
rest:
like wax near a fire.
The valleys will be broken apart
by water rushing down a slope.

firstLine: All of that will happen because
rest:
Jacob’s people have done what is wrong.
The people of Israel
have committed many sins.
Who is to blame
for the wrong things Jacob has done?
Samaria!
Who is to blame for the high places
where Judah’s people worship other gods?
Jerusalem!

firstLine: So the Lord says,
rest:
“I will turn Samaria into a pile of trash.
It will become a place for planting vineyards.
I will dump its stones down into the valley.
And I will destroy it
down to its very foundations.

firstLine: All of the statues of Samaria’s gods
rest:
will be broken to pieces.
All of the gifts its people gave to temple prostitutes
will be burned with fire.
I will destroy all of the statues of its gods.
Samaria collected gifts that were paid to temple prostitutes.
So the Assyrians will use the gifts
to pay their own temple prostitutes.”

firstLine: Micah Sobs Over His People
rest:
I will sob and cry because Samaria will be destroyed.
I’ll walk around barefoot.
I won’t have anything on but my underwear.
I’ll bark like a wild dog.
I’ll hoot like an owl.

firstLine: You who live in the town of Shaphir,
rest:
leave in shame and without your clothes.
Those who live in Zaanan
won’t come out to help you.
The people in Beth Ezel will sob.
They won’t be able to help keep you safe.

firstLine: Those who live in Maroth will groan with pain
rest:
as they wait for help.
That’s because the Lord will bring trouble on them.
It will reach the very gate of Jerusalem.

firstLine: You who live in Lachish,
rest:
get your horses ready to pull their chariots.
You trust in military power.
That was the beginning of sin
for the people of Zion.
The wrong things Israel did
were also done by you.

firstLine: People of Judah, you might as well say good-by
rest:
to Moresheth near Gath.
The town of Aczib won’t give any help
to the kings of Israel.

firstLine: An enemy will attack
rest:
you who live in Mareshah.
Israel’s glorious leaders will have to run away
and hide in the cave of Adullam.

firstLine: The children you enjoy so much
rest:
will be taken away as prisoners.
So shave your heads and sob.
Make them as bare as the head of a vulture.

firstLine: People’s Plans and God’s Plans
rest:
How terrible it will be for those
who plan to harm others!
How terrible for those who make evil plans
before they even get out of bed!
As soon as daylight comes,
they carry them out.
That’s because they have the power to do it.

firstLine: If they want fields or houses,
rest:
they take them.
They cheat men out of
their homes and property.

firstLine: So the Lord says to them,
rest:
“I am planning to send trouble on you.
You will not be able to save yourselves from it.
You will not live so proudly anymore.
It will be a time of trouble.

firstLine: So you won’t even have anyone left
rest:
in the Lord’s community
who can divide up the land for you.

firstLine: Some Prophets Aren’t Really Prophets at All
rest:
“Don’t prophesy,” the people’s prophets say.
“Don’t prophesy about bad things.
Nothing shameful is going to happen to us.”

firstLine: People of Jacob, should others say,
rest:
“The Lord isn’t angry with us.
He doesn’t do things like that”?
The Lord replies, “What I promise brings good things
to those who lead honest lives.

firstLine: But lately my people have attacked one another
rest:
as if they were enemies.
You strip the rich robes off
those who happen to pass by.
They thought they were as safe as men
returning from a battle they had won.

firstLine: You drive the women among my people
rest:
out of their pleasant homes.
You take my blessing away
from their children forever.

firstLine: The Lord Promises He Will Save His People
rest:
“People of Jacob, I will gather all of you.
I will bring together
you who are still left alive in Israel.
I will gather you together like sheep in a pen.
You will be like a flock in its grasslands.
Your country will be filled with people.

firstLine: The Lord Warns Israel’s Leaders and Prophets
rest:
Then I said,
“Listen, you leaders of Jacob’s people!
Pay attention, you rulers of Israel!
You should know how to judge others fairly.

firstLine: The time will come when Israel
rest:
will cry out to the Lord.
But he won’t answer them.
In fact, he’ll turn his face away from them.
They have done what is evil.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“You prophets are leading my people
down the wrong path.
If they feed you,
you promise them peace.
If they do not,
you prepare to go to war against them.

firstLine: The Spirit of the Lord
rest:
has filled me with power.
He helps me do what is fair.
He makes me brave.
Now I’m prepared to tell Jacob’s people
what they’ve done wrong.
I’m ready to tell Israel they’ve sinned.

firstLine: Your judges take money from people
rest:
who want special favors.
Your priests teach only if they get paid for it.
Your prophets won’t tell fortunes
unless they receive money.
But you still claim to depend on the Lord.
You say, “The Lord is with us.
No trouble will come on us.”

firstLine: So because of what you have done,
rest:
Zion will be plowed up like a field.
Jerusalem will be turned into a pile of trash.
The temple hill will be covered with bushes and weeds.

firstLine: People From Many Nations Will Worship at Mount Zion
rest:
In the last days
the mountain where the Lord’s temple is located will be famous.
It will be the most important mountain of all.
It will stand out above the hills.
And nations will go to it.

firstLine: Every man will have
rest:
his own vine and fig tree.
And no one will make them afraid.
That’s what the Lord who rules over all has promised.

firstLine: The Lord’s Kingdom Will Come
rest:
“The time is coming
when I will gather those who are disabled,”
announces the Lord.
“I will bring together those
who were taken away as prisoners.
I will gather those I have allowed to suffer.

firstLine: Jerusalem, you used to be
rest:
like a guard tower for my flock.
City of Zion, you used to be
a place of safety for my people.
The glorious kingdom you had before
will be given back to you.
Once again a king will rule over your people.”

firstLine: But now many nations
rest:
have gathered together to attack you.
They say, “Let Jerusalem be polluted.
We want to see others laugh when Zion suffers!”

firstLine: But those nations don’t know
rest:
what the Lord has in mind.
They don’t understand his plan.
He will gather them up like bundles of grain.
He will take them to his threshing floor.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“People of Zion, get up
and crush your enemies.
I will make you like a threshing ox.
I will give you iron horns and bronze hoofs.
So you will crush many nations.”
They got their money in the wrong way.
But you will set it apart to the Lord.
You will give their wealth
to the Lord of the whole earth.

firstLine: A Ruler Will Come From Bethlehem
rest:
Jerusalem, you are being attacked.
So bring your troops together.
Our enemies have surrounded us.
They want to slap the face of Israel’s ruler.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“Bethlehem, you might not be
an important town in the nation of Judah.
But out of you will come
a ruler over Israel for me.
His family line goes back
to the early years of your nation.
It goes all the way back
to days of long ago.”
Bethlehem was also called Ephrathah.

firstLine: The promised ruler will stand firm
rest:
and take care of his flock.
The Lord will give him the strength to do it.
The Lord his God will give him
the authority to rule.
His people will live safely.
His greatness will reach
from one end of the earth to the other.

firstLine: Jacob’s people who are still left alive
rest:
will be scattered among many nations.
They will be like dew the Lord has sent.
It doesn’t wait for a man’s command.
They will be like rain that falls on the grass.
Rain doesn’t wait for someone to give it orders.

firstLine: So Jacob’s people will be scattered
rest:
among many nations.
They will be like a lion
among the animals in the forest.
They’ll be like a young lion
among flocks of sheep.
Lions attack and tear as they move along.
No one can keep them
from killing what they want.

firstLine: Lord, your powerful hand will win the battle
rest:
over your enemies.
All of them will be destroyed.

firstLine: “At that time I will destroy
rest:
your war horses,” announces the Lord.
“I will smash your chariots.

firstLine: I will pull down the poles you used
rest:
to worship the goddess Asherah.
And I will destroy your cities completely.

firstLine: I will pay back the nations
rest:
that have not obeyed me.
My anger will burn against them.”

firstLine: The Lord Brings Charges Against Israel
rest:
Israel, listen to the Lord’s message. He says to me,
“Stand up in court.
Let the mountains serve as witnesses.
Let the hills hear what you have to say.”

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“My people, what have I done to you?
Have I made things too hard for you? Answer me.

firstLine: Remember how Balak, the king of Moab,
rest:
planned to put a curse on your people.
But Balaam, the son of Beor,
gave them a blessing instead.
Remember their journey from Shittim to Gilgal.
I want you to know
that I always do what is right.”

firstLine: The people of Israel say,
rest:
“What should we bring with us
when we go to worship the Lord?
What should we offer the God of heaven
when we bow down to him?
Should we take burnt offerings to him?
Should we sacrifice calves
that are a year old?

firstLine: The Lord Will Punish His People
rest:
The Lord is calling out to Jerusalem.
And it would be wise to pay attention to him.
He says, “Listen, tribe of Judah
and you people who are gathered in the city.

firstLine: You sinful people, should I forget
rest:
that you got your treasures by stealing them?
You use dishonest measures to cheat others.
I have placed a curse on that practice.

firstLine: You have followed the evil practices
rest:
of King Omri of Israel.
You have done what the family
of King Ahab did.
You have followed their bad example.
So I will let you be destroyed.
Others will make fun of you.
The nations will laugh at you.”

firstLine: Micah Is Sad Because Israel Has Sinned
rest:
I’m suffering very much!
I’m like someone who gathers summer fruit in a vineyard
after the good fruit has already been picked.
No grapes are left to eat.
None of the early figs I long for remain.

firstLine: Jerusalem Will Be Rebuilt
rest:
The people of Jerusalem say,
“Don’t laugh when we suffer,
you enemies of ours!
We have fallen.
But we’ll get up.
Even though we sit in the dark,
the Lord will give us light.

firstLine: People of Jerusalem, the time will come
rest:
when your walls will be rebuilt.
Land will be added to your territory.

firstLine: Prayer and Praise
rest:
Lord, be like a shepherd to your people.
Take good care of them.
They are your flock.
They live by themselves
in the safety of a forest.
Rich grasslands are all around them.
Let them eat grass in Bashan and Gilead
just as they did long ago.

firstLine: The Lord says to his people,
rest:
“I showed your people my wonders
when they came out of Egypt long ago.
In the same way, I will show them to you.”

firstLine: When the nations see those wonders,
rest:
they will be put to shame.
All of their power will be taken away from them.
They will be so amazed
that they won’t be able to speak or hear.

firstLine: The Lord Is Angry With Nineveh
rest:
The Lord is a jealous God who punishes people.
He pays them back for the evil things they do.
His anger burns against them.
The Lord punishes his enemies.
He holds his anger back
until the right time to use it.

firstLine: But he will destroy Nineveh
rest:
with a powerful flood.
He will chase his enemies
into the darkness of punishment.

firstLine: The Lord will put an end
rest:
to anything they plan against him.
He won’t allow Assyria to win the battle
over his people a second time.

firstLine: The Lord says,
rest:
“His army has many soldiers.
Other nations are helping them.
But they will be cut off and pass away.
Judah, I punished you.
But I will not do it anymore.

firstLine: The Lord Will Destroy Nineveh
rest:
Nineveh, armies are coming to attack you.
Guard the forts!
Watch the roads!
Get ready!
Gather all of your strength!

firstLine: The commander of the attackers
rest:
sends for his special troops.
But they trip and fall on their way.
They run toward the city wall.
They keep their shield in front of them.

firstLine: They open the gates that hold back
rest:
the waters of the river.
And the palace falls down.

firstLine: The attackers order that the city’s people
rest:
be taken away as prisoners.
The female slaves cry like sad doves.
They beat their chests.

firstLine: “Steal the silver!” the attackers shout.
rest:
“Grab the gold!”
The supply is endless.
There is plenty of wealth
among all of the city’s treasures.

firstLine: “Nineveh, I am against you,”
rest:
announces the Lord who rules over all.
“I will burn up your chariots with fire.
Your young lions will be killed with swords.
I will leave you nothing on earth to catch.
The voices of your messengers
will no longer be heard.”

firstLine: The Lord Will Judge Nineveh
rest:
How terrible it will be for Nineveh!
It is a city of murderers!
It is full of liars!
It’s filled with stolen goods!
The killing never stops!

firstLine: All of that was caused by the evil longings
rest:
of the prostitute Nineveh.
That woman who practiced evil magic
was very beautiful.
She used her sinful charms
to make slaves out of the nations.
She worshiped evil powers
in order to trap others.

firstLine: “Nineveh, I am against you,”
rest:
announces the Lord who rules over all.
“I will pull your skirts up over your face.
I will show the nations your naked body.
Kingdoms will make fun of your shame.

firstLine: Nineveh, are you better than Thebes
rest:
on the Nile River?
There was water all around that city.
The river helped to keep it safe.
The waters were like a wall around it.

firstLine: All of your forts are like fig trees
rest:
that have their first ripe fruit on them.
When the trees are shaken,
the figs fall into the mouths
of those who eat them.

firstLine: In spite of all of your hard work,
rest:
fire will burn you up inside your city.
Your enemies will cut you down with their swords.
They will destroy you
just as grasshoppers eat up crops.
Multiply like grasshoppers!
Increase your numbers like locusts!

firstLine: You have more traders
rest:
than the number of stars in the sky.
But like locusts they strip the land.
Then they fly away.

firstLine: Habakkuk Asks the Lord a Question
rest:
Lord, how long do I have to call out for help?
Why don’t you listen to me?
How long must I keep telling you
that things are terrible?
Why don’t you save us?

firstLine: Why do you make me watch while
rest:
people treat others so unfairly?
Why do you put up with the wrong things
they are doing?
I have to look at death.
People are harming others.
They are arguing and fighting all the time.

firstLine: The Lord Gives His Answer
rest:
The Lord replies,
“Look at the nations. Watch them.
Be totally amazed at what you see.
I am going to do something in your days
that you would never believe.
You would not believe it
even if someone told you about it.

firstLine: They laugh at kings
rest:
and make fun of rulers.
They laugh at all of the cities
that have high walls around them.
They build dirt ramps against the walls
and capture the cities.

firstLine: Habakkuk Asks the Lord Another Question
rest:
Lord, haven’t you existed forever?
You are my holy God.
So we won’t die, will we?
Lord, you have appointed the Babylonians
to punish your people.
My Rock, you have chosen them to judge us.

firstLine: Are you going to let them
rest:
keep on emptying their nets?
Will they go on destroying nations
without showing them any mercy?

firstLine: The Lord Gives His Answer
rest:
The Lord replies,
“Write down the message I am showing you in a vision.
Write it clearly on the tablets you use.
Then a messenger can read it
and run to announce it.

firstLine: The message I give you
rest:
waits for the time I have appointed.
It speaks about what is going to happen.
And all of it will come true.
It might take a while.
But wait for it.
You can be sure it will come.
It will happen when I want it to.

firstLine: “The Babylonians are very proud.
rest:
What they want is not good.
“But the one who is right with God
will live by faith.

firstLine: “Wine makes the Babylonians do foolish things.
rest:
They are proud. They never rest.
Like the grave, they are always hungry for more.
Like death, they are never satisfied.
They gather all of the nations to themselves.
They take their people away as prisoners.

firstLine: “Won’t those people laugh at the Babylonians? Won’t they make fun of them? They will say to them,
rest:
“‘How terrible it will be for you
who pile up stolen goods!
You get rich by cheating others.
How long will that go on?

firstLine: “How terrible it will be for the Babylonians!
rest:
They build their kingdom with money
they gained by cheating others.
They have tried to make the kingdom
as secure as possible.
After all, they did not want to be destroyed.

firstLine: “How terrible it will be for the Babylonians!
rest:
They build cities by spilling the blood of others.
They establish towns by committing crimes.

firstLine: “How terrible it will be for the Babylonians!
rest:
They give drinks to their neighbors.
They pour the drinks from wineskins
until their neighbors are drunk.
They want to look at their naked bodies.

firstLine: But the Babylonians will be filled
rest:
with shame instead of glory.
So now it is their turn to drink
and be stripped of their clothes.
The cup of anger in my powerful right hand
is going to punish them.
They will be covered with shame instead of glory.

firstLine: The harm they have done to Lebanon
rest:
will bring them down.
Because they have killed so many animals,
animals will terrify them.
They have spilled man’s blood.
They have destroyed lands and cities
and everyone in them.

firstLine: “If someone carves a statue of a god, what is it worth?
rest:
What value is there in a god
that teaches lies?
The one who trusts in another god
worships his own creation.
He makes statues of gods that can’t speak.

firstLine: Habakkuk Prays to the Lord
rest: This is a prayer of the prophet Habakkuk. It is on shigionoth. Here is what he said.

firstLine: But I will still be glad
rest:
because of what the Lord has done.
God my Savior fills me with joy.

firstLine: The Lord Will Judge the World
rest:
“I will sweep away everything
from the face of the earth,”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: “I will destroy people and animals alike.
rest:
I will wipe out the birds of the air
and the fish in the waters.
I will destroy sinful people along with their gods.
I will wipe man off the face of the earth,”
announces the Lord.

firstLine: The Lord Warns Judah
rest:
“I will reach out my powerful hand against Judah.
I will punish all those who live in Jerusalem.
I will cut off from that place
what is left of Baal worship.
The officials and priests who serve other gods
will be removed.

firstLine: I will wipe out those who bow down on their roofs
rest:
to worship all of the stars.
I will destroy those who take oaths
not only in my name but also in the name of Molech.

firstLine: When my sacrifice is ready to be offered,
rest:
I will punish the princes and the king’s sons.
I will also judge all those who follow
the practices of other nations.

firstLine: At that time I will punish
rest:
all those who worship other gods.
They fill the temples of their gods
with lies and other harmful things.

firstLine: “At that time people at the Fish Gate in Jerusalem
rest:
will cry out,” announces the Lord.
“So will those at the New Quarter.
The buildings on the hills will come crashing down
with a loud noise.

firstLine: The Day of the Lord Is Coming
rest:
“The great day of the Lord is near.
In fact, it is coming quickly.
Listen! The cries on that day will be bitter.
Even soldiers will cry out in fear.

firstLine: Their silver and gold
rest:
will not be able to save them
on the day I pour out my anger.
The whole world will be burned up
when my jealous anger blazes out.
Everyone who lives on earth
will come to a sudden end.”

firstLine: Gather your people together,
rest:
you shameful nation of Judah!
Gather them together!

firstLine: So look to him, all of you people in the land
rest:
who worship him faithfully.
You always do what he commands you to do.
Continue to do what is right.
Don’t be proud.
Then perhaps the Lord will keep you safe
on the day he pours out his anger on the world.

firstLine: A Message About Philistia
rest:
Gaza will be deserted.
Ashkelon will be destroyed.
Ashdod will be emptied out at noon.
Ekron will be pulled up by its roots.

firstLine: How terrible it will be for you Kerethites
rest:
who live by the Mediterranean Sea!
Philistia, the Lord has spoken against you.
What happened to Canaan will happen to you.
The Lord says, “I will destroy you.
No one will be left.”

firstLine: It will belong to those who are still left alive
rest:
among the people of Judah.
They will find grasslands there.
They will take over
the houses in Ashkelon and live in them.
The Lord their God will take care of them.
He will bless them with great success again.

firstLine: A Message About Moab and Ammon
rest:
The Lord says,
“I have heard Moab make fun of my people.
The Ammonites also laughed at them.
They told them that bad things
would happen to their land.

firstLine: So Moab will become like Sodom,”
rest:
announces the Lord who rules over all.
“Ammon will be like Gomorrah.
Weeds and salt pits will cover those countries.
They will be dry and empty deserts forever.
Those who are still left alive among my people
will take all of their valuable things.
So they will receive those lands as their own.
And that is just as sure as I am alive.”
The Lord is the God of Israel.

firstLine: Moab and Ammon will be judged
rest:
because they are so proud.
They made fun of the Lord’s people.
They laughed at them.

firstLine: A Message About Cush
rest:
The Lord says, “People of Cush,
you too will be killed with my sword.”

firstLine: A Message About Assyria
rest:
The Lord will reach out his powerful hand against the north.
He will destroy Assyria.
He’ll leave Nineveh totally empty.
It will be as dry as a desert.

firstLine: The Lord Will Save Jerusalem
rest:
How terrible it will be for Jerusalem!
Its people crush others.
They refuse to obey the Lord.
They are “unclean.”

firstLine: The Lord says to his people,
rest:
“I have cut off other nations.
I have wiped out their forts.
I have left their streets deserted.
No one walks along them.
Their cities are destroyed.
Not even one person is left.

firstLine: I said to you people of Jerusalem,
rest:
‘Because I cut off other nations,
you will have respect for me.
Now you will accept my warning.’
I wish you had returned to me.
Then your homes would not have been torn down.
And I would not have had to punish you so much.
But you still wanted to go on sinning
in every way you could.

firstLine: So wait for me to come as judge,”
rest:
announces the Lord.
“Wait for the day I will stand up
to witness against all sinners.
I have decided to gather the nations.
I will bring the kingdoms together.
And I will pour out all of my burning anger on them.
The fire of my jealous anger
will burn the whole world up.

firstLine: “But then I will purify what all of the nations say.
rest:
And they will use their words to worship me.
They will serve me together.

firstLine: My scattered people, you will come to me
rest:
from beyond the rivers of Cush.
You will worship me.
You will bring me offerings.

firstLine: But inside your city I will leave
rest:
those who are not proud at all.
They trust in me.

firstLine: Those who are still left alive in Israel
rest:
will not do anything wrong.
They will not tell any lies.
They will not say anything to fool others.
They will eat and lie down in peace.
And no one will make them afraid.”

firstLine: The time is coming when people will say to Jerusalem,
rest:
“Zion, don’t be afraid.
Don’t give up.

firstLine: The Lord says to his people,
rest:
“You used to celebrate my appointed feasts in Jerusalem.
You are sad because you can’t do that anymore.
So others make fun of those feasts.
That was a heavy load for you to carry.
But I will bring you back to your city.

firstLine: At that time I will punish
rest:
all those who crushed you.
I will save those among you who are disabled.
I will gather those who have been scattered.
I will give you praise and honor
in every land where you were put to shame.

firstLine: Haggai Tells His People to Rebuild the Lord’s Temple
rest: A message came to the prophet Haggai from the Lord. Haggai gave it to Zerubbabel and Jeshua. It came on the first day of the sixth month of the second year that Darius was king of Persia. Zerubbabel was governor of Judah and the son of Shealtiel. Jeshua was high priest and the son of Jehozadak. Here is what Haggai said.

firstLine: The New Temple Will Be Beautiful
rest: A second message came to me from the Lord. It came on the 21st day of the seventh month. The Lord said,

firstLine: The Lord Will Make His People Pure and Clean
rest: A third message came to me from the Lord. It came on the 24th day of the ninth month of the second year that Darius was king.

firstLine: The Lord Compares Zerubbabel to His Royal Ring
rest: A final message came to me from the Lord. It also came on the 24th day of the ninth month. He said,

firstLine: The Lord Wants His People to Return to Him
rest: A message came to the prophet Zechariah from the Lord. It was the eighth month of the second year that Darius was king of Persia. Zechariah was the son of Berekiah. Berekiah was the son of Iddo. Here is what Zechariah said.

firstLine: A Vision of a Horseman Among Some Myrtle Trees
rest: During the second year that Darius was king, a message came to me from the Lord. It was the 24th day of the 11th month. That’s the month of Shebat.

firstLine: A Vision of Four Horns and Four Skilled Workers
rest: Then I looked up and saw four animal horns.

firstLine: A Vision of a Man Holding a Measuring Line
rest: Then I looked up and saw a man. He was holding a measuring line.

firstLine: “Where are you going?” I asked.
rest: “To measure Jerusalem,” he answered. “I want to find out how wide and how long it is.”

firstLine: A Vision of the High Priest Dressed in Fine Clothes
rest: Then the Lord showed me the high priest Jeshua. He was standing in front of the angel of the Lord. Satan was standing to the right of Jeshua. He was there to bring charges against the high priest.

firstLine: A Vision of the Gold Lampstand and Two Olive Trees
rest: Then the angel who was talking with me returned. He woke me up. It was as if I had been asleep.

firstLine: “What do you see?” he asked me.
rest: “I see a solid gold lampstand,” I answered. “It has a bowl on top of it. There are seven lamps on it. Seven tubes lead to each of them.

firstLine: A Vision of a Flying Scroll
rest: I looked up again and saw a flying scroll.

firstLine: “What do you see?” the angel asked me.
rest: “A flying scroll,” I replied. “It’s 30 feet long and 15 feet wide.”

firstLine: A Vision of a Woman in a Basket
rest: Then the angel who was talking with me came forward. He said to me, “Look at what is coming.”

firstLine: “What is it?” I asked.
rest: “A measuring basket,” he replied. “The sins of the people all through the land are in it.”

firstLine: A Vision of Four Chariots
rest: I looked up again and saw four chariots. They were coming out from between two mountains. The mountains were made out of bronze.

firstLine: A Crown Is Given to Jeshua
rest: A message came to me from the Lord. His angel said,

firstLine: Treat Everyone Fairly
rest: During the fourth year that Darius was king, a message came to me from the Lord. It was the fourth day of the ninth month. That’s the month of Kislev.

firstLine: The Lord Promises to Bless Jerusalem
rest: Another message came to me from the Lord who rules over all. He said,

firstLine: The Lord Destroys Israel’s Enemies
rest:
This is the Lord’s message
against the land of Hadrach.
He will judge Damascus.
That’s because all of the tribes of Israel look to him.
So do other people.

firstLine: But I will guard my temple
rest:
against enemy armies.
No one will ever crush my people again.
I will make sure it does not happen.

firstLine: A King Comes to Zion
rest:
“City of Zion, be full of joy!
People of Jerusalem, shout!
See, your king comes to you.
He always does what is right.
He has the power to save.
He is gentle and riding on a donkey.
He is sitting on a donkey’s colt.

firstLine: I will set your prisoners free
rest:
from where their enemies are keeping them.
I will do it because of the blood
that put my covenant with you into effect.

firstLine: Return to your place of safety,
rest:
you prisoners who still have hope.
Even now I announce that I will give you back
much more than you had before.

firstLine: The Lord Will Appear
rest:
Then the Lord will appear over his people.
His arrows will flash like lightning.
The Lord and King will blow the trumpet of his thunder.
He’ll march out like a storm in the south.

firstLine: The Lord who rules over all
rest:
will be like a shield to his people.
They will destroy their enemies.
They’ll use slings to throw stones at them.
They’ll drink the blood of their enemies
as if it were wine.
They’ll be full like the bowl that is used
for sprinkling the corners of the altar.

firstLine: The Lord Will Take Care of Judah
rest:
People of Judah, ask the Lord
to send rain in the spring.
He is the one who makes the storm clouds.
He sends down showers of rain on all people.
He gives everyone the plants in the fields.

firstLine: The Lord who rules over all says,
rest:
“My anger burns against the shepherds.
I will punish the leaders.
I will take care of my flock.
They are the people of Judah.
I will make them like a proud horse in battle.

firstLine: The most important building stone
rest:
will come from the tribe of Judah.
The tent stake will also come from it.
And the bow that is used in battle will come from it.
In fact, every ruler will come from it.

firstLine: “I will make the family of Judah strong.
rest:
I will save the people of Joseph.
I will bring them back
because I have tender love for them.
It will be as if
I had not sent them away.
I am the Lord their God.
I will help them.

firstLine: I will whistle for my people
rest:
and gather them in.
I will set them free.
There will be as many of them as before.

firstLine: The Two Shepherds
rest: The Lord my God says, “Take care of the sheep that are set apart to be sacrificed.

firstLine: “How terrible it will be for that worthless shepherd!
rest:
He deserts the flock.
May a sword strike his arm and his right eye!
May his powerful arm become weak!
May his right eye be totally blinded!”

firstLine: The Lord Will Destroy Jerusalem’s Enemies
rest: This is the Lord’s message about Israel. The Lord spread out the heavens. He laid the foundation of the earth. He created the spirits of all men. He says,

firstLine: Israel’s People Will Sob Over the One They Pierced
rest: “I will pour out a spirit of grace and prayer on David’s family line. I will also send it on those who live in Jerusalem. They will look to me. I am the one they have pierced. They will sob over me as someone sobs over an only child who has died. They will be full of sorrow over me, just like someone who is full of sorrow over an oldest son.

firstLine: The Lord Makes Israel Pure and Clean
rest: “At that time a fountain will be opened for the benefit of David’s family line. It will also bless the others who live in Jerusalem. It will wash away their sins. It will make them pure and clean.

firstLine: The Good Shepherd Is Killed and the Sheep Are Scattered
rest:
“My sword, wake up! Attack my shepherd!
Attack the man who is close to me,”
announces the Lord who rules over all.
“Strike the shepherd down.
Then the sheep will be scattered.
And I will turn my hand against their little ones.

firstLine: Here is what will happen in the whole land,”
rest:
announces the Lord.
“Two-thirds of the people will be struck down and die.
But one-third will be left.

firstLine: The Lord Will Be King Over the Whole Earth
rest: The day of the Lord is coming. At that time Jerusalem’s enemies will steal everything its people have. They will divide it up right in front of them.

firstLine: The Lord Chooses Jacob Instead of Esau
rest:
“Israel, I have loved you,” says the Lord.
“But you ask, ‘How have you loved us?’
“Wasn’t Esau Jacob’s brother?” says the Lord. “But I chose Jacob

firstLine: Give Your Best to the Lord
rest:
“A son honors his father. A servant honors his master. If I am a father, where is the honor I should have? If I am a master, where is the respect you should give me?” says the Lord who rules over all. “You priests look down on me.
“But you ask, ‘How have we looked down on you?’

firstLine: “You put ‘unclean’ food on my altar.
rest:
“But you ask, ‘How have we made you “unclean?”’
“You do it by looking down on my altar.

firstLine: The Lord Warns the Priests
rest: “Now I am giving a warning to you priests.

firstLine: Judah Is Not Faithful to the Lord
rest: People of Judah, all of us have one Father. One God created us. So why do we break the covenant the Lord made with our people long ago? We don’t even keep our promises to one another.

firstLine: The Lord Will Judge His People
rest:
You have worn the Lord out by what you keep saying.
“How have we worn him out?” you ask.
You have done it by saying, “All those who do evil things are good in the Lord’s sight. And he is pleased with them.” Or you ask, “Is God really fair?”

firstLine: Do Not Steal From God
rest: “I am the Lord. I do not change. That is why I have not destroyed you members of Jacob’s family.

firstLine: “Will a man dare to steal from me? But you rob me!
rest:
“You ask, ‘How do we rob you?’
“By holding back your offerings. You also steal from me when you do not bring me a tenth of everything you produce.

firstLine: “You have spoken bad things against me,” says the Lord.
rest: “But you ask, ‘What have we spoken against you?’

firstLine: The Day of the Lord Is Coming
rest: “You can be sure the day of the Lord is coming. My anger will burn like a furnace. All those who are proud will be like straw. So will all those who do what is evil. The day that is coming will set them on fire,” says the Lord who rules over all. “Not even a root or a branch will be left to them.

firstLine: The Family Line of Jesus
rest: This is a record of the family line of Jesus Christ. He is the son of David. He is also the son of Abraham.

firstLine: Jesus Christ Is Born
rest: This is how the birth of Jesus Christ came about. His mother Mary and Joseph had promised to get married. But before they started to live together, it became clear that she was going to have a baby. She became pregnant by the power of the Holy Spirit.

firstLine: The Wise Men Visit Jesus
rest:
Jesus was born in Bethlehem in Judea. This happened while Herod was king of Judea.
After Jesus’ birth, Wise Men from the east came to Jerusalem.

firstLine: “‘But you, Bethlehem, in the land of Judah,
rest:
are certainly not the least important among the towns of Judah.
A ruler will come out of you.
He will be the shepherd of my people Israel.’” ()

firstLine: Jesus’ Family Escapes to Egypt
rest: When the Wise Men had left, Joseph had a dream. In the dream an angel of the Lord appeared to him. “Get up!” the angel said. “Take the child and his mother and escape to Egypt. Stay there until I tell you to come back. Herod is going to search for the child. He wants to kill him.”

firstLine: “A voice is heard in Ramah.
rest:
It’s the sound of crying and deep sadness.
Rachel is crying over her children.
She refuses to be comforted,
because they are gone.” ()

firstLine: Jesus’ Family Returns to Nazareth
rest: After Herod died, Joseph had a dream while he was still in Egypt. In the dream an angel of the Lord appeared to him.

firstLine: John the Baptist Prepares the Way
rest: In those days John the Baptist came and preached in the Desert of Judea.

firstLine: Jesus Is Baptized
rest: Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan River. He wanted to be baptized by John.

firstLine: Jesus Is Tempted
rest: The Holy Spirit led Jesus into the desert. There the devil tempted him.

firstLine: “If you are the Son of God,” he said, “throw yourself down. It is written,
rest:
“‘The Lord will command his angels to take good care of you.
They will lift you up in their hands.
Then you won’t trip over a stone.’” ()

firstLine: Jesus Begins to Preach
rest: John had been put in prison. When Jesus heard about this, he returned to Galilee.

firstLine: “Land of Zebulun! Land of Naphtali!
rest:
Galilee, where non-Jewish people live!
Land along the Mediterranean Sea! Territory east of the Jordan River!

firstLine: The people who are now living in darkness
rest:
will see a great light.
They are now living in a very dark land.
But a light will shine on them.” ()

firstLine: Jesus Chooses the First Disciples
rest: One day Jesus was walking beside the Sea of Galilee. There he saw two brothers. They were Simon Peter and his brother Andrew. They were throwing a net into the lake. They were fishermen.

firstLine: Jesus Heals Sick People
rest: Jesus went all over Galilee. There he taught in the synagogues. He preached the good news of God’s kingdom. He healed every illness and sickness the people had.

firstLine: Jesus Gives Blessings
rest: Jesus saw the crowds. So he went up on a mountainside and sat down. His disciples came to him.

firstLine: “Blessed are those who are spiritually needy.
rest: The kingdom of heaven belongs to them.

firstLine: Salt and Light
rest: “You are the salt of the earth. But suppose the salt loses its saltiness. How can it be made salty again? It is no longer good for anything. It will be thrown out. People will walk all over it.

firstLine: Jesus Gives Full Meaning to the Law
rest: “Do not think I have come to get rid of what is written in the Law or in the Prophets. I have not come to do that. Instead, I have come to give full meaning to what is written.

firstLine: Murder
rest: “You have heard what was said to people who lived long ago. They were told, ‘Do not commit murder. () Anyone who murders will be judged for it.’

firstLine: Adultery
rest: “You have heard that it was said, ‘Do not commit adultery.’ ()

firstLine: Divorce
rest: “It has been said, ‘Suppose a man divorces his wife. If he does, he must give her a letter of divorce.’ ()

firstLine: Oaths
rest: “Again, you have heard what was said to your people long ago. They were told, ‘Do not break the promises you make to the Lord. Keep the oaths you have made to him.’

firstLine: Be Kind to Others
rest: “You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye must be put out for an eye. A tooth must be knocked out for a tooth.’ (; ; )

firstLine: Love Your Enemies
rest: “You have heard that it was said, ‘Love your neighbor. () Hate your enemy.’

firstLine: Giving to Needy People
rest: “Be careful not to do ‘good works’ in front of others. Don’t do them to be seen by others. If you do, your Father in heaven will not reward you.

firstLine: Prayer
rest: “When you pray, do not be like those who only pretend to be holy. They love to stand and pray in the synagogues and on the street corners. They want to be seen by others. What I’m about to tell you is true. They have received their complete reward.

firstLine: “This is how you should pray.
rest:
“‘Our Father in heaven,
may your name be honored.

firstLine: Forgive us our sins,
rest: just as we also have forgiven those who sin against us.

firstLine: Fasting
rest: “When you go without eating, do not look gloomy like those who only pretend to be holy. They make their faces very sad. They want to show people they are fasting. What I’m about to tell you is true. They have received their complete reward.

firstLine: Put Away Riches in Heaven
rest: “Do not put away riches for yourselves on earth. Moths and rust can destroy them. Thieves can break in and steal them.

firstLine: Do Not Worry
rest: “I tell you, do not worry. Don’t worry about your life and what you will eat or drink. And don’t worry about your body and what you will wear. Isn’t there more to life than eating? Aren’t there more important things for the body than clothes?

firstLine: Be Fair When You Judge Others
rest: “Do not judge others. Then you will not be judged.

firstLine: Ask, Search, Knock
rest: “Ask, and it will be given to you. Search, and you will find. Knock, and the door will be opened to you.

firstLine: The Large and Small Gates
rest: “Enter God’s kingdom through the narrow gate. The gate is large and the road is wide that lead to death and hell. Many people go that way.

firstLine: A Tree and Its Fruit
rest: “Watch out for false prophets. They come to you pretending to be sheep. But on the inside they are hungry wolves.

firstLine: The Wise and Foolish Builders
rest: “So then, everyone who hears my words and puts them into practice is like a wise man. He builds his house on the rock.

firstLine: Jesus Heals a Man Who Had a Skin Disease
rest: Jesus came down from the mountainside. Large crowds followed him.

firstLine: A Roman Commander Has Faith
rest: When Jesus entered Capernaum, a Roman commander came to him. He asked Jesus for help.

firstLine: Jesus Heals Many People
rest: When Jesus came into Peter’s house, he saw Peter’s mother-in-law. She was lying in bed. She had a fever.

firstLine: It Costs to Follow Jesus
rest: Jesus saw the crowd around him. So he gave his disciples orders to go to the other side of the Sea of Galilee.

firstLine: Jesus Calms the Storm
rest: Jesus got into a boat. His disciples followed him.

firstLine: Jesus Heals Two Men Controlled by Demons
rest: Jesus arrived at the other side of the lake in the area of the Gadarenes. Two men controlled by demons met him. They came from the tombs. The men were so wild that no one could pass that way.

firstLine: Jesus Heals a Man Who Could Not Walk
rest: Jesus stepped into a boat. He went over to the other side of the lake and came to his own town.

firstLine: Jesus Chooses Matthew
rest:
As Jesus went on from there, he saw a man named Matthew. He was sitting at the tax collector’s booth.
“Follow me,” Jesus told him. Matthew got up and followed him.

firstLine: Jesus Is Asked About Fasting
rest: One day John’s disciples came. They said to Jesus, “We and the Pharisees go without eating. Why don’t your disciples go without eating?”

firstLine: A Dead Girl and a Suffering Woman
rest: While Jesus was saying this, a ruler came. He got down on his knees in front of Jesus. He said, “My daughter has just died. But come and place your hand on her. Then she will live again.”

firstLine: Jesus Heals Two Blind Men
rest: As Jesus went on from there, two blind men followed him. They called out, “Have mercy on us, Son of David!”

firstLine: There Are Only a Few Workers
rest: Jesus went through all the towns and villages. He taught in their synagogues. He preached the good news of the kingdom. And he healed every illness and sickness.

firstLine: Jesus Sends Out the Twelve Disciples
rest: Jesus called for his 12 disciples to come to him. He gave them authority to drive out evil spirits and to heal every illness and sickness.

firstLine: I have come to turn
rest:
“‘sons against their fathers.
Daughters will refuse to obey their mothers.
Daughters-in-law will be against their mothers-in-law.

firstLine: Jesus and John the Baptist
rest: Jesus finished teaching his 12 disciples. Then he went on to teach and preach in the towns of Galilee.

firstLine: “‘We played the flute for you.
rest:
But you didn’t dance.
We sang a funeral song.
But you didn’t become sad.’

firstLine: Cities That Do Not Turn Away From Sin
rest: Jesus began to speak against the cities where he had done most of his miracles. The people there had not turned away from their sins. So he said,

firstLine: Rest for All Who Are Tired
rest: At that time Jesus said, “I praise you, Father. You are Lord of heaven and earth. You have hidden these things from the wise and educated. But you have shown them to little children.

firstLine: Jesus Is Lord of the Sabbath Day
rest: One Sabbath day Jesus walked through the grainfields. His disciples were hungry. So they began to break off some heads of grain and eat them.

firstLine: God’s Chosen Servant
rest: Jesus knew all about the Pharisees’ plans. So he left that place. Many followed him, and he healed all their sick people.

firstLine: “Here is my servant. I have chosen him.
rest:
He is the one I love. I am very pleased with him.
I will put my Spirit on him.
He will announce to the nations that everything will be made right.

firstLine: Jesus and Beelzebub
rest: A man controlled by demons was brought to Jesus. The man was blind and could not speak. Jesus healed him. Then the man could speak and see.

firstLine: The Miraculous Sign of Jonah
rest: Some of the Pharisees and the teachers of the law came to Jesus. They said, “Teacher, we want to see a miraculous sign from you.”

firstLine: Jesus’ Mother and Brothers
rest: While Jesus was still talking to the crowd, his mother and brothers stood outside. They wanted to speak to him.

firstLine: The Story of the Farmer
rest: That same day Jesus left the house and sat by the Sea of Galilee.

firstLine: “In them the words of the prophet Isaiah come true. He said,
rest:
“‘You will hear but never understand.
You will see but never know what you are seeing.

firstLine: The Story of the Weeds
rest: Jesus told the crowd another story. “Here is what the kingdom of heaven is like,” he said. “A man planted good seed in his field.

firstLine: “‘An enemy did this,’ he replied.
rest: “The servants asked him, ‘Do you want us to go and pull the weeds up?’

firstLine: The Stories of the Mustard Seed and the Yeast
rest: Jesus told the crowd another story. He said, “The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed. Someone took the seed and planted it in a field.

firstLine: Jesus Explains the Story of the Weeds
rest: Then Jesus left the crowd and went into the house. His disciples came to him. They said, “Explain to us the story of the weeds in the field.”

firstLine: The Stories of the Hidden Treasure and the Pearl
rest: “The kingdom of heaven is like treasure that was hidden in a field. When a man found it, he hid it again. He was very happy. So he went and sold everything he had. And he bought that field.

firstLine: The Story of the Net
rest: “Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a net. It was let down into the lake. It caught all kinds of fish.

firstLine: “Do you understand all these things?” Jesus asked.
rest: “Yes,” they replied.

firstLine: A Prophet Without Honor
rest: Jesus finished telling these stories. Then he moved on from there.

firstLine: John the Baptist’s Head Is Cut Off
rest: At that time Herod, the ruler of Galilee and Perea, heard reports about Jesus.

firstLine: Jesus Feeds the Five Thousand
rest: Jesus heard what had happened to John. He wanted to be alone. So he went in a boat to a quiet place. The crowds heard about this. They followed him on foot from the towns.

firstLine: Jesus Walks on the Water
rest: Right away Jesus made the disciples get into the boat. He had them go on ahead of him to the other side of the Sea of Galilee. Then he sent the crowd away.

firstLine: “Come,” Jesus said.
rest: So Peter got out of the boat. He walked on the water toward Jesus.

firstLine: “‘These people honor me by what they say.
rest: But their hearts are far away from me.

firstLine: The Faith of a Woman From Canaan
rest: Jesus left Galilee and went to the area of Tyre and Sidon.

firstLine: Jesus Feeds the Four Thousand
rest: Jesus left there. He walked along the Sea of Galilee. Then he went up on a mountainside and sat down.

firstLine: “How many loaves do you have?” Jesus asked.
rest: “Seven,” they replied, “and a few small fish.”

firstLine: Jesus Is Asked for a Miraculous Sign
rest: The Pharisees and Sadducees came to put Jesus to the test. They asked him to show them a miraculous sign from heaven.

firstLine: The Yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees
rest: The disciples crossed over to the other side of the lake. They had forgotten to take bread.

firstLine: Peter Says That Jesus Is the Christ
rest: Jesus went to the area of Caesarea Philippi. There he asked his disciples, “Who do people say the Son of Man is?”

firstLine: Jesus Tells About His Coming Death
rest: From that time on Jesus began to explain to his disciples what would happen to him. He told them he must go to Jerusalem. There he must suffer many things from the elders, the chief priests and the teachers of the law. He must be killed and on the third day rise to life again.

firstLine: Jesus’ Appearance Is Changed
rest: After six days Jesus took Peter, James, and John the brother of James with him. He led them up a high mountain. They were all alone.

firstLine: Jesus Heals a Boy Who Had a Demon
rest: When they came near the crowd, a man approached Jesus. He got on his knees in front of him.

firstLine: Jesus Pays the Temple Tax
rest: Jesus and his disciples arrived in Capernaum. There the tax collectors came to Peter. They asked him, “Doesn’t your teacher pay the temple tax?”

firstLine: “Yes, he does,” he replied.
rest: When Peter came into the house, Jesus spoke first. “What do you think, Simon?” he asked. “Who do the kings of the earth collect taxes and fees from? Do they collect from their own sons or from others?”

firstLine: “From others,” Peter answered.
rest: “Then the sons don’t have to pay,” Jesus said to him.

firstLine: The Story of the Lost Sheep
rest: “See that you don’t look down on one of these little ones. Here is what I tell you. Their angels in heaven can go at any time to see my Father who is in heaven.

firstLine: When Someone Sins Against You
rest: “If your brother sins against you, go to him. Tell him what he did wrong. Keep it between the two of you. If he listens to you, you have won him back.

firstLine: The Servant Who Had No Mercy
rest: Peter came to Jesus. He asked, “Lord, how many times should I forgive my brother when he sins against me? Up to seven times?”

firstLine: Jesus Teaches About Divorce
