rest: When Jesus finished saying these things, he left Galilee. He went into the area of Judea on the other side of the Jordan River.

firstLine: Little Children Are Brought to Jesus
rest: Some people brought little children to Jesus. They wanted him to place his hands on the children and pray for them. But the disciples told the people to stop.

firstLine: Jesus and the Rich Young Man
rest: A man came up to Jesus. He asked, “Teacher, what good thing must I do to receive eternal life?”

firstLine: “Which ones?” the man asked.
rest: Jesus said, “‘Do not commit murder. Do not commit adultery. Do not steal. Do not give false witness.

firstLine: The Story of the Workers in the Vineyard
rest: “The kingdom of heaven is like a man who owned land. He went out early in the morning to hire people to work in his vineyard.

firstLine: “‘Because no one has hired us,’ they answered.
rest: “He said to them, ‘You also go and work in my vineyard.’

firstLine: Jesus Again Tells About His Coming Death
rest: Jesus was going up to Jerusalem. On the way, he took the 12 disciples to one side to talk to them.

firstLine: A Mother Asks a Favor of Jesus
rest: The mother of Zebedee’s sons came to Jesus. Her sons came with her. Getting on her knees, she asked a favor of him.

firstLine: “What do you want?” Jesus asked.
rest: She said, “Promise me that one of my two sons may sit at your right hand in your kingdom. Promise that the other one may sit at your left hand.”

firstLine: “You don’t know what you’re asking for,” Jesus said to them. “Can you drink the cup of suffering I am going to drink?”
rest: “We can,” they answered.

firstLine: Two Blind Men Receive Their Sight
rest: Jesus and his disciples were leaving Jericho. A large crowd followed him.

firstLine: Jesus Enters Jerusalem
rest: As they all approached Jerusalem, they came to Bethphage. It was on the Mount of Olives. Jesus sent out two disciples.

firstLine: “Say to the city of Zion,
rest:
‘See, your king comes to you.
He is gentle and riding on a donkey.
He is riding on a donkey’s colt.’” ()

firstLine: Jesus Clears Out the Temple
rest: Jesus entered the temple area. He began chasing out all those who were buying and selling there. He turned over the tables of the people who were exchanging money. He also turned over the benches of those who were selling doves.

firstLine: “Do you hear what these children are saying?” they asked him.
rest:
“Yes,” replied Jesus. “Haven’t you ever read about it in Scripture? It says,
“‘You have made sure that children and infants
praise you.’” ()

firstLine: The Fig Tree Dries Up
rest: Early in the morning, Jesus was on his way back to Jerusalem. He was hungry.

firstLine: The Authority of Jesus Is Questioned
rest: Jesus entered the temple courtyard. While he was teaching there, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to him. “By what authority are you doing these things?” they asked. “Who gave you this authority?”

firstLine: The Story of the Two Sons
rest: “What do you think about this? A man had two sons. He went to the first and said, ‘Son, go and work today in the vineyard.’

firstLine: “Which of the two sons did what his father wanted?”
rest:
“The first,” they answered.
Jesus said to them, “What I’m about to tell you is true. Tax collectors and prostitutes will enter the kingdom of God ahead of you.

firstLine: The Story of the Renters
rest: “Listen to another story. A man who owned some land planted a vineyard. He put a wall around it. He dug a pit for a winepress in it. He also built a lookout tower. He rented the vineyard out to some farmers. Then he went away on a journey.

firstLine: Jesus said to them, “Haven’t you ever read what the Scriptures say,
rest:
“‘The stone the builders didn’t accept
has become the most important stone of all.
The Lord has done it.
It is wonderful in our eyes’? ()

firstLine: The Story of the Wedding Dinner
rest: Jesus told them more stories. He said,

firstLine: “Caesar’s,” they replied.
rest: Then he said to them, “Give to Caesar what belongs to Caesar. And give to God what belongs to God.”

firstLine: Marriage When the Dead Rise
rest: That same day the Sadducees came to Jesus with a question. They do not believe that people rise from the dead.

firstLine: The Most Important Commandment
rest: The Pharisees heard that the Sadducees weren’t able to answer Jesus. So the Pharisees got together.

firstLine: “What do you think about the Christ? Whose son is he?”
rest: “The son of David,” they replied.

firstLine: “‘The Lord said to my Lord,
rest:
“Sit at my right hand
until I put your enemies
under your control.”’ ()

firstLine: Jesus Judges the Pharisees and the Teachers of the Law
rest: Jesus spoke to the crowds and to his disciples.

firstLine: Signs of the End
rest: Jesus left the temple. He was walking away when his disciples came up to him. They wanted to call his attention to the temple buildings.

firstLine: “Right after the terrible suffering of those days,
rest:
“‘The sun will be darkened.
The moon will not shine.
The stars will fall from the sky.
The heavenly bodies will be shaken.’ (; )

firstLine: The Day and Hour Are Not Known
rest: “No one knows about that day or hour. Not even the angels in heaven know. The Son does not know. Only the Father knows.

firstLine: The Story of Ten Bridesmaids
rest: “Here is what the kingdom of heaven will be like at that time. Ten bridesmaids took their lamps and went out to meet the groom.

firstLine: The Story of Three Servants
rest: “Again, here is what the kingdom of heaven will be like. A man was going on a journey. He sent for his servants and put them in charge of his property.

firstLine: The Sheep and the Goats
rest: “The Son of Man will come in all his glory. All the angels will come with him. Then he will sit on his throne in the glory of heaven.

firstLine: The Plan to Kill Jesus
rest: Jesus finished saying all these things. Then he said to his disciples,

firstLine: A Woman Pours Perfume on Jesus
rest: Jesus was in Bethany. He was in the home of a man named Simon, who had a skin disease.

firstLine: Judas Agrees to Hand Jesus Over
rest: One of the Twelve went to the chief priests. His name was Judas Iscariot.

firstLine: The Lord’s Supper
rest: It was the first day of the Feast of Unleavened Bread. The disciples came to Jesus. They asked, “Where do you want us to prepare for you to eat the Passover meal?”

firstLine: Jesus Says That Peter Will Fail
rest:
Jesus told them, “This very night you will all turn away because of me. It is written that the Lord said,
“‘I will strike the shepherd down.
Then the sheep of the flock will be scattered.’ ()

firstLine: Jesus Prays in Gethsemane
rest: Then Jesus went with his disciples to a place called Gethsemane. He said to them, “Sit here while I go over there and pray.”

firstLine: Jesus Is Arrested
rest: While Jesus was still speaking, Judas arrived. He was one of the Twelve. A large crowd was with him. They were carrying swords and clubs. The chief priests and the elders of the people had sent them.

firstLine: Jesus Is Taken to the Sanhedrin
rest: Those who had arrested Jesus took him to Caiaphas, the high priest. The teachers of the law and the elders had come together there.

firstLine: Peter Says He Does Not Know Jesus
rest: Peter was sitting out in the courtyard. A female servant came to him. “You also were with Jesus of Galilee,” she said.

firstLine: Judas Hangs Himself
rest: It was early in the morning. All the chief priests and the elders of the people decided to put Jesus to death.

firstLine: “I have sinned,” he said. “I handed over a man who is not guilty.”
rest: “What do we care?” they replied. “That’s your problem.”

firstLine: Jesus Is Brought to Pilate
rest:
Jesus was standing in front of the governor. The governor asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?”
“Yes. It is just as you say,” Jesus replied.

firstLine: “Which of the two do you want me to set free?” asked the governor.
rest: “Barabbas,” they answered.

firstLine: “Then what should I do with Jesus who is called Christ?” Pilate asked.
rest: They all answered, “Crucify him!”

firstLine: “Why? What wrong has he done?” asked Pilate.
rest: But they shouted even louder, “Crucify him!”

firstLine: The Soldiers Make Fun of Jesus
rest: The governor’s soldiers took Jesus into the palace, which was called the Praetorium. All the rest of the soldiers gathered around him.

firstLine: Jesus Is Nailed to a Cross
rest: On their way out of the city, they met a man from Cyrene. His name was Simon. They forced him to carry the cross.

firstLine: Jesus Dies
rest: From noon until three o’clock, the whole land was covered with darkness.

firstLine: Jesus Is Buried
rest: As evening approached, a rich man came from the town of Arimathea. His name was Joseph. He had become a follower of Jesus.

firstLine: The Guards at the Tomb
rest: The next day was the day after Preparation Day. The chief priests and the Pharisees went to Pilate.

firstLine: Jesus Rises From the Dead
rest: The Sabbath day was now over. It was dawn on the first day of the week. Mary Magdalene and the other Mary went to look at the tomb.

firstLine: The Guards Report to the Chief Priests
rest: While the women were on their way, some of the guards went into the city. They reported to the chief priests all that had happened.

firstLine: Jesus’ Final Orders to His Disciples
rest: Then the 11 disciples went to Galilee. They went to the mountain where Jesus had told them to go.

firstLine: John the Baptist Prepares the Way
rest: This is the beginning of the good news about Jesus Christ, the Son of God.

firstLine: Long ago Isaiah the prophet wrote,
rest:
“I will send my messenger ahead of you.
He will prepare your way.” ()

firstLine: “A messenger is calling out in the desert,
rest:
‘Prepare the way for the Lord.
Make straight paths for him.’” ()

firstLine: Jesus Is Baptized and Tempted
rest: At that time Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee. John baptized him in the Jordan River.

firstLine: Jesus Chooses the First Disciples
rest: After John was put in prison, Jesus went into Galilee. He preached God’s good news.

firstLine: Jesus Drives Out an Evil Spirit
rest: Jesus and those with him went to Capernaum. When the Sabbath day came, he went into the synagogue. There he began to teach.

firstLine: Jesus Heals Many People
rest: Jesus and those with him left the synagogue. Right away they went with James and John to the home of Simon and Andrew.

firstLine: Jesus Prays in a Quiet Place
rest: It was very early in the morning and still dark. Jesus got up and left the house. He went to a place where he could be alone. There he prayed.

firstLine: Jesus Heals a Man Who Had a Skin Disease
rest: A man who had a skin disease came to Jesus. On his knees he begged Jesus. He said, “If you are willing to make me ‘clean,’ you can do it.”

firstLine: Jesus Heals a Man Who Could Not Walk
rest: A few days later, Jesus entered Capernaum again. The people heard that he had come home.

firstLine: Jesus Chooses Levi
rest: Once again Jesus went out beside the Sea of Galilee. A large crowd came to him. He began to teach them.

firstLine: Jesus Is Asked About Fasting
rest: John’s disciples and the Pharisees were going without eating. Some people came to Jesus. They said to him, “John’s disciples are fasting. The disciples of the Pharisees are also fasting. But your disciples are not. Why aren’t they?”

firstLine: Jesus Is Lord of the Sabbath Day
rest: One Sabbath day Jesus was walking with his disciples through the grainfields. The disciples began to break off some heads of grain.

firstLine: Crowds Follow Jesus
rest: Jesus went off to the Sea of Galilee with his disciples. A large crowd from Galilee followed.

firstLine: Jesus Appoints the Twelve Apostles
rest: Jesus went up on a mountainside. He called for certain people to come to him, and they came.

firstLine: Jesus and Beelzebub
rest: Jesus entered a house. Again a crowd gathered. It was so large that Jesus and his disciples were not even able to eat.

firstLine: Jesus’ Mother and Brothers
rest: Jesus’ mother and brothers came and stood outside. They sent someone in to get him.

firstLine: The Story of the Farmer
rest: Again Jesus began to teach by the Sea of Galilee. The crowd that gathered around him was very large. So he got into a boat. He sat down in it out on the lake. All the people were along the shore at the water’s edge.

firstLine: In that way,
rest:
“‘They will see but never know what they are seeing.
They will hear but never understand.
Otherwise they might turn and be forgiven!’” ()

firstLine: A Lamp on a Stand
rest: Jesus said to them, “Do you bring in a lamp to put it under a large bowl or a bed? Don’t you put it on its stand?

firstLine: The Story of the Growing Seed
rest: Jesus also said, “Here is what God’s kingdom is like. A farmer scatters seed on the ground.

firstLine: The Story of the Mustard Seed
rest: Again Jesus said, “What can we say God’s kingdom is like? What story can we use to explain it?

firstLine: Jesus Calms the Storm
rest: When evening came, Jesus said to his disciples, “Let’s go over to the other side of the lake.”

firstLine: Jesus Heals a Man Controlled by Demons
rest: They went across the Sea of Galilee to the area of the Gerasenes.

firstLine: A Dying Girl and a Suffering Woman
rest: Jesus went across the Sea of Galilee in a boat. It landed at the other side. There a large crowd gathered around him.

firstLine: A Prophet Without Honor
rest: Jesus left there and went to his hometown of Nazareth. His disciples went with him.

firstLine: John the Baptist’s Head Is Cut Off
rest: King Herod heard about this. Jesus’ name had become well known. Some were saying, “John the Baptist has been raised from the dead! That is why he has the power to do miracles.”

firstLine: Jesus Feeds the Five Thousand
rest: The apostles gathered around Jesus. They told him all they had done and taught.

firstLine: “How many loaves do you have?” Jesus asked. “Go and see.”
rest: When they found out, they said, “Five loaves and two fish.”

firstLine: Jesus Walks on the Water
rest: Right away Jesus made his disciples get into the boat. He had them go on ahead of him to Bethsaida. Then he sent the crowd away.

firstLine: The Faith of a Greek Woman
rest: Jesus went from there to a place near Tyre. He entered a house. He did not want anyone to know where he was. But he could not keep it a secret.

firstLine: Jesus Heals a Man Who Could Not Hear or Speak
rest: Then Jesus left the area of Tyre and went through Sidon. He went down to the Sea of Galilee and into the area known as the Ten Cities.

firstLine: Jesus Feeds the Four Thousand
rest: During those days another large crowd gathered. They had nothing to eat. So Jesus called for his disciples to come to him. He said,

firstLine: “How many loaves do you have?” Jesus asked.
rest: “Seven,” they replied.

firstLine: The Yeast of the Pharisees and Herod
rest: The disciples had forgotten to bring bread. They had only one loaf with them in the boat.

firstLine: “Later I broke seven loaves for the 4,000. How many baskets of pieces did you pick up?”
rest: “Seven,” they answered.

firstLine: Jesus Heals a Blind Man
rest: Jesus and his disciples came to Bethsaida. Some people brought a blind man. They begged Jesus to touch him.

firstLine: Peter Says That Jesus Is the Christ
rest: Jesus and his disciples went on to the villages around Caesarea Philippi. On the way he asked them, “Who do people say I am?”

firstLine: “But what about you?” he asked. “Who do you say I am?”
rest: Peter answered, “You are the Christ.”

firstLine: Jesus Tells About His Coming Death
rest: Jesus then began to teach his disciples. He taught them that the Son of Man must suffer many things. He taught them that the elders would not accept him. The chief priests and the teachers of the law would not accept him either. He must be killed and after three days rise again.

firstLine: Jesus’ Appearance Is Changed
rest: After six days Jesus took Peter, James and John with him. He led them up a high mountain. They were all alone. There in front of them his appearance was changed.

firstLine: Jesus Heals a Boy Who Had an Evil Spirit
rest: When Jesus and those who were with him came to the other disciples, they saw a large crowd around them. The teachers of the law were arguing with them.

firstLine: Anyone Who Is Not Against Us Is for Us
rest: “Teacher,” said John, “we saw a man driving out demons in your name. We told him to stop, because he was not one of us.”

firstLine: Leading People to Sin
rest: “What if someone leads one of these little ones who believe in me to sin? If he does, it would be better for him to be thrown into the sea with a large millstone tied around his neck.

firstLine: In hell,
rest:
“‘The worms do not die.
The fire is not put out.’ ()

firstLine: Jesus Teaches About Divorce
rest: Jesus left that place and went into the area of Judea and across the Jordan River. Again crowds of people came to him. As usual, he taught them.

firstLine: Little Children Are Brought to Jesus
rest: People were bringing little children to Jesus. They wanted him to touch them. But the disciples told the people to stop.

firstLine: Jesus and the Rich Young Man
rest: As Jesus started on his way, a man ran up to him. He fell on his knees before Jesus. “Good teacher,” he said, “what must I do to receive eternal life?”

firstLine: Jesus Again Tells About His Coming Death
rest:
They were on their way up to Jerusalem. Jesus was leading the way. The disciples were amazed. Those who followed were afraid.
Again Jesus took the Twelve to one side. He told them what was going to happen to him.

firstLine: James and John Ask a Favor of Jesus
rest: James and John came to Jesus. They were the sons of Zebedee. “Teacher,” they said, “we would like to ask a favor of you.”

firstLine: “We can,” they answered.
rest: Jesus said to them, “You will drink the cup I drink. And you will go through the baptism I go through.

firstLine: Blind Bartimaeus Receives His Sight
rest:
Jesus and his disciples came to Jericho. They were leaving the city. A large crowd was with them.
A blind man was sitting by the side of the road begging. His name was Bartimaeus. Bartimaeus means Son of Timaeus.

firstLine: “What do you want me to do for you?” Jesus asked him.
rest: The blind man said, “Rabbi, I want to be able to see.”

firstLine: “Go,” said Jesus. “Your faith has healed you.”
rest: Right away he could see. And he followed Jesus along the road.

firstLine: Jesus Enters Jerusalem
rest: As they all approached Jerusalem, they came to Bethphage and Bethany at the Mount of Olives. Jesus sent out two of his disciples.

firstLine: Those in front and those in back shouted,
rest:
“Hosanna!”
“Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord!” ()

firstLine: “Blessed is the coming kingdom of our father David!”
rest: “Hosanna in the highest heaven!”

firstLine: Jesus Clears the Temple
rest: The next day as Jesus and his disciples were leaving Bethany, they were hungry.

firstLine: The Dried-up Fig Tree
rest: In the morning as Jesus and his disciples walked along, they saw the fig tree. It was dried up all the way down to the roots.

firstLine: The Authority of Jesus Is Questioned
rest: Jesus and his disciples arrived again in Jerusalem. He was walking in the temple courtyards. Then the chief priests came to him. The teachers of the law and the elders came too.

firstLine: The Story of the Renters
rest: Jesus began to speak to the people by using stories. He said, “A man planted a vineyard. He put a wall around it. He dug a pit for a winepress. He also built a lookout tower. He rented the vineyard out to some farmers. Then he went away on a journey.

firstLine: “Haven’t you read what Scripture says,
rest:
“‘The stone the builders didn’t accept
has become the most important stone of all.

firstLine: Marriage When the Dead Rise
rest: The Sadducees came to Jesus with a question. They do not believe that people rise from the dead.

firstLine: The Most Important Commandment
rest: One of the teachers of the law came and heard the Sadducees arguing. He noticed that Jesus had given the Sadducees a good answer. So he asked him, “Which is the most important of all the commandments?”

firstLine: The Widow’s Offering
rest: Jesus sat down across from the place where people put their temple offerings. He watched the crowd putting their money into the offering boxes. Many rich people threw large amounts into them.

firstLine: Signs of the End
rest: Jesus was leaving the temple. One of his disciples said to him, “Look, Teacher! What huge stones! What wonderful buildings!”

firstLine: “So in those days there will be terrible suffering. After that, Scripture says,
rest:
“‘The sun will be darkened.
The moon will not shine.

firstLine: The Day and Hour Are Not Known
rest: “No one knows about that day or hour. Not even the angels in heaven know. The Son does not know. Only the Father knows.

firstLine: A Woman Pours Perfume on Jesus
rest: The Passover and the Feast of Unleavened Bread were only two days away. The chief priests and the teachers of the law were looking for a clever way to arrest Jesus. They wanted to kill him.

firstLine: The Lord’s Supper
rest:
It was the first day of the Feast of Unleavened Bread. That was the time to sacrifice the Passover lamb.
Jesus’ disciples asked him, “Where do you want us to go and prepare for you to eat the Passover meal?”

firstLine: Jesus Says That Peter Will Fail
rest:
“You will all turn away,” Jesus told the disciples. “It is written,
“‘I will strike the shepherd down.
Then the sheep will be scattered.’ ()

firstLine: Jesus Prays in Gethsemane
rest: Jesus and his disciples went to a place called Gethsemane. Jesus said to them, “Sit here while I pray.”

firstLine: Jesus Is Arrested
rest: Just as Jesus was speaking, Judas appeared. He was one of the Twelve. A crowd was with him. They were carrying swords and clubs. The chief priests, the teachers of the law, and the elders had sent them.

firstLine: Jesus Is Taken to the Sanhedrin
rest: The crowd took Jesus to the high priest. All of the chief priests, the elders, and the teachers of the law came together.

firstLine: “You have heard him say a very evil thing against God. What do you think?”
rest: They all found him guilty and said he must die.

firstLine: Peter Says He Does Not Know Jesus
rest: Peter was below in the courtyard. One of the high priest’s female servants came by.

firstLine: Jesus Is Brought to Pilate
rest: It was very early in the morning. The chief priests, with the elders, the teachers of the law, and the whole Sanhedrin, made a decision. They tied Jesus up and led him away. Then they handed him over to Pilate.

firstLine: “Are you the king of the Jews?” asked Pilate.
rest: “Yes. It is just as you say,” Jesus replied.

firstLine: “Why? What wrong has he done?” asked Pilate.
rest: But they shouted even louder, “Crucify him!”

firstLine: The Soldiers Make Fun of Jesus
rest: The soldiers led Jesus away into the palace. It was called the Praetorium. They called together the whole company of soldiers.

firstLine: Jesus Is Nailed to a Cross
rest: A man named Simon from Cyrene was passing by. He was the father of Alexander and Rufus. Simon was on his way in from the country. The soldiers forced him to carry the cross.

firstLine: Jesus Dies
rest: At noon, darkness covered the whole land. It lasted three hours.

firstLine: Jesus Is Buried
rest: It was the day before the Sabbath. That day was called Preparation Day. As evening approached,

firstLine: Jesus Rises From the Dead
rest: The Sabbath day ended. Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought spices. They were going to apply them to Jesus’ body.

firstLine: Luke Writes an Orderly Report
rest: Many people have attempted to write about the things that have taken place among us.

firstLine: The Coming Birth of John the Baptist
rest: Herod was king of Judea. During the time he was ruling, there was a priest named Zechariah. He belonged to a group of priests named after Abijah. His wife Elizabeth also came from the family line of Aaron.

firstLine: The Coming Birth of Jesus
rest: In the sixth month after Elizabeth had become pregnant, God sent the angel Gabriel to Nazareth, a town in Galilee.

firstLine: Mary Visits Elizabeth
rest: At that time Mary got ready and hurried to a town in Judea’s hill country.

firstLine: Mary’s Song
rest:
Mary said,
“My soul gives glory to the Lord.

firstLine: He has taken note of me
rest:
even though I am not important.
From now on all people will call me blessed.

firstLine: He shows his mercy to those who have respect for him,
rest: from parent to child down through the years.

firstLine: John the Baptist Is Born
rest: The time came for Elizabeth to have her baby. She gave birth to a son.

firstLine: Zechariah’s Song
rest: His father Zechariah was filled with the Holy Spirit. He prophesied,

firstLine: “Give praise to the Lord, the God of Israel!
rest: He has come and set his people free.

firstLine: He promised to save us from our enemies,
rest: so that we could serve him without fear.

firstLine: “And you, my child, will be called a prophet of the Most High God.
rest: You will go ahead of the Lord to prepare the way for him.

firstLine: It will shine on those living in darkness
rest:
and in the shadow of death.
It will guide our feet on the path of peace.”

firstLine: Jesus Is Born
rest: In those days, Caesar Augustus made a law. It required that a list be made of everyone in the whole Roman world.

firstLine: Angels Appear to the Shepherds
rest: There were shepherds living out in the fields nearby. It was night, and they were looking after their sheep.

firstLine: “May glory be given to God in the highest heaven!
rest: And may peace be given to those he is pleased with on earth!”

firstLine: Joseph and Mary Take Jesus to the Temple
rest: When the child was eight days old, he was circumcised. At the same time he was named Jesus. This was the name the angel had given him before his mother became pregnant.

firstLine: “Lord, you are the King over all.
rest:
Now let me, your servant, go in peace.
That is what you promised.

firstLine: The Boy Jesus at the Temple
rest: Every year Jesus’ parents went to Jerusalem for the Passover Feast.

firstLine: John the Baptist Prepares the Way
rest: Tiberius Caesar had been ruling for 15 years. Pontius Pilate was governor of Judea. Herod was the ruler of Galilee. His brother Philip was the ruler of Iturea and Traconitis. Lysanias was ruler of Abilene.

firstLine: The Baptism and Family Line of Jesus
rest: When all the people were being baptized, Jesus was baptized too. And as he was praying, heaven was opened.

firstLine: Jesus Is Tempted
rest: Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan River. The Spirit led him into the desert.

firstLine: It is written,
rest: “‘The Lord will command his angels to take good care of you.

firstLine: Jesus Is Not Accepted in Nazareth
rest: Jesus returned to Galilee in the power of the Holy Spirit. News about him spread through the whole countryside.

firstLine: “The Spirit of the Lord is on me.
rest:
He has anointed me
to tell the good news to poor people.
He has sent me to announce freedom for prisoners.
He has sent me so that the blind will see again.
He wants me to free those who are beaten down.

firstLine: Jesus Drives Out an Evil Spirit
rest: Then Jesus went to Capernaum, a town in Galilee. On the Sabbath day he began to teach the people.

firstLine: “Be quiet!” Jesus said firmly. “Come out of him!”
rest: Then the demon threw the man down in front of everybody. And it came out without hurting him.

firstLine: Jesus Heals Many People
rest: Jesus left the synagogue and went to the home of Simon. At that time, Simon’s mother-in-law was suffering from a high fever. So they asked Jesus to help her.

firstLine: Jesus Chooses the First Disciples
rest: One day Jesus was standing by the Sea of Galilee. The people crowded around him and listened to the word of God.

firstLine: Jesus Heals a Man With a Skin Disease
rest: While Jesus was in one of the towns, a man came along. He had a skin disease all over his body. When he saw Jesus, he fell with his face to the ground. He begged him, “Lord, if you are willing to make me ‘clean,’ you can do it.”

firstLine: Jesus Heals a Man Who Could Not Walk
rest: One day Jesus was teaching. Pharisees and teachers of the law were sitting there. They had come from every village of Galilee and from Judea and Jerusalem. They heard that the Lord had given Jesus the power to heal the sick.

firstLine: Jesus Chooses Levi
rest:
After this, Jesus left the house. He saw a tax collector sitting at the tax booth. The man’s name was Levi.
“Follow me,” Jesus said to him.

firstLine: Jesus Is Asked About Fasting
rest: Some of the people who were there said to Jesus, “John’s disciples often pray and go without eating. So do the disciples of the Pharisees. But yours go on eating and drinking.”

firstLine: Jesus Is Lord of the Sabbath Day
rest: One Sabbath day Jesus was walking through the grainfields. His disciples began to break off some heads of grain. They rubbed them in their hands and ate them.

firstLine: Jesus Chooses the Twelve Apostles
rest: On one of those days, Jesus went out to a mountainside to pray. He spent the night praying to God.

firstLine: Jesus Gives Blessings and Warnings
rest: Jesus went down the mountain with them and stood on a level place. A large crowd of his disciples was there. A large number of other people were there too. They came from all over Judea, including Jerusalem. They also came from the coast of Tyre and Sidon.

firstLine: Blessed are you when people hate you,
rest:
when they have nothing to do with you
and say bad things about you,
and when they treat your name as something evil.
They do all this because you are followers of the Son of Man.

firstLine: “But how terrible it will be for you who are rich!
rest: You have already had your easy life.

firstLine: Love Your Enemies
rest: “But here is what I tell you who hear me. Love your enemies. Do good to those who hate you.

firstLine: Be Fair When You Judge Others
rest: “If you do not judge others, then you will not be judged. If you do not find others guilty, then you will not be found guilty. Forgive, and you will be forgiven.

firstLine: A Tree and Its Fruit
rest: “A good tree doesn’t bear bad fruit. And a bad tree doesn’t bear good fruit.

firstLine: The Wise and Foolish Builders
rest: “Why do you call me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ and still don’t do what I say?

firstLine: A Roman Commander Has Faith
rest: Jesus finished saying all those things to the people. Then he entered Capernaum.

firstLine: Jesus Raises a Widow’s Son From the Dead
rest: Some time later, Jesus went to a town called Nain. His disciples and a large crowd went along with him.

firstLine: Jesus and John the Baptist
rest: John’s disciples told him about all these things. So he chose two of them.

firstLine: “He is the one written about in Scripture. It says,
rest:
“‘I will send my messenger ahead of you.
He will prepare your way for you.’ ()

firstLine: A Sinful Woman Pours Perfume on Jesus
rest: One of the Pharisees invited Jesus to have dinner with him. So he went to the Pharisee’s house. He took his place at the table.

firstLine: The Story of the Farmer
rest: After this, Jesus traveled around from one town and village to another. He announced the good news of God’s kingdom. The Twelve were with him.

firstLine: A Lamp on a Stand
rest: “People do not light a lamp and then hide it in a jar or put it under a bed. Instead, they put it on a stand. Then those who come in can see its light.

firstLine: Jesus’ Mother and Brothers
rest: Jesus’ mother and brothers came to see him. But they could not get near him because of the crowd.

firstLine: Jesus Calms the Storm
rest: One day Jesus said to his disciples, “Let’s go over to the other side of the lake.” So they got into a boat and left.

firstLine: “Where is your faith?” he asked his disciples.
rest: They were amazed and full of fear. They asked one another, “Who is this? He commands even the winds and the waves, and they obey him.”

firstLine: Jesus Heals a Man Controlled by Demons
rest: Jesus and his disciples sailed to the area of the Gerasenes across the lake from Galilee.

firstLine: “Return home and tell how much God has done for you.”
rest: So the man went away. He told people all over town how much Jesus had done for him.

firstLine: A Dying Girl and a Suffering Woman
rest: When Jesus returned, a crowd welcomed him. They were all expecting him.

firstLine: “Who touched me?” Jesus asked.
rest: They all said they didn’t do it. Then Peter said, “Master, the people are crowding and pushing against you.”

firstLine: Jesus Sends Out the Twelve Disciples
rest: Jesus called the Twelve together. He gave them power and authority to drive out all demons and to heal sicknesses.

firstLine: Jesus Feeds the Five Thousand
rest: The apostles returned. They told Jesus what they had done. Then he took them with him. They went off by themselves to a town called Bethsaida.

firstLine: Peter Says That Jesus Is the Christ
rest: One day Jesus was praying alone. Only his disciples were with him. He asked them, “Who do the crowds say I am?”

firstLine: “But what about you?” he asked. “Who do you say I am?”
rest: Peter answered, “The Christ of God.”

firstLine: Jesus’ Appearance Is Changed
rest: About eight days after Jesus said this, he went up on a mountain to pray. He took Peter, John and James with him.

firstLine: Jesus Heals a Boy Who Had an Evil Spirit
rest: The next day Jesus and those who were with him came down from the mountain. A large crowd met Jesus.

firstLine: The Samaritans Do Not Welcome Jesus
rest: The time grew near for Jesus to be taken up to heaven. So he made up his mind to go to Jerusalem.

firstLine: It Costs to Follow Jesus
rest: Once Jesus and those who were with him were walking along the road. A man said to Jesus, “I will follow you no matter where you go.”

firstLine: Jesus Sends Out the Seventy-two
rest: After this the Lord appointed 72 others. He sent them out two by two ahead of him. They went to every town and place where he was about to go.

firstLine: The Story of the Good Samaritan
rest: One day an authority on the law stood up to put Jesus to the test. “Teacher,” he asked, “what must I do to receive eternal life?”

firstLine: Jesus at the Home of Martha and Mary
rest: Jesus and his disciples went on their way. Jesus came to a village where a woman named Martha lived. She welcomed him into her home.

firstLine: Jesus Teaches About Prayer
rest: One day Jesus was praying in a certain place. When he finished, one of his disciples spoke to him. “Lord,” he said, “teach us to pray, just as John taught his disciples.”

firstLine: Forgive us our sins,
rest:
as we also forgive everyone who sins against us.
Keep us from falling into sin when we are tempted.’”

firstLine: Jesus and Beelzebub
rest: Jesus was driving out a demon. The man who had the demon could not speak. When the demon left, the man began to speak. The crowd was amazed.

firstLine: The Miraculous Sign of Jonah
rest: As the crowds grew larger, Jesus spoke to them. “The people of today are evil,” he said. “They ask for a miraculous sign from God. But none will be given except the sign of Jonah.

firstLine: The Eye Is the Lamp of the Body
rest: “No one lights a lamp and hides it. No one puts it under a bowl. Instead, people put a lamp on its stand. Then those who come in can see the light.

firstLine: Six Warnings
rest: Jesus finished speaking. Then a Pharisee invited him to eat with him. So Jesus went in and took his place at the table.

firstLine: Jesus Gives Words of Warning and Hope
rest:
During that time a crowd of many thousands had gathered. There were so many people that they were stepping on one another.
Jesus spoke first to his disciples. “Be on your guard against the yeast of the Pharisees,” he said. “They just pretend to be godly.

firstLine: The Story of the Rich Man
rest: Someone in the crowd spoke to Jesus. “Teacher,” he said, “tell my brother to divide the family property with me.”

firstLine: Do Not Worry
rest: Then Jesus spoke to his disciples. He said, “I tell you, do not worry. Don’t worry about your life and what you will eat. And don’t worry about your body and what you will wear.

firstLine: Be Ready
rest: “Be dressed and ready to serve. Keep your lamps burning.

firstLine: Jesus Will Separate People From One Another
rest: “I have come to bring fire on the earth. How I wish the fire had already started!

firstLine: Understanding What Is Happening
rest: Jesus spoke to the crowd. He said, “You see a cloud rising in the west. Right away you say, ‘It’s going to rain.’ And it does.

firstLine: Jesus Gives a Warning
rest: Some people who were there at that time told Jesus about certain Galileans. Pilate had mixed their blood with their sacrifices.

firstLine: Jesus Heals a Disabled Woman on the Sabbath Day
rest: Jesus was teaching in one of the synagogues on a Sabbath day.

firstLine: The Stories of the Mustard Seed and the Yeast
rest: Then Jesus asked, “What is God’s kingdom like? What can I compare it to?

firstLine: The Narrow Door
rest: Then Jesus went through the towns and villages, teaching the people. He was on his way to Jerusalem.

firstLine: Jesus’ Sadness Over Jerusalem
rest: At that time some Pharisees came to Jesus. They said to him, “Leave this place. Go somewhere else. Herod wants to kill you.”

firstLine: Jesus Eats at a Pharisee’s House
rest: One Sabbath day, Jesus went to eat in the house of a well-known Pharisee. While he was there, he was being carefully watched.

firstLine: The Story of the Big Dinner
rest: One of the people at the table with Jesus heard him say those things. So he said to Jesus, “Blessed is the one who will eat at the feast in God’s kingdom.”

firstLine: “The servant came back and reported this to his master.
rest: “Then the owner of the house became angry. He ordered his servant, ‘Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the town. Bring in those who are poor. Also bring those who can’t walk, the blind and the disabled.’

firstLine: It Costs to Be a Disciple
rest: Large crowds were traveling with Jesus. He turned and spoke to them. He said,

firstLine: The Story of the Lost Sheep
rest: The tax collectors and “sinners” were all gathering around to hear Jesus.

firstLine: The Story of the Lost Coin
rest: “Or suppose a woman has ten silver coins and loses one. She will light a lamp and sweep the house. She will search carefully until she finds the coin.

firstLine: The Story of the Lost Son
rest: Jesus continued, “There was a man who had two sons.

firstLine: The Story of the Clever Manager
rest: Jesus told his disciples another story. He said, “There was a rich man who had a manager. Some said that the manager was wasting what the rich man owned.

firstLine: “‘I owe 800 gallons of olive oil,’ he replied.
rest: “The manager told him, ‘Take your bill. Sit down quickly and change it to 400 gallons.’

firstLine: “Then he asked the second one, ‘And how much do you owe?’
rest:
“‘I owe 1,000 bushels of wheat,’ he replied.
“The manager told him, ‘Take your bill and change it to 800 bushels.’

firstLine: More Teachings
rest: “The teachings of the Law and the Prophets were preached until John came. Since then, the good news of God’s kingdom is being preached. And everyone is trying very hard to enter it.

firstLine: The Rich Man and Lazarus
rest: “Once there was a rich man. He was dressed in purple cloth and fine linen. He lived an easy life every day.

firstLine: Sin, Faith and Duty
rest: Jesus spoke to his disciples. “Things that make people sin are sure to come,” he said. “But how terrible it will be for the person who brings them!

firstLine: Jesus Heals Ten Men
rest: Jesus was on his way to Jerusalem. He traveled along the border between Samaria and Galilee.

firstLine: The Coming of God’s Kingdom
rest: Once the Pharisees asked Jesus when God’s kingdom would come. He replied, “The coming of God’s kingdom is not something you can see just by watching for it carefully.

firstLine: “Where, Lord?” his disciples asked.
rest: He replied, “The vultures will gather where there is a dead body.”

firstLine: The Story of the Widow Who Would Not Give Up
rest: Jesus told his disciples a story. He wanted to show them that they should always pray and not give up.

firstLine: The Story of the Pharisee and the Tax Collector
rest: Jesus told a story to some people who were sure they were right with God. They looked down on everybody else.

firstLine: Little Children Are Brought to Jesus
rest: People were also bringing babies to Jesus. They wanted him to touch them. When the disciples saw this, they told the people to stop.

firstLine: Jesus and the Rich Ruler
rest: A certain ruler asked Jesus a question. “Good teacher,” he said, “what must I do to receive eternal life?”

firstLine: Jesus Again Tells About His Coming Death
rest: Jesus took the Twelve to one side. He told them, “We are going up to Jerusalem. Everything that the prophets wrote about the Son of Man will come true.

firstLine: A Blind Beggar Receives His Sight
rest: Jesus was approaching Jericho. A blind man was sitting by the side of the road begging.

firstLine: “What do you want me to do for you?” Jesus asked.
rest: “Lord, I want to be able to see,” the blind man replied.

firstLine: Zacchaeus the Tax Collector
rest: Jesus entered Jericho and was passing through.

firstLine: The Story of Three Servants
rest: While the people were listening to these things, Jesus told them a story. He was near Jerusalem. The people thought that God’s kingdom was going to appear right away.

firstLine: Jesus Enters Jerusalem
rest: After Jesus had said this, he went on ahead. He was going up to Jerusalem.

firstLine: “Blessed is the king who comes in the name of the Lord!” ()
rest: “May there be peace and glory in the highest heaven!”

firstLine: Jesus Clears Out the Temple
rest: Then Jesus entered the temple area. He began chasing out those who were selling there.

firstLine: The Authority of Jesus Is Questioned
rest:
One day Jesus was teaching the people in the temple courtyard. He was preaching the good news to them.
The chief priests and the teachers of the law came up to him. The elders came with them.

firstLine: The Story of the Renters
rest: Jesus went on to tell the people a story. “A man planted a vineyard,” he said. “He rented it out to some farmers. Then he went away for a long time.

firstLine: “Caesar’s,” they replied.
rest: He said to them, “Then give to Caesar what belongs to Caesar. And give to God what belongs to God.”

firstLine: Marriage When the Dead Rise
rest: The Sadducees do not believe that people rise from the dead. Some of them came to Jesus with a question.

firstLine: David himself says in the Book of Psalms,
rest:
“‘The Lord said to my Lord,
“Sit at my right hand

firstLine: until I put your enemies
rest: under your control.”’ ()

firstLine: The Widow’s Offering
rest: As Jesus looked up, he saw rich people putting their gifts into the temple offering boxes.

firstLine: Signs of the End
rest: Some of Jesus’ disciples were talking about the temple. They spoke about how it was decorated with beautiful stones and with gifts that honored God. But Jesus asked,

firstLine: Judas Agrees to Hand Jesus Over
rest: The Feast of Unleavened Bread, called the Passover, was near.

firstLine: The Last Supper
rest: Then the day of Unleavened Bread came. That was the time the Passover lamb had to be sacrificed.

firstLine: Jesus Prays on the Mount of Olives
rest: Jesus went out as usual to the Mount of Olives. His disciples followed him.

firstLine: Jesus Is Arrested
rest: While Jesus was still speaking, a crowd came up. The man named Judas was leading them. He was one of the Twelve. Judas approached Jesus to kiss him.

firstLine: Peter Says He Does Not Know Jesus
rest: Then the men arrested Jesus and led him away. They took him into the high priest’s house. Peter followed from far away.

firstLine: The Guards Make Fun of Jesus
rest: There were men guarding Jesus. They began laughing at him and beating him.

firstLine: Jesus Is Brought to Pilate and Herod
rest: At dawn the elders of the people met together. These included the chief priests and the teachers of the law. Jesus was led to them.

firstLine: “If you are the Christ,” they said, “tell us.”
rest: Jesus answered, “If I tell you, you will not believe me.

firstLine: Jesus Is Nailed to a Cross
rest: As they led Jesus away, they took hold of Simon. Simon was from Cyrene. He was on his way in from the country. They put a wooden cross on his shoulders. Then they made him carry it behind Jesus.

firstLine: It is written,
rest:
“‘The people will say to the mountains, “Fall on us!”
They’ll say to the hills, “Cover us!”’ ()

firstLine: Jesus Dies
rest: It was now about noon. The whole land was covered with darkness until three o’clock.

firstLine: Jesus Is Buried
rest: A man named Joseph was a member of the Jewish Council. He was a good and honest man.

firstLine: Jesus Rises From the Dead
rest: It was very early in the morning on the first day of the week. The women took the spices they had prepared. Then they went to the tomb.

firstLine: On the Road to Emmaus
rest: That same day two of Jesus’ followers were going to a village called Emmaus. It was about seven miles from Jerusalem.

firstLine: “What things?” Jesus asked.
rest: “About Jesus of Nazareth,” they replied. “He was a prophet. He was powerful in what he said and did in the eyes of God and all of the people.

firstLine: Jesus Appears to the Disciples
rest: The disciples were still talking about this when Jesus himself suddenly stood among them. He said, “May peace be with you!”

firstLine: Jesus Is Taken Up Into Heaven
rest: Jesus led his disciples out to the area near Bethany. Then he lifted up his hands and blessed them.

firstLine: The Word Became Human
rest: In the beginning, the Word was already there. The Word was with God, and the Word was God.

firstLine: John the Baptist Is Not the Christ
rest: The Jews of Jerusalem sent priests and Levites to ask John who he was. John gave witness to them.

firstLine: Jesus Is the Lamb of God
rest: The next day John saw Jesus coming toward him. John said, “Look! The Lamb of God! He takes away the sin of the world!

firstLine: Jesus Chooses the First Disciples
rest: The next day John was again with two of his disciples.

firstLine: “Come,” he replied. “You will see.”
rest: So they went and saw where he was staying. They spent the rest of the day with him. It was about four o’clock in the afternoon.

firstLine: Jesus Chooses Philip and Nathanael
rest: The next day Jesus decided to leave for Galilee. He found Philip and said to him, “Follow me.”

firstLine: “Nazareth! Can anything good come from there?” Nathanael asked.
rest: “Come and see,” said Philip.

firstLine: “How do you know me?” Nathanael asked.
rest: Jesus answered, “I saw you while you were still under the fig tree. I saw you there before Philip called you.”

firstLine: Jesus Changes Water Into Wine
rest: On the third day there was a wedding. It took place at Cana in Galilee. Jesus’ mother was there.

firstLine: Jesus Clears Out the Temple
rest: After this, Jesus went down to Capernaum. His mother and brothers and disciples went with him. They all stayed there for a few days.

firstLine: Jesus Teaches Nicodemus
rest: There was a Pharisee named Nicodemus. He was one of the Jewish rulers.

firstLine: John the Baptist Gives Witness About Jesus
rest: After this, Jesus and his disciples went out into the countryside of Judea. There he spent some time with them. And he baptized people there.

firstLine: Jesus Talks With a Woman From Samaria
rest: The Pharisees heard that Jesus was winning and baptizing more disciples than John.

firstLine: “I have no husband,” she replied.
rest: Jesus said to her, “You are right when you say you have no husband.

firstLine: The Disciples Join Jesus Again
rest: Just then Jesus’ disciples returned. They were surprised to find him talking with a woman. But no one asked, “What do you want from her?” No one asked, “Why are you talking with her?”

firstLine: Many Samaritans Believe in Jesus
rest: Many of the Samaritans from the town of Sychar believed in Jesus. They believed because of the woman’s witness. She said, “He told me everything I’ve ever done.”

firstLine: Jesus Heals the Official’s Son
rest: After the two days, Jesus left for Galilee.

firstLine: Jesus Heals a Disabled Man
rest: Some time later, Jesus went up to Jerusalem for a Jewish feast.

firstLine: Life Because of the Son
rest: Jesus was doing these things on the Sabbath day. So the Jews began to oppose him.

firstLine: Giving Witness About Jesus
rest: “If I give witness about myself, it doesn’t count.

firstLine: Jesus Feeds the Five Thousand
rest: Some time after this, Jesus crossed over to the other side of the Sea of Galilee. It is also called the Sea of Tiberias.

firstLine: Jesus Walks on the Water
rest: When evening came, Jesus’ disciples went down to the Sea of Galilee.

firstLine: Jesus Is the Bread of Life
rest: They found him on the other side of the lake. They asked him, “Rabbi, when did you get here?”

firstLine: Many Disciples Leave Jesus
rest: Jesus’ disciples heard this. Many of them said, “This is a hard teaching. Who can accept it?”

firstLine: Jesus Goes to the Feast of Booths
rest: After this, Jesus went around in Galilee. He stayed away from Judea on purpose. He knew that the Jews there were waiting to kill him.

firstLine: Jesus Teaches at the Feast
rest: Jesus did nothing until halfway through the Feast. Then he went up to the temple courtyard and began to teach.

firstLine: The Jewish Leaders Do Not Believe
rest: Finally the temple guards went back to the chief priests and the Pharisees. They asked the guards, “Why didn’t you bring him in?”

firstLine: “No one, sir,” she said.
rest: “Then I don’t find you guilty either,” Jesus said. “Go now and leave your life of sin.”

firstLine: Jesus’ Witness Is True
rest: Jesus spoke to the people again. He said, “I am the light of the world. Those who follow me will never walk in darkness. They will have the light that leads to life.”

firstLine: “Who are you?” they asked.
rest: “Just what I have been claiming all along,” Jesus replied.

firstLine: The Children of Abraham
rest: Jesus spoke to the Jews who had believed him. “If you obey my teaching,” he said, “you are really my disciples.

firstLine: “Abraham is our father,” they answered.
rest: Jesus said, “Are you really Abraham’s children? If you are, you will do the things Abraham did.

firstLine: The Children of the Devil
rest: Jesus said to them, “If God were your Father, you would love me. I came from God, and now I am here. I have not come on my own. He sent me.

firstLine: Jesus Makes Claims About Himself
rest: The Jews answered Jesus, “Aren’t we right when we say you are a Samaritan? Aren’t you controlled by a demon?”

firstLine: Jesus Heals a Man Born Blind
rest: As Jesus went along, he saw a man who was blind. He had been blind since he was born.

firstLine: “Go,” he told him. “Wash in the Pool of Siloam.” Siloam means Sent.
rest: So the man went and washed. And he came home able to see.

firstLine: “Where is this man?” they asked him.
rest: “I don’t know,” he said.

firstLine: The Pharisees Want to Know What Happened
rest: They brought to the Pharisees the man who had been blind.

firstLine: The Blind Will See
rest: Jesus heard that the Pharisees had thrown the man out. When he found him, he said, “Do you believe in the Son of Man?”

firstLine: The Shepherd and the Flock
rest: “What I’m about to tell you is true. What if someone does not enter the sheep pen through the gate but climbs in another way? That person is a thief and a robber.

firstLine: The Jews Do Not Believe
rest: Then came the Feast of Hanukkah at Jerusalem. It was winter.

firstLine: Lazarus Dies
rest: A man named Lazarus was sick. He was from Bethany, the village where Mary and her sister Martha lived.

firstLine: Jesus Comforts the Sisters
rest: When Jesus arrived, he found out that Lazarus had already been in the tomb for four days.

firstLine: “Where have you put him?” he asked.
rest: “Come and see, Lord,” they replied.

firstLine: Jesus Raises Lazarus From the Dead
rest: Once more Jesus felt very sad. He came to the tomb. It was a cave with a stone in front of the entrance.

firstLine: “Take away the stone,” he said.
rest: “But, Lord,” said Martha, the sister of the dead man, “by this time there is a bad smell. Lazarus has been in the tomb for four days.”

firstLine: The Plan to Kill Jesus
rest: Many of the Jews who had come to visit Mary saw what Jesus did. So they put their faith in him.

firstLine: Mary Pours Perfume on Jesus
rest: It was six days before the Passover Feast. Jesus arrived at Bethany, where Lazarus lived. Lazarus was the one Jesus had raised from the dead.

firstLine: Jesus Enters Jerusalem
rest: The next day the large crowd that had come for the Feast heard that Jesus was on his way to Jerusalem.

firstLine: “City of Zion, do not be afraid.
rest:
See, your king is coming.
He is sitting on a donkey’s colt.” ()

firstLine: Jesus Tells About His Coming Death
rest: There were some Greeks among the people who went up to worship during the Feast.

firstLine: The Jews Still Do Not Believe
rest: Jesus had done all these miraculous signs in front of them. But they still would not believe in him.

firstLine: “The Lord has blinded their eyes.
rest:
He has closed their minds.
So they can’t see with their eyes.
They can’t understand with their minds.
They can’t turn to the Lord. If they could, he would heal them.” ()

firstLine: Jesus Washes His Disciples’ Feet
rest: It was just before the Passover Feast. Jesus knew that the time had come for him to leave this world. It was time for him to go to the Father. Jesus loved his disciples who were in the world. So he now showed them how much he really loved them.

firstLine: “No,” said Peter. “You will never wash my feet.”
rest: Jesus answered, “Unless I wash you, you can’t share life with me.”

firstLine: Jesus Tells What Judas Will Do
rest: “I am not talking about all of you. I know those I have chosen. But this will happen so that Scripture will come true. It says, ‘The one who shares my bread has deserted me.’ ()

firstLine: Jesus Says That Peter Will Fail
rest: After Judas was gone, Jesus spoke. He said, “Now the Son of Man receives glory. And he brings glory to God.

firstLine: Jesus Comforts His Disciples
rest: “Do not let your hearts be troubled. Trust in God. Trust in me also.

firstLine: Jesus Is the Way to the Father
rest: Thomas said to him, “Lord, we don’t know where you are going. So how can we know the way?”

firstLine: The Father Will Send the Holy Spirit
rest: “If you love me, you will obey what I command.

firstLine: The Vine and the Branches
rest: “I am the true vine. My Father is the gardener.

firstLine: The World Hates the Disciples
rest: “Does the world hate you? Remember that it hated me first.

firstLine: What the Holy Spirit Will Do
rest: “Now I am going to the One who sent me. But none of you asks me, ‘Where are you going?’

firstLine: The Disciples’ Sadness Will Turn Into Joy
rest: Some of his disciples spoke to one another. They said, “What does he mean by saying, ‘In a little while, you will no longer see me. Then after a little while, you will see me’? And what does he mean by saying, ‘I am going to the Father’?”

firstLine: Jesus Prays for Himself
rest:
After Jesus said this, he looked toward heaven and prayed. He said,
“Father, the time has come. Bring glory to your Son. Then your Son will bring glory to you.

firstLine: Jesus Prays for His Disciples
rest: “I have shown you to the disciples you gave me out of the world. They were yours. You gave them to me. And they have obeyed your word.

firstLine: Jesus Prays for All Believers
rest: “I do not pray only for them. I pray also for those who will believe in me because of their message.

firstLine: Jesus Is Arrested
rest: When Jesus had finished praying, he left with his disciples. They crossed the Kidron Valley. On the other side there was a grove of olive trees. Jesus and his disciples went into it.

firstLine: “Jesus of Nazareth,” they replied.
rest:
“I am he,” Jesus said.
Judas, who was going to hand Jesus over, was standing there with them.

firstLine: Jesus Is Taken to Annas
rest: Then the group of soldiers, their leader and the Jewish officials arrested Jesus. They tied him up

firstLine: Peter Says He Is Not Jesus’ Disciple
rest: Simon Peter and another disciple were following Jesus. The high priest knew the other disciple. So that disciple went with Jesus into the high priest’s courtyard.

firstLine: The High Priest Questions Jesus
rest: Meanwhile, the high priest questioned Jesus. He asked him about his disciples and his teaching.

firstLine: Peter Again Says He Is Not Jesus’ Disciple
rest:
Simon Peter stood there. He was warming himself. Then someone asked him, “You aren’t one of Jesus’ disciples, are you?”
He said, “I am not.”

firstLine: Jesus Is Brought to Pilate
rest: Then the Jews led Jesus from Caiaphas to the palace of the Roman governor. By now it was early morning. The Jews did not want to be made “unclean.” They wanted to be able to eat the Passover meal. So they did not enter the palace.

firstLine: “So you are a king, then!” said Pilate.
rest: Jesus answered, “You are right to say I am a king. In fact, that’s the reason I was born. I came into the world to give witness to the truth. Everyone who is on the side of truth listens to me.”

firstLine: “What is truth?” Pilate asked.
rest: Then Pilate went out again to the Jews. He said, “I find no basis for any charge against him.

firstLine: Jesus Is Sentenced to Be Crucified
rest: Then Pilate took Jesus and had him whipped.

firstLine: “Let’s not tear it,” they said to one another. “Let’s cast lots to see who will get it.”
rest:
This happened so that Scripture would come true. It says,
“They divided up my clothes among them.
They cast lots for what I was wearing.” ()
So that is what the soldiers did.

firstLine: Jesus Dies
rest: Later Jesus said, “I am thirsty.” He knew that everything was now finished. He knew that what Scripture said must come true.

firstLine: Jesus Is Buried
rest: Later Joseph asked Pilate for Jesus’ body. Joseph was from the town of Arimathea. He was a follower of Jesus. But he followed Jesus secretly because he was afraid of the Jews. After Pilate gave him permission, Joseph came and took the body away.

firstLine: The Tomb Is Empty
rest: Early on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene went to the tomb. It was still dark. She saw that the stone had been moved away from the entrance.

firstLine: Jesus Appears to Mary Magdalene
rest: Then the disciples went back to their homes.

firstLine: “Woman,” he said, “why are you crying? Who are you looking for?”
rest: She thought he was the gardener. So she said, “Sir, did you carry him away? Tell me where you put him. Then I will go and get him.”

firstLine: Jesus Appears to His Disciples
rest:
On the evening of that first day of the week, the disciples were together. They had locked the doors because they were afraid of the Jews.
Jesus came in and stood among them. He said, “May peace be with you!”

firstLine: Jesus Appears to Thomas
rest: Thomas was one of the Twelve. He was called Didymus. He was not with the other disciples when Jesus came.

firstLine: Jesus Does a Miracle at the Sea
rest: After this, Jesus appeared to his disciples again. It was by the Sea of Galilee. Here is what happened.

firstLine: Jesus Takes Peter Back
rest:
When Jesus and the disciples had finished eating, Jesus spoke to Simon Peter. He asked, “Simon, son of John, do you really love me more than these others do?”
“Yes, Lord,” he answered. “You know that I love you.”
Jesus said, “Feed my lambs.”

firstLine: Jesus Is Taken Up Into Heaven
rest: Theophilus, I wrote about Jesus in my earlier book. I wrote about all he did and taught

firstLine: Matthias Is Chosen to Take the Place of Judas
rest: The apostles returned to Jerusalem from the Mount of Olives. It is almost a mile from the city.

firstLine: The Holy Spirit Comes at Pentecost
rest: The day of Pentecost came. The believers all gathered in one place.

firstLine: Peter Speaks to the Crowd
rest: Then Peter stood up with the Eleven. In a loud voice he spoke to the crowd. “My Jewish friends,” he said, “let me explain this to you. All of you who live in Jerusalem, listen carefully to what I say.

firstLine: He said,
rest:
“‘In the last days, God says,
I will pour out my Holy Spirit on all people.
Your sons and daughters will prophesy.
Your young men will see visions.
Your old men will have dreams.

firstLine: In those days I will pour out my Spirit
rest:
even on those who serve me, both men and women.
When I do, they will prophesy.

firstLine: Everyone who calls
rest: on the name of the Lord will be saved.’ ()

firstLine: I will put your enemies
rest: under your control.”’ ()

firstLine: The Believers Share Life Together
rest: The believers studied what the apostles taught. They shared life together. They broke bread and ate together. And they prayed.

firstLine: Peter Heals the Disabled Beggar
rest: One day Peter and John were going up to the temple. It was three o’clock in the afternoon. It was the time for prayer.

firstLine: Peter Speaks to the Jews
rest: The beggar was holding on to Peter and John. All the people were amazed. They came running to them at Solomon’s Porch.

firstLine: Peter and John Are Taken to the Sanhedrin
rest: Peter and John were speaking to the people. The priests, the captain of the temple guard, and the Sadducees came up to the apostles.

firstLine: Scripture says that Jesus is
rest:
“‘the stone you builders did not accept.
But it has become the most important stone of all.’ ()

firstLine: The Believers Pray
rest: Peter and John were allowed to leave. They went back to their own people. They reported everything the chief priests and the elders had said to them.

firstLine: The Believers Share What They Own
rest: All the believers were agreed in heart and mind. They didn’t claim that anything they had was their own. They shared everything they owned.

firstLine: Ananias and Sapphira
rest: A man named Ananias and his wife, Sapphira, also sold some land.

firstLine: The Apostles Heal Many People
rest: The apostles did many miraculous signs and wonders among the people. All the believers used to meet together at Solomon’s Porch.

firstLine: An Angel Opens the Prison Doors
rest: The high priest and all his companions were Sadducees. They were very jealous of the apostles.

firstLine: Seven Leaders Are Chosen
rest: In those days the number of believers was growing. The Jews who followed Greek practices complained against the Jews who followed only Jewish practices. They said that the widows of men who followed Greek practices were not being taken care of. They weren’t getting their fair share of food each day.

firstLine: Stephen Is Arrested
rest: Stephen was full of God’s grace and power. He did great wonders and miraculous signs among the people.

firstLine: Stephen Speaks to the Sanhedrin
rest: Then the high priest questioned Stephen. “Is what these people are saying true?” he asked.

firstLine: “‘Heaven is my throne.
rest:
The earth is under my control.
What kind of house will you build for me?
says the Lord.
Where will my resting place be?

firstLine: Stephen Is Killed
rest: When the Sanhedrin heard this, they became very angry. They ground their teeth at Stephen.

firstLine: Philip Goes to Samaria
rest: The believers who had been scattered preached the word everywhere they went.

firstLine: Simon the Evil Magician
rest: A man named Simon lived in the city. For quite a while he had practiced evil magic there. He amazed all the people of Samaria. He claimed to be someone great.

firstLine: Philip and the Man From Ethiopia
rest: An angel of the Lord spoke to Philip. “Go south to the desert road,” he said. “It’s the road that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza.”

firstLine: Saul Becomes a Believer
rest: Meanwhile, Saul continued to oppose the Lord’s followers. He said they would be put to death. He went to the high priest.

firstLine: “Who are you, Lord?” Saul asked.
rest: “I am Jesus,” he replied. “I am the one you are opposing.

firstLine: Peter Goes to Lydda and Joppa
rest: As Peter traveled around the country, he went to visit God’s people in Lydda.

firstLine: Cornelius Calls for Peter
rest: A man named Cornelius lived in Caesarea. He was a Roman commander in the Italian Regiment.

firstLine: Peter Has a Vision
rest: It was about noon the next day. The men were on their journey and were approaching the city. Peter went up on the roof to pray.

firstLine: Peter Explains His Actions
rest: The apostles and the believers all through Judea heard that people who were not Jews had also received God’s word.

firstLine: Believers Are Called Christians for the First Time
rest: Some believers had been scattered by the suffering that came to them after Stephen’s death. They traveled as far as Phoenicia, Cyprus and Antioch. But they told the message only to Jews.

firstLine: An Angel Helps Peter Escape From Prison
rest: About this time, King Herod arrested some people who belonged to the church. He planned to make them suffer greatly.

firstLine: Barnabas and Saul Are Sent Off
rest: In the church at Antioch there were prophets and teachers. Among them were Barnabas, Simeon, and Lucius from Cyrene. Simeon was also called Niger. Another was Manaen. He had been brought up with Herod, the ruler of Galilee. Saul was among them too.

firstLine: Events on Cyprus
rest: Barnabas and Saul were sent on their way by the Holy Spirit. They went down to Seleucia. From there they sailed to Cyprus.

firstLine: Paul Preaches in Pisidian Antioch
rest: From Paphos, Paul and his companions sailed to Perga in Pamphylia. There John left them and returned to Jerusalem.

firstLine: In another place it says,
rest: “‘You will not let your Holy One rot away.’ ()

firstLine: “‘Look, you who make fun of the truth!
rest:
Wonder and die!
I am going to do something in your days
that you would never believe.
You wouldn’t believe it even if someone told you.’” ()

firstLine: Paul and Barnabas Preach in Iconium
rest: At Iconium, Paul and Barnabas went into the Jewish synagogue as usual. They spoke there with great power. Large numbers of Jews and non-Jews became believers.

firstLine: Paul Preaches in Lystra
rest: In Lystra there sat a man who couldn’t walk. He hadn’t been able to use his feet since the day he was born.

firstLine: Paul and Barnabas Return to Antioch
rest: Paul and Barnabas preached the good news in the city of Derbe. They won large numbers of followers. Then they returned to Lystra, Iconium and Antioch.

firstLine: Church Leaders Meet in Jerusalem
rest: Certain people came down from Judea to Antioch. Here is what they were teaching the believers. “Moses commanded you to be circumcised,” they said. “If you aren’t, you can’t be saved.”

firstLine: “‘After this I will return
rest:
and rebuild David’s fallen tent.
I will rebuild what was destroyed.
I will make it what it used to be.

firstLine: A Letter Is Written to Non-Jewish Believers
rest: Then the apostles, the elders and the whole church decided what to do. They would choose some of their own men. They would send them to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas. So they chose two leaders among the believers. Their names were Judas Barsabbas and Silas.

firstLine: Paul and Barnabas Do Not Agree
rest: Some time later Paul spoke to Barnabas. “Let’s go back to all the towns where we preached the word of the Lord,” he said. “Let’s visit the believers and see how they are doing.”

firstLine: Timothy Joins Paul and Silas
rest: Paul came to Derbe. Then he went on to Lystra. A believer named Timothy lived there. His mother was Jewish and a believer. His father was a Greek.

firstLine: Paul’s Vision of the Man From Macedonia
rest: Paul and his companions traveled all through the area of Phrygia and Galatia. The Holy Spirit had kept them from preaching the word in Asia Minor.

firstLine: Lydia Becomes a Believer
rest: At Troas we got into a boat. We sailed straight for Samothrace. The next day we went on to Neapolis.

firstLine: Paul and Silas Are Thrown Into Prison
rest: One day we were going to the place of prayer. On the way we were met by a female slave. She had a spirit that helped her to tell ahead of time what was going to happen. She earned a lot of money for her owners by telling fortunes.

firstLine: Paul and Silas Arrive in Thessalonica
rest: Paul and Silas passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia. They came to Thessalonica. A Jewish synagogue was there.

firstLine: Paul and Silas Are Sent to Berea
rest: As soon as it was night, the believers sent Paul and Silas away to Berea. When they arrived, they went to the Jewish synagogue.

firstLine: Paul Preaches in Athens
rest: Paul was waiting for Silas and Timothy in Athens. He was very upset to see that the city was full of statues of gods.

firstLine: Paul Goes to Corinth
rest: After this, Paul left Athens and went to Corinth.

firstLine: Priscilla and Aquila Teach Apollos
rest: Paul stayed in Corinth for some time. Then he left the believers and sailed for Syria. Priscilla and Aquila went with him. Before he sailed, he had his hair cut off at Cenchrea. He did this because he had made a promise to God.

firstLine: Paul Goes to Ephesus
rest: While Apollos was at Corinth, Paul took the road to Ephesus. When he arrived, he found some believers there.

firstLine: Trouble in Ephesus
rest: At that time many people became very upset about the Way of Jesus.

firstLine: Paul Travels Through Macedonia and Greece
rest: All the trouble came to an end. Then Paul sent for the believers. After cheering them up, he said good-by. He then left for Macedonia.

firstLine: Eutychus Is Raised From the Dead
rest: On the first day of the week we met to break bread and eat together. Paul spoke to the people. He kept on talking until midnight because he planned to leave the next day.

firstLine: Paul Says Good-by to the Ephesian Elders
rest: We went on ahead to the ship. We sailed for Assos. There we were going to take Paul on board. He had planned it this way because he wanted to go there by land.

firstLine: Paul Continues His Journey
rest: After we had torn ourselves away from the Ephesian elders, we headed out to sea. We sailed straight to Cos. The next day we went to Rhodes. From there we continued on to Patara.

firstLine: Paul Arrives in Jerusalem
rest: When we arrived in Jerusalem, the brothers and sisters gave us a warm welcome.

firstLine: Paul Is Arrested
rest: The seven days of cleansing were almost over. Some Jews from Asia Minor saw Paul at the temple. They stirred up the whole crowd. They arrested Paul.

firstLine: Paul Speaks to the Crowd
rest:
The soldiers were about to take Paul into the fort. Then he asked the commander, “May I say something to you?”
“Do you speak Greek?” he replied.

firstLine: “‘Who are you, Lord?’ I asked.
rest: “‘I am Jesus of Nazareth,’ he replied. ‘I am the one you are opposing.’

firstLine: “‘What should I do, Lord?’ I asked.
rest: “‘Get up,’ the Lord said. ‘Go into Damascus. There you will be told everything you have been given to do.’

firstLine: Paul the Roman Citizen
rest: The crowd listened to Paul until he said this. Then they shouted, “Kill him! He isn’t fit to live!”

firstLine: Paul Is Taken to the Sanhedrin
rest: The commanding officer wanted to find out exactly what the Jews had against Paul. So the next day he let Paul out of prison. He ordered a meeting of the chief priests and all the Sanhedrin. Then he brought Paul and had him stand in front of them.

firstLine: The Plan to Kill Paul
rest: The next morning the Jews gathered secretly to make plans against Paul. They took an oath that they would not eat or drink anything until they had killed him.

firstLine: Paul Is Taken to Caesarea
rest: Then the commanding officer called for two of his commanders. He ordered them, “Gather a company of 200 soldiers, 70 horsemen and 200 men armed with spears. Get them ready to go to Caesarea at nine o’clock tonight.

firstLine: Paul’s Trial in Front of Felix
rest: Five days later Ananias the high priest went down to Caesarea. Some elders and a lawyer named Tertullus went with him. They brought their charges against Paul to the governor.

firstLine: Paul’s Trial in Front of Festus
rest: Three days after Festus arrived, he went up from Caesarea to Jerusalem.

firstLine: Festus Talks With King Agrippa
rest: A few days later King Agrippa and Bernice arrived in Caesarea. They came to pay a visit to Festus.

firstLine: Paul Speaks to Agrippa
rest: The next day Agrippa and Bernice arrived. They acted like very important people. They entered the courtroom. The most important officers and the leading men of the city came with them. When Festus gave the command, Paul was brought in.

firstLine: “Then I asked, ‘Who are you, Lord?’
rest: “‘I am Jesus,’ the Lord replied. ‘I am the one you are opposing.

firstLine: Paul Sails for Rome
rest: It was decided that we would sail for Italy. Paul and some other prisoners were handed over to a Roman commander named Julius. He belonged to the Imperial Guard.

firstLine: The Storm
rest: A gentle south wind began to blow. They thought that this was what they had been waiting for. So they pulled up the anchor and sailed along the shore of Crete.

firstLine: The Ship Is Destroyed
rest: On the 14th night we were still being driven across the Sea of Adria. About midnight the sailors had a feeling that they were approaching land.

firstLine: On Shore at Malta
rest: When we were safe on shore, we found out that the island was called Malta.

firstLine: Paul Arrives in Rome
rest: After three months we headed out to sea. We sailed in a ship that had stayed at the island during the winter. It was a ship from Alexandria. On the front of it the figures of twin gods were carved. Their names were Castor and Pollux.

firstLine: Paul Preaches in Rome
rest: Three days later Paul called a meeting of the Jewish leaders. So they came. Paul said to them, “My brothers, I have done nothing against our people. I have also done nothing against what our people of long ago practiced. But I was arrested in Jerusalem. I was handed over to the Romans.

firstLine: “‘Go to your people. Say to them,
rest:
“You will hear but never understand.
You will see but never know what you are seeing.”

firstLine: Paul Longs to Visit Rome
rest: First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for all of you. People all over the world are talking about your faith.

firstLine: God’s Anger Against Sinners
rest: God shows his anger from heaven. It is against all the godless and evil things people do. They are so evil that they say no to the truth.

firstLine: God Judges Fairly
rest: If you judge someone else, you have no excuse for it. When you judge another person, you are judging yourself. You do the same things you blame others for doing.

firstLine: The Jews and the Law
rest: Suppose you call yourself a Jew. You trust in the law. You brag that you are close to God.

firstLine: God Is Faithful
rest: Is there any advantage in being a Jew? Is there any value in being circumcised?

firstLine: No One Is Right With God
rest: What should we say then? Are we Jews any better? Not at all! We have already claimed that Jews are sinners. The same is true of those who aren’t Jews.

firstLine: It is written,
rest: “No one is right with God, no one at all.

firstLine: “Their throats are like open graves.
rest:
With their tongues they tell lies.” ()
“The words from their lips are like the poison of a snake.” ()

firstLine: Becoming Right With God
rest: But now God has shown us how to become right with him. The Law and the Prophets give witness to this. It has nothing to do with obeying the law.

firstLine: Abraham’s Faith Made Him Right With God
rest: What should we say about those things? What did our father Abraham discover about being right with God?

firstLine: “Blessed are those
rest:
whose lawless acts are forgiven.
Blessed are those
whose sins are taken away.

firstLine: Blessed is the man
rest: whose sin the Lord never counts against him.” ()

firstLine: Peace and Joy
rest: We have been made right with God because of our faith. Now we have peace with him because of our Lord Jesus Christ.

firstLine: Death Through Adam, Life Through Christ
rest: Sin entered the world because one man sinned. And death came because of sin. Everyone sinned, so death came to all people.

firstLine: Living a New Life
rest: What should we say then? Should we keep on sinning so that God’s grace can increase?

firstLine: Slaves to Right Living
rest: What should we say then? Should we sin because we are not ruled by law but by God’s grace? Not at all!

firstLine: An Example From Marriage
rest: Brothers and sisters, I am speaking to you who know the law. Don’t you know that the law has authority over us only as long as we are alive?

firstLine: Struggling With Sin
rest: What should we say then? That the law is sin? Not at all! I wouldn’t have known what sin was unless the law had told me. The law said, “Do not want what belongs to other people.” (; ) If the law hadn’t said that, I would not have known what it was like to want what belonged to others.

firstLine: The Holy Spirit Gives Life
rest: Those who belong to Christ Jesus are no longer under God’s sentence.

firstLine: The Hope of Future Glory
rest: What we are suffering now is nothing compared with the glory that will be shown in us.

firstLine: We Will Win
rest: We know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him. He appointed them to be saved in keeping with his purpose.

firstLine: It is written,
rest:
“Because of you, we face death all day long.
We are considered as sheep to be killed.” ()

firstLine: God’s Free Choice
rest: I speak the truth in Christ. I am not lying. My mind tells me that what I say is true. It is guided by the Holy Spirit.

firstLine: He said to Moses,
rest:
“I will have mercy on whom I have mercy.
I will show love to those I love.” ()

firstLine: God says in Hosea,
rest:
“I will call those who are not my people ‘my people.’
I will call the one who is not my loved one ‘my loved one.’” ()

firstLine: He also says,
rest:
“Once it was said to them,
‘You are not my people.’
In that very place they will be called ‘children of the living God.’” ()

firstLine: Earlier Isaiah had said,
rest:
“The Lord who rules over all
left us children and grandchildren.
If he hadn’t, we would have become like Sodom.
We would have been like Gomorrah.” ()

firstLine: Israel Does Not Believe
rest: What should we say then? Those who aren’t Jews did not look for a way to be right with God. But they found it by having faith.

firstLine: It is written,
rest:
“Look! In Zion I am laying a stone that causes people to trip.
It is a rock that makes them fall.
The one who trusts in him will never be put to shame.” (; )

firstLine: God’s Faithful People in Israel
rest: So here is what I ask. Did God turn his back on his people? Not at all! I myself belong to Israel. I am one of Abraham’s children. I am from the tribe of Benjamin.

firstLine: It is written,
rest:
“God made it hard for them to understand.
He gave them eyes that could not see.
He gave them ears that could not hear.
And they are still like that today.” (; )

firstLine: David says,
rest:
“Let their feast be a trap and a snare.
Let it make Israel trip and fall. Let Israel get what’s coming to them.

firstLine: Two Kinds of Olive Branches
