rest: Again, here is what I ask. They didn’t trip and fall once and for all time, did they? Not at all! Because Israel sinned, those who aren’t Jews can be saved. That will make Israel jealous of them.

firstLine: All Israel Will Be Saved
rest: Brothers and sisters, here is a mystery I want you to understand. It will keep you from being proud. Part of Israel has refused to obey God. That will continue until the full number of non-Jews has entered God’s kingdom.

firstLine: Praise to God
rest:
How very rich are God’s wisdom and knowledge!
How he judges is more than we can understand!
The way he deals with people is more than we can know!

firstLine: “Who can ever know what is in the Lord’s mind?
rest: Or who can ever give him advice?” ()

firstLine: “Has anyone ever given anything to God,
rest: so that God has to pay him back?” ()

firstLine: Living for God
rest: Brothers and sisters, God has shown you his mercy. So I am asking you to offer up your bodies to him while you are still alive. Your bodies are a holy sacrifice that is pleasing to God. When you offer your bodies to God, you are worshiping him.

firstLine: Love
rest: Love must be honest and true. Hate what is evil. Hold on to what is good.

firstLine: Obey Those in Authority
rest: All of you must be willing to obey completely those who rule over you. There are no authorities except the ones God has chosen. Those who now rule have been chosen by God.

firstLine: Love, Because the Day Is Near
rest: Pay everything you owe. But you can never pay back all the love you owe each other. Those who love others have done everything the law requires.

firstLine: The Weak and the Strong
rest: Accept those whose faith is weak. Don’t judge them where you have differences of opinion.

firstLine: It is written,
rest:
“‘You can be sure that I live,’ says the Lord.
‘And you can be just as sure that every knee will bow down in front of me.
Every tongue will tell the truth to God.’” ()

firstLine: Again it says,
rest:
“You non-Jews, be full of joy.
Be joyful together with God’s people.” ()

firstLine: And again it says,
rest:
“All you non-Jews, praise the Lord.
All you nations, sing praises to him.” ()

firstLine: And Isaiah says,
rest:
“The Root of Jesse will grow up quickly.
He will rule over the nations.
Those who aren’t Jews will put their hope in him.” ()

firstLine: Paul Serves the Non-Jews
rest: My brothers and sisters, I am sure that you are full of goodness. What you know is complete. You are able to teach one another.

firstLine: It is written,
rest:
“Those who were not told about him will understand.
Those who have not heard will know what it all means.” ()

firstLine: Paul Plans to Visit Rome
rest: Now there is no more place for me to work in those areas. For many years I have been longing to see you.

firstLine: Personal Greetings
rest: I would like you to welcome our sister Phoebe. She serves the church in Cenchrea.

firstLine: Paul Gives Thanks
rest: I always thank God for you. I thank him because of the grace he has given to you who belong to Christ Jesus.

firstLine: Taking Sides in the Church
rest: Brothers and sisters, I ask all of you to agree with one another. I make my appeal in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. Then you won’t take sides. You will be in complete agreement in all that you think.

firstLine: Christ Is God’s Power and Wisdom
rest: The message of the cross seems foolish to those who are lost and dying. But it is God’s power to us who are being saved.

firstLine: It is written,
rest:
“I will destroy the wisdom of those who are wise.
I will do away with the cleverness of those who think they are so smart.” ()

firstLine: Wisdom From the Holy Spirit
rest: The words we speak to those who have grown in the faith are wise. Our words are different from the words of the wise people or rulers of this world. People like that aren’t going anywhere.

firstLine: It is written,
rest:
“No eye has seen,
no ear has heard,
no mind has known
what God has prepared for those who love him.” ()

firstLine: “Who can ever know what is in the Lord’s mind?
rest:
Can anyone ever teach him?” ()
But we have the mind of Christ.

firstLine: Taking Sides in the Church
rest: Brothers and sisters, I couldn’t speak to you as if you were guided by the Holy Spirit. I had to speak to you as if you were following the ways of the world. You aren’t growing as Christ wants you to. You are still like babies.

firstLine: Apostles of Christ
rest: Here is how you should think of us. We serve Christ. We are trusted with God’s secret truth.

firstLine: Do Not Take Believers to Court
rest: Suppose one of you wants to bring a charge against another believer. Should you take it to the ungodly to be judged? Why not take it to God’s people?

firstLine: Sexual Sins
rest: Some of you say, “Everything is permitted for me.” But not everything is good for me. Again some of you say, “Everything is permitted for me.” But I will not be controlled by anything.

firstLine: Marriage
rest:
Now I want to deal with the things you wrote me about.
Some of you say, “It is good for a man not to have sex with a woman.”

firstLine: Food Offered to Statues of Gods
rest:
Now I want to deal with food offered to statues of gods.
We know that we all have knowledge. Knowledge makes people proud. But love builds them up.

firstLine: The Rights of an Apostle
rest: Am I not free? Am I not an apostle? Haven’t I seen Jesus our Lord? Aren’t you the result of my work for the Lord?

firstLine: Warnings From Israel’s History
rest: Brothers and sisters, here is what I want you to know about our people who lived long ago. They were all led by the cloud. They all walked through the Red Sea.

firstLine: Sharing in the Body and Blood of Christ
rest: My dear friends, run away from statues of gods. Don’t worship them.

firstLine: The Believer’s Freedom
rest: You say, “Everything is permitted.” But not everything is good for us. Again you say, “Everything is permitted.” But not everything builds us up.

firstLine: Proper Worship
rest: I praise you for being faithful in remembering me. I also praise you for staying true to all my teachings, just as I gave them to you.

firstLine: The Lord’s Supper
rest: In the following matters, I don’t praise you. Your meetings do more harm than good.

firstLine: Gifts of the Holy Spirit
rest: Brothers and sisters, I want you to know about the gifts of the Holy Spirit.

firstLine: One Body but Many Parts
rest: There is one body. But it has many parts. Even though it has many parts, they make up one body. It is the same with Christ.

firstLine: The Gifts the Holy Spirit Gives
rest: Follow the way of love. You should also want the gifts the Holy Spirit gives. Most of all, you should want the gift of prophecy.

firstLine: In the Law it is written,
rest:
“Through people who speak unfamiliar languages
and through the lips of strangers
I will speak to these people.
But even then they will not listen to me.” ()
That is what the Lord says.

firstLine: Proper Worship
rest: Brothers and sisters, what should we say then? When you come together, every one of you brings something. You bring a hymn or a teaching or a word from God. You bring a message in another language or explain what was said. All of those things must be done to make the church strong.

firstLine: Paul Explains the Good News
rest: Brothers and sisters, I want to remind you of the good news I preached to you. You received it and have put your faith in it.

firstLine: Believers Will Rise From the Dead
rest: We have preached that Christ has been raised from the dead. So how can some of you say that no one rises from the dead?

firstLine: The Body That Rises From the Dead
rest: But someone might ask, “How are the dead raised? What kind of body will they have?”

firstLine: “Death, where is the battle you thought you were winning?
rest: Death, where is your sting?” ()

firstLine: The Offering for God’s People
rest:
Now I want to deal with the offering of money for God’s people.
Do what I told the churches in Galatia to do.

firstLine: What Paul Asks for Himself
rest: After I go through Macedonia, I will come to you. I will only be passing through Macedonia.

firstLine: Final Greetings
rest: The churches in Asia Minor send you greetings. Aquila and Priscilla greet you warmly because of the Lord’s love. So does the church that meets in their house.

firstLine: God Gives Comfort
rest: Give praise to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! He is the Father who gives tender love. All comfort comes from him.

firstLine: Paul Changes His Plans
rest: Here is what we take pride in. Our sense of what is right and wrong gives witness that we have acted in God’s holy and honest ways. That is how we live in the world. We live that way most of all when we are dealing with you. Our way of living is not wise in the eyes of the world. But it is in keeping with God’s grace.

firstLine: Forgive Those Who Make You Sad
rest: Suppose someone has made us sad. In some ways, he hasn’t made me sad so much as he has made all of you sad. But I don’t want to put this too strongly.

firstLine: Serving Under the New Covenant
rest: I went to Troas to preach the good news about Christ. There I found that the Lord had opened a door of opportunity for me.

firstLine: The Glory of the New Covenant
rest: The Law was written in letters on stone. Even though it was a way of serving God, it led to death. But even that way of serving God came with glory. And even though the glory was fading, the people of Israel couldn’t look at Moses’ face very long.

firstLine: A Treasure in Clay Jars
rest: So because of God’s mercy, we have work to do. He has given it to us. And we don’t give up.

firstLine: Our Home in Heaven
rest: We know that the earthly tent we live in will be destroyed. But we have a building made by God. It is a house in heaven that lasts forever. Human hands did not build it.

firstLine: Christ Brings Us Back to God
rest:
We know what it means to have respect for the Lord. So we try to help other people to understand it.
What we are is plain to God. I hope it is also plain to your way of thinking.

firstLine: He says,
rest:
“When I showed you my favor, I heard you.
On the day I saved you, I helped you.” ()
I tell you, now is the time God shows his favor. Now is the day he saves.

firstLine: Paul’s Sufferings
rest: We don’t put anything in anyone’s way. So no one can find fault with our work for God.

firstLine: Do Not Be Joined to Unbelievers
rest: Do not be joined to unbelievers. What do right and wrong have in common? Can light and darkness be friends?

firstLine: “So come out from among them
rest:
and be separate,
says the Lord.
Do not touch anything that is not pure and clean.
Then I will receive you.” (; ,)

firstLine: “I will be your Father.
rest:
You will be my sons and daughters,
says the Lord who rules over all.” (; )

firstLine: Paul’s Joy
rest: Make room for us in your hearts. We haven’t done anything wrong to anyone. We haven’t caused anyone to sin. We haven’t taken advantage of anyone.

firstLine: Giving Freely to Others
rest: Brothers and sisters, we want you to know about the grace that God has given to the churches in Macedonia.

firstLine: Paul Sends Titus to Corinth
rest: God put into the heart of Titus the same concern I have for you. I am thankful to God for this.

firstLine: Planting Many Seeds
rest: Here is something to remember. The one who plants only a little will gather only a little. And the one who plants a lot will gather a lot.

firstLine: It is written,
rest:
“They have spread their gifts around to poor people.
Their good works continue forever.” ()

firstLine: Paul Speaks Up for Himself
rest: Christ is gentle and free of pride. So I make my appeal to you. I, Paul, am the one you call shy when I am face to face with you. But when I am away from you, you call me bold.

firstLine: Paul and Those Who Pretend to Be Apostles
rest: I hope you will put up with a little of my foolish bragging. But you are already doing that.

firstLine: Paul Brags About His Sufferings
rest: I will say it again. Don’t let anyone think I’m a fool. But if you do, receive me just as you would receive a fool. Then I can do a little bragging.

firstLine: Paul’s Vision and His Painful Problem
rest: We can’t gain anything by bragging. But I have to do it anyway. I am going to tell you what I’ve seen. I want to talk about what the Lord has shown me.

firstLine: Paul’s Concern for the People of Corinth
rest: I have made a fool of myself. But you made me do it. You should have praised me. Even though I am nothing, I am in no way less important than the “super-apostles.”

firstLine: Final Warnings
rest: This will be my third visit to you. Scripture says, “Every matter must be proved by the words of two or three witnesses.” ()

firstLine: Final Greetings
rest: Finally, brothers and sisters, good-by. Try to be perfect. Pay attention to what I’m saying. Agree with one another. Live in peace. And the God who gives love and peace will be with you.

firstLine: There Is No Other Good News
rest: I am amazed. You are so quickly deserting the One who chose you because of the grace that Christ has provided. You are turning to a different “good news.”

firstLine: Paul Was Appointed by God
rest: Brothers and sisters, here is what I want you to know. The good news I preached is not something a human being made up.

firstLine: Paul Is Accepted by the Apostles
rest: Fourteen years later I went up again to Jerusalem. This time I went with Barnabas. I took Titus along also.

firstLine: Paul Opposes Peter
rest: When Peter came to Antioch, I told him to his face that I was against what he was doing. He was clearly wrong.

firstLine: God’s Grace and Our Faith
rest: We are Jews by birth. We are not “non-Jewish sinners.”

firstLine: Faith or Obeying the Law
rest: You foolish people of Galatia! Who has put you under an evil spell? When I preached, I clearly showed you that Jesus Christ had been nailed to the cross.

firstLine: The Law and the Promise
rest: Brothers and sisters, let me give you an example from everyday life. No one can get rid of an official agreement between people. No one can add to it. It can’t be changed after it has been made. It is the same with God’s covenant.

firstLine: Children of God
rest: You are all children of God by believing in Christ Jesus.

firstLine: Paul’s Concern for the Believers in Galatia
rest: At one time you didn’t know God. You were slaves to gods that are really not gods at all.

firstLine: Paul’s Appeal to the Believers
rest: I make my appeal to you, brothers and sisters. I’m asking you to become like me. After all, I became like you. You didn’t do anything wrong to me.

firstLine: Hagar and Sarah
rest: You who want to be under the authority of the law, tell me something. Don’t you know what the law says?

firstLine: It is written,
rest:
“Be glad, woman,
you who have no children.
Start shouting,
you who have no labor pains.
The woman who is all alone has more children
than the woman who has a husband.” ()

firstLine: Christ Sets Us Free
rest: Christ has set us free. He wants us to enjoy freedom. So stand firm. Don’t let the chains of slavery hold you again.

firstLine: Chosen to Be Free
rest: My brothers and sisters, you were chosen to be free. But don’t use your freedom as an excuse to live in sin. Instead, serve one another in love.

firstLine: Living by the Holy Spirit’s Power
rest: So I say, live by the Holy Spirit’s power. Then you will not do what your sinful nature wants you to do.

firstLine: Do Good to Everyone
rest: Brothers and sisters, what if someone is caught in a sin? Then you who are guided by the Spirit should correct that person. Do it in a gentle way. But be careful. You could be tempted too.

firstLine: The Creation of a New Nature
rest: Look at the big letters I’m using as I write to you with my own hand!

firstLine: God Gives Spiritual Blessings
rest: Give praise to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ. He has blessed us with every spiritual blessing. Those blessings come from the heavenly world. They belong to us because we belong to Christ.

firstLine: Paul Prays and Gives Thanks
rest: I have heard about your faith in the Lord Jesus. I have also heard about your love for all of God’s people. That is why

firstLine: God Has Given Us New Life Through Christ
rest: You were living in your sins and lawless ways. But in fact you were dead.

firstLine: God’s New Family
rest: You who are not Jews by birth, here is what I want you to remember. You are called “uncircumcised” by those who call themselves “circumcised.” But they have only been circumcised in their bodies by human hands.

firstLine: Paul Is the Messenger to Non-Jews
rest: I, Paul, am a prisoner because of Christ Jesus. I am in prison because of my work among you who are not Jews.

firstLine: Paul Prays for God’s People
rest: I bow in prayer to the Father because of my work among you.

firstLine: The Body of Christ Is One
rest: I am a prisoner because of the Lord. So I am asking you to live a life worthy of what God chose you for.

firstLine: That is why Scripture says,
rest:
“When he went up to his place on high,
he led a line of prisoners.
He gave gifts to people.” ()

firstLine: Living as Children of Light
rest: Here is what I’m telling you. I am speaking for the Lord as I warn you. You must no longer live like those who aren’t Jews. Their thoughts don’t have any purpose.

firstLine: Wives and Husbands
rest: Wives, follow the lead of your husbands as you follow the Lord.

firstLine: Children and Parents
rest: Children, obey your parents as believers in the Lord. Obey them because it’s the right thing to do.

firstLine: Slaves and Masters
rest: Slaves, obey your masters here on earth. Respect them and honor them with a heart that is true. Obey them just as you would obey Christ.

firstLine: God’s Armor
rest: Finally, let the Lord make you strong. Depend on his mighty power.

firstLine: Final Greetings
rest: Tychicus is a dear brother. He is faithful in serving the Lord. He will tell you everything about me. Then you will know how I am and what I am doing.

firstLine: Paul Prays and Gives Thanks
rest: I thank my God every time I remember you.

firstLine: Paul Honors Christ in Prison
rest: Brothers and sisters, here is what I want you to know. What has happened to me has really helped to spread the good news.

firstLine: Thinking Like Christ
rest: Are you cheerful because you belong to Christ? Does his love comfort you? Is the Holy Spirit your companion? Has Christ been gentle and loving toward you?

firstLine: Living Like Christ
rest: My dear friends, you have always obeyed God. You obeyed while I was with you. And you have obeyed even more while I am not with you. So continue to work out your own salvation. Do it with fear and trembling.

firstLine: Timothy and Epaphroditus
rest: I hope to send Timothy to you soon if the Lord Jesus allows it. Then I will be cheered up when I receive news about you.

firstLine: Do Not Trust Human Nature
rest: Finally, my brothers and sisters, be joyful because you belong to the Lord. It is no trouble for me to write about some important matters to you again. If you know about them, you will have a safe path to follow.

firstLine: Moving on Toward the Goal
rest: I have not yet received all of those things. I have not yet been made perfect. But I move on to take hold of what Christ Jesus took hold of me for.

firstLine: Do What Is Best
rest: Here is what I’m asking Euodia and Syntyche to do. I want them to agree with each other because they belong to the Lord.

firstLine: Paul Gives Thanks for Help Received
rest: At last you are concerned about me again. That makes me very happy. We belong to the Lord. I know that you have been concerned. But you had no chance to show it.

firstLine: Final Greetings
rest: Greet all of God’s people. They belong to Christ Jesus. The brothers who are with me send greetings.

firstLine: Paul Prays and Gives Thanks
rest: We always thank God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, when we pray for you.

firstLine: Christ Is Far Above Everything
rest: Christ is the exact likeness of God, who can’t be seen. He is first, and he is over all of creation.

firstLine: Paul’s Work for the Church
rest: I am happy because of what was suffered for you. And in my body I fill up my share in Christ’s sufferings. I do it for his body, which is the church.

firstLine: Freedom From Human Rules
rest: You received Christ Jesus as Lord. So keep on living in him.

firstLine: Rules for Holy Living
rest: You have been raised up with Christ. So think about things that are in heaven. That is where Christ is. He is sitting at God’s right hand.

firstLine: Rules for Christian Families
rest: Wives, follow the lead of your husbands. That’s what the Lord wants you to do.

firstLine: More Directions
rest: Spend a lot of time in prayer. Always be watchful and thankful.

firstLine: Final Greetings
rest: Tychicus will tell you all the news about me. He is a dear brother. He is a faithful worker. He serves the Lord together with us.

firstLine: Paul Gives Thanks
rest: We always thank God for all of you. We pray for you.

firstLine: Paul’s Work for God in Thessalonica
rest: Brothers and sisters, you know that our visit to you was not a failure.

firstLine: Paul Longs to See the Believers in Thessalonica
rest: Brothers and sisters, we were torn away from you for a short time. We were no longer with you in person, but we kept you in our thoughts. We really longed to see you. So we tried very hard to do so.

firstLine: Timothy Brings a Good Report
rest: But Timothy has come to us from you just now. He has brought good news about your faith and love. He has told us that you always have happy memories of us. He has also said that you long to see us, just as we long to see you.

firstLine: Living in a Way That Pleases God
rest: Finally, brothers and sisters, we taught you how to live in a way that pleases God. In fact, that is how you are living. In the name of the Lord Jesus we ask and beg you to do it more and more.

firstLine: The Lord Is Coming
rest: Brothers and sisters, we want you to know what happens to those who die. We don’t want you to be sad, as other people are. They don’t have any hope.

firstLine: Final Directions
rest: Brothers and sisters, we ask you to have respect for the godly leaders who work hard among you. They have authority over you. They correct you.

firstLine: Paul Prays and Gives Thanks
rest: Brothers and sisters, we should always thank God for you. That is only right, because your faith is growing more and more. The love you all have for each other is increasing.

firstLine: The Man of Sin
rest: Brothers and sisters, we want to ask you something. It has to do with the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ. It concerns the time when we will go to be with him.

firstLine: Stand Firm
rest: Brothers and sisters, we should always thank God for you. The Lord loves you. God chose you from the beginning. He wanted you to be saved. Salvation comes through the Holy Spirit’s work. He makes people holy. It also comes through believing the truth.

firstLine: Paul Asks for Prayer
rest: Finally, brothers and sisters, pray for us. Pray that the Lord’s message will spread quickly. Pray that others will honor it just as you did.

firstLine: Paul Warns Those Who Do Not Want to Work
rest: Brothers and sisters, here is a command we give you in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ. Keep away from every believer who doesn’t want to work. Keep away from anyone who doesn’t live up to the teaching you received from us.

firstLine: Final Greetings
rest: May the Lord who gives peace give you peace at all times and in every way. May the Lord be with all of you.

firstLine: Paul Warns Against Certain Teachers of the Law
rest: Stay there in Ephesus. That is what I told you to do when I went into Macedonia. I want you to command certain people not to teach things that aren’t true.

firstLine: The Lord Pours Out His Grace on Paul
rest: I am thankful to Christ Jesus our Lord. He has given me strength. I thank him that he considered me faithful. And I thank him for appointing me to serve him.

firstLine: Directions for Worship
rest: First, I want all of you to pray for everyone. Ask God to bless them. Give thanks for them.

firstLine: Leaders and Deacons
rest: Here is a saying you can trust. If anyone wants to be a leader in the church, he wants to do a good work for God and people.

firstLine: Directions for Timothy
rest: The Holy Spirit clearly says that in the last days some people will leave the faith. They will follow spirits that will fool them. They will believe things that demons will teach them.

firstLine: Advice About Widows, Elders and Slaves
rest: Don’t tell an older man off. Make an appeal to him as if he were your father. Treat younger men as if they were your brothers.

firstLine: Love for Money
rest: Suppose someone teaches ideas that are false. He doesn’t agree with the true teaching of our Lord Jesus Christ. He doesn’t agree with godly teaching.

firstLine: Paul Gives a Command to Timothy
rest: But you are a man of God. Run away from all of those things. Try hard to do what is right and godly. Have faith, love and gentleness. Hold on to what you believe.

firstLine: Paul Tells Timothy to Be Faithful
rest: I serve God, knowing that what I have done is right. That is how our people served him long ago. Night and day I thank God for you. Night and day I always remember you in my prayers.

firstLine: If we don’t give up,
rest:
we will also rule with him.
If we say we don’t know him,
he will also say he doesn’t know us.

firstLine: Even if we are not faithful,
rest:
he will remain faithful.
He must be true to himself.

firstLine: A Worker Who Pleases God
rest: Keep reminding the believers of those things. While God is watching, warn them not to argue about words. That doesn’t have any value. It only destroys those who listen.

firstLine: Terrible Times in the Last Days
rest: Here is what I want you to know. There will be terrible times in the last days.

firstLine: Paul Gives a Command to Timothy
rest: But you know all about my teaching. You know how I live and what I live for. You know about my faith and love. You know how patient I am. You know I haven’t given up.

firstLine: Personal Words
rest: Do your best to come to me quickly.

firstLine: Final Greetings
rest: Greet Priscilla and Aquila. Greet those who live in the house of Onesiphorus.

firstLine: The Work of Titus on Crete
rest: I left you on the island of Crete. There were some things that hadn’t been finished. You needed to sort them out. You also had to appoint elders in every town. I told you how to do it.

firstLine: Teaching God’s People
rest: What you teach must agree with true teaching.

firstLine: Do What Is Good
rest: Remind God’s people to obey rulers and authorities. Remind them to be ready to do what is good.

firstLine: Final Words
rest: I will send Artemas or Tychicus to you. Then do your best to come to me at Nicopolis. I’ve decided to spend the winter there.

firstLine: Paul Prays and Gives Thanks
rest: I always thank my God when I remember you in my prayers.

firstLine: Paul Makes an Appeal for Onesimus
rest: Because of the authority Christ has given me, I could be bold. I could order you to do what you should do anyway.

firstLine: The Son Is Greater Than the Angels
rest: In the past, God spoke to our people through the prophets. He spoke at many times. He spoke in different ways.

firstLine: God never said to any of the angels,
rest:
“You are my Son.
Today I have become your Father.” ()
Or,
“I will be his Father.
And he will be my Son.” (; )

firstLine: He also says,
rest:
“Lord, in the beginning you made the earth secure. You placed it on its foundations.
The heavens are the work of your hands.

firstLine: God never said to an angel,
rest:
“Sit at my right hand
until I put your enemies
under your control.” ()

firstLine: A Warning to Pay Attention
rest: So we must pay more careful attention to what we have heard. Then we will not drift away from it.

firstLine: Jesus Was Made Like His Brothers
rest: God has not put angels in charge of the world that is going to come. We are talking about that world.

firstLine: He says,
rest:
“I will announce your name to my brothers and sisters.
I will sing your praises among those who worship you.” ()

firstLine: Again he says,
rest:
“I will put my trust in him.” ()
And again he says,
“Here I am. Here are the children God has given me.” ()

firstLine: Jesus Is Greater Than Moses
rest: Holy brothers and sisters, God chose you to be his people. So keep thinking about Jesus. He is our apostle. He is our high priest. We believe in him.

firstLine: A Warning Against Unbelief
rest:
The Holy Spirit says,
“Listen to his voice today.

firstLine: It has just been said,
rest:
“Listen to his voice today.
If you hear it, don’t be stubborn.
You were stubborn when you opposed me.” ()

firstLine: God’s People Enter His Sabbath Rest
rest: God’s promise of enjoying his rest still stands. So be careful that none of you fails to receive it.

firstLine: Jesus Is the Great High Priest
rest: We have a great high priest. He has gone up into the heavens. He is Jesus the Son of God. So let us hold firmly to what we say we believe.

firstLine: In another place he said,
rest:
“You are a priest forever,
just like Melchizedek.” ()

firstLine: A Warning Against Falling Away
rest: We have a lot to say about that. But it is hard to explain it to you. You learn too slowly.

firstLine: God Keeps His Promise
rest: When God made his promise to Abraham, he took an oath to keep it. But there was no one greater than himself to take an oath by. So he took his oath by making an appeal to himself.

firstLine: Melchizedek the Priest
rest: Melchizedek was the king of Salem. He was the priest of God Most High. He met Abraham, who was returning from winning a battle over some kings. Melchizedek blessed him.

firstLine: Jesus Is Like Melchizedek
rest: Suppose the Levites who were priests could have made people perfect. The law was given to the people so they could become perfect through the priests. Then why was there still a need for another priest to come? And why did he need to be like Melchizedek? Why wasn’t he from Aaron’s family line?

firstLine: Scripture says,
rest:
“You are a priest forever,
just like Melchizedek.” ()

firstLine: The High Priest of a New Covenant
rest: Here is the point of what we are saying. We have a high priest like that. He sat down at the right hand of the throne of the King, the Majesty in heaven.

firstLine: It will not be like the covenant
rest:
I made with their people of long ago.
That was when I took them by the hand.
I led them out of Egypt.
My new covenant will be different because they didn’t remain faithful to my old covenant.
So I turned away from them,
says the Lord.

firstLine: This is the covenant I will make with Israel
rest:
after that time, says the Lord.
I will put my laws in their minds.
I will write them on their hearts.
I will be their God.
And they will be my people.

firstLine: Worship in the Holy Tent on Earth
rest: The first covenant had rules for worship. It also had a sacred tent on earth.

firstLine: The Blood of Christ
rest: Christ came to be the high priest of the good things that are already here. When he came, he went through the greater and more perfect holy tent. The tent was not made by people. In other words, it is not a part of this creation.

firstLine: Christ’s Sacrifice Is Once and for All Time
rest: The law is only a shadow of the good things that are coming. It is not the real things themselves. The same sacrifices have to be offered over and over again. They must be offered year after year. That’s why the law can never make perfect those who come near to worship.

firstLine: So when Christ came into the world, he said,
rest:
“You didn’t want sacrifices and offerings.
Instead, you prepared a body for me.

firstLine: You weren’t pleased
rest: with burnt offerings and sin offerings.

firstLine: “This is the covenant I will make with them
rest:
after that time, says the Lord.
I will put my laws in their hearts.
I will write my laws on their minds.” ()

firstLine: Then he adds,
rest:
“I will not remember their sins anymore.
I will not remember the evil things they have done.” ()

firstLine: A Warning to Remain Faithful
rest: Brothers and sisters, we are not afraid to enter the Most Holy Room. We enter boldly because of the blood of Jesus.

firstLine: In just a very little while,
rest: “The one who is coming will come. He will not wait.

firstLine: Living by Faith
rest: Faith is being sure of what we hope for. It is being certain of what we do not see.

firstLine: God Trains His Children
rest: You struggle against sin. But you have not yet fought to the point of spilling your blood.

firstLine: A Warning Against Saying No to God
rest: Try your best to live in peace with everyone. Try to be holy. Without holiness no one will see the Lord.

firstLine: Final Words
rest: Keep on loving each other as brothers and sisters.

firstLine: So we can say boldly,
rest:
“The Lord helps me. I will not be afraid.
What can a mere man do to me?” ()

firstLine: Facing All Kinds of Trouble
rest: My brothers and sisters, you will face all kinds of trouble. When you do, think of it as pure joy.

firstLine: Listen to the Word and Do What It Says
rest: My dear brothers and sisters, pay attention to what I say. Everyone should be quick to listen. But they should be slow to speak. They should be slow to get angry.

firstLine: Treat Everyone the Same
rest: My brothers and sisters, you are believers in our glorious Lord Jesus Christ. So treat everyone the same.

firstLine: Show Your Faith by What You Do
rest: My brothers and sisters, what good is it if people claim they have faith but don’t act like it? Can that kind of faith save them?

firstLine: Control What You Say
rest: My brothers and sisters, most of you shouldn’t want to be teachers. You know that those of us who teach will be held more accountable.

firstLine: Two Kinds of Wisdom
rest: Are any of you wise and understanding? You should show it by living a good life. Wise people aren’t proud when they do good works.

firstLine: Obey God
rest: Why do you fight and argue among yourselves? Isn’t it because of your sinful longings? They fight inside you.

firstLine: Bragging About Tomorrow
rest: Now listen, you who say, “Today or tomorrow we will go to this or that city. We will spend a year there. We will buy and sell and make money.”

firstLine: A Warning to Rich People
rest: You rich people, listen to me. Cry and sob, because you will soon be suffering.

firstLine: Be Patient When You Suffer
rest: Brothers and sisters, be patient until the Lord comes. See how the farmer waits for the land to produce its rich crop. See how patient he is for the fall and spring rains.

firstLine: The Prayer of Faith
rest: Are any of you in trouble? Then you should pray. Are any of you happy? Then sing songs of praise.

firstLine: Peter Praises God for a Hope That Is Alive
rest: Give praise to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ. In his great mercy he has given us a new birth and a hope that is alive. It is alive because Jesus Christ rose from the dead.

firstLine: Be Holy
rest: So prepare your minds for action. Control yourselves. Put your hope completely in the grace that will be given to you when Jesus Christ returns.

firstLine: It is written,
rest:
“All people are like grass.
All of their glory is like the flowers in the field.
The grass dries up. The flowers fall to the ground.

firstLine: The Living Stone and a Chosen People
rest: Christ is the living Stone. People did not accept him. But God chose him. God places the highest value on him.

firstLine: In Scripture it says,
rest:
“Look! I am placing a stone in Zion.
It is a chosen and very valuable stone.
It is the most important stone in the building.
The one who trusts in him
will never be put to shame.” ()

firstLine: And,
rest:
“It is a stone that causes people to trip.
It is a rock that makes them fall.” ()
They trip and fall because they do not obey the message. That is also what God planned for them.

firstLine: Obey Your Rulers and Masters
rest: Follow the lead of every human authority. Do it because the Lord wants you to. Obey the king. He is the highest authority.

firstLine: Scripture says,
rest:
“He didn’t commit any sin.
No lies ever came out of his mouth.” ()

firstLine: Wives and Husbands
rest: Wives, follow the lead of your husbands. Suppose some of them don’t believe God’s word. Then let them be won to Christ without words by seeing how their wives behave.

firstLine: Suffering for Doing Good
rest: Finally, I want all of you to live together in peace. Be understanding. Love one another like members of the same family. Be kind and tender. Don’t be proud.

firstLine: Scripture says,
rest:
“Do you want to love life
and see good days?
Then keep your tongues from speaking evil.
Keep your lips from telling lies.

firstLine: Living for God
rest: Christ suffered in his body. So get ready as a soldier does. Prepare yourselves to think in the same way Christ did. Do it because those who have suffered in their bodies are finished with sin.

firstLine: Suffering for Being a Christian
rest: Dear friends, don’t be surprised by the painful suffering you are going through. Don’t feel as if something strange were happening to you.

firstLine: Scripture says,
rest:
“Suppose it is hard for godly people to be saved.
Then what will happen to ungodly people and sinners?” ()

firstLine: To Elders and Young Men
rest: I’m speaking to the elders among you. I was a witness of Christ’s sufferings. And I will also share in the glory that is going to come. I’m making my appeal to you as one who is an elder together with you.

firstLine: Final Greetings
rest: I consider Silas to be a faithful brother. With his help I have written you this short letter. I have written it to cheer you up. And I have written to give witness about the true grace of God. Stand firm in it.

firstLine: Be Sure That God Has Chosen You
rest: God’s power has given us everything we need to lead a godly life. All of that has come to us because we know the One who chose us. He chose us because of his own glory and goodness.

firstLine: Prophecy Comes From God
rest: So I will always remind you of these things. I’ll do it even though you know them. I’ll do it even though you now have deep roots in the truth.

firstLine: False Teachers Will Be Destroyed
rest: But there were also false prophets among the people. In the same way there will be false teachers among you. In secret they will bring in teachings that will destroy you. They will even turn against the Lord and Master who died to save them. His death paid for their sins. They will quickly destroy themselves.

firstLine: The Day of the Lord
rest: Dear friends, this is now my second letter to you. I have written both of them as reminders. I want to stir you up to think in a way that is pure.

firstLine: The Word of Life
rest: Here is what we announce to everyone about the Word of life. He was already here from the beginning. We have heard him. We have seen him with our eyes. We have looked at him. Our hands have touched him.

firstLine: Walking in the Light
rest: Here is the message we have heard from him and announce to you. God is light. There is no darkness in him at all.

firstLine: Dear children, I’m writing to you
rest:
because your sins have been forgiven.
They have been forgiven because of what Jesus has done.

firstLine: Fathers, I’m writing to you
rest:
because you have known the One who is from the beginning.
Young people, I’m writing to you
because you have won the battle over the evil one.
Dear children, I’m writing to you
because you have known the Father.

firstLine: Fathers, I’m writing to you
rest:
because you have known the One who is from the beginning.
Young people, I’m writing to you
because you are strong.
God’s word lives in you.
You have won the battle over the evil one.

firstLine: Do Not Love the World
rest: Do not love the world or anything in it. If you love the world, love for the Father is not in you.

firstLine: A Warning About the Enemies of Christ
rest: Dear children, we are living in the last days. You have heard that the great enemy of Christ is coming. But even now many enemies of Christ have already come. That’s how we know that these are the last days.

firstLine: Children of God
rest: Dear children, remain joined to Christ. Then when he comes, we can be bold. We will not be ashamed to meet him when he comes.

firstLine: Love One Another
rest: From the beginning we have heard that we should love one another.

firstLine: Put the Spirits to the Test
rest: Dear friends, do not believe every spirit. Put the spirits to the test to see if they belong to God. Many false prophets have gone out into the world.

firstLine: We Love Because God Loved Us
rest: Dear friends, let us love one another, because love comes from God. Everyone who loves has been born again because of what God has done. That person knows God.

firstLine: Faith in the Son of God
rest: Everyone who believes that Jesus is the Christ is born again because of what God has done. And everyone who loves the Father loves his children as well.

firstLine: Final Words
rest: I’m writing these things to you who believe in the name of the Son of God. I’m doing it so you will know that you have eternal life.

firstLine: A Warning Against Ungodly Teachers
rest: Dear friends, I really wanted to write to you about the salvation we share. But now I feel I should write and ask you to stand up for the faith. God’s people were trusted with it once and for all time.

firstLine: Remain in God’s Love
rest: Dear friends, remember what the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ said was going to happen.

firstLine: Praise to God
rest: Give praise to the One who is able to keep you from falling into sin. He will bring you into his heavenly glory without any fault. He will bring you there with great joy.

firstLine: Greetings
rest:
I, John, am writing this letter.
I am sending it to the seven churches in Asia Minor.
May grace and peace come to you from the One who is, and who was, and who will come. May grace and peace come to you from the seven spirits who are in front of God’s throne.

firstLine: One Who Looks Like a Son of Man
rest:
I, John, am a believer like you. I am a friend who suffers like you. As members of Jesus’ royal family, we can put up with anything that happens to us.
I was on the island of Patmos because I taught God’s word and what Jesus said.

firstLine: The Letter to the Church in Ephesus
rest:
“Here is what I command you to write to the church in Ephesus.
Here are the words of the One who holds the seven stars in his right hand. He also walks among the seven golden lampstands. He says,

firstLine: The Letter to the Church in Smyrna
rest:
“Here is what I command you to write to the church in Smyrna.
Here are the words of the One who is the First and the Last. He is the One who died and came to life again. He says,

firstLine: The Letter to the Church in Pergamum
rest:
“Here is what I command you to write to the church in Pergamum.
Here are the words of the One with the sharp sword that has two edges. He says,

firstLine: The Letter to the Church in Thyatira
rest:
“Here is what I command you to write to the church in Thyatira.
Here are the words of the Son of God. He is the One whose eyes are like blazing fire. His feet are like polished bronze. He says,

firstLine: It is written,
rest:
‘“He will rule them with an iron rod.
He will break them to pieces like clay pots.” ()
I have received this authority from my Father.

firstLine: The Letter to the Church in Sardis
rest:
“Here is what I command you to write to the church in Sardis.
Here are the words of the One who holds the seven spirits of God. He has the seven stars in his hand. He says, ‘I know what you are doing. People think you are alive, but you are dead.

firstLine: The Letter to the Church in Philadelphia
rest:
“Here is what I command you to write to the church in Philadelphia.
Here are the words of the One who is holy and true. He holds the key of David. No one can shut what he opens. And no one can open what he shuts. He says,

firstLine: The Letter to the Church in Laodicea
rest:
“Here is what I command you to write to the church in Laodicea.
Here are the words of the One who is the Amen. What he gives witness to is faithful and true. He rules over what God has created. He says,

firstLine: The Throne in Heaven
rest: After this I looked, and there in front of me was a door standing open in heaven. I heard the voice I had heard before. It sounded like a trumpet. The voice said, “Come up here. I will show you what must happen after this.”

firstLine: “You are worthy, our Lord and God!
rest:
You are worthy to receive glory and honor and power.
You are worthy because you created all things.
They were created and they exist.
That is the way you planned it.”

firstLine: The Scroll and the Lamb
rest: Then I saw a scroll in the right hand of the One sitting on the throne. The scroll had writing on both sides. It was sealed with seven seals.

firstLine: In a loud voice they sang,
rest:
“The Lamb, who was put to death, is worthy!
He is worthy to receive power and wealth and wisdom and strength!
He is worthy to receive honor and glory and praise!”

firstLine: The Seals
rest: I watched as the Lamb broke open the first of the seven seals. Then I heard one of the four living creatures say in a voice that sounded like thunder, “Come!”

firstLine: 144,000 Are Sealed
rest: After this I saw four angels. They were standing at the four corners of the earth. They were holding back the four winds of the earth. This kept the winds from blowing on the land or on the sea or on any tree.

firstLine: The Huge Crowd Wearing White Robes
rest: After this I looked, and there in front of me was a huge crowd of people. They stood in front of the throne and in front of the Lamb. There were so many that no one could count them. They came from every nation, tribe, people and language. They were wearing white robes. In their hands they were holding palm branches.

firstLine: They cried out in a loud voice,
rest:
“Salvation belongs to our God,
who sits on the throne.
Salvation also belongs to the Lamb.”

firstLine: They said,
rest:
“Amen!
May praise and glory
and wisdom be given to our God for ever and ever.
Give him thanks and honor and power and strength.
Amen!”

firstLine: So
rest:
“they are in front of the throne of God.
They serve him day and night in his temple.
The One who sits on the throne will spread his tent over them.

firstLine: The Seventh Seal and the Gold Cup
rest: The Lamb opened the seventh seal. Then there was silence in heaven for about half an hour.

firstLine: The Trumpets
rest: Then the seven angels who had the seven trumpets got ready to blow them.

firstLine: The Angel and the Little Scroll
rest: Then I saw another mighty angel coming down from heaven. He was wearing a cloud like a robe. There was a rainbow above his head. His face was like the sun. His legs were like pillars of fire.

firstLine: The Two Witnesses
rest: I was given a long stick that looked like a measuring rod. I was told, “Go and measure the temple of God and the altar. Count the worshipers who are there.

firstLine: The Seventh Trumpet
rest:
The seventh angel blew his trumpet. There were loud voices in heaven. They said,
“The kingdom of the world has become the kingdom of our Lord and of his Christ.
He will rule for ever and ever.”

firstLine: They said,
rest:
“Lord God who rules over all, we give thanks to you.
You are the One who is and who was.
We give you thanks because you have taken your great power
and have begun to rule.

firstLine: The nations were angry,
rest:
and the time for your anger has come.
The time has come to judge the dead.
It is time to reward your servants the prophets
and your own people and those who honor you.
There is a reward for all your people,
both great and small.
It is time to destroy
those who destroy the earth.”

firstLine: The Woman and the Dragon
rest: A great and miraculous sign appeared in heaven. It was a woman wearing the sun like clothes. The moon was under her feet. On her head she wore a crown of 12 stars.

firstLine: They overcame him
rest:
because the Lamb gave his life’s blood for them.
They overcame him
by giving witness about Jesus to others.
They were willing to risk their lives,
even if it led to death.

firstLine: Everyone who is supposed to be captured
rest:
will be captured.
Everyone who is supposed to be killed with a sword
will be killed with a sword.
So God’s people must be patient and faithful.

firstLine: The Beast out of the Earth
rest: Then I saw another beast. This one came out of the earth. He had two horns like a lamb. But he spoke like a dragon.

firstLine: The Lamb and the 144,000
rest: I looked, and there in front of me was the Lamb. He was standing on Mount Zion. With him were 144,000 people. Written on their foreheads were his name and his Father’s name.

firstLine: The Three Angels
rest: I saw another angel. He was flying high in the air. He came to tell everyone on earth the good news that will always be true. He told it to every nation, tribe, language and people.

firstLine: The Harvest of the Earth
rest: I looked, and there in front of me was a white cloud. Sitting on the cloud was One who looked “like a son of man.” () He wore a gold crown on his head. In his hand was a sharp, curved blade for cutting grain.

firstLine: Seven Angels With Seven Plagues
rest: I saw in heaven another great and miraculous sign. Seven angels were about to bring the seven last plagues. The plagues would complete God’s anger.

firstLine: The Seven Bowls of God’s Anger
rest: Then I heard a loud voice from the temple speaking to the seven angels. “Go,” it said. “Pour out the seven bowls of God’s anger on the earth.”

firstLine: Then I heard the altar reply,
rest:
“Lord God who rules over all,
the way you judge is true and fair.”

firstLine: The Woman and the Beast
rest: One of the seven angels who had the seven bowls came to me. He said, “Come. I will show you how the great prostitute will be punished. She is the one who sits on many waters.

firstLine: Babylon Falls
rest: After these things I saw another angel coming down from heaven. He had great authority. His glory filled the earth with light.

firstLine: With a mighty voice he shouted,
rest:
“Fallen! Babylon the Great has fallen!
She has become a place where demons live.
She has become a den for every evil spirit.
She has become a nest for every ‘unclean’ and hated bird.

firstLine: All the nations have drunk
rest:
the strong wine of her terrible sins.
The kings of the earth took part in her evil ways.
The traders of the world grew rich from her great wealth.”

firstLine: Give her as much pain and suffering
rest:
as the glory and wealth she gave herself.
She brags to herself,
‘I rule like a queen. I am not a widow.
I will never be sad.’

firstLine: They will cry out,
rest:
“‘How terrible! How terrible it is for you, great city,
dressed in fine linen, purple and bright red!
How terrible for you, great city, gleaming with gold, jewels and pearls!

firstLine: The light of a lamp
rest:
will never shine in you again.
The voices of brides and grooms
will never be heard in you again.
Your traders were among the world’s most important people.
By your magic spell all the nations were led down the wrong path.

firstLine: Again they shouted,
rest:
“Hallelujah!
The smoke from her fire goes up for ever and ever.”

firstLine: Fine linen, bright and clean,
rest:
was given to her to wear.”
Fine linen stands for the right things that God’s people do.

firstLine: The Rider on the White Horse
rest: I saw heaven standing open. There in front of me was a white horse. Its rider is called Faithful and True. When he judges or makes war, he is always fair.

firstLine: The Thousand Years
rest: I saw an angel coming down out of heaven. He had the key to the Abyss. In his hand he held a heavy chain.

firstLine: Satan Is Judged
rest: When the 1,000 years are over, Satan will be set free from his prison.

firstLine: The Dead Are Judged
rest: I saw a great white throne and the One who was sitting on it. When the earth and sky saw his face, they ran away. There was no place for them.

firstLine: The New Jerusalem
rest: I saw a new heaven and a new earth. The first heaven and the first earth were completely gone. There was no longer any sea.

firstLine: The River of Life
rest: Then the angel showed me the river of the water of life. It was as clear as crystal. It flowed from the throne of God and of the Lamb.

firstLine: Jesus Is Coming
rest: “Look! I am coming soon! Blessed are those who obey the words of the prophecy in this book.”
